Reviews.Title: “Perfect, perfect, perfect. You won't go wrong.”
Reviews.Author: BOOBOO138
Reviews.Content: We stayed 10 nights in a Prime Ocean View room. The spacious lanai overlooked the tranquil & spacious garden which was actually on the 3rd floor. There, you won't get any of the hustle & bustle which might be happening at the lobby or lower lobby floors where the pools & restaurants are. Perfect design for a most memorable & relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice stay at the Four Seasons Wailea”
Reviews.Author: alwaysevol000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from the Four Seasons Maui. We stayed March 9th through March 19th. I booked through whatahotel (loraine travel). Because of this we received the full buffet daily ($85 dollar value a day for two people), a lunch at Ferraros ($85 value), room upgrade based on availability, and every 5th night free (so we had two free nights). The buffet was great, but not sure I could justify $85 a day if it wasn't included. The lunch at Ferraros wasn't that good. My wife got the lobster salad sandwich and I got a burger. We have had better of both at many restaurants. A room upgrade wasn't available right away. I asked to be placed on a wait list (I realize an upgrade for 10 nights wasn't going to be easy). After 3 nights we were upgraded from our partial ocean view room to an ocean view prime. Both rooms were on the inside of the resort looking into the gardens and out onto the ocean. One was farther back (still a good view in my opinion). The prime ocean view was closer to the ocean. Definitely not worth it if we had to pay for it, but it was a good view. Because we spent such little time in the room, I would most likely look for a garden or mountain view next time. What we really enjoyed that made our stay excellent: - Room service & staff - Workout area & staff - Outrigger Canoe Program (free): Saw whales & turtles - Valet guys top notch with directions, blankets, water & towels - Duo: Again, we really liked the buffet. We also went here once for dinner. Really liked the dinner. It was expensive (just like Spago & Ferraros), but we felt it was worth it. - Pool & Beach service was great. I did feel the serenity pool is somewhat over rated. We liked hanging out closer to the main pool near the lawn. Those chairs have really nice ocean views. What could be improved: - My wife thought the rooms were dated (carpet, furniture, bed). Bathroom, amenities & house keeping service were great. - Spago: I'm more than willing to drop money on a meal if it's worth it. Our meal was good, but not worth the money. - Ferraros: We were expecting better based on the reviews. Our lunch is mentioned above. We also ate here once for dinner. Again, not that great. My wife had the seafood pasta (don't recall the name, but it was recommended by the waiter as their signature dish) and I had the short rib & gnocchi. Mine was good, but serving size was really small. My wife didn't like her order, but it was huge. - I know we were there in March, but the resort is really focussed on families. Some days it annoyed me a little and other days it didn't. I could see how some people could be put off by it.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice for a QUIET getaway!”
Reviews.Author: scottie138
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the fantastic Four Seasons Hotel in Maui in January. What a terrific, beautiful hotel. The rooms were awesome, spacious, beautifully decorated with great views. While the hotel is lovely, it is a little isolated. I was really disappointed in the beach, and the pool is in the shade. There is a serenity pool which is super quiet. Ferraro's restaurant was absolutely amazing although pricey. They had 2 musicians who were wonderful. The area is great for honeymooners or people just looking for a quiet getaway.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!!”
Reviews.Author: lilly425
Reviews.Content: I had visited the Four Seasons in Wailea over twenty years ago when they first opened. I wasn't staying there, but I went with my parents to check out the properly. I was amazed and told myself that one day I would stay here. Fast forward and my husband and I made reservations to stay for one week. It was one of the best travel experiences we've ever had. As soon as we arrived we were greeted with a friendly aloha and received leis and a cool refreshing beverage. The check-in was fast and friendly. Our room was not available yet, as we were a little early, but they took all of our luggage and sent us a text message on our cell phone an hour later when our room was available. We had an ocean view room, which was large, quiet, spotless and comfortable. The beds were heaven...all of the linens were so soft and the bed was so comfortable, I slept better than I have in a long time. In fact, I was in need of a new bed and ended up ordering a bed and the linens from the hotel because I was so in love with waking up without back pain for the first time in many, many months. The housekeeping service was great and didn't disturb us at all. If we were taking an afternoon nap, housekeeping would leave a message on the phone telling us to call them if we wanted our room freshened up. I would call before we left for dinner and the room would be done by the time we got back. They even have an iphone/ipad app that I used to request additional pillows in our room - amazing! Every employee we encountered was extremely friendly, always willing to chat and answer questions about the properly. At the pool, I was always greeted by name. I spent most of my time at the serenity pool. I did get up early to reserve a couple of chairs, but I didn't find this to be an inconvenience. They kept really good track of people who have been gone for longer than he allotted time and they pulled their towels so other people can sit there. They brought around goodies every once in a while - pineapples, brownies, popsicles, and if you're there early morning, they even bring muffins. They brought around cool moist towels when it was hot out and, one day when it was kind of rainy and windy, they brought warm towels. The food service at the pool comes from the Duo restaurant just downstairs and is very good - wraps, burgers, salads, sandwiches. The drinks from the bar are also very good. The concierge was very helpful in getting us rides into Wailea (this is provided by the hotel within a certain radius of the hotel), a taxi, booking excursions, etc. If we needed a ride, it was there within minutes. We ate at all three restaurants while we were there. We loved Ferraro's even though it was closed the first two time we wanted to eat there because of bad weather. When we finally did go, we found it was well worth the wait! Reserve a table at sunset for a romantic dinner experience. We ended up eating there twice. We also went to Duo three times - another great experience. The steak and mahi mahi were both excellent, and the breakfast buffet is wonderful. We were less thrilled with Spago's. I was expecting great things, but we had to wait quite a while, even though we had reservations, and the pork chop I had, while abundant, was somewhat bland and unexciting. We did not go back there. The grounds of the resort are immaculate and very beautiful. The resort is pretty small, but it never felt crowded. The beach is shared with the Grand Wailea next door, but, again, it was usually pretty quiet. There is a paved walking path that leads to the Grand Wailea and beyond on one side, and past some gorgeous homes on the other. It was nice to be able to walk at night after dinner (bring a light at night, so you don't step on any frogs)! I had very high expectations because of all the reviews I'd read here. Was it expensive? YES! This was by far the most I've ever paid for a hotel room. But I have to say, it was worth every penny! I can't wait to go back! I almost feel like the people there are family now! Mahalo for reading and aloha!

Reviews.Title: “A friendly place...that will treat you like Royalty.”
Reviews.Author: missneha
Reviews.Content: Prepare to be completely spoilt at the Four Seasons Resort Maui. This place is a secluded piece of heaven. The location the hotel itself, the service, the food and the celebrity spotting. Youâ€™ll never want to leave. My husband and I stayed at the Four Seasons in Maui in May 2011 for 7 nights. The experience was just pure indulgence from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. Greeted so warmly with a Lai and a tropical mocktail we were quickly and easily checked in whilst chatting to the friendly staff who all seem so happy to be working in such a nice place and willing to do anything to make your stay enjoyable. Our room was perfect, spacious, elegant, comfortable and impeccably clean. When we arrived in the room there was a gorgeous long stem red rose and a bottle of champagne waiting for us. The view from the room was beautiful, landscaping beautiful Maui in all its beauty. The other reviews here are right. You donâ€™t ever feel like leaving the resort. The grounds are so lush and well groomed; the pools (including the adultâ€™s only infinity pool) are amazing. We spend some time at the infinity pool just relaxing drinking cocktails at the swim up bar, enjoying the view and soaking up the sun on the very comfy lounge chairs, but the highlight of the infinity pool is the AMAZING service. Your ice water is always topped up; you are served fruit, iceblocks, muffins and lots of treats by the pool all day, not to mention lunch and yummy meals any time you like. A lovely lady will come and spritz you with Evian (srsly right?!), you can lay back and relax with cucumbers on your eyes and a cold towel. I spent a few hours lying by the pool, reading a kindle (the hotel provides to you for your stay) and really relaxing. You are treated like royalty. We saw Hillary Duff and her sister at the infinity pool throughout the week. A cheap thrill for a pop / Disney kid like me. Hehe. We booked a Snorkelling tour to the Molokini crater through the resort. They recommended an awesome company to go with and it was one of the most fun snorkelling experiences ever. We swam with heaps of turtles, so many varieties of fish and enjoyed a sunny day on a yacht including a nice lunch and drinkies as well as comfortable transport to and from the hotel. Thanks so much to Wendy for booking that for us we had an unforgettable day. My husband and I had a coupleâ€™s spa treatment at the hotel and it was sublime! We spent 5 hours being pampers, massaged and taking a relaxing journey to heaven and back. We came out of our spa day feeling like brand new. A must doâ€¦pure Bliss! I also got my hair cut in the salon and they did an awesome job. I was very happy with it. They even styled it for me for dinner that night. We also went on the Outrigger Canoe Program on a beautiful sunny morning which was a highlight for me and my husband. We saw turtles, learnt the traditional ways of the Hawaiian canoe and got a bit of an island tour from the fringes of the ocean. It was wonderful. I also did yoga a couple times on the beach on the morning. It was very nice and peaceful. Meals at the hotel were perfect, 5 star and left you wanting for absolutely nothing. The eveningâ€™s musical accompaniment with dinner at Duoâ€™s was so exquisite. A perfect 5 star meal, under the stars, in the candlelight, looking out onto the ocean with the most beautiful music around you. It was just magical. I have so many nice things to say about Four Seasons Maui, I donâ€™t think I have done it justice in this short review, but I would definitely recommend that you spoil yourself and go and check it out. You will be amazed.

Reviews.Title: “heaven”
Reviews.Author: cypans
Reviews.Content: visited in nov 2011 for a 5 day trip for my birthday, The hotel staff were courteous and service exemplary. The rooms are great with amazing views and the poolside service is excellent and good choices of drinks. The restaurants attached are great but lack a good vegetarian menu . Suggest getting a pizza and order a wine and starter while watching the ocean and sky into the night with a special someone for a change!

Reviews.Title: “Too Decadent / Not Unique”
Reviews.Author: LeftCoastGirl
Reviews.Content: I knew that the Four Seasons Wailea was one of the best-rated Four Seasons in the world, but our 6-night stay left us lukewarm. I can't believe I'm saying this about such a luxurious place, but there were some big problems combined with such a touristy, crowded, Disneyland like atmosphere that ultimately we were disappointed about our big splurge. First of all, our "Garden View" room was so bad that we paid a big chunk of money in order to be moved to an Ocean View room. "Garden View" is a euphemism for "gardener's alley" -- it's the cramped landscape strip between the Four Seasons and the adjacent hotel, and it's where all the property maintenance staff start up their mowers and power tools, roll their service carts back and forth, etc. It was so loud from all the machines and the traffic noise above Wailea that I couldn't open my lanai door to enjoy a breeze -- my ears literally were ringing. The Ocean View room to which we moved was truly a spectacular view, but they only gave us a minimal discount; mostly we paid dearly for the upgrade. I didn't like the touristy feel of Maui in general, Wailea, nor this Four Seasons -- the hotels crowd together in cheek-by-jowl, and it's just a monoculture of tons of mostly white rich tourists and locals who barely hide their resentment at us. The staff at this Four Seasons were all solicitous and accommodating, but it didn't feel genuine; there was a coolness behind their polished exteriors. The beach boys were an exception -- really nice guys, intelligent and funny -- amazing considering that they have to wait on guests hand and foot, right down to spritzing people with water or doing foot massages for sunbathers (honestly, I was embarrassed to even witness this). Spago (the much-touted Wolfgang Puck restaurant in the hotel) was mostly glitz and self-congratulatory presentation: I've had better food for less money. There were some things I loved about it: the infinity pool is breathtaking, and the bartenders there are excellent -- what mai tais! The spa was lovely, with good masseuses and a eucalyptus-infused steam room. The rooms were immaculate and housekeeping was very good, although I felt they messed around with my stuff a little too much to make it personal (setting up my jewelry for me on special little tatami mats, rearranging my things on the bedside table). Beds and bedding were really comfortable and, as you'd expect, luxurious. My favorite Four Seasons, though -- believe it or not -- is in Las Colinas outside of Dallas, Texas. Not for the location -- and I don't even golf! -- but just for the hotel and service.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the best. Period.”
Reviews.Author: rms522
Reviews.Content: Manicured lawns and gardens, absolutely the best service, wonderful food everywhere, and the utmost beauty overlooking Molokai and other islands on the distant horizon. This resort tops them all. I've yet to visit Bali, Bora Bora or Tahiti - but the experience here alone is worth every dollar spent.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy road!”
Reviews.Author: LoveToEat03
Reviews.Content: We picked the Four Seasons because of all the wonderful reviews here on TripAdvisor. And after being there, and splurging and spending over $1000 on a Club Floor Ocean View room, I agree with all the positive comments, it was a beautiful hotel, clean, amazing staff, great restaurants, large bathrooms. BUT, we have one very large complaint. There was a noisy road, the entry road to the hotel, just outside our room. For the ocean view, you had to look across the noisy road, across condominiums and then the ocean. You could not hear the ocean, because of the road. Sometimes tour buses sat for an hour with the engine running, drivers music blaring. We did not enjoy spending time on our lanai, like we usually do, and it was too noisy to leave the door open to enjoy the breezes. I stay in a lot of hotels for business and I can't believe for the money that this room was a long a noisy road! I can't believe more people haven't mentioned this in their review! We will not stay here again, even though the service, large rooms and restaurants were wonderful. We will go back to our usual hotel, pay a heck of a lot less and have a true ocean view room, with no noisy road!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Ending to a Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: KateWhitefish
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I spent our last 3 days of our honeymoon at the Four Seasons Wailea to finish up our 12 day honeymoon on Maui. From the second we arrived not a detail was missed and our experience was beyond any expectation. From the lei's on arrival, the personalized text when our room was ready, to the champagne in our room, and the towel service, icy pops, and cold cucumbers at the pool, the Four Seasons has not missed one detail! Our partial ocean view room was beautiful and I'm really glad we didn't pay more for for a full ocean view. The bathroom is huge and beautiful! The beds are amazing and the room very big and comfortable. The restaurants were great, and we enjoyed eating at the bar for a more casual experience. We loved our stay and will hopefully be back again soon! Thank you Four Seasons, it was the best!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific service! Great food at Ferraro's!”
Reviews.Author: C'Dale J
Reviews.Content: The only negative was one small part of the room. The air conditioning fan blows right at the bed :-( Great bed, though! This is the first time after a motel stay when I crawled into my own bed and did't say, "Oh, it's so good to be in my own bed!" Four Seasons bed was wonderful. Other than the fan on my head at night, thist was the most awesome place I have ever experienced!

Reviews.Title: “Only place to stay on Maui. PERIOD.”
Reviews.Author: rhuckabee5
Reviews.Content: Truly the only place to stay on Maui. We stayed in the Malei suite and it was beyond words. Everyone knows your name, pool was fantastic as well as the service. I had a foot massage at my pool chair that was fabulous! I have stayed at other resorts on Maui and there is no comparison. Don't waste your money on any other area or resort!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: momandktravel
Reviews.Content: This a lovely hotel. We loved our spacious room. The staff in this hotel sets the gold standard for hotel staffs. Everyone was so nice, friendly and helpful. The food is great. We loved lunch and snacks at the pool. The teen menus are really nice for older children who do not want to order from a children's menu. We tried all three restaurants for dinner and could not pick a favorite because they were all so good. The only negative was the noise level in our room. We had a mountain view room. When we made the reservation were we warned that the room overlooked a parking. Overlooking the parking lot was really not a problem because you really do not notice that your room overlooks a parking lot because the parking lot is covered. The view of the golf course and mountains was beautiful. The problem was the noise level, the room faced the hotel mechanical systems and a very busy road. We had a wonderful, large balcony but sitting on it was not very pleasant because of the noise. If a bus or truck went by we could hear it in our room with the door closed. I would recommend getting an ocean view room and not the mountain view room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Spectacular stay at Four Seasons Maui!!”
Reviews.Author: Alan728
Reviews.Content: After having a perfect trip last month at the Four Seasons in Hualalai, we thought no place could ever match the service and amazing experience we had there. Because Hualalai was completely full, our TA recommended we try Maui. WOW! What an amazing place! Great call, Linda, and thanks for getting us free breakfast every day and your other perks! The staff is fantastic and the food is excellent. They went over and above the call of duty, but not just for us but all the guests. We had dinner in town two nights, but enjoyed the hotel restaurants more. The hotel arranged for a car rental for two days to drive around the island -- just the right amount of time. We ate at Mama's Fish House the night we had the car and had a delicious dinner. Highly recommend it. We had a garden view room, which was a great room, but next time we may opt for an Oceanview room as we would have appreciated having a better view. The really tough choice will be which Four Seasons to go to next. What the heck, maybe we'll go to both!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth It!”
Reviews.Author: Beachnme
Reviews.Content: I have generally looked for a great combination of price and luxury when traveling to Hawaii. But after staying at the Four Season twice over a 9 month period, I don't want to go anywhere else. It is well worth any premium you may pay due to the facilities, staff, and location. Every time I think about our next vacation, Maui and the Four Season are at the top of my list. As a comparison, I have stayed at the Grand Wailea, Kea Lani and local time share properties but all have something that deters me from going back. Worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Wailea does it again”
Reviews.Author: Saskatoonbanker
Reviews.Content: As always, the Four Seasons label has provided first class service and amenities that always meet and/or exceed our expections. World Class, First Class, A+++++ (yes, that`s 5 of them)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing. Everyone was right on.”
Reviews.Author: beachgirl212176
Reviews.Content: Was onky abe to stay one night but we maximized our time there and really soaked it all in. All the reviews are right on the money. f you can afford it, do it. You won't be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay, Met High Expectations”
Reviews.Author: gingertea8
Reviews.Content: We had high expectations prior to our stay at the Four Seasons Wailea due to the hotel's reputation and TA reviews and this resort met or exceeded all of them. We took the advice of fellow travelers on TA and booked through WhatAHotel, a preferred partner of the 4S and had a fantastic experience. Preferred hotel partner packages include an upgrade when available, free breakfast for two at Due every morning ($85 a day value), and a $85 credit for lunch at one of the other restaurants on site. The breakfast buffet is probably the best one I've ever had. They have multiple stations of both prepared and made to order food and a wide selection of juices, fruit, and pastries. When we arrived, we were welcomed with leis, refreshments, a small dessert in the room, and an upgrade from a Garden View room to a large Garden View suite. The bell boy showed us all the amenities of the room before leaving. The resort does not nickle and dime you - bottles of water, fresh towels, and sunscreen are given out freely all over the resort. You can even borrow towels straight at the valet desk to take off the resort. All the cabanas and umbrellas are included in the room rate except for the extra fancy cabanas with flat screen TVs and mini-fridges, which are $300 a day. Since we left our son with his grandparents for this vacation, we took advantage of the gorgeous adults only Serenity Pool almost daily. To get the best chairs, however, you have to get there right before it opens at 7 am. This is easier than it sounds if you are coming from the US mainland because of jet lag. You can still get chairs most of the time if you go later, but they will be further back from the ocean view. My husband would go and reserve a chair and chill out while I got ready in our room, then I would meet him there before we went to breakfast. The staff will hold your chairs for an hour. At the Serenity Pool, staff will walk around with free fruit and aromatherapy spritzes. They also offer massages and mani/pedis for a fee. The only fees I found annoying were the mandatory valet parking ($25 a day) and the daily internet fees. There are literally no other parking options at the resort and to access the internet at the resort, it was $10 for slowish wifi and $20 for the "premium" internet package. I think the resort should include wifi in the room rate. Other than that, we really had no complaints. We found the resort a perfect romantic vacation, but also noticed it was extremely family friendly. It was difficult to leave the resort and we hope to come back some day soon.

Reviews.Title: “A true luxury resort...from the moment you arrive until you depart!”
Reviews.Author: seattlebrooksjanzen
Reviews.Content: This was our 9th trip to the 4 Seasons - we just cannot get enough of it! While the sticker price may schock some - we feel that it is worth every penny! There are always fresh towels at the pool - no towel cards like other resorts. When you want a drink you can always find someone to bring it to you. If your kids are bored of the pool - send them to kids for all seasons (must be 5) and they are guarenteed a wonderful experience. Staff never says "no" rather finds a way to meet your needs. It is true luxury and you will leave so relaxed and rujevenated.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: SA9_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to the Four Seasons Maui for our honeymoon. We were told if there is one trip you will want to splurge it is your honeymoon and everyday I am so thankful we took that advice. The Four Seasons Maui made us feel so special from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. There was the spectacular service, views, and all the fun extra surprises that come with your stay (I don't want to say what they are because I want you to be surprised too). We had booked a luau and a snorkeling excursion and the entire time we were away we just wanted to be back at our hotel. Other than that we literally did not leave the hotel and I don't really know why you would ever want to. The next time we go back we have decided we are not renting a car since the Four Seasons will shuttle you to nearby locations and other than that, the hotel has everything you could need- breathtaking views, delicious restaurants, pool, beach...it is luxurious relaxation at it's finest! I cried when we left and dream everyday of going back. If you are heading to Maui don't even look into other hotels, book the Four Seasons Maui and you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Service.”
Reviews.Author: W8dr
Reviews.Content: The service and attention to detail at the Four Seasons Wailea is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “3rd Visit, Still as Great as Always”
Reviews.Author: dcv2002
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd visit to the FS Maui at Wailea. It was great to be back, would have liked to stay longer (however I think SAP booked every room for the days I was looking at). Yes this place is pricey (not nearly as pricey as FS Hualalai), however you get what you pay for and more. Booked using $100 day/credit package, plus got free breakfast, room upgrade and $85 lunch at Ferraro's for our 3 night stay. This is probably the nicest beach my family as ever been too. Sand is silky smooth. Water is not too rough, but can be still used for ocean games. Free snorkeling right off the beach. Rent kayak's, SUP's, etc. Set up lounge chairs with umbrellas for you. Excellent view. Superb. One thing that always makes us come back, and we always do: OUTRIGGER CANOE EXCURSION. If you have the chance, do this. My 9-year old son had his first trip. This is memorable, not only for the trip, but for the guides/people that bring you out that give you knowledge about Maui and the surrounding islands, history and canoeing. My 6-year old daughter loved the FREE Kids For All Seasons activities. She actually wanted to go there more. Gave Mom and Dad some free time. Room and bathroom were huge, though we were at the back of the resort for a little longer walk. The FS Maui is all about luxury, service, relaxing, fun, sun, swimming and beach. It is our families favorite hotel. Hopefully I'll be able to write a 4th review soon.... Oh, and the beds are to die for. I don't think I've had as good a night sleep as I had there. Plus they know how to treat children right!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: RB702
Reviews.Content: This resort is simply fantastic. My wife and I came here for our babymoon and it couldn't have been better. Resort food is outstanding from Spago and Duo to the muffins at Snorkels, and each hotel employee treats you as if they know you are taking a trip of a lifetime. It is well worth the price even though it does get expensive. I can't imagine that another hotel on the island even comes close. Four Seasons was great on our honeymoon and now on the babymoon and we hope to be able to enjoy trips at Four Seasons resorts for many years to come. Mahalo Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: countryguylawrence
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 10 days at the Four Seasons and there is nothing we can say that has not already been said. It was our first trip to Maui so we cannot compare it to other hotels and resorts on the island but we can compare it to the few other 5 star hotels we have stayed at. We booked through whatahotel.com and that is the only way to go. They are a preferred partner with 4 Seasons. We got a free upgrade, breakfast buffet each morning, and one lunch for up to $85.00. The breakfast was very good and never got old. You can get eggs, pancakes, french toast, waffles, and omelots to order along with a buffet featuring a ton of fruit, hot breakfast items, pastries, and other baked items. Our lunch at Ferarro's probably rates a B+. Good but not great. All of our other meals were eaten off site while we took in the sights and sounds of Maui. Unlike other resorts, for the most part you are not nickle and dimed at 4 Seasons. There is no daily resort fee, no fee for cabanas and beach chairs, ice water at every turn, free bottled water in room, treats poolside and at the beach throughout the day, cumcumbers for your eyes, evian spritzer water, and free sun screen. The pool and beach workers are always right there but not intrusive. And the L'Occitane bath products are certainly top of the line. My only complaint is with the fee for in room internet service. I find it incredible that a resort that offers all of this finds it necessary to charge $10.00 for internet service. Really???? I have no problem with the parking fee but the internet? The staff and attention to detail is what really sets 4 Seasons apart. From the moment of arrival you are pampered (and let's face it, we all like that). The check in is smooth with someone at your side at all times. The room is waiting for you with treats and welcome cards. The evening turn down service is just another touch. When reading about that service before our stay, I wondered how necessary that was. While not necessary, being at a beach resort it is really nice. We had a way of really messing up the room through the day so this was a service we very much appreciated. Again, the beach and pool help was exceptional. And the concierge service was just as exceptional. They gave great information and took care of anything we asked. Everyone who works at 4 Seasons looks as though they love their job. A scowl was no where to be seen. The infinity pool is a great spot. While it could certainly be larger, we thoroughly enjoyed it. It was always quiet even though it was generally full. It was not a problem for us to go down early for the chairs since we are early risers anyway. On the couple of occasions where we planned to go later, a spot quickly opened up and we were paged. The beach is very close and was never crowded. We got our one hour free snorkel equipment at the hut by the beach. The reef to the side of the beach was okay for snorkeling but not great. It will depend on what you are used to and your expectations from that standpoint. We enjoyed the lobby bar and the nightly hula and music. A great place to people watch, whale watch, and sunset watch. I strongly encourage everyone to rent a car. Maui is very easy to navigate and the expense is well worth it. We drove every day and I cannot imagine not having the ability to do that. We reserved through discounthawaiicarrental.com. Four Seasons certainly is not cheap but the experience is one of a kind. My only reason for giving it four stars is that I think the room charge is a little high and to also make a statement about the internet. Guess the internt charge is just a pet peeve.

Reviews.Title: “Could not be better. Not cheap, but you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: crackcorn
Reviews.Content: There is nothing to plan for, nothing to worry about. Just show up. Whatever you need or want to do will be immediately taken care of. The level of professionalism of the staff is of the highest level. The location is perfect. The amenities are great.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing week!”
Reviews.Author: DuckSausage
Reviews.Content: Won a President's Club trip for my company and had a wonderful week in the sun and sand. Thank goodness the company paid for most of everything because it was crazy expensive. I mean, you'd expect expensive at a luxury hotel but wow...$72 for breakfast for two...cocktails $15. Other than that, the pools, beach, staff, etc. was fantastic. Whale season was in full swing. You could see whales at anytime from the hotel property. Property grounds and service was immaculate. Everything you would expect from a Four Seasons property can be found in Maui. Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Iryna K
Reviews.Content: This is the most wonderful hotel I could imagine. No better place for luxury vacation

Reviews.Title: “I can only say WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: Scorpio1211
Reviews.Content: I am staying at the hotel right now, it is expensive but worth every dime. The rooms are clean fully equipped , bathroom huge with batc & shower. The public areas a clean and taken care of regularly. The staff are willing to assist helpful and polite. One of the best hotels I've been in, and maybe even THE best

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience!”
Reviews.Author: ibemygg
Reviews.Content: Great service and athmosphere, excellent location and facilities! I warmly recommed this hotel to anybody who wants a luxury experience in an extremely friendly and relaxing environment.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay on Maui”
Reviews.Author: Boise09
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a quite, relaxing place to stay in Hawaii, this is it. We stayed at 5 other hotels during our 5 weeks in the Islands - none compard to this. The Four Seasons is more expensive than any of the others, but was well worth it to us. the rooms are wonderful, and the service is unbelievable, especially compared to other hotels. If you are looking to relax and be pampered, this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Faultless beach hotel resort.”
Reviews.Author: BartonWG
Reviews.Content: Amazing 5 days in this resort hotel. Impeccable levels of quality in all areas. I would highly recommend this hotel for those wanting great service, food, views, rooms and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best resort in Wailea”
Reviews.Author: Aacandrac
Reviews.Content: This resort is one of my favorite places to stay. Service is great, rooms are spacious and food is good. The atmosphere is relaxing and the views are like looking at a postcard. This is the perfect hotel for couples and friends.

Reviews.Title: “paradise .......”
Reviews.Author: Aodhan O
Reviews.Content: from the beautiful views and private beach this was an experience one can only imagine. i was blown away by it. bit expensive for american standards but worth it for that special trip with someone you want to spoil. Safer than cruises !

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: kriztie707
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed on Maui for 10 nights. One week visiting a good friend and then ending our trip at the wonderful Four Seasons Maui. The resort lived up to our expectations and more. Room: We booked a Garden View room but were upgraded to the Executive Suite Ocean View. The room was very spacious with a separate living and dining area, two balconies, a large bedroom and bathroom with Jacuzzi tub. The king bed was very comfortable although we found the feather pillows too soft but were able to select different pillows from their night time menu. We really enjoyed having the balcony space to sit and relax just listening to the waveâ€™s crash on Wailea Beach. The room was very clean, not a spot of dust to be found, and turn down service was always consistent. Hotel: The hotel is beautiful. It is not as large as some of the other hotels in the area, which was nice. Then resort never felt crowded. There were always staff members throughout the hotel willing to help you. The grounds were meticulously maintained. The staff members always seem to remember your name. We only had one issue with the concierge on our last day, she was supposed to schedule an airport pick up for us at 7:30pm but never called and we did not get a pick up till after 8pm. I was disappointed she did not remember to call for our taxi pickup since all the other services we received were top notch. We really enjoyed the nightly hula show and torch lighting ceremony in the lobby lounge. It was a great way to end a day at the pool with a cold beer and some lovely Hawaiian music. Dining: We booked through a preferred partner and received the daily breakfast buffet and a lunch credit included in our rate. The breakfast buffet at Duo was excellent. All the food was fresh and there was a huge selection of items. You also receive a smoothie shot with your breakfast and the flavor changes each day. Dinner at Duo was good. The service was a little slow but the waiter was very friendly and the cotton candy at the end was a nice surprise. Lunch from Ferraroâ€™s was excellent. The portion sizes are so big that my husband and I shared a lunch each day. Dinner was also great. Ferraroâ€™s transforms in to an Italian restaurant at night with some great live music. The homemade pasta was excellent. The ocean views are very nice from Ferraroâ€™s for lunch and sunset if you have an earlier dinner. We ordered from the pool side menu a couple times and the food was excellent as well. Pool/Beach: All the pool areas are great. We thoroughly enjoyed the serenity pool. You do need to wake up early to get a good seat but we were up at 7am anyway so it didnâ€™t bother us. It was worth it to have the seats with a direct ocean view. The main pool was also nice and you never had to fight for a seat there. The pool side waiters always kept your water filled and asked if you needed anything. They also come around with different goodies throughout the day such as muffins, fresh fruit, cold towels, and brownies. The beach in front of the hotel was very nice. There are always staff members around to set up the beach chairs for you. You do share the beach with other hotels and all the beaches in Maui are public so it can get busy at times but there are designated chairs for Four Seasons guests. Overall: A wonderful hotel on Maui worth every penny. If you have the budget for the Four Seasons there is no question you should stay here. The service here does not even compare to other hotels on Maui. We look forward to returning to the Four Seasons Maui in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice short get away”
Reviews.Author: BetteNoir
Reviews.Content: My husband and I left the baby with grandma for 4 nights and headed over to Maui to stay at the FS for a short getaway. First trip to Maui for both of us, although I lived in Kauai for two years when I was young. This was our second Four Seasons property that year, having stayed at the one in Nevis in April, and I have subsequently stayed at the FS in Dallas as well. Positives: I would say that in general this is a lovely property and I experienced what I would consider a standard FS experience = value for money, etc... The rooms are large, the bathrooms cavernous. The location and ocean view is outstanding. We spent most of our time at the adults only pool and loved where it was situated on the property. Food is of course excellentâ€¦at the standard FS prices. ;) Slight negatives: When we checked in we were taken to a room that smelled strongly of mildew. They did quickly change our room, and said it was probably due to carpet cleaning that didnâ€™t dry well. But if they know this is a potential issue, one would have expected them to check it out before they put guests in that room. The main pool was kind of dirty and the tiling and fountain could use a good cleaning and repair here or there. That surprised me a bit, as I usually find FS properties to be immaculate. Needless to say, I never used that pool. The resort was pretty full, and you felt it. It was always a wait to get into breakfast, and we had trouble getting dinner reservations at times or places we wanted. As a recently frequent visitor to the FS chain, I felt a bit of a lack of acknowledgement. In contrast, when we stayed at the FS Dallas we were personally greeted by the resort manager and upgraded to a larger suite. On Maui I just felt like one of the massesâ€¦and I never felt the service was anything other than normal. What I like about FS properties is that I find the service to be above and beyond normal. Maui disappointed on that regard. Of course normal service at Four Seasons is still WAY better than a lot of other places. Would definitely go back if I wanted to return to Maui, although I would be tempted to try the Ritz if it was a quiet couples trip again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Chris H
Reviews.Content: Location of this resort is everything. Very nice common areas. Room was tired looking, old carpet, although spacious. Very comfortable beds. Duo breakfast buffet was excellent, every single day! Duo dinner was very good one evening and very poor another and quite expensive. At one dinner at Duo the service was very slow, but the restaurant was slow? We ordered the duck and really couldn't tell even what it was, at one point, we perhaps thought it was a tough steak. Pool is quite small. When we went to watch the moon set/sun rise at the beach, the cabanas all had already had books and sandals...at 5:30 a.m. We spent most of our time at the beach. The attendants at the beach did a great job. Two mornings had small muffins offered and a few days had water offered, hit or miss. No special treats; however, overlooking the pool service during lunch at Ferraro's (which was very good/good value) the pool service offered many more treats/water than the beach. Also, at the pool there were people who had cabanas that were also lounging in chairs, outside of the cabanas, and the pool is so small, there is not room for that. Check in was great as was the concerge. We took several trips to the Shops at Wailea via hotel transport, those drivers were very nice and very accommodating. There was a great paved path just off the beach that ran the length of the resorts as well as condos next door. Was lovely; however, be careful on the path (wide enough for 2) as there were joggers that were very obnoxious "on your left" "on your right" and even some of the older people on the path had a hard time keeping up with this. On Wed night there was a "Manager's Reception" that we attended. It was very nice. Only for an hour, could have been longer as many of the guests were talking and it was enjoyable. Some of the employee's of the resort were there, they were all very nice, making sure there were no pressing concerns. I would certainly say this resort is a couples resort. Highlight of the trip was the location, beach, watching the whales right from the room and the beach. Hoping to return next year. Very magical place!

Reviews.Title: “First class resort”
Reviews.Author: Alo99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent a week at the Four Seasons for our honeymoon and found the resort to be amazing in every way. We arrived early in the morning before our room was ready but it was no problem as they have a suite where you can change and enjoy the facilities while your room is being prepared. We grabbed lunch and went down to the pool and the front desk sent us a text message when our room was ready. We spent much our our stay hanging out at the Serenity Pool which overlooks the bay and includes a swim up bar. It was whale watching season and from the infinity pool, you could look into the bay and see humpback whales playing in the ocean. Service was impeccable and they know you by name after day one. We cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Easy Best Pick - But Not Perfect”
Reviews.Author: BuonaNotteRoma
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed for nine nights at the Four Seasons at Wailea...without our kids. It's with good reason that this resort is considered one of the finest in the world. The size is big enough to have every amenity imaginable yet small enough to retain a sense of intimacy and peacefulness. The resort is staffed with well-trained and friendly people in every corner and practically every interaction with a staff member was pleasant. The common areas are kept immaculately clean and the decor is contemporary, classy and beautifully maintained. The location is ideally suited for an island vacation; Four Seasons is elevated from the beach and set back from view of the neighboring (immense) Grand Wailea and condo rentals. Every typical Hawaiian activity can be had here: sunbathing, pool and ocean swimming, snorkeling and SCUBA diving, whale watching, kayaking, paddle-boarding etc. are all based on the resort premises and rentals easily charged to the room. The health club and spa are beautifully maintained and in the case of the former, at least one attendant was always present making sure the equipment is kept clean, water bottles are full and headphones are working. Additionally, the resort offers several complimentary activities during each day...check the schedule. There are two swimming pools, one is for adults-only and a small grotto with a waterfall. The resort offers one breakfast location (DUO) with a la carte or three levels of buffet dining with typical resort-hostage pricing. Lunch is served either at your pool/beach chairs or the ocean-view restaurant (Ferraro's) and plates are easily split for lighter dining. Light snacks and coffee are available at the beachside snack-bar, Snorkels. There is also a nice sized cocktail bar off of the main lobby that features music every night. There is a path that connects the Four Seasons to the other resorts and to the mall (about one mile walk). The resort access road has a cycling lane and sidewalk perfectly suited for jogging/walking. Lounge chairs can be claimed at 7am and 'protected' by the attendant for up to one hour. The Four Seasons does a very good job of this even on busier days. The attendants keep the towels fresh, water or drink glasses full and bring occasional treats like pineapple, mini-muffins, cucumber slices, cool towels and water throughout the day. The resort also provides three choices of sunscreen complimentary to its guests at various stations throughout the deck areas. My wife and I stayed in an ocean view suite which was amply sized, clean and regularly 'freshened up' by the staff during the day. Small tokens of appreciation (bookmarks, sunglass wipers, slippers) were left in the room by the staff...although there was no pillow mint with turndown service (haha). The air conditioner worked great and the sheets & towels smelled nearly as fresh as home. The room had a lanai with chairs and table offering a lovely view of the water just beyond the resort grounds and driveway...technically an 'ocean-view' to be sure. In short, the Four Seasons Wailea lives up to every expectation we had for the resort going in, yet..we were strangely not overwhelmed. I attribute this to a couple of factors: first, there were several company groups staying at the resort during our stay. Perhaps they required special attention of the staff. Second, I recently stayed at the Four Seasons Vail (Colorado) where the staff was so attentive and sincere I was truly overwhelmed. By comparison the staff in Maui seemed to be well-trained and hard-working. Finally, the Four Seasons charged approximately 35% more than the next most expensive hotel I priced (The Ritz at Kapalua) and nearly double the rate of the neighboring Fairmont. With that came perhaps an in-kind expectation of value. My final comments notwithstanding, we will return to the Four Seasons the next time we visit Maui. After all, nobody's perfect and I'm quite sure there is nothing even approaching the high standard set on Maui by the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular. Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: TriciaOksiuta
Reviews.Content: Your wish is their command. They never say no to anything! They make what you want happen. This hotel is true paradise. The second you walk in your anxiety melts away. We spent our honeymoon here and would recommend it to anyone. First class all the way! The pool service is great with hourly treats to keep you cool. Skip Spago as you can tell its not run by the hotel and the service/cost is the same but the service is not as good. Once you've had this hotels service, you'll never look back. We are already planning our return!

Reviews.Title: “Holiday in style”
Reviews.Author: rodneythecat
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here and it was perfect in every way - the remembering of your name, fabulous service, huge luxury rooms. Yes a bit pricey but the whole experience is sensational. my only comment would be that the sun loungers are very very close together - which for a Brit I found a real invasion of my personal space- and there was no room to move in and out of the sun.....otherwise its perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Resort. There is nothing this resort could improve upon. Nothing.”
Reviews.Author: lhippocampe
Reviews.Content: There is nothing this resort could improve upon. Nothing. It is perfect. We are absolutely sold on Four Seasons. We are already planning our next Four Seasons Resorts vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation in paradise”
Reviews.Author: jm4fps
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Maui provides the utmost in luxury and care! We love all Four Seasons, but keep returning to this one, mainly due to the staff! They provide the kind of attention, courtesy, and care not available elsewhere! This hotel exceeds expectations in all areas...an exemplary group of people! I can't say enough great things about them!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience! Perfect location, super friendly staff, amazing food.”
Reviews.Author: Alycia P
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this resort. Originally, we were going to book the Ritz-Carlton, but after reading reviews we found out that the Ritz is located in a rainy part of the island. So glad we listened- that is a well-known fact on the island! The Four Seasons rooms were comfortable, not the best I've stayed in but clean and comfortable. The staff was amazing, accommodating and friendly. The restaurants were magnificent- very good food. The concierge was super helpful. I participated in sunrise meditation and oceanside yoga- I highly recommend both. I received an outdoor massage- absolutely perfect. And during whale season you have a prime view of whales off the shore. Fantastic trip and we can't wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Catherine C
Reviews.Content: Everything about Four Seasons was done to perfection. My husband and I stayed 6 nights in Feb and it was glorious. I knew we had to stay there after watching the Modern Family episode. It all lived up to our high expectations and more. We went through what-a-hotel and got the free level upgrade, free buffet breakfast ($35 per person + gratuities), and a free $85 lunch at Ferraro's. I would definitely recommend that. We paid for the mountain side (parking lot view) room but got the garden view room as the upgrade. There wasn't much of a view as expected but we didn't spend much time in our room either. Room: Very spacious and the bathroom was even more so. Bed was very comfortable and there was also a sitting area and office space. I have stayed at some hotels in NYC where the rooms are smaller than the bathroom at Four Seasons. I enjoyed the L'Occitane bath products. We also liked that they also provided an after-sun lotion which is great after a day at the beach. Check-in: Quick and easy. We were greeted with pineapple, lemonade and a refreshing towel. We got leis upon entry and everyone was so genuinely friendly from the start. There were also small biscuits in the room waiting for us. The little things are truly appreciated. Grounds: Everything was immaculate. From the lobby to the tennis courts. From the pools to the beach. I don't see one leave out of place. Care is taken to keep this hotel in top notch shape. I normally try to stay at newer hotels but this property proved that an older hotel, when managed and kept properly, can be just as amazing. Service: They are soooo nice here. Frozen lemonade and pineapples and towels by the pool. Ice water is refilled every time you run a little low. When you leave your food at the buffet, your waiter will cover the food so that the birds do not get to it. Everyone greets you when they see you. We woke up early one morning to go Whale watching and we enjoyed the free coffee and baked goods at the front lobby. Lemonade stand was also appreciated mid day there. Valet: If they know you are going for a long trip, they provide you with bottles of water in the car. Another small yet nice gesture. When we left, they gave us goodbye jelly beans. Sweet. Pools: Various levels of sunscreen were provided by the pool which was appreciated. Whether you are at the infinity pool or the fountain pool, you will enjoy yourself. People wake up early to get spots at the infinity adult pool. We were there for 2 days but found the fountain pool just as good. We however did enjoy the swim up bar at the infinity pool. There aren't too many people there so things never got too rowdy. Beach: It was great that the cabanas were free. Other hotels charge $20 per day. Take advantage! We saw other families with babies got a crib from the hotel staff by the beach right beside their loungers. Perfect for families with small children. Wailea beach is beautiful. the sand is soft and reefs are nearby for snorkeling. We could always find chairs and if not, the staff could easily set one up for you. The view is spectacular and the beach area was easily accessible from the resort. Food: Duo breakfast was excellent. I loved the change up at the buffet so that you don't get bored. I really enjoyed the crepes and the pina colada waffles. The miso soup and dim sum also catered to the Asian palette. The daily free smoothie shot was amazing. Yum! Pool side, room service and Ferraro food were pretty much the same and expensive as expected. The food was OK but can get boring after a few days. Go out and eat at other locations to make it a little more exciting. We tried Tommy Bahamas (at Shops at Wailea) and had our reservations but it turned out much better than expected. We ate at Spago one night. Once again, very expensive but the food was excellent. We recommend the seafood red curry. It was a great setting with great service. The waiter really took care to give us his food recommendations and made the night enjoyable. Activities: There were plenty of activities like yoga and snorkeling to keep you busy at the resort. We also liked the activity centre with pool, table tennis and shuffle board when you just want to escape the sun for a little bit. The gym was well equipped and the open air cardio area was just another plus to the hotel. Shopping: I managed to find a few great deals at the shops at Four Seasons. A dress was 50% off so shopping can be done right on site. The local artists that were there every morning also provided venues for one-of-a-kind gifts and souvenirs. Lobby Bar: Live music and hula dancing were a great way to move to the evening and watch the sun set and fire lighting ceremony. Tip: Make booking the free outrigger program the first thing you do when you get to the hotel. The spots fill up quickly. I would even e-mail the hotel in advance to get a spot if possible. There were 3-4 sessions per weekday and each spot only allowed for 4 guests. It was a popular activity. The instructors were amazing and even did double duty as island tour guides telling you stories and history of the island. We got in at the 7:45AM spot and enjoyed the morning whale watching and sightseeing. One small negative was that we did have to pay for our wifi internet. We also stayed at Grand Wailea and Hana Kai on this trip and both of these locations had free wifi which in my mind should be standard. Location: The resort is a little far from Lahaina, which is where all the action is at. We had friends in that area and we thought we would see them more but we ended up just meeting them for dinner. We did spend one full day at Lahaina with them also but driving back at night was extremely tiring after a full day's of activities. At the end, we were sad to leave. Maui was amazing and Four Seasons definitely added to that experience.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST!”
Reviews.Author: ACKCUk
Reviews.Content: 'The best hotel I have ever stayed at' was my wifes summary of the Four Seasons Maui at Wailea. This is where managers/owners of all the other aspiring 5* resorts, wherever they are in the world, should visit to discover what it means to provide 'top level customer service'. Many others on this site have provided details of what to expect, I just wanted to add my voice to the long list of satisfied customers. This was our fist visit to Hawaii/Maui (a wonderful paradise) and our first stay at a four seasons. If they are all this good we will be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome I want to live there!!”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: I had an amazing week! everything was perfect - so perfect that i want to go back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: asher8506
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons in Wailea for six nights in October 2011 for our honeymoon. After a rough trip over from Tampa, complete with a flight change and 3 hour delay in Dallas, once we arrived at the Four Seasons, we immediately felt welcome and relaxed. They make a point to go the extra mile, remembering your name, making reservations and recommendations for you - basically catering to your every need before you have to ask. The adult's pool area is great, I only wish it was bigger because the chairs get filled up fast. But, there was always plenty of room at the main pool and the attendants would let us know when chairs became available at the adult's pool. It was also nice to receive complimentary snacks such as otter pops and jello, as well as cold towels as we lounged around the pool. We had a lot planned during our stay, since it was my husband's first time to Maui, and many of the guests don't leave the resort. I kind of wish we had spend more than two days at the resort itself and enjoyed all the amenities. The location of the hotel itself is in the most desired area of Maui and was about 20-45 mins to every adventure we planned. We went next door to the Grand Wailea for the spa, since it had so many great reviews (and it was amazing) but the hotel itself was way too overcrowded with lots and lots of children running around. We were torn between the Grand Wailea and the Four Seasons and after visiting the Grand Wailea, I knew we made the right choice. Spago at the Four Seasons was one of our favorite places for dinner and we had the breakfast buffet as well, which was also good. The bar food wasn't all that great and limited in selection while being overpriced. One of the things we really appreciated was the Aloha Suite on our way out. We took a red-eye flight home, so we checked out in the morning, spending the day at the pool and were able to shower and refresh before our 9 pm flight courtesy of this suite. All in all, we were spoiled and had an amazing stay we won't forget.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding!!!!!!”
Reviews.Content: No disappiontments here, this resort is first class all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully taken care of and perfect for families!”
Reviews.Author: bludaizie
Reviews.Content: Of course you expect a lot from a Four Seasons property and this Maui location delivers! The hotel grounds are lovely, the people are helpful with every request. Our 15 month old was completely pampered as well. Upon our arrival the front desk greeted my son and gave him toys which made this little traveler very happy! It didn't stop there. Once we got to our beautiful room there were special treats set up for the adults as well as for my son. They also had more toys, plush state bird and bath toys placed out for him. Our ocean view room was perfect and I could sit on my bed and watch the whales. It was magic! Downstairs the kids play area was perfect for our little one. The pools were great and you felt very pampered as the pool stewards walked around offering your water, snacks, sun screen and the like. The beach was also very nice as well and loved all of the activities readily available right at your finger tips. An addition, the fact that there is a reef w/in swimming distance from the beach was icing on this cake! Long story short this resort was absolutely perfect for this family and we can not wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious VIP Experience”
Reviews.Author: ZeldaSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: Beyond five star VIP experience! I was treated like royalty during my entire visit!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel - of all time!”
Reviews.Author: BurgerflipperHK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Four Seasons in the last week of January 2012 - 2 adults and 2 6yr olds. Stayed in a junior executive suite which had a separate living area where the kids slept at night - great size room for the 4 of us as it gave us privacy at night to watch TV/ read while the kids slept. Hotel was fabulous. Quality of the resort in terms of build and finish is exactly what you would expect from the Four Seasons. Spot on. Despite being a 450+ room "resort" style hotel, we never felt it was that big. Facilities were amazing - 4 pools, great gym, games room, nice beach, great quality restaurants, top kids club and Four Seasons service. Also very conveniently located close to South Kihei where there are lots of activities (we went surfing and stand-up paddle boarding) and restaurants so you don't have to eat in the hotel every meal. Its a fully priced hotel - so its expensive but you definitely get what you pay for. All round, probably the best hotel we have stayed in - ever. Cannot recommend more highly!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: DianneSeattle
Reviews.Content: It is the most relaxing place. Everything is easy and perfect. Food is outstanding, service is just right, not rushed and not lazy. Friendly people and a beautiful property. The beach is not crowded and you can walk on it or on the pathway to keep your feet clean. Music in the lobby bar at sunset is a lovely touch.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, amazing beachside luxury resort”
Reviews.Author: 415beach
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from the most fantastic week in Maui at the Four Seasons in Weilea. The service was 5 star, the resort itself is I think the most beautiful in the area, and the clientelle are all friendly. We don't have kids yet however, the resort also seemed to do a fantastic job in accomodating families with kids menu, baby beach/pool playpens, play room (more for the older kids and teens), and babysitting center too! I would highly recommend the resort to anyone that is looking to stay on the Weilea side. The beach is accessable and fantastic with all sorts of beach toys to rent like kayaks, paddle boards, etc. We tried the sunrise Yogo on the beach and even my husband enjoyed it! There excersize classes all were fantastic. One thing to note, the resort is very expensive and drinks/lunch by the pool, dinner at one of their restaurants all add up VERY quickly so make sure and watch out as we were a bit surprised by our bill. However, I would say that ever dollar was well worth it! I really enjoyed the adult poolside during the day. Kids under 21 are not allowed up there but I would say that it wasn't that that made it so appealing- the views and infinity pool all made it worth it. But make sure to get there early as the chairs are usually booked up by 7:30am in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer F
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a 5 star resort in Maui, this is it! Service, rooms, restaurants, all top notch. Even the breakfast buffet was excellent. Adult only serenity pool with swim up bar and infinity edge was fantastic. The view overlooks putting green, mountains & ocean. Clearly the best spot to relax & enjoy a cocktail. Our room was worth every penny. Loved the large balcony with lounge chairs. Bed and feather pillows were so comfortable. Highly suggest staying here.

Reviews.Title: “poolside pampering”
Reviews.Author: californiagal62
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Four Seasons. We found the room lovely and huge. The bed was very comfortable. We were greeted with a little dessert tray and a lovely note in our room upon arrival. The bathrooms are huge and nicely arranged. We appreciated the empty refrigerator in the room so we could store things of our own and the complimentary bottles of water each day. The staff was friendly and greeted us with "aloha". The deck off of our room was also comfortable and enjoyable to sit comfortably and enjoy the lovely gardens and a view of the ocean. We found the pool area to be fantastic, comfortable and we certainly found the complementary cabana's fabulous. The staff kept our water glass filled with ice water, they came around offering pineapples, cold pops, frozen lemonade and a few other goodies. They place terry cloth covers on each chase lounge as well as a clean towel. The service couldn't have been better. We also found it easy to order food from the many staff coming around regularly. The food was nicely prepared and came at a reasonable time. We split meals and the staff handled this nicely without any extra charge. We would have like self parking offered so we could come and go easily. It was nice having the coffee available each morning on the lower level. This was a special vacation, we hope to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun at Thanksgiving”
Reviews.Author: yellowrosetexas3
Reviews.Content: Since I decided NOT having to cook and going someplace fun for Thanksgiving was a hit in my book, I opted for a little fun in the sun. I have never been disappointed yet at a Four Seasons! Rooms were wonderful, room service was great. Dessert petit fours on arrival. The only negative I had was that it was very "kid friendly" and I didn't mind that until it came time to spa in he Hale and it was hardly relaxing with the kids playing football and listening to their screams while trying to relax during a 250.00 massage! Then you had to walk back to the spa in a robe. Ok, i am modest. They even have a room to stay in after check out until you have to leave for the airport..after all if check out is noon and your flight leaves at 10 PM and you have done everything..then what? Almost perfection...

Reviews.Title: “Bliss”
Reviews.Author: Janet A
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel was very busy with conferences, we were well taken care of and pampered for the three days we were there. Bar staff remembered our favourite drinks and were very good at their jobs. All restaurants were outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “The time of your life!”
Reviews.Author: JoAnne M
Reviews.Content: I challenge you to have a better vacation anywhere else! This is the second visit in 18 months with my adult children and we can't wait to return. You are greeted daily by name, the cold towels, chilled pineapple, frosty pops, and Evian spray which are circulated non-stop all day don't even start to describe the experience. The facility is always in perfect condition. The staff are warm and engaging, professional without being pretentious. Forget what it costs as you can't compare it to any other property on the island. We did a "pub crawl" to check out the other resorts and there is no other comparison. They have spoiled us forever.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but Ritz was better”
Reviews.Author: anna78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spend 8 days in Maui in August 2010. We stayed at the Four Seasons and the Ritz. Usually I love Four Seasons properties, however for the money we found that the Ritz was a much better deal. The good: - Rooms, service, location - The food and dinner specials at Spago were great The ehh: - The adult pool was really nice but you had to pay for a cabana to use it, since getting a chair was basically impossible - and we weren't there during peak season. - The beach was not so great. It was really small and just not very nice. In fact most days we left the hotel to go to some of the other public beaches which were nicer

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TSLive
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for the first part of our honeymoon in late June. We stayed here 4 nights, followed by 3 nights at the Sheraton in Kaanapali, then 5 nights at the Grand Hyatt in the island of Kauai. This was our favorite stay between the 3. I think we paid $460 per night for the cheapest room option which ended up around $500 per night after tax. If you're looking for value in the traditional sense you're probably not looking here. That being said, there are a lot of perks and this is pretty much the best money can buy. Here are the bullet points: - We were upgraded to a corner suite garden view. It was peaceful on the terrace. I don't think there is value in paying for a view, it was pretty much irrelevent to our stay. - We received a free bottle of champagne for our honeymoon - The room was average for a 4-5 star place - The bathroom is incredible. Huge, all marble, radio for the shower, L'Occitane toilertries. - The whole place is open air. If there was a typhone the whole place would get wet! - Partly outdoor fitness center, a game room, not much shopping on site - The valet is awesome and really your only option. Free water, free towels, printed directions, etc. "Free" but gave $10 every time which I personally think is the floor at a place like this. - The lounge is $10-12 per drink with some light entertainment - There is a nice pool in the middle and an adult pool. You need to get up at like 8am to reserve a chair at the adult pool, otherwise they'll take your phone number and call you in 2-3 hours. - Free sun lotion and lemonade stand - The waiters bring you iced water cups even on the beach (free, like everything else) - The beach is really great. Very clean. Pretty quiet since there aren't too many kids at this hotel and its not a public beach. - Free chairs, towels, umbrellas, scuba gear, etc - employees on the beach to help you. The scuba is pretty good by the rocks to the left. We found it good if not better than the infamous black rock in Kaanapali. - The area isn't like Kaanapali by the way. It's more like a retirement community than a village. - We ate at Ferreros and Duo if I remember the names correctly. Both were good but not amazing. We had a comparable meal at the Ruth Chris Steakhouse. It's at the shopping plaza which is a 10-15 minute walk. The shopping plaza had a mix of cheap places and not so cheap places. - I played golf across the street at the blue course and it was ok but nothing special. Overall service was impeccable. The employees are truly helpful and genuinely good people. Fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon destination, heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: Wil-Jam
Reviews.Content: We booked our room over 6 months before coming and were really expecting a lot from our honeymoon at the Four Seasons resort at Wailea and still we were positively surprised many times during our stay. When we arrived, we couldn't stop smiling. It felt like a dream to walk in and see the hotel and the beautiful grounds! We were lei'd and given some tropical drinks and someone took our luggage. At the reception they told us they had upgraded us to a prime ocean view room. We booked a garden view room, so this upgrade for 11 nights was worth a lot! The room was big and beautiful, the bathroom was huge! The view from our room was spectacular! We booked with Whatahotel.com, so we had $80 credit for lunch at Ferraro's and free breakfast everyday. The breakfast is really a huge perk! It costs over $80 per day for two! The breakfast is great though, they have everything you can dream of and cook to order pancakes, french toasts, omelets and much more! The breakfast was always one of the highlights of the day! Although the 11 days at Maui were actually one big highlight! Most days we stayed at the Serenity Pool. During the first days of our stay there were some annoying rich kids that were drinking in the pool and quite loud, but when they left, the atmosphere at the pool was really quiet. Closer to the end of our stay the Serenity Pool was basically the only spot on the grounds that was full of people, otherwise the resort was really quiet and the staff said that it was the quietest time of the year. There were mostly honeymooners, though the whole island seemed to be full of honeymooners! All the restaurants at 4S were good, we liked Ferraro's most and ate there twice. They had a beach wheelchair that you can borrow to get to the beach if you need one. The guys also push you to the beach and back up if you need help. We had lunch at the pool most days. The nachos and quesadillas were both big enough to share and they were delicious! Coke at pool was $5 and mostly ice, but once we started to order it with just a bit of ice, it was better. Beer was $6, so not that bad. The staff were all just amazing. Jeff at the pool was our favorite! He always had time to have a chat with us and took good care of us! The service here was no doubt the best we have ever seen anywhere in the world! The hotel and the grounds were beautiful and very well taken care of! It was a joy to just walk around and enjoy the beauty of the place! Every time we left the hotel we felt like we just want to go back asap. Even though we live on the opposite side of the globe, I'm pretty sure, we'll go again some day!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie E
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fantastic!!! Everything about it!! The staff are professional..of course, it's the Four Seasons and we all like it because of the consistsncy. The service, location, variety of restaurants which included Spago's are all enjoyable in their own way. We came during whale season and WOW!!! The whales love The Four Seasons as well. We saw tons of whales during our visit. They love coming close to the shore. On our last day, we decided to rent a kayak and venture out in front of the hotel and a whale breeched out of the water directly in front of our kayak. It was incredible!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I've been to this hotel quite a few times”
Reviews.Author: travelkuo
Reviews.Content: And each time, the experience is better than the first. The service at this hotel is outstanding....I guess you can never go wrong with any Four Seasons Resorts. The spa is the best in Hawaii. My daughter order a PB&J and she said it was the best PB&J that she ever tasted!!

Reviews.Title: “My wife and I have now been back twice and we love it. It's the best hotel we have ever stayed.mwe highly recomend spago”
Reviews.Author: Adrian B
Reviews.Content: Spago for dinner and the serenity pool cabana and also go to maui stables in Hana for horsriding

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: Colin H
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best vacation we have ever had. We had a heck of a time getting to Maui due to delayed flights, missed connections etc. When we arrived we were informed that they had upgraded us to a partial ocean view executive suite due to our troubles! It was just what we needed. The room was clean and had an excellent view. The staff and service was second to none, friendly and always greeted us by name. They were very accommodating to our two year old daughter as well. They had a diaper genie in the bathroom and her name spelled with sponges on the ledge of the bath. We will be making this an annual trip for us to the Four Seasons Maui! Thank you for a great stay

Reviews.Title: “There is a reason that virtually everyone gives this Resort 5 Stars!”
Reviews.Author: Snoops70
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this resort for 6 days. It was expensive, but well worth it. From the minute we arrived, we were treated like royalty, starting with a room upgrade and being called by our names in virtually every interaction we had with staff. There is no detail too small and nothing is overlooked, from the complimentary sunscreen around the pool and beach, to the complimentary iced tea in the lobby. We went with our 2 young children (5 and 7), and I was amazed at how family friendly this resort is. When we got to our room, there were sponges laid out in the bathroom in the shape of letters spelling our children's names, miniature bathrobes, a "welcome" cookie decorating set, and a "welcome" stuffed Hawaiin Nene bird for each child. We used Kids for All Seasons (the kids camp/daycare) just once for a few hours, but it's free and my kids loved it. It allowed my wife and I to use the spa at the same time (which was extreme serene) and the adults-only Sereneity pool, which wasn't as serene, but had amazing views. However, space is at a premium for lounge chairs at the Serenity pool - you have to get there early to secure a spot. Even if you can't, the Fountain pool is also wonderful and if you have kids, the kids pool is great too. My wife took advantage of the spa at others times and had two wonderful massages. Aside from spending a ton of time swimming at the pools and beach, we took advantage of the complimentary tennis, yoga and croquet. The games room was really fun, too! Not complimentary, but also fun, was having the resort pack us a picnic lunch that we took with us on an outing to a local state park. For dining, we ate at all three restaurants, and all were superb. In my opinion, Duo had the most interesting food, Ferraro's had the best views and Spago was the best overall experience. We celebrated my wife's birthday with dinners at Ferraro's (with the kids - all restaurants have a kids meno by the way) and Spago (without the kids). Both times, the resort, knowing we were celebrating, provided us with prime ocean view seats. In short, this was probably the best vacation we've been on, largely due to the staff and environment at the resort. We don't treat ourselves often to lavish vacations, but this one was well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “A magical stay”
Reviews.Author: Gustavo R
Reviews.Content: Absolutely great! All-star hotel in the middle of paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Best Holiday destinatin”
Reviews.Author: niks85
Reviews.Content: Went to Four Seasons Maui for my honeymoon. Amazing place. Stayed on the club level - room was huge with a beatiful ocean view. Beautiful large bathroom with music that can be place into the bathroom. Service was perfect - the club lounge provided 4 different courses of food everyday, and drinks all day.
