So there was no need to eat anywhere else and food was wonderful. We were given a bottle of french champagne as it was our honeymoon which was a lovevly surprise. Hotel amenities are great - in particular the adult-only pool. I have absolutely no complaints about our stay and hope that I can afford to go back again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel317
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room. Incredible immense bathroom. Our very well located "garden view" room (390) even had a sliver of ocean. As with all Four Seasons properties amenities too many to mention. Especially nice were free sunblock everywhere and some cabanas free and first-come basis. Spago was super and the women's room unbelievable according to my wife. Art collection excellent and extensive--they have both a written self-guided tour and iPod tour very much worth taking. Negatives: charging $10-20/day for internet in 2012 just isn't right, and tacky in the extreme at a Four Seasons at their rates. The "Serenity Pool" was not very serene, over-populated by party animals frolicking in the pool with their drinks, making a lot of raucous noise, and generally behaving like the sales reward winners they were. Too few chaises means you go on a "waiting list" for one. Really! But the view is sensational if you can ignore the rest. No self-park. $20/day parking is another rather tacky add-on which some may want but some days you may not even use the car. Would we return: absolutely. Although the Four Seasons on the Big Island is better.

Reviews.Title: “Super relaxing”
Reviews.Author: penguinschu
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons has service down to a science. From the moment you arrive, you are treated as a guest of the staff. They honor you every opportunity they have. I was hesitant the first time I went to a Four Seasons because I felt it might be too snotty. The exact opposite is true. It is welcoming and comfortable and an ideal place to kick back and relax away the stresses of your everyday life. I have also noticed the other people at the hotel are there to relax as well. It is a good vibe. Very comfortable. FS Maui has an excellent beach and beach staff. It is shared with only one other hotel and feels very private. The view is great and if you are there in February or March you will get a show of breaching Humpback Whales. When we travel here, we try to make it during this season for that exact reason.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Experience - You'll Be Ruined for All Other Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Kristin K
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing and you really feel the difference compared to other hotels immediately. From the moment we stepped out of the car we felt welcome and special. We mentioned we were going up to Haleakala the next morning for sunrise and the guy who greeted us said he would check the weather for us and informed us that they would supply extra blankets for our trip up there. We didn't even ask for it. Check it was a breeze and totally stress free. The room was GORGEOUS! Huge bathroom, double sinks, marble floor, seperate shower. Excellent welcome snack. Huge balcony with super comfy chairs. They thought of everything! The only complaint that I had was how they handle the chairs at their serenity pool. Apparently you have to get there at like 7am to get one and its sort of a stressful free for all. I didn't do that. I did notice that the chairs seem to open up a lot more in the early afternoon so if you really want one but don't want the stress, just get on the waiting list. I still say they should have a reservation system with a waitlist to fill in people who don't show or as people leave, but thats just my thought. As it turned out, it didn't really matter anyway. We discovered that if you can get a chair facing the ocean at the main pool, which is pretty easy to do in a cabana in late morning or early afternoon, that its just perfect. Sure theres a few kids around, but they're no more annoying than the LA d-bags at the serenity pool. The views are amazing from there as well and service of course is excellent. The restaurants are very very pricey...BIG TIME. I'm talking $90 for a steak pricey. Luckily theres a lot of great restaurants around in the area like the Monkeypod which is very cool and we loved the Kai Japanese Tapas place down the street as well. I have never stayed at such a great hotel in the US. A few in Thailand like the Oriental, Penninsula, etc, but never in the US and this one is amazing. Service is perfect, the rooms and hotel are amazing and the food is fantastic. Whatever you need, you will almost never hear no, they will try to find a way to take care of your needs. As a matter of fact, they do a great job of trying to anticipate your needs which is even better. Sure, it costs a little more, but its worth it, and that level of service and maintenance isn't cheap. A word of warning...if you stay here, you'll be spoiled for all other US hotels and everything else will be a step down and you'll be unhappy everywhere else you stay because you'll always say "well, its not the Four Seasons in Maui".

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: Andrea S
Reviews.Content: What can I say that hasn't already been said about this amazing property? It really is a beautiful resort, with amazing staff and amenities. My husband and I spent 5 nights here on a 10 day trip to Hawaii (last 5 nights at the St. Regis Princeville in Kauai - do not stay there). Our entire trip was incredible from check in to check out, truly a five star experience. Everything here is thought of for you, the staff anticipates your needs and goes out of their way to make sure you are enjoying yourself. They do all of this with huge smiles and "of course, no problem!" statements and attitudes. Rooms: We had a club level room, and if you have the opportunity to book this category of room I would jump on it. The Concierge's are amazing, there is a breakfast spread that changes daily, afternoon tea and snacks, and appetizers in the evening. Probably the best value is that cocktails/wine/beer/soda/water are also included. The rooms are beautiful and spacious, very nice bedding, and the bathrooms are to die for. There is plenty of counter space, a double sink and separate tub and shower. The shower is awesome, great shower heads, water pressure and bath products. Housekeeping is also qucik, attentive and curtious, they leave no detail undone. I left my sunglasses out on the table one night when turndown had come in, they not only cleaned them for me, but laid them nicely on a glass cleaning cloth. Now that is service! Personal note on Concierge service - I wasn't feeling well one night and my husband went to the club lounge to grab a snack, when Rowena (amazing amazing person) asked where I was, and he mentioned I wasn't feeling well she offered to come check on me, to keep me company, offered to get anything I wanted for supper (we went with chicken soup!). And it really was just genuine caring service, which was unbelievably appreciated :-) Food/Drink: All of the offerings in the club lounge were very good. We did spend a lot of time at the Serenity pool, enjoying cocktails and lunch daily. Cocktails at the pool were from $13 - $15, wine $16 - $22, beer $6 - $9. Everything we tried was delicious (Bloody Mary's, mixed cocktails and Mojitos). Food was awesome, large portions, and reasonably priced. We shared a spring roll appetizer and a turkey wrap with onion rings one day and it was a huge portion of food for about $35. Most appetizers are from $10-$20 and entrees and salads from $15- $35. Lobby Lounge: Again, very good appetizers and sushi. Cocktails/wine/beer same price as above, excellent popcorn shrimp appetizers and spicy tuna roll sushi. Spago: Food here was excellent, great experience great servers, nice atmosphere. Definitely make reservations! Dinner can get pricey but it is well worth it! Resort Amenities: Here is where the true value of the Four Seasons Wailea shines through. Morning Yoga on the beach - included and a great program! Coffee in the lobby available for guests, sunscreen available at the pools/beach, all sunchairs have a nice cushion on them so they are very comfortable, snacks at the pools, (pineapple, ice pops, mini muffins,etc) Outrigger canoe (make reservations early for this, and just to note it does not run on weekends), snorkel equipment available for 1 hour a day. Scuba shop on site to rent all kinds of water sport stuff, we rented a kayak for an hour for $40 and were able to see fish, coral, and sea turtles! Finally, the Serenity pool a truly Heavenly experience! We traveled between 1/5/12 and 1/9/12, we arrived at the pool around 7am to reserve a seat, usually only a few people were in line, and we always got a great spot! There are probably about 50 chairs so it fills up quick, but we had no problem on any day we chose to go. The pool itself it beautiful, and the staff is very friendly and attentive, always filling up water glasses and coming around to see if you needed anything without being pushy or intrusive. Overall this was a truly amazing experience, and if you are going or planning on going, you will, without a doubt, find every need or want taken care of long before you need to ask anyone. This is a relaxing, happy, easy-going place to be, and you will probably want to pack up the entire staff and take them home with you at the end of your stay, they really are that amazing! Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Paradise!!!”
Reviews.Author: truffles17
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the Four Seasons we knew we were in paradise. You see the ocean as soon as you step into the beautiful lobby. The check-in was smooth and they had a little treat for my 9 month old. But that was only the begninning! We were upgraded to an ocean view room and once we got to our room, we were amazed at all the personal touches. They had treats for my husband and I, and plenty of personalized toys (with her name written out) for my daughter. I have never heard of or been to another hotel/resort that does that. It was really special. The room was immaculate! Spacious, clean and well decorated. Our view was of course amazing! And every morning, I saw a variety of different birds from my balcony. As a birder, this was awesome as I didn't even have to leave the room to do some birding. The pools were amazing, especially the Serenity Pool. When you first see the view from that pool you are just blown away. It couldn't be more perfect. We traveled on three of the five days we were there and the valet guys were always so helpful and informative on how to get to places plus provided us with good tips on where to eat and what to do. Yes I did say Valet and not concierge. We knew what we wanted to do so we didn't really go to the concierge desk but just chatting with the valet guys while they got our car was so helpful. All of the staff was always smiling and we always got an "Aloha!" from all of them everywhere on the resort. There is a shopping mall about 10 minutes away (walking) from the resort which is wonderful. They have a great gift shop there which is very affordable for all you knickknacks and souvenirs. We ended up eating breakfast at one of the restuarants in the mall, I think it was called Blue cheeseburger but I'm not sure. We all got the breakfast special which was delish! Hint:Take the shortcut by passing thru the Grand Wailea Resort next door. Plus you get to see their grounds, which are beautiful, but you can compare and tell that you are staying at the best resort at the Four Seasons. Make sure to take advantage of the complimentary snorkeling. We ended up doing this the last day we were there and I regret not doing it more often. The fish are amazing and my husband saw two sea turtles!Yes i despise him a little because I did not get to see them. I'm sure if we went more than once, I would've seen them. The entire snorkeling trip takes less than two hours and is a great workout. Again, I wish we had done it earlier and more frequently during our stay. There is a garden pathway to the left of the resort. This is the pathway you want to be on while the sun is setting over the ocean. You can't really see the sunset from the lobby as we found out. So if you want to take pictures of the sunset, this is the place to be. Or even if you don't, this pathway is beautiful and a nice place for a relaxing walk in the evening. Everything was positive about our stay at the Four Seasons Resort Maui. It is an impressive resort all around and one that we will be comparing all our future stays at other hotels/resorts to.

Reviews.Title: “RELAXING, LUXURIOUS EXPERIENCE- DEFINITELY A DO-OVER”
Reviews.Author: allisonlight
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned last week from a week long vacation to Four Seasons Wailea in Maui. We had a fabulous time and will definitely book this trip again next year. Overall, if you have researched this property, everything you have read is probably true. There are many wonderful features, and "value added" reasons to book your stay at the Four Seasons. My husband and I stayed on the club level and it was definitely well worth the extra investment. While the food on this level wasn't exactly gourmet, it wasn't bad either. Some items being much better than others. Dining in Maui is expensive and we found great value in the club level. The alcohol selection on club level is top notch though. Only high end liquor and wine available. We dined at the pool on once occasion and thought the food was very good. (Nachos about $25, pina colada $16) We ate at Duo for breakfast and dinner and loved it both times. The breakfast bar is $35 per person, but the pancakes with warm coconut syrup and macadamia nuts are to die for and worth trying. I won't forget those for a LONG TIME. We ate at Ferraro's twice, once for lunch and once for dinner. We found it to be better for dinner. Unfortunately, other than pool food, Ferraro's is the only restaurant open for lunch. While vacationing, I was able to borrow a kindle (at no charge) from the concierge and read several books during my stay! The fitness center is more than adequate for any fitness enthusiast. They have many fitness group classes to choose from. I took part in the spin class and it was a killer! I want to touch on the serenity pool while I'm on this subject, because this is a hot item at the resort. If you are travelling without children, then you will definitely be sucked into the serenity pool "quicksand" once you get there. The serenity pool is beautiful, no doubt. It literally looks like a postcard. Unfortunately, this little slice of paradise only accomodates about 75 people. Expect to wait in line at at least 6:30 am, yes, 6:30am, (They start seating at 7am) to get a good spot at this coveted pool. There is nothing anyone can do to help you get a spot- everyone waits in line. You can leave your seats for an hour at a time. I had a few issues with the serenity pool, one being that the sun isn't even out until at least 9-9:30am, and since it's shade, it's cold! Remember that you get your seat at 7am, but there's no service in this area until they open the bar until 10-10:30am (I can't remember exactly which.) So basically, they force you to "protect" your spot, with no service, while it's still cool and there's no sun. They also do not allow you to talk on your cell phone in the serenity pool area. If you rent a cabana, you can blab away as loud as you want too. But if you are in the chairs around the pool, they will discreetly and politely tell you it is not allowed. Don't forget to turn your ringer on silent- they will hear it. The housekeeping service was twice a day and excellent. For example, They saw my sunglasses sitting on the desk and left a Four Seasons sunglasses cleaner. They left us goodies upon arrival and the L'Occitane toiletries were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting”
Reviews.Author: dallas9284
Reviews.Content: Well this was our third time back and the resort is beautiful and upscale. The service is always wonderful. If you can choose anytime of the year try and go during the off season. We went after Thanksgiving which did provide for a lower volume of people, but DUOs, one of the restaurants there closed on our second day there for maintenance. Shame because it was a good place to get a steak and the breakfast buffet is served there. They switched the buffet to Spago which provided nice views, but buffett was smaller. Other than that they were doing some general maintenance in our hallway and on grounds which is my only real complaint since I have never been there when they were doing this kind of maintenance. I usually go in September and it is a little warmer and sunnier than when we just went in November, but we all had a great time and you get what you pay for. The spa was wonderful as usual and we had great meals at resort and at shoppes of Wailea. A couple of tips: The lounge is a nice place to hang out and they have a dinner menu. Get there 30mins before sunset and get a good seat for their sunset entertainment. Secondly Ferraros is an awesome restaurant especially for dinner. Try and get as close a seat to ocean as possible and 20-30 mins before sunset for a beautiful sunset dinner. As is gets darker their live music kicks in and the night sky is awesome. Oh one more tip. If you plan on doing some activities get to the concierge in the first day or two to review and get reservations for activities that way you are not waiting till the last day or two to try and do something. I highly recommend this resort and if your into it you get to see some famous people as well.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay in Wailea”
Reviews.Author: nogus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Four Seasons Wailea this last November to celebrate our honeymoon. It was a very special experience for us because my in-laws were able to come from Japan and stay at the hotel with us for 3 days also. The service was amazing which is what you would expect from a Four Seasons property and the grounds were beautiful. We ate at both Ferraros restaurant and Duo. Both were very good and the service was pretty darn good too. My wife had a massage at the spa and I could tell her experience was very special. All of the staff was friendly and helpful and we will be staying at the Four Seasons again, hopefully in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent.”
Reviews.Author: Lassie52
Reviews.Content: This resort is definitely the best I have ever stayed at. The attention to detail is second to none. Such a magnificent holiday,nothing was ever too much trouble for any staff. You will not be disappointed at all. We stayed at a competitive hotel next door prior to staying at the Wailea Four Seasons only because it was booked out, you can't compare the two. The Four seasons wins hands down in all categories.If you want to be pampered and spoiled, this is the resort for you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Daniel G
Reviews.Content: The perfect honeymoon! There is no doubt in my mind this hotel is worthy of its top 5 US ranking. The customer service and facilities will exceed your expectations, even after going in with the idea that your expectations will be exceeded. Friendly staff, gorgeous facilities, and everything you're looking for in a great Maui experience. Strongly recommend it. Two tips: Don't be afraid to ask the concierge for advice or tips. They are very helpful. And two, consider the garden view rooms, since you will pay half as much and you won't miss the ocean view.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ever.”
Reviews.Author: MarciaCuik
Reviews.Content: Great service. Great location. No complaints. The hotel is a perfect place to relax. You can enjoy Wailea beach during the stay. This wasn't our first time to Maui, so we didn't explore so much of the island, instead we enjoyed the perfect service and amenities of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “family of five's awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: zahid h
Reviews.Content: Just came back from our first trip to the resort and Hawaii........it was beautiful. the resort was all that we hoped for and more. We have a 13 year old, a 5 year old and a 6 month old, all boys, and not a grumble or the dreaded "I'm bored" from the elder of the kids. The infant was cared for from the start, from the little baby care products in the bathroom, the crib in the room, already setup when we checked in, to the complimentary playpens by the cabana, or the pool loungers. The teenager got the boogie board from the hotel shop and spent the holiday chasing waves. The resort might seem steep as far as prices are concerned, but the complimentary services offered more then made up for it: no charges for the cabanas, no charges for the kids camp/club, the free kids meals at restaurants, no charges for the playpens etc and on it goes. The staff is exemplary, and again, its the little touches that count, the smiles, the greetings by name. I know its corny, but its what counts. My wife went to the grand wailea to use their spa, she says it felt like standing in line at a buffet (even though it was rated as the "best in Maui" by Conde Nast), to recuperate from that experience, she went to the four seasons spa...a world apart. Restaurants: Ferraro's is awesome for romantic meals, order the lobster linguini. share, there's plenty for two. Spago's: we went with the whole kaboodle, requested, and got a great table to see the sunset. get there by 5 pm (winter time) to get the best table. Duo: go for the full buffet, and spend a load of time at breakfast. it's a beautiful setting, its relaxed, the service; wonderful (ask for micheal) but watch out for the sparrows. those little buggers are aggressive. sorry if I wax lyrical, it was THAT good. we've stayed at resorts all over the world, but nothing compared to the service and the excellence we experienced here. we cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: pc_seattle
Reviews.Content: Overall, the Wailea Four Seasons is an intoxicating, breathtaking experience, near paradise. After agonizing over the best hotel to stay in Wailea I think this may be it. The beach front and terraced areas that have umbrellas and covered cabanas are amazing. I didn't see this in any other hotel I surveyed in Wailea-- from almost any vantage you have sweeping views of ocean! The pools are great. For kids, there aren't the big kid play areas like other places (which was good for me, as I was looking for serene, quiet). The adult serenity pool was very nice, with a swim up bar. I will note however, to secure a nice beach spot on one of the prime terraced umbrellas/cabanas you have to get up at the crack of dawn and reserve at 7am-- and it can be a bit competitive. The service was overall pretty good but perhaps not fantastic. I hesitate to put this here, but I did fine urine splashed on the wall in the bathroom (reminiscent of my stay at some horrible roadside hotel many years ago). I cleaned it off with a washcloth, and then had some elses gross urine stained washcloth in my 5 star hotel bathroom. I did tell concierge and they were nice about it, I guess. The other downside is that the menus cater to the American mean-- that is, the food is "pretty good", but certainly not catering to the vegetarian-quinoa-organic set, and overall, not a lot of healthy menu options. These small inconveniences were offset by all the other perks, including the fact we were upgraded from a garden view to an ocean view at no additional cost. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Service”
Reviews.Author: LovePalmTrees2012
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Maui where we spent 7 nights at the Four Seasons in Wailea. We now understand why this hotel is rated best in the area. We travel quite a bit and have stayed in some beautiful resorts all over the world, but never have we felt so pampered and indulged. The hotel is beautiful and is located right on Wailea Beach, one of our favourite beaches in the world. We booked out stay through ----------------- so we were given a complimentary room upgrade, daily full buffet breakfast and an $85 lunch credit. We were celebrating our anniversary and found a beautiful red rose and bottle of champagne in our room when we arrived. The service at this hotel is unparallelled. The staff goes out of their way to be helpful and really make you feel at home. And the list of complimentary activities is endless: yoga on the beach, pilates, aerobics classes, tennis camps, and the traditional Hawaiian Outrigger Canoe Program (which was so much fun). If you have kids, the camps are also complimentary. The rooms are very spacious and impeccably clean, with maid service twice daily. The on site restaurants are amazing, especially Ferraro's, and are destinations in and of themselves, so make your reservations early. I suffer from severe food allergies so restaurant dining can be an ordeal for me, but the staff went above and beyond to make sure that I was not only comfortable, but thoroughly enjoyed the dining experience. The ranting and raving in all of these reviews is 100% earned. Thank you Four Seasons for a truly memorable week in paradise!! We can't wait to come back!!

Reviews.Title: “The best Four Seasons Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1foodude
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a number of Four Seasons Hotels and while they are all nice, this one is by far the best. The view is outstanding and the rooms are excellent, but what sets this place apart is the service. Just walking around the property the staff knew me by name. You really don't need to leave the hotel and except to visit a restaurant in town and a whale watching cruise, we didn't! I don't know what was going on the week we were there, but there were a lot of teenagers there which was beginning to get on my nerves a bit. Other than that, are stay was excellent - oh, I saw Jody Foster there so that didn't hurt either...

Reviews.Title: “What others could learn”
Reviews.Author: fidelrobert
Reviews.Content: This is a very expensive property. But if you can shell out the dough, go for it. You won't regret it. There are two things this property does that other properties could learn from. First, impeccably clean rooms. I LOVE THIS. (Yes, I am shouting.) Second, staff that is unpretentious and genuinely helpful. It's so easy, but others can't seem to get it right. It doesn't hurt that the Four Seasons is beautiful. It truly is. Be sure to explore every inch of it. Tips: go to the first floor game room some evening for some fun. One of the few I've ever seen that adults can be comfortable in. Pool tables, ping pong, etc. Another tip: catch the adult pool up on the top floor deck above the restaurants. It is really cool. Final tip: walk to the Shops at Wailea. No need to arrange and wait for a ride. It's close enough. I'll go back to the Four Seasons Wailea every chance I get.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence!”
Reviews.Author: sjs1234
Reviews.Content: This is a showcase for luxury. The only thing more lovely then the hotel is the view. Service doesn't get any better then what we experienced during our stay. There is no place else you should stay in Maui. The price for an ocean view room is well worth it. Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: rwagner999
Reviews.Content: I only wish I could live at this resort. I try to stay here at least once a year. It is one of the only resorts where I feel everything I need is right here and no need to go off property. I love all three restaurants. On our first trip my daughter ordered chicken quesadillas. She was saying how nice it would be if they offered rice and beans with it. The waiter overheard her and apologized and said that the following day the chef would make sure it was available. The next day it was. This is the sevice you expect and get at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Surreal experience, year after year after year!”
Reviews.Author: blazer1115
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been making the Four Seasons Wailea a MUST stop during our annual Hawaii vacation. There are so many wonderful attributes of this gorgeous resort that it's difficult to focus on just a few. However, tops on the list is the service. It is remarkable that we see the same faces year after year and they remember us from the previous trip and they remember specifics about our previous conversations. The resort itself is beautiful, the rooms are spacious and comfortable and the bathrooms are big...VERY big! The restaurants are all top-notch and the cocktails perfectly made, regardless of which bar you choose to enjoy them in. In my opinion, Wailea beach is among the most beautiful and pristine in all the Hawaiian islands and, for the divers out there, some fantastic dive sites are within a reasonable distance. Ultimately, there is honestly not a single negative comment I can make about this resort and I believe we will continue to revisit year after year. This resort is not cheap by any means but I feel that everyone should treat themselves at least once during their lifetime...

Reviews.Title: “panache, everything with a touch of class”
Reviews.Author: marx-engels
Reviews.Content: nothing is pretentious...everything "comme il faut" it is the real way of "savoir vivre" it is heaven on earth if i could i would become addicted to four-season resorts

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable!”
Reviews.Author: focusedonstyle
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Maui is beautiful and the employees give you 5-star service. This is a pricey place to stay but well worth every penny. We got married here as well and we were treated like royalty. You will not regret staying here! Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “The resort standard by which all other resorts should be compared”
Reviews.Author: lasereyesdoc
Reviews.Content: We continue to be wowed by the staff, facilities and services at Four Seasons Resort Maui. Our most recent stay during the incredibly busy festive season was punctuated by the expected Four Seasons service. However, the staff goes above and beyond beginning with a personal welcome by the managment staff when our taxi pulled up and ending with a personal farewell by top management at our departure. In between the quality of service is without peer. The effort to ensure that every need is addressed and every comfort provided cannot be matched anywhere else we travel. Poolside service is excellent. Housekeeping knows our personal needs and preferences and provides for them in the room before we have even checked into our room. Our desired cleaning schedule is anticipated and ensured. When I casually mentioned that I had a sore throat, a selection of teas were in my room along with an electic kettle without my asking. The breakfast buffet is superb. The inhouse restaurants are all exceptional with the exception of Spago which continues to be hit and miss and overpriced. However, Duo and Ferraro's provide the best food on Maui. There is no reason to stay at any other hotel in Maui and this is clearly one of the best resorts in the USA.

Reviews.Title: “My wife cant wait to get back”
Reviews.Author: mpdorf
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Four season Maui on our honeymoon. I dont think I have much more to add to the reviews that have already been posted. The service at the Four Seasons was impecable, restaurants top notch and the location phenomenal. Perfect honeymoon. My wife loved the spa, and I took full advantage of the dive shop on site. The one problem.... My wife now has a new benchmark for luxury travel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: angcici
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Maui on a belated honeymoon in Nov 2011. We stayed across the island so we managed to see all parts. By far, our experience at the Four Seasons could not be matched. It was a beautiful space with too many ammenities that we were unable to take part in all of them! They were beyond helpful offering blankets for when we went to Haleakala, towels, direction and anything we needed! The Spa was amazing and my beachside massage excellent. The extras we got by booking through What a Hotel were wonderful bonuses! We ate at all of the restaurants and enjoyed every single one. The Four Seasons offers the best service and our future Maui trips will only require staying at this hotel. They made our honeymoon magical!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- great visit”
Reviews.Author: MJP76
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and great service. It was not exactly the atmosphere we had in mind â€“ larger than we expected and more people. We have been to Tahiti several times and prefer the smaller style of the hotels there. However, that is the only thing that was not perfect and that was really our own fault for not having the right expectations since we knew how big the hotel was when we booked it. The service here was amazing (better than Tahiti) and it is a very, very nice hotel. The pools were good. The beach is great for snorkeling and kayaking so we would highly recommend that. We had an ocean view room and it was lovely. The rooms are very clean and spacious. The bathroom is huge with more than enough counter space, floor space, separate tub & shower as well as toilet closet. We had a huge lanai with two lounge chairs and a table with two chairs. The grounds are beautifully manicured and maintained. Nice tennis courts and plenty of activities. The restaurants were good and breakfast was always a pleasant experience. We dined out a couple of nights and dined in a couple of nights. Definitely try to explore the island with a rental car one day or two. Hotel parking is expensive. Hotel concierge was wonderful. The whole place is very well managed and they really go the extra mile for the guests if there is any kind of issue. It is an expensive hotel, but if you want great service and a great experience then you really canâ€™t go wrong here!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star”
Reviews.Author: LeKaren
Reviews.Content: Was lucky enough to stay here on a business trip with my husband. We were only scheduled to stay for 3 nights which, after travelling from London, felt like a very short time indeed! The journey is completely worth it - as soon as we arrived we felt the tension dissipate. From the friendly staff at the front entrance who whisk your baggage to your room to the pool attendants filling your glass with water whenever needed, nothing ever appeared too much trouble. Ok, you would expect this level of attentiveness from a hotel costing this much...& it does cost ($45+ for a continental breakfast!). I had one of best massages I've ever had in the spa, again pricey but worth it. Impeccably clean all round, beautiful rooms with huge bathrooms & plenty of wardrobe/hanging space. Off site there is a great little shopping centre less than 10 minutes walk along the beach...couple of nice restaurants here too if you wish to take a break from the hotel itself. Fabulous trip, would gladly return.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable”
Reviews.Author: AndreasF355
Reviews.Content: Simply the most amazing experience we have ever had in a five star resort. From the moment of arrival to the airport you are carried through a seamless and effortless experience. I don't know how they operate so perfectly but we did not have one experience or interaction that wasn't memorable. The hotel is spectacular, the pool and beach are gorgeous, but the staff are te stars. Bravo! Recommend the going on the Outrigger! We had a close up experience with whales. Life long memory. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Cathy430
Reviews.Content: I don't believe there is anything else to say! Staying at the Four Seasons Resort Maui at Wailea is an absolutely wonderful experience. The rooms are exceptionally clean and spacious. You certainly don't mind having to share the bathroom with your spouse because the bathroom is very large with more than enough counter space, floor space, separate tub & shower as well as toilet closet. The grounds are beautifully manicured and maintained, the restaurants provide absolutely delicious food and the beach is wonderful but above all, the service provided at this resort is perfectly stellar! While on Maui we rented a car which we found to be the only way to truly visit the island as we were free to come and go as we pleased and were able to visit a few out of the way spots that otherwise would have been missed. Be advised that guests vehicles at the Four Seasons Maui MUST be valet parked. If you have the opportunity to visit this property my advise is to do so without hesitation unless, you are on a tight budget - this resort is quite expensive - but if money is no object I wholeheartedly recommend a vacation at Four Seasons Maui at Wailea!

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to every expectation”
Reviews.Author: Mollysgrandma
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location, gorgeous hotel, every little detail taken care of. We have stayed here a few times and will continue to do so. Yes, it's expensive, but worth every penny! Ferraro's is our favourite restaurant there - great food and ambiance. I was really impressed when I asked the concierege where I could buy a book and she loaned me a Kindle which had ninety books downloaded on to it. Yet another feature the Four Seasons had thought of.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Maria P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled from Australia to celebrate our 10 year anniversary at The Four Seasons in Maui. I knew we it would be great but was just overwhelmed at how wonderful everything was. The Four Seasons has thought of everything - when it comes to providing exceptional service, they have left no stone unturned. We booked a garden view room and were pleasantly surprised when we upgraded to a partial ocean view by our travel agent (whatahotel.com). The room was wonderful. Great size and again, everything you could think of. We didn't spend too much time in the room as the location was just beautiful. We spent a lot of time in the cabanas near the pool or on the beach. The poolside and beachside service was amazing. We didn't need to bring anything with us as everything was provided from sunscreen, reading materials, towels and water. They even came around every few hours with a different food or treats for us to try! The service in all the restaurants (Spago and Ferraro's) was very friendly. The food in Spago was exceptional. The food in Ferraro's was a little overpriced, but still OK. The view from both was breathtaking. Overall, we had a wonderful time at the Four Seasons and Maui. Thank you to all the staff who made it that extra special. This was truly the best hotel we have ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the serenity pool!!!”
Reviews.Author: misnerd
Reviews.Content: Aloha, This was our second trip to the 4 Seasons Maui, and our 4th trip to Maui--this hotel by FAR exceeds all expectations!!! Despite DUO being under construction, and having a view of the parking garage (be forewarned if you opt for a "mountain view room"), we had a fabulous time. Wouldn't stay anywhere else on Maui (will opt for ocean view room again next time!). The adults only serenity pool is fantastic--Eric and Danny took great care of us. And Ross was great at the ocean equipment place, teaching us how to paddle board. Love this place, can't recommend it highly enough!!!! Two quibbles: we always enjoyed the fact that the 4 seasons doesn't nickel and dime people on "resort fees" etc. That said, this last time, we had to 1) pay for internet in our room or by the pool ($10 for crappy internet or $18 for slightly less crappy internet; had trouble with both and was comped; thankfully, Cassandra was awesome!!!) and 2) pay for valet parking ($20/night) when you CANNOT self park. I am not against these folks making $$ or changing things in an economic crisis, but somehow I hate having to pay extra when I get there. I would prefer they just add $20/night for valet parking (since there is no other option) to the price of the room. If you have to valet park, then just include that in the price!!!!! And charging tow tiers of internet access is just silly, most people want (and need) to be connected to the internet these days. And it wasn't working most of the days we were there in December, but that may have been due to weather conditions. That aside, the service, the property, the serenity pool is just awesome!!!! I will come many more times, just because it is just THAT great. But please, stop charging with the "extras", felt more luxurious before when it was "all inclusive", and I appreciated that especially about the 4 seasons....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: A2Traveler_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 20 year anniversary by taking a trip to Hawaii. We decided that the Four Seasons in Maui would be the place to stay. We are very glad we did. This hotel knows what the word 'service" means. Prior to arriving at the FS, we did receive a telephone call that DUO would be undergoing renovations so it would be closed during our visit. The breakfast buffet moved to Spago. I must say the buffet was fantastic! We did have an ocean view room and it was lovely. Our room was cleaned daily, morning and night, so no complaints here. The bed was so comfortable and the pillows so fluffy. We had no problems falling asleep at night. We stayed at the FS for seven days and then moved on to Ohau. After experiencing such great service, and no crowds on the beaches, it was a shock to our system when we arrived at our new hotel in Waikiki. We both wished we had never left Maui. Thank you Four Seasons for making our trip so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning”
Reviews.Author: kirbytristan
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in this resort!!! Wanted to move in. Service was amazing, Staff were the friendliest I had seen!!! Will for sure be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly amazing!!!!”
Reviews.Author: crosslinha
Reviews.Content: Where do you start after the most memorable stay on any vacation? The moment we arrived on Dec 5 to our departure on Dec 16 we knew we chose the perfect resort for us. We went to Maui to get married(just us two) and to honeymoon! Everyone-laundry service-conceierge-pool staff-valet-gift shop-business center-EVERYONE knew how to make us feel special. Wendy was a great help on our decision making for our day trip to Hana. Kristen and Rowena at the pools were awesome! Valet Jeff was always helpful with making our dinner reservations and taking pics of us! Ha Jeff-the pool guy-was by far the most attentive, fun, entertaining and awesome staff at the FS. The room service 2x a day was so detailed, very cleaned, and organized. Laundry service was great considering I had to travel w my wedding dress and the made it look like new! The different art displays daily were nice and we bought some hand made baskets! The outrigger and snorkel time were great! Make sure you go in the am bc the waters get choppy! I had a blast paddle boarding too! Never tried it before and it was so fun! I have so much to say about the FS I could write a book. It was the most amazing place i have ever been, and we travel a lot!!

Reviews.Title: “My advice to hotel operators - Aspire to the Four Seasons Wailea”
Reviews.Author: 144edward
Reviews.Content: Our family spent 6 nights at the Four Seasons, Wailea (Maui) and I can simply say it is the finest "service" hotel our family has enjoyed. There's no great secret to operating a hotel, but it takes a remarkable amount of effort, management and customer focus to make it look this effortless :) Rooms were excellent, well kept and clean. Beds were comfortable with the soft pillows I like. With kids we had an interconnecting room which worked well. On arrival we had all our three kids names spelt out in bath sponge letters in their bathroom. Very cute and a nice touch. The hotel is extremely well kept and maintained. The facilities are first rate. During the day we pretty much roamed between the Cabana's surrounding the main pool, or on the beach where the staff are only too happy to either pitch an umbrella or beachside cabana. Great restaurants including Spago's for fine dining or Ferraro's for a little more "casual" dining. Mind you the view is simply amazing and there's nothing casual about the service, the food nor the location, it's just what the people wear :) It's things like "complimentary hotel car". I mean how many times have you been suckered in by this to find there's one car that is never quite around when you need it and is no good for families? Well there must be 5 Hotel Cars here and we never waited anymore than about 2 minutes to get taken to the shops or restaurants. Great cars, clean cars and plenty even for a family of 5! I have stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village at Waikiki approximately 5 times in the past 5 years and have to say staying here has made me realise how tired the HHV experience is. What is most impressive is that there is an abundance of staff everywhere. And not just staff. Real customer focused, nothings an effort, can I *really* help you staff. It's proactive, but not in your face, it's professional, but never clinical. It's just appears effortless and yet everywhere. Always a smile, never a problem. If you want one of the most relaxing holidays possible, in one of the most beautiful locations, at one of the best maintained hotels, with outstanding amenities and the most friendly staff possible, then the Four Seasons Maui is simply a must. Congratulations Four Seasons, this is the new standard to which other operators should aspire. An amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Short but fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: Gordon B
Reviews.Content: Many trips to Maui in the past, first time at the Four Seasons. That's our place from now on.

Reviews.Title: “One Unforgettable Stay”
Reviews.Author: sbajaj621
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I wanted to take a trip that would be absolutely epic so after looking through different islands around the US, we settled on Maui. Coming from New York, the trip was a bit long but well worth it, especially once you come across the beautiful open-walled lobby accompanied by the perfect island weather. We arrived fairly late into Wailea and couldn't help but grab a quick drink after check-in then walked a few short steps to the soft sand beach. We stayed at this hotel for about a week and to this day we still rave about how this is the best hotel we have ever stayed at. Rented a car and drove around all of Maui - always made time for a quick nightcap at the Four Seasons. We are already planning our anniversary back. Rooms were great as well, definitely seek out a balcony room! The staff all go way out of their way to help you and are extremely welcoming and friendly. If you are staying in Maui, this hotel is a must visit.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place in Maui”
Reviews.Author: luluatoll
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Maui is an easy vacation. Fly in, rent a car and drive 30 minutes to the hotel. Its a big property but manages to maintain an small property feel. This visit we opted for their $100 extra a night to upgrade to a ocean view suite. The room indeed had an oceanview from the balcony only - I quickly learned the difference between "ocean front" and "ocean view". The suite was really large and clean, but despritely needed updating. Its was a faded '80's memory - wicker and sunfaded cushions. The room service was subpar - one meal having to be completely returned. The ledd expensive Duo restaurant had a sudden closing for 3 weeks on our second day, leaving us Spago $$$ or Italian Ferraro restaurant. If you are travelling without kids - get up a bit early and make a reservation at the Serenity Pool - quaint, quiet and by reservation only - but worth it. If you are looking for a quiet get away avoid ThanksGiving. Weekend. This was my 3rd time to this resort - and wow what a diiference coming at Thanksgiving it was a zoo, really hard to get a seat by the pool or beach.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, Amazing staff, and we plan to return in 2012”
Reviews.Author: ceilokla
Reviews.Content: It just gets better! This was our 3rd visit to Maui Four Seasons and again it was fabulous. We were upgraded to a partial ocean room and were amazed with the views from our lani. In past visits we have stayed in mountain and garden view rooms. To me an inner courtyard room either garden or partial ocean view made for a more relaxing visit. We spent most of our time on the beach. It is an exceptionally beautiful beach with crystal clear blue water. To me it seemed that the service at the beach was more personable then that at the serenity pool. I also found the beach far more interesting than the pool [saw whales from the beach]. When we visited FS in 2010 housekeeping was inconsistent with some days our room not being serviced until after 4pm. This trip our room was serviced in the mornings or early afternoon, while we were at the beach. 99% of the staff went beyond expectations in anticipating our needs and attentiveness to needs. The only negative I experienced came from Spago's [and I think that Spago's is managed separate from the hotel]...okay, that explains the "attitude" at Spago's. We ate at Ferraros one night, good service however, the food is average at best. We ended most evening having cocktails in the lobby lounge listening to the live music and found this very enjoyable. Duo's was closed during our stay so no comment on that restaurant this stay. Overall this was a relaxing, refreshing vacation mostly due to the extraordinarily beautiful beach, positive atmosphere and staff at Maui four seasons. We are making plans to return in 2012 to celebrate birthday/anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “5 Days of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: MI6007
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Maui is wonderful resort. Beautiful beach and beautiful views make it a great location for a romantic getaway or family with kids trip. The staff is exceptional and the service is attentive but you are not overwhelmed with their presence.

Reviews.Title: “Unmatched Service and Quality”
Reviews.Author: Michael H
Reviews.Content: Undoubtedly the best hotel stay in 35 years of travelling. The service, which was very attentive and off the chart friendly, was even better than the reviews we read before coming. Just when things couldnâ€™t get better they upgraded us to a fabulous suite because the hotel next door was undergoing some minor construction. It's expensive but we saved some money by following a previous TA tip to book through What-A-Hotel.com (Lorraine Travel)free breakfast, one free lunch and perhaps a little pull for that great upgrade. Ask for Lucy. You won't want to leave the hotel to see Maui -simply awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Wow Effortless Relaxation!”
Reviews.Author: Ellie M
Reviews.Content: Everything is there, sunscreen, magazines, pool/beach toys, water service, pack n play & cabanas. It's all there for you complimentary. Just pack your clothes and don't think about anything!

Reviews.Title: “The best of the best....”
Reviews.Author: Jeff749
Reviews.Content: My wife, 16 y/o son and I spent an outstanding first week of Dec at the resort. I have to say while we have grown to have very high expectations when paying premium dollars for 5 star locations, the team at Four Seasons Maui met and exceeded our scale. Extremely clean rooms and resort in general with exceptionally attentive staff. Pricey perhaps, but left feeling we received outstanding value for our money. We will be back.....

Reviews.Title: “Typical Four Seasons Excellence!”
Reviews.Author: JetJunkie
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of staying at the Four Seasons Maui for 10 nights. This was a special wedding anniversary, and luxury was a requirement for our stay. This hotel did not disappoint us in the luxury department! Our room was on the top floor and close to the ocean ... which gave us gorgeous views from our balcony. The cleanliness of our room was top-notch, and fittings were amazing. The only blemish on an otherwise perfect stay was our dinner at the Spago restaurant. What a disappointment! Mediocre food and pretentious staff ... not a good combination. Overall though, can't wait to go back to the Four Seasons Maui ...

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST RESORT THERE IS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dieoma
Reviews.Content: The staff is superb, the Resort is gorgeous, the location is perfect. Relax and enjoy!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service, amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: GoddessSarah
Reviews.Content: I most enjoyed the recreation activities - tennis lesson, feldenkreis, meditation, yoga on the beach... so much that I really didn't even leave the hotel to explore Maui. I'll have to do that next time. I was content with living in luxury 24-7 during my stay, and they had upgraded me to a huge suite. There was the most incredible sunset on the beach. I really didn't want to leave, I'd like to live at the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but worth the luxury”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: The service and setting are perfect. If you plan to stay in West Maui, this hotel is in league above the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience. (Beach services need a tweak.)”
Reviews.Author: Jason M
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I recently stayed at the resort. Upon check in, we were greeted with Leis and warm towels, and a little cup refreshing mint tea. We were upgraded upon check in to a wonderful room overlooking the back of the hotel and the ocean. This was the perfect area of the hotel to stay since we had wonderful views of the Maui sunset. I posted a picture of the last sunset of our stay. The hotel, grounds and room were immaculate. The space is large, and airy. Open and comfortable. It's never overdone or uptight. There is amazing Hawaiian art all over the resort. The flowers are beautiful, as is all of the other spaces of the hotel. The bed was very comfortable. My favorite touch was the pre-set radio stations in the bathroom. I always set ours to Hawaiian music. The bathrooms are huge, well appointed and also immaculate. We sat in all areas of the resort including at the beach (more on this later) the fountain pool, the lawn overlooking the beach and the serenity pool area. Service was attentive and fantastic. Drinks were wonderful as was the Mai Tai in the pineapple! Food served at the pool was great. Yes, the serenity pool is crowded and you will often not be able to get a seat here. Put your name on the wait list first thing in the morning after breakfast. This was not a big deal for us since we preferred sitting by the pool or overlooking the beach. Overall, service was fantastic, and everyone greeted us by name. We needed a shuttle to run to a dinner reservation (because DUO was closed) in Wailea and were taken in a very nice late model Cadillac with wonderful service. We ate at Spago, Ferraro's, the Lobby lounge, the pool and had room service. Ferraro's was our favorite. We had a wonderful server who was Italian and had a nice chat with him about Italy. We loved sitting in the lobby lounge drinking wonderful Mai Tais, watching the hula dancer and listening to music. I had a neck and shoulder massage by the pool which was amazing. The staff is very attentive and came around with cucumber slices, cool towels, Evian spritzer and little treats. This was our favorite part of the stay...sitting on the lawn overlooking the beach reading and enjoying the service. My fiancÃ© got a mani-pedi. When she accidentally chipped off the nail polish, they fixed it for free. We took the outrigger canoe class on Friday and that was fun. Great to be out on the water and get a different perspective of the island. All in all, If you are looking for the perfect blend of relaxed, but attentive service, with a nice sense of being in Hawaii, this is the perfect place. Now for the two slightly less than awesome aspects which is saying a lot because basically everything in this resort is wonderful and excedes expectation. Everyone who works here should be proud. DUO was closed for repairs which meant that the breakfast buffet had to be held upstairs at Spago which made for a less than an ideal set-up. Some of the buffet foods were cold and the space was often a little messy and crowded. Also, we weren't told of DUO being closed until check-in (don't think there is anything on the website alerting people? Or maybe I missed it.) However, since we booked through American Express we had breakfast credits, so we just went with the flow. The second issue was the beach staff. Every morning I came down in hopes to snorkel but was told that the conditions were too rough. I explained that I was an excellent swimmer and would be happy to rent the equipment and sign a waiver. With that said, the conditions often did get rough towards the evening. During the day, however, the conditions were quite calm and I saw everyone else at other resorts along the beach snorkeling. I'm not sure what the conditions needed to be to allow snorkeling? It's an ocean. Not a pool. Adding to the frustration might have been a bit of a gruff attitude of the employees. Contrasted against the perfect services elsewhere in the resort I noticed it here more. Also, the service down at beach wasn't the same as the rest of the resort. Here again, a bit of gruff service. I wanted to ask about the beach activities (boogie boards, kayaks, etc.) but didn't feel very welcome. The staff huddled around the umbrella stand at the back of the beach and seemed to reluctantly come out to help set up a chair. Specifically, I very politely asked one of the employees to please help me out and keep an eye on our bag (which was under our chair, it wasn't as if I was asking him to personally hold it for me) for 20-30 minutes while we took the outrigger canoe course. This is a public beach, and I don't think I was asking for anything that outrageous. It was early in the morning and not that many Four Season guests were on the beach yet. In hindsight, probably should have run the bag up to the room and avoided asking which resulted in a snippy response about how safe the beach was and how that wasn't his job. I explained that I wasn't going to hold him accountable, just needed a hand since we didn't plan well and left valuables in the bag at the chair. Finally, the water trampoline was not in the water. Perhaps a small thing, but together with the other issues at the beach, we felt a little let down with the beach services overall. I would suggest if you really want to take part in beach activities (besides sitting on a lounge chair) you should book specific activities through the concierge. Overall, an incredible experience and we are looking forward to returning and staying at other Four Season's resorts around the globe.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: Michelle T
Reviews.Content: Very kid friendly and pampering experience for the entire family.

Reviews.Title: “A slice of heaven here on earth....”
Reviews.Author: iluvsophia
Reviews.Content: I ended a two week stay on Maui with 3 nights at the Four Seasons to celebrate my fiance's 50th birthday. After spending the first week and a half in upcountry Maui and exploring every piece of the island that we could, the Four Seasons was a perfec way to end a perfect trip. It exceeded my expectations on so many levels....from the spa, to the service poolside, the beautiful location, yoga on the beach, the birthday suprises left for us, the upgraded room....everything about it made me forget about the pricetag and wish we had stayed longer! I booked through Whatahotel, and we recieved many perks that increased the value of our stay including complimentary breakfast each morning and the buffet was fresh and delicious. We indulged in a oceanside couples massage which was amazing and the spa was one of the most beautiful I had ever been to. We had a couple of very small issues that were handled by smiling faces within minutes and no need was left unfufilled. I would definitely recommend this resort for anyone that wants a top-notch experience in Maui...but Maui is way to beautiful to be left unexplored so be sure to force yourself to leave the resort and see as much as you can. Once you check into this resort you will have trouble wanting to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: cathyfromwi
Reviews.Content: We won a week's stay at this resort and it was awesome. If we would have had to pay for it though, I'm not sure it would have been that awesome. Don't get me wrong, there was not one thing I can think of to complain about. It's just that for the price you pay, I guess I would expect exceptional service, food, accomodations, etc. My husband and I both agreed that it was a vacation of a lifetime since we could never bring ourselves to spend that type of money and come back. Guess it's all relative to how much money you have and where your priorities lie. We were on the club floor and took use of the free food and beverages in the club lounge. Everyone there was so nice and helpful, always greeting us by our names. We couldn't figure out how they were so quick to appear when you entered the room until they showed us tthe hidden motion sensor. The breakfast food and snacks and desserts thru out the day were amazing and always very good. Some things were almost too pretty to eat. Service at the pool was also amazing. They were constantly filling up your water and asking if you needed anything from the bar. We enjoyed talking to the staff and hearing how they ended up in Maui. We took advantage of the free canoe trip they offer from the beach. Be sure to sign up for this right away since the timeslots fill up fast. It is only a half hour and you don't need to be in great shape to do it. There is a lot of rest stops where the tour guide stops to talk. We also took advantage of the free snorkel gear. Not much to look at compared to the catamaran snorkel tours we have done in the past. We regret not booking one this time. Hotel room was really nice. We were joking that there must be cameras in the room because it seems everytime you leave, your dirty towels get replaced with clean ones. The main area of the room was pretty basic but the bathroom was amazing. It was huge and fully stocked with lotions, soaps, shampoo, conditioner, etc. We ate at the 2 of the restautrants (Duos and Ferraros). Both were really good but then again, when you are paying $50 or more for an entree, would you expect less? Overall the property is well maintained and very pretty. Unlike other resorts, they are very detail oriented and try to make your stay as wonderful as possible. We were in the club lounger one night and young couple came in looking for chocolate chip cookies and they had none but the staff went out of their way to find them some with 15 minutes. If there was anything you needed, they will go out of their way to get it for you.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Great with Significant Qualifications”
Reviews.Author: Mac B
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property kept in good condition in spite of its age. Majority of staff are friendly, helpful, and very service oriented. Some are less so. It seems that traveling to this property during a slow period unfortunately results in slightly less attentive service, fewer staff stretched with more work, and an unn Four Seasons like lackadaisical attitude. Unfortunately that can be visible to guests. Housekeeping is late and slow. Servers in restaurant at breakfast are sparse and slow. Dirty dishes piled up on tables a couple says, etc. regardless of the seasons, the standards should be maintained. Wish restaurants had some healthier items on the menu.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but not "perfect"”
Reviews.Author: Doogie5511
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that every Four Seasons hotel I've stayed at has been a cut above anything around it and this one is no exception. The pools, rooms and restaurants are all first rate as one would expect from this chain. In addition, I went for a couple of scuba dives with the on-site dive shop and both were excellent. I received just the right amount of guidance after explaining it had been a few years since my last dive. Generally speaking my stay there was as great as I expected it to be. With that said, there were a few disappointments. If you have stayed in a smaller Four Seasons before, understand that this is a massive property and as such it seems impossible for them to be quite as attentive. Another casualty of the sheer size of the place is the serenity pool. This pool, similar to their other resorts, is wonderful and definite step up from the larger family pool if you don't have kids. Unfortunately it became a stress point for my girlfriend and I as everyday became a race to get down to the pool in the morning to reserve a chair before it filled up. If we were later than 10 - 11am, we were put on a waiting list and were forced to sit at the bar and watch the attendant expectantly for our turn in the que for a seat - a process that sometimes took hours. Even more frustrating, there was no process for advance reservations. My suggestion to them is to provide advance notice to guests of the popularity of the serenity pool at check-in and offer a reservation system of some sort so other plans can be made on days when the pool is exceptionally busy. A couple of other small issues: We had some tiny bugs crawling around our room. They weren't bed bugs and were harmless but nonetheless we noticed the hotel sent a memo around indicating to guests that some sort of insect spraying was under way. Also the beds are unusually soft - if you like a firm mattress you may not sleep as well - I didn't. Bottom line, this is a wonderful property in the tradition of Four Seasons but if you are used to the dignified, attentive service of some of their smaller hotels this one might not provide the same experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: prneidlein
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Four Seasons is perfect. A great balance of family, luxury, and casual fun. Location is great for excursions and the beach is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property”
Reviews.Author: wr943
Reviews.Content: Overall the Four Seasons Wailea is a great property that gets almost everything right and is by far the best resort on Maui. First a few negatives. Price - it is expensive and there is no way around that. Our expectations - the reviews on Trip Advisor are almost universal in that the resort caters to your every need, and for the most part that is create, however, there was some inconsistent service at the pool area. Again, for the most part the service at the pool was great but we had one bad experience in the middle of the trip in which the service fell below our expectations. We had a garden view suite and the view from lanai was as advertised but also included annoying noise from delivery trucks. Also, the house cleaning service on the whole was good, a couple of days it fell below expectations (however, I have chalked this up to us having an infant who was napping in the afternoons and we had to turn away the maids and also the resort did send someone by asking our thoughts and I said everything was great, as such I give the resort a pass on this). Now the great - location, we have always stayed at the Ritz in Kapalua, Wailea and the Four Seasons is a much better location. The beach and beach service is absolutely great. The overall staff is top notch and very friendly, again we had a infant who could be loud and the staff loved him. The grounds are perfect and spotless. The resort was busy but never had a real busy feel as there was always a beach chair or pool chair avaiable. Room service was the best I have ever had and on the whole the restaurants were top notch. In addition, the resort catered to our every need for our infant son who turned one while we were there. The resort provided toys and all kinds of extras for him. Overall the Four Seasons Wailea is the best property we have ever stayed at in Maui and plan on staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this resort. Highly recommend. Will definitely go back.”
Reviews.Author: John W
Reviews.Content: If you wanted to be treated like you are special and stay in a resort that will knock your socks off, this is the one. It is beautiful, clean and unlike any other place I have stayed in. From the moment I stepped onto their property I was wisked away into a tropical paradise. Everything you need is in one gorgeous place. I so look forward to going back. It's worth the splurge!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have ever stayed at in my life!”
Reviews.Author: JoeSimTravel
Reviews.Content: Best hotel I have ever stayed at in my life. I honestly wish I could afford to live there. Loved it! Expensive but totally worth it. If you're on a budget, stay somewhere on the island for the first part of your trip but stay at the Four Seasons for at least 2 nights at the end of your stay...you'll be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Complete Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: globalflyereal
Reviews.Content: Of all of the hotels around the world that I have visited (and that is ever continent), I think I have to rank this one as the BEST! The Four Seasons Resort Maui at Wailea is a "hidden" paradise. Tucked away from the main areas, it offers every bit of luxury. The food is excellent...every single meal! The service is laid back and very prompt. We had an ocean view room that was huge. At the time, the top floor where we were located was only half vacant due to renovations so it was extra quiet. The concierege assisted us in renting a car (car rental desk in lobby) for a trip to Laihaina for the luau (bonus we ever experienced a small earthquake)! There is a private "adults only" pool a top one of the roofs where it overlooks the ocean and we could see whales breaching in the distance. If you want true paradise, this is THE number one address!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the splurge”
Reviews.Author: Frankee11
Reviews.Content: We have never been so well cared for or stayed at such an impeccable property. The staff is genuinely warm and made sure our every want was fulfilled, and then some. You get what you pay for, and it was worth every penny. We've decided a few less vacations in order to stay in a place like this might be worth waiting for.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have ever stayed at !!!”
Reviews.Author: BforBoy
Reviews.Content: 1 sentence summarizes my stay "One of the best hotels I have ever stayed at". Wow!!! The rooms, spa/gym facilities, restaurant were outstanding. The staff on the most part were very polite and helpful. There were a few that gave a little bit of attitude, but I guess that's expected of hotels of this caliber! I will definitely go back again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: cmaz
Reviews.Content: I never really wanted to go to Hawaii, i thought i'd be bored - and now i can't wait to be bored again!! It was sheer heaven. We chose the Four Seasons after researching Trip Advisor and other sites. While it is expensive, it was worth every penny. The setting is so beautiful and the service so fabulous, you can't help but feel special and relaxed. We got a garden view room which was perfect for us. We spent most of our time on the beach and saw enough ocean and saved what we would have spent on an ocean view room for dinners and golf. Every time we would return to our room, "the angels" had been there to make sure it was always perfectly neat walking back in. The concierge team was terrific help to make sure we had the experience we wanted. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, and very pricey”
Reviews.Author: gte190f
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 nights in a garden view room in October 2011. The purpose of our trip was a baby moon, so we were not super active. We paid about $400 / night in the end for our trip, including the 5th night free discount. We signed up using Whatahotel, a Four Seasons partner, and as a result got a free breakfast every morning. We did not get a room upgrade due to lack of availability. Pros: 1.) Room service twice a day - very useful at the beach 2.) Fabulous free breakfast. We LOVED the breakfast and looked forward to it every morning 3.) Various free classes onsite. I took the water aerobics class at the beautiful outdoor pool several times during our trip. 4.) Large, spacious rooms. 5.) Free, covered cabanas at the main pool 6.) Uniformly friendly, helpful staff. We particularly loved the servers at breakfast. 7.) Beautiful, uncrowded beach with places to sit and umbrellas for Four Seasons guests Cons 1.) Cost, cost, cost. We could have had a wide open ocean view for the same amount of money elsewhere. Hard to say if it was worth it. 2.) Room service came rather late most days. 3.) Lunch options at the resort were all $20 or more - absolutely no options for less than $20 per person (including food only, not any kind of drink). Drinks were obviously very expensive , too. As a result, we ended up going to Safeway and making ourselves sandwiches. $60 or $70 / days for lunch was just more than we felt like spending (including drink, tip, etc.) 4.) Dinner options also overpriced, so if you don't have tons of money, you'll end up driving most nights for dinner. 5.) Rooms, while very nice, were a bit old - you can tell the place has not been renovated lately. 6.) The Serenity Pool is famous, but it's always packed. You have to get on a waiting list to use it, after which you may wait a couple hours or more (they'll call you) only to get a seat w/o an ocean view. Their main pool is very nice, but the Serenity Pool is overrated. Overall, we loved it. We are borderline on being able to afford it, and it definitely wouldn't be an annual trip for us. We did stop next door at the Grand Wailea, and it's clearly not nearly as nice as the Four Seasons. If you can afford it, Four Seasons is a wonderful spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but quiet ambience”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrotterMX_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at the beginning of November. While the hotel has been renovated and the rooms do not lack anything at all, the building is not a modern one. The service however is superb: the people at the Concierge desk are simply incredible and make everything easier for guests. The other staff is also incredible: Mr. Amante was just amazing while Brandon Clark was always courteous and helpful. One detail that was just beyond expectations is that there is a courtesy suite for people who have already checked out but whose plane will leave later on the day: you can take a shower and relax at the courtesy suite before your plane leaves. This is something unique and made us feel really pampered. The food at the hotel is just OK. The breakfast buffet is acceptable but nothing extraordinary while dinner at the other hotel restaurants (Spago, Duo) is above average but nothing out of the ordinary, especially if you consider the high prices you are paying. Probably the thing that we liked less about the Four Seasons Wailea is the ambience. This hotel is targeted to a mature and upscale clientele (50 years and older) and it shows. The ambience is very quiet: for instance, the last seating at the restaurants takes place at 9 30 pm so the hotel is practically dead after 11 pm (and you can say the same of all Wailea). Further, guests seem to be more comfortable at the pool than at the beach so the beach service is not as good as the one you get at the pool: no food or drinks and the beach chairs are not as comfortable as the pool chairs. The beach however is really nice. It is really sad that guests just donÂ´t appreciate the beach. If you want to lie around a pool you can do that in NY city! If you want a more active vacation you can rent a car and go outside of Wailea. Either you can drive to Hana or go to Makena beach which is just 10 minutes away and it is the closest thing to a Caribbean beach that you will find in Maui. Overall, the hotel is great but you should expect a very quiet ambience.

Reviews.Title: “luxurious and heaven at the ocean”
Reviews.Author: denise k
Reviews.Content: One of the most awesome luxurious hotels on Maui... The service is beyond compare with little needed to do. Staff is totally at your service with towels, snacks and even aloe lotion for your sun burn. The three restaurants on property are wonderful and I could dine daily at Spago. The food is outstanding, service super and views wonderful. Lunch at Ferraro sitting looking at the ocean is just amazing. The food is wonderful and they even have half potions if you want.....The spa is special and gives you the total hawaiian flavor........ Well worth the high price. In this case what you pay is what you get. AWESOME

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: Katie M
Reviews.Content: The hotel was so great we didn't want to leave to go anywhere else in Maui. Seriously we cancelled like 3 dinner reservations because it was so comfortable there. The serenity pool was amazing, great service, servers were there to fetch you whatever you needed at least once every 5 min. And they did a nice job of keeping it quiet and relaxing even when it got a little crowded at times. I liked all of the little amenities-l'occataine products, including after sun lotion, woolite to wash your bathing suits, sunscreen at the pool/beach, complimentary snorkel rental for an hour a day, beach bag to use for the day, ect. The only thing to look out for is that the internet and valet service isn't free-$10 for the internet and $20 a night for the valuet, which they don't tell you when you check in. And there really isn't a marked option to park on your own. But it is pretty nice to have them pull up, give you whatever you needed for the day (towels, water, ect). Pricy, yes. But worth it for a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, Beautiful and Luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: jmsgnewyork
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons is a beautiful hotel and very luxurious. The staff is extremely friendly and very accommodating. At the pool, they come around with cold, wet towels and they are constantly filling up your water glass and they come around with pineapple and otter pops. Your biggest complaint the entire time will be both the beach and the pool are amazing and it's so hard to make a decision of where to go!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: calebys
Reviews.Content: This is probably one of the best hotels that I have stayed at. Came here for our honeymoon in early November and the hotel grounds are magnificent. The staff was quite attentive and courteous. Received a free bottle of champagne due to our honeymoon. I booked through whatahotel.com and received free breakfast for two as part of the deal. Breakfast buffet is very good with good selection. The hotel is right next to the beach, which is nice. Used their scuba diving service here though the "shore dive" off the hotel to the nearby reef was quite disappointing (I'd recommend a boat dive from another operator if you are an avid diver). Food and beverage is not cheap but not out of the ordinary for a Four Seasons Hotel. Overall, an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Giving them a slight pass...”
Reviews.Author: JP3CHICAGO
Reviews.Content: Sometimes I am a tougher critic than others. This is the case today as I write my review on our recent stay at the FS Maul. Don't get me wrong. We think that the place is FANTASTIC and will be back again as soon as possible.
