The reason that I suggest that I am giving a them a slight pass with a five star excellent rating is that we stayed during slow season. I think that the few minor staff issues were a result of the hotels low occupancy numbers and the hotel stretching their employees a bit to save some money. Overall the property is in excellent condition. It is hard to believe that this property is 20+ years old as the design, finishes, and architectural style is still competitive or better than most hotels being put up today. It is well thought out and the rooms and bathrooms are done to perfection. We were upgraded to a very large one bedroom suite (#451) that faced the ocean and had a walkout terrace for our daughter to play. It was an excellent choice. The check in and front desk staff are excellent and made us feel so welcome. Chris at the lobby bar was also excellent at making guests feel welcome. Even when he was very busy he was able to meet each guests needs and make them feel special. The breakfast staff at the DUO buffet were at times slow and not up to the normal FS standard. On multiple days we had to track someone down to get drinks, clear plates, or ask for our bill. It was not their normal behavior. The housekeeping service was not timely. One of the housekeepers explained that during slow season they had "many more rooms" to attend to each day. It was apparent in timing but not in quality. They did an excellent job! During the day we were not getting service before 3 or 4pm. On two nights we were back from dinner before turndown service had been performed. This is not a huge issue but unfortunately our daughter woke up when they came to bring fresh towels one night. Anyone with kids will tell you that was a bit annoying. We realized that it was our fault for not putting out their special "hush" sign so that they would know to knock softly. That special baby sleeping sign is truly a FS touch! Finally the pool staff was also a bit stretched. Overall they were excellent however at times it was hard to get another drink. Many people had to flag them down to set up cabanas or get fresh towels. The best way I can describe it was that they were in a reactive mode instead of a proactive mode. Perhaps it was because we spent most of our time in the kiddie pool area. Since my last stay the addition of the adult only serenity pool was an awesome touch! Overall I highly recommend this hotel. It is perfection come to life. As I said in an earlier review "if you can not relax here, you can not relax anywhere!" Congrats to this excellent team for creating and delivering such an excellent experience to so many guests over the years!

Reviews.Title: “A real vacation”
Reviews.Author: whitleybh
Reviews.Content: This is my second time around at this property. What a place, they managed to exceed my expectations again even though this time I knew what to expect. I truely wept when I left, which is hard to admit as a man. The staff felt like friends by the end of our stay. I am amazed at how Four Seasons does it. They really must treat their employees so well becuase they were all genuinely happy to be of service. This is the finest property on Maui, we toured the others. Grand Waliea is a tried property, espcecially evident being next door to FSM. If you have the means, I highly recomend this property, without hesitation. Yes its expensive but you get your money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Jeanie1218
Reviews.Content: From the first day I was planning a return trip. The Four Seasons is absolutely AMAZING. This was a splurge vacation for us and it was money well spent. We were upgraded to a partial ocean view room. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and impeccably clean. The resort is beautiful both day and night. The staff are so warm and friendly, and they truly do anticipate your every need. When you go to the beach, they set up your lounge chairs complete with terry cloth covers and towels, they place an umbrella in just the right location to shade you if desired, they bring you cool cloths and ice water. The same treatment appears to happen at the pools, but we were too enamored with the beach to hang out at the pools. There is no alcohol allowed on the beach and no food service, so we did lunch by the pool. I highly recommend the fish and chips and the blueberry mojito! They have amazingly healthy food with plenty of fruits and vegetables. I had the best hash browns I've ever had at Duo. The outdoor dining at Ferraro's is so romantic. Dinner at sunset is spectacular and dining under the stars, well I wish I could do that every night! We also had a fun and delicious dinner at Spago on our last night. We weren't in a planning mood and didn't make reservations, so we ate at the bar. The bartenders were fun and the food was delicious. The tomato and goat cheese salad was fabulous! Just remember to stuff you wallet with tipping money for the valet parking attendants and the beach and pool staff.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service that is second to none!”
Reviews.Author: Bunkses
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the first 5 days of our honeymoon here in the beginning of October. Everything about this hotel was amazing. At check in, we asked if any complimentary honeymoon upgrades were available, and not only were we offered a partial ocean view room, but the front desk representative showed us the room we were initially scheduled to be in as well as the proposed new one to allow us to select the room we preferred. At that moment I knew that the Four Seasons in Maui would live up to all the other fabulous reviews here. The room was breathtaking - very spacious, and the bathroom - WOW! The pictures are online, but it had every amenity imaginable, including L'occitaine "after sun" lotion, which helped my skin stay moisturized after long days in the sun. The hotel also leaves a great beach bag in your room for you to use during your stay for no cost. Like many other reviewers, we loved the serenity pool. You should plan to get there early to get a good seat (7 a.m. when it opens). You can leave your stuff there for an hour to grab breakfast at Duo, which is amazing. I loved the full buffet, and the service was (once again) amazing. At the serenity pool, the great service continues. I don't think I ran out of ice water once, and any time I wanted food, the pool assistants were there with a menu. One day I said we did not want to eat at the pool because I wanted something from Ferraro's (a restaurant at the resort), and I was immediately told they could order it for me and have it delivered to the serenity pool!!?!? Yes, they are that amazing. Then, around 9 a.m. they come around with these pastry bites for a snack (complimentary), around 11 a.m. they come around with fresh pineapple (complimentary), in the early afternoon they come arond with cucumbers, cold towels, and evian sprtiz (complimentary), then around 3 p.m. they bring around Flavor-ice pops!!! (complimentary), then around 5 p.m. they bring around rice krispie treats drizzled with chocolated (complimentary), and finally, before the serenity pool closes at 7, they come around with little cups of aloe vera (you guessed it, complimentary). It was amazing. Also, no need to pack sunscreen because there is plenty of it in all SPFs near both pools. In the pool, the underwater music is so soothing as you float on your back, and my favorite was the "french bubbler" sections - about 6 inches of water that you could sit in while you read (well, that's what we did). The main pool was also great, and the complimentary amenities were offered there as well. Although, I would say the servers at the serenity pool were more attentive...perhaps because they had less guests to tend to. Every restaurant at the resort was amazing. The food, the service, and the ambiance. Ferraro's on the ocean is beautiful, and the food was great. Duo has a fresh seafood bar one or two nights during the week with king crab legs, lobster tail, oysters, etc. It was awesome. Spago was also superb, and if you're looking to save money at Wolfgang Puck's restaurant, opt for the pre fixe 3-course menu (with or without wine pairings). It was excellent! The one feature that was the most impressive was the quality of service - never have we ever been treated so spectacularly on vacation. The way the hotel employees always said "Aloha" and the waiters at dinner knew what we did during the day was amazing. It was like they really cared that we were enjoying our honeymoon. Finally, one thing I did not see anyone else write about, which we thought was so great, were the backpack picnic lunches the Four Seasons prepared for us for the day we drove the Road to Hana. We opted for the "Road to Hana" picnic, and we had a salumi platter, roasted veggies, hummus, pita, cold fried chicken, maui chips, sparkling water, french bread, and cookies. All this was packed in these amazing cooler backpacks (no need to bring any other bag with you on the Road to Hana), with real silverware, cloth napkins, and...wait for it, a real tablecloth!! They are sold per person, I believe $35/person plus tax and service charge, and we got two. We both eat quite a bit, and we had many leftovers for the next day's lunch. You could definitely get one picnic backpack lunch and have enough for two. The Four Seasons exceeded our expectations (and we are very particular). While Hawaii is too far from our home on the east coast to return every year for our anniversary, we intend to stay at a Four Seasons resort (somewhere in the world) every anniversary just to enjoy that same level of service.

Reviews.Title: “WOW. Service can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: davis121
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th stay at a Four Seasons Hotel but this one beats them all. The price is higher than the average but it is worth it. We checked in around 1PM and greeted with lei's for my wife, daughter (age 4), and me. Our daughter also got a toy and we all were offered a small piece of pineapple and juice. Check in was quick and accurate and they took us to our room. Waiting for us was a nene goose and treats for our daughter. Our view(room 490) was towards Grand Wailea but we didnt mind since we usually spend very little time in the room. The decor wasnt modern hawaiian but the more traditional clean hawaiian style. Not over done, and less is more in this case. Room: Plenty of drawer space, huge bathroom, and large sized room to walk around. Bed was king size and moderately firm. Couch was also firm and comfortable. Plenty of water pressure and hot water came out quickly. Pool: Our trip began October 30th for 5 days and it was low season. There was plenty of cabanas and plenty of chairs available on the beach. Again this was low season but more importantly there was no indication of less staffing. We were quickly offered towel service for anywhere we wanted to sit and always ice water next to our chairs. They have complimentary sun block spf 8,15,30 and they smell very good. Maybe every few hours or so someone came around with treats (cherry jello, pineapple on bamboo sticks, etc.). There are 2 jazuzzi's both the same size holding about 8 people comfortably but more can fit. One is adults only since it was closer to the bar at Ferraro's. The water temperature I thought was very hot. My wife and daughter liked it but I coudnt stay in there when it was already 84F outside. Kids pool: Kids can swim anywhere but they have their own upper pool with a small slide, waterfalls, and a toddler area with water about 1 feet deep. Water was warm but not uncomfortable. Toys were already in the pool for kids. We brought our own floatation vest so cant comment on the ones hotel provides. Beach was nice with minimal waves, not enough to boogie board. Fairly calm but still need to keep an eye on kids. Once on the beach someone also got our chairs, umbrella, and table ready with towels and cant forget the ice water. Water is typical Hawaiian temperature, which is not cold and can just jump right in. Snorkeling is 1 hour complimentary and there was plenty to see about 50 yards off the beach in front of the hotel and the deth is about 20 feet. We noticed a lot of people from other hotels were using the Four Seasons area to go snorkeling. Ferraro's: We had dinner there once with no complaints. I had the braised beef gnoochi and our daughter had grilled cheese sandwhich. We had lunch there many times and its also the only place open for lunch. We tried many different item menu and were pleasantly surprised everytime. I actualy wish we stayed 5 more days just to try every lunch item. Duo: Breakfast: I had crab egg benedict and it was the best i had. I also enjoyed the granola parfait very much. Our daughter had the buffet and it was also very good. Dinner: We ate here everynight but one and it was also very good. We had the prix fix menu item twice and wish also had more time to try other items on the menu. I recommend everything. Thursday thru Sat. they have fresh seafood( i saw raw oysters, lobster, shrimp and others I cant remember), i think its all you can eat. Serenity pool: Didnt go but took a look and it seemed nice. Service: With out a doubt Four Seasons Wailea does a great job trying to anticipate your next move and needs. They seem to make it an art trying to be one step ahead of your thoughts to make your stay as comfortable as possible. Im not sure how they filter out staff with all the same qualities but that must be a trade secret. I left some stuff out so you will be pleasantly surprised when you stay there. We are talking about returning again around the same time during low season. November in Maui is nice and sunblock is necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Nina B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were at the Four Seasons in September 2011 for our honeymoon. From the time we arrived to the time we left one week later, we were treated like royalty. The staff are so professional and courteous--our every whim was catered to. Every little detail has been thought of from staff knowing your name to the planning of our sunset dinner. If you have any doubts of staying here ---DON'T. I would stay at this resort over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every cent!”
Reviews.Author: rubynyla
Reviews.Content: All the reviews are spot on. This hotel was so beautiful with no detail skipped. The grounds are beautiful, rooms are modern and the staff are just so attentive. The gym is very nice and current with water, fruit and cold towels available. The food is delicious- worth eating at the restaurants. Overall, the four seasons reputation was upheld and we can't wait to return. Such an amazing stay! Wish we were there longer than five nights!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular resort in a perfect setting”
Reviews.Author: benless
Reviews.Content: Staff and service could not have been any better from the moment we arrived with our traditional lei welcome till the moment we left, with bottled water and bagged jelly beans in our vehicle. The room was oversized, clean and beautifully appointed as was the oversized bathroom. The public areas were spotless and full of interesting art pieces and the grounds were meticulously manicured. The pool attendants were continually going around to see if there was anything you needed and were always friendly and polite. This was our first stay here; have only been home two days and already referred some visitors to Maui to this resort and will continue to do so without any hesitation. An amazing resort in every imagainable way!

Reviews.Title: “This place is pure nirvana!”
Reviews.Author: KandAJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 10 days on our honeymoon and could not have been happier. There is not a single negative thing to say about the place. Complimentary services abound, and we really appreciated not being nickel and dimed with various resort fees that most other places in Hawaii seem to have. The food is great no matter where you decide to eat, or even if you decide to order room service. The rooms are clean; the beds very comfortable. The pools are all very nice, but the serenity pool is by far the nicest place to be. And the cabanas are well worth the extra money if you choose to splurge. The service is truly exceptional, from the front desk to the sundry shops in the resort. We ran out of some toiletries at one point, and the shop downstairs didn't carry the brand we use, so the saleswoman offered to stop by walmart on her way home that evening to pickup what we wanted, and then bring it for us the next day. She wouldn't even take a tip for doing it, until I really insisted. That experience was typical of the amazing service.

Reviews.Title: “Tops the charts!”
Reviews.Author: maryellen k
Reviews.Content: Aloha! The Four Seasons in Wailea was the ultimate in top shelf vacation. I am 51 and waited all my life for that Lei to be wrapped around my neck. From the fabulous decor, including fresh Hawaiin floral arrangement arrays to the dinners at Spago were over the top! The beachside views were just amazing, the walk along the beach every morning was just breathtaking, they have a path that wraps around the ocean and each time you turn it is as if you are in a new paradise, yet no too strenuous that you must be in tip top shape. My favorite time was the rooftop couples only pool in which you have music underwater in the famous infinity pool seeming like you are about to immerse right into the magnificent ocean. This is a fabulous honeymoon spot as well as couple or family vacation. The children are entertained and they are not overwhelming to those that dont have children with them. The golf course, although i am not very good was perfect for my husband to play and me to join him for the day! I took magnificent photos of the course! The spa was lovely and the staff over the charts, especially at the times when they delivered to your chair fresh pineapple or other mouth watering treats. i loved pool/beach side dining for lunch with so many delicious options accented with a glass of wine! Mahalo and hope we meet again fabulous 4 Seasons!

Reviews.Title: “no aspect of the experience can be overstated.”
Reviews.Author: davidenyc
Reviews.Content: your stay will be completely amazing. the quality of the service & housekeeping staffs, the concierge on both the main floor & the club floor, the impeccable grounds, the pool side service, the beautiful beach, the views of west maui, the quality of the food at all three restaurants. you never have to leave the grounds, but do, you're in maui! i've stayed here seven times over the last twenty years and the quality of the experience has never slip one bit. the club floor is well worth the premium.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect, relaxing vacation even with our 4-year old son in tow. the kids' amenities were spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: case29
Reviews.Content: Prior to the arrival of our son, we had been to this Four Seasons 3 times as a carefree couple. I have to say this was one of our most relaxing trips as a family to date. The weather in Maui was absolutely perfect (end of October timeframe) and the kids' amenities and activites offered by the Four Season Wailea were the best we've seen at a resort. The Four Seasons is well on its way to cultivating a loyal customer for life in him! It started with check in - lei welcome with a refreshing juice and pineapple slices for the three of us, plus a cool color-change nerf football for our son. Then as we got settled into our room, a knock on the door revealed a tray of treats, rubber ducky family and a stuffed Nene bird. The bathroom was kitted out with a kid-size robe and slippers, kids' toiletries and letter sponges that spelled out our son's name. It didn't end there for him with the gifts - the day before check out, he received a Maui hardcover kid's book, juice and cookies! The kid's swimming pool and rec room were amazing. Pool/beach toys were provided. My husband and I were still able to partake in our usual vacation activities of golf, tennis and spa treatments. We are already planning a trip back next year - when our soon-to-be born daughter will be around 6 months! P.S. Kids 5 and under eat free at the on-site restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “The complimentary services are outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: lcbean
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 nights Oct 15-Oct 25, 2011 for a convention. The furniture in the guest room is a bit outdated. Perhaps some colorful artwork would help spice it up. The mattress, OMG -- phenomenal! The furniture needs to be a bit more contemporary for sure. The complimentary services are out of this world! Ask for a sleep aid when you are there. Great lavendar masks; foot salts with a soaker. Very pleased with the friendliness and staff's suggestions for dinner. Four years ago, we stayed at the Marriott. Very nice. But this totally blew me away. We went next door to the Grand Wailea - thinking that we would stay there next. It seemed too busy for me. I am a Four Seasons person from now on -- including leisure. Simply amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2skibum2
Reviews.Content: Services and staff were great. very clean. views were spectacular. Very good for business conference. Golf nearby is plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing resort that you can spend your honeymoon at in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: Jenna S
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Maui was everything we expected it to be and more. The service and facility is perfect for a honeymoon, or relaxing Hawaiian getaway. The pictures and website are true to tell. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “It was our 25th wedding anniversary and the hotel made it a most memorable time. Thanks Four Seasons!”
Reviews.Author: Del M
Reviews.Content: One of the best properties and staff in the Four Seasons chain.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME VACATION”
Reviews.Author: Lisa P
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful - a little tricky getting around the hotel - we always had a hard time finding our room again but the hotel was beautiful. The service was EXCELLENT. I would not recommend the spa - it was just okay. I have been to better spas. The spa treatment was good but the spa itself is just okay. I did not like that once you get into your robe you have to walk past the checkin desk. On a positive note, the beach was beautiful and the staff was so attentive. I would like to mention that the game room was AWESOME! Great ping pong tables and pool tables, etc......I would highly recommend the Four Seasons Resort Maui at Wailea

Reviews.Title: “Paradise.”
Reviews.Author: ShShCdn
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed here for 10 days for our honeymoon last year. We had read/heard so many positive reviews that we felt we had no choice but to splurge! We ended up getting our breakfasts included and one night free through our travel agent, which was an added bonus. There are really not enough words to describe how magical this resort is. From the views, to the staff, to the food...you are truly treated like royalty and if you can afford it,it is worth every penny!!! We still talk about it all of the time and hope to return for our anniversary one day!

Reviews.Title: “Both nice and disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: beatrice35
Reviews.Content: Our stay in October @ the 4 seasons Maui was both nice and disappointing. Our positive thoughts and experiences are: - nice, clean, airy feeling, amazing first impression from lobby of the ocean and resort -everybody at the reception really polite -hotel was quiet, in spite of the size and the non stop almost weddings taking place -Spago Restaurant was really accommodating of our child's food intolerances and well as taste buds. -beach very nice and nice snorkelling by the rocks -nice pool for adults and kids Negatives: -we asked for a room with no mold, we suffer from mold allergies as a family, and they gave us a beautiful, big, quiet room, with MOLD! An air purifier was stationed in the room, only in our room, as we learned later, for the precise purpose of cleaning the mold from the air. After 2 nights of mold, we had sores in our noses and my toddler son's eyes and nose were achy,my husband refused to sleep in the room and camped in the hallway on a chair until 3 am. The 3rd day we asked to be moved in another room, only by late afternoon did they find another room. They said the room did not have mold but was mildew that we sensed, not true, the sores in my nose were certain of what grew in the carpets of that room. At the reception they said that they cannot say the room has mold, because they would have to decommission the room and the hotel is full, cannot afford to do that! The manager, a young lady who dealt with our issue, gave is a much smaller room (albeit, she argued its the same size only different compartmenting, but its not true. It was missing a whole sitting area the other room had, and our toddler help getting bumps from the crib, and the 2 queen beds (we asked for 1 king!) in the small room.). The manager offered to pay for dinner one night for us for basically wasting our entire 3rd day moving, packing and unpacking, loosing my hair brush in the move and having to heal from the sores in our noses and respiratory systems! The matter closed. Our second bone of discontent was the fact that in spite of the fact that the hotel/ restaurants have a seemingly sympathetic take on food intolerance/ allergies, they are very inflexible. We asked for warm goats' milk for our son, they wasted 2 days and kept blaming each other for why they could not come up with it.Then they basically put it in the fridge of the room, and when we asked them how to warm it up, they provided a broken bottle warmer and 2 plastic bottles. We ended up warming it up in the sink, in a glass. At the restaurants, hit and miss again. We asked to sit down with the chef to come up with a meal plan for our 2.5 son, the chef finally did only to tell us to talk to the waiters each time. We did that, only to have a guy at one of the restaurants yell at me: "what do you want ma'm?!" when I asked for some lemon and another piece of fish! We asked to have food that was tasty for the toddler, only not to contain egg, wheat, cow's milk, coconut or orange. All other condiments and spices in the world were fine! They brought us the same thing over and over: steamed broccoli and carrots and when I asked for something like asparagus, the waiter yelled at us, then did a loud "Grrrrr" behind my back that embarrassed and startled me and went shouting and gesturing at the manager! The manager was nice and brought us the asparagus and lemon. At Duo, their other restaurant, we had to argue with the waiter for mashed potatoes that had no cream for the child. We said: can you just take a backed potato from the main manu (they have a children's menu) and put a little olive oil and salt and bring it along with meat? No, of course not, for that we have to call in the morning and ask for the chef to find a small potato, etc. In the end, if we pay $5 for it, of course they could find it! In the end, going to any of their restaurants was stressful and we tried to avoid them. We started to order room service, and upon talking to the rooms assistant manager, Chris I think was his name, he took it upon himself to help us and talked to Spago, the 3rd restaurant, made reservations for us and then and at Spago only, things were good. We got there and food was tasty, looked good, waiters were respectful and a little stressed by the thought that we may complain I think. We are not people who complain, we try to take as much as we can, that's why we put up with the moldy room for 2 nights, started to buy food outside resort, etc... Anyway, thanks Chris, for all the help. When it comes to ensuring our child is OK, it made a big difference to know he will finally eat... My last complaint is about the cleaning staff, hit and miss again in the second room we were given. They completely forgot to clean one day, they did not replenish anything until the last night, left garbage in the room at times, not very careful. thorough. My general impression of the hotel is that its a big institution rather than a romantic hotel. The many workers are well trained to be nice, they occasionally drop the ball and the managers are busy to fix the errors. It sa somewhat fake culture and I did not buy into it. The lack of flexibility and errors in EVERY department we encountered made us feel alienated and not very happy most of the time. I will not go back to Four Seasons Maui, in spite of the positives.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: MValSmth
Reviews.Content: From the moment of our arrival to our last "Aloha", the staff at this hotel was friendly and worked very hard to impress. It worked. It seemed that all of our needs were anticipated and the staff was at the ready to surprise us with pampering, to include fixing my wife's broken reading glasses by providing a new screw. Good: The serenity pool. The service there was top notch as well. Of the 5 days we were there, we only had to wait for a chair on day. I am not sure what other are talking about in having to fight to get them. Try the blueberry mojitos - the best! The buffet was amazing in the AM, Spago..... Some very unique flavors and combinations, and killer service of course. Less good. Prices. Vary from Steep to Crazy Steep. Bring your money and have a great time. Note: This is a good fit for folks looking for quiet and relaxation. Kids? Partying? not so much.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the whole family.”
Reviews.Author: my3barones
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons surprises you expect.... Goodies and luxuries continuously offered throughout the day by the pool. The chair policy about not reserving is off for such a high end hotel. Comical that we found ourselves meeting up with several other pool fanatics at 6 am to reserve our favorite spot. Having said that, our persistence was noticed and after the 3rd day we found our preferred chairs miraculously saved for us. Can't say enough about the pool staff, so friendly and attentive! Lots of kids making friends and alternating between playing in the pool and going down the steps to the beach. In the end we were shocked to see our pool tab for food and drinks. A testament to the fact that we were so relaxed and attended to that once laid out we didn't move.

Reviews.Title: “20th Anniversary vacation stay at the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Brian D
Reviews.Content: It was truly the best vacation and hotel my wife and I have ever stayed at. The service, staff, location, facilities, shops, restaurants were outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable stay I've ever experienced.”
Reviews.Author: Jeff T
Reviews.Content: My (now) wife and I spent our honeymoon at the Four Seasons, spending six nights in early October, and I can say without equivocation, I have no regrets about spending the extra money. The property itself is perfectly maintained and manicured. The pool is great. Breakfast is top notch. It wasn't over crowded (that time of year). But the REAL value is in the service. Everyone has a smile on their face, asks if you need help, and generally goes the extra mile. We spent the majority of our days traveling the island, which says a lot because the courtesy we received while we were on the property made it worth the while. It puts you in a good mood.

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favour and stay at this property!”
Reviews.Author: Donna K
Reviews.Content: We arrived to an overwhelming welcome and it contiuned the entire time we were there. The restauartns are superb and you really do not need to leave the hotel. We did the beach walks and this property was by far the best one. I am in the tourism business as is my husband and we have stayed at some amazing places around the world.. this one is right up there with ther best. The ambience and overall feel of the hotel immediately puts you in the right aloha mood. The ONLY negative would be the food and beverage prices are a little on the excpensive side. I think you need a 'cheaper option' Keep up the great work.. we will be back! Mahalo....

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: JEBinMD
Reviews.Content: Everyone here - the valets, bellmen, housekeeping, concierges, etc - is awesome! They really know how to treat a guest and made our trip totally memorable. Even the slightest of problems was dealt with without delay and we really felt like we were the most important people at the resort. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Incredible sevice, incredible restaurants, beautiful property.”
Reviews.Author: Vivian F
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful! Just the right size property. Staff was very helpful, and always with a smile on their faces. All of the restaurants are great. Lot's to do! They do try to accomodate kids, but there were not many around (but I went in October - most kids are back in school). Room service was very good. The only thing I felt that could be improved upon is the Spa. It was very nice, but other then the massages, the only other amenity was a small sauna room (Euctalpytus - and at it was great!). I would highly recommend this Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful holiday”
Reviews.Author: Jane M
Reviews.Content: Our stay at your hotel was perfect...starting with the valet service at the door, front desk, concierge, our wonderful room on the 6th floor with a partial ocean view, room service on the verandah, sitting by the pool during the day, twice daily maid service, etc. Practically everyone called us by name. We even joined the Four Seasons Club. Thanks again for making our trip so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “trip of a life time”
Reviews.Author: Sabrina L
Reviews.Content: everything was over the top great, the staff at the pools to the people at the desk . Room staff did a great job visted twice a day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, but you can hear voices from next room”
Reviews.Author: VSS13
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 days in the garden room in this resort on the first floor.The location itself is beautiful., but the location is far away from all the activities. Will have to pay for self parking and you will need a car if you stay at this location. You can hear voices from the other room and outside . So it is really irritating if you are not a sound sleeper. You will need to pay extra for Internet service. The free hula dance is ok. Complimentary coffee is offered in the morning. No chocolates at turn down service. On the whole stay was great. But very expensive

Reviews.Title: “Great property if you like the ultimate pampering experience”
Reviews.Author: charlotteorchid
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted the ultimate experience for our anniversary. We had been to Kauai for our honeymoon and had always wanted to try Maui. If you want to be 'seen' and have everything already thought of for you then the Four Seasons is for you. If you want to 'get away' and be the only one on the beach go to Kauai. There was nothing wrong with our stay, but we realized afterward that their service felt a bit intrusive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: JG535
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons in mid-October. We wanted to splurge and stay here, and it was truly worth every penny. They make you feel welcome, and everyone remembers your name. I had a conversation with one employee, Clive, and I mentioned to him that we were celebrating my birthday. The next day, I found a box of chocolates delivered to my room, courtesy of Clive and the staff at the Four Seasons! This attention to detail is what separates the Four Seasons from the rest. We had a partial ocean view room, which was very spacious. The complimentary outrigger canoe ride was one of the highlights of our trip, and our daughter took advantage of the complimentary snorkle equipment every day. I can't say enough about this great place!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations. Wonderful honeymoon resort!”
Reviews.Author: KAHPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: We were in Hawaii for 12 days on our honeymoon, first half here, second half in Kauai. Wish we had stayed here the entire time!! From the moment you arrive you are treated like royalty!!! We booked our room on the club level and it was well worth it! Every morning I walked down and got my Kona coffee and a few steps later I was back in the room relaxing on my deck. All day long the club had wonderful breakfast items, snacks, hors d'oeuvres, drinks, and from 5-7 they had alcoholic beverages. They also had a personal concierge there just for club floor guests. Highly recommend booking on that floor! Overall the service at this hotel can't be beat. The valets are wonderful. Pool staff works their tails off! The second you arrive at the pool you are greeted by someone who will put towels on your chair (including a nice fitted chair cover). Moments later someone else will pour you cold ice water and that water will be refilled all day without you ever even having to think that you wish you had more water. You will receive fruit, popsicles, cold washcloths all while just relaxing in your chair. Going in Oct was perfect because we could arrive at the pool anytime of day and have our choice of seats. I hear in the summer it's crowded with lots of kids. You can also choose to use the adult infinity pool but I found that more crowded and louder. The food in the hotel is wonderful. Ate at Spago and Duo and loved both. Lunch we always had poolside and it was great as well. If you go to Duo for breakfast it will be very expensive, but if you have to worry about price for things don't stay at the Four Seasons. One day instead of eating the continental breakfast in the club we had the buffet at Duo and yes it's about $35 per person but it's wonderful!!! Don't look at prices, just enjoy your experience here!! Another thing we loved was you are able to have spa services poolside. We had foot massages in a cabana after our Haleakala bike tour and it was the best massage I've ever had!! My husband used the gym and said it was small but very nice and clean. They have open-air equipment as well. Really nice running/walking path oceanfront that is a few miles long in front of the Four Seasons and other hotels. This path, including many areas of the hotel/island smells wonderful. Plumeria and other flowers add to the heavenly experience here. I was also impressed by how new everyone seems in the hotel. It's fairly old so I was expecting it to look old but it doesn't. Our room was very nice, bathroom was huge, hotel was spotless. Exactly what you expect from a Four Seasons. I highly recommend this hotel if you want to relax and be pampered!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort, wonderful service and truly made our holiday !”
Reviews.Author: JoeCool_KL
Reviews.Content: I can only say that we were glad that we decided to stay at Four Seasons Resort Maui. It is pure luxury from the moment of arrival with the leia they put over your shoulders to the check in and the wonderful rooms and service, pool and beach, etc etc. The food at the resort is good and upon arrival, we had the lobster sandwich and one of the best Mai Tai cocktail served up in a pineapple. Breakfast spread is good and so many varieties of eggs and sausages - one guest was raving about the portugese sausages and insisted that I had to try them. The people working at this resort are so genuinely friendly and courteous and ever ready to assist. The beach has sand that looks and feels like brown sugar and sea water nice to swim in. They provide sunblock and bring water to you periodically while you are sunning yourself. Some people were even snorkelling and we could see small fishes near our feet while swimming very close to the shore ! The resort has a nice pool with 2 heated jacuzzis within. The bed is one of the most comfortable we have ever slept in and most days, we just slept in and woke up later than normal as the bed was so very comfortable. It is truly a very nice resort to splurge on and make your trip to Maui special.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat this resort...”
Reviews.Author: tjoneser
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this resort several times with my husband and have always really loved it. This last time was the first time we took the kids with us. We stayed the last 3 nights of our 10 day Maui excursion (having just stayed for a week at Honua Kai for the first part of the trip). I hadn't been to the resort in a while & wanted to end our trip with a bit of luxury. It didn't disappoint! While the rooms of course are dramatically smaller and more expensive than the Honua Kai, it's that service & attention to detail that make this place so special. Despite our smaller dwellings, the kids really loved it, we really weren't in the room all that much. From the moment we arrived, the kids had special things waiting for them in our room (stuffed animal, mini-robes to use, treats, their names spelled out in sponge cutouts, special bath products). We had some little treats too for us. While the pool wasn't really anything special for the kids (a very baby slide, kind of boring pool stuff for my 9 & 7-year olds), they had the kids club, which they absolutely loved and were always begging us to take them to, as well as a game room with pool tables, ping pong, table shuffle board and several video game consoles. There is also a really nice beach in front of the resort (although it got VERY windy in the afternoon), as well as locals who for a fee will let your kids go on an on-ocean trampoline. I also really love their massages there. I always get the massages in the Hale/oceanside, they are really amazing, so relaxing to be right next to the ocean, and I've never had a bad therapist. Every time we left the valets gave us cold bottled water, and when we checked out, they gave us water and little treats for the kids. Be prepared to spend a lot poolside if you eat there, but as always, really great service. I went to check out the "Serenity Pool", which is their newer adults only pool. I'd say calling it the Serenity Pool is a bit of a mis-direct. It was very rowdy and loud, it was like a Vegas pool-scene for middle-aged folks. The big pool down below was WAY more tranquil and relaxing. There aren't many chairs available either at the Serenity Pool, although they have cabanas available to rent for almost the price of their cheapest rooms. Only 4 bad things the entire stay: 1) our friends in another room found a roach in their room. Yes, they have big roaches in Hawaii, and I guess sometimes they end up in the room somehow. Still, eww. 2) the first night, we had to call to have turndown service. For some reason they'd forgotten and we had a pullout bed for the kids, for which we needed linens, kind of unusual for their service (you get to expect a lot from them!) 3) when we checked out, we had a ton of luggage with the other family and it all got scattered between the 2 cars. However, when we got to the airport, I realized we were missing a small carryon bag. After realizing that it was unlikely it got taken at the airport, I called the Four Seasons. They said they'd check & call back. About 10 minutes later, they called to say they'd found it thankfully, and that they'd be driving it to the airport. I am very thankful that that happened not only at a resort closer to the airport (than Lahaina) but also that it was the Four Seasons because they did the right thing taking it out to us. 4) No free wi-fi??? Really??? I would think this would be standard now at almost all hotels, especially high-end hotels. (I mean, Honua Kai had it!) I think this is a really lame thing for them to charge for, especially when they are otherwise really good at not nickeling & dime-ing people there (no charge for game room or kids club, for example). But wifi? They include wifi at the Serenity Pool cabanas. I just think that is very odd on their part. But despite the negatives, I do love this resort, the whole place smells amazing like a spa, it's relaxing from the moment you arrive, and you just cannot beat the service (3 o'clock otter pops!) We'll definitely be back someday!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Sharon B
Reviews.Content: Open air lobby, excellent service, breathtaking views, outstanding restaurants....what more do you need?

Reviews.Title: “Pure Bliss”
Reviews.Author: ALJeff
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our second half of our Maui trip at the Four Seasons Wailea. We just arrived back home yesterday, and "cried" as we drove away from the Four Seasons. We ddin't want to go home. All I can say is, why didn't we spend the entire trip at the Four Seasons? As soon as you pull into the circle drive, you are greeted by a number of friendly faces. I originally booked a Garden View room, but we were upgraded to a Partial Ocean View room. What a wonderful surprise!! Our room was not ready but we were already dressed for the beach. The front desk told us to not worry about anything but to enjoy their facilities. As soon as we walked onto the beach, Sam set up 2 beach chairs, a table and an umbrella. He set it up in less than 5 minutes and said if we needed anything, to ask them for help. After all, we were on vacation. Everywhere we went, all the employees were smiling and greeted us with an "Aloha." After spending most of the day on the beach, we checked-in and our bags beat us to the room. O.M.G. Amazing. The entire hotel room and bathroom is 100 times more massive than our master bedroom and bathroom at home. And you could smell how clean the suite really was compared to an ordinary hotel. Just like everybody said, it was home. The truly amazing thing was that the housekeeping did an amazing job cleaning up our room. We had wedding cake and rose petals everywhere, and you couldn't tell if there was a mess earlier. She even cleaned my husband's jeans that had sand all over legs, after our 1st anniversary photo shoot. The L'Occitane products were a pleasant bonus for us. When we went out to Mama's Fish House for our anniversary dinner, the valet called the restaurant to inform them of our upcoming arrival. We didn't have to inform them that we were running late, but the valet took it upon themselves to inform the restaurant. Again, something you would not expect. The canoe program was a pure blast. Not only did we get a fantastic workout, but we saw tons of green sea turtles. One actually swam under me and came out. No way you could see these gracious creatures unless you snorkel out there. My husband did snorkel out in the cove and saw a lot of sea turtles and eel. This is the cove next to the Grand Wailea. We ate at Duo and Ferraro's which were both great. We had the Wailea Buffet at Duo since we weren't craving a heavy breakfast. Quite pricey for pastries and fruit ($30). We ate at Ferraro's for lunch. We decided take out since eating lunch on the beach was a nice way to depart our stay. The serenity pool was awesome. The water in the pool and spa were at the perfect temperature. But the best part of the pool? The amazing view. We didn't have any issues with getting 2 lounge chairs since this is their low-season. However, there was still a crowd at the pool. Although our 3 nights went by so quickly, we will be returning in the near future. Hopefully for every anniversary and any other holiday. Book The Four Seasons Wailea because it will be the best decision you'll ever make.

Reviews.Title: “LUXURY HOTEL, 5 STAR SERVICE!”
Reviews.Author: chrizNYC
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week long trip to Maui and the best part of the trip: Four Seasons! I was so glad to pick this hotel out of hundreds of others. From the moment we pulled into the hotel lobby, there was warm welcome, fresh leis, fruits and juice, dessert, milk and cookie, and toys...all complimentary of the hotel. My 3 year old son was excited to get so much toy delivered to our room. We spent the days lounging by the pool and the beach. The free sunscreen by the pool area was so thoughtful. Salt water pool was very clean with beautiful view. There was never too many people in the pool and tons of empty cabanas and lounge chairs around. Pool side serivice was excellent. The servers constantly filled our cups with ice water and passing around bite size dessert and fruits. There were so much toys in the kiddie pool area, that my son never played our own toy. The small waterslide kept him busy all day. Food at the hotel was delicious. We tried all three restaurants in the hotel, our favorite was Spago. We usually make same day reservation and there was always table available for us. We had the buffet breakfast everyday and loved it! Our room was spacious with garden view. I had the option to upgrade for free but then got lazy to do so. We didn't spend that much time in the room anyway. I loved the toiletries made by L'Occitane, made my hair so soft and shining. Even though the hotel was more expensive than most of the others on the island, but we felt that we were getting so much more in return. On our last day, I left cell phone and passport in the room. Four seasons sent someone driving to the airport and delivered everything to me. I was speechless, that was 5 star service! Overall, Four seasons was well worth every penny and deserves the 5 stars. I booked through whatahotel and got complementary daily buffet breakfast, lunch at Ferraro and room upgrade, value over $500. Will definitely stay at Four Seasons again!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!!!”
Reviews.Author: RCRGator
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to spend the money to stay at the Four Seasons in Maui but I am so glad I did. The room was incredible with great views of the ocean. Every little touch and amenity was taken care of....from sunscreen and treats at the pool to Woolite in the closet to launder your bathing suits. The Four Seasons gets all the small details right (and large ones too). The hotel is nice as it is one of the smaller ones in Wailea - you don't feel like you're one of millions. We had no problem getting cabanas both poolside and hillside everyday. The snorkel equipment was great and the reef right off the beach provided a great snorkeling experience. We saw at least one sea turtle every day! The paddle board rentals were great and fun as well. The food was exceptional - we ate at Ferraro's three times (all great), Spago once (very good) and Duo once (husband's favorite, my least favorite). The fitness room was nice and the activity room provided lots of things to do when you want to get out of the sun. Overall, one of the best resorts I have ever been to with exceptional service and staff. I would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “The place to go in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: Dan W
Reviews.Content: Everything about this location is Top Shelf. It was a wonderful stay. We go to Hawaii every year. This will always be our choice while in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected at every level; didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: MSinAZ
Reviews.Content: Spago is amazing; breakfast is great. Poolside service was the best. Comprehensive spa and well appointented cardio and lift equipment. Great room with excellent bathroom. Everyone who works there is beyond nice and goes out of their way to be helpful. Of the 3 golf courses, the "Emerald" is the best - beautiful and challenging enough.

Reviews.Title: “A honeymoon to remember.”
Reviews.Author: Wilson C
Reviews.Content: We arrive at the hotel with a big surprise. They have upgraded us from a garden view room to an ocean view. And what a view it was. The room was comfy with a patio and a bathroom almost the same size as the bedroom. Service there was just perfect and everybody remembers your name. With the complimentary 1 hour snorkeling rental, we managed to see 3 Hawaiian green turtles right off the beach of the hotel. Pool service was great and I love their smoothies. The restaurants were not bad, the Italian restaurant has a great ocean side sitting. Really nothing to complaint about except may be a bit pricey. But you paying for the best.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: M30001
Reviews.Content: Wow! Great four seasons. Great location, great service, great resort feel - just great overall! Lots of free amenities (sunscreen, snorkel equipment, etc). Resort is connected via a path to other resorts in the area. After walking around them, four seasons feels more serene/tranquil, although others nearby (Fairmont, Grand Wailea) appeared nice as well. Ferraros (restaurant in hotel) was delicious. Would highly recommend - don't think you'll be disappointed as long as you can stomach the bill at the end.

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: whitehbr
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing time relaxing at the resort. The beach, pools, and hotel was top notch. We came from the 4 Seasons in Kona which was more spread out, where this one is built upwards. Duo was our favorite restaurant by far at the resort. You can easily walk to neighboring resorts and eat at their restaurants as well.

Reviews.Title: “One amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kjve9876
Reviews.Content: Hawaii is amazing but you want to know about the hotels, Four Seasons did an amazing job on this property. The service is spot on, employees are extremely helpful, food is amazing and the activities they offer are unbeatable. The spa is amazing, based on Hawaiian treatments with a modern flare, they have a great facility that is warm and welcoming. The only negative thing I can say is the restaurants service can be rather slow but it's a truly minor complaint. I highly recommend this hotel, it's well worth the cost because even the lowest priced rooms are outstanding. Enjoy Hawaii and all is has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: 993TT
Reviews.Content: My favorite hotel so far of anyplace I've been. They actually spray fragrance on the fans cooling the outdoor breakfast area. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've ever stayed...”
Reviews.Author: Clara B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon and they have upgraded us to a partial ocean view, where we could watch the beautiful sunset. The hotel layout is very nice. It is not huge like the Grand Wailea next door, but it is elegant and subtle. We enjoyed every corner of the hotel. Since it's off season, it was less crowded and we could get the cabana overlooking the ocean. The pool staff walked around offering snacks and drinks - we could stay at the pool one whole day without getting bored! The adult only serenity pool is so "cool", great to hang out with friends there. There were some free activiteis too like yoga class, pilates etc. Needless to say we enjoyed the good food at the restaurants too, even in the lounge they served very fresh sushi! The staff in general were very friendly and helpful. I've stayed in many luxury hotels before for business and leisure and can say this is the best I've experienced. Of course the hotel is expensive, but it is worthwhile if you want to have a wonderful memory.

Reviews.Title: “The most luxorious 6 days of my life”
Reviews.Author: LindsayAnnWagner
Reviews.Content: We went on our honeymoon here in Julyâ€¦ there's only ONE thing wrong with this hotelâ€¦ you NEVER want to leave!!! I have been to many high rating hotels in several cities, Vegas hotels always top my list, this is on a whole other level. This story best sums it up: A man and his wife were at the lobby bar having a drink before dinner. She was telling him how a button came loose on her dress. The bartender (whom they were not talking to) overheard and made a phone call, 2 seconds later someone was at her side with a needle and thread!! The adults only infinity pool is the best place in the world, the pool staff and bartenders are so much fun! Can't wait to go back on some future anniversary!!!

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: diegoh
Reviews.Content: My wife and newborn were there in March for the tsunami (which never actually arrived at the Four Seasons). Besides having to delay my beach scuba dive, it really didn't effect much else. The whales out front were incredible (and listening to them sing during the dive was surreal). Service was what you'd expect, and of course all the food we ate was incredible. They had a crib and stuffed animal in the room for us, which was a really nice touch. Bath toys too. It was a special experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Honeymoon, Thanks Four Seasons - Maui”
Reviews.Author: DrJDS
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fabulous honeymoon at the Four Seasons Resort Maui at Wailea. The resort and staff were fabulous. We made use of the various resort services (room service, day spa, salon, etc.) and found them all to be excellent. We spent six days at the resort and had a wonderful time. Well worth the investment. JS

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong!!!”
Reviews.Author: october_bride_to_be
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many hotels on Maui and this was the most luxurious. If you are looking for top of the line from the rooms, to the pools, to the service, you must stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing food and service!”
Reviews.Author: blueskiesaustralia17
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 10 days at Four Seasons Maui with our 8 and 6 year old children. The service at the Four Seasons was amazing. In the time we were there we inevitably asked 'Would it be possible to...' 'Is it ok if...' and every time the staff were able to make our request happen. Our daughter loved the beautiful Ahi fish they have at the restaurants and the made it into sushi especially for her every day for lunch by the kids pool. The arrival and leaving gifts really made us feel welcome and I was astounded that despite the large number of staff, there was such consistency in service levels. The food also deserves a mention. Ferraro's was our favorite and the food everywhere (except room service) was excellent. Spargo (which is not managed by Four Seasons) had terrible bar service but fabulous food. The hotel is on a gorgeous beach. We snorkelled straight off it and saw a giant turtle! The pool is big, the heated spa fun and the kids club had gekko hunting which was a big hit. Very successful holiday.

Reviews.Title: “A top notch luxury hotel in a gorgeous location”
Reviews.Author: celesteram
Reviews.Content: I had difficulty deciding between the three large luxury hotels in Wailea (Fairmont Kea Lani, Grand Wailea, and Four Seasons). I think we made the right choice after much reading on Trip Advisor and getting our travel agent's opinion. The Four Seasons is loaded with top notch restaurants for each meal of the day. Breakfast was the best buffet we have experienced ever. Lunch at Ferraro's was delightful near the pool. Duo was a fantastic dinner spot. We elected not to go to Spago and eat at a different location instead. Next time we'll definitely try Spago. The service, professionalism and cleanliness were absolutely perfect. We enjoyed the complimentary outrigger canoe program, although we would love to have stayed out on the water longer! The beach was very nice, but not as nice as some of the West Maui beaches. One thing to note, and I confirmed this with a couple of folks who live in the area: Most days around noon, the wind and water kick up and can make things a bit dicey in the water, but still pleasant. The serenity pool gets quite windy since it is on an elevated section of the resort. On the subject of the serenity pool, we noticed that a lot of people complained about the limited chairs available and getting in line early in the morning to reserve one. We really didn't have much trouble here. We usually put our name on the list and were called within and hour to come up and claim our spot. My only issue with this resort is a personal one, and might not mean nearly as much to a majority of people. When I go to Hawaii, a big part of the draw for me is the culture and the style of the islands. I love the lei greetings, luaus, Hawaiian music, Hawaiian art, hula, and the perpetuation of all things that make this place unique and special. The Four Seasons has the lei greeting, the outrigger program, a couple of hours of live music & hula in the lounge each evening, and some Hawaiian art scattered in the lobby area. But I miss the Hawaiian music constantly playing in the background, the weekly luau, the sound of Tahitian drums from time to time, and need I say it again? more Hawaiian music everywhere! Maybe it seems incongruous with the more European styled hotel? Just sharing my thoughts. The Hawaiianness that exists there is very elegant, but sparse and sterile feeling. Beyond that, our experience at the Four Seasons was phenomenal, especially when we realized we had been upgraded to a suite, which we attribute to American Express. Because we are explorers and like to change things up, we might try the Ritz Carlton Kapalua or the Grand Wailea next time, for comparison.

Reviews.Title: “A great relaxing time in absolute luxury!”
Reviews.Author: George P
Reviews.Content: We loved DUO breakfast, which was probably the best breakfast we had on Hawaii. The resort is running a scuba diving and outrigger (canoeing) sessions; what an experience! We will probably never forget dining at Ferraroâ€™s while the sun was gracefully setting down. The hotel is in a great location, love the beach. It was a great relaxing time in absolute luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite stay on the Hawaiian Islands”
Reviews.Author: rgildea
Reviews.Content: If you want to splurge on a luxurious stay in Maui, choose the Four Seasons. Their resort is immaculate, beds are incredibly, blissfully comfortable, the staff is attentive and professional. It was our anniversary and we arrived to find a bottle of champagne in our room. We chose the club option which is so worth the extra you pay. You have incredibly scrumptious foods at different times of the day, breakfast, afternoon tea, cocktails in the evening with more yummy delectible goodies. My favorite was the chocolate croissants baked fresh every morning from their bakery. Always someone on staff to assist you personally in anything you need, reservations, directions, local information. The rooms are large and spacious. There was even a DVD player so I could still do my Zumba (had to work off those chocolate croissants!) The pools are beautiful and poolside assistants come by with assorted complementary fruits, muffins, water while you bask in the sun. We always would come out fairly early to find our places to lay in the sun as people would all be doing this to get their favorite spots. They will hold them for up to an hour unattended. So we would find our location, lay our things down and then go back up to the club floor for some breakfast goodies and then ooze back into our lounges. The Serenity pool for adults only is our favorite, but you really have to be wanting to get up early for that. People line up around 6 a.m. to get in by 7 a.m. However, worth it, so worth it. So we did that once or twice for a quiet, blissful day sans the noise of happy blissful children playing in pools elsewhere. Love children, just nice to have an adult break. Swim up pool bar... awesome. I wish they had more than one Serenity Pool! Walks along the beach... what can you say? It's Wailea Beach. Like viewing the world in Techni-Color. The colors are so vivid it's hard to look away. The Spa offered complimentary yoga and we enjoyed that on the beach in the early morning. Speaking of the Spa... truly that was our only disappointment. As Spa's go, and we've been to quite a few, it was a bit of a let down compared to everything else at the Resort. And way over priced, as most are at resorts of this caliber. We had a couples massage in huts on the beach and unfortunately my husband didn't ask about the cost. Five hundred dollars was a bit much and our massages were not stellar. We may have just caught two of the girls on an off night, so I wouldn't rush to too much judgment. But it was way over the top on the cost. We booked a couples massage at the Grand Wailea next door a few days later for $295 and it was incredible. Soaking in mineral baths, citrus body scrub, and massage. I would definitely recommend their spa. Grand Wailea had been our second choice for our stay and frankly, you can't go wrong with either if you're willing to indulge a bit with your finances. We did not eat at the restaurants onsite (Club kept our tummies most content) however, we definitely recommend for over the top service a splurge at Nick's at the Fairmont down the road and also Mulligans on the Golf course (Irish Pub). And if you have a rental car and plan on driving around, Mama's Fish House (I believe that's what it's called) should not be missed. Absolutely the best fish we've ever had, but also a splurge. After a week, we headed on to the Grand Hyatt on Kauai. When we checked into our room and checked out their club option, we wanted to cry and run back to the Four Seasons. Not in the same ballpark. The Grand Hyatt was nice (beds horrible) and the staff nice enough, but it's a horrible shock to your system after staying at the Four Seasons. Thanks Four Seasons for a stay we'll never forget!!

Reviews.Title: “wow, wow, wow”
Reviews.Author: HorseDiva
Reviews.Content: Our family spent a magical 8 days at the Four Seasons in fall of 2010. It will remain one of the best vacations we ever took. We think about it and dream about our return often. The attention to detail, amenities, location and offerings at the Four Seasons are not to be rivaled. We traveled with a 7 year old and he was treated like a king---Child amenities, kids camp and great dining options for kids were an added bonus and a great option for a family who didn't want to endure the circus of the neighboring Grand Wailea. Four Seasons offers a much more elegant and relaxing option and the attendants at the pools, beach and elsewhere will cater to your every need. Was an absolute idyllic trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: PhyllisWisconsin
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Four Seasons. It is a beautiful property. The service was outstanding. The beach was beautiful and we spent hours enjoying it. We liked that there were shuttles always available to take us to nearby restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “My husband and I spent our 25th anniversary here”
Reviews.Author: debbie g
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our 25th anniversary here at The Four Seasons and everyone here helped make the experience wonderful. The staff was very professional and friendly. We did not want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Hawaii Five-O”
Reviews.Author: VoxVolpe
Reviews.Content: This Four Seasons deserves a perfect 5 rating. Though it is an old style hotel built before the preferred new Four Season resort style, it is wonderful place to stay and much like the Four Seasons on the Big Island of Hawaii, it is the best location to stay in Maui. The service was excellent, the food exquisite, and the property well maintained and beautiful. We stayed on the Club level and the team there was exceptional, kind, and truly helped make our stay delightful. The rooms are spacious and Four Seasons comfortable. We enjoyed all three of the restaurants and the overall food quality was excellent. The beach is what you expect as a perfect Hawaii beach and the sunsets are beautiful. This property has the hearted beach than the Four Seasons on the Big Island but lacks the resort feel. There is a great deal to do in Maui and it is probably the favorite of the islands visited. This property is well worth visit and deserves a Hawaii 5 rating.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: mp_renegade6
Reviews.Content: This trip was so amazing, we did not want to leave and head back home to reality! Hands down, best vacation we've ever been on and will be hard to top. From the moment we arrived, the service was impeccable from arrival to departure. We were upgraded from an Oceanview Prime Room to a One Bedroom Oceanfront Suite - a very generous surprise! The view was amazing from the huge lanai and we enjoyed a number of room service meals from there (fabulous food also!) The end of September is more into the low season, so the resort was not crowded at all and we did not have to struggle to find a spot at the Serenity Pool nor the normal pool, which was nice (at any time of day). The Serenity Pool was nothing short of amazing and the drinks were muy bueno! It did become windy around noon every day, so unless you like sand blowing in your face, it's best to retreat to one of the pools. The pool attendants are just wonderful and bring you everything from muffins, water, fruit, cool towels, etc. For restaurants, we ate the full breakfast buffet at Duo every morning and just loved all the options. We did eat room service several times (more due to laziness, than anything else! ha!) and the food was really great all around every time. We ate at Spago our last night there and while the food was great overall, it didn't really blow our socks off. We also ordered food at the pool for lunch (the nachos with chicken are awesome!) on occasion as well. We did rent a car, which came in handy for heading up to Haleakala early one morning (we do not like to do group tours at all) and we also headed over to the Shops at Wailea, which is a nice shopping center. We also went into Kahului to the shopping center there (needed to fix the iPhone) and had fun hanging out there also. Beyond that, we really just did not want to leave the resort...it was almost similar to the feeling you get when you wake up on a cold fall morning and just don't want to get out from under the warm covers (we're from NY!). We loved every minute and truly had a chance to relax to the extent we never have been able to before. A must visit for us again! Anyone considering Maui should not look any further than the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Bliss!”
Reviews.Author: Georgia K
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in early September and I wish we never left. It set the standards for the rest of our time in Hawaii and next time we will stay here the whole time! Everything about the hotel was perfect. The room had the most amazing bathroom - massive, clean, comfy robes and plush towels. The rest of the room was a good size with walk out patio area and views to the ocean. The bed was so comfy we slept for 13 hours our first night, a rarity in our normal life. We spent most of our time by the pool and it was so relaxing. We were looked after by the best pool staff, bar staff, waiters, everyone was so accommodating. There is so much to do at this resort and everything is really nicely spread out so you don't feel like you're surrounded by people all the time. You have a choice of 3 pools, one adults-only which seemed a bit quiet, the main pool (we had the same spot every day), and a side pool off the main pool. Also plenty of private / semi-private cabanas available. Even the exercise room was pleasant - lots of machines, the very best of course, and plenty to accommodate guests - all overlooking the ocean. We ate at Spago one night, it was superb! Our waiter was fabulous, great atmosphere, pleasant staff, lots of choice, food and wine fantastic. Breakfast every day was unbelievable, the selection seemed endless, dining room flowed seamlessly with the rest of the resort, the perfect way to start the day. We absolutely rate this hotel as one of the best we've been to. And we will be back! Don't even bother staying anywhere else in Hawaii - they pale in comparison to the Four Seasons Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: map1977
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my honeymoon where we stayed at the Four Seasons Maui. The only negative I can say is that this hotel is so good that any other hotel afterwards will never measure up! The hotel itself is gorgeous, the grounds are amazing, the amenities are great and the service is unparalleled. The only small thing I will say is that I don't think the "ocean view" rooms are worth it unless money is no object. Unlike traditional ocean view suites which have a direct line of sight with the ocean, none of the rooms in this hotel look directly out onto the water (just due to the way the hotel was built). In my mind, it's definitely better to save the money and just book a garden or mountain view room which are both lovely and cost significantly less. Trust me, with a hotel this good in Maui of all places, you won't be spending too much time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “WOW simply the best, it's going to be hard to top”
Reviews.Author: luvtravel27
Reviews.Content: We read all the other raving reviews and thought it couldn't live up to expectations, but it did!! 100%. We were just going to stay at the Westin Lahaina (Kaanapali) for the length of our stay in Maui but after reading all the reviews on trip advisor we couldn't resist staying a few nights at the four seasons just to see for ourselves. Yes it is expensive (luckily we got a good deal through whatahotel.com) but it is absolutely worth it. The service is absolutely amazing. The staff need to be regonised, along with the amazing location on the beach and the beautiful resort itself, the staff really make the stay. I can't rave enough about this resort. From the moment we arrived to be greeted by the staff at our taxi to the moment we left, everyone was so friendly and welcoming. The guys around the pool that set up your sunlounge and continually top up your water and offer you jelly cups and wet towels. Every detail is thought of. The room was amazing with music piped through a massive bathroom. The gym was amazing. It made me actually WANT to use it. The only down fall was that the adults pool with the music under water was always full and you had to put your name on a wait list. Which was ok as it was also always full of Ken and Barbies!! We were happy down at the other pool. The Grand Wailea next door looked nice also. But couldn't imagine it living up to the Four Seasons!! But then what would!

Reviews.Title: “50th at Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Keyav8r
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 50th anniversary during the week of Sept. 10-17 at the Four Seasons-Maui and it could not possibly have been any better. Every superlative you have read about this fabulous resort is true (and to some extent understated). On arrival we were upgraded to an ocean view prime suite and found chanpagne and chocolate covered strawberries in our suite compliments of the regional VP and general manager (Thank you, Mr. Steinhauer). Both the living room and bedroom had balcony access with full views of the upper courtyard, the ocean, the island of Lanai and absolutely beautiful sunsets. The suite included a full bathroom off the bedroom and a "guest" bathroom off the entry hallway (one for each of us). The king bed was very comfortable and the entire suite was very well decorated and appointed to meet every need. Housekeeping was unobtrusive, yet somehow able to freshen the rooms twice a day, including turndown service. We ate at all of the restaurants and had room service and pool service and can attest that you cannot have a bad meal at the Four Seasons-Maui. I think our favorite of the three restaurants was Duo, although that may have been because of the fantastic breakfast each morning. Spago and Ferraros were both very good, but we went back to Duo for our anniversary dinner. Both the food at the pool and the room service meals arrived hot and fresh - not always the case at other resorts. I can almost believe the entire resort staff is telepathic as everyone seems to know your name as soon as you check in. I'm sure it is more likely a result of Four Seasons emphasis on personal service blending with the Maui spirit. You can't beat the pool service (Thanks - Fredo, Rowena and Greg) or the wait staff (Thanks - Sophie). We were also impressed that several of the managers approached us to introduce themselves and ask how we were enjoying our stay. A couple of tips. First, if you are celebrating a special event (birthday, honeymoon, anniversary, etc.) let them know when you book your reservation. It will be noted and recognized. Second, book your reservation through Ivonne at Whatahotel.com. They are a Four Seasons Preferred Partner and you will receive a room upgrade, free breakfast each day of your stay and a lunch credit at Ferraro's, all at no increase in rates. All in all, we would rate the Four Seasons-Maui as 15 stars on a 1 to 5 star scale. Would we go back? An unqualified YES!

Reviews.Title: “Another Day in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: bossychihuahua
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Four Season in Wailea, Maui for six nights in September for a well deserved vacation. In this case, you truly get what you pay for....the customer service is phenomenal. The entire staff is welcoming and friendly. We booked an Ocean View Room and, upon check-in, were upgraded to an Ocean View Prime Room. The views were amazing (room 693) and it was also fun to be able to hear the hotel VIPs (Lucy & Ricky the resident parrots) "chatting" from time time. Dining at Ferraros and DUO was absolutly yummy. Did I mention they give you cotton candy at the end of the meal at DUO, otter pops as treats while lounging by the pool, and jelly beans when you check out? Just some little things, but really made the entire hotel stay memorable. Great amenities and lots of activities to choose from.....or simply just lounge by the pool all day long! Also appreciated the environmental sustainable initiatives they have implemented at this hotel as well. Overall, a wonderful hotel with staff that goes out of their way to ensure you have a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking sunsets”
Reviews.Author: claudillita
Reviews.Content: We visited this property to celebrate our wedding anniversary. From the start we love the openness of this property, you can feel the breeze anywhere your walk in. We stayed on the 5th floor and were upgraded to a large suite ( perhaps I shouldnâ€™t say this) with front ocean view, I think it was because it was our anniversary and because weâ€™ve visited several of their properties, we were very pleased! We had the best sunsets from our balconies.( yes balconies) We had the breakfast buffet every morning and I would highly recommend it, plenty of options and very healthy. We sat first in the adult pool and although we had to put our names down to get a spot, they sat us fairly quickly( less than an hour) in the area. There was a large group of Mary Kay ladies and to be honest, they were all nice and fun to have around! We also sat by the large-kiddy pool and it was the best ocean view. We snorkel ed by the reef in the hotel beach and we noticed several tour boats bringing snorkelers into our area and we indeed saw pretty fish and turtles in the area. We also took a tour to Molikini with Kai Kanani sailing charters (reserved through concierge) and tried some SNUBA diving. We loved it! We also reserved dinner at mama fish house, you have to try it but be prepared for the 45 min drive (75 usd) each way. we waked around the walkboard to the properties next door- Grand Wailea, Marriot and private residences and I would recommend the Grand Wailea for families- they have water slides, kiddy beach, activities. FS is more focus toward couples. The drinks and hotel food was excellent and what can I say about the service?? Four seasons never leaves room for improvement, they are great on that department. The hotel landscaping is immaculate, every detail in the architecture, rooms, pool and it was perfectly designed to provide a very high end stay and service.
