Thanks Four Season, I will continue to be your loyal customer!

Reviews.Title: “Hawaiin Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Raffello
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Four Season in Wailea, Maui for six nights in September to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary. This is truly the best hotel in Wailea! You are treated like royalty from the moment you arrive to the time you leave. Our accommodations were suppose to be a Garden View and we were upgrade to Ocean View room which was magnificent. Dining at Ferraros and Spagos was outstanding!The entire hotel is just the most romantic and relaxing place. The staff could not do enough for you. We were greeted by our names and congratulated on our anniversary multiple times. They made us feel so special. My husband and I are well traveled and felt this experience was one of the best!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise away from home!”
Reviews.Author: carrie m
Reviews.Content: What can I say but the Four Seasons Maui is the top of the line in resorts and my favorite hotel in the world-so far. I've stayed here twice without our kids. This hotel has fabulous food/drinks, good size rooms/amenities, beautiful grounds, pools, spa and fitness center and kids activities. I really enjoyed the yoga on the beach and the 5:30 am complimentary coffee/pastries in the lobby. The brunch was awesome in the restaurant. The drinks by the pool or at Ferraro's bar were so yummy esp. the lava flow and mai tais. This is the best hotel on Maui b/c it's small, quaint, and there is a great attention to detail along with top notch service. We've always stayed in the Mountain View room b/c we're not in the room much and it saves some $$. You have a great ocean view everywhere else in the hotel so no biggie to overlook the mountain when in you're room. The tennis courts are great and are supplied with complimentary rackets, ball rack and water. Can't wait to go back again. Though there are many kids that stay here, especially in the summer, you hardly notice them because they're very sophisticated and well travelled/behaved. The beach is nice-basically a bay with tiny waves. There is a great mall across from the hotel with upscale stores and restaurants like Tommy Bahama. Celebrated my husband's 40th bday at Mama's and had the best meal of our life. Great golf at the hotel too.

Reviews.Title: “Without any doubt the best hotel in Maui”
Reviews.Author: babi_mikroula
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for our honeymoon, spending 4 delightful days here. This hotel has all you need to feel absolutely happy. Located on the best beach of Maui, tastefully arranged, offering several restaurants and bars alternatives, this hotel has all you may need to enjoy your stay. The breakfast buffet is the best we had in Hawaii, the service is absolutly faultless. The rooms are incredibly quiet and comfortable (we had a garden view double room). This hotel is approximately 20% more expensive than the others, but in our opinion it is worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons With Kids -- Still Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: WhereItsWarm
Reviews.Content: Much has been said about how fantastic this hotel is. However, I thought it might be helpful to provide families traveling with children with a review that is specifically geared towards the family experience. We went to the Four Seasons Maui in August for 10 nights with our two children aged 4 and 6. Overall, I would summarize the family experience as consistent with everything else that has been said about this place. The hotel and its staff think of everything and the family experience at the Fours Seasons Maui was fantastic. Here are some of the highlights: Room: We spent the first 5 nights in a garden view room and the second 5 nights in a garden view executive suite. Both rooms were great but the suite provided added privacy since the kids slept together on a sofa-bed in the room adjoining the bedroom. The sofa bed was more comfortable than a typical sofa bed and the children slept very well. As has been stated in several other reviews, the room has several surprises for the kids upon check-in (a stuffed animal, their names spelled out in sponge letters in the bathroom and child-sized four seasons robes to use). Kids for All Seasons: This was, for us, the real wild-card. We had no idea whether or not the kids would take to the KFAS programming. As it turns out, they LOVED it. We sent them to KFAS for 6 of the 10 days we were there and they did not want to leave when we picked them up. The programming is varied and well thought out and the staff was fantastic. I could not have been happier (nor could the kids). On their first day, each child is given a cubby in which to keep their arts and crafts. There is an outdoor activity, swimming, indoor play time and movies daily. It is a perfect combination of activities and rest and my children really enjoyed meeting the other kids. My youngest (the 4 year old) had to be accompanied by a caretaker (arranged through the hotel) but the whole thing worked seamlessly and my little guy enjoyed the program as much as my older child. On one evening every week, there was a special activity organized for the kids (at an additional cost). When we were there, our kids got a tour of the 4S kitchen, got to make their own pizzas and cupcakes and, after dinner, watched a movie. It provided a great opportunity for my wife and I to have a nice dinner together without any guilt. For their part, the kids had a blast. The evening activity was a little on the pricey side, but it was well worth it. Nanny: My youngest child had a nanny when he attended KFAS because the program requires supervision for kids under the age of 5 (it has something to do with licensing). We arranged through the concierge to have a nanny provided and requested that he have the same nanny for the entire stay. This was set up in advance and it worked out nicely. The nanny was great, came with activities, and really developed a good rapport with our child. We also had her babysit one night and she kept both of our kids occupied and happy. The cost was $20 per hour. Meals: The kids at for free at Ferraros and Duo (provided that parents are also ordering meals). For some reason, the kids don't eat free if you order food at the pool (even though it comes off the same menu as the childrens' menu used in the other restaurants). Overall: The pools, the beach, the facilities... they are all perfectly suited for children. There were many kids at the end of August and the hotel was bustling. However, the kids at the resort were generally well-behaved. While I was a little reluctant to take young kids at first, based on this past experience, I would definitely bring them next time. At this hotel, you really can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Cyndi M
Reviews.Content: Best 40th birthday ever! We split our time between this property and the Grand Wailea next door. Perfect, exquisite, memorable, unforgettable.....quite simply the best time of my life. It was worth every penny for the absolute best of everything. If you are trying to decide whether to go.....GO!!!

Reviews.Title: “4th of July stay”
Reviews.Author: LouiseThomas
Reviews.Content: One thing I love about the Four Seasons are the rooms and the beautiful, well maintained property and this one didn't disappoint. Very spacious rooms, especially the bathrooms. The ocean view was a disappointment though as most ocean view rooms are diagonal to the ocean due to the layout of the hotel, and rooms are far from the ocean so you don't get that on the ocean feel. Service on the beach was top-notch and even though we visited on a very crowded weekend, there were still plenty of staff to accomodate our needs. There were no affordable restaurant choices for dinner though, although plenty in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever! A slice of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: LauraJKent
Reviews.Content: Our family has stayed at the FS Maui on and off for the past 15 years. We typically visit during Spring Break in April but have also visited during Christmas. They hotel can be very crowded during those times but we have never had trouble getting a reservation for dinner at any of the three restaurants on property. Speaking of restaurants, they are all absolutely fantastic. Ferraros at Sunset is a real treat and they have music nightly which provides a very nice ambiance. The rooms are spacious, clean and quiet. The Garden View rooms have been our favorite on the third floor as they have sliding doors that lead to a deck and a lawn area. Everyone from the valet, front desk, restaurants servers, pool attendants and spa employees provides TOP client service and all of them somehow remember my family's names. They have watched my kids grow up and remember us year after year. The outrigger program is amazing and each time we have seen turtles. Even though you do have to get up early at times to find a beachfront chair, it is well worth it. We have been spoiled by the FS Maui and honestly would't stay anywhere else in Maui. This hotel is bar none!!! (the part in this review where they ask you when you last visited would not let me choose August 2010 which was when we were last there so I had to put Oct 2010 but we went in August which I must say was a wonderful time to go since we typically go during spring break and it is much more crowded during the "breaks."

Reviews.Title: “Paradise found”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoPisces
Reviews.Content: Quite possibily the very best hotel on the planet. Four Seasons Maui holds all the cards: top service, top dining, top pools, top rooms and top spa. Nothing is left to chance. It is not a cheap hotel, but pretty much everything is included once you get here. There is snorkeling right off the beach, which had an abundance of colorful fish. I saw some eels and a turtle too. We ate at all of the restaurants here, and I suggest them all, in this order: Duo, Ferraros, Spago. Of the three I think Spago was the only one that was overpriced ($39 for chicken?). Theres a nice game room too and with pool tables, video games and shuffle board. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Living Up To The 5-Star 5-Diamond Standard”
Reviews.Author: FlyersFanInLA
Reviews.Content: I have been told there are as few as 17 hotels in the world that have both 5-stars and 5-diamond ratings. I have been lucky to stay at a few of them and magic is in the little details. To be clear - you are paying for his level of excellence at the Four Seasons in Maui but its 100% worth it. This was our 6th stay with them and we will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Some advice among the superlatives...”
Reviews.Author: smcp
Reviews.Content: What this large property manages to do extremely well is to make you feel a sense of intimacy and privacy in what is a vast site. We stayed for 5 nights in a prime ocean view room. First thing to note is that the design of the hotel means the majority of the ocean view rooms are set well back from the ocean so if you are expecting to hear waves lapping against your door, forget it. Second, you are in a top tier hotel - there are no bargains. However, start your day by grabbing coffee, bagels and fruit from the "shack" on the beach and sitting on the loungers on the beach. A lot more romantic and affordable then paying $80 for breakfast in the room. Service is exceptional, especially pool and beach side. If you want a place at the serenity adult pool, get there for 7 stake a place and then head for breakfast. It has the best swim up bar and staff ever! The spa is a disappointment. The Grand Wailea next door is much grander. Ditto with the gym - plenty of outdoor options to keep you fit. In fact the daily agenda of "free" activities is excellent so check them out. If you are looking for a more authentic Hawaiian experience I would suggest the Hana Maui but for a 5 star luxury service hotel this place is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Last Minute Luxury”
Reviews.Author: NatureCat
Reviews.Content: We were in a huge bind. We had just flown in from the mainland and picked up our dog from the kennel. Our flight to Maui was late, but we thought we would try to catch the last ferry back home to Lana'i. Oops, didn't work out. Not thinking that ALL the hotels on Maui might be sold out, we started our frantic phone calls. Not only did we need a place to stay for the night, we also needed one that accepted small dogs. Our first choice due to location and rate was the Westin. They were sold out. The second choice was the smaller hotels and VRBO rentals. No such luck. We finally called the Four Seasons and they were able to get us in at the last minute at a kama'aina rate. They knew we were beat and hungry when we arrived. The concierge immediately started calling around to see what dinner options were still available. Great service! And the best part, they allowed us to bring our little dog. The resort is stunning and first class all the way. I usually prefer a more intimate setting, but I don't know anyone who would complain about the gorgeous room we received (was this the run-of-the-house last minute bring your dog room? Wow!). It was quite spacious and the bathroom was fit for a queen. The view from the lanai was serene and beautiful. I did find the pool and beach area to be crowded (especially compared to FS Manele Bay, Lana'i), but it was still lovely. This resort is expensive, but I would definitely stay here again after I save my pennies for a special occasion...or another last minute "oops"!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: kit001_10
Reviews.Content: Everything has already been said. This hotel is out of this world. Best hotel stay ever. If you are thinking about staying here pay the little extra and go for it. It is well worth it. The staff here are fantastic and the service is fit for a king.

Reviews.Title: “The gold standard for Maui”
Reviews.Author: NippyMcWhiskerson
Reviews.Content: We're going to have a hard time ever staying anywhere else next time we go to Maui - The Four Seasons really spoiled us. The staff and service stood out the most - just excellent. Everyone did whatever they could to make us more comfortable or get us whatever we needed. I was continually surprised at how many of the staff learned and remembered my name. Beyond the service, the property is gorgeous, rooms are very nice and immaculate, pools are great, and they are on an outstanding beach. It's honestly difficult to complain about anything here. If you are looking for a relaxing trip where you spend many of your days lying by the pool or on the beach and don't even want to leave the resort, I don't think you can do better than The Four Seasons. It's not cheap, though. We got a mountainside room, which is they're cheapest, but I have to say I would totally get it again. Considering that the room itself is the same as nicer-view rooms, and you get all the same service, I'd recommend it. We overlooked the parking garage, but it was covered and there was nice landscaping right outside our balcony. The only reason to splurge and get a nicer room, IMO, is if you really like to sit out on your balcony and enjoy coffee or breakfast or something. Otherwise, you can't go wrong with a mountainside room if you are trying to get The Four Seasons into your budget. Note that they provide many amenities for free that other hotels charge you for. The only extra thing we paid for ever was overnight parking ($20). Fitness center, spa with steam room, cabana by the pool with great service - all free. They have 3 restaurants, and we tried all of them. They're all expensive, as you'd expect. Spago had outstanding service and generally excellent food, though it is very expensive. Ferraro's wasn't anything special to me. Duo was not bad - this is the one I would rely on for dinner if you don't want to leave the resort but you're not looking for a super-special meal or anything. Duo had great, but not too formal, service, and the food was quite good. It's still expensive, but as long as you don't get carried away you can keep the bill reasonable. If you want to get out of the resort for a more reasonable dinner, Kihei seemed like the most residential town in the area, and was not far away at all, but you do have to get the car. Some quick tips: 1. We booked through WhataHotel, which got us a free full buffet breakfast every day, plus a free lunch at Ferraro's one day. That was a better deal than anything that was being offered on the Four Seasons website, so definitely look into it. I'd never used WhataHotel before, but they were great and easy, and I'd use them again. 2. Poolside chairs and cabanas are first come first served, and sometimes they can go early. We ended up waking up around 7am or so most days, headed down and reserved a nice spot with one of the pool attendants, then went to breakfast. That worked out really well. If you make friends with the folks around the pool, they will help you find good spots. 3. The Serenity Pool is great - it's adults only, and is an infinity pool. Chairs there get snapped up really early. We spent one day up there, and it's great, but I have to say we enjoyed other days by the other pools more. We did not find noisy kids or anything like that to be a problem, and we would just walk up to the Serenity Pool when we felt like taking a dip in there. 4. Try to grab one of the spots on the terraced hill overlooking the beach. They are private, a little more quiet, have a great beach view, but are also not far at all from the pool. You'll get sun for much of the day, but you can put up the shade cover there and it's meshy enough that it allows good airflow so it's not too hot. 5. Get out early and enjoy your lounging, because it does get windy in the afternoon in Wailea. The mornings are calmer and little more peaceful. 6. We got a couples massage in the oceanside hale. It was awesome. It's screened from the beach so it's private, but being able to hear the waves and have a breeze blowing through was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Resort”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Best1
Reviews.Content: This resort is heaven on earth. My husband and I spent our first year wedding anniversary there and we could not be happier. Once they found out about our anniversary they surprised us with a complimentary champagne , red roses and a lovely card. I'm in a wheelchair and they provided us the most wheelchair accessible room I could possibly ask. They treated us with respect and kindness. The staff were incredibly kind. The food was amazing. We wish we could live there forever! THANK YOU

Reviews.Title: “No-where else to stay! Forget the rest...”
Reviews.Author: James A
Reviews.Content: If you are particular about superior service, immaculate accommodations and attention to detail, then it has to be the Four Seasons. Though I have stayed at many of the Four Seasons facilities, Maui certainly has to be one of the most beautiful. This trip was to renew our wedding vows, and we needed help in contracting with an officiant, photographer etc. and the concierge (Pikake) was incredible in referring the best, and with coordinating everything. Restaurants are also excellent, though would pass on the Wolfgang Puck place (Spago)...staff was pretentious and food just "good", did not match up to the price

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: CathyMPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in a garden view room. The service is as close to perfect as it can get. Every staff member greeted us. Pool attendants and the valet were phenomenal. Housekeeping was stellar. Will always remember what a fantastic stay we had here. I hope to get back someday.

Reviews.Title: “A slice of paradise”
Reviews.Author: lkoontz99
Reviews.Content: Situated on the beautiful shore of Wailea beach, the Four Seasons Maui is a slice of paradise. The rooms are large and clean, and the bathroom is huge, with plenty of counter space for your things. The staff at the beach is quick to set up chairs and umbrellas for you each morning, and delivers cups of water frequently throughout the day. Some mornings, they even bring you mini breakfast muffins! Sea turtles hang out in the coral along Wailea beach, so you simply need to walk off the beach and swim out a few yards to see them! Excersice classes are free, and the yoga on the beach in the mornings is a wonderful experience. All of the restaurants are good, but Ferraro's is spectacular and has beautiful ocean views. If you want to venture off site to another restaurant in the Wailea area, the Four Seasons staff will gladly drive you and come back and pick you up. If you want an active trip or if you just want to relax at the pool/beach or on your lanai, you really can't go wrong with the Four Seasons, Maui. It's pricey, but worth it. We will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel Policy- Honeymoon plans ruined :(”
Reviews.Author: benjaminlevi
Reviews.Content: I always loved the four seasons and have stayed at many of there hotels, though I just got married and being a doctor and having a hard schedule december around xmas was the only time I could get off since work is slow. I had my plans set to take my new wife to the four seasons in Maui as I think it is one of the most gorgeous hotels there. Though to my disappointment after trying many travel agencies and using the american express travel department being a platinum member I was told, " Four Seasons at the end of December and new years only allows past guests to stay." I was disappointed so much that it kind of ruined the Four Seasons Brand name for me because St.Regis would never do this to customers. I hope Four Seasons would change their policy as I also emailed the office of the president to see if I would get a response and if they can make my honeymoon happen by giving me the chance to reserve my room at the Four Seasons Maui I hope they reply, if not they lost a good customer

Reviews.Title: “SINGLE PARENTS EXPERIENCE AT MAUI FOUR SEASONS”
Reviews.Author: valentinagiovanni
Reviews.Content: I revisited the Maui Four Seasons 10 yrs after a very romantic time with my husband there. This time it was just my daughter and I. The place is lovely, the beach beautiful- but we had a few odd experiences from getting sent to a closed restaurant on a weekend, and finding a bizarre note in our room. The Kids for all Seasons club is nice but they need more help, as my daughter needed individual attention which they couldnt provide. Then I got a bad report about her behavior, which i felt they could have handled differently and more caringly. The FS management made up for some of the negative experiences. For the Positive-every restaurant is first rate. (Theyd tailor make dinners for my daughter- for a price but still great attentive service.) The rooms may need an update in a few years but overall, they know how to do it right there.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome To The World of YES!”
Reviews.Author: alwyscllct
Reviews.Content: Most previous reviews talk about the great service but you must experience it for yourself to obtain a full appreciation. We are seasoned travellers who spent 3 nights here recently as part of a 10 night Hawaii trip celebrating our 30th anniversary, this leg of the trip was all we could have hoped for. In a world of fine print and excuses the 4 Seasons shows how to suceed by putting the customer first. A couple of specific thoughts: There was a glitch with our room and it was taken care of very professionally. Did not love the serenity pool, felt like we were crashing someones private party. The best beach service/prescence of any hotel we ever experienced in the Islands (thanks Sam) with complimentary lounges/umbrellas/snacks and a perfect beach to boot. The outrigger canoe ride was just great, thanks Gary! So too was the yoga, the cucumber/evian spritzes, the buffet breakfast (Kudos to Bobbie), the views, the nightly Hawaiin music and Hula dancer, the impeccible service, the car waiting with water, the free cabanas around the pool, the great bathrooms with great products, the great memories, did I mention the great service? Considering the programs that are offered together with the complimentary services makes the resort while not cheap, a great value in the luxury market.

Reviews.Title: “Truly remarkable. What a wonderful experience.”
Reviews.Author: Paul H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I honeymooned at The Four Seasons for 12 days in September 2011. We stayed on the 8th floor "Club" level. We simply can't say enough positive things about the hotel, and more importantly, the wonderful professional staff that make it a truly memorable experience. Pat, JiJi, Kimberly, Margaret and Chris all made our stay effortless, and frankly it felt way nicer than home! The word "No" simply isn't in the The Four Seasons vocabulary. We loved being greeted by the staff by our names every morning. The facility is very family friendly but has a super adults-only infinity pool. The quality of the room and the bathroom was superb and we loved the nice little treats that the staff kept delivering to our room. We can't wait to return to this hotel and would unreservedly recommend it to anyone. Dont' miss: cocktails at the bar at Ferraro's by the pool at sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: HighMaintenance01
Reviews.Content: This property lives up to the Four Seasons standard. The setting in Wailea is amazing. We have stayed at The Grand Wailea, Fairmont Kea Lani and Marriott on previous trips and Four Seasons topped all of them which is not easy as they are all spectacular resorts. We visited in March and the whale watching was out of this world.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at its best!”
Reviews.Author: altagrac
Reviews.Content: This is where you want to go if you want total luxury on your honeymoon. The rooms & property are amazing and the serenity pool is a can't miss. Restaurants are expensive but lots of great options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “average overprised”
Reviews.Author: leramd30
Reviews.Content: Choose other places the service will be as slow but you will pay less. The entire time I was in the hotel there will be some repair going on-constant noise, the corridors are too warm,food of questionable quality. The pool smell like chlorine(very strong smell) to get breakfast you had to stay in line. Overall my experience was negative and I will not be coming back. The best thing about the trip was a great tennis trainer.

Reviews.Title: “dream vacation”
Reviews.Author: jljazz
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons offer among the best there is at every level of luxury, ambience, food, and service. Cadillac shuttle service to and from the beautiful Wailea Gold and Emerald golf course is at your beckon call. And the beauty of that golf course (especially the Emerald) is breathtaking. put this on the bucket list.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutelly loved it. Cant wait to be back”
Reviews.Author: OllieDallas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons Wailea for our 10th anniversary and canâ€™t say enough good things about it. Best vacation ever!!!!! We had a partial ocean view room and it was nice and comfortable. Restaurants were fantastic and we never left the property. Customer service makes this place stand out thoughâ€¦..its unparallel. Also, we noticed that it was very family friendly and we canâ€™t wait to bring our son here soon (they have the most precious kids buffet set up for breakfast) However, we were on a romantic trip and serenity adult only pool was our hangout. Also, gym is very nice and we took advantage of the beach yoga classes. Canâ€™t wait to be back

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: JCDPKT
Reviews.Content: Pay the extra money to stay here and get pampered. It's worth it. Their customer service is unparalleled. Everywhere we went there was someone asking us how we were doing and if we needed anything. It was amazing. The property itself is gorgeous with a beautiful beach in front of the hotel. They have 3 pools. 1 of them is an adult serenity pool. The rules to get a chair their kinda sucks. You have to get to the pool at 7am or put your name in to get a chair and that usually took 2 to 4 hours. But its worth it and there is plenty of other activities to do while you wait. One complaint I had about the WiFi was they charge $6 a day to use it. I feel like a nice place like the four seasons shouldn't be nickel and diming patron over something so small. The Hyatt I just stayed at in LA had free WiFi! Overall a great experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing”
Reviews.Author: JeffJacobs
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Four Seasons, in Waimea Maui for my honeymoon. I can't say enough great things about the place. It was simply paradise. Anything you could possible ask for in a hotel. The rooms were spacious and beautiful. The main pool was fun and relaxing. The serenity (adult) pool is peaceful and has incredible views. The staff was above and beyond anything you could possible ask for or want. If you can think of it, they already have and have it at the hotel. I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: lesjas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the 2nd half of our honeymoon. This is a very upscale hotel. Our travel agent had said that some people find it a little 'snooty' for their taste. We fell a bit into this category. It was a great hotel we enjoyed very much, but we did prefer the more laid back Grand Hyatt on Kauai. The pools were nice & they provided the cabanas based upon availability with no extra charge. Snorkeling gear was available to borrow for a set amount of time & rent after that. Outrigger canoe lessons were free. Our room was huge, bright, clean & comfortable. There were many private events going on at the hotel during our stay if that type of thing bothers you. On the beach they provide towels, chairs & umbrellas. It is in a very nice part of town. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Resort that will set your mind at ease”
Reviews.Author: chanw
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an 8 day stay at the Four Seasons Resrot Maui at Wailea. Since this was our first trip to Maui, we chose to primarily stay at the resort and we were not disappointed. Our garden view room was on the first floor and it was very peaceful at night to sit on our private porch and yet have grass and all the garden flowers in front of us. We were able to use the business office to check our emails daily with no problem. The valets were all excellent in that we had a rental car and did leave the property once a day. Besides the infinity pool ( which is a must if you don't have children with you) we LOVED the artwork in throughout the resort. Oh my, you must take the time to see it all. There is a docent tour every Friday afternoon or you can get an I Pod with the tour to go on your own. Also, every day different artists from the island were featured in the lower lobby. Now their work is not your inexpensive arts and crafts item, but the real thing. We do recommend finding different places to stay during the day to enjoy the ocean on the property. The place was full of honeymooners and families with small children given the time of the year. The music in the front lobby was very enjoyable each evening. If napping in a hammock under a thatched roof, palm trees swaying and the ocean waves lulling you to sleep - then The Four Seasons Resort Maui is for you. ( We did tour the two hotel properties next to the Four Seasons and trust me - there is no comparison.)

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: JerseyShoreTraveler
Reviews.Content: The views from the resort were simply incredible. Multiple indoor/outdoor restaurants allow you to eat and simultaneously enjoy a gorgeous sunset. Food was generally excellent and always very good at the on-site restaurants (we tried them all). Poolside service was outstanding. The pool was visually interesting, but more conducive to getting wet than swimming laps. The rooms were top notch, as were the bathrooms. After agonizing over which hotel to stay at on Maui, I have absolutely no regrets about my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Beyond Belief”
Reviews.Author: Planner73
Reviews.Content: We decided to splurge while staying in Maui and chose the Four Seasons Hotel. We read all of the reviews and they were spot on. The staff was top notch--met our every need and then some. The room was well appointed with a magnificent bathroom and a relaxing balcony. Two high points were the serenity pool and the combo kayak snorkel outing. This hotel is worth every penny. In fact, when you take in account all of the complementary items that most resorts nickel and dime you for (beach chairs, towels, umbrellas, snorkel gear) the overall cost starts to come closer to the lesser hotels.We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Maui in every way!!!-Wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Cathy C
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived until we drove out of the hotel property to leave we were treated like celebrities. The staff was warm, welcoming, attentive, and paid much attention to detail. The food was excellent and the pool side service was second to none in every way. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “how to experience maui relaxed”
Reviews.Author: antonmagnani
Reviews.Content: we have enjoyed excellent service and attention to detail, great food in a choice of restaurants and relaxing ambience... the beach fabulous... a place we would return and reccomend to friends...

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon choice in Maui. Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Anthony K
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my honeymoon. Knew we made the perfect choice the moment we stepped into the Four Seasons Resort. If anyone is considering another resort for Maui other than the Four Seasons, don't. Four Seasons Resort Maui at Wailea fulfilled our every need and made our honeymoon as special as it possibly can be. Thank you Four Seasons!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing, counting the days until we can return”
Reviews.Author: KonaBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: We moved to the Four Seasons after spending 8 days at the Honua Kai. Honua Kai was ok but the Four Seasons was spectacular. It was my husband's 40th birthday and they went out of their way to recognize it, from the room upgrade to the cake that housekeeping left in the room. This was our 6th trip to Hawaii and we've always had a fantastic time but have never felt all that special - everyone is celebrating a milestone it seems from honeymoons, to anniversaries and birthdays - but the Four Seasons made us feel like we were the only guests there. Fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “can't wait to come back”
Reviews.Author: Inga19b
Reviews.Content: I am absolutely impressed. Everything was excellent - the beach and the sea, the hotel buildings and rooms, the spa and the food. But what impressed me more than other things is service. It's a rare combination of high professionalism and friendliness, readiness to be always helpful. Thank you for wonderful vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and relaxation in Maui.”
Reviews.Author: 3Canons
Reviews.Content: My family and I come to Maui often. This is by far the best hotel in Maui. The service, the restaurants, the amenities, the spa and guest rooms are excellent and always consistent. The new pool is amazing. Travelling here with kids could not be easier. The kids club is great and all the extras they provide for your children like the treats upon arrival, the keiki buffet and game room make your kids feel welcome. As for adults, the newly added adult pool is just lovely. It is situated so that you feel like you are in another world. There is a swim up bar and cabanas, the infinity pool overlooks the ocean. The shops- Cabana and 22 Knots offer beach chic clothes for men, women and kids (not your typical logo resort wear). All of the restaurants are amazing. We can't wait to come again.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Service--First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MichelleJIB5
Reviews.Content: We called FS Maui after having a not-so-good experience at a vacation rental. They were able to accommodate us with a Garden View Room (we didn't really care what view it was after our experience). When we got there to check-in, we had been upgraded to partial ocean view! The valets were so welcoming as well as the lobby desk associates. The 5 of us couldn't get a smile off of our face. Our room had 2 balconies with beautiful views. The kids had Sponge Bob cookies at the table waiting to be decorated as well as bath gifts and travel bag. A bottle of champagne was brought to our room to celebrate our upcoming anniversary. A simple mis-spell of one of our kids' names was immediately corrected and a stuffed Nene bird was gifted for the inconvenience. We didn't get to enjoy the pool or grounds since wth tour stops we were trying to fit in. So, the valets, room attendants & check-in made the experience for us. Bottled water offered to us for arrival and departures, towels for snorkeling, directions, anything we needed. Those little things do make a difference (and without being hit with multiple extra fees) Next trip, we will split 1/2 Grand Wailea,1/2 Four Seasons. Can't wait for our next trip to paradise but FS wins out overall!

Reviews.Title: “what can i say it lives upto its reputation! super stars”
Reviews.Author: asifcool83
Reviews.Content: Well we had booked a Partial Ocean View Room with king bed, Angled view of ocean from balcony only... and it was our honeymoon in 2010. Well we got a free upgrade to their best room. Full ocean view amazing super suite. I dont remember the name. Since we were there in April 2010. We were greeted with best care. the reception was class apart. Our room was an amazing suite. we were given a free champagne and cake to celebrate with. The rooms were large, both the bathrooms were amazing. the inner bathroom was huge. later the concierge were amazing. the lady helped us alot i forgot her name, but i think asian american. the restaurants served the best quality food. the sound and view of the ocean was mesmerizing. Overall one of the best stays we ever had. Thank you Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on Maui Period!”
Reviews.Author: lhenry1998
Reviews.Content: Going out to the pool and being spritzed with Evian water, and fed fresh fruit, as well as an occasional cold towel, is heaven on Earth. No hotel on Maui can rival the service, this is a one of a kind hotel. Four Seasons cleared their beach of rocks, and brought in new sand, making it paradise. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “I still dream about it...”
Reviews.Author: soosano
Reviews.Content: We came here for a three day stay after a week on the big island with family. It was the perfect end to a great vacation. The instant we arrived, we were greeted with leis and a cold drink. Our room was ready early and we were ready to roll in less than an hour. The room was not huge, nor was it small, but just right. The decor was neutral and unassuming, nothing spectacular, but nice. The bathroom was clean and very large with a shower and a tub. Our children are 1.5 and 3.5 and they had LIttle Twig toiletries in the room for them and stuffed Hawaiian Geese dolls, which they loved. They also ate free in the resort restaurants, which was wonderful considering the picky toddler and the other one who only wanted grilled cheese. Service was impeccable. The kids pool was nice, with a small rock slide and a waterfall, as well as a small tidepool for the really little ones. We were also steps from the beach. The only letdown for me was the spa service I got. My swedish massage was not great (not terrible, just not great) and for the price, I wanted it to be great. Not even sure why it wasn't great. I didn't have that "I just got a massage!" euphoria and relaxedness afterwards. Although we got an extra foot massage/treatment (free at the time we reserved it) and my husband described his as great, while I'm not really sure I got one? I would have said something if I was dissatisfied, but I was just not wowed, so I guess you can't really explain that. Anyway, if we ever get back to Maui, we are definitely staying here, with or without kids!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay here!”
Reviews.Author: octraveler08
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at this hotel six years ago for a brief trip and had fond memories of the hotel, its fantastic service, and the beach in front. This time, my husband and I plus our daughter and her husband visited in July, and it was even better! The hotel added an adults only pool area, and since we had no young children with us, we were free to enjoy this new amenity for hours at a time. It's a great addition: two pools, one an infinity overlooking the ocean, two hot tubs, cabanas you can rent for the day (very expensive) plenty of lounge chairs, complimentary snacks, pampering servers. The breakfast buffet is amazing, recreation room provides lots to do inside, walkway along the coast absolutely lovely in the morning. Staff everywhere is friendly, helpful. Rooms are spacious--we had partial ocean view which includes small patio, and beds were very comfortable. Housekeeping kept on top of things. Spa facilities top notch. Shuttle service to nearby restaurants and shopping center is very convenient. Things are close enough to walk if you choose. Although you really could spend all your time at the hotel and be as happy as a clam, you would miss out on so much Maui has to offer. Staff equips you with water and beach towels for outings. We drove out to Lahaina and spent a little time there, and on the way back pulled off at one of the small sandy beaches in the late afternoon--the water was warm, calm, and so relaxing! We also went snorkling south of the hotel. At one tiny beach we visited, we enjoyed being in the water with the company of two sea turtles. After spending time exploring the beaches, it was always so nice to come back to the hotel to friendly greetings and the pool area to relax. The FS staff takes care of all your needs. This is what I call a vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Resort Maui is #1 resort in Hawaii and the Americas!”
Reviews.Author: Andre C
Reviews.Content: FS Maui is the best resort anywhere, this is a true paradise! We spent 9 days with our 2 children 7 and 9 as returning guests and had the most wonderful time imaginable. We did not leave the resort spending quality time all day long at the amazing resort. The people at the FS treat you like you are part of a family or Hawaiiing Ohana, you truly feel special just being here with the most wonderful people to experinece all day long. Typical day is 6:30am sunrise walk and stroll on the gorgeous Wailea Beach, maybe some mediatation or yoga with wonderful instructors, reserving your favorite poolside cabana at 7am with the super-friendly pool attendants. Then proceed to the fantastic gym and workout facilities that make long workouts pass in a tropical luxury setting, enjoy the cold towels and refreshing drinks. Must have a relaxing breakfast at the Duo patio restaurant which must be the best buffet anywhere in Wailea or Maui and a great value for the exceptional offerings that change daily. The kids/keiki's loved the chocolate croissants and the malasadas or local donuts anf guava juice. Macademia nut pancakes with lillikoi syrup were a hit too. Hang around the many pools and then let the kids enjoy some funtime in the kids luxurious playroom with pool tables and ping pong when they need a break from long swims. Go set-up on the beach for some quality snorkelling and boogie-boarding on perfect waves and by 12 noon the wind shifts and the most beautiful breeze and winds come along to cool you off while enjoying the brilliant sunshine. Wander back to the pool to enjoy some gourmet poolside lunches and drinks in the cabana, the daily fresh fish offerings were so nummy. Afternoons it is time to wind down and have a drink up at the amazing adult serenity/infinity pool, fun to sit there and sip a cocktail or cold longboard draft with lemon, so relaxing. Enjoy sunsets and tradewinds from your 5 start hotel lanai and room before heading downstairs to Duo or Spago for world class dining. Dinners at Spagos are unreal and the sunsets are always spectacular. The wine list is tops too. Moonlight walk after dinner on the beach with the waves lapping over your feet is unforgettable and your day is done to re-do all over the next day anyway you choose. Enjoy paradise at the Maui FS!

Reviews.Title: “third visit”
Reviews.Author: lwmjr
Reviews.Content: this is a great hotel. great service. big rooms. we went in august, was packed. the hotel a bit strained under the numbers. a wait to get seats by the adults only infinity pool. a wait to sit in the bar. suggest, go in june, great weather, less crowded. small observation; a sense they cut back a little bit; seemed a few less folks working the pools/beaches; small sized coffee cups for early morning [jet lagged] coffee in the lobby. guess a sign of economic times.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect as expected from 4 Seasons”
Reviews.Author: ks_bazhenova
Reviews.Content: Amazing getaway! - perfect service, good rooms, fresh & tasty food, great choice of wines, perfect spa services - everything you would expect from 4 seasons. The best place in the hotel is serenity pool: underwater music, comfortable sun beds, cabanas available for rent, great beach bar & waiter service, refreshing towels, complimentary ice cream, aftersun cream, fresh fruit, etc - are brought for the comfort of the guests. But you have to arrive early to book a sun bed in a good location! Spa treatments are very good as well - I do recommend to try.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: ilviaggiatorebravo
Reviews.Content: i think this hotel is fantastic i went in 38 people all of this family and this was fantastic.this hotel is cool the service is perfect,room service too, all is super good.this hotel is big and is not smal my sun lost in think hotel so is very big i think is the breakfast is very good. will recome back next years and don't lose your children

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Tmerc10
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable service, extremely kid friendly. Wonderful rooms with excellent amenities. Truly memorable vacation. Will definitely be back Must do: oceanside massage

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York City, New York, USA
Reviews.Title: “This hotel was disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Travel3264
Reviews.Content: We had heard such positive feedback on this hotel -- from others on this site and from friends who had also stayed here, but this hotel did not live up to expectations. We stayed here for our honeymoon and, even though we booked with a travel agent and specified it was our honeymoon, we were given a terrible room. They had said they had "upgraded" us, but we had a room that overlooked the service entrance -- and our room reeked of diesel fuel from the trucks stopping by to make deliveries. When we complained, we were told that the hotel was booked and they could move us to a nicer room the next night -- which they did. That room was nice, but nothing incredible. The real problem with the hotel is that it was filled with people who were there for some corporate retreat -- people who had won some kind of sales contest. These people flooded every area of the hotel and were boorish and incredibly loud. Even though we woke up very early to secure chairs at the coveted serenity pool (which was a beautiful area), these sales contest people were also there -- and did not understand that the area was for people who wanted quiet. Not only did the talk incessantly, they often shouted across the pool area. Hotel management did nothing to enforce the rules of the serenity pool -- but instead offered to move us to a cabana in the main pool area. We went to the Four Seasons looking for a romantic honeymoon, but that was not what we received at the hotel. If you are thinking of going there for your honeymoon, you should check to make sure there won't be any corporate retreats going on at the same time!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Heaven”
Reviews.Author: spotdog
Reviews.Content: What can I add about this hotel? It's all been said before...sheer heaven. Spent 3 nights here to celebrate my 50th birthday and loved every minute of our stay. Property is beautiful and staff amazing (well, with one unhelpful exception but he doesn't dampen my feelings about this top notch staff). I could have spent weeks being pampered at the serenity pool. The staff there work so hard at making sure you enjoy your stay. They're just great! A happy birthday welcome cake and other goodies as well as a card greeted me on arrival. Dinner at Ferraro's was lovely - terrace a delight and staff so pleasant....and the food was wonderful. I'd spent a year planning my birthday trip and I am so glad I chose this hotel. Just wish I'd booked several more nights rather than splitting my stay. I wouldn't stay anywhere else on Maui - the cost is worth it! Book with a preferred travel agent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Service, Duo and Spagos Top notch”
Reviews.Author: robertrsm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with 18 family members for 9 days and had a great time. We did have 3 personal private dinners. Two of them at DUO and one at Ferarros. Will say the crew at DUO is the best. Merritt the waiter treated us like Ohana, and even though we had 5 kids accomodated the dinners perfectly. Ferraros unfortunaley was not as accomodating. Lea the waitress would not even allow my wife to switch from Ceasar salad with Anchovy to regular salad. We were shocked with the amount of money our father in law paid for everyones room and the 3 private dinners for 18 people, that at least the salad type was "negotiable", but i guess not. Besides this, the service was impeccable, from the bell men and valet crew, to the housekeeping team. They all treated us so well. Once again you get what you pay for (except Ferraros). Great fitness center, and the kids really liked the rec room, and the day camp.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: London8008
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at the Four Seasons, from the moment we arrived we definitely felt a great sense of warmth from the everyone involved. The location is fantastic and there are lots to do at the resort. The beach is simply wonderful and the poolside service is perfect. Regularly water is topped up and treats are offered from fresh fruit to popsicles. Definitely a great place for kids. There is an adult pool which is also a sight to be seen. The breakfast was very filling with lots of variety although a tad on the expensive side. We ate at Spago which was a wonderful treat and a great evening.

Reviews.Title: “Service beyond our expectations”
Reviews.Author: etan92612
Reviews.Content: We stayed at five hotels during our Hawaii vacation. Four Seasons was by far the best experience. It was just me and my husband, no kids. We felt so pampered. Everyone seemed to care. It isn't over the top touristy. No luau, staff aren't dressed in brightly colored Aloha shirts, L'Occintane toiletries no mango scented lotion, wonderfully understated Polynesian decor. This property is appealing to both Hawaii locals and mainlanders (no plate lunch). Outstanding service and unexpected pleasant surprises. When we arrived at our room we had a nice presentation of sweets and a bottle of Domaine Carneros from Napa. When we made a restaurant reservation we requested a table out of the wind because I was chilly at night. When we arrived at our table they had a shawl draped on my chair. On our departure the valet put two gift bags of jelly beans and a nice farewell note in our cup holders. There were countless other things that people such as Sari at the front desk, Darrett who made up our beach chairs in the morning, Jenn the oh so pleasant server at Ferraro's and Rodrigo who set up our comfy pool chairs and served us drinks poolside made this a great experience. Families with kids might prefer the Grand Wailea next door (we stayed there too) but this is definitely the place if you leave the kids home.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: LVgirlLasVegas
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons Maui can not be beat! Our third year in a row and our vacations just keep getting better. We couldn't imagine staying anywhere else on Maui. If you enjoy having your every need catered to, then look no further!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in the world. Perfect, in every way.”
Reviews.Author: x35109
Reviews.Content: I'm a fairly critical person and I'm here to say this is the best hotel in the world. Top notch service, great comfort, great facilities and good restaurants (although restaurants aren't PERFECT like the resort). Main considerations: 1) Serenity pool - swim up bar, NO KIDS!!!!! (no one under 21 allowed). Has an infinity edge pool looking out at ocean with great sunset view. Bar tenders at the serenity pool alone are enough to make me go back to this place every year. 2) Service, yes, its a 4 seasons but this is the best 4 seasons. The bar tender was telling me that 4 seasons employees from all over the world come there to train b/c its their highest revenue grossing hotel (and its clear why when you're there). 3) Food options are good. Spago is a Wolfgang Puck restaurant (saw Oprah there one night last week when I was there). Ferraros is good italian (limited menu options for dinner... BUT AMAZING lunch). Serenity pool has its own menu, Duo is great for breakfast and for dinner. 4) Great beach, great ocean out front, great snorkling on property. Some of the most exciting marine life I've ever seen snorkling has been outside of this resort just heading out into the water in front of the hotel and sticking my face in the wtaer (saw eagle ray, turtles, tons of fish, octopus, etc.) 5) One thing I will say, the spa here is ok, but not the best. I'm not really a big spa guy, but my wife says this one is good, but not as good as places that focus on spa access. Just an FYI. This is the best in the world, go there or you will regret it. If you don't go there you won't understand what I'm saying until you do end up going and then you will kick yourself for not having gone earlier.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service and luxury of course...loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Ashley1Ocampo
Reviews.Content: We took our "annual family summer vacation" to the Maui Four Seasons and it was fabulous. 1st thing, let's get the price conversation out of the way...it is definitely expensive! I was well aware of this going into it as I have stayed at other Four Seasons and this is Hawaii so fair warning to the budget travelers this is not the spot for you even if you get a really cheap rate on the room you need to be prepared to spend quite a bit. Also if you do not like the be around the high roller crowd it might intimidate some people. No free Internet, no self parking, sodas are $5 cocktails are at least $15 and up. Nothing is free and nothing is inexpensive. You will spend at very least $500 a day on meals and I think that is a pretty modest estimate we are wine drinkers so it was more like $600 per day. Now the good stuff...The service and staff is of course immaculate which is what the four Seasons is renowned for. The restaurants were really good especially Duo, the steak house, they have a raw bar a couple days a week that is outstanding, fresh lobster tail, mussels, oysters, shrimp, clams. The breakfast is great and different everyday they have an omelet/ pancake station that is to die for. The pool cabanas are first come first serve. You must get out there early in the am to reserve yours (before 8 am). They will hold the cabanas for an hour at the time and for two hours between 12-2 pm for lunch. This is the best part, get a cabana with a great view of the ocean. Our kids are old enough that we went up to the adult pool a couple of times and left them to swim at the main pool. The adult "Serenity"pool is an infinity with a swim up bar, great Jacuzzis but be aware this area is more for rest and relaxation so if you have had a lot to drink and want to take the party up there I would recommend keeping it down. The good news is that for people who don't want to be around screaming kids and loud partiers this adult pool is certainly a retreat! This hotel has a fantastic reef just there off the beach where you can snorkel and see sea turtles, eels, fish, everything! My son and husband went diving both in front of the hotel and out on an excursion and the hotel was the best. Rooms are fantastic, we had an ocean view double. Housekeeping is great, anything you want you can get as they are very accommodating of course. Must do: Road to Hana, a very scenic drive where you encounter waterfalls and black pebble beaches-don't take any black stones home with you-it will be tempting but it brings bad luck! Just rent a car (the hotel can help with this) and get a map! It is absolutely beautiful you will not regret it takes about 6-8 hours so start early. Mama's Fish House: touristy and very $$$ but worth it especially if you have kids, great food and it is kind of a Maui institution of sorts.

Reviews.Title: “BEST hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Sheryl M
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in our stay was a wonderful experience! Our room, pools, restaurants, service was outstanding. Beautiful beach as well. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: oehler_melissa
Reviews.Content: The new pool is great with excellent views. The cliffside private areas to sunbathe are fabulous. The rooms and restaurants are great. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “great property”
Reviews.Author: lonelyapart
Reviews.Content: the property is awesome. It's true. But pay your attention the time of visiting this wonderful resort. in August there were full of families with children. The services was very good except two things: 1) the bed linens were not changed during our 4 nights (instead of my putting a shell on the bed - the sign for housekeeping to change them, and their rule to change the linens after 3rd night 2) for the whole our staying we was not provided with extra gel-douche. So we used all the soaps in the bathroom. During check out they gave us a discount in the amount of one day breakfast. But we preferred better to have good services before than after staying. All other services and amenities were brilliant. We liked the massages in the spa, near the pool area (free cold towels, water, ice etc.). The food quality unfortunately is not extra tasty, just average.

Reviews.Title: “luxurious but no free WIFI”
Reviews.Author: dubin7
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderful and the staff is superior. I have 2 complaints. When you pay as much as you do to stay here, WIFI and parking should be included, especially WIFI. really tacky to charge for that.

Reviews.Title: “Another Paradis on Earth ...I'd be back in a flash any time!”
Reviews.Author: mjw044
Reviews.Content: Huge double room plus all amenities , ocean view, unforgetable experience complimentary kayaking (pity I only did it on my last day), beautiful, peaceful, food too good, memorable ...

Reviews.Title: “MOST AMAZING ROMANTIC EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: chasingelsol
Reviews.Content: I am so spoiled after staying here! My fiance surprised me by bringing me to the four seasons in maui and then on top of taking me to this luxurious hotel he proposed to me over a sunset dinner that he coordinated with the staff. It was the most wonderful experience from arrival to departure! The staff was so friendly and helpful, the room was gorgeous, and the grounds are breathtaking. Almost everything is complimentary and the staff walks around all day freshening your water cups and bringing goodies such as muffins, ice cream, fruit, cucumber for your eyes, etc. The adult infinite pool feels like you're in a dream and the lay out beds are extremely comfortable. I can't wait to come back here...hopefully next year to kick off our honey moon!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Excellence”
Reviews.Author: rainman2000
Reviews.Content: I spent a special couple birthday week at the Four Seasons Maui. It was just fantastic. Beautiful resort. Beautiful pools. Beautiful beaches. Fantastic restaurants. And impeccable service. The most impressive thing about this hotel was the training of the staff to make the guest feel welcomed and well taken care of. It was really great. We did have one negative experience that was not fully resolved, unfortunately, that stuck with us for a few days. We had a partial ocean view room on the top floor of the hotel. The room was fantastic, we enjoyed the balcony, and we preferred to stay there. However this was an adjoining room with a door leading to the connected room next door. In this other room was a younger family with several very loud children. They were very noisy screaming at 11PM at night, and also again by 7AM. For a romantic +$600/night birthday stay, the screaming kids were pretty much unwelcomed... The connecting doors did not provide enough sound proofing in such a way that it felt like the kids were in the same room as us. Having kids myself, I know how they can be...but it really did affect the ambiance of the room, and made us uncomfortable given that it seemed the children would never settle down. So after day 2 when it was apparent that the family next door were neither leaving or would keep their kids in line, we decided to ask to be moved. We were promptly moved to another building but it was on the ground floor, with no ocean view. :-( In fact we felt we had to take a lesser room to avoid the noise. If we had received a similar room, or even a slight upgrade, we would have felt the dis-accommodation was OK...but this really was a penalty for having to rectify the problem. It was a pain to move, so we just took what we got and went on with our stay. But I think the Four Seasons could have done better. The Four Seasons made the stay wonderful with everything else, but the resolution on the room was not as good as it could have been. We will stay at Four Seasons again...and keep our fingers crossed that we will not have a disruption like this again.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible experience”
Reviews.Author: Bdwfe53
Reviews.Content: Everything was far and above our expectations, even for a four seasons resort. The only complaint I have was the in room WiFi service which was not anywhere near the standard it should be, But hey,..,.. who needs wifi in paradise anyway???

Reviews.Title: “Best Honeymoon Location on the planet!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lindsey310
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I came to the four seasons for our honeymoon July 31-Aug8th 2011. We were so spoiled from the second we stepped out of our car. We were greeted with fresh flower leis and iced tea. We checked in and were upgraded to a garden view suite which was so luxurious! The four seasons goes above and beyond to ensure your every need is catered to! We had champagne waiting for us in our room and the amenities just kept on coming, there is no wonder at all they are the only hotel on the island to have both the AAA 5 diamond award and the fobes magazine 5 diamond award! I didnt want to leave, in fact I told the lady I want to live here, she said yes its a very nice island, I said no, I want to live at the four seasons!!! The place is very pricey but worth every single penny! The serenity pool is amazing, the main pool and the beach are great!!! The resort is the cleanest I have ever seen, they clean your room 2 times a day! I surprised my husband with a 50 minute hot stone massage by the ocean, worth every penny and he was so relaxed after, he couldnt stop raving about it and he said it was the best massage he ever had! We ate at Duo and Ferraros. Wasnt a big fan of duo and loved Ferraros. We dont mind paying for good quality food but I think for the price, the food at Duo was sub par. There is only one issue I can think of: Its going to be very difficult to stay at other properties that arent the Four Seasons, they created 2 monsters out of my husband and I, we are now in love with the Four Seasons!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Another scintillating experience!”
Reviews.Author: ilikeniceplaces
Reviews.Content: Most notably, this resort had terrific professional service as literally each staff member we encountered was warm, said hello and gladly gave assistance. The word 'professional' is key; the polished demeanor of everyone from the front desk to the bellhops to the staff at Snorkels (board/kayak/snorkel etc. rental shop) to the dining staff to the cabana staff was remarkably consistent. I felt so relaxed and supported at this truly great honeymoon destination. Other major positives - Spago was excellent; the breakfast dining at Duo was amazing every morning; activities were well publicized, multitudinous and therefore easy to use; and the cabanas (view, waitstaff, comfort, accessibility). They could probably work on the food at Duo for dinner just a bit, but this is a minor complaint. I had forgotten until I wrote this review. So, if you have a choice between going to another nice hotel and going here for a briefer stay, choose this spot. This being said - you'll have to spend some extra cash at the hotel to truly enjoy your stay and the convenience of the facilities, so if it's a stretch just to stay here, you may not have the experience we did.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort! Worth every penny.”
Reviews.Author: Lizjaneh
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Maui. We began at the Hyatt and moved to the Four Seasons. What a wonderful place to stay. They do it right... from the fresh leis upon arrival to the jellybeans in the car at checkout. The poolside service is second to none. The kids camp was fun for our 4 and 6 year old (babysitter had to be present for our four year old) and we thoroughly enjoyed the serenity pool. We will be back! If you have an opportunity to splurge on the four seasons, go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: JandA28
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to spend your honeymoon. The service was just incredible as was attention to detail. The little touches were exceptional- from the little muffins that came round the pool every morning to the ice lollies that came round every afternoon. Everyone is made to feel very special. The serenity pool (for adults only) was fabulous as were the restaurants. Everytime we left the front gate of the hotel we regretted it and wondered why we ever left! The spa was beautiful and I had the most amazing massage I've ever had there. We just loved it.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Calderwood
Reviews.Content: I thought the nicest hotel ever was the Grande Bretagne in Athens, but I have a new favorite!!!!! Expensive, but worth every penny! The spa was so nice we showered there every day after the beach before going up to our room. Private beach, unbelievable pools and as usual with Four Seasons, the service was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Cant write enough about how amazing this place is!!”
Reviews.Author: GD71
Reviews.Content: Probably the best place I have ever stayed at. Went on our honeymoon and we wish we could have stayed longer. Room service breakfast on the balcony of our room was awesome the first day. Adult pool and pool bar is amazing. All the restaurants were great too. Expensive but definitely worth it. Can't wait to go back again someday.

Reviews.Title: “Expectation met. First stay in Maui and the paradise of the island was complemented nicely by our stay at the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stephen3030
Reviews.Content: Choose Maui and this hotel to celebrate a birthday. Stayed at the hotel for 10 days and the family never had a better time. The location of the hotel is perfect and we found ourselves in the pool almost as much as the ocean. The restaurants are nice but as all have stated pricey. Duo is great for breakfast. Do yourself a favor and go to Matteos for dinner, the pizza is not bad. The shops at Waliea are nice and the hotel offers a ride. Beyond that not much else is around but who needs it. Get up early get a cabana and call it a day with poolside service

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable service for most of the trip”
Reviews.Author: cmc_in_ny
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Four Seasons for four days at the end of July. With the exception of one day, the poolside service was out of this world. Our first day, Freddo made it seem like he was our personal pool attendant, checking in frequently but not intrusively. The next day we had some other staff members at the pool and by the end of the day I remarked to my husband that the pool attendants wouldn't take notice of us if our hair were on fire in our pool chairs! I had to walk to the towel hut myself to order food and drink and to close out our check (put away your hankies, my friends, it was only a 25-foot walk), and just as we were leaving the pool attendant came by with another copy of our bill to sign, because I guess he was paying attention, after all. That experience was the only reason I gave the resort four instead of five stars. The day after that, though, we had great service once again. We ate dinner at all three restaurants on the property, and they were all top-notch in terms of food and service, and one night we went off-property to eat at Capische, which suffered by comparison with the Four Seasons restaurants. The resort seemed pretty full when we stayed there, and there were a LOT of families, which surprised me because while I would say the hotel catered to children with kids' menus and some activities, the pool was not large and the stretch of beach was crowded and also not that large. We have children of our own but had foisted them off onto my in-laws, so the noise of children by the pool was not that troublesome to us; we did try to get seats at the kid-free Serenity Pool and weren't able to, and apparently those chairs get spoken for not long after the pool opened at 7am. If you don't feel like getting up that early, I recommend putting your name on the waitlist. We put ourselves on the wait-list (with no guarantees by the staff that we would get seats), and we did get called for openings at the Serenity Pool but we were pretty well settled by the family pool at that point and declined to move. We got a couples' massage in one of the Oceanside huts, and we agreed that we had each just had one of the best massages EVER. There are also some massage services available poolside, which we did use the first day and we thought it was very enjoyable. My one regret was that I would have liked to get more of a feel for Hawaii while we were there, my first (and so far only) trip out there. The food and service were outstanding, but it could have been a Four Seasons anywhere. For first-time visitors I would recommend venturing out for some excursions, like maybe a Luau, the Haleakala bike excursion (which we did and I highly recommend), to get more of a "taste of Hawaii." One final story to give credit to the concierge desk: I asked the concierge for help printing my boarding pass to return home, and it wasn't that easy to print it, since I had booked through one airline but the flight was operated by another. The concierge tried both airlines' websites but was unsuccessful, then called both airlines, and finally got the double-secret confirmation code that allowed her to print my boarding pass. After dealing with all that on my behalf, which would have raised my blood pressure dangerously high, she then pleasantly thanked ME for MY patience while she resolved that issue! The Four Seasons is really something else.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it! You will not be disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Doug2011_11
Reviews.Content: After our visits to two of the other islands, we wanted to end our time in Hawai'i on Maui with total relaxation. The Four Seasons was the perfect choice. Our stay was incredible from registration through departure. We did not want to leave. Highlights include staying on the club floor, the serenity pool, spa treatments, the wonderful staff and barrage of services to enjoy. We did not realize the true meaning of vacation until now.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent, Sublime and Delicious”
Reviews.Author: PadmaTravel
Reviews.Content: Ahhh Maui -- island paradise. At the Four Seasons everyone is happy all the time -- and the staff are kind, lovely and go above and beyond! It is worth every penny to have a magnificent adventure in Hawaii. The concierge made wonderful reservations for us -- and we had great tables always. The Maui Under Sea Adventures dive shop next door to the hotel was amazing. If you are considering scuba diving -- and are staying at the hotel -- look no further. Blaze - the manager rocks! And the operation is efficient, clean and runs so smoothly -- and the guys are super nice. Take a shower after scuba, nice warm towel and water from the shop -- deluxe. The dive masters are focused, intelligent and attentive to service -- and they know how to have fun too! Sleeping at night was heavenly... We felt so blessed to have been there. Go and enjoy every moment -- everyone there does!

Reviews.Title: “A good solid "A"”
Reviews.Content: When you read the reviews on here and the most common recurring complaint is a long walk from the elevator to a guestroom, that pretty much says it all. We stayed at Hualalai a few years ago and loved it. I remember talking to people there (mostly honeymooners) who were on the circuit - i.e., Four Seasons Maui, then Four Seasons Hualalai, and all seemed to say Hualalai was way better. So we were reluctant to go to Maui instead of back to Hualalai. But they're both fantastic. Totally different, but fantastic. Four Seasons Maui is less nature-y, less secluded and it's a bigger resort. (If my husband were writing this, he would want to point out that the major advantage of Hualalai is the gym, lap pool and tennis courts which blow Maui's facilities away.) Back to Maui -- at first we were disappointed there wasn't more seating at the 'serenity pool', but we found plenty of other quiet places to sit and this wasn't an issue at all. Yes, people get up early to get prime seating at the pools, but there are more than enough decent (and shaded) places to sit. If you want to sleep in you'll be fine. The pool attendants were great and anticipated all your needs (including some needs you don't know you have, like rice krispie treat afternoon snacks). Spa was great, and nothing weird like 'signature foot bath rituals' that waste ten minutes of massage time. Lots of stuff going on at the resort -- yoga on the beach every morning, kayaking, paddleboarding, snorkeling, lectures on eco-friendly cosmetics (huh?) -- most if not all of it included. All very family friendly. I thought the crowd would be more Real Housewives of BH/Ari Gold-like, but maybe they're all in Cabo. In general the staff was great but not overly solicitous, and this can be a hard balance to strike. When you go for a run in the morning, they greet you with water and gatorade upon your return. The room looked like the rooms at the Ritz in Beijing (again, huh?) - i.e., nothing location specific about the decor - but there was a huge mirror cleverly placed to reflect the ocean so the decor fade into the background and it's all about the view, at any angle (unless you're looking at the flatscreen). The bathroom is huge but has no windows (am I the only person who cares about this?). We were graciously upgraded from a partial ocean view room to a prime ocean view room. Two [petty] criticisms. First, they only have one person making omelettes/pancakes/waffles at the breakfast buffet and the line gets really long. Second, you have to pay for wireless. I think $10/day for unlimited devices. You're paying $800+/night. It makes me want to steal $10/day worth of towels and L'Occitane soaps. Would be hard to stay anywhere else in Maui after this.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay for Maui lovers”
Reviews.Author: MiaPianist
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many hotels in Maui, but this one is our favorite. It has a gogeous view, great beach and fabulous restaurans. The rooms are nice and comfortable with wonderful. We like the decor of this hotel. Unlike some of the Maui hotels, this one is not too noisy or overly crowded. We feel we were treated nicely by the hotel stuff. The concierge was veryhelpful suggesteing great eateries around the hotel etc.. I highly recommned it to anyone who would like to make your vacation extra special in Maui and it is worth paying the price.

Reviews.Title: “Most amazing hotel ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Marxpro
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel!! It was just as amazing as ever. My favorite part was the Serenity pool. It was wonderful. I can't imagine staying at any other property in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat this service!”
Reviews.Author: Cozmix2000
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our honeymoon in Maui and The Big Island. We stayed at the four seasons for both legs of our trip. The service can not be beat at the four seasons Wailea! Poolside service is incredible! If you want the adult's only serenity pool, be sure to wake up early (6:30am) to grab a seat, otherwise you go on a waiting list until 4pm. You can still enjoy the pool without a seat-it's just not as fun. It was so nice to be called Mr. and Mrs. everywhere we went in the resort from check in to the 3 restaurants. Everyone greeted you by your name. The food is expensive, but also great. Can't go wrong with a spectacular meal at Spago's! There are also many complimentary activities such as beachside yoga and outrigger canoe.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Facilities, Delicious Restaurants”
Reviews.Author: AJMC791
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons Maui for 1 week, and had a wonderful vacation. The pools are great, there are plenty of secluded and "in the action" lounge chairs, and there is a great infinity pool/adult area for those people who truly want to relax. We took advantage of the spa (where I had truly the best facial I can ever remember), the workout facility (very new cardio equipment), and the 3 restaurants. Our favourite for dinner was Duo, thought both Ferraro and Spago were fantastic as well. The breakfast buffet at the hotel was outstanding, and our lunches at Ferraro consisted of really great food and a beautiful location overlooking the ocean. Our room was a good size, with a great balcony, and a very sizable washroom. We will certainly be back

Reviews.Title: “Great, as always”
Reviews.Author: Show66
Reviews.Content: Made our 3rd stay at the FS Maui in December with our 5 year old son. As always, it was one of the highlights of our trip. Son loved the Kids for All Ages program and spent the better part of 2 days there, which set up two quiet, peaceful days for Mom & Dad at the serenity pool. I'm generally cost conscious on trips, but I always consider the FS Maui a great value even with the high cost of rooms. We rarely left the resort, spending most of our days at the pool, on the beach, and strolling the areas around the FS.

Reviews.Title: “Been there & wanna move there!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BlumeSingapore
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Four Seasons on Maui on numerous occassions and in my opinion it is one of the best hotels in the world. Fantastic service, great location, incredible atmosphere,... A place you'd simply want to move to. It feels like HOME!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding In Every Way”
Reviews.Author: Dennis0606
