Reviews.Content: Immaculate, outstanding service. Club Room accomodations and concierge service was first class. Restaurants, Spa, pool and beach facilities were excellent. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate luxury best holiday and hotel i have ever had.”
Reviews.Author: steve_islets
Reviews.Content: I was originally planning to stay at the Fairmount next door but my wife twisted my arm to go to the more expensive hotel the Four Seasons-I'm glad i listened to her. When we first arrived we thought we were in paradise until we went to our room. Unfortunately we were given a room on the ground floor above the boiler room of the hotel. There was a constant noise that we could not get rid of which we initially thought was the air conditioning generator but it was not. We had just arrived from London and wanted peace and quiet but this was very annoying. Within 10 minutes the problem had been solved and the assistant manager had moved us to a better room, which was superb. I cannot fault this hotel in anyway at all. I stay in many hotels all over world and without doubt this is one of the finest only the Hilton Calvieleri in Room comes close. The location, rooms, service, staff, beach everything was immaculate. Although expensive it was worth every penny. However the weather was a bit unpredictable at times and after midday the weather was often cloudy but still warm. I will now always consider a Four seasons resort whenever i want a luxurious holiday-nobody can match them. They even have a resort car that will take you to any other restaurant nearby outside of the hotel free of charge !

Reviews.Title: “Four Nights, Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: mhipp
Reviews.Content: I agonized for several months on whether or not to spend the extra money on this hotel and I have to say it was worth every penny. We reserved a garden room but were upgraded to a partial ocean view which was great. I have to say though, that the garden rooms were in very nice areas of the hotel, had nice views, and would have been just fine I am thinking. I looked at where the mountain views were located, and I think that this would have been a disappointment had I spent $500 a night for a room that looked at a parking garage. So, I would spend the extra money on the garden room if those were my two choices. Having said that though, I like to spend time on the lanai in the mornings with coffee and in the evenings for drinks. If you didn't care about that maybe the mountain view would be OK. Everything about this hotel lives up to the other good reviews I have read on Tripadvisor. The staff is very welcoming and it doesn't seemed forced. They genuinely seem to be happy to help make your stay special. It is a testament to the management because good customer service, such as this, has to come from the top down. The thing that I was most impressed with is the placement of the trees,plantings, artwork, and other elements, that all combine to exude a tropical ambiance that isn't forced or overdone... it's just perfect! Everything in the hotel is done in neutral, understated colors and this serves to provide a relaxing beautiful atmosphere. The beds were very comfortable and the large bathrooms were great. I am a traveler that will typically spend $250-$300 per night for a room, so the rates at the Four Seasons were a stretch for me, but as I said at the beginning it was definitely worth it, and I would encourage anyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection! And we have been everywhere ...”
Reviews.Author: PamPlanoTexas
Reviews.Content: We finally made it back to Hawaii after 20 years. We visited Maui and Kauai (just like our honeymoon 20 years ago!). But this time we stayed at Four Seasons Maui and it was so wonderful that it was sad to leave! We booked through WhataHotel which was a brilliant decision. They are a Four Seasons Preferred Provider so we enjoyed an amazing room upgrade. Our enormous ocean front balcony gave us a full view of the pool, ocean, Molikini crater, and also the gardens where we saw weddings taking place. The accommodations were well worth the expense and the staff is second to none. They are over the top accommodating. We have tween-age kids and they know how to treat them ... not like the little ones ... more like teenagers. They enjoyed finding "teen" menus that were a nice bridge in between the kid and adult menus. Food throughout the property was fantastic. Best breakfast buffet anywhere with nice touches like little smoothies that changed daily and they offered to pack extras like chocolate croissants to go for snacking later. And, our fabulous breakfast was included each day, again thanks to WhataHotel. I'll be booking through them again! If you happen to be going to Kauai too (like we did), be warned that there is nothing like the Four Seasons available there. So, I recommend you go to Kauai first so you are not let down with your hotel! Go there first, then move to the ultra-luxurious Four Seasons next. One more food tip - the risotto appetizer at Spago is amazing. And one activity tip -- the scooter snorkeling and/or scooter diving is a lot of fun! And you can go right off the beach at the hotel. Outdoor spa treatment was also a treat - and they happily allowed my daughter to participate which is not always the case (some insist on 16 and up or 18 and up). Our kids donâ€™t enjoy kidsâ€™ clubs, but we all enjoyed their nice game room with billiards, shuffle board, ping pong, fooseball and more. We have traveled all over the Caribbean to many luxury resorts (other favorites include Ritz Grand Cayman, Ritz St. Thomas, Atlantis and many, many more) and this resort has really done everything right. It was great start to finish. We didn't rent a car and they even drove us any time we chose to go off property. There is a nice shopping/dining plaza nearby where we had a good casual meal at Tommy Bahamas. If you are considering this spot - you can't go wrong! And enjoy the perks by booking with WhataHotel. I was a bit unsure because 95% of the time I like to book direct. I called the Four Seasons first to make sure it was legit ... and they confirmed that it was. And, Greg provided personal service via email every step of the way ... including our personal confirmation direct from the Four Seasons. It was a great experience and I look forward to booking with them again, and I look forward to returning to this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but do not reserve a mountain side room!”
Reviews.Author: Djkin
Reviews.Content: Very much enjoyed our stay. Our only complaint was the room. Picture on their website shows a beautiful mountain side view yet our view was of the parking garage. If you stood on a chair and stretched you could see a small view of the mountain. We complained and after one night they moved us to a garden view....much better! No one wants to pay four season room prices to wake up to car alarms, doors slamming and a view of concrete. If you've booked a room here make sure it's not mountainside!

Reviews.Title: “Adult serenity pool is a great enhancement”
Reviews.Author: TacomaTravel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned to the Four Seasons for the first time since our honeymoon in June 2008 and had an even better experience. The adult serenity pool was built after our first visit and I must say that it has greatly improved an already outstanding resort hotel, especially for couples traveling without children. I guess the downside is that you have to get there around 6:30 in the morning to get chairs for the day when the pool opens at 7. They will hold your chairs for you for an hour, two hours between 11 and 2. The beach is excellent as well. This time we took advantage of the outrigger program, snorkeling, and kayaking and really enjoyed it. All in all, just a great, relaxing experience. The staff is great of course. We reserved the least expensive mountainside room and they upgraded us to a huge ocean view prime suite with a full separate living room and two bathrooms. We were blown away by this generosity. I suppose I can find some things to complain about. You have to walk a long way back to your room. The poolside drinks are $13 or $15 but extremely weak. The lounge chairs by the main pool should be replaced pretty soon in my opinion. They just are not four seasons quality. Also, the pools didn't look to be as clear as they should have been, though this may be a function of the fact that they are saline pools. These are pretty nitpicky and do not detract from the overall experience though. You can't really go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: JKAMA
Reviews.Content: One of our favoriter places to go! All the staff make you feel welcome, know you by name, and are truly glad you are there. Chad, our waiter at Duo for breakfast was the bewst - just love him! Kalua and Fredo at the pool were my best friends!!!! Love them all. Can't wait to go again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome accommodations for families with little ones!”
Reviews.Author: buncolady
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with a four year old and 6 month old twins. They brought us 2 cribs, 2 high chairs and 2 swings to our room. There was gifts in the room for the babies and 4 yr. old. The pool attendants brought us a travel yard for the babies to sleep in and pointed out the cabana's that can close if the sun became an issue. They brought around popsicles, skewers of pineapple, mini muffins etc. Everyone was so nice. It made our vacation!

Reviews.Title: “This property is clean, crisp and professional in every way.”
Reviews.Author: Geog50
Reviews.Content: I know why I love Four Seasons. From the valet when you arrive to the room with special touches for our children to the bartenders in the lobby, everyone greets you with a smile and makes themselves available for anything you may need. A must return for us!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing!”
Reviews.Author: dlm03
Reviews.Content: Serenity pool for adults has an infinity pool with a view you cannot miss. First trip with my six month old granddaughter. Hotel had everything you could possibly need. Ate at all three restaurants and they were terrific. Staff exhibits a care and concern for your comfort. Property is impeccable!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we've ever stayed in!!”
Reviews.Author: stp4dwf
Reviews.Content: From start to finish, the 4 Seasons knows how to pamper their guests and make you feel so special. The service at the adult pool was amazing all the way to the valets who helped with every question. The conceriege was so helpful both prior to and during our trip. The food was sensational at Ferraro's and Duo. The room are huge, beautifully decorated and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Compares”
Reviews.Author: streltsy
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Maui is the best place to stay on the island and perhaps in all of Hawaii. We have been here several times and have never had any complaints. The service is outstanding from the room to the pool to the beach. They will trip over each other here to get you a packet of sugar. The bottom line is they want you to be extremely happy staying here and it shows. The staff here is the best trained staff of any hotel we have ever stayed at. It is incredible. The resort amenities here are unparalleled. The recent addition of the Serenity Pool (for adults only) is out of this world. We stayed as a couple this time to experience the Serenity Pool and it was incredible. However, we have stayed at this resort several times with our young kids, and the Four Seasons does kids better than any other resort in Maui. We have stayed in most of the high end ones so I am comfortable saying this. If you have kids, this is the place to be. If you don't have kids, you can find seclusion here as well. They perform an incredible balancing act here. We didn't stay here when we first starting visiting Maui hotels because of the price, but it IS worth it. If you are considering a high-end resort in Maui, spend the extra couple hundred a night to spring for the Four Seasons. You cannot be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Our Dream Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: EB52811
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fabulous and didn't disappoint us in anyway. We arrived and got upgraded to a partial ocean view suite and had a bottle of champagne waiting for us in the room form the GM of the hotel. They definitely take care of anything you want and everything you didn't know you wanted. We loved it and wouldn't stay anywhere else on the island!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: 4sunnyskies
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most beautiful hotels with 5 star service. Every staff member we encountered was top notch. Whatever our request was, they met it with a great attitude. From the valet, to the front desk, to the staff at the restaurants, to room service, to the great guys down at the beach, to the poolside staff....just an amazing vacation with our kids. We did not want to leave and cannot wait to go back! Thank you Four Seasons for a perfect vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect from start to finish.”
Reviews.Author: LondonsSweetTooth
Reviews.Content: The are not enough superlatives to accurately describe our stay at this hotel. The staff are absolutely fabulous and obviously care about the vacation experience of their guests. To the excellent team at the dive shop (especially Mark, who was a brilliant guide for our snorkel safari and scooter snorkels) to concierge services, to front of house, to room keeping, to the restuarant staff and the outrigger canoe team, than you for making this the best hotel experience I have ever had. Sure, it's not cheap, but it is worth every penny. The only drawback is that the resort is so good, you won't want to leave it to see the rest of maui. LST.

Reviews.Title: “Benchmark by which to judge everything else”
Reviews.Author: Margofam
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 nights with 4 and 7 year old kids. Impeccable service, surprisingly good value if consider kids club free (but kids need to be over 5 else need to hire a babysitter), beautiful rooms, great restaurants. Only challenge was getting up at 6:30am to reserve good spot at adults only pool but then discovered this was the best time on island to be up and abut anyway. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “four seasons service”
Reviews.Author: wilbury29
Reviews.Content: Great service. Lovely hotel. Room was right at the back of the hotel, overlooking the golf green, which was not ideal but the staff and service more than made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “The FOUR SEASONS was 5 STAR!!”
Reviews.Author: kenarsen
Reviews.Content: We were booked at the Grand Wailea (GW) next door and after 1 night switched to this property. It honestly was night and day and our experience was amazing. The service at this hotel was over the top and the staff anticipated our every need. In the mornings we would go on a long walk and when we would arrive back to the front of the hotel the bellman would greet us with a cold towel and water. While at the adult pool (which is incredible) they staff would come around hourly with fresh lemonade, fruit, aloe vera and ice water. Most people think this is fluff and your paying extra for all of this but our room rate at the 4Seasonas was $85 less per night than at the GWailea. The size and accessibility of the property was great and super manageable and you could get around this property very quickly and easily. The rooms were awesome and the beds were impossible to get out of in the morning and included a "turn down" service with fresh towels, slippers and little treats every night. We ended up eating at all of the restaurants and nothing but good things to say. When planning my trip I bounced back and forth from the 4Seasons to the GW and ended up picking the wrong hotel. I wish I would have know what I know now prior to booking. Luckily we were able to get out of our GW reservation without a penalty and ended up extending our trip from 8 days to 12 days. The only negatives I could find about this property would be for breakfast you really had only 1 option and it was kind of pricey and the chairs at the adult pool would be booked by the early am. What we did was put our name on the list for chairs and head to the beach and the staff would call our cell phone when our spot opened up. I would recommend this property to anyone that wants to be treated like royalty. The hotel is child friendly but if you have a large family and want to keep the kids busy I would also check out the GW. Hope this helps. KA

Reviews.Title: “Not as perfect as everyone says.”
Reviews.Author: earnestsubi
Reviews.Content: I had my wedding at the Four Seasons Resort in Maui and we had about 75 guests and ended up spending about $75k just on the wedding alone, that a grand a head, yet they did not upgrade our room, in fact, some of our guests that were staying at the resort had a bigger room than ours! We got a cabana at the serenity pool and were almost shooed out of there because some members of our party were having a conversation. Overall, I felt like we were constantly being ragged and nagged on by the staff. I do not think I will go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay! Beautiful Resort.”
Reviews.Author: MFJ60
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time there. There is so much to do at or near the resort. The staff does everything possible to ensure you have a great stay. They said the hotel was completely sold out, yet there was still chairs available at the pools, although the prime locations were taken early (overlooking the ocean, and at the serenity pool). Although it is expensive, we felt like we did get a good value for the money spent. Highly recommend Ferraro's, if you are in the Wailea area.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation and activities can be had at the luxurious Four Seasons Maui at Wailea.”
Reviews.Author: hahnje
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons has something for everyone. We did it all! We relaxed on the beach under an umbrella while listening to the surf. We also did the morning yoga class on the beach. My daughter and I had facials and took advantage of two complementary add-on treatments (it seems that there are specials everyday). You should go early and sit in the eucalyptus steam room. During our stay, the surf got stronger as the day went on. Watch the flags; red flag means it is a strong surf. Every day the beach guys had to rescue a guest from getting slammed into the lava rocks on the south end of the beach. We rented boogey boards and enjoyed them by staying in the middle of the beach. Plan on all your water activities early in the day and schedule your spa treatments in the afternoon. Since we are from the midwest, getting up early was not a problem. The mornings are the best for jogging/walking on the beach path. We snorkeled (1 hour free/day) and paddle boarded when the surf was still not so strong. The nights are quiet in Maui so going to bed at 9pm suited us just fine. The 6th floor roof-top tennis courts are nice. The surface is nice even for those of us that have knee problems. The hotel provides complementary rackets and balls. We scheduled 6:30 court time and the court was already shaded. Schedule the outrigger canoe (complementary) before your trip 7 or 7:45am. This is a MUST-DO activity and the canoe will fit a family of 4 plus the two staff members. We were able to do the activity twice (you can get the second by being on the wait list if someone cancels or if no one signs up). You will get wet in this activity, but bring your camera so that you can take a picture (they store it in a dry bag). At the end of your outing, the staff provides pineapple! The grounds are lovely. Everyday there was a wedding ceremony held in a different part of the hotel. One afternoon, my husband and I were reading in two chairs under a grass hut by the hammock in the meditation grass area when the staff started putting together the wedding alter and the dance floor. The staff puts it together quickly, quietly, and without any problems. Had we not been watching them, we would not have heard them. Each bride looked radiant. We took the Trilogy Molokini snorkeling tour. It takes about 30-40 minutes to drive to the marina. We did the regular snorkeling. You do not need to do snuba unless you just want to try it. The water clarity is excellent so you will not miss anything. We saw 3 large sea turtles. The porters gave us towels and water bottles when we left the resort. We also went on the sunrise Haleakala van tour with Polynesian Adventure Tours. We got up at 2am for a 3am pickup time. There are muffins or banana bread in the lobby. The porter gave us blankets (we scheduled this trip the day before so we didn't have our cold weather jackets). It can be 40-50 deg F at elevation 10,730 ft. We saw some tourist bring their hotel robes plus blankets. The weight room is excellent. We like to work out atleast 3 times per week and they have all the equipment needed for each muscle group. The cardio equipment is outdoors under ceiling fans. When you are done, grab a cold wet towel and an apple at the desk. Four Seasons has a game room that anyone can use. They have two pool tables, ping pong table, two internet stations, and video playing room with Wii (guitar hero) and 4 game videos. I never saw this room empty in the afternoon and evening. If the kids were done with being in the pool or the beach they were in this room! The parents could be taking the afternoon class or working out while the kids were entertaining themselves. Great vacation spot for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “The greatest place in the world!”
Reviews.Author: Mrmorals
Reviews.Content: Literally don't know where to start...my wife and I stayed here for the best week of our lives as part of our honeymoon in early May this year. From the moment we arrived we were treated like Royalty, our room was upgraded and literally every member of staff couldn't do enough for us. I don't have enough adjectives to say what a fantastic hotel this is in a beautiful location AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: TexasLady7509
Reviews.Content: So much has already been said that I feel like I don't have a lot to add, but I had to put in my two cents about how wonderful this place is. I hope when I get to heaven, it's half as nice as laying out by the infinity pool at the Four Seasons Maui! The service is second to none, the rooms are spacious, the food was delicious. Tips: We received a complementary upgrade to an ocean-view room. It was nice to have the upgrade, but I would have been disappointed if I had paid for it. It was really just a partial ocean view, and there are so many "free" places to have much better views, I just don't think it's worth it. Get an oceanside massage. Divine. Stop at Costco on your way in to stock up on wine and snacks. Go see the sunrise at Haleakala but bundle up!! As in ski gear. It's cold up there.

Reviews.Title: “The Four Seasons Maui no- ka oi”
Reviews.Author: Albany_NY_Brad
Reviews.Content: This was our 7th stay at the Four Seasons Maui; and with this visit, as with all our visits, there is little one can say that is negative about this beautiful resort. The staff provides the highest level of excellence and always greets you by name, Aloha and a smile. Many of the staff have been working for the 4S for years and it is nice to be recognized upon returning. The resort is clean, and well maintained. There are no extra charges for amenities such as pool lounges, pool cabana's, beach lounges/umbrellas and beach snorkel equipment. We dined at Duo (it was offering a prefix meal) and Ferraro's; we received exceptional meals at both locations. A new addition at the 4S is the serenity pool; this is an adult-only pool and offers a panoramic view of the island of Lana'i and the West Maui mountains. One can generally get seating at this pool if you're at the pool to reserve a seat early AM; they do maintain a waiting list, and will contact you when a seat becomes available. At each of the resorts pools and beach one in constantly treated with pampering and treats. There is only Excellence at the Four Seasons Maui. The Four Seasons Maui no- ka oi.

Reviews.Title: “Not Up To Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Fred6219
Reviews.Content: First off, we had ajoining rooms with two 15 year old daughters. Ocean view but a two and a half minute walk to elevator. Stayed for 5 days. Pool service very slow, had to look for waiters. You had to be at adult pool at 6:30 am or you didn't get in. Small kids at main pool all the time. You could go to ocean until about 11 and then the wind and waves made it impossilbe to enjoy. All the food was very expensive and service was always slow, was seated 15-30 minutes later than reservations and took at least 2 hours to complete meal. We stayed the week before on Ohau at the Halekulani and it was much nicer other than no beach front. Not worth the expense and would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Best honeymoon hotel imaginable”
Reviews.Author: Stanneken
Reviews.Content: Environs, service, facilities, rooms, restaurants and entertainment were all impeccable. Staff were absolutely accommodating in every way. The pools, the beach, the free outrigger canoe session, the evening entertainment at the lobby bar, the stunning serenity pool, the beautiful garden and the top-notch dining were all contributed to the vacation of a lifetime. We could not get over how well we were taken care of. Although staying here is not cheap, the quality of the hotel left us entirely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite! Will be back...”
Reviews.Author: citychic
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a week at the Four Seasons Maui in one of the suites. While the generic room decor was a bit disappointing for the price, the hotel more than made up for it with the exceptionally spacious bathroom, gracious staff, wonderful food, and excellent location. On the room: I think I can be forgiven for expecting more from the hotel room, given the gorgeous public areas of the hotel. The suite was decorated in earth tones - it was not as "rustic" as the decor at the Four Seasons on the Big Island - but more resembled what I'd expect to find in a mid-tier hotel. Forgettable, nothing special. Stepping out on the balcony of the room and looking back at the patio doors, I got that same feeling. I expected more. The bathrooms were stocked with L'Occitane toiletries. The room had a partial ocean view from the living room and the balcony and faced another Wailea hotel. Perhaps for my next stay, I'd ask to have a room facing the inner courtyard (where the main pool is). Extras The internet in the room was an extra $6 (what's another $6 when the room costs upwards of $1,000/night, but still), while parking was another $20 per night. Didn't mind the parking fees as the attendants were wonderful. That said, I was so thrilled with the rest of the hotel... Food The hotel has a branch of Spago, but I was told it wasn't really part of the Four Seasons. The food wasn't bad. What I really liked were the1) buffet breakfast at DUO (the only place where breakfast is served the the hotel; get a table near the smaller pool); 2) poolside meals (fish and chips and the lobster salad were standouts); and 3) Ferraro's for dinner (great food all around, plus a beautiful setting) Facilities The hotel had everything from a large beach right outside (FS staff provide water, chairs, and umbrellas for hotel guests), several wonderful pools (including an adult-only "Serenity Pool"), and a large rec room (great for rainy days). The lush grounds were a treat for the eyes (unlike the surprisingly "threadbare" grounds of the Four Seasons Dallas at Las Colinas). Staff I loved the attentive, friendly staff - valets, concierges, front desk, restaurant staff, pool/beach side. Just wonderful. All in all, I enjoyed a restful week doing nothing and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute paradise- can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Asinex01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent the beginning of our honeymoon here, and it was absolutely amazing. The staff was great, very welcoming, helpful, and made a nice, appropriate fuss that we were newlyweds. Our room was beautiful, the pools, specifically the serenity pool for adults are lovely and the view is of complete paradise. Ferraro's restaurant at the resort is the best place for a nice, romantic dinner and the lobby bar is also a nice, large area that serves a good menu and great Mai tai's! The spa was also excellent - I treated myself to a massage in a hut built on the beach side and it was truly wonderful. Huge props for this hotel. My husband and I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed decadence at its best”
Reviews.Author: princessluxury
Reviews.Content: We arrived way before check-in but the hotel guest suite was offered to us to shower and change so we could take up a pool lounger and wait for the room which they managed to get us into an hour early despite the fact the resort was at capacity which was very welcome after a long haul flight from Oz. Prime ocean view room had fabulous vista and the standard of service from the housekeepers to courtesy cars to shops etc had all you would expect from the Four Seasons. Kids loved the kids club and its a nice touch to have it as part of the expensive but worth it room rate! Late jet lagged room service dinner was one of the best meals we had on the holiday which was a complete shock. Boutique shopping on site was great too and the spa was exquisite. Loved dinner at Spago, adult pool was heaven and was everything the reviews say and more.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome trip, amazing service, best beach - be back next year!”
Reviews.Author: Macfry
Reviews.Content: perfect size hotel for us. friendly, no hassles - loved it. Mahalo

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Venue!”
Reviews.Author: alphadog63
Reviews.Content: The hotel is absolutely beautiful and the service is outstanding. The restaurants on site were all great, and the bar by the pool has the best blueberry mojitos we have ever had! Yes, it is expensive, but truly worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Best service you will ever get at a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: baddabin6
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were personally greeted and my wife and I were given a lea. Next the hostess brought us cool mint towels to wipe our heads. As we went to check in the hostess brought us cold drinks. Very nice start to a check in, we were celebrating our 30th anniversary and the hotel upgraded us to a suite. We had booked the garden view which was a nice very nice view. The garden view suite room 478 was astonishing, it was a very large room. The bathroom has a radio built in. I never needed to find an ice machine since my ice bucket always was filled with ice. The serenity pool was outstanding, you are given free sunscreen and as you lay by the pool the staff comes around with fresh fruit, mini muffins and continuously keeps a cup of fresh ice water by your side. They even come around with chilled towels for your face! The bar service was pretty good and the Real pineapple frozen Mai Tai was outstanding @ $17 while the tap beer was $6. The 3 restaurants in the hotel are upscale restaurants and the breakfast buffet is very high at $35 a person but even in the restaurant the service goes above and beyond. Each time I opened a packet of splendor and put the wrapper on the table it was cleaned up in less than a few seconds. I have to say that this was the best hotel for comfort and service that we had ever stayed at. This made our 30th anniversary very special. I had booked this and surprised my wife and I have to say she feels it was the best and most relaxing stay she has ever had. Incase you are wondering we do NOT work in the hotel industry. Price is high but you definitely get what you pay for at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Easily the most relaxing hotel I have stayed in. Perfection.”
Reviews.Author: JuneDuke12
Reviews.Content: Very expensive in May, but superior to every other hotel on island in terms of serenity, food, cleanliness, service, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful island, beautiful resort and wonderful service. We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: TiffNZ
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Wailea would have to be the best resort I have ever experienced from beginning to end. The staff were all very friendly and extremely helpful. When we arrived we were told we had been upgraded to a full ocean view room and this was simply stunning. It was only a standard room but it was huge for two and the bathroom seemed enormous. Being from New Zealand & Australia and having never been to the USA the prospect of tipping was ominous - who to tip, when to tip and how much! Eventually we got used to it and I can honestly say that tipping for service here is well deserved as the staff are all brilliant. It really just showed me how bad the service is back home. A friend who came to Maui at the same time but didn't want to pay the extra to stay at the Fours Seasons decided to stay at the Marriott Wailea regretted her decision after visiting us. If you love luxury and experiencing the best then there is only one choice in Wailea and that is the Fours Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond all expectations. PERFECT!"”
Reviews.Author: intrepidtravelerfla
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 25th Anniversary and her birthday here for a week starting June 3rd to June 10th, 2011. I had read all of the glowing reviews on Trip Advisor about the Four Seasons before we booked last fall and our trip. I honestly had a hard time believing that all of the "over the top" reviews of the Four Seasons could be accurate. I must tell you that I was wrong. We have been blessed to be able to travel all over the world, and without exception, the Four Seasons was the best. Best service, best accommodations, best of everything. From the minute you arrive, you are not just another guest. You become one of the family. You hear a lot {usually hype] about living aloha on Hawaii. They do it at the Four Seasons. Some tips from our trip. 1. We stayed on the Club floor in an upgraded room. This was an amazing value. You receive personalized service, and all 6 of the Concierges were very personable and helpful. There is breakfast, light lunch, cocktails, finger food around dinner and nightcap drinks all inclusive. Trust me; with the prices in Hawaii, this is a true bargain. We ate out each night but honestly you could skip the dinner and enjoy the fantastic service and food in the Club. If you can swing it, definitely upgrade to the Club level. 2. The hotel is stunning and the service exceptional. You can read all of the reviews already written that go into some detail about this, but all I can say is that the service is flawless. From the watermelon served as you sun bake [burn?] on the beach to the service in the Hotel, we had perfect service. 3. We ate out each night and would recommend DUO, especially the raw bar on the weekends. You cannot eat all of the seafood. We also ate at Spago and Ferraro's. I did all of the planning ahead but the concierges at the Four Seasons were a big help getting us excellent tables. I would rank the restaurants in this order; DUO, Ferraro and then Spago. 4. We also ate at the MALA in the Marriot and the food there was the best of the entire week. We also ate at Capische and I would not go back. Ruth Chris was also consistent with other one's we have eaten at. 5. We didn't really do any sightseeing this time, as we have been to Maui before. So we were, I hate to admit it. just lazy and sat at the Beach. Wailea Beach is exactly as advertised; beautiful, especially the sunsets. Heaven on earth. I could go on and on but don't want to bore anyone. All I can say is that we went with high expectations, and they were exceeded in every respect. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, amazing in every way”
Reviews.Author: Kat008186356
Reviews.Content: This is by far the most beautiful hotel I have ever stayed at. The actual hotel is beautifully designed and the setting is stunning. We arrived having had a long flight in from the UK and were greeted by one of the valets who provided cold bottles of water and refreshing towels to make us feel slightly more human again! We were accompanied to our room and given a guided tour of the hotel and it's amenities along the way. The service on all fronts is first class from the waiters and bar staff, the housekeeping staff and the front desk staff. They are attentive without making you feel claustrophobic. The rooms are very spacious, particularly the bathrooms and it is really nice to have your own balcony area to enjoy the sunset if you aren't down at one of the restaurants enjoying it. We ate in all three of the restaurants at the hotel while we were there and they were all amazing, Ferraro's being our favourite.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best!”
Reviews.Author: h2opolodad
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons in Wailea is still the one to beat. After our fifteenth stay here, we are still looking forward to the time that it does not meet our every expectation. But it did again on this trip. And even though it had been over two years in between visits, nearly every person we came in contact with greeted us like they had just seen us the previous week. There were some minor gripes that are my personal pet peeves (I don't believe in stating a rule and then ignoring it, such as rules about using the cabanas and leaving them open for more than an hour), but other than that, the FS Maui continues to be as close to perfection as I have seen in a resort hotel. We visited the Grand Wailea (too big) and the Ritz Carlton (too windy) just to compare, and we still find the Four Seasons to be the best around.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, and our travel agent made it so much better”
Reviews.Author: DaninChicago
Reviews.Content: Before our trip, when we said we were going to Maui, people asked where we were staying. When we told them the Four Seasons, they invariably said that it was the nicest place on earth. They are so right. It is beautiful, the food at each of the restaurants was great, the people were so friendly and helpful, and the beach it is on is outstanding. And we can't say enough about our travel agent -- whatahotel.com -- by booking through them, we each got a free breakfast buffet every day ($85 for two!), a free lunch one day, and a fabulous upgrade from our cheapest room to one overlooking a lovely garden. They even sent a nice welcome gift when we checked in. I was really skeptical about booking through them, and actually found their facebook page and messaged people who said they had good experiences with them to make sure they were legitimate. They totally exceeded my expectations. It made a fantastic vacation even more fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places to be pampered”
Reviews.Author: belomiser
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in a Partial Ocean view Exec Suite Facing the north side. It gives you the privacy from the two lanais -- that is the only place where you do have your space as the hotel and the beach are packed in Summer. Rooms facing the inner garden are nice as well but the lanais on one side, face lanais on the other side of the hotel. We loved the pools with the kids. It is hard getting a shady spot at the adult pool unless you go early around 7 to grab one. Enjoyed the beach activities -- the outrigger canoe (book it a day or two in advance), snorkeling, boogie boards and my teenager got his scuba certification via the dive team attached to the hotel. Got a great dvd with all the sea creatures he saw on his first dive. The gym is great for an early morning workout and the weight room is attached to the spa so look out for it -- did not see it the first day. The breakfast buffet varied on a daily basis and it was a blast -- enjoyed the omelets and the fresh fruits section. Service at all 3 restaurants was great and so was the food. The concierges are helpful in planning activities and making suggestions that balance a restful holiday as well as doing activities with the kids. We spent time at the hotel and the beach for 4 days and did the helicopter ride, zip-lining and the trip to lanai on the other 3 days . Thanks for a lovely vacation and shout out to the Dive team, the servers the concierge and the folks at the poolside. Mahalo

Reviews.Title: “The Nicest Hotel I've Ever Been To!”
Reviews.Author: jracleveland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon for 10 days. I don't even know where to being to talk about the amazing and unparalleled experience we had at the Four Seasons Resort Maui at Wailea. The incredible service and attention begins upon arrival. As we checked in (fairly late, nearly 11pm because of our flight arrival) we were offered cold lavender towels and cucumber-infused water. The amazing service continued throughout the entire stay. The pool staff is constantly bringing by complimentary refreshments: assorted muffins, Evian sprays, chilled towels and cucumbers, fresh fruit, ice water, popsicles, etc. The list goes on and on. And they never seemed to be *too* attentive. They simply anticipated guests' needs and exceeded them. I would be thinking, "It's warm and I'm getting thirsty," and there was immediately someone there refilling my water glass or beverage. Amazing. We ate by the pool most days and the food was delicious. We also had breakfast several days at Duo and dinner at Ferraro's. All were great and the service - again! - unbelievable. Everyone called us by name and ensured that every need was met. The Lobby Lounge is also nice. There is Hawaiian music every afternoon and other types of music nightly. The housekeeping staff cleans the guest rooms twice daily. And they really pay attention to little, tiny details. For example, my husband left a book open, face-down on the coffee table and when we returned the housekeeping staff had put a bookmark in the book for him! We were floored. The attention to detail is what makes this hotel stand out from every other. The grounds are lush and beautiful and the guest rooms are spacious and spotless. We had an ocean-view room and enjoyed sitting out on the balcony to watch the sunset. We spent most of our days by the adults-only Serenity Pool. Future hotel guests, be warned: to get your choice of lounge chair (or any chair at all) be prepared to line up around 6:30am daily. It wasn't difficult for us because of the time change, being from Minnesota. We were up anyway. Though the days we did decide to sleep in a little, we ended up sitting by the Fountain Pool. Also nice and just as great of service, though a little louder because it's filled with children and families. If you're looking for a fun splurge, reserve a Luxury Cabana by the Serenity Pool. We reserved one of these cabanas twice during our stay and it was a great decision. The cabanas have wireless internet and huge TVs. They also come with complimentary champagne and fruit plates and the service is even better! They really are amazing and its provides a nice reprieve from the sun. I've uploaded a few pictures with my review. All in all, I can't rave about this resort enough. There's never a reason to leave and we will definitely return very soon. Thank you Four Seasons for the most incredible honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific stay. Great beach. Use WhataHotel to book!”
Reviews.Author: grdokie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband for 5 nights for an anniversary trip. It really did live up to all expectations after reading glowing reviews! We booked through WhataHotel.com, which I would particularly recommend. (I had read about it from the other reviews). When you book you get free breakfast every day (gratuity included), a lunch credit at Ferraro's up to $85, and a free room upgrade (if available). They matched the "5th night free" rate from the hotel's website. The breakfast buffet was the highlight of the trip! It was amazing--I saw it featured on a Giada DiLaurentis show. Definitely get the macadamia nut pancakes with the lilikoi syrup!! And knowing that you are eating for free makes it taste even better! it normally costs $85 for 2 (gratuity included). The attention to detail at this hotel is excellent. We mentioned it was our anniversary, and they gave us a free bottle of champagne. You leave a book on the night stand, the maid leaves a bookmark and a book light next to it. Etc, etc. The beach in front of the hotel is awesome too! Sandy, no rocks, great snorkeling! We rented Stand-up paddleboards twice, which were fun! (Albeit pricey). Played ping pong/shuffleboard in the game room. We both got massages beach-side which were great. The grounds are immaculate and beautiful, with orchids everywhere you look. This was our first trip to Maui, and the Four Seasons made it memorable indeed! It is very expensive--other reviewers urged to go ahead and splurge. I would second that!!

Reviews.Title: “Really is worth it”
Reviews.Author: IcyBlueZz
Reviews.Content: Went there for our honeymoon and really the first getaway ever with just the two of us. (our trips normally comprised of lots of family & of course lots of crazy fun) But seeing that it is our honeymoon, we decided maybe it would be best to go by ourselves... We stayed there for almost a week and everyday they made us feel like royalty. Staff there were so good to us. We arranged a lot of our activities last minute and they took care of everything for us. (of course you shouldn't wait til last minute) Word of advice, plan ahead and especially make reservations for the Luaus, they get booked up FAST! There are a lot of activities to do there... *snorkeling *ziplining *LUAUS!! *bike riding down a scary-a** mountain (with hairpin roads that dont have any railings to keep you from falling over) after seeing an amazing sunrise *sight-seeing...rent a car (yes the hotel will also arrange this for you) still by far the best trip and stay I've had. By the way I had the partial ocean view room and it was still nice. But if you really dont want to spend the extra money, just ask yourself are you really going to be in the room that much to enjoy the view. If not, spend the money on the real site seeing when you're actually outside enjoying Maui.

Reviews.Title: “For beachside luxury and privacy in a resort setting, look no further.”
Reviews.Author: wandererer151
Reviews.Content: Any guest of the Four Seasons collection has a rather high set of expectations. The fact is, the Four Seasons sets the benchmark for all others, and the location in Wailea will not disappoint. While the main focus here is relaxed luxury, you won't find too many children running around the grounds. That's what next door is for. I stayed in a 1-bedroom ocean view suite, which had a great open layout, large bathrooms, and a wonderful lanai. The food was as expected, rich in flavor and served by absolute professionals. While I did rank the hotel Excellent, because anything less would be truly a lie, I was not 100% thrilled by the simplistic nature of resort. I do like a bit more going-ons. I'm not talking Panama City Spring Break of Senior year, but a little more activity wouldn't hurt. The beach is serene, the waters warm, and Wailea really is just tops when it comes to oceanside Maui. This hotel should definitely be on your short list (very short list)

Reviews.Title: “5 stars in paradise”
Reviews.Author: njfamilytravel
Reviews.Content: There are not enough words in the English language to describe the Four Seasons Maui. Their reputation as the best resort in Maui is well deserved. They get everything right - from the moment you arrive to the moment you leave. The staff is finely attuned to the needs of their guests - they anticipate and deliver and they make it look so effortless. The service is so far beyond the rest that it makes the expense totally worth it. I like the fact that so many of their services are bundled into the price (kids club, cabanas, snorkel equipment, scuba lesson, outrigger program, fitness and yoga classes) -- I'm probably paying more than going ala carte, but it's better than feeling nickeled and dimed. Weilea is the perfect location on Maui - the weather is superb and the sunsets will break your heart, every single time. The most important thing for us was that we felt we were truly on vacation. This is was our first time at this Four Seasons - you can bet we will be returning!

Reviews.Title: “As good as advertised”
Reviews.Author: darwin96
Reviews.Content: It's hard for a hotel to live up to expectations some times. We had read that Four Seasons Wailea was the top rated resort in the entire United States on some lists. It did not disappoint us. The service, as always with Four Seasons, was fabulous. It was hard to leave the resort and do island activities. We just wanted to lie around on their beach and by their pools and soak up the service. The concierge was very helpful with my requests to make special arrangements for an anniversary celebration. They also tipped off the front desk that we were there for a 10th anniversary and we got an upgrade from Garden View to Ocean View Deluxe which is highly appreciated. I agree with other reviews that the Ocean View/Partial Ocean View rooms might not be worth the premium. I'm not complaining because I got a free upgrade, but if I had paid for the Ocean View, I might have been unhappy with the angled view we had. The rooms have refrigerators so you can stock them yourselves or order certain things to be stocked. Poolside drinks were reasonably price as far as 5 star resorts go ($10-$14 cocktails/wine; $6-7 beer). The adult infinity pool is a nice option, but there is often a wait list to get seats there. We were just as happy at the regular pool though. Not a lot of kids the week we were there. The practice, at both pools, of them finding chairs for you and then holding them for you all day (as long as you donâ€™t leave them for > 1hr) was a double edged sword. It was nice to have that security if you got good chairs. There are a lot of people who seem to abuse it though and stretch that 1 hr policy. We saw some great spots go unused for a long time because someone was â€œusingâ€� them. I also have to applaud the valets. If you called down and gave even a couple minutes notice, you never had to wait for your car. We had a convertible and they even took our top down/up requests and had the car ready!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel,unbeatable service”
Reviews.Author: lilly6
Reviews.Content: Thought it was about time I wrote a review for this gorgeous hotel although it was a while ago when we stayed. The room was beautiful,bathroom was massive & all services were fantastic. we ate here a couple of times & the food was lovely,well presented & tasty. Around the pool the bring little treats,fruit on a stick & the smoothies are fantastic,amazing choices. the staff were lovely at all times,we had breakfast every morning in the breakfast area & the choices were plentiful. I also had a pedicure which i enjoyed,the staff at the spa were very good. Wish I was there now.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic perfection! (Great for Celiacs, too)”
Reviews.Author: EmSaso
Reviews.Content: Wow. Although this place is pricey, it was worth every penny! The most beautiful views, incredible food, a perfect beach, and the service is near perfection! As far as the food goes, I'm Celiac and they had loads of options for me. The breakfast buffet (do NOT miss it!) even had a gluten-free table with muffins and breads, and they could make you pancakes and waffles at your request! The room was gorgeous, the tennis courts were in perfect condition, we had the BEST massages at the spa, always loads of seating at the beach and at poolside... I can't say enough about the Four Seasons Maui! The only negative is that the concierge desk was not too fabulous. They confused the dates for some of our outings. I would recommend not using them and just booking direct with the provided. Small detail though. This place is truly paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Best in class service and hotel condition”
Reviews.Author: ryonius
Reviews.Content: The service and property condition were truly best in class. The food was fantastic. The homemade pasta at Ferarro's was amazing, not to mention the ambiance. Duo's steaks were also fantastic and both my wife and I agree that the breakfast buffet was truly the best we have ever experienced. We also appreciated their attention to detail and awareness of allergies- they even had a gluten free section so that those with gluten senstivities could also enjoy fresh pancakes, toast, etc. The hotel grounds were clean and well manicured. The new serenity pool was amazing, fantastic views, relaxing and quiet, and the service was once again best in class- our water cups were never lacking a full pour of ice water. We enoyed the amazing food and drinks while lounging poolside and enjoying the views of West Maui from this infinity pool location-oh, and should you want to take a dip, you'll notice underwater music. In addition, being footsteps to the beach is also convenient when wanting to snorkle, paddle board or swim in the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “You'll be treated like a king and queen”
Reviews.Author: beachgirl430
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights on my honeymoon and the hotel and grounds far exceeded our expectations. It's expensive, and we booked the cheapest room that we could get because we wanted to splurge and stay at the Four Seasons for 2 nights of our 10 day honeymoon in Hawaii. The room had a nice view of the countryside and a balcony with comfortable chairs. The room was really large for a standard hotel room, and the bathroom was amazing! Music in the bathroom, jacuzzi tub, marble countertops and floors, very comfortable room. I have stayed at many 5-7start Marriott resorts and the room here was larger than most of the other rooms I've seen. The service is outstanding here, you will really feel like a queen. There are many workers ready to serve you, the pool-side attendants fill your water every 15 min or so, bring you ice pops, muffins, rice kripy treats, sun tan lotion while you're sitting by the pool. They also have a beautiful serenity pool for 21+ with a swim up bar, AND there's underwater music! Four Seasons has thought of everything, the grounds are just so incredibly beautiful. There's a kids pool too and it's far enough away from the main pool and serenity pool so you won't be bothered with yelling or running kids. I would stay here again in a second, it's absolutely gorgeous! Oh and the snorkeling right off the shore is awesome, some people pay to take a boat out to the same snorkeling reef that you can swim right out to from the hotel. Snorkel gear was free for an hour, and only $5 for each additional.

Reviews.Title: “A resort which is more like a palace!”
Reviews.Author: Gracie_Family
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights with our 2 year old girl, and we had a great time. Our daughter was spoiled with lots of toys and snacks, both on arrival and through our stay. Four Seasons is best for young families and kids among all the other 5 star hotels and resorts. The pool area was massive and beautiful, with a kids' section with a water slide. We had free use of cabanas, which were plentiful. Poolside service was good in general, although most of the time we had to ask someone to set up our chairs (instead of having it ready for the guests). The games room was fantastic, with pool, shuffle board, foosball and table tennis, as well as video games and a computer. I would not hesitate before recommending this resort to other young families out there!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, one of the best hotels in the world”
Reviews.Author: Jaxrestauranter
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to a lot of hotels and this one is probably our all-time favorite. The location of this hotel is simply incredible. It is all open air and the breeze was wonderful in September. They have recently added a new and impressive pool area. The prices aren't cheap but you truly get what you pay for here...and it's worth it. The rooms are spotlessly clean and the service was solid. We also had a great meal at Duo, which is located on the property.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you would expect....and more”
Reviews.Author: mskitz
Reviews.Content: There is a good reason that this is the top-rated hotel in Maui. This hotel defines luxury. The Four Seasons Wailea is to what the Crystal Serenity is to cruiselines. As you can see from previous reveiws, service is fabulous and the guest reigns surpreme here. The staff simply never say "no". Don't have something you want in your room? They'll bring it. Want something from the lunch menu for dinner? You can have it? Want something that's not even on the menu? They'll make it. This is a property that still does twice a day room cleaning. Very much appreciated. And, yes, while they do charge for internet service, there is no daily resort charge--which virtually every other hotel in the area has. This hotel also gives you 2 bottles of water everytime they freshen up your room. (no charge.) And there are great little coffee makers (with good coffee) and little fridgies. The beds are wonderful and the linens are of the extremely high cailber you'd expect. My husband and I are not big beach/swimming pool people. However, we do always want a nice terrace and a good ocean view. We enjoyed both things along with a view over the beautiful plantings on the property. We usually dine at various restaurants in the Wailea/Kihei area. This time, we ate almost all of our meals on the property--enjoying the wonderful oceanside dining at Ferraro's as well as the continental food at Duo. We were here for 10 days and probably ate 5 room service breakfasts, 8 lunches at Ferraro's and 8 dinners at either Ferraro's or Duo. There is a very high employee to guest ratio and that simply means very high service levels. Yes, this is an expensive place. However, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've stayed at...”
Reviews.Author: bostonweb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here as part of an anniversary trip (first part of trip at Marriott Kauai Resort via a time share from a family member...will post a review on that soon). See attached pics of the Four Seasons. The FS gave us a complimentary upgrade from the $465 per night room to a partial ocean executive suite with free bottle of champagne. UNREAL room. with HUGE bathroom. Everyone has pretty much stated that the FS resort is unbelievable. They are right. Service is impeccable, resort is amazingly clean and the scenery is incredible. Rented a luxury cabana at the serenity pool one day over memorial day weekend. If you can swing it, I would say it's worth it. We paid about $350 plus any food/drink/tips...the front facing ocean view cabana's are $395...I actually think the cheaper ones are better. We had no problem getting a chair or cabana at the regular pool (which is still great, but definitely a little more noisy). We didn't feel like rushing to get in line at the serenity pool at 7am for one of the regular chairs so to us it was worth having our own space, etc. Plus, it was nice to live large for a day. Serenity pool is fantasitc...you can obviously use the serenity pool/bar even if you don't have a chair reserved...but you do have to reserve (free of charge) a chair at the serenity pool). Food: Ate breakfast at Duo. Yeah, it's on the pricer side but the bacon, eggs and hash browns were all awesome. Probably the best bacon I've ever eaten. We don't do large breakfast's often so it was worth it. Had dinner at Duo and Ferraro's. Both great, but favorite was Ferraro's. Try the seabass if you like fish. Melted off the knife like a piece of steak. Bar apps were pretty great as well. Chicken nachos were our fave. Off the resort...the pizza up the road at Matteo's was great. Ate at Monkeypod by the shop at Wailea. Thought it was above average, but not amazing. Good food though and great selection of beers. Played golf at Wailea Emerald. Great views throughout and course in awesome shape. Lots of bunkers! Good sports bar (had NHL hockey on which I was looking for) is Mulligan's right by Wailea Blue course...cheap local beers at happy hour. $20 per day for parking (valet only). Didnt' love the valet only option...the resort will also drive you any where local you want to go free of charge (sans a tip for the driver). Hope this helps....

Reviews.Title: “Back again - still amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: phxtravelguy
Reviews.Content: When you think of the ultimate resort with the most incredible service... this is the resort you should think of. As we pulled up, one of the bellman greeted me and my partner by name... asked about Phoenix (where we live)... this is amazing because we haven't been to this resort in nearly 2 years. But he remembered. From the room, to the restaurants and the pool staff... totally superior.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny”
Reviews.Author: elf.dml
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort 2x and feel that the high level of service and amenities available are worth every penny. They know you by name from day one, we ate almost every meal at one of the restaurants and all meals were great with our favorite being Ferraro's, we liked walking to the Wailea shops during the evenings, my husband went diving with Ed Robinson dive shop at least 3x each stay and recommends them highly, the FS staff arranged for a very nice snorkel trip to Molokini on a luxury sailboat, we tried the SPA 4x total and loved the couples massage overlooking the ocean and the facials, the adults only pool is lovely-yes, the getting in line at 7am or earlier is hard but worth the great spot for the day, if you like dark beer try the coconut porter at the adult pool bar, the pool staff gives you tons of towels, ice water galore, clean your sunglasses, give you frozen fruit and other treats daily, we did try the large family pool 1x w/ cabana and it was nice-not that busy but the view and personal service at the adults pool was tops! The cleaning staff was spot on, they brought me extra feather pillows with no problem. I think the great things about the FS chain is "service without an attitude" all staff is friendly and seems like they like their job which shows thru to the vacationer. They have nighly entertainment in the lobby. The gardens are great to walk around and view a sunset. There were alot of kids which is a downfall if you are looking for romance but all kids we encountered were well behaved. We drove ourself to Hana-saw the black beach and waterfalls-got a speeding ticket for going 25 MPH in a school zone $100(ish) be careful it sneaks up on you...the school, ate at Momma's Fish House which was FABULOUS! We are going back for 10 days the end of August and are planning a snorkel trip to Lanai with Trilogy Excursions. The only complaint we heard while there were people trying to "out do the Jones" but who cares...pay attention to your spouse/family and enjoy your hard earned trip and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: snurglefarb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay for 4 nights at this Four Seasons hotel. Although the room rate was rather pricey, the hotel made up for it by extremely helpful and pleasant staff and a great location. We stayed in a garden view room which had an angled view of the sea. It is not really worth paying for a sea view when you can just walk outside. We ate at DUOs and Ferraros. Food was great at both except for the poor recommendation of a Californian wine which we did not like. Eating at Ferraros outdoors at sunset was a very romantic experience. We did not bother trying the "serenity" pool as the one time we checked it out in the late afternoon, it was crowded and noisy, full of the beautiful people getting sloshed at the swim up bar. We preferred the main pool which was peaceful and had most attentive staff on hand to bring cold drinks, etc. All in all - we enjoyed our first visit to this hotel and will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great service, don't go for the mountain view room”
Reviews.Author: DJKsar
Reviews.Content: the best service in all parts of the hotel. From check-in to meals to pool staff just amazing. The adult pool is very relaxing but you have to come very early to get a spot. The cabanna's are $500 and when we came the first day they said you can get it for half-off -- uhhh no. The beach is great for snorkeling and kayaking so highly recommend you do that one of the days. We also used the gym (outdoor machines available and in-door room a little small for doing pilates) and tennis courts before breakfast every morning. Only down-side is the mountain view room overlooked the parking lot and the busy street so it was noisier than any other part of the hotel at night and morning.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing- worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Dee_Kiss
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons Maui is amazing. Its the top class experience with amazing rooms, lovely restaurants and you can do as much or as little as you want. There are fun free activites like outrigger canoe lessons or you can hire snorkel gear or paddleboards. Just off the beach you can snorkel with sea turtles which you don't need to go on a tour for. One tip with that is do it forst thing in the morning- before 9am thats when the turtles are feeding and getting cleaned just off the beach. We had a relaxing time here. But one annoyance was the whole 'hogging beach chairs' thing. People have a tendency to put there towels there and then go off to breakfast etc. IF you don't mind sitting on the beach I recommend this over the pool chairs. The serenity pool is very nice to relax and have cocktails in the pool but can also get busy. Do head out of the resort for meals as there are some great casual dining options in Waliea village - the Japanese cafe is fab and we ended up going there twice. I also recommend you get a hire car for a day or two and explore the island - I organised a picnic pack with the hotel and we had a romantic picnic at Big Beach which was lovely. The Hana Hwy is also worth a whole day - make sure you stop in a few small towns and go past the end of the Hwy. The spa was over priced so we went to teh one in the resort next door - name escapes me. It was ok but they have seperate male/female spa rooms so you won't get to hang out with your partner if you go together

Reviews.Title: “Dream Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: brookeandben
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived to the Four Seasons, we felt like VIP. We were greeted with refreshements and cold towels as we were guided to check-in. The website company I had used did NOT inform the Four Seasons of our RSVP. Luckily I had the e-mail and the Manager called the website company to comfirm our reservations. We originally had garden view rooms and because of our inconvenience (which was the travel websites fault, not the Four Seasons), the hotel upgraded us to a 2 room full ocean view suite!!!!!!!!!! Needless to say the room and views were breathtaking! Since the hotel has their own beach, we went snorkeling along the natural reef off the beach and saw "Big Pappa" - the 100 year old sea turtle. We also had the hotel arrange surf lessons which was an awesome experience! When I look back at our honeymoon, it will be one of the best vacations of our lives, which it should be. When you want to get away and experience how the other half lives, then you need to stay at the Four Seasons!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: txtravelinmom7
Reviews.Content: There's not much more I can say that others haven't already said. This was our second year in a row to FS Maui and it was PERFECT once again. We stayed at the Ritz for our first two nights and were MISERABLE. I even tried to call and get us moved to the FS early. I won't do the Ritz again. It's too big and both nights we were there, there was a convention of what sounded like cackling magpies outside of our room. I swear I have never heard middle aged women so loud in my life. Either way, the rooms at the FS are larger and more plush to boot. The bed at Ritz isn't very comfortable either. The lady above our room did everything in high heels so at all hours of the day you could hear her above us. The weather in Wailea was MUCH better too. The FS is amazing, don't hesitate, GO!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to be pampered”
Reviews.Author: lrenfer
Reviews.Content: Like many others, got alot of help from other reviews here. To start with summary: This location is very much worth the higher price of the rooms and you will be glad you did. First, we found that the various employees here were uniformly helpful, engaging, and always tried to be as helpful as they could. Even the cleaning ladies were cheerful and pleasant. One day we were out on the lanai of the room the entire time they worked on the room. Instead of just slipping out when they were done, they opened the door and asked if they could get anything else for us. A simple thing, but repeated many times during the stay. Though i am usually one to spend little time at the place of lodging and most of my time exploring or doing activities, this is one occasion that you may just want to enjoy relaxing with the service provided amidst beautiful ocean/beach/garden views. We did very little offsite for 5 days and were glad we did. Each morning we found it easy to get up early (because of time change) and enjoyed their open air aerobic facilities with plenty of amenities. For some reason, we both found it very easy to get our exercise "out of the way" here. Because we booked through whatahotel service we both enjoyed the morning breakfast buffet at no charge every morning. Frankly this was probably the culinary highlight of our trip as the quality and quantity of selection was wonderful and it was simply a delight to enjoy this meal each am. We usually enjoyed this big meal around mid morning and found that the last 3 days of our trip we only wanted two meals a day with this being the first. Another tip: for me i love simpler food--which means cheaper food. Each evening we would take a short drive to Kihei to eat something simple--even plate lunch (which i love) sometimes and then would go to a small place for a different flavor of gelato ice cream each evening. Definitely a situation that kept food costs way down and we enjoyed the food. The room upgrade we got thru whatahotel was unbelievable--room normally costs above $2k a night

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: amb45
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the FS for 10 nights in May. I booked through a website called Whatahotel.com as the deal had breakfast included. All I can really say is we had a fantastic time. I would definitely recommend the Scuba as you get to see lovely coral, fish and if lucky turtles. All the staff were very nice, they even brought us pastries and some goodies on our last night as a treat! It is expensive but in the end it's worth it, would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “If you can't decide between the Ritz and the Four Seasons, pick the FS!!!”
Reviews.Author: moorech1
Reviews.Content: Ditto to what others have said. FS Wailea is simply the best. We stayed here 4 nights in May 2011 and were going to spend 3 more nights at Ritz Carlton Kapalua. After one night at the Ritz, we moved back to the FS. It was just too big and felt like a chain hotel. The FS was intimate while not cramped and the service and facilities are stellar. If you are on the bubble as to which top end hotel to pick on Maui, save yourself some time and just stay the Four Seasons!

Reviews.Title: “Unparalleled Service”
Reviews.Author: sirtoasty
Reviews.Content: There isn't too much to be said that hasn't already been said. This is a gorgeous resort, in a gorgeous location, but the thing that really sets it apart is the attention to detail on the service end. For example, as you're sitting by the pool, they have people that will come by every so often to offer you all kinds of little niceties -- mini-muffins, fresh pineapple, cool damp towels, or even to spray you with a refreshing mist. I also really appreciated that they had sunscreen dispensers everywhere, in case I needed a little on the fly, and the fact that most of the cabanas are free. The serenity pool is a fantastic place to hang out, but if you aren't able to get a spot here, consider one of the spots tucked into the hill between the resort and the beach. There are some great views there, and you'll get plenty of peace and quiet. As another side note, there is some top notch artwork all over the resort. If you're into that sort of thing, it's worth walking around just to take it all in. I would really have to struggle to find fault with this place. If I could offer one bit of constructive criticism to the folks at Four Seasons that I suspect are reading this, it would be this: for a resort of this quality, the toilet paper is oddly pedestrian. Not only was it not up to the level of everything else about the experience, it was actually below what I would expect at a "normal" hotel. Ultimately, though, that is just an observation, and didn't take away from the 5-star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Aloha Spirit Lives at the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: michelevernon
Reviews.Content: Beautiful flowers, fountains and grounds greeted us as we drove up. From the moment we entered we were addressed by our names. All the staff said hello to us, no matter who and where they were every single day we were there (7 days). Our room was spacious, with a king bed, nice balcony with an angled view of the ocean. The bathroom was luxuriously large and amenity filled. The shower was great. The room was quiet (7th floor). Most of the dining, lounge and bar spaces were open and inviting with no walls. The effect was constant soft perfect temperature under cover but still outside. The true wonder and mystery was the fact that bugs don't seem to like staying at the Four Seasons, because we saw almost none. We used the concierge service frequently and they helped graciously and effectively. From the bellmen/valet staff to the restaurant management, everyone had suggestions to make our stay on Maui a pleasant one. It's impressive that the Four Seasons combines the Aloha Spirit of Hawaii and their dedication to fantastic customer service to provide a delightful stay for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: LCBmagnolia
Reviews.Content: Everything a honeymoon should be...relaxation, superb service, yummy cocktails, outstanding culinary cuisine...etc. etc. We were on our honeymoon so we took advantage of most of the amenities on-site. Spa treatments were a little pricey but well worth it...great gym. Truly a little piece of heaven on earth...

Reviews.Title: “Loved the adults-only pool area!”
Reviews.Author: cstaples
Reviews.Content: Even the best Hawaiian resorts can feel over-run by noisy kids and families-- especially during periods like Spring Break. The Four Seasons has a nifty solution-- an adults-only Serenity Pool area, where kids under 21 are banned, as well as cell phones. We spent every day there, from before breakfast, to sunset. During the course of a day, we were offered an incredible array of free perks-- from morning muffins, to chilled pineapple, to sunglass cleaning, to aftersun lotion. There's a full-service bar with amazing food, and some of the best views on the entire property from a beautiful infinity pool. The only drawback was too much demand-- to get a spot in the shade, you need to be in line before 7:00 a.m. Surely management will keep this in mind for future renovations-- the Serenity Pool could easily be twice the size, and should be a standard feature at all Four Seasons Resorts.

Reviews.Title: “everything you would expect”
Reviews.Author: josiegrammer
Reviews.Content: There are so many fabulous reviews here i don't think i need to go on and on about how amazing the resort is. We took our 2 children who were 9 and 6 at the time. We had the garden view one bedroom suite. It was a huge beautiful room although it didn't have the most awesome view. it looked over towards the Grand Wailea and there was a little side road there that was a busy sometimes with deliveries etc. I know that there are one or two of these suites that open right onto the gardens (ours was one floor up) and i think those are more desirable. We weren't in the room that much anyway so it didn't matter - the view is amazing everywhere else in the resort. Also, the cabanas at the main pool are really nice and complimentary - you need shade there in the summer! even though the hotel was packed - we did not have trouble getting chairs or cabanas at the main pool. We did have to wait for chairs at the adult pool both days we went there but it was fine since the bar up there is so nice... and the guys helping at the pool just grabbed us when something opened up. My kids really had a great time - loved the snorkeling, stand up paddling etc... my son loved the kids club and my daughter was probably just a little too old for the kids that were there at the time. we hired a babysitter through the hotel two nights and she was awesome and we paid less hourly than we do back home. One thing i will mention is that having been lucky enough to have also visited the FS in Punta Mita, I think I prefer that resort over this one. Both my husband and i felt that way. i can't really say exactly why though because this place is amazing. I think the kids may have liked this one better bc you can't swim in the ocean in Punta Mita. I can't imagine anyone not having an amazing time here.

Reviews.Title: “What's not to like”
Reviews.Author: allovus
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Four Seasons this past Easter Week 2011. My wife and 2 childrened loved it. They wait on you hand and foot. Get ready to pay. But when you stay at the FS what do you expect. Loved it and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Stunning”
Reviews.Author: Camillefb
Reviews.Content: I think that the Four Seasons Maui is quite possibly the best hotel experience I have ever encountered. From the moment my mother and I arrived, we were treated like royalty. We received our Lei's and were then escorted to the front desk and promptly given delicious fruity iced tea. We were then led to our beautiful double room with french doors that opened up onto the balcony. The room was amazing and spacious and the bathroom was large with a separate marble bath, shower and double sinks. If looking for comfort and luxury, this is the resort for you. Our days at the spa and by the pool were amazing...the perfect way to relax and recharge your batteries. The poolside service was impeccable. We enjoyed the adult infinity pool the most because it was serene and very pleasant. On our days off the property we enjoyed the complimentary car service the the Wailea shops (which you should definitely visit if you go) and luau that was recommended to us by the wonderful concierge. My mother and I had one of the most amazing dinners at Spago, on the Four Seasons property...they even packed a meal for us 'to go' on our flight back to the mainland! Everything about this resort was perfect and I recommend this spot to anyone who needs some serious rest, relaxation and a bit of fun!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Wonderful Staff, Great Food, & Incredible Location”
Reviews.Author: ProTravel76
Reviews.Content: By far one of the most wonderful hotel experiences I've ever had. The hotel and their staff ensure that you want for nothing.
