The Spa is also incredible; I had a 60 minute "ocean side" massage as well as a 90 minute massage in the spa. And they were by far the best massages I've ever had in my life.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Paradise in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: pbrory
Reviews.Content: As a traveler who has been all over the world and has a great appreciation for hotels I was truly amazed by our experience at the Four Seasons Resort at Maui. From the stellar service to the luxurious accommodations with incredible views, and delicious restaurants the hotel was impeccable. The hotel is pricey but as far as we were concerned well worth it. The free upgrade to an ocean front view however was very nice. The concierge staff and hotel managers were also very helpful in arranging my proposal to my girlfriend which included a private beachfront 5 course meal with a tailored menu and private unukalhai player. Our stay was incredible and we will definitely be returning perhaps for our wedding.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing. Indulgent. Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: jessanomic
Reviews.Content: We went to the Four Seasons as the last stop on a month long holiday to the USA for our honeymoon. We were upgraded to a partial ocean view room and upon entering the room we had a nice card from the hotel manager and a complimentary bottle of champagne in the fridge and a red rose. The staff were all lovely. The breakfast buffet was nice and we enjoyed great meals in the on site restaurants. We enjoyed an ocean side massage which was amazing. The regular spa was great as well with lovely shower, creams, hair care products etc. We had grand plans to see the rest of Maui, but we were so happy and relaxed we just stayed by the pool for the three days we were there. The L'occtaine products in the bathroom were also really appreciated and lovely. Initially we wondered whether we should spend so much to stay, but were glad we did and it was worth the money

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous --- fantastic week and super travel agent!”
Reviews.Author: HugsforTTT
Reviews.Content: I will try to make this review short and meaningful, as it has already been stated that this is a phenomenal hotel with exception service. We booked our travel through Whatahotel.com. We traveled as a family for a quick 6 day getaway for my birthday. We have a 5 year old and 7 month old. When we arrived at the hotel, there were several valets available to park the car. Our check- in was smooth and quick. There was a problem with our room, but it was addressed and resolved efficiently by Housing Director, David Crouch. We utilized the kids club, which my son thoroughly enjoyed -- there were plenty of children his age, and the staff provided a variety of engaging activities throughout the day. He had a wonderful experience, and met several little friends to play with everyday. The breakfast and wait staff were very also accommodating --- we have a child with nut allergies and they made sure his meals were cooked separately to avoid cross contamination. They also ensured that my daughter had a cooked sweet potato waiting for her during lunch everyday, so we would not have to wait 40 minutes for the potato to bake. We had a late flight out on our last day, and after with speaking with my travel agent at WhataHotel!, the hotel allowed us to remain in the room for the entire day, which was wonderful, since we could swim, relax and pack in a leisure fashion -- and the children could take a long nap before the 10 hour flight home. We had a great time and I highly recommend the hotel. If you want pampering and a luxurious stay, then treat yourself to a fabulous trip. Whatahotel.com was instrumental in our having a wonderful vacation. There were small issues that were promptly addressed and resolved by our agent. We definitely felt like we had an insider assuring quality control.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful facility with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: amadeusny
Reviews.Content: the resort was so nice it was hard to leave during the day, but with so much there it was not really necessary to go anywhere else. Our massages were extraordinary. The spa however, is small, without a sauna or hot tub. It did not the amenities of a typical destination spa. that would have made it perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Four Reasons to stay at the Four Seasons Maui”
Reviews.Author: Dramarix
Reviews.Content: 1. Gorgeous grounds & views 2. Spacioius rooms (bathrooms are huge) and balconies 3. Beautiful beach 4. a. Wonderful wet bar at the adult only infinity "Serenity" pool one more.... 5. Wonderful Spa treatments This was my 2nd stay at the 4S Maui and the second time was much better than the first time. It may be the difference between getting an ocean view vs a garden room. If you can afford it splurge it's definitely worth it. The views and grounds are beautiful. Another great plus is that Wailea is the driest part of the island. The breakfast was great, but for dinner I recommend going off property for dining. Not a big fan of Spago's. You will get better options going to Lanai City Grill, Mama's Fish House, Halimaile General Store to name a few. My boyfriend really enjoyed Emerald and Gold golf courses while I enjoyed the fabulous spa, in-hotel boutiques and also Wailea shops. We do not have children and loved the serenity pool (adult only) which has an infinity pool that has the most breathtaking view. I recommend getting chairs really early because they run out rather quickly. By early I mean 7am..Not too bad for the east coasters :) The rooms by far are spacious and the bathrooms were wonderful too. The service is also worth the money. If you can request a room on the left wing of the hotel I think it would be better. If you get put on the right side you have to walk forever to get there. Just a little tip that will give you easier access to the grounds. I would definitely return and recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday of a Lifetime”
Reviews.Author: Maui075
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Hotel in Maui must be the perfect location for a holiday. The hotel is beautiful bright and spacious. The service you recieve from the delightful staff is second to none. Having a very unusual food allergy the help I recieved from the waiters and chefs was brilliant making my holiday trouble free.The food in each restaurant was of the very highest standard.The service provided round the pool too was excellent and everywhere you went the reception you got was bright cheery and very helpful. The beach was very close by and very clean - perfect for sunbathing, swimming or taking part in any of the activities provided such as snorkling, paddle boarding or outrigging. The bedrooms were very comfortable and spacious providing everything you might need together with a very large ensuite bathroom with excellent facilities.I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a special and memorable holiday. I would very much like to make a return trip

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home”
Reviews.Author: lasereyesdoc
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here since it opened which is over 20 times. there is nothing one can say other than superlative after superlative. The entire staff is magnificent. We are personally greeted by name by everyone from the door man to bellman to breakfast hostess to even the resort manager and general manager. There is no reason to stay at any other hotel in the state. The value for the dollar is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: liveohio
Reviews.Content: We had such a wonderful time. Staff is very polite and friendly. Great pool side food! Husband did not like the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: familyof5chicago5
Reviews.Content: I was nervous to go to the Four Seasons with our 3 kids (age 7 to 12) over spring break. While I knew that it would be beautiful (IT WAS!) and the service would be great (IT WAS OUTSTANDING!), I was concerned that the atmosphere would have us "shushing" our kids in all of the public spaces. I couldn't have been more wrong. We were traveling during spring break, so I'm sure that had something to do with it, but the hotel was filled with families, and we were very comfortable there. We ate in all of the restaurants at the hotel (which was not what I anticipated being able to do.) We had connecting rooms with ample space. The "oceanview" rooms (as opposed to "prime oceanview") have a view from the balcony, but definitely felt far away from the water. We did not run into any staff member who was rude or less than genuinely helpful. Even as we were headed out the door to the airport, they were sending us off with dried pineapple as a 'travel snack'. The little extras for our kids (gifts at arrival and departure!) were so pleasant. Even though my kids knew that the Grand Wailea next door had great water features at their pool, they still preferred the Four Seasons. My younger kids were happy with the Kids for All Seasons kid's club also.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Want To Leave!”
Reviews.Author: CP9292
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights at the beginning of April and LOVED it!! We booked through Whatahotel and were very pleased with the perks they offered. The breakfast buffet was outstanding and a great way to start the day every day (the waffles were amazing!). We spent most of the time at the adult pool. I was surprised by how early we had a to get a chair, but the service up there is worth it. A couple of days it wasn't quite as "serene" and we would have liked with people getting loud at the pool bar, but it still was great. Lunch at Ferraro's was wonderful. The staff was fabulous. We just wish we could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tennismom10
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful one week stay with my 12 yr old daughter. It was what you would expect from a Four Seasons hotel. Pricey, but well worth it! Would definitely recommend this hotel. My parents stay next door at the Grand Wailea. There was nothing wrong with it, but the Four Seasons was just superior in every way. Glad we chose the Four Seasons!!

Reviews.Title: “If money were no object, we'd be back often...& for longer!”
Reviews.Author: Pete255060
Reviews.Content: I managed to sneak this booking in before my wife - who keeps a close eye on the household budget - cottoned on! Ok , so it was only for 3 nights before we headed off to Kaanapali for the remainder of the trip (although booking it through American Express gave us a 4pm checkout not to mention the room upgrade). My wife wasn't too impressed....UNTIL WE GOT THERE! I had taken the liberty of booking a spa treatment for her in advance, which she didn't think too much of....UNTIL SHE GOT THERE! (this is a recurring theme of our stay, in case you hadn't noticed.) Lisa the spa lady apparently was fantastic, and it ranked as the highlight of my wife's stay. The highlights for me included the food at Spago's (our waiter gave us a great Chardonnay recommendation: Du Mol) and the helicopter flight with Blue Hawaiian. We also had a great dinner at Ferraro's (excellent duo - violin & guitar) and lunch too. We also rated Duo for the sashimi. The lounge area boasted great musicians playing piano & double bass. Everything was top notch. The shops at Wailea proved expensive but the offerings were exquisite. Staying in the Wailea area proved a handy place to take a snorkel trip to Molokini as opposed to Kaanapali, given the closer proximity. My wife was convinced this would be a one-time only visit to Maui...UNTIL SHE GOT THERE! I'd better save my pennies, because she would like to return....in style, to the Four Seasons, which thoroughly deserves its number 1 ranking.

Reviews.Title: “Sh1t was off the hook!”
Reviews.Author: Dontworrybehappy64
Reviews.Content: I've been to Paris, I've been to Italy, and I've been to Barcelona. And in my personal opinion, my stay at the 4 seasons in Maui was the greatest experience/vacation of my life and I don't expect anything to top it! The service is outstanding, very kind and helpful. My family and I stayed in a partial ocean view room which is all you need. The view was gorgeous and so were the rooms. Everything from the lobby to the bathrooms were stunning. The work out facilities were great (weight room could've been bigger). Dining was wonderful, Ferraros offers a night time view of the ocean that cannot be described. The food was great and live violin and guitar duets made the moment special. The beach was great, pools were beautiful. Surfing was a blast, a must.

Reviews.Title: “A splurge that's worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Smitty02
Reviews.Content: To start out, this is the first time I've ever written a review. That's how impressed I was! To say they went above and beyond my expectations is an understatement. We arrived for our five year anniversary - 5 night stay (booked the one night free special). For our honeymoon, we didn't get the R&R experience we wanted. So for our five year, we really wanted to go all out on a no worries, mind numbing, life of luxury vacation. The Four Seasons really delivered. We booked a partial ocean view room. Let's just be clear from the get go that booking this trip was well outside our financial comfort zone. We're very frugal and never splurged like this on a vacation, the bar for "making it worth it" was high from the start. The resort outdid themselves by upgrading us to a prime ocean view suite since it was our anniversary. Not only was it an amazing view, we even had a lawn outside. Why is grass important you may ask? Well, when you have a little lawn like this you can pull your private lounge chairs out onto it, lay back and star gaze over a bottle of champagne. Oh yes, did I mention they gave us a free bottle of champagne to celebrate? As I said, the bar was high but they went well beyond my expectations. They really made the trip feel special and unique from the moment we arrived. In regards to the serenity pool, you need to be up and at them by 7 am to select your prime spot. If you're visiting some other time than spring break, you may be able to have your choice around 8 or 9 am. Four Seasons will only hold the chairs for one hour if you leave, but it's not enforced while seats are still available. The Serenity pool is amazing. We watched the whales play in the ocean all day. Pool side service the first day was perfect. On the first day, the staff frequently came by to check on things (Water filled? Check. Drinks? Check. Cold washcloth? Check. Watermelon? Check.). The morning of our second day, the Japanese Tsunami hit HI at 3 AM. Many of the staff had been evacuated the night before and had not seen their homes or checked in with family before reporting to work. As a result, the remaining days were good, but the frequency of service was less. No big deal. Food on property is good, better than off property (HI is not known for cuisine). The best value and end-to-end experience is the daily full breakfast buffet. The service there was consistently great. We ate in the lobby bar one night - sushi. It was good, but overpriced for a casual dinning experience. The truth be told, two of us dining on a light dinner in the lobby and eating a full meal at Ferraro was within $25. Our stay was wonderful. From the room service, house keeping, valet, and concierge, it was amazing how gracious these folks always were. We'll definitely be staying at a Four Seasons again (my wife is already planning our next trip, Italy, and of course the Four Seasons is now on the list). If you're going to Hawaii and looking to spend a fair bit of time on the resort, then this is the place. Take the plunge, it will be memorable.

Reviews.Title: “We were treated like royalty!”
Reviews.Author: sirjohn1962
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing! The staff is wonderful; they all act like they love their jobs, and are all about making the guests happy. We were pampered beyond belief. The room was wonderful. The location is awesome, with a beautiful rock and coral free beach. Even on days when there were a few scatered clouds they seemed to skirt out around our hotel leaving basking in the full sun. They have a free outrigger canoe program that is a must, but space is limited so you might want to call before you arrive and reserve your spot so you don't miss out. Loved the constant complimentary little snacks around the pool area and the daily relaxation treatment complete with Evian spritz! The only down side I can see is that the rooms are very pricey and then they also charge for some of the extras you might expect to be included (internet access, parking). If money is not a problem for you you will love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong staying here!”
Reviews.Author: beachbabyMemphis
Reviews.Content: We had the most enjoyable vacation ever due in large part to staying at the Four Seasons Maui. The service it the best I've ever experienced. They just won't allow you to have a bad time. We went in March and it was not crowded at the Four Seasons but as we walked down the beach to the Grand Wailea and Marriott, you could hardly find a spot on the beach or at their pool that wasn't taken by guests. The conceriege was extremely helpful at arranging our outings. Definitely the way to go on choosing things to do. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. The hotel is lovely and we hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “You must stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SEWZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights in March 2011. Prior to arrival, we were at the St. Regis in Kauai for five nights, and I wish we would have stayed longer at the Four Seasons instead, as it rained the entire time we were in Kauai. I booked our room through www.whatahotel.com, and was so pleased with the result. Our package included daily buffet breakfast for two, lunch at Ferraroâ€™s and an upgrade for the same rate as was published on the hotel website. I will definitely be using this website to book hotels in the future â€“ it was great to not have to worry about breakfast in the morning (which was very nice but quite expensive). Everything that you read about the hotel is true â€“ it is absolutely worth every penny. The service is amazing, the grounds are beautiful, the beach is perfect for swimming, snorkeling, paddleboarding, etc. The hotel bar was a wonderful place to have a drink in the evening. We ate at every restaurant in the hotel and were happy for the most part. A nine course, wine paired dinner at Spago was truly the highlight of the trip; IT WAS SPECTACULAR. The only issue I could find with the hotel was that our bed was extremely old and uncomfortable. I wish we had asked to move rooms, as Iâ€™m sure they would have been more than accommodating. After coming from the wonderful bed at the St. Regis, this was a disappointment. If you are traveling without kids, the adults-only serenity pool is the perfect place to spend the day. We got up early every day to reserve our chairs and it was well worth it. The hotel offers daily free beach yoga and fitness classes. It felt like a really healthy place to vacation. Overall, I absolutely loved the hotel and cannot wait to go back. I cried when the valet pulled the car up to leave for the airport â€“ it was that amazing. Yes, itâ€™s expensive, but absolutely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “$$$$$ and worth every penney!”
Reviews.Author: Major12
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for five nights before going to Oahu and Waikiki and we want to go back Now! What a wonderful hotel and staff - we just can't say enough good things about the employees. We stayed in a room on the top (8th) floor, which is the club floor and the service experienced at the Club Room was fantastic as was the food and drinks offered throughout the day and evening. To a person the employees there were some of the best hotel employees we have ever experienced. Our room was very clean with a beautiful view of the inner courtyard of the hotel and the ocean beyond. It was also very quiet at night - no disruptions at all. Okay, there was the tsunami warning with the sirens going off every hour. Fortunately the wave action only created minor damage on Maui and nothing to Wailea beach or the Four Seasons. Other than that experience it was very peaceful and relaxing. The room also has a huge bathroom and a good size lanai. The pool area is relatively small for a Hawaii resort, but more than adequate and you can always go down to beautiful Wailea beach directly in front of the resort. Once again the employees at the pool were exceptional. We only tried Spago for dinner on our first night and were mildly disappointed due to cold food and I have reviewed the restaurant separately. We used the club room for breakfast and a light lunch and the food there was great so why use a hotel restaurant. The grounds of this Four Seasons were extremely well cared for and quite beautiful. Of all of the resorts I have stayed at on Maui (about ten) this place is on the top of the list now and it more than lives up to the Four Seasons name for luxury and overall quality. So we say save your $$ and give this resort a try on your next visit to Maui. I'm pretty sure we'll be back next year. In this case you do get what you paid for!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, Amazing, Amazing”
Reviews.Author: My_Visit
Reviews.Content: We went for our anniversary, were supposed to stay 4 nights and go back to Honolulu, but decided to stay on two more nights. We had one of the best rooms on the 9th floor. While the room is angled as many hotels in Hawaii, the view is quite lovely out on the lanai. The bathroom was luxurious. Service was amazing. We were greeted when we arrived with drinks and leis. We were early and were able to get into our room pretty quickly. The pool and beach side service was impeccable. Never had a problem getting cabanas and shaded lounge chairs. Loved that you don't have to pay extra for the cabana like many hotels. The morning beach yoga, other classes, and scuba diving were great. Loved every restaurant. The best was the personalized service. After a couple of days, I wasn't in the mood for the same salad dressing, so they made me one from scratch based on ingredients I asked for. My husband and I both have special dietary needs, and the manager went and got us certain ingredients from a local organic shop and made available to us from any locaion on the property. It was all very impressive. The location is excellent, great views and beach area. The property is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - If you can afford it!”
Reviews.Author: Rols001
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon in Feb 2011. The Resort is nice and the service is fantastic, we were treated to a complementary bottle of champagne and fondue after our arrival. Resort staff are friendly and very helpful. The resort is located on the opposite side of the island to the airport - its about a 30min drive from the airport. Since we didn't have a car we took the "speedishuttle" which cost us around $80 for a return trip for 2. The resort is in great condition personally I think they need more pools and the room decor is a bit dated but nothing to complain about. We did a whale watching tour which was good and went to a luau at the Grand Wailea next door which was too expensive for what it was - $100 per person for a 1 round buffet & some dancing (at least it was open bar) but I wouldn't recommend it to others. One other note - dining here is VERY expensive everything from the restaurants to room service and in between. All in all it was a great stay & I'd recommend this hotel to others - if you can afford it!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT- VERY PEACEFUL 5 STAR HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: kbraun
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many fine hotels in the world, so I feel I can give an unbiased review of the four seasons Maui. The year before this I traveled to Waikiki Beach and stayed at the Royal Hawaiian and was very disappointed. The room was tiny, old, and had no balcony. The beach in Waikiki is crowded and touristy. Maui has a totally different vibe. Upon arrival, everything was lovely. We were greeted kindly and check in was a breeze. We had booked a garden view room and it was spacious and lovely. It was on the ground floor with a nice little deck with chair facing the manicured grounds. The room was very clean and modernly furnished. The bathroom was large and open and clean as well. The food at the hotel is all 5 stars. The restaurant by the pool had excellent salads. I didn't get a chance to eat at Spago unfortunately but I heard that was excellent. We ate the brunch at the hotel lobby restaurant, which was also fabulous. The spa is not overly large, but very quiet and charming. My boyfriend and I both had nice massages. The beach is nice, except in the afternoon the wind REALLY picks up. So itâ€™s almost impossible to stay at the beach unless you wanted to be pelted by sand. I did not find the beach overly crowded at all, and we enjoyed renting free snorkel gear from the hotel. The Shops at Wailea are right next to the hotel, which is nice. Cheeseburger in Paradise is a must for lunch. The staff was all A+ and friendly and courteous throughout the hotel. The adult pool was probably the busiest. We had to wait to get a chair for 30 min at one time. My boyfriend enjoyed the poolside bar. The hotel overall is VERY serene. It's a very peaceful atmosphere. The only thing I didn't like really was the high winds in the afternoon which were unbearable at the beach and uncomfortable at the pool, but that has nothing to do with the hotel. The concierge was also very friendly with us and gave good recommendations where to go jet skiing.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch service”
Reviews.Author: BGosivetti
Reviews.Content: Great location & facilities. Service is extremely attentive. Resort facilities can get crowded, but staff are responsive and solicitous, and do everything they can to improve your experience. Concierge desk is knowledgeable and very useful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience lives up to reputation”
Reviews.Author: travelingmarCalgary
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for one night and the service was super. Had dinner at the Duo and was not really that impressed with the food but it was not bad just not great. One difficulty we had was trying to find a place to have a quiet drink on a Saturday night and we had no success finding a place to sit in a lounge. The room was fabulous but avoid the mountain view by the HVAC. The noise and steam do not make it amenable to sitting on the balcony. Great experience and takes one item off the bucket list.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I Have Ever Been To”
Reviews.Author: miken01
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went here on our honeymoon and it was truly an unforgettable time. The hotel is spotless, there is enough room at the pool, grounds and beach to find plenty of seating. The staff is the best and most hospitable service industry workers I have ever encountered. The food at all of the restaurants was amazing and to top it all off your in Hawaii! If you are even questioning this hotel for a second, stop and BOOK IT you wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: april207
Reviews.Content: All I can say is book now. This is the most perfect vacation spot. We traveled with our two small kids. The hotel is extremely kid-friendly. The kids receive a welcome gift and cookies their first night. They even spell out their names in sponges. My husband and I were celebrating our anniversary so the hotel sent up a bottle of bubbly and cake. The service is top notch. My daughter went to the Kids Club and loved it. Kids who are five and under eat free at the restaurants. Ferraros is the easiest with kids but we did see kids at Spago and Duo as well. We tried a nanny one night via Nanny Connection (the concierge hooks you up). That was easy and turned out really well. There is a huge game room. Every day their are about four or five free exercise classes. Oh and the services by the pool are amazing. Several time a day the staff comes around with treats - muffins, rice krispie treats, fruit, otter pops, evian spritzes and cucumbers for your eyes. It's pure heaven!!! It's a bit on the pricey side but there are no extras. The hotel doesn't charge you for cabanas or beach chairs or stick you with a resort fee. If your kids are five and under you don't even need to pay for their food! They do charge $20 a night for parking and $6 a day for wireless internet. Next time, I would not take a car.

Reviews.Title: “DONT STAY AT FOUR SEASONS.....”
Reviews.Author: jody_bennett
Reviews.Content: Staying here now at Four Season Maui in RM670 for 7 days. Property is small so hotel is has many bad rooms that are on street side. Very noisy. I havent slept in days. Staff is not courteous and are frankly arrogant. I've stayed at Grand Wailea and Fairmont next door and they are much nicer rooms and restaurants for same/price.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: Mer13
Reviews.Content: I decided to finally write some reviews since I have relied on alot of these for planning my trips. My husband and I went to Maui & Kaui in August of 2010. We stayed at the Four Seasons in Maui. It was the most amazing hotel experience EVER. From the minute we got out of our car the staff was there to serve our every need. We got a free upgrade and had a room that was a palace. The location of the hotel is PERFECT if you are looking for a place on the beach. Many hotels I read about like the Ritz Carlton in Maui did not seem to have promising beach situations. I assure you the beach is wonderful here. We saw sea turtles just from snorkeling right off the hotel beach. They have tons of water sports like paddle surfing right there available for you to rent. The pool is beautiful and the infinity pool was everything people have been saying about it. It has gorgeous views and it's very peaceful. The hotel is definitely expensive, however it's worth the splurge. The only thing that was a little overrated was Spago. We knew the price was going to be alot, but we weren't all that impressed. Down the block make sure you go to this restaurant in the Wailea hotel. I forget the name offhand, but that was one of our best meals in Maui. The concierge can set you up with reservations, info, and they even set the car for your day with water and snacks. I can't say enough about this place. It really has everything you can want and expect in a luxury hotel. There is live music every night too which is nice. It's not party central, but if you are there with a spouse and are looking to relax it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, just remember perfection doesn't exist.”
Reviews.Author: johnjudge
Reviews.Content: Big, clean, nice rooms, a beautiful resort and friendly, attentive staff. This resort is great. Three pools, a lovely beach, three good restaurants plus pool side dining. Ok it's the 4 seasons we know it is close to perfections... but what is the down side? The valets have to go a long way to get your car, so call down so you don't have to wait. The restaurants are expensive (yes I get it is Maui and the 4 Seasons) even compared to 4 Seasons on the big island. The food (Even Spago) didn't quite match my expectations or my wifes. Ferraro was blah, Duo was pretty good, and Spago well it didn't work out well for us. The best meal we had at the Four Seasons was a dinner pool side off the lunch menu. So go, stay there, have a great time, but realize ahead of time there will flaws despite their best intentions. It's life. But they try very hard.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely want to go back and stay longer next time.”
Reviews.Author: toocolduphere
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 21/2 weeks on Maui and stayed at 6 different places. We enjoyed each one for different reasons but we saved Four Seasons for our last two nights and we were glad we did, what a treat! I was a little hesitant to book the Four Seasons partially because of the price and although I like really nice hotels, I was concerned it might be stuffy. We loved our garden view room......so spacious, clean, big bathroom and verrrry comfy bed! The service was fabulous from check in to check out. Very friendly, they were there when/if you needed them but not over the top. We had dinner at Ferraro's one night and Spago's the next thinking we were saving the best for our last night. Turns out we preferred Ferraro's. We didn't have reservations so had to sit at the bar. We loved the food (lobster linguine..yum), atmosphere and there was even some live music. Spago's was rather dark and had a dull atmosphere. (we were inside so perhaps outside on the patio would have been better) The food was flavorful but very expensive for the amount you get and I usually do prefer smaller portions. Very beautiful hotel, great location. I definitely hope to go back and stay longer next time. (by the way, our other 2 favourite places to stay were The Inn at Mama's Fish House and Ho'oilo House bed and breakfast)

Reviews.Title: “A special place......”
Reviews.Author: dbrooke11
Reviews.Content: This place is such a special place and everyone is just happy to be there. Maui in general is a beautiful island, but then when you come back for the day to the Four Seasons, you just have a constant smile on your face. The service is incredible. They think of things you may need even before you do. And all staff is as friendly and personable as you can imagine. A definite gem.......

Reviews.Title: “The best service ever!”
Reviews.Author: mauibound9902
Reviews.Content: The Four Season Wailea is hands down the best hotel we've stayed in on any of the islands. It may be the best hotel, service wise, we've ever stayed in. My husban summed it up in one word...anticipate. They anticipate your every need--with a smile. I read a review before we left that the staff was so friendly (but the guests were not.) I'd have to say that I found that to be true as well--but not all. Our 2 weeks there was fabulous! I would not stay anywhere else in Hawaii. Wailea is a wonderful town..and though we went allover the island (driving, sailing, hiking, and helicopter) if you didn't want to leave the Four Seasons--you wouldnt be disappointed. oh..and the art work in the hotel is incredible along with local artists displaying their work every day. a gem. Can't wait to go back :-)

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at Four Seasons 11 times and counting!”
Reviews.Author: 4Molly
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here 11 times during the past 10 years. We really love this hotel. But we learned early on not to go during high season which is Thankgiving thru New Years and 4th of July weekend. Honestly the best time to go is mid January thru February. The weather is gorgeous, hotels are half full, and the whales are swimming through on their annual migration pass. The hotel is located an easy 30-minute drive from the airport. We always rent a car at the airport and drive ourselves to the hotel. It's really nice to have your own car to have the freedom to go for a drive to shop or dine. We book the car as a package with the hotel. We don't get a convertible anymore. Actually kind of a hassle, it gets windy in the afternoon and the sun gets hot. All of the convertibles we ever rented had black interior so it feels like you're cooking inside the car. So now we get a regular car with good air conditioning which is cheaper than a convertible. The Four Seasons (in the quieter seasons) usually doesn't have too many kids as families tend to stay next door at the much larger Grand Wailea which has more kiddie attractions and fun swimming pools. We always get an ocean view room. Even though we are not in our room that much during the day, it feels like a true Hawaiian vacation to see the ocean from your room. The pool is great, and we usually lay out in a cabana facing the ocean. Best to limit sun exposure because you will burn fast. The breezes keep you cool ,and it's easy to be fooled that you're not frying. You see a lot of people sunburned lobster red and they look pretty miserable. The pool service is excellent. They are always walking around with a smile bringing fresh towels, cold water, menus, sunscreen, etc. The spa is small but very good. We usually have massages at the beginning of our stay to get us in a relaxed mood. Love the breakfast buffet. It is expensive but honestly all food in Hawaii is expensive. Lunch is usually poolside - hamburgers, shakes, etc. Dinner we usually drive somewhere to Kihei or Lahaina. There are several good restaurants that the concierge can recommend. For snorkeling or diving, the little dive shack is a good place to get outfitted. You can also get certified through them, which we did, and had a lot of fun doing our dives including a night dive. In summary, it is a luxurious hotel. Very clean, well decorated, friendly and efficient staff, and good food. Is it expensive? Yes, it's a Four Seasons, not a Holiday Inn. If you want to splurge on a relaxing vacation and feel spoiled, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Service”
Reviews.Author: traveler32678
Reviews.Content: After researching on this and other travel sites, my only concern about this hotel was that it had the potential of being overhyped. Every aspect of our stay here either meet or exceeded our expectations. The grounds are beautiful, the serenity pool was amazing and the service is second to none. Its hard to describe what makes the service so exceptional. Its only noticable when you go to another hotel and experience the difference. I will say that our meal at Ferraro's was slightly above average. The ambiance and service were great but the food was so-so. A friend recommended a place called Capesce that is 5 minutes away and the Four Seasons provides a free ride too and from. The food was great, the service was good and the view is really nice. It's a pretty good place to see the sunset but Ferraro's view is better. We booked a snorkeling trip through the hotel and that was decent. The boat and the staff were great but the actual snorkeling was poor. If you have ever snorkeled or gone diving in the Caribbean you will be incredibly disappointed. It was great to be on a boat and searching for whales but the actual snorkeling portion was weak. They have a snuba option that is an additional charge and it is a total waste of money. There's absolutely nothing to see an additional 15 feet down. Dont be fooled by the overpromising sales presentation on the boat. The fitness center is great. The cardio equipment is outside and has a great view. The weight room has everything you need but is a little cramped. The other guests were extremely curtious so it wasnt a big deal. I would stay at this hotel everytime I go to Maui. It can be more expensive than some other hotels but you are never nickeled and dimed. Water, coffee, gym are all included.

Reviews.Title: “The gold standard.”
Reviews.Author: scbelle
Reviews.Content: We booked the Four Seasons through the Platinum Amex Fine Hotels and Resorts program that offers a free upgrade upon availability. When we arrived, no other rooms were ready, so they escorted us to a "mountainview room" but told us not to unpack. The room was perfectly acceptable, and though there is no view, they had disguised the parking garage and the landscape was lovely enough that it was fine. We spent some time cleaning up from travel and then exploring the resort and checked back with the Front Desk. They had already collected our suitcases and moved them to a ground floor garden view executive suite. We LOVED this room. There are some perks to not having an ocean view--primarily PRIVACY. Our room had two lanais, which was nice as well. They have added doors so that the living area of the suite can be separated from the bedroom, which is quite nice as well. While we spent as little time as possible in the room, it was the height of luxury. Lovely, lovely, lovely. Bed was very comfortable. Bathroom was spacious and divine. Public areas of the hotel are to-die-for gorgeous because they have truly taken advantage of their seafront hillside. The vistas are amazing--from the lobby bar, we could watch whales playing out in the bay. Magical. As my mother had been kind enough to plan this mother-daughter trip, I booked us 80-minute "Mele Wailea" massages in the oceanside "hale haus"--what a treat. Also, very nice after the long flight from the east coast! The little massage huts are tucked away from the main hustle and bustle of the beach and pools, so they were very quiet. Massages were very good. The spa facilities were very nice--was particularly enamored with the Toto Shower Towers. Absolutely lovely. That said, we also visited the Grand Wailea spa... While the FS spa was in much better shape, it had many fewer amenities... Ocean was lovely, but my mother is not super fond of sand (she prefers to look at it rather than lie on it) so we spent most of our time at the pools. There are many little nooks and crannies on the terraced hillside to lounge as well. Pools were both lovely. We only spent one day at the main pool, however, and then only because it was too windy up at the serenity pool. It was not too noisy at the main pool, but it was not as... serene ;) Oh, the serenity pool. Perhaps my favorite place on earth? They are quite serious about the age limit--I am in my twenties and was definitely asked for ID--be forewarned if you look young! Their are ample loungers (and those with covers if, like me, you burn easily) and they are wonderfully comfy. The serenity pool is located on a little cliffside and the views from the infinity pool are amazing (more whale watching!). Service is superb with all of the cold towels/cucumbers, water, evian spritz, cold fruit, etc. Swim up bar makes excellent drinks--I was particularly addicted to the blueberry mojitos. There is also a nice hot tub. Love love love. Activities: I had arranged all of our off-resort activities before the trip. I highly recommend a private "road to hana" tour--yes, you *can* drive it yourself, but then the driver misses out on the views. We did the full loop which was very interesting. We also did a helicopter tour of Wailea and Lanai--can't recommend highly enough. So beautiful--and this time the whale watching was as if you were a national geographic cameraman! I would skip the luau's unless you have at least a group of four--you need to bring your own party, if you know what I mean. The only resort activity we did was the sea-kayaking expedition to watch whales--HIGHLY RECOMMEND! We even perhaps got too close, but WHAT an amazing experience. DO IT!!!! RESTAURANTS: Overall, I'll tell you straight: there is no reason to leave the resort to eat UNLESS you are out sightseeing. We ate at "nice" restaurants at the nearby mall, and the food was middling. FYI, I also give the famous Cheeseburger in Paradise a C-, so skip that unless you're in the neighborhood. We definitely found the food at the Four Seasons far superior to anywhere else. Room Service: We were wiped out the day of our "Road to Hana" tour and ordered pizzas and salads in our room. Pizza was hot, salad was crisp, and service was prompt. Breakfast: Our package included a continental breakfast with an amazing array of pastries, cereals, and delicious tropical fruit. They also brought us a different "special" smoothie each day--though somedays were better than others. On our "Road to Hana" day they let us pack a to-go breakfast. One day I did upgrade to a full, hot breakfast which was delicious, though not absolutely necessary. Ferraro's: I'm ashamed to say we only ate lunch here one day--but it was VERY tasty. Poolside dining: Sooooo embarassing, but every other day we were on the resort, we ended up ordering food to eat poolside. There were a lot of nachos! What can I say--it was so gorgeous up at that serenity pool I never wanted to leave! Lobby Bar: At least two nights we ended up making dinner out of selections from the bar appetizer menu. Most of the choices weren't particularly fancy, but they were yummy if you don't feel like having a formal sit down dinner. Duo: Very good steak house. We ordered pretty standard fare--it was excellent. Spago: I would say a step above Duo, if only because the menu was a little more adventurous. Absolutely delicious. Wonderful views. OVERALL: Beautiful, beautiful property. Wailea is magical. Definitely would go here again. This place DEFINES 5* properties. Not enough can be said about the quality of the staff. LOVED this place. Hawaii is hard to get to from the East Coast, particularly with the Caribbean so accessible, but I will definitely be back one day.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever!”
Reviews.Author: TableOf5
Reviews.Content: Lots of words describe this resort: romantic family friendly luxe relaxing best restaurants stellar service easy beach access We stayed at FSMaui, The Fairmont Kea Lani, Grand Wailea and Marriott Wailea and this one RULED Wailea! Grand Wailea was a MAJOR disappointment, completely unkempt and had terrible service. We didn't last 15 hours there. It was so bad we broke our reservations and literally ran back into the Four Seasons' open arms who were happy to put us back into our same amazing room at the same rate and I was pleasantly surprised when I noticed the carpet had been shampooed already! Kids Club was fantastic! We're so sold!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cakeshop
Reviews.Content: We stayed for our first time ever at a Four Seasons hotel. This was a special treat and we weren't disappointed. Were greeted with lei's and cold towels upon arrival, recieved excellent service by the pool (they lay down chair covers and then towels for you), they have lounge chairs on beach which is steps from hotel, sand buckets to borrow for small kids, free snorkel gear for 1 hour at a time, fruit offered while lounging on beach and by pool, while exercising they pour you water and give it to you at your treadmill, etc...The customer service is just beyond compare. My husband thought I was crazy but I loved the hawaiian music in the bathrooms- which were huge- they helped add to the tropical vacation ambiance. It is really expensive to stay, but have to say I didn't regret it and hope to save up some cash to go again- maybe without teenagers next time. Excellent snorkeling (saw eels and sea turtles) right outside hotel, but unfortunately were only able to go 1 day- other days were bad conditions. If you're there and the conditions are good- make sure to go out (even multiple times a day) and enjoy it because you never know if you'll get to go again. One negative- went for cocktails at lounge to see hawaiian dancer at night (nice ambiance great music and dancer) but cocktails and appetizer were the worst I ever had and I was very disappointed because I expected it to be great. Food by pool was good,but not sure what happened at the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “The best resort in Wailea”
Reviews.Author: cacktusjack
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Wailea is a really huge hotel. It's more like a hotel than a resort/hideaway. But it is beautiful and the staffs are amazing! Celebs seem to love it, too. ;) We were greeted warm and personally and had a wonderful time there. Because of high-season it often was hard to get pool chairs and we had to queue up for breakfast regularly. This was shock for us at a Four Seasons hotel. We briefly told them that this is really uncommon for us but did not complain. Later during our breakfast a supervisor came and offered us some complimentary food/drinks and apologized for the inconvenience. We also had a nice talk. The professional and warm way they dealt with the "problem" was outstanding! We really felt the hotel cares about us which is the most important thing about luxury hotels. We will come back for sure!! PS: We loved the pool-chairs on the hill facing the ocean and West Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Over-hyped”
Reviews.Author: PS11
Reviews.Content: It is a fabulous property with great service. But, when a 'prime' ocean view room means over 80% of the view is of other hotel rooms, when an upgrade means moving to the 'worst' rooms of next category (i.e., lower floors, close to smoking areas), when paid wireless internet has two price-points - low bandwidth and broad-band, - I really wonder is this hotel worth staying just for better perceived service. I have never written a trip advisor review but thought important enough to now write. I convinced my wife to stay here as against Ritz based on some great experience with Four Seasons and some great reviews but the Four Seasons at hotel at Maui seemed over-hyped and not a place I expected it will be.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, Absolutely Breathtaking!”
Reviews.Author: MichiganMandy
Reviews.Content: This is one beautiful upscale resort you don't want to miss. My husband and I traveled here in August and I never wanted to leave. The resort itself and the grounds are immaculate. I felt like I was walking into a postcard or the vacation experience of Gatsby! Upon arrival, we were laii'd and treated wonderfully. The resort just smells like fresh exotic flowers and the views are to die for. Our room was quite nice, with a massive bathroom and snacks. We even had a bottle of champagne delivered as it was our anniversary. The resort is built into a hill so everything slopes down toward the beach. It was a bit windy down on the beach, so we usually opted to stay around the pool area (the serenity pool is the place to go) or one of the cabanas on the hillside. The dining options were lovely, but very pricey. We went to Wolfgang's Spago restaurant and we each ordered a drink, and split 4 small plates. The bill almost reached $300. There are other places to eat around town though. There are attendants all over the place waiting to put a towel on a chair for you, get you a beverage, spritz you with water or do anything you ask of them. Amazing service. I felt like royalty. This is a place the celebrities vacation, that is how good it is. In fact, Eddie Murphy and his family was in the cabana next to us! He was with his family of course and people weren't bothering him like they probably would at other resorts. If you want a truly quality and memorable experience, book your vacation here. But also be prepared to spend alot of money!

Reviews.Title: “A True Five-Star Resort!”
Reviews.Author: lillychambers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Four Seasons in Maui for 10 days, and were truly bathed in the lap of luxury. They upgraded us to a room with an ocean view. The food was wonderful, but expensive. The service was better than we have ever experienced. They even remembered your name when they came around to the pool chairs with wet towels. We wouldn't recommend this resort for kids, but if you are looking for a romantic escape then this hotel is one of the finest you'll find!! -:)

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best”
Reviews.Author: AmyGoes211
Reviews.Content: Simply put, this is the most luxurious hotel my husband & I have ever stayed in. We enjoy all types of hotels for all types of reasons, but this one just knocked my socks off! We spent three nights here and were constantly impressed with the level of service and friendliness from the staff. When we approached the check-in desk, the lady noticed we hadn't received a lei yet, so she made a call and we got them promptly. This is one example of the little things that really make a difference. Our favorite part of our stay was the Serenity Pool (adults only). We were at the Four Seasons to experience ultimate relaxation, and this is the place to be. We did have to get up around 6:30 AM to be in line to secure our seats by the pool when it opened at 7, but this wasn't a problem for us at all since we are naturally early risers, especially in Hawaii. We would spend hours by the pool, being waited on hand and foot. The chairs were very comfortable and covered with a fresh clean towel just for us, and we could leave at any time for up to an hour and they'd save our seats. This made it possible to go to the breakfast buffet or take a brief swim in the ocean. Service people constantly came by offering things to us - a refill of ice water, a chilled towel, jello, fruit slices, ice pops, muffins, etc. It was never ending and so awesome. The beach was nice - we spent one afternoon there and the service was great. The worker set up chairs and an umbrella for us, gave us fresh towels, and they even water down the scalding hot sand so you don't burn your feet! There is a path leading from the Four Seasons going both north and south along the beach to some of the neighboring hotels. We only used it to walk around for fun, but there were runners/walkers and also people going to other hotels for dinner. It's very convenient. We visited the spa and found it to be top notch. Go early to spend some time in the locker room/steam room, it is very nice. I got a massage and a facial. The massage was awesome, the facial was pretty good. The spa itself is completely relaxing, very beautiful, and serene. We had drinks and/or dessert in the lobby bar each night and the service was great. The desserts were spectacular. We had dinner one night at Ferraro's and found the food to be delicious and the service to be impeccable. We ate dinner kind of early at 6:30, but we had an unbeatable view of the sunset. In short, this is an amazing resort and you will not be disappointed if you choose to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: Whit_Wilson
Reviews.Content: This hotel is incredible. The property is beautiful--we especially liked the serenity pool. The rooms are extremely modern and spacious. The gym facilities were very well equipped. The service is excellent. Perhaps our favorite part of the experience, however, was the food. Even though it is not cheap, it is actually a pretty good value considering the quality of the food, the size of the meals, and the presentation.

Reviews.Title: “Magical”
Reviews.Author: Cosima21
Reviews.Content: We loved our event stay in this wonderful hotel. The staff was wonderful and we appreciated all the activities the hotel has to offer. There were wonderful exercise classes and water sports. The spa was serene with great therapists. The food was great at all three restaurants. A nearby mall offers a pleasant shopping opportunity! I would love to go back and would recommend it for absolutely anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on Earth!”
Reviews.Author: mfost
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled here for 5 nights as one of 5 hotels we stayed at on our Hawaiian Honeymoon! Though all the hotels we stayed at were top notch (including the Ritz and the St Regis) nothing came close to touching the quality, beauty and service of the Four Seasons Wailea. The rooms were perfect with giant bathrooms that included a huge double sink, separate vanity, music selection with speakers, and little conveniences such as woolite and after-sun lotion for guests. Bathroom products were L'Occitane, which was luxurious, too! Rooms came with a big plasma tv, complimentary water, and a dvd player (for which guests could borrow dvds free of charge from the concierge!) The people at the hotel gave you water and towels, too, whenever you went on any excursion. What placed this hotel above all others is the quality of the service. You are not allowed to lift a finger and they anticipate every possible need you could have. For example, they set you up at the pool chairs by helping you find a spot, arranging your umbrellas, lying out towels for you, getting you ice water (and filling it every few minutes without being in your face). They bring you ice cold towels by the pool to refresh with, and cucumbers for your eyes, while offering to mist you with this cool aromatherapy water! There are pumps of sunscreen by the pool (waterproof in different strengths) that smell amazing so you needn't fret if you forget to bring your own. I literally could go on for hours about all the little things they do that put them above any other hotel (even other Four Seasons establishments). There is the main pool (with a kiddy pool offside) which is spectacularly gorgeous, and then the 'serenity pool' which is for adults only. The serenity tpool has an infinity pool which looks as though it runs into the ocean. It's a bit quieter and is definitely worth going. It's smaller, which means it fills up quickly, but you get on a waiting list and will be in fast, and they will call you when they have your chairs set up for you! Though some may find this to be annoying, you can still stay at the other pool which is just as beautiful....plus, the size of the serenity pool is what makes it special and quieter! The concierge and staff are wonderful, and they take pride in offering recommendations and arranging your activities. They even send your ininerary up to your room for you to keep track of everything! Their recommendations for activtiies and restaurants were always spot on - when we followed our own paths (instead of listening) the meals were never as good (but hey, sometimes you have to be adventurous!) There were lots of good places to shop nearby, too! The spa was wonderful with a very serene atmosphere and lovely products. They had a reasonable deal going on at the time, two services for $200 so I ended up getting a 1 hour facial and 1 hour massage and was thrilled with both. The buffet breakfast was the best we had out of all other hotels - the pastries were fresh and kept under a warmer...nothing like a toasty croissant to start your morning! And they had custom omlettes, waffles and pancakes made just for you with lots of toppings to choose from. We had dinner at the hotel's restaurant DUO one night at it was one of our favorite meals of our whole trip - definitely try the mac and cheese, you might die from deliciousness. My only regret was not coming to the four seasons as the last stop on my honeymoon, as nothing could compare. This is the hotel that all other hotels in the world should aspire to be. They have many staff who have been working there for 10 years plus, which is clear as they cater to your every need with a smile. What's more, if you offer them tips they seem genuinely surprised...not like those other hotels that go above and beyond but do so with their hands out. If you're looking for heaven on earth, stay here and don't consider for a milisecond staying anywhere else! I will forever spend the rest of my days figuring out how to get the hell back to the 4SW!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible, Over the Top Service at Four Seasons Maui”
Reviews.Author: Manihi
Reviews.Content: WOW! Unbelievable and discrete service, incredible attention to the smallest of details, and a beautiful hotel at the best beach on Maui. This hotel deserves its five stars status by a long margin. It makes other five stars hotel pale in comparison. Other might have good to excellent service when you ask for but at the Four Seasons Maui, they anticipate your needs without you having to raise a hand to ask. The rooms were as clean as they can get, everything are modern, well decorated, spacious, with a dream bathroom. We loved each detail of the hotel from the room to the pool service, valet, bell desk, restaurants, reception and even personalized touches that were given to each of us. Our experience at the Four Seasons Maui put them on the top of our hotel selection when we travel again. It is just unfair to the competition as each five stars hotel we go to now must prove that they belong in the same league as the Four Seasons Maui. We can only hope that their level of service continues to excel and exceeds our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you read is true!”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl056
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons in Wailea for 5 nights in December. We had a partial ocean view room, which was on the 4th floor of the resort and you had a side view of the ocean. While the 4th Floor sounds high it was really on the ground level and we had a corner room so the steps exiting that floor were to the left of our balcony. The balcony was large, but the location not ideal. To be honest, we barely used our balcony due to its location. People tended to smoke on the stairs. The room was also next to the supply room for the cleaning crews and it got a little noisy at 7.30 am every morning (it was room 413). Our air conditioning tended to be noisy too if it was on low. All small things, just minor annoyances. No other complaints with the room, large bathroom, double sink, comfy bed, complimentary water in the room and wherever you went in the resort. The resort and grounds were really top notch. We only had difficulty once getting seating at the serenity pool and put our names on a waiting list. We loved the convenience of the adult pool, but I would have liked it to be a little larger. This was the first time I'd been to Wailea and absolutely loved it! We used the beach front pathway to venture out at night to dinner. We walked over to the Wailea shops (15 min walk) a couple of times and the other direction towards the Fairmont (about 10 mins). Be warned especially heading to the Fairmont at night, parts of the pathway are pitch dark. I loved Nick's at the Fairmont, more upscale, white table cloths, etc. Highly recommend it, great food. We also went to Humu Restaurant at the Grand Wailea next door for my husband's birthday. Nice, but not great, I wish we had gone to Nick's for his birthday, more of an occasion place to go. Loved Ferraro's at the resort, great service good food. They had an extensive Italian wine menu that we had difficulty navigating but the food was great. Great buffet at Duo's in the morning (about $30 p/p). All these places were very expensive (drinks at the pool were expensive), but just factor that in before you get there and the sticker shock will be better! We did visit the spa. It was very nice and relaxing, I wouldn't say it was anything extraordinary but very enjoyable, not crazy expensive either. We had a car and explored the island quite a bit. If you don't have a car you'll most probably spend more time at the resort and the beach. Either way you can't go wrong! All in all it was a very relaxing 5 nights. I would categorize the resort and the experience as understated luxury. I would love to check out the beach front villas next time at the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: michael14ny
Reviews.Content: Going in we had high expectations from all we had heard about this place. My wife and I stayed here for 6 nights on our honeymoon. Happy to say it lived up to much of its hype. The property is very nice and the service is above any other place I have been. We had booked a garden view and got upgraded to a ocean view suite which was great. The week after thanksgiving is a quiet week so the place wasn't too packed which was a perk. In a crowded week, I can imagine the fights for pool chairs is annoying as even we had to get down by 8am for chairs in the sun. We rented a convertible and did a drive on the road to Hana - an interesting thing to do once in your life. Did dinners at Ferraros and Spago on property, plus drove outside to Mamas Fish House, Capische, and Pacifico. All quite good. Highlights: Pool and resort service is great and what really differentiates this place, including staff knowing your names and constantly bringing ice water, cold towels, pineapple, sample shots and smoothies of the days, sunglass cleaning, avion sprays, etc. The adult serenity pool / hottub have amazing views and a nice bar. Property itself is gorgeous. Outdoor gym is nice. Eat offsite a few nights to get out and see scenic parts of Maui. Beach is great. Paddleboarding was a blast. Downsides: Long trip from NY. Its also a big hotel that sits on a popular beach next to a few other hotels so you are reminded that this is a crowded beach destination. (For a more quiet and private feeling, go to the Four Seasons Hualalai on the Big Island - we went there for our next week and its like your own private island vacation). Prices are ridiculous but you know that going in - but eat offsite to save a few bucks and stock your fridge from nearby stores. No drink or food service on the beach is disappointing but its a public beach so not hotels fault. Overall a great place and amazing first leg of our honeymoon. If we lived on the west coast, would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “You can't put a price on heaven”
Reviews.Author: PortCreditLadybug
Reviews.Content: Ok, this hotel is expensive. But it is absolute perfection. We stayed in a prime ocean view room, which was around $750 a night after discounts. There are so many activities at this hotel which are geared toward young people and young families that I should point out that even the cheapest room gives you access to ALL of the facilities at this fabulous resort. This hotel is so beautiful it will take your breath away. It also has the best restaurant in Mauii - Spago. Wolfgang Puck was there signing his new book while we were there. I requested a special table for my husband's 60 th birthday and we we escorted to the best table in the lanai overlooking the ocean. It was an experience we will never forget and we are deeply grateful to all the staff at Four Seasons and Spago who made it so memorable for us.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: BHarrington2010
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Four Seasons Resort was outstanding. From the moment you arrived at the lobby, the staff were there to greet you and take care of all your needs. We were fortunate to have met an employee " John" who had the same interests as we had in reef diving and told us of places to dive off the beated path that we would enjoy, He always stopped for a moment each time we crossed paths to see how our stay was going and to recomend places around the island that we might enjoy. We had booked a garden View room and upon check-in were upgraded to and ocean view that was just awesome to relax out on the balcony and see the sunset. The room was spacious and bathroom was large by other hotel standards. The mini bar was stocked with waters ,coffee and ice and rooms were serviced twice daily. The staff placed different bedding schemes to keep the room looking new. The amenities were abundent and was impossible to take part in all that is offered with this fine resort. The beach is public but maintained by the hotel. During our stay,We met "Manny" who was responsible for your needs on the beach . Manny greeted you and set up your chairs and umbrellas at your favorite location on the beach. The reef in the morning was calm and had the best visibility to snorkel and take pictures. The afternoon was when the waves grew and was awesome for body surfing or just having a good time. The beach staff would come around and hand you and ice towel to cool off or jello's . The hotel had three restaurants on the property and we dined at DUO's and was not disappointed. As with this type of five star hotel,the starting menu price for a three course diner will be around fifty dollars per person and increase depending on your selection but well worth it . There are local restaurants down the road at the Wailea Shops if you wish to venture off the hotel grounds and offer a good value for the price. I've traveled to alot of countries and they were great places but this hotel stands apart from the rest,That is why I plan to return to the Four Seasons Hotel/Wailea again as it was for me one of the best relaxing times in a long time. Thanks to the entire staff for a enjoyable two weeks. B. Harrington Portland,ME

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Bluebirds2
Reviews.Content: There are some amazing resorts in Wailea-Maui which makes choosing one a difficult choice. However, after a recent stay at the Four Seasons Wailea, I will definately choose to stay there again. What really made our stay extraordinary at the Four Seasons-Wailea was the people who worked there. Everyone, from the valet, receptionist, housekeeping, pool attendants, and restaurant workers were friendly, caring, and attentive. They worked extra hard to make sure our stay was a pleasant experience....and it truly was! I booked my stay through the What a Hotel website. The perks they offer, plus all the "little extras' that the Four Seasons provides, adds up to a good savings. We went on the outrigger canoe; a couple of exercise classes; played pool; borrowed CD movies; and had a private cabana..... all for FREE! No additional resort fee here! (Though there is a $20 parking fee per day.) Awaiting us in our spacious and beautifully decorated room was a plate of scrumptious tea desserts, water (in the mini fridge), coffee, and a generous supply of L'Occitane bath products. Though I hesitantly booked the least expensive room (mountain view), I was very pleased with it, and would do it again! I liked the spacious balcony, with comfortable furnishings to view the mountains and surrounding trees. The parking garage below my room was partially concealed and did not hinder my enjoyment of the room and surrounding view. Infact, I barely noticed it because the mountain view was so pretty. There is a bit of car noise, however, from the nearby street, but it was minimal or non-existant with the sliding glass door closed. We ate twice at Ferrarro's because the food was so good. I can hardly wait to go to the Four Seasons Wailea again. What started out as a "splurge" vacation, turned out to be a "value" in what we received from our whole experience there.

Reviews.Title: “One word - WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dolphin7410
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Wailea for a total of 4 nights. For our first 3 nights, we stayed at a much less expensive hotel off the beach, because we were barely going to be in our room during that time. On night four, we decided to try the Four Seasons and see what all the fuss was about. We had absolutely no plans - just wanted to relax and have some fun. We booked a mountain view room, but were upgraded to a partial ocean view room upon check in. That was a nice surprise! We had a ton of bags crammed into a tiny convertible, but the bell man was a pro and handled all of our luggage with great care. He was extremely pleasant and offered us many good tips for the rest of our trip. Before our room was ready, we did a quick walk around the grounds. A gentleman working at the pool greeted us and answered some questions we had with a smile, and also offered to take a picture of us. The service at all the restaurants and bars was wonderful. We ate dinner at Spago and it was very good, although be prepared to pay big bucks for it. We also sat in the lobby bar area for the hula/torch lighting ceremony, and it was pretty cool. On our first day, we spent most of our time at the main pool right in front of the beach. It wasn't a problem to find a covered cabana, and the chairs are the most comfortable I've ever been in. We went upstairs to check out the Serenity Pool, but there weren't any chairs available so we decided to come back first thing in the morning. We ate breakfast at 6:30 in Duo (best breakfast I've ever had, actually) and were ready to snag our chairs at 7:00. There was a short line of people waiting, but we got the chairs we wanted and there were plenty left over for at least an hour or two. We were told that we were permitted to leave the area for up to an hour and they wouldn't move our things. Two hours during lunchtime. We really loved the Serenity Pool and hot tub. The view is wonderful, and I really liked being there first thing in the morning when so few people were there. Yes, there really is music playing under water! I had forgotten about that, so it was a surprise when my husband and I went underwater. The pool bar opened at 10AM. The beach is really beautiful and nice. We didn't spend a ton of time on it because we were really enjoying the pools. We did get some coffee and the little snack bar by the beach (called Snorkels, I think?) and it was pretty good. When we checked out, we had to once again fit all of our bags into a small convertible. The bell man handled packing the car for us, and did a much better job that we had done. He seemed happy to do it. We weren't at the Four Seasons long, but it was long enough to fall in love with it! We are still dreaming about it and can't wait to go back. No negatives to report at all!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: CThom7
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I spent four nights of our two week honeymoon in Hawaii at the Four Seasons, and although it is a bit pricey for our budget, we are glad we splurged. It's one of the few times in my life where I've spent way too much money, but felt absolutely no remorse when I looked at my credit card statement. To start, the staff is fantatstic-helpful, friendly and knowledgeable without being obseqious. The amenities are tops-a particular shout out to the great games room with ping pong, pool, handcurling, free internet, TV, newspapers, Guitar Hero, Wi and other video games. I loved the fitness "atrium"--lots of top notch cardio machines in a lovely outdoor setting. The breakfast buffet is incredible, and surprisingly reasonable for what you get. Spago is less reasonable, but we still had a phenomenal meal. I could go on, but I have to earn some money to pay for my vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel! You will not beat the service!”
Reviews.Author: shotbadly
Reviews.Content: Ihave stayed at a few nicer hotels such as Ritz Carlton in L.A. and a couple boutique hotels as well and this place blew my mind! Everything is spot-on. The service is astounding and the beauty of the hotel is unsurpassed. We stayed in a partial ocean view room the first night ($750.00) and found that the view wasn't worth the extra ($150.00) per night. The bathrooms are awesome and the restaurants are wonderful. I can't say enough good things about this place. Room service is really expensive so it's best to eat somewhere else for breakfast unless you want to spend the dough.

Reviews.Title: “perfect honeymoon-CLUB LEVEL”
Reviews.Author: agburch
Reviews.Content: My husband and I married in August of 2010. We originally planned our honeymoon at the Little Dix Bay in the British Virgin Islands. Needless to say, the night before we were set to fly out the following morning, a hurricane came through the BVI's & prevented us from going . Thanks to trip insurance, we ended up flying out the following day to Maui and everything transferred to the Four Seasons in Wailea. To say the very least, there is absolutely nothing either of us would change about our honeymoon. We were so thankful we went to Maui instead of where we were originally planning to go. We originally decided on somewhere else, due to the length of the flight from Tennessee to Hawaii. However, the flight was well-worth the experience we came home with. Be prepared, everything in Hawaii is expensive. Therefore, Hawaii is not the place to go if you are not prepared to spend money. That said, we would go back in a heartbeat and are trying to figure out the quickest way to get back and experience this island again. It's a lovely resort, and the service you will receive is HANDS-DOWN the best out there. If you have the money to spend, I would highly recommend the Club Level of the Four Seasons, where we were. There is no way to put into words how accommodating the staff is and what a lovely experience we had. There are many things to do in Hawaii; however we enjoyed the resort so much that we rarely left the grounds. The restaurants on site are all top notch. I researched and researched untiI I was exhausted, trying to find the perfect place for a honeymoon, I read more reviews on different locations. And thankfully because of a hurricane, we ended up at the Four Seasons in Maui. If you go, you will not regret it! We were so blessed to have had such a wonderful experience to come home with. Thank you to the Four Seasons for such a welcoming, friendly, and accomodating staff and a lovely experience that we will never forget! It truly could not have been better. We hope to be back for our 1 year anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable resort, Remarkable location”
Reviews.Author: YGlobalTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons after checking out of the disappointing Grand Wailea. We have stayed at a number of Four Seasons, Ritz-Carlton, and other high-end resorts. The hotel met or exceeded all of our expectations. The service was attentive, but warm. We enjoyed the serenity pool and found the food to be very good. This is one of the nicest hotels we have had the pleasure of staying at. The snorkeling at the hotel (complimentary equipment) was a fantastic bonus. The hotel had complimentary cabanas at the main pool, a nice perk that many luxury hotels offer at a significant cost.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding property and is deserving of it's reputation of being the best of the best”
Reviews.Author: LuckyPhil54
Reviews.Content: The hotel meets all expectations of a property that caters for everyone. Had a great time and relaxed and left recharged. Catering was 1st class as was the pool areas and beach.

Reviews.Title: “heaven on a pacific paradise,best for honeymoon !”
Reviews.Author: kikola12
Reviews.Content: leaving from los angeles after our 4 beautiful days over there,all we needed was a total luxurious relaxation,on this beautiful best located 4 seasons in maui island after a year of investigation looking & listening relatives and friends about hawaii,their tradition,culture ,activities ,helicopter tours,best spa,best beaches & best resorts! and here after a year just spend our 7 days of absolute paradicious holidays for our 10th honeymoon! we got the very best of not only the outstanding resort,but through maui's secrets,shopping ,culture & art! service was really beyond compare not only from other 4 seasons we stayed but also from our every year summer holidays in assia! here the situation is completly different .we really loved the very happy communiation of hawaiians people around the resort and we actually give the best reccomendations of service both me and my husband.it's something we are sure u cant find elsewhere except in usa,same situation in nyc and los angeles. the rooms were fantasticly located,very huge not only the rooms but bath areas with private places for men & women,furniture the colours of dark wood we always love to see on our 4 seasons resorts & not only villas or suites,that's our best taste. very huge & comfortable beds,wide big tv screen and beautiful paradicious coloured of maui's gardens which really impressed us so much! all the pools were big,very beautifully designed,the fountain one something u hardly see on other 4 seasons resorts,the serenity with the sunset every day and the opening of fire is the spot no one would ever miss in his/her life,the music under water,the palms all around the resort & gardens. absolutly relaxing time at the very luxuriously designed spa area and the relaxing outdoor areas .....what to say! best service over there too & beautiful hawaiian skills of all personel staff at the spa! the shops there,the boutigue ,the salon ,the indoor and outdoor gym is what surprised me with the very hi tech machines and mostly the view can somebody have in front while working out outdoors ,with the ways through the pacific ocean via flowers & gardens.....heaven!
