water activities the best,new things we ve learned over there during our stay,the stand up petal ,the private canoeing ,snorkelling at waileas bay and in front of fairmont keylani resort continuing swimming from our resort,very colourful big and small different fishes,stories u can never forget saying....and last but not least....my everymorning yoka lesson at 7/8 in the morning with the peacefully amazing relaxing view of the pacific ocean...while concentrading looking at the far away volcanos....another secret of hawaii's story! all these ,the amazing spago,the italian and the polynesian restaurants with the specialists on wines and best chef's with michellen stars are above words,beyond compare memories. what our eyes saw every single morning,different artists,designers from all over the world is again unigue in this hotel,the story of my life there....memories by pieces & paintings continuing in our house after our forgetable 10th hawaiian honeymoon! now i realised and learned why they have hawaii on the top list of paradicious honeymoon! and since we visited lanai & honolulu,from what our resort informed us,maui is the best,4 seasons maui again the best in whole hawaii.we really reccomend it to people looking for relaxation,luxury ,culture & mainly tropical paradise! here is a dream comes true! our heaven!

Reviews.Title: “expensive but amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: tententen
Reviews.Content: First, lets get the obvious out of the way. It's expensive. Once you accept that, you are free to thoroughly enjoy the frankly remarkable service this place has to offer. We were upgraded from the partial ocean view room to a suite for free, and we did have a partial ocean view which included the mountains in the distance (stunning at sunset and sunrise) but the drawback was that part of the parking lot was below. Not really a problem unless you're a very light sleeper. I know that we never even mentioned it to each other while we were there. The room came with dvd players in bedroom and living room, a minibar with creamer for the complimentary coffee and two free bottles of water every day. There are no other drinks in the bar, but you can call down for anything you require on their list. Room service has a very full selection and you can also order picnic baskets which come with blankets, coolers etc in case you are taking a road trip. Very thoughtful! Many people have complained here about the lack of room at the pool. I will say we tried to go to the serenity pool once, but it was booked all of that day and the next. Not very serene! The pool itself looked fine but nobody was using it, and loungers were close to each other there. We went to the main pool and had our pick of chairs at 9 or 10am every day, and once at 4pm. There was never a problem getting two adjacent chairs in a secluded area, and all kids were well behaved. Mind you, this is november and the situation is likely very different during the holidays. Most smaller children were in the kids pool area near Duo's. Pool service includes your choice of drinks and food from a menu so we had lunch at our loungers once. We tried the beach, there is less space there but we had no problem getting chairs. The snorkelling was fine but the waves were a bit strong so we had to be careful not to get washed closer to the rocks. Beautiful parrotfish and other species, but if you are used to snorkelling coral reefs this will not compare. Duo's serves a great a la carte breakfast, which is all we tried from there. Ferraro's is good too but reserve at night or you might end up eating at the bar, which we did once but we quite enjoyed it. The lounge in the lobby is usually full but offers beautiful views. Everyone who served us seemed very content and did an exemplary job. Many staff members had been at the hotel for 10-20 years, and one commented that they were treated very well there. It shows! If you are the kind of person who likes to enjoy places by exploring them and getting a more local taste of an environment, this is probably not the experience you are looking for. if you are out to unwind and be treated well, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't want to leave!!”
Reviews.Author: Champagneandcupcakes
Reviews.Content: Everything was great, the stay, front desk, Spago's, Ferrero's, beach, serenity pool, drinks, bed, room, bathroom. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Definately falls in my favorite five”
Reviews.Author: morrisonkid
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here at the end of September. Great hotel in a top notch location for Maui. Only one disapointment was that when we arrived and checked into our room it was terribly musty. They bought up an air purifier which helped a bit but we ended up moving to another room the next day. From that point on, the stay was perfect. Dinner at Duo's was excellent. Since I had Mahi Mahi the night before I had the filet mignon. It was to die for. Spago's was great too. Pool service and wait staff could not have been more attentive. Enjoyed just kicking back and being pampered. Would also recommend Maui Mountain Cruisers if you want to do a bike trip down Mt. Haleaka. We got to the summit before the crowds and had prime seating for the sunrise. Looking forward to going to Four Seasons Hualalai in 2011

Reviews.Title: “Great Time / Honeymoon at the 4 Seasons Maui”
Reviews.Author: wkatl
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property with first class service. The pool/beach is great. The spa was very enjoyable. Nice gym. Good food, albeit a bit pricey (but you are at the 4 seasons ;)). We really enjoyed it and hope to be back.

Reviews.Title: “amazing!”
Reviews.Author: MichaeldDallas
Reviews.Content: We decided to spend the last few days of our Hawaii trip in Maui and booked two rooms at the Four Seasons at the last minute. What a great decision it turned out to be. EVERYTHING was perfect. This is as beautiful a hotel as I can imagine and the staff was always at our service. Food was terrific, hotel was in perfect condition and the landscape was impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Perfection”
Reviews.Author: macaide
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Four Seasons Resort Maui at Wailea for the second leg of our Hawaii vacation this past October. Every aspect of our experience with the Four Seasons was simply amazing. We had a Ocean View prime room that had a view that exactly matched the advertisements. The pools were great too. We spent most of our time at the Serenity pool. Everything about the hotel is pricey but your in Maui and your staying at a high end resort so its all to be expected. You definitely get what you pay for. The only potential downside I see is the pools could get very crowded during the busy season. The serenity pool was packed every day and the end of October is considered to be there slow season. We never had an issue with it but I could see it being a problem during the busy season.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Maui”
Reviews.Author: kawaiitraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last summer and had an amazing experience, so decided to return this summer. Although we still had an amazing time, we were not totally satisfied with the experience this time round. When we arrived, we found that there were bloodstains on the toiletseat and the room was quite dusty. They were quick to respond to the problem and after expressing our dissatisfaction to the management, we were moved to another room. The staff were amazing, however the staff at the pool were not very quick to set up your sunbeds, even during busy times you sometimes had to ask several times. Furthermore, we were frequently told that only one cabana per room was available, which became frustrating as we had two rooms and felt that the staff should have remembered, communicating this up to twice a day sometimes took away some of the relaxation of the pool area. Despite this, I would say that it is definitely worth staying here and is probably the best hotel on the island, although I think a few areas need to be improved before it can be called a 5star hotel. The restaurants are definitely worth visiting if you are staying on the island, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the spa.

Reviews.Title: “Simply wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: UlysseLeBeauVoyage
Reviews.Content: With our 2 toddlers we spent 10 days in Four Seasons Resort Maui at Wailea. There is not much to say, one should just stay in the hotel to see what it is... Everything was amazing!!! The stuff were great! Everyone was so nice! the service was excellent! And so many gifts our children received when we just arrived and were leaving! Especially for families with children it's an amazing place!! There is a child room with plenty of toys to play with. The pool was warm enough for children not to get cold and with many toys around. Even on the beach there were lots of toys. Our room was so comfy and bathroom was so big! From restraunts we liked Spago the most. Food in Duo was OK but not as outstanding as we could expect from luxurious hotel (maybe it matches american standards but when you are used to eat fine food it's dissapointing ). In conclusion if we go to Maui again we will certainly stay there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Paradise!! Cried when we left!”
Reviews.Author: DianaNJ78
Reviews.Content: So I always get a little sad when it's time to leave a vacation destination. After all, it only means it's time to get back to reality..work, stress, etc. This time I cried (I am not at all a crier)! What can I say about the Four Seasons Maui that hasn't already been said? First of all, Maui is heaven on earth! Staying at the Four Seasons Wailea was just too good to be true. We had the most perfect honeymoon I could have ever imagined. Our intention was to go on a few tours (Road to Hana, helicopter ride over Haleakala, luau, etc). Well, we made it to the Old Lahaina Luau..on our last night!! Why would anyone want to leave this resort? We were pampered from the moment we got there till the moment we left. We got the honeymoon greeting (champagne, personalized note, rose). The day we were leaving, we decided to splurge on that "pineapple drink" we saw everyone drinking (I believe the drink is $20 each). Well, when the pool attendant brought us our pineapples, he told us they were "on the house" and said they were sad to see us go and hoped we would return for our anniversary. I mean, if that isn't great service, I don't know what is! Those were just two of the many, many things the staff did to make us feel special. I know these people are trained to use guests' names in the restaurants, around the pool, etc., but it's amazing how they remember your name even when they see you around the resort. Every new person I met congratulated us on our marriage and asked us if we were enjoying our honeymoon. The day we were checking out, so many people wished us well and hoped we'd return the following year with a little bundle of joy. I can't say enough about this hotel's staff, the grounds, the food, etc. Everything was absolute perfection. Although at one point, we considered this trip a "once in a lifetime" splurge, we now feel that this is a treat we deserve at least every few years.

Reviews.Title: “The Extra Mile...Heck the Extra 10 Miles!”
Reviews.Author: cschuten
Reviews.Content: This place is unbelievable! There have been so many good reviews, I'm just going to hit some high points. The service: The people are SO nice and fall over themselves to help. On one occasion I was at the scuba shop which is right next to Ferraro's. A waiter dropped a glass on the path next to me. I wasn't wearing any shoes as I had just come from the beach. One of the waitresses brought me a pair of slippers and 4 different people came by to appologize to me for the inconvience of broken glass. The Food: We had the breakfast buffet every morning. It was always amazing and even though you pay more for it, it's totally worth it. We had Ferraro's for lunch and many many cocktails. We were never disapointed. We had dinner at Duo's and it was outstanding. We didnt LOVE Spago. Too fancy for our taste, but if eating foods that are decorated so elaborately you can't identify it, this is your place. *The food at this resort is the best I've ever had, ever. With that said it's crazy expensive, so if you have to pack granola bars and head out elsewhere for dinner, it's worth it to experience the best place this side of heaven* Amenities: In the room you get the holy trinity plus shower lotion, after sun lotion, packet woolite, q-tips and more! Maid and turn down service. Housekeeping does a great job. There is a charge for parking ($20 nightly) and wireless internet. There are so many cool things to do at the resort, you really dont need to leave. Snorkel gear is complimentary as is the outrigger program ( I highly reccomend this). You can rent boogie boards, canoes, and paddle boards. The paddle boards are crazy fun, give it a shot. There is a really nice game room where there are video games, shuffle board, billiards, and ping pong. On Celebrities: Yep they come here. On our stay Mick Fleetwood, Jerome "the Bus" Betis, and Larrry Flynt were all there. We didnt see them, but some of our friends did. Overall impression: I LOVE THIS PLACE! It has become my mission in life to visit the other 54 four seasons. If you can swing it, it's just amazing.

Reviews.Title: “This experience was fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: tntmummy
Reviews.Content: We live in Maui part time, but needed to stay in a hotel for a few days. I was so impressed with the rooms, service and staff that I still think about my stay there almost daily. If you are going to Wailea, there is no better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Time of my Life”
Reviews.Author: Meeche1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 8 days celebrating my 50th b-day. I usually stay in 4 star hotels because we certainly can't afford this all the time BUT - do it just once in your life because there is clearly nothing like this hotel. It was more than you can imagine. Everything and everyone there was soooo classy. I can not list in this review all the great things about this hotel except that it is beyond belief. Splurge just once and you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but too crowded”
Reviews.Author: nydisneygirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Four Seasons for 5 nights during our annual trip to Hawaii. It was our first trip to this hotel, and we had high expectations due to prior stays at the Four Seasons on the Big Island. We were a bit disappointed. Is this the nicest hotel on Maui? Probably. We explored the Fairmont, the Grand Wailea, and the Ritz, and the Four Seasons seems to top them all. Our main complaint is that the hotel is just too crowded for the price. Things we liked: - staff is friendly, as you'd expect. - beach is lovely; location within Wailea is nice - outrigger canoe program very enjoyable - beautiful view from adult pool - Spago exceeded our expectations - the hotel has local artists in the lobby each day, so you can decide to check out their booths or not. Things we didn't like as much: - As others have noted, the pools are crowded, especially the adult pool. I had hoped that it being September, the pools wouldn't fill up as fast. Wrong. We had to be at the adult pool by 7:20 every morning. Then there's the ability to leave for only an hour at a time (2 hours for lunch). We had a few occassions where after a morning walk or some other activity, one of us had to go back to check-in before we could get cleaned up or grab breakfast. To me, that's just ridiculous, especially when you're paying so much per night. - Our rooms were far from the elevators, and our partial ocean view was a view of the ocean about 500 yards away. I normally don't mind walking, but the walk wasn't scenic at all (just inside the hotel cooridors). - I felt the rooms and most restaurants did not have a good sense of place. The rooms are pretty generic and you could be anywhere. Ferraro's lunch menu does not use many local ingredients (eat at the pool instead). The spa is generic luxury. Even the main pool looks more LA than Hawaii and you can't even see the beach. I did apprecaite the Hawaiian artwork in the hotel common areas, and wish they could have incorporated it more into the rooms themselves. - Pool service at the main pool wasn't great. We waited for towels and water, and were offered very few of the goodies that make a Four Seasons experience what it should be. We had the opposite experience at the adult pool, where service was wonderful. - cardio machines are open-air but tucked in a corner without a great view or a nice breeze. It can be quite muggy outside in Maui. If you can, a jog or stroll on the beach path is the way to go. Overall, its a nice hotel and I think if we'd gone here without ever going to Hualalai, we'd have liked it more.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, restaurants, location”
Reviews.Author: govanjoe
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in August with three kids and had a wonderful time. The staff were outstanding and went out of their way to make us feel pampered. We loved the location and layout of the restaurant/pool area. The pool was much much less crowded c/w the Grand Wailea next door and the restaurants were far superior. There is no comparison between the two hotels IMO. On the down side the pool seemed very small for a grand hotel, the rooms were on the small side and Spago although with excellent food felt a bit overpriced even for Maui. We stayed here just before moving two hotels down to the Wailea Beach Villas. Very different experience. The WBV is better for larger families large suite and panoramic views whereas the Four Seasons better as a full service hotel if you want pampering with the best Wailea restaurants on site.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else on Maui...especially for a Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: nyg16606
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that I am not a seasoned-luxury resort traveler. I don't always need/and or want super attentive staff, plush settings or daily valet service. With that said, I would not stay anywhere else on the island of Maui. Being our honeymoon (and for the fact that we made it through the wedding with ZERO debt), we went for the splurge. No regrets! Wailea is a beautiful, serene setting. We have wondered into Lahaina and Ka'anapali a few times and every time we do, we are even more thankful for our decision. Wailea does not strike you as a tourist trap. Although it is a little drive to most activities (give it a good hour to get to Lahaina), the benefits far outweigh the negatives. We are in the Ocean Prime room (upgraded at check-in) which offers a diagonal view of the ocean as well as the lush gardens and fountains. This room is definitely sufficient! We entertained the idea of upgrading once more, but due to unavailability we couldn't. That's probably better anyway, seeing as we underestimated how much food would cost here! That's my only negative comment- be prepared to spent at least $70 a meal (for 2 people, including tax and gratuity) for room service. We made it out of Ferraro's for dinner at about $180. But can you really put a price on the pictures we got of that sunset??? Bottom line- just know what to expect and prepare for it. This resort is far superior to the other options. If you have made it to Maui, you might as well get the most out of it. The beach is awesome and the attendants make it that much better. Out of habit, I went to grab my towel as we were leaving. Before I could touch it, a voice from across the sand- "I will get that! You don't pay all of this money for nothing. Relax, that's why you're here!" Such vibrant smiles and easy going personalities are infectious on this island. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've visited till today”
Reviews.Author: LuisKowa
Reviews.Content: A paradise in the paradise of Hawai'i. Luxuriant gardens on the seaside of Wailea, excelent service, white sand and pacific blue water. No wishes open ( only stay there for a longer time)

Reviews.Title: “Hard to Beat”
Reviews.Author: SFore
Reviews.Content: If you are on the fence regarding any of the resorts in Wailea, end your search here. From the time you arrive and check in, until you sadly drive back to the airport you will be treated better than you have ever imagined and will feel like you are living in a fantasy. When deciding where to take my girlfriend on her first trip to Hawaii, I surprised her with 4 nights at the Four Seasons and was going to finish our stay at Grand Wailea...well we never made it to GW. I used AMEX Fine Resorts & Hotels to book everything and I received my room upgrade, complimentary breakfast and 100 credit and everything went really smooth. When I asked to extend our stay, they even upgraded us to a suite since they were out of our smaller size room for the same price! The breakfast buffet at DUO was excellent, and dinner there was fabulous...we tried Spago but was not impressed at all, very expensive and not worth it at all. The staff was incredible everywhere around the facility and this is what separates the Four Seasons from the rest. I felt like I could spend all day at the Serenity Pool! My GF talked me into doing my first ever spa treatment and I am hooked! We tried the Cocoon Massage and don't think I have ever felt better afterwards. Only complaint was that we both felt the beds were a little soft and mushy. I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Maui Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Love2travelfromOz
Reviews.Content: This was our first ever holiday to Hawaii and FS Maui was a dream start. We had hired a car and drove from airport to FS - about half an hour. We were welcomed with cool drinks Lei's, toys for our kids, and incredibly attentive staff. We had booked a single partial ocean view room, and were immediately upgraded to two connecting full ocean view rooms (admittedly set back a fair way from the beach area of the resort). Every element of our stay was a dream: assistance for the kids (food free), all meals fantastic ( a shade expensive but what can you expect at FS?), free kids club, great beach, great pools, lovely weather. We also really liked having the Shops at Wailea nearby for change of scene - some good shopping (cheap and expensive depending on what you're after), plus a few restaurants . I couldn't recommend this hotel (and location in Maui) enough to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Compare Four Seasons Maui To Any Other Hotel. Best of The Best!”
Reviews.Author: Orchidaceous
Reviews.Content: Okay, so this review is loooong overdue. We stayed at the Four Seasons Maui in June of 2007! We spent 10 days at this wonderful resort (we were on our honeymoon). I can't say enough great things about this hotel. Top notch and beautiful from the moment we arrived to the morning we checked out (a very sad day). Fantastic staff, clean and bright rooms, beautiful property and delicious food! Writing this review makes me want to go back ASAP. You're paying top dollar at this hotel, but you won't be disappointed. The breakfast buffet was yummy (but pricey) and the poolside lunches were fabulous! The staff treats you as though you're the only guest staying at the hotel. No hidden "resort fees" on your bill at the end of your stay. They even provide coffee and snacks for the people getting up at 2am to watch the sun rise on Mt. Haleakala! And the concierge will be honest about what's fun (and a waste of time/money) on the island. You will be spoiled rotten if you stay at the Four Seasons Maui! And you'll love every minute of it!

Reviews.Title: “Great for honeymooners...when school is in session”
Reviews.Author: saraindc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons Maui for the first half of our honeymoon and, in general, had a great experience. I give it four stars instead of five solely because of the pool/lounge chair situation. On our first day at the hotel, we found every chair by the pools occupied, and there were screaming children everywhere. We found one seat, which we shared for five minutes until we saw a child running around naked and using the pool as his toilet. We got up and finally were directed to the (very small) adult-only infinity pool, and we were told that we could sign up on a waitlist for chairs. (We were also told that we "should have come earlier in the summer, when children are still in school.") Thereafter, we had to wake up at 6:30 every morning to get in line for chairs at the adult pool, and we could only leave the chairs for two hours before they were given away. We understood that it was the fairest way to allocate chairs in the quieter area of the resort, but talk about a bummer of a honeymoon when you have to wake up at 6:30 every day! We really did have a good experience at the hotel otherwise, and the service was impeccable, but at the end of our trip we were disappointed by the value and overall leisure experience. It made for a stressful honeymoon, albeit in a beautiful setting. We'd recommend this hotel, but only during off-times when children are in school, and only for special occasions because we didn't feel that we got a great value for what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Ah-MAZING!”
Reviews.Author: GML_31
Reviews.Content: This resort is TOP NOTCH. From the valet parking, the amazingly beautiful foyer, friendly receptionists, and the rooms, this resort will remain a beautiful memory for me and my husband. We travelled to Maui on our honeymoon, and like a DOZEN at least other honeymooners, we stayed here. We stayed in a mountainview room, and do not regret this choice at all. We were able to call down to Valet anytime we wanted to leave (you pay for valet in your final bill btw ($20 a day) and our car was waiting. We had blankets for our Mt. Haleakala excursion, fresh, cold bottled water when we wanted it, and clean towels for our beach excursions. We ate at Spago (not to be missed!) and had the best food I've ever eaten. Service is impeccable, and the rooms are quiet and spacious. I especially loved the Hawaiian music played in the bathrooms through the speakers at your request. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware of this hotel's cancellation policy - 21 days!”
Reviews.Author: AusGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: My family and I arrived at the Four Seasons in Maui for a five day stay. When we were shown our so called suites (which were just normal size rooms) we were disappointed to say the least. At the rate of approx $AUS1500 we were told that another $1000 dollars per night would give us much larger rooms. We immediately decided to cut our stay short as this type of accommodation was not acceptable. The problem was that we would be penalized 2 nights rate x 2 rooms as there was in fine print a 21 cancellation policy. We also paid for the executive club which was way below standard. The food was disgusting and an insult. The hotel offered very little in the way of entertainment and activities. Could not wait to return to the Halekulani in Honolulu where everything was perfect. We have stayed in many Four Seasons Hotels and have never been treated like this before. They were willing to do nothing to make our stay more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Dreamy”
Reviews.Author: leileiDetroit
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited the Four Seasons Maui in September 2009 to celebrate our two year anniversary. I have been dreaming about our stay ever since! We went to Kaanaplai for our honeymoon and it was beautiful however Wailea is a small piece of heaven. Kaanapali is much closer to Lahaina and there is much more to do in regards to dining and entertainment however you will not want to leave the Four Seasons Resort once you arrive. It is truly amazing! I have not one complaint about the resort. It is truly paradise! TThe grounds are beautiful and the staff is amazing. We were pampered our entire stay. The beach is gorgeous and there is a beautiful trail along the beach that we walked or ran daily. The snorkeling is great and right in front of the resort. Many people came in very excited to announce they saw a huge sea turtle! There is an outrigger canoe available daily and is a great experience. The adult only serendity pool is so tranquil you may forget you are at a public facility. :) There are many extras. The staff serves complimentary ice pops and fruit treats throughout the day and there is a daily infused water to quench your thirst....ahhh. No need to bring sunscreen as the resort has complimentary sunscreen and it smells so good. We did not rent a car as we did all of our site seeing during our first visit to Maui and wanted to truly enjoy the resort. We used the complimentary shuttle and it was very convenient and quick. We were debating between the Four Seasons and the Grand Wailea so we took a tour of the Grand Wailea one afternoon and we were absolutely relieved that we decided to stay at the Four Seasons! The Grand Wailea was also beautiful however it seemed a bit run down and the pool was very loud...like a zoo. We shared the pool Regis Philbin and his family one beautiful afternoon! A nice surpirse! We enjoyed all restaurants on the property as well as those off the property. They were all very good. I would recommend making a trip to a market to stock up on drinks and snacks as everything is pricey at the resort. This is now my favorite place on earth and I hope to return for our 5th anniversary. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to paradise!”
Reviews.Author: metalmaiden
Reviews.Content: I could go on and on about this property but I'm just going to say it is simply perfection! Luxury, pampering, but it really is a great value for your money because if all the complimentary services that others charge for. The staff refers to you by name and goes above and beyond to make sure your stay is exactly what you want and a memorable experience. It is a large hotel but as a private, intimate, personalized feel. The poolside services are not to be missed. We walked in the door to a lei greeting and let out a sigh and never stressed a moment of our stay. This will be the benchmark we measure all future hotels against.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: ckerstein
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Wailea Four Seasons was utter perfection. The entire staff had the Aloha spirit we mainlanders were hoping to find.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for in life....”
Reviews.Author: lvbengal
Reviews.Content: first time at a four seasons resort and i am very impressed. i am usually very demanding in regards to service but i honestly cannot complain about a darn thing. the hotel the location the staff were all top notch. its a bit pricey but they dont nickel and dime you to death like other resort hotels. as long as i can afford it i am only staying here from now on. those that stay in kannappali are missing out the best part of maui and that is their loss....the only negative is that spago restaurant is severly over priced and over hyped....stick to ferrarros....

Reviews.Title: “Peacefull experience”
Reviews.Author: Newyork555
Reviews.Content: Resort is Luxury all the way. tranquility and peace through out the resort!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING ALL THE WAY!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bcgradmom
Reviews.Content: LOVED LOVED LOVED it. We travel all the time, I am a part time travel editor so one of my perks is getting to go all over the place. We extended a "working vacation" on Oahu and went over to Maui for 5 blissful nights. The FS is fabulous, pristie, perfect, wtih perfectly matched impeccable service. You are made to feel like royalty and it has a soothing and relaxed but super elegant atmosphere. We will most certainly go back. Pool, beach areas all fabulous as were the restaurants. The weather was splendid and overall I would have to say this is my favorite Four Seasons yet.

Reviews.Title: “best so far”
Reviews.Author: 60982Mac
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed at the four seasons for 5 days prior to waikiki. We arrived at the four seasons expecting something good but left after one of the best holiday experiences we have had. On arrival we were upgraded to a garden view suite and then elected to pay an additional amount to have a deluxe ocean view suite. I wouldn't hesitate to have a garden room and spend the extra money on other things as you wont spend much time in the room while everything else in the hotel is so good. The room was sensational with wonderful views of the ocean and pool. Duo's and ferraro's were fabulous but spargos staff was a bit pretentious. The service around the pool was better than we have experienced at other hotels. The extra treats and service such as cold towels and fruit during the day made the stay even better. We also had an ocean side massage which was one of life's great experiences. The swimming and snorkeling is good but with such service and great pools you will enjoy both. Except for the door and bar staff at spargos who seemed to think they were doing us a favour serving us we couldn't fault our stay here. .

Reviews.Title: “The Rave reviews don't do this place justice you just have to go there.”
Reviews.Author: ther0adlesstraveled
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this beautiful resort to celebrate our 20 year Anniversary. We've stayed in many luxury resorts but I can honestly say nothing compares to the Four Seasons. The property is truely amazing! The rooms are huge and the bathroom is as large as most bedrooms. This resort has hundreds of rave reviews and that is the reason we chose this resort but I want to recognize the phenomenal staff that we "fell in love" with while we were staying at the resort. The door men/ drivers( Eli, Chauncy and the crew) were so genuinely warm and welcoming. Anything we needed or thought we would need was already thought of and provided. The fabulous pool attendants WOW!! My husband and I were so impressed with all of them. Jeff, Chris, Kevin,Brian, and Thea! Those guys are amazing and exceptional people thank you for making our days so fun and enjoyable. There attention to detail is staggering! We felt like royalty! The Restaurant staff at Duo, breakfast was always a treat with Erin and Mia. Can't thank the chef enough for making my favorite pineapple muffins especially for me! I felt so special. Dinner was wonderful with Brad as our server. We really enjoyed him and all of his tips! Ferraros is a great Italian restaurant but this place transforms from a casual restaurant during the day to an extremely romantic restaurant at night. We spent our Anniversary dinner with the lovely staff at Ferraros. Renato was our server and he was such an integral part of our magical evening. He knows his wine!!! Renato was stellar in every way. Grazie Renato!! Jamaal is a genius, he can make you the most delicious and refreshing drinks - I am so coming back for that Pineapple Mojito!! Austin was our Ferraro server second night he was so great too very accomodating and personable.Katie who works the shack - That gal rocks! Thank you for going above and beyond. Don't miss the Outrigger Canoe program its an incredible opportunity that is given to everyone that stays at the resort. Gary and Rob are First Class and so knowledgable. It's truely and experience you cannot miss. Gary and Rob are absolutely the coolest guys you can't miss meeting these guys. The Scuba program was wild my husband dove for the first time and he is hooked. Blaze Anderson spends most of his time in the ocean and he is the best instructor you could ever hope for. Last but not least I received the most relaxing and wonderful massage from Margo. I chose to have a massage in a hale by the ocean and it was the best decision ever! Listening to the waves crash and feeling the wind blow while being pampered was spriritual! Margo is extremely talented and has 30 plus years of experience with the lomi lomi massage. Everything you have read in these reviews just doesn't even do this place justice. Find a hammock, or a private cabana to watch the sunset. My husband and I have started a seperate account for our Four seasons annual trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort...”
Reviews.Author: travel12967
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at the 4S Wailea. The staff was overall attentive, and the property is really exceptional. The breakfast buffett at Duo was excellent, and included when booking through whatahotel.com which was a nice added bonus. The hotel is expensive but that is to be expected at a 4S property. We really didn't feel the need to leave ever. On our last day the service at the serenity pool was a little dodgy, but overall the service was really good. Special thanks to Chris who did a great job for us! I'd recommend the hotel to anyone. Additionally the Lanai Manele Bay 4S is exceptional as well. Try them both if you're so fortunate.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, but not Hawaiian enough”
Reviews.Author: V Traveler
Reviews.Content: It's tough to give anything but perfect marks to the Four Seasons, since the hotel is very nice, the staff is great, and they absolutely spoiled our kids with gifts in the room, popsicles at the pool and free access to the kid's club room. We just had a vague feeling at the end of the trip that overall we had not enjoyed the Four Seasons as much as other hotels in Hawaii. Part of the problem is that we didn't feel entirely comfortable - everything is just too nice and perfect. And we are not ones to wear $1200 shoes to breakfast or show up at the pool with Louis Vuitton bags. If you are, you will be very comfortable at the Four Seasons showing off your wealth to the other guests who will then show off their wealth to you. Also, it just didn't feel very Hawaiian. The views were great, and the hula in the evenings was nice, but while at the resort we never really felt like we were in Hawaii. It's basically a nice hotel that could be anywhere, with some Hawaiian decoration, but not a major Hawaiian theme. Other than that, my only complaints were that there wasn't really convenient self-parking (I hated always having to use the valets even just for quick trips to Starbucks) and that they charge for internet access. The pricing of food, wine, etc... are higher than anywhere else - probably no surprise there, but when a glass of wine in the restaurant is more than the entire bottle at the store, that's more than the customary margins. The breakfast buffet was good, but at $34 was it better than $22 buffets at other hotels? Not really. Having said that, though, my kids had no complaints at all. Great pool area for kids, lots of gifts and personal attention throughout their stay, and the Kids for All Seasons club room was very well done. They didn't want to leave. Four Seasons has definitely perfected the idea that a hotel can be luxurious and very kid-friendly at the same time. Probably the best hotel for young children that we've ever stayed at. So if you want luxury, stay here. If you just want a romantic honeymoon, absolutely. But if you want to experience Hawaii, you might want to try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons with infant.. Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: lovinsj
Reviews.Content: 15 nights in Maui and our first 5 nights were at the 4S... I've been at this resort before but this was our first time staying here. Check-in was smooth, fast and easy. Everyone was friendly and prompt on helping us with all of our bags and baby. We had 2 rooms connecting.. each had a crib and little gifts for our baby. In our room, we had a bottle of champagne and some snacks for our anniversary. My mother in law came with us so she put the baby to sleep while my wife and I walked around. The grounds are AMAZING, as is the crescent moon beach. Our first night was pretty uneventful. A quick review of our 5 days.... Pros - The service here is top notch. All of the workers are friendly and helpful. The cabanas are great to have with a baby since they will bring a pack-n-play to keep them in the shade. You get quite a bit of "freebies". The cabanas are free, fitness activities (except for spinning classes) are free as well as the water activities. The first hour of snorkle is free. We ate at Spago and Duo and both were amazing. The food and service at both were top notch, as well as the price tag. Around 350-375 for 3 people. Cons - the valet. this is the only way to arrive/leave the resort. I would like to be able to park my own car and not have to worry about calling down 20-30 mins in advance every time I wanted to drive to get coffee or run to the store. Beside the valet, this was my ONLY complaint about the resort. I will DEFINATELY stay here again. Plus on a side note.. My mother in law was sitting at the pool with our baby and Ray Liotta and his daughter came over asking if he could see her. She thinks he came over to hit on her. hahah We left the 4S and headed to our 2nd destination.. The Ka'anapali beach club. I will review that as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Honeymoon Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelcailin
Reviews.Content: After reviewing lots of different locations and hotels in Mauii, we decided on the Four Seasons in Wailea for the first week of our honeymoon based on consistently good reviews we read and we were not disappointed. We spent 5 days here and had a fantastic time. The location of Wailea is convenient for seeing all of Mauii. The hotel is nice and small, feels intimate and personable. Yes it's expensive but it's got great rooms & great service, we couldn't fault anything. I do agree that the food is very expensive but you have to expect that from a hotel of this quality. To make our money stretch a bit further we drove 5 mins or walked 15 mins. to the shops at Wailea every day for lunch which was nice break from the sun. I would definately recommend this place to honeymooners, we got a complimentery room upgrade and bottle of champage on arrival and nothing but the best service including helping us make restaurant bookings as well as a snorkel trip and surf lesson. It was the perfect start to a great honeymoon and we'll never forget it.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: jennamack
Reviews.Content: Almost all pros: Beautiful resort, clean, insanely high thread count sheets, huge room (and we were in cheapest room. We ate everywhere on resort but Spago and food was very good.) Service was excellent but not too "in your face" as it can be with hotels of this caliber. Lots of cool amenities, free sunscreen, treats all day at the pool, coffee/tea/water service all over the resort. No trouble getting chairs despite what other reviewers indicated. Restaurants to try: Capiche (spell?) & Nick's Fish for a very nice dinner& Longhis for breakfast, Cheeseburger in Paradise is a cool place for very laid back. They do shuttle you to most restaurants in a 2 mile or so radius so take advantage of that. The negatives were not many: 1) they tried to strongarm us into upgrading our room for $200 per night at the front desk. Tacky. Just upgrade people if you have vacant better rooms as it builds loyalty. Overall a great trip and it exceeded expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Service, Value and Size of Four Seasons is why we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: blissfulbride
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been planning a trip to Maui for the past year. We decided to go in August because we were told that it is not too crowded at this time with kids going back to school and people don't really travel. The rates were extremely good at this time. We had researched and spoke to people on where to stay on the island; we decided we wanted to stay in Wailea, but we did not know which resort was best for us. We compared prices and looked at reviews. The following 3 were our choices and why we did NOT go there and why we are so excited we stayed at the FS: The Fairmont- this was really our second choice. We walked over there and would have stayed there; however, 2 of the 3 pools were under construction. Also, the reviews stated you were nickeled and dimed for everything. Grand Wailea- too big...there are over 700 rooms on this resort. We walked around it is so big, you get lost. There were kids all over and it was VERY crowded; it felt dirty. Marriott Wailea- it does not have a beach; my husband loves the surf and wanted to stay where there was a beach with beach chairs and beach access. Also, the reviews stated it was difficult to get a chair to lay out while you were there. Now on to why we stayed at the Four Seasons: Service, value, and size of hotel were the main reasons: Service: The service was incredible! If there was something that was forgotten (water at night, room service mess up), they would come back immediately and bring it. The men at valet made sure you knew where you were going that day and if you were going on tours would give you water, or blankets (for Haleakala). When you would go to the beach, you could get a chair set up any where you want...no charge! You could then go to the pool or the lawn and get a cabana/chair/or a chair with shade and they would come around to fill your cup with ice water as well as get your drink/food order! Value: It is EXPENSIVE, but Maui is expensive! We felt that out of the hotels we were looking for, this one offered what we were looking for and the prices were pretty comprable. We did not feel nickeled and dimed for anything. We got fruit and popsicles by the pool; sunscreen everywhere, so you do not have to pack it; cabanas and chairs near the pool, on the beach or wherever you would like that was available...all for no charge! We had water/ water bottles anytime we asked for them...no charge! We really felt as though we had paid for what we got and there weren't any "hidden fees", which made us REALLY enjoy our time. Size: The hotel has less than 200 rooms, I believe. It felt small and not overcrowded. You felt like people were around, but you had your own space. The hotel was VERY clean and I believe that comes from the small size of the hotel being able to be maintained. The grounds were kept very nice; people were always cleaning and it did not feel dirty. Suggestions: We do suggest you wake up early to enjoy the surf; the waves pick up about 10:30-11 ish and it is very windy. We did drive to Big Beach down the road from the hotel and the water was very calm; it is a great beach to hang on. Kihei is the small town next to Wailea; there are great restaurancts beyond the FS property. We did go to the FoodLand in Kihei to grab some snacks. We decided to do this after we got a cheese plate for 1 that was $45 from room service! The cheese and crackers was perfectly fine at foodland; there is a small fridge in your room to store a few small items. Arriving and time change- I read a review from someone that ate @ Ferraro's when they arrived; they stated they enjoyed their meal and went straight to bed. We are 5 hours ahead of Maui, so we booked a 6pm dinner at Ferraro's for when we arrived. It was perfect; we ate and were in bed by 8:30pm. We did the Haleakala tour the next morning b/c we were still on our time, which worked out to be great! In closing, we wanted to stay in Wailea and drive to different parts of the island to see all Maui had to offer. We were very glad we stayed in Wailea; we had high expectations that were all met! I do think, you have to be careful with your expectations because the people at the Four Seasons are wonderful, but they are human! Go enjoy the beauty of this island and place....you will not be disappointed if you splurge and enjoy some time at the FS. Thanks Four Seasons!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A birthday gift to myself”
Reviews.Author: AnesthesiaGurl
Reviews.Content: I decided last minute to travel to Maui for 5 days solo to celebrate my 36th birthday. So I looked at EVERY hotel review on yelp.com & here. Since I only had 3 days before flying out- I was limited on where I could stay since it was labor day weekend & most hotels had already been booked. I saw the Four Seasons & kinda felt a need for some pampering so I said, "why not?" I arrived & was blown away in a positive way regarding the level of sevice. The staff were all very pleasant & seemed very genuine. The grounds were impecable- perhaps a little too manicured for my taste. The views were magnificent. I was originally placed in room #626 but wasn't too keen on looking at the putting green & asked if there was another room with a different view that was in the same price category. Boy am I glad I asked! There was indeed! Room #679 which was a 100% better view- the entire gardens with a partial ocean view. The staff was so helpful- it was not quite 3 pm (regular check in time) but my 1st room was available so they let me check in early at 2 pm. When I requested a room switch they offered to move my luggage for me once my room was ready- nice! I went to the pool in the meantime. Wow... I loved the serenity pool, but there was always a wait list for a chair- forget a cabana. There was nice music playing underwater in the serenity pool which is such a nice touch. The restaurants were not that impressive for the money, but ok. I liked the breakfast buffet at Duo. Drinks were very, very good- loved the mai tai. I spent one day in the spa. It was nice, but I was disappointed that there wasn't a jacuzzi in the spa- only a small wet sauna. The prices are through the roof for typical services offered in most spas. I had an oxygen facial that was just ok. I was not really able to relax though because she kept talking about which product she was using next & what it did. ugh... I should have got a massage. I spent 5 glorious nights here. I even had dinner in my room one night. The staff that delivered the meal set up an entire table setting w/ flower arrangement for me- nice touch. I especially loved the music channels that you can play in the bathroom. I would leave the Hawaiian music playing so it I could hear it upon entering my room. Housekeeping comes twice a day. They provide a turn down service in the evening & will even place houseslippers near the bed for you. The bed is just heavenly... like laying in a big fluffy cloud. I really want to duplicate the bed in my own home. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay here, but I don't think I will do it again. I prefer a hotel with more personality. I also felt that Wailea was similar- nothing like the character of Paia. I wish I could have stayed at Paia Inn, but they were booked. The only way to make this type of resort really pay off in my opinion is to literally stay here & never leave. I prefer to go explore.

Reviews.Title: “Fou”
Reviews.Author: texanaussie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four of our eight days in Maui, after four days at the Sheraton. The FS is much nicer than the Sheraton, but it is still a behemoth of a hotel that doesn't manage what most other FS hotels have in spades. We love the two FS hotels in the Maldives and appreciate the great service and individuality they pride themselves on. The rooms here are nice and the service better than average, but it lacks personality and is still very expensive and even more so if you want an ocean view. It ticks the boxes on paper, and we don't mind paying more for something special, but this hotel loses something in translation. For starters, the pool area is too small for such a large hotel. As mentioned in previous posts, you have to get up very early to secure a sun lounge by the pool. There were quite a few noisy kids about even though there was supposed to be a separate kids' area. The pool menu specifically mentioned that games like Marco Polo were not allowed at the big pool, but there were MP games every day. We headed to the beach to get a lounge and were amazed (especially for FS) that there was no service on the beach. The beach is nice and the water is wonderful, but having to go all the way up to get anything is annoying. That said, the snacks from the pool bar are tasty and the drinks were very good and I had a lovely spa experience before our dinner at Spago. We ate at Spago and it was good but not fantastic (the three tuna cones were the standout). We were surrounded by children and it was a lesson to us about different ways of parenting. Where one couple (he was a star of a well-known crime drama) was having an animated discussion with their very well behaved daughter, the other nearest table plonked a DVD onto the table for their daughter with the volume turned too loudly so that we heard every song from The Little Mermaid. We went for a drink at the main bar where Jennifer made a mean margarita, but were surprised how early it closed. We went out for a few meals and our favourite was Sorrento's at sunset. We also enjoyed our rented convertible for tooling around the island. The Four Seasons was nice, but it all depends what you are used to. We spent one night at the Hana Maui by accident and it was the only hotel that we stayed in that made us say, "Wow!"

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but it all depends on why you are in Maui.”
Reviews.Author: Clark1982
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at The Four Seasons Wailea for part of our honeymoon in Maui. I should preface my review to say that we are both hardworking people, who came to Hawaii to explore the islands and appreciate the sites and adventures unique to this part of the world. During our trip, we were fortunate enough to stay at many hotels and B&Bs around the islands and I can say that I can definitely see why so many people love this place. The resort itself is beautiful, with a staff that truly seems to care about your stay.I think that for us, for this trip, it was not the best fit as we did not come all of the way to Maui to stay all day at the hotel (which is what this hotel seems set up for), but that, unlike some other luxury hotels, the Four Seasons Wailea seems to not just take your money for granted as the staff and amenities go above and beyond the typical and justify the hefty price tag and if we had wanted a place where we would be happy spending all day the hotel, this would have been it .

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort Ever!”
Reviews.Author: justin_foster
Reviews.Content: My wife has always dreamed of going to Hawaii so we decided to do it right and stay at FS. We were not disappointed in the least. Right from the moment you drive up the service is top rate. Even the lower priced rooms are spacious and well appointed. As for food, everything we had was fantastic. We tried breakfast at DUO and in our room and the even set you a table with a centerpiece on your balcony. For lunch we tried Ferarro's and eating poolside, both were great. Dinner at both Ferarro's and DUO was exceptional and we went early enough to get an unobstructed view of the sunset. The main pools are quite loud and full of families, but the serenity pool area is wonderful for a couple on a romantic getaway. The beach is perfect white sand and the ocean is very clear. There are rocks 20 yards out but there is plenty of white sand to swim and play in the waves. Waves usually come in the afternoon. Right beside the beach there is a reef that is filled with snorkelers and fish. It is true what they say about celebrities, they are all over the place here. We saw some very big names hanging out. It's great how no one disturbs them and the hotel staff treat everyone the same. We even got a better table than one of the celebs (we were blocking their view of the ocean :) Service was amazing. They kept coming with water and treats all day. They would even use your name on the beach (I'm amazed how they keep it all straight who is where on the beach). One time my wife went to throw out some garbage and one of the attendants intercepted her and took care of it! Even the sunscreen is included. Room service leaves on the radio and fills the ice... there is hardly anything you have to do for yourself EVER. Overall we had a fantastic experience and I can't wait to go back. Next time I would skip the car rental and spend all of the time on the resort. Some tips: - Be prepared to tip. We gave between $5 and $10 to the Valet, Bellhop and the people who set up your chairs. Self-serve is NOT an option here (Get used to it and you may like it) - Get to the serenity pool by 6:00 if you want a seat, otherwise use the waiting list (they will call you, it's actually not a bad option if you want to spend the morning on the beach/garden/main pool) - If you miss seats at the serenity pool try the ultra private seats beach facing in the garden (fantastic place to spend the day) they are limited but we found spots as late as 7:30 - Unless you plan to eat away from the resort plan on at least $200 per adult per day minimum for food. With gratuity and taxes. It's pricey but really good food! There are not really alternative inexpensive options in the area. You can save on drinks by going into Kehei or the Shops at Wailea and stocking your in-room fridge - Snorkeling gear is free for the first hour and you don't have to go very far to see tropical fish and turtles - There is a $6 charge per day for internet and $20 per night for valet, but you will quickly not mind since it is a fraction of the burn rate at this place :) There are a lot of complimentary items (use of beach tote, morning coffee, muffins, freezer pops, sun screen, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon Indulgence”
Reviews.Author: GHC3
Reviews.Content: As everyone says, absolutely amazing. No better "aloha" hospitality anywhere. Every detail and wish attended to. Staff could not be friendlier or more helpful. Food and service at Spago especially noteworthy as outstanding. An amazing honeymoon destination. More families than I would have expected, but the separate kid's pool kept the adult pool primarily for adults. We will be back without question and could not consider staying anywhere else in Maui after this unprecedented experience.

Reviews.Title: “By far best hotel”
Reviews.Author: lcs55
Reviews.Content: Service is outstanding. It was a nice surprise to find a birthday card and two trays of desserts in the hotel room ready for me. The room is spacious and the hotel provides you with daily newsletters. It was amazing that there are complimentary activities such as yoga, meditation, gym facility, outrigger canoes, snorkel gear, and aerobics. The outrigger canoe ride was awesome. The guides are very informative and helpful. I got to see a few sea turtles come up to the canoe. We paddled about 10 minutes from the beach and had the opportunity to jump out of the canoe for a quick dip. The serenity pool was unique since it was adults only with a pool side bar. It was very relaxing and the waiters come around frequently to provide you water and any drinks to your likings. In the pool, there is music underwater. The service is amazing and every worker treats you like a royalty.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: SherBB
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Maui is absolute perfection. The service is outstanding. One night, we had a baby in an adjoining room that was crying loudly. I mean, shrieking to the point that I could hear the baby in the bathroom, with the shower on. I called the front desk, and, Hillary called me back after a few minutes to tell me we could be moved to another room. The bellman was at our door within ten minutes, helping us pack up to be moved. The Serenity Pool is heaven. We did not have difficulty securing chairs at any point during our stay. Service was not quite as attentive as at the main pool, but, it was still quite good. During our stay, we never left the resort. We had been to Maui twice before, so, we really just wanted to enjoy the Four Seasons. The beach, pool, and all the restaurants are exceptional. We did not eat at Ferraro's, but, Spago and Duo were fantastic. The spa facilities are not what I expected for a resort of this caliber. There is no sauna or whirlpool in the spa, and, the showers are quite small. It's not the type of spa where one would want to hang out and relax for a long period of time. It's more functional than luxurious. We booked the 80-minute couples oceanside massage, and, it was fantastic. I would recommend this over a service in the actual spa. When we return to Maui, I would not even consider staying anywhere else. If you're on the fence about staying at the Four Seasons, don't give it a second thought. Just book it. You absolutely will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Met -- but did not exceed -- my extremely high expectations...”
Reviews.Author: blue8910
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time researching various properties before choosing the Four Seasons. My expectations were extremely high (voted #1 resort in the U.S. by Conde Nast readers, AAA 5 diamond award, Forbes 5 star award, raving TripAdvisor reviews, etc., etc.). And the resort delivered. It is absolutely stunning, and the service is amazing. However, my lofty expectations were not exceeded. First, some awesome (and expected) aspects: -They upgraded us 2 levels to Partial Ocean View ($825/night) from Mountainside ($445/night). Room was unbelievable (expected). -Spago, DUO, and Ferraro's were all outstanding. Service at each was superb. We enjoyed the food at DUO most, though Spago had excellent kobe beef sliders and unbelievable bread. Ferraro's had the best dinner atmosphere (oceanfront outdoor sunset view). All three were truly memorable dining experiences. Also, you MUST try Mama's Fish House up in Paia (just past the Kahului airport on Hana Hwy). Second, there were a couple of small details that could be improved: -I expected awesome service -- and generally got awesome service. However, when we lounged by the pool, my water cup sat empty for 10-15 minutes on multiple occasions. I expected butler-level service by the pool. However, each pool attendant takes care of roughly 10-15 cabanas, and this caused my water cup to not always be full. Not a huge deal, but could be improved. -We asked one pool attendant where we could find a newspaper. She said, "they have those up at the concierge." She should have, instead, gone and gotten us one. A different pool attendant, when asked about magazines, referred me to the pool stations for selection. Again, should have gotten the magazine for me instead. -The housekeepers failed to give us turndown service one evening by the time we got back from dinner at 8pm. They knew we had 6pm dinner reservations, or at least should have known. Yet they failed to turn down our room on time, so I put the "privacy please" sign up. They also failed to re-stock our matches 2 times, and our coffee 1 time. Very small details, but I expected absolute perfection at this highly acclaimed resort. All in all, this is a superb property with a superb location and superb service. If I hadn't already read 200+ raving TripAdvisor reviews, I would have been absolutely stunned at the service, beauty, and location of this resort. Even with my extremely high expectations, I loved this resort. We walked past the Fairmont and Grand Wailea properties, and they did not even come CLOSE to comparing. We also walked around the Ritz property up in Kapalua, and it did not compare either - much farther from ocean with sea-weed waters at the beach. However, we did prefer the Hotel Hana-Maui to this resort, albeit slightly, because it was much less crowded and in a much more genuine Hawaiian location (Hana, as opposed to over-developed Wailea). But that's more of a matter of personal preference. Ultimately, this resort is AWESOME. I strongly recommend it to couples. There were some screaming children around the pool areas, but most parents knew how to keep their children quiet. If you have screaming children, please go stay at the Grand Wailea, not here. Very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Canadian-Beagle
Reviews.Content: My wife and two girls spent a week in Maui at the Four Seasons. This was not our first stay at the hotel. I simply have nothing negative to say - the hotel is superb. The service was exceptional at all levels - from the front desk to the business centre. The staff at the pool is great as are the folks in housekeeping and room service. While we were there everyone was on. We ate at Ferraro's and Duo twice and also had room service twice. All dinners were excellent. The wait staff was excellent as was the food. Nothing is inexpensive but at least it is top notch. Wailea beach is a beautiful beach. While it gets a bit rough mid afternoon that allows for fun and frolic in the water. My girls loved playing in the waves. No matter what it cost to stay here, I felt that I was receiving value.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Wailea - Excellent Service, but still very busy”
Reviews.Author: kates70
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve been hesitant to write this review because I have such admiration for this hotel and I donâ€™t want to point out all the issues, but I feel that people should get as many different perspectives to be able to inform their travel decisions. So here goes: This was our third trip to the Maui FS in the last year (April 09, October 09, April 10) for a combined total of 26 days. We arrived at the hotel with a mountainside room booked â€¦ since on our last two trips we were given complimentary upgrades were almost expecting one. Donâ€™t anticipate an upgrade because at the time of our stay there were two very large corporate groups (same as October) and also some film stars with their respective entourage. So, we were disappointed to find out that they had given us one of the very farthest rooms facing the Grand Wailea parking lot. We asked to pay for a garden room upgrade but nothing was available. They finally offered us an upgrade for $200 extra per night, but after some intense negotiations :), they agreed to $100. Okay, as tacky as everyone may think, it was both mine and DHâ€™s 40th birthdays this week and we felt that this would definitely warrant an upgrade (plus we had already been to the hotel twice in the same year). Wishful thinking I guess. And we were very happy they agreed to the upgrade. Thanks 4S! Okay, now in our super fabulous $1200 per night room directly facing the beach, we were feeling a bit guilty for getting this room for $525 per night. Saying that, I would never pay $1200 for a room like this. It was the exact same layout as the other less expensive rooms and the balcony had a lot of direct sun on it. I only went out once to listen to some bad karaoke that was blasting until 10 p.m. one night as part of a corporate function. Not cool. To repeat the good aspects of this hotel would take a long time as there are many. However, I should say that the staff continues to amaze me at every turn. They are truly the best part of this hotel. But here are some observations/recommendations of our 3 stays in general. 1) Noise/Crowds: Donâ€™t expect a super quiet experience at this hotel. The pool is busy, the beach is busy, the restaurants are busy, the lobby lounge is busy, the valet area is busy, the adults-only pool is busy â€¦ etc, etc, etc. But overall the staff manage it pretty well. We had a serious noise issue in our room for 4 days - the people above us were opening/closing their very heavy balcony door every 10 to 15 minutes most of the day/night (this is reminiscent of a recent stay at the Ritz Carlton in St. Thomas â€¦ same exact balcony doors). We tried to take a nap a couple days but finally gave up. We called down to the front desk at least 4 times, but the situation wasnâ€™t handled at all and when we checked out a manager met us at the front desk to apologize and let us know that when we returned to the hotel 4 days later (from the Big Island) they would make sure that our stay was peaceful. (they did honour their word and put us in a nice quiet upgrade to a partial ocean viewâ€¦ thanks 4S). That being said, they should have notified the people above us to explain how loud their door was in our room. I had a feeling it was a family/or celebrity entourage and they didnâ€™t want to upset them. 2) Restaurants: We ate every meal (except two) at the hotel over 9 days. If you want a good table for dinner/lunch, make sure you ask for one. And itâ€™s better to make reservations (even for lunch). Generally speaking we found that the corporate groups/families get priority seating (especially in Spago). This is common theme we have experienced as travellers and itâ€™s really a thorn in my side. The food at all the restaurants is very good to excellent, with Ferraroâ€™s still being our favourite. We love the lunch menu (seafood cobb salad, kobe beef burger), and the dinner experience is truly lovely â€¦ make sure to request a table in the front row â€“ donâ€™t expect them to offer this right up â€¦ you have to ask. We have visited Spago three times over our three stays and it has always been a great meal. Although, the service is confusing and awkward as they have 4 or 5 people serving your table. Generally the service has been consistent and always with a smile, but, the difference over the past year is that the staff are really, really busy. They are truly worked off their feet and this is really noticeable in the lobby lounge area. Fortunately, the quality hasnâ€™t suffered, but we did have to wait most nights for a table at the lobby lounge. It seems to be the place to take the kids and extended family for the torch lighting ceremony/dancers. They need to create a more adult friendly lounge and make their guests without children happy too. We were patient enough to wait for a table each night, but we saw several people leave the lounge area looking perturbed. And there really isnâ€™t another alternative for drinks except the bar area at Ferraroâ€™s (which was always very busy as well). 2) Quirks: Our toilet overflowed and basically flooded the entire bathroom. It took 3 very excited calls to get someone to come up. We werenâ€™t quick enough to lift the toilet lid and lift the stopper â€¦ but eventually we figured it out (as well as remove the carpet on the floor.) To apologize, they sent up a note and a box of chocolates. I thought that was a nice gesture. Also, the new sheets they are using to replace the well-known 4S sheets with brown trim arenâ€™t that great. Iâ€™m not kidding, it was if we were the first to use them because they actually scratched my skin to the point of redness. I mentioned this to housekeeping and the next day they put on the older version â€¦ ahh, what relief. 3) Pools: The pool service is great but I felt that this time the main pool needed to be better cleaned. It felt a bit slimy from all the sunscreen, and definitely too warm for my Canadian blood. I hate warm pools. We didnâ€™t even try the serenity pool this time because in October 09 we could never get a chair, or the ones available were in the hot sun. If I could have one wish for the 4S it would be to somehow make more natural shade areas â€“ I find the cabanas can get very hot. 4) Misc: The Orchid Salon is not worth the price and I wouldnâ€™t recommend it. Although itâ€™s not part of the 4S brand, it is located on their premises, so they should be aware of the quality or lack of it. For $150 for a mani/pedi, I expected it to be in a nice relaxing setting. Instead there was a very loud women somehow indirectly related to the hotel (not sure what her job was exactly, or if she was in fact an employee) who sat next to me and basically gossiped about all the celebs that were staying there, etc. This was tacky and annoying. And the light on the manicure table was burnt out so the manicurist had stand and struggle to do my manicure in an awkward position on the pedi chair. It was uncomfortable for me, and I am certain it was uncomfortable for her too. We continue to love, love, love this hotel and have always felt they offer a premium product. We are returning in April 2011, even though the prices have gone up considerably â€“ at least 25% over two years. We have booked through a Four Seasons Preferred Partner, and with this we get free breakfast and an $85 lunch credit. If you love great and friendly service, if you have lots of money to spend, and are okay with a busy hotel with lots of small children, this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel but Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: ramblindave
Reviews.Content: We were there last week for three days and two nights. It is the Four Seasons and you get the little extras that comes with staying there. However paying triple what a Hyatt costs simply does not make sense. The pools were average but the beach was not too busy and was only filled with Four Season guests. I did enjoy the fact that the hotel was packed yet other then specifics locations, you felt like you had room. The Serenity Pool was a disaster, it felt like I was in Vegas with all the young kids on college break except we were all 40 years old, loud and boisterious and very tipsy. They need to not only tell people to turn off their phones but also turn off their mouths. Definitely go snorkeling around the point, saw a beautiful sea turtle and the paddle boarding looked like lots of fun. All other amenities including dinner will cost you an arm and a leg literally get ready to hobble back to the airport. We did all our eating outside of the hotel except one night we went out for drinks in the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Resort Maui- the Spa is sub-par”
Reviews.Author: MPKC
Reviews.Content: I recently used the Spa at the Four Seasons and found their massage services only fair. Maybe their's a 4Seasons massage or something because my friend and I received what sounds like the same massage but from two different people. While they concentrated well enough on our backs, neither masseuse did much work on the front of our bodies. We had asked for the additional foot scrub for $45 and that especially was sub-par, we've gotten much better in any old nail salon. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect except for serenity pool”
Reviews.Author: michaelanna
Reviews.Content: I traveled for 5 days with my wife from 5 august to 10 august . We had a great time wonderful hotel with superb service and some super places to eat. Spago was favourite though very pricey , we went for the 49 dollar special available from 845 pm so made it a bit more reasonable. I would agree with la casanda the pool rules are ok but you need to use them. If you are at pool by 8 you will get a seat. I did that and then went back to bed for 45 minutes and then went down , you are able to hold the chair for an hour. We sat for an hour on the chair and then went for breakfast , brilliant at Duos. We returned at about 11 am and had the chair for the rest of the day. Service at pool was great and drinks and cucumber on eyes lovely. Also free sunscreen , though the hotel run out on last day of high sunscreen. The whole envronment of the hotel was great and staff very friendly and they get to know you all by the end of our stay which made it nice. Rowena at pool is great and she really looked after us. All in all magic place but for 1000 dollars a night I do think they need to think about space at serenity pool. I don't believe I should have to get up at 730 am each morning to get a chair. The private cabanas take up too much room and limit space

Reviews.Title: “A chance to renew and refresh and spend quality time with our family”
Reviews.Author: Norwegian_explorer
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week in Maui with our sons, 18 and 22, who both just graduated ... so it's a transition time. We found the Four Seasons just about perfect for our varied needs. My husband and I liked to get up early to snorkel or take yoga on the beach, while the boys slept in. Our sons like to run on the treadmills, play tennis, and play bridge with us in our rooms. One night we played ping pong, shuffleboard (disk on a table type), foose ball, etc for fun in the lovely games room. We liked the free car service to local restaurants. Prices for lunch were too high in my opinion at the Four Seasons, but the meal for my husband and me at Spago's was one of the best of our lives. We don't really enjoy being "waited on" too much, so the service at the pool was overkill (pumpkin mini-muffins, jello, sun balm, water) so we spent almost no time there. The waves in the afternoon were surprisingly good for boogey-boarding, for late July/August. We explored the island too and just had a lovely time overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with One Major Flaw - The Pool Rules”
Reviews.Author: LaCansada
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel and property, great service, lovely beach. Just plain crazy pool rules, especially for that beautiful infinity edge "Serenity Pool" that you see in all the ads for this hotel. Basically, you just plain can't use it.. You have to get in a line at 6:30 am (so the pool staff told me) so that you can sign up for a lounge chair to use within one hour of making this reservation. I'm not talking about a cabana rental, I'm talking about a lounge chair, a place to sit. You can then have the chair all morning and you are allowed to have a one hour break to leave the pool, you get another another two hour break for lunch, and then an additional one hour break in the afternoon. So you can reserve the chair for 8 hours, only use 4 of those 8 hours and no one else can come and sit in your designated chair while you are "on break from the pool". I went one afternoon to find 2/3 of the lounge chairs empty due to a bit of rain but was told that I could not sit down. There was a waiting list for a lounge chair. For $600 a night I was unable to use this pool on any day of a 7-day stay unless I wanted to use it all freakin' day and sign up for a chair at 6:30 am. What a horrible management system. When I complained to the "Pool Manager" I got a box of chocolate and a card that evening. But no lounge chair any subsequent day at the beautiful infinity edge pool overlooking the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, but beware of the long walks to elevators...”
Reviews.Author: gemlaa
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to Maui for our 5 year anniversary, and after much research, we discovered that The Four Seasons Wailea seemed the most accomodating for families traveling with young kids. We booked our trip months in advance, and both my husband and I called the resort to let them know of our special situation - that it was our anniversary, we were traveling with our 2 1/2 year old daughter, and that I would be 7 months pregnant by the time we got there. We requested that they give us a room that would be close to the elevators so that pregnant me and my toddler would have easier access. When we arrived we found lots of toys, books, and snacks for our toddler, and also a nice bottle of champagne and chocolates for our anniversary. But the one thing they seemed to have overlooked was our request to be close to the elevators, and after consulting the hotel map, we realized that not only were we far from the elevators, we were in the farthest possible room from the elevators. As soon as we realized this we called down to the front desk and asked them for a change of rooms. We were told that since it was a holiday weekend, there wasn't another room available. When I asked them why they didn't inform us of this earlier, they claimed that they did not know I was pregnant or that we requested a room close to the elevators. I suppose that is possible, but since both my husband and I both called, and the hotel noted that we were traveling with a toddler, it seemed suspect that they would not have noted our request for a room closer to the elevators.
