Some of you reading might be thinking "what's the big deal?" , but for anyone who has ever been pregnant, walking starts to get difficult around the 7th month of your pregnancy, not to mention a 2 1/2 year old also can't walk very far without wanting to be picked up. And all this would have been fine we were were able to leave the room in the morning and not come back to the hotel until the evening, but as anyone with a toddler would tell you, it is nearly impossible to not have to return to the room for something - kid's nap, diapers, snacks, toys, change of clothes, etc. - at least twice during the day. After a while we really dreaded the walk. The location of our room and the inability of the hotel to change our room is really my only complaint. Other than that the resort was wonderful - the hotel is beautiful, the food was delicious (and yes, pricey), the service was great, particularly around the pool and the ocean. The restaurants were all extremely accomodating towards parents dining with children - every one of them had crayons, toys, and ample highchairs for the kids. The kiddie pool was beautiful, the beach almost felt private and the water was very calm. You can also do light snorkeling right off the beach, there is a small reef about 30 yards from the beach that is teeming with fish and sealife. Our room was surprisingly big, as is our bathroom, and we never heard our neighbors, so great soundproofing! The hotel contracts out for babysitters, but you can get a sitter as late as 4 hours in advance. The Kids for All Seasons children's program and room was great, with lots of fun activities and excursions. The sunset dinners at Farraro's was my favorite part, the wait staff was so accomodating, taking photos after photos of couples and familes against a gorgeous Hawaiian beach sunset. The spa was small but tranquil, and I highly recommend getting a massage in one of their seaside cabanas. So all in all we had a wonderful time at the Four Seasons Wailea, and I would recommend the hotel to my friends with kids, but caution them to try and confirm a room close to the elevators if at all possible!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: klojoy
Reviews.Content: For our honeymoon we traveled to Hawaii. We spent half our honeymoon on the island of Kauai, and the other half at the Four Season Maui! By far, our time at the Four Season Maui was the best! We did not want to leave! The guest rooms and service were incredible! We spent our days by the pool enjoying frozen pinapple cocktails! The pool staff was great. The assisted us with our chairs and getting us towels. We enjoyed cucumber slices for our eyes, Evian spritzers, and tastes of pineapple by the pool! In the evening, we enjoyed cocktails and live entertainment in the lobby. We truely felt as if we were on our honeymoon and enjoyed every minute that we were there!

Reviews.Title: “Family Dream Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Islandforme
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful vacation!! We stayed 2 weeks on the club level (8th floor). The service that we received was above anything imaginable. They were at our beckon call. My 9 year old son did not want to leave. He spent many days at the Four Season's Kids Club. That was hard for Mom and Dad, we would describe ourselves as over protective. Within a few days we became very comfortable with process and people that ran the camp. (They made each clubber take a swimming test each day. If they passed they gave them a wrist band that allowed them to swim at the pool.) Here are some things we found to be above and beyond: 1. Concierges on the 8th floor. (Look for Kimberly she was fanstastic) 2. They have a car to takke you anywhere in Wailea. (We never waited more than 5 min's) 3. Pools (WOW) 4. Beach was perfect. (It has a reef right off the beach. My wife had a turtle swin up to her goggles) 5. Food (Great but, very very expensive) 6. Kid Club (Your kids will love it. They do crafts, swim, tour the resort on hunts, have a mini rock wall, show movies (needed down time), will feed lunch (each day they offered a buffet at the pool for kids), computer games,) 7. View - You will see when you arrive. 8. Need a drink at the pool or beach - Watch for them they will be around soon. 9. Always had a chair, umbrella, or cabana. Had to get up by 8 -9 am to get the good ones at the pool. 10. Beach walk - This was nice stroll. Take your camera. You will not believe the sunsets. 11. Trade winds begin about 11 am and blow until 4. It helped on the beach. 12.. The club level had food and drinks available just about anytime you needed them. 13. The club level is pricey, but if you have the means you will not be displeased!

Reviews.Title: “As my husband kept saying, "this place is magical."”
Reviews.Author: megand231
Reviews.Content: Words cannot even begin to describe how impressed my husband and I were with this hotel. Every single staff member that we encountered was friendly, professional, and went above and beyond to make our stay at the Four Seasons enjoyable. While lounging by the pool, you are approached by staff members that offer cubes of either pineapple or watermelon, mini muffins, refreshing ice cold face towels, glasses of ice water, as well as frozen ice pops. (the ones wrapped in plastic that the staff would cut open for you) Another feature we enjoyed was the complimentary sunblock that was by the pool, and also by the beach. The hotel provided SPF 8, SPF 15, and SPF 30. One downside to this hotel was the adult only Serenity Pool. Unless you get there bright and early, you were not able to utilize this facility. There are only a certain number of chairs, and once they have all been reserved, you are put on a waiting list. My husband and I waited for almost three hours before we received a phone call, and at that point, we needed to start to get ready for dinner, so we were unable to claim our seats. Another negative to the Serenity Pool is the early closure. The area is only open until sunset. We found this unusual, as many people enjoy swimming in the evening. Another downside was the noises that we heard from our hotel room. We booked a mountain view room, and to our surprise, learned that our room was above the parking garage. We would hear horns and back up warning beeps, early in the morning. We are from New York, and are used to the noise, but were not expecting to hear that while vacationing. Overall my husband and I enjoyed our stay at the Four Seasons so much, that we have already began discussing the next time we want to vacation there. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for relaxation, and pampering. We will definitely be staying again, hopefully in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: LizVandy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I honeymooned in Kauai and Maui. Good thing we stayed at the Grand Hyatt in Kauai first because I never would have left the Four Seasons if we went there first. From the second we arrived everything was taken care of for us. We received a free room upgrade and complimentary champagne and treats were sent to our room. We hardly saw any sights on the island of Maui because we never wanted to leave the hotel. Duo was our favorite restaurant there (we thought Spago was overpriced and overhyped). We liked it so much we ate there two nights in a row. We often drove to the nearby 808 Deli and brought back salads and sandwiches to have on our lanai or in a cabana for lunch. The adult only pool is heavenly. The fitness center is open air. Wailea has the world's most beautiful sunsets. I could go on and on for days about how perfect this place is. I am spoiled for anything else because I now compare every hotel I stay at to this one and there is no comparison because this place is perfection.

Reviews.Title: “Love love love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: md78
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with my husband and this was our second stay at this hotel. We loved it so much the first time so we decided to return. I cannot say enough great things about this hotel. They have added and adults only infinity pool since the last time we visited and we really enjoyed it. The views were amazing and it truly was serene. Our room was spacious, clean and bright. The only complaint I have about this hotel is the extremely pricey food- however, the food is certainly high quality, organic for the most part and very fresh. The beach area is public but the sand is perfect on this beach! There is also great snorkeling just off shore. We will go back to this hotel again when we visit Maui!

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL ON THE PLANET - PERIOD!”
Reviews.Author: foodiehotelguy
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here 4 times... we've gone back each time since our honeymoon. As you can tell, there are around 900 reviews of this hotel and 99% of them are all claiming excellence. Don't let someone post a bad review because they don't know a good hotel when they expirience one keep you away from this amazing resort. As a hotel owner myself, I give the product, cleanliness, public areas, and staff all A+'s. From the moment you drive in and notice the lush landscaping and the friendliest valet service ever you know you've arrrived! Hands down this is my favorite resort I have ever been to. Make sure you have sunset reservations at Ferraros and order the lobster risotto (you may have to let them know in advance if you want that dish). The small town of Kihei nearby is great as well - everything you need is there. In my opinion, Wailea is a real resort feeling area while Lahiana is more like Key West...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort!”
Reviews.Author: drf10
Reviews.Content: This was our second stop on our honeymoon and we were greeted with smiling doormen with leis to put around our necks, an even more friendly lady behind the check in counter who told us she upgraded our room to an ocean view because of being newlyweds. The room was on the 6th floor and was spacious and very clean. The view was very pretty and there was a nice size balcony to eat or hang out. The bathroom was large and had a nice size shower and double sinks for the two of us to keep our toiletries. The staff at the hotel could not have been more helpful and friendly while we were there. We spent 7 days at the resort and everyday was amazing. We loved going to the infiniti pool for adults only. It's the newest addition to the hotel and the views are honestly breathtaking. The pool staff come around continuously refilling ourcup with water, or handing cold wash cloths out to cool off, or fresh pineapple and muffins, and i even had my sunglasses cleaned. They truly never overlook you. The food was excellent at every spot at the hotel. Breakfast at Duo's was fantastic everyday and we had lunch at Ferraro's and the poolside most days. Both lunch menus are great. We ate dinner at every restuarant and even just had some sushi one night downstairs in the lobby lounge area and it was great. One of my favorite parts of the hotel was the fitness center. My husband and I worked out almost everyday and it was a great experience. The cardio machines are outside under a canopy with lots of fans. There is also a large room with weights and machines and another studio. They offer free yoga and other fitness classes each day although i did not take advantage of this. I'm sure the classes are good, however. The spa is beautiful and I decided to treat myself to a hot stone rub and it was absolutely amazing. Overall, the Four Seasons is worth every penny considering the service is top notch, superior. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect experience, beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Sealover2008
Reviews.Content: Simply elegant, with excellent service, super clean and comfortable rooms, great breakfast buffet. Worth every dollar. Beautiful beach, right outside the pool area (the way we like it!). My kids felt extra pampered by free cookies and little toys. If we loved Maui we would be back here, or maybe we will come back because OF the hotel. Who knows? The Spago restaurant has amazing food, and the kids menu has fantastic food (steak with mushroom sauce, mashed potatoes and vegetables, as an example) for a unbelievable price ($9!!!). Drinks by the pool are so-so as is the food from the pool restaurant - but we enjoyed the experience nevertheless. One suggestion to the hotel: add a more Hawaiian atmosphere, ( for example: the green polo shirts for the attendants are a little Florida-ish).

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Treat”
Reviews.Author: Ajarn
Reviews.Content: For our anniversary we wanted to do something a little special. We decided upon the Four Seasons (FS) Maui because we wanted a first-rate experience and because of the overwhelming ratings here. We had developed high expectations based on the generally glowing reviews. We booked a garden-view room under the fifth-night-free promotion for ten nights 6/13-6/23 (paid for eight). I requested a refrigerator and microwave for convenience as we had our 2 Â½ year old son with us. Upon arrival at OGG our driver was waiting for us as we exited the aircraft, not down on the transportation level with all the other greeters. How they arranged that Iâ€™ll never know. FS contracts with an upscale Maui company for airport transportation. We were promptly driven to the FS in an Escalade. Not cheap but nice to arrive in some style (~$220). Our return trip to the airport was via taxi happily arranged by the concierge. FS uses a specific (Maui Island Taxi?) company so I suspect they are reliable. The arrangement was automatically confirmed for us by the concierge the night prior to departure. Cost ~$60 before tip. No problems and we would use them again. Check in was efficient. We were upgraded to a garden-view executive suite from our standard garden-view room. I can only conclude that they had capacity and our ten-night stay justified the upgrade. Weâ€™re nobody special and first time FS visitors. My math tells me we had a room that retails for $980 daily and we were paying $476 before taxes (reflecting promotion plus upgrade). No complaints here. Nice way to build customer loyalty. The room was ~850 square feet with a decent view of western Maui and the ocean. We had two balconies â€“ one with loungers and the other with a table and four chairs for entertaining. We also enjoyed two large plasma televisions and a dining area. Our son loved â€˜hisâ€™ sofa bed. Sure enough we had our microwave and actually had two refrigerators. We had a nice anniversary amenity waiting for us when we arrived, including a stuffed eagle-ray with the FS logo embossed on it for our son. The night before our departure we received a very nice dessert tray including a white chocolate conch shell we initially thought was real, a signed thank-you card and a Hawaii-themed childrenâ€™s book for our son. As for the grounds, as others have commented, they are really something - take the time to examine the flora and fauna. One thing I did not care for that I mentioned during check-out; on our last day a vendor was allowed to sell stuffed animals by the childrenâ€™s pool area. The concession was literally12-15 feet from the edge of the lower childrenâ€™s pool. Now, they had a machine that actually injected stuffing into the animal of your choice. I suppose is there some novelty to that but it struck me as a bit tacky and opportunistic. It just did not seem right. Besides, junior already had his FS souvenir stuffed eagle ray. Rather than expound further about the stay Iâ€™d prefer to try and offer some useful observations and tips. As others have mentioned, things are not cheap here, come here with that in mind and that the cost is the cost. I guarantee that youâ€™ll have a more enjoyable visit. If youâ€™re on a budget Iâ€™d probably avoid this area. Full buffet breakfast is around $80 for two with tip. Kids eat free at Duo and Ferraroâ€™s. Busiest time seems to be between 8:30 and 10:00 a.m. and there can be a wait if occupancy is up. I recommend getting up early with the sun, walk on the beach with a cup of complimentary coffee then grab an early breakfast. The weather and surroundings are beautiful. Sleep when you get home. Unless you are complete novices to the ocean and snorkeling, I recommend using the one-hour daily free gear rental (and float belt) and swimming off the south end of Wailea beach. You will notice several tour boats visiting the area daily. As long as the yellow flag is displayed the water is fine but always use good sense. We followed a sea turtle along the rocks perhaps 50 feet from shore. That was neat! If youâ€™re new to the ocean Iâ€™d consider asking the concierge for assistance in planning an organized trip that you are comfortable with â€“ the ocean is still the ocean and not to be taken lightly. We used the nanny service for toddler-sitting during our snorkel excursion. FS uses an outside company and the concierge will happily arrange it for you. Our â€˜nannyâ€™ was a pre-school teacher and mom. Our son took to her immediately. They played on the beach and in the pool while we enjoyed the ocean. Itâ€™s a three-hour minimum at $18 per hour. Probably one of the cheapest conveniences in the area. Weâ€™d easily use the service again (I wish we hadâ€¦). If you want to enjoy the nightly hula dance at the lounge I suggest getting a seat around 5:30 or so as it can fill-up pretty quickly. One of two fellows light the torches each night after the hula dancing (my son called him torch-man). They are friendly and glad to pose for pictures with you. Make reservations for dinner if you want a guaranteed table at any of the three restaurants. They can sell out quickly, unless you donâ€™t mind eating at 9 in the evening. Keep your eyes open for the daily activity sheet. They had a lei-making class for kids although my wife enjoyed it more than my son. All are welcome. My wife enjoyed the yoga class on the beach each morning. They have also meditation and tai-chi a couple times a week - all complimentary. Itâ€™s a vacation, try something new! Use the complimentary hotel car service to the Shops at Wailea. Get your souvenirs and snacks at the ABC store. We had a good dinner at Longhiâ€™s. I liked the fact that itâ€™s a local chain. Longhiâ€™s also serves breakfast daily but you donâ€™t get buffet â€˜grazingâ€™ privileges or the FS view of western Maui. I have to admit we also had a decent dinner at Tommy Bahamas, also at the Shops at Wailea. The concierge desk handles Budget car rentals. We grabbed a car for a day to go into Lahaina â€“ very convenient and easy. As we were considering what size car to rent it occurred to me to ask what parking is like in Lahaina â€“ I was told tight. We opted for the small car. Traffic can also get pretty snarled during rush hour. Ask the concierge about conditions to avoid any unexpected surprises. We intended on spending most of our time at the resort so we did not book a car for the entire stay. If youâ€™re staying more than a few days grab a car for an excursion and consider visiting the Safeway a couple of miles north for casual snacks or lunch items or beer to keep in the fridge. The food at the resort is generally quite good â€“ it just became a bit much for us given the length of our stay and we started craving more basic items. The only real stumble we encountered was when we returned from our excursion to Lahaina. The bellman asked if weâ€™d like our groceries delivered to our room as our hands were full with a tired child, a car seat and a backpack. I said yes and gave him our name and room number. The groceries were apparently delivered to another room and I ended up calling to ask where they had gone. The eventually found us. Not a huge deal but a bit odd and something that should not happen. And, we found our bed too soft for our middle-aged backs. You can request things you may not be accustomed to requesting elsewhere. On our second day I left a note for Housekeeping requesting chocolate milk for our son each evening as a bedtime snack. Each afternoon a box of chocolate milk was delivered to our room. On those days we had the DND on the door a voice message was left indicating the milk could not be delivered and to please call for delivery. The cost was minimal and the convenience was wonderful. At a dinner at Ferraroâ€™s we requested cucumber in lieu of carrot/celery sticks as a side for our sonâ€™s meal. Sure enough we got cucumber (no cost). At breakfast if you donâ€™t see the exact item you want ask what they can do. If they have the ingredients theyâ€™ll do what they can. Coconut pancakes not on the menu? Just ask. Need a mango sliced? Just ask. The kidâ€™s club is open for younger kids (<5) when accompanied by an adult. Our toddler son loved afternoon visits there with my wife as a break between pool, sun and ocean. There are crafts, puzzles and DVDs to watch although weâ€™re not big on video for our toddler. There is also a secured outdoor area for more physical play. Thereâ€™s even a small rock-climbing wall. We were always warmly welcomed. Weâ€™re not wealthy folks. This was a treat for us as a family anniversary celebration and we wanted to try the FS experience. It was not cheap but we all enjoyed ourselves as much as I believe we could at any major resort. Yes, weâ€™d probably do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: meghan109
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons, Wailea was the last stop on our honeymoon and we couldn't wait for it as we had saved the best for last. Or so we thought. The Four Seasons was likely grand in its hayday, but everything to us seemed tired and worn - the grounds, gardens, main pool, and even our room. When we checked in, we had to immediately switch rooms because the entire hall/wing and our room was musty. The pool area was overcrowded with too many kids and we had to call more than once for our room to be cleaned. The only saving grace was the adult pool which was new, serene and peaceful. If you have a family, you may like the kid friendly nature of it, but if you are on your honeymoon, STAY AWAY. I came home with food posioning and was hopitalized for three days - the likely culprit was the chicken from Ferraros and if that wasn't bad enough, my husband and I unpacked and two bugs crawled out of our suticases. GROSS!! I would have liked to think they were from the airplane which our luggage flew home on, but unfortunately, one of the bugs was tucked in a bag with my swimsuit that was inside the suitcase so the critter had to have crawled in from our room. For the money we spent to stay there, it certainly could have been put to better use elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “One of our favorite stays”
Reviews.Author: kim1131
Reviews.Content: If you're willing to pay the money, this is no question the best hotel in Maui. The service is outstanding in both the hotel and the restaurants. The common areas are beautiful and clean. The adult infinity pool area is fabulous for those couples traveling without children. As the Four Seasons always does, they cater to your every need. Rooms are a standard size but baloncies are a bit bigger. Ther bathroom was huge and spacious, we loved it! We also took advantage of the fitness center and the free group fitness. Both were great! If you have kids the Grand Wailea may be better for you, there were a lot of kid activities although the kids would be fine at the Four Seasons too. Guess it depends how much your kids need to be "entertained." To us, a couple without children, we felt like the Grand Wailea was a circus and there was a noteworthy difference in the service of the staff (we visited their spa for the day). As a result, we feel unless you're getting a better deal somewhere else in south Maui, the Four Seasons is your best bet, not doubt about it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just an overwhelmingly beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: adam9961
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this by saying I am usually not a four seasons or ritz person. In fact I am your typical marriott or hilton guy. I dont have the money to go to the four seasons usually, and although Im far from poor I tend to watch what i spend. My wife and I splurged and decided to go to maui for a nice vacation. We were torn between Ritz and four seasons. Let me just say after seeing both there is no comparison. The four seasons is so much nicer. It did not rain once from July 3 to July 10 when we were there. Wailea hardly ever has rain. We checked in and everyone was extremely nice. Rooms are absolutely gorgeous. We were upgraded to a garden view room. (we could see the ocean) The resort is so beautiful, and they had a huge staff out at all times picking up leaves and taking care of flowers. The grounds were overwhelming. It was about 87 degrees the whole time we were there, but it felt good. There was a constant breeze that made it feel more like 80. Our main hangout was the serenity pool. Its just astounding how nice it is. The only problem, which is actually pretty nice, is they only allow enough people in as there are chairs. This means if its busy you may get put on a waiting list. (never longer than a few hours) The swim up bar is amazing. The bartenders were very friendly. Rob was one of the nicest there. He is a good bartender too. Eric another bartender that is amazing. He made the best drinks I've ever had. Ask him for his watermelon gin drink. Absolutely amazing and I hate gin. We did have an older man that wore a hat and sunglasses that worked around the pool that was rude, but other than that we had the friendliest staff. They constantly walk around and give you water or fruit. The hotel spares no expense in any of their landscaping. The whole place will amaze you all week. Everywhere you look there is something new to surprise you. We stayed on floor number 4, and we actually had a celebrity on the same floor as us. (She is the main character on the city) Everyone said that they have celebrities here ALL the time. Food was a major bummer here. Ate at all the restaurants but Spago. We didnt eat at spago because the others were so bad. It gets a little expensive. We ate at ferraros for lunch twice and dinner twice. Burgers for lunch are 19 dollars and wife had a little pizza for 22. Dinner is around 30-50. Duo was disappointing. I had a ribeye that was one of the worst Ive ever had for 46. I also had ahi tuna that was above average for 44. Our best meal was at nearby capische. Go around 6 to catch the beautiful sunset. For anyone on a budget check out Cafe O'lei in kihei. (5 mins away) or make the 20 min trip to a little place called beach bums. Beach bums is a bar the locals go to, but they had some great food for 10-30 bucks. All in all this resort is expensive. Its beautiful, and its worth every penny... but its alot. We had a blast and I feel that the experience was well worth the hefty cost. The other wailea hotels are not anywhere as nice as this one. The Grand Wailea is rundown and has a feeling of an overcrowded theme park with a ton of people that seem like they belong on myrtle beach with cut off jeans. The Marriott was pretty ugly and old. Food was terrible when we ate there. The Fairmont is the second nicest in the area, but all the white can get a little ridiculous... Also went down to Makena resort to catch our boat to Molokini. Makena is similar a marriott. The other hotels just werent that nice.... The sheraton in kaanapali didnt look that nice. Hyatt was nice and Ritz was nice... but once again nothing like the four seasons. The grounds werent as pretty, and the serenity pool at the four seasons is the most gorgeous pool ive ever seen. The ritz pool was unimpressive from what I saw. The other problem is all the rain at the ritz. Its rainy and windy. Who wants to go to the beach to have it rain. Go to wailea where it hardly ever rains and it is beautiful every day. You wont be disappointed. you might want to see if a conference is scheduled when you are there. we had GSK there when we were there, and they kind of felt like they ran the place. They were loud and some seemed like they just had no manners. The serenity pool is supposed to be quiet and relaxing and many were yelling or talking on cell phones. It also made the place crowded. It was much more enjoyable when they werent there. I have to say a lot of them were what I would call hicks...

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps the closest thing to heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: Alohamousey
Reviews.Content: Where to start? I can just say that this place gave me the memory of a lifetime. It was honestly so beautiful, so serene, so peaceful that I would keep playing the image of this resort over and over and over again in my mind. It is that beautiful. To start, the service is absolutely off the top. No, this hotel is not pretentious, not prissy, and not snutty. Those hostile comments were probably written by people who can't afford to stay at this place and therefore felt the need to badmouth it. I find the service is just right. They don't try to be in your face all the time but they certainly know how to pamper you. All the staffs had a smile on their face the whole time we were there. They aim to please you any way that they can. They go above and beyond your every single need, and they even anticipate the things that you will run into based on the sites that you will be visiting. The valet boys would ask us where we are going and give us the appropriate goodie bags to go with our itenaries. This is the type of service that you should get when you are vacationing in the most beautiful place on earth. The facility is wonderful. The pools are very beautiful. I recommend their serenity pool because it is on a higher deck and you do get a slightly better view of the ocean but you still don't see that much of the ocean though. In either pool you can wear the waves though so you really can't go wrong with either pool. The fitness area is a bit too small and the treadmills are outside so it gets muggy and hard to breath especially if you workout in the afternoon. Workout in the early morning instead. The weight room is unfortunately way too small but who comes here to lift weights?! They have a beautiful garden which I think is the best hidden secret of the resort because it is really serene, full of beautiful tropical flowers, and has several hamacks. There is nobody in sight for hours, and at night of course the famous tiki torches go up. I would spend 2-3 hours in the garden in the morning and enjoy my peace and quiet. The rooms are just very classic good four seasons standards - nothing to really add. The restaurants were very good but a bit too pricey even for New York (where I'm from) standards. But you didn't come to Maui for a cuinary trip, right? The Wailea beach and the resort path: being that this is my 3rd trip to Hawaii I have some good comparisons. I honestly think that the Wailea beach is the best beach so far in all of the Hawaiian beaches. (I've only been to Oahu and Maui so far, so I might change my mind later). Waikiki and Haunama bay are too crowded. Lanikai and Kailua beach have serious erosion problems (beautiful, regardless). North Shore Oahu too wavy and can break your neck. Ko Olina is impossible to get a parking spot. KaAnapoli is too crowded (albeit nice as well). Makena is beautiful but the waves are too scary. Now there is something about the Wailea beach that is just right. The turquois water is absolutely stunning and with the golden sand in it, it looks like flecks of gold under the bright Maui sun. The view is also breathtaking - you can see the west maui as well as the Lanai island. I would love to return to this area again some day. Now the resort path is shared by multiple mega resorts such as Grand Wailea, Fairmount, Marriot, and some other private rental condos, so it does get crowded especially in the late morning when people start to jog around, but that didn't bother me so much, perhaps I'm from a crowded place? Compare to the Wailer's Village or Waikiki, the South Maui is very peaceful and quite.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Treat”
Reviews.Author: Aussies1
Reviews.Content: Our family of five arrived at the Four Seasons after 4 days in Kaanapali. Upon checking out of our condo in Kaanapali we filled in time by driving to Twin Falls which is half way along the road to Hana. Quite a nice drive though not as amazing as I expected. Lunched at Mama's Fish House on the way back. Lovely atmosphere on a beautiful beach. Arrived at Four Seasons at check-in time to make the absolute most of our 3 days there. Were pleasantly surprised at our upgrade from POV to Ocean View. We were a little concerned at how we would all it in the room (after been spoilt in our beautiful spacious ocean front villa at Kaanapali Ali) but it proved to be large and very comfortable. Thoroughly enjoyed all the luxuries and great service at Four Seasons. Definitely the best choice in Wailea. Though our 14 year old son enjoyed the pools at Grand Wailea where friends were staying. Our 16 and 19 year old daughters loved sitting by the pool up on the grassy area which overlooked the beach. Found the adult pool a bit pretentious. Snorkelling on Wailea beach was fantastic. Very clear with many colourful fish and turtles. Much better than Black Rock in Kaanapali and probably even better than Honolua Bay which was also pretty good. Even the tour boats stopped outside Four Seasons for snorkelling. Yes, it is a very quiet area with not much to do but just make the most of the wonderful resort and relax for a few days. We had a car but only used it to drive to Wailea Hotel's restaurant Capishe. A lovely meal with great views at night. We also dined at Duo (had the $49 three course meal). It was pretty good but the service and atmosphere wasn't great. Probably should have dined at Spago. We also dined at Ferraro's which had a lovely night atmosphere on the beachfront. Average food though my gourmet 19 year old daughter said she had one of the best meals at this restaurant. Great games room with Billiards, Table tennis, etc and a separate video games room. We found the free internet service in the games room to be more than adequate for our purposes. Also free tea, coffee and newspapers each morning in the games room. Ridiculously priced boutique though judging by some of the guests at the hotel probably not a concern for them. The resort could do with a general store type shop to purchase essentials such as breakfast items. I walked to the Fairmont next door for these. Back home now in cold Melbourne, Australia. Can't wait to go back oneday...

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon PERFECTION!”
Reviews.Author: sweetpea1283
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights in Maui and 5 nights on the Big Island for our honeymoon. My only advice is if you're staying more than one place stay here last it will blow any other place out of the water and you will be in withdrawal when you leave!!! The other reviews cover it but our experience was IMPECCABLE. Got upgraded to an ocean prime room and it was great, amazing inside - huge bathroom, comfy bed, and great view. The infinity adults pool was beautiful. Just walking around the lobby or having a happy hour drink, every little experience made me feel like a movie star being spoiled!! Best of the best. Oceanfront couples signature massages were amazing!!! All the restaurants were delicious. Room service was very good and they also brought us a bottle of champagne for our anniversary which was a nice touch. My husband got a great hair cut at the salon. There was a super cute women's boutique that was like the equivalent of a mini barneys co-op or intermix. Valet and concierge were super incredible. We had rented a jeep and did the road to hana (amazing) and the sunrise at haleakala. If you're coming from the east coast do the sunrise the first day, you have to wake up at 2 am (=8 am east coast time, do it before you're adjusted)... they packed our car full of blankets and water (they anticipate EVERYTHING it spoils you so much!) and the sunrise was amazing. Only advice dress warm its seriously cold, like 30-40s and very windy. But worth it. Summary: if you can afford it or rationalize it, go!!! It is SOOOO worth it and amazing!!! Sigh. Can't wait to return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pampered with high level of attention/service”
Reviews.Author: WendyWN
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 days in Kaanapali first at the Westin Maui and then our final 3 days at the Four Seasons in Wailea as we decided to do hotel hopping instead of island hopping and stay in different areas of Maui without having to drive as much. This was my second trip to Maui (last trip was more than 10 years ago) and the first trip for my husband and 2 kids, ages 8 and 5. We were meeting up with my sister's family to celebrate her 15th wedding anniversary and all our kids birthdays were in June/July and our own anniversary in late June so it was a great reason to splurge a little for our trip. This was the first time that our family stayed in a hotel as nice and expensive as Four Seasons, usually I only stay at 3 star hotels or less. I did my research onlline first to find the ideal hotel for us in Wailea. My sister had stayed at Grand Wailea 5 years ago for her 10th anniversary but I wanted to try Four Seasons based on all the good reviews I read through Maui Revealed and Tripadvisor and especially since it included a lot of complimentary things that most other hotels would charge for. The concierge was excellent and e-mailed me back with my many questions I had as I was doing research of what I was planning to do when we got there. When we arrived, we were greeted with flower leis (the guys got painted macadamia nut leis (I think that's what they are) and personal greeting and taken to the hotel lobby with our luggage and our rental car taken for valet parking. My sister had reserved 2 mountainside rooms months in advance for the regular rack rate $425/night (we didn't care for the nicer views) and we requested to be near each other but unfortunately we were placed a floor above each other. This place is huge so it took a long time to get to the elevator from where our room was located just to get to each other's room, but we found the stairs to be a shortcut. When we arrived to our room, we were pleasantly surprised with a happy anniversary card (belated) as well with bottle of complimentary wine left in the refrigerator as well as some yummy goodies on the table in celebration for my daughter's belated birthday. The unfortunate part was that the ants from outside also found it to be yummy and thus we couldn't enjoy the goodies. So housekeeping had to come back and spray and I never bothered to call room service for the replacement. The next morning the ants followed the same scent trail despite no more food and I had to call housekeeping again but soon the ants disappeared with no food present. We were also pleasantly surprised with 2 spotted eagle ray stuffed animals left for my two children. On the day of my son's birthday (2 days later), we were pleasantly surprised with a drop off of balloons with a present (juggling balls) for his 8th birthday and they also included a present (wooden puzzle) for my daughter's belated 5th birthday (2 wks prior) at the same time. Later when I returned in the afternoon, a small dessert/cake with M&M's were left out on the table for him but of course the ants came back again. I had to call room service and housekeeping to let them know what happened again and this time, they delivered a new one in 1/2 hour after housekeeping came again and sprayed right away. My sister who was one floor below us in the room below had no issues with ants coming in despite food on the table. We had dinner at Spago the first night we arrived for my sister's anniversary and the food was EXCELLENT. We love Wolfgang Puck restaurants and the service was excellent, expensive but everything was great! We had poolside food as well for lunch and the food was okay but my sister didn't think the pizza was that great for the price they charge. We didn't get to try Duo or Ferraro restaurant but figured it was less expensive to eat off resort. We also tried out the complimentary outrigger canoe and booked this in advance and it was a good learning experience, and we left our 2 kids in complimentary Kids for All Seasons camp for the morning briefly (you would only pay $15 for lunch if they stayed for such). The kids had fun making a "volcano" in the sand, but I went back after we were done with the outrigger canoe and they rather be picked up than stay. if your child can not swim, you had to come down in the morning at 11 AM to watch them anyways when they were going to the keiki pool. In their game room, they had ping pong, video games (Guitar Hero and others), foozball and table shuffleboard and pool tables with complimentary internet/computer access. They also had a business center that was also complimentary which I used as well to print out boarding passes on day of departure. So I didn't need to use laptop or get/pay for internet access. I also tried their complimentary Zumba class and had a blast. Staff was helpful in finding complimentary cabanas near the poolside as well as down at the beach which was a nice plus, and setting them up with covering or umbrellas and providing towels, but of course we tipped them for their help. If you stayed at the poolside long enough, someone also comes out and gives out ice pops, as well as fresh pineapple or spritz your face and put cucumber slices on your eyes - these were kind of neat. The rooms were huge and spacious and the beds were comfortable. Nice small refrigerator with 2 water bottles given per day, with coffeemaker and usual coffee (would have been nice to have tea bags in the room), also had DVD player. Bathtub and separate shower with option to play various types of music in the bathroom. Bathrobes for the adults and little bathrobes for the kids - how cute. They even supplied kids' shampoo/bubble bath and sunscreen as well. They had turndown service in evenings as well. One day I left tip and daytime housekeeping didn't even take it. We also took complimentary shuttle down to shops of wailea and nearby restaurants in Wailea. They do charge overnight valet parking at $20/day but I wish they had option to self park. We never bothered taking our car out. Never tried the adult serenity pool, but they have a small keiki pool for the little ones and then a 3 1/2 foot pool area and then a larger family pool with hot tub for family and separate one for adult. Nothing fancy about their pools, but wasn't too crowded. There's not as much to do in Wailea compared to Kaanapali but it's less hot in Wailea and a bit windier in the afternoons. This is a great place to do serious R&R. I think it's great if you come as couple without kids or come with kids who don't mind staying in the kids camp. Of course there's the option to arrange for water activities such as sailing/snorkeling in nearby Maalea Harbor which we didn't end up doing after all in Wailea (we canceled a sailing trip due to recent sunburn and seasickness from another rafting/snorkeling trip we took few days prior while in Kaanapali). If you don't mind paying a bit more and tipping people to be pampered (I wish I knew the tipping etiquette well enough so I'm not under or overtipping), and have many amenities included, this is a great place to stay. I wouldn't recommend it so much with families with teenagers b/c I think they would get bored more easily and the pools at Grand Wailea would make more sense for them although Grand Wailea is much more expensive and charges extra for cabanas, etc. Overall there were more posiitives than the minor negatives that we experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance & Perfection”
Reviews.Author: SamuraiBlue
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best hotel in Wailea, and possibly on the island of Maui. The experience from start to finish was everything I would expect from a luxury resort: attentive staff, delicious food, excellent housekeeping, pristine facilities, etc. I have no idea how Hotel Wailea is #2 behind the Four Seasons. The Four Seasons should be in a class by itself. I am a harsh critic at this price point, but in my experience, it was worth every penny and then some. Tip: Book a table at Ferraro's during the sunset at least one night of your stay whether you're staying at the Four Seasons or elsewhere. It'll be your best meal on that end of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Most incredible hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: lovelyleo33
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent a week here and we cannot wait to go back. Everything was beautiful and the service was fantastic. If you can treat yourself to this place don't hesitate to do so!

Reviews.Title: “Four Season Wailea Keeps Get Better & Better”
Reviews.Author: happyfamilyinnz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have traveled to the Four Seasons Maui for years. Our last visit was our first with our infant daughter and we couldn't be more pleased. We were upgraded to an ocean view prime suite and it was simply amazing! Every detail was tended to for our daughter. The room was completely child proofed before we arrived - every plug covered and the lanai banister had netting. There were welcome amenities for her and a snack on arrival. Laundry was an exceptional value for children and food free in most restaurants for kids under 5. As always, the spa was amazing and pool was fantastic. We got married at the resort a few years back and didn't think anything could top that trip. We were wrong...the resort keeps getting better and better!

Reviews.Title: “Every Day is a Day in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Nicegrump
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from 8 nights at the Four Seasons. We are experienced travelers. I think that this is the best hotel on the planet. I have not experienced a comparable level of service anywhere. Pools - We had no problem with pool chairs and cabanas at either the Serenity Pool or the main pool. The hotel was at/or close to capacity but you would never know it. Everyone is provided cups with water, that are continuously refilled, frozen pops are served poolside, cucumbers for the eyes with a cold cloth, and of course the evian spritzers. Food - Breakfast and Lunch are expensive. If you live in a major metropolitan area, then you will not find dinners at the Four Seasons or area restaurants any more expensive than dinner in a nice restaurant in a major metropolitan area. We ate at Ferraro's and Spago and they were wonderful. The ocean side ambiance of Ferraro's at night is truly wonderful. For breakfast , we tried the different hotels and Longhi's at the Wailea shops. They all were good but expensive. The best, for breakfast were Duo's at the Four Seasons and Longhi's at the Wailea shops. Lunches were spent mostly poolside with menus from Ferraro's. Lunch is expensive, but honestly, my wife and I would share a sandwich after having had a big breakfast. To reduce breakfast and lunch expense, it is worth a trip or two to the shops at wailea to pick up cereal, milk, deli etc to keep in the fridge in the room. It can make a significant impact. Also, it is worthwhile buying your favorite liquor at the shops, it you enjoy having a drink on your lanai in the evening. The Room - the rooms are clean and very nice. The hotel's grounds are spectacular. We stayed in a garden-view room that had a private patio. It was wonderful to go out on the lanai in the evening , read, surf the internet, talk etc. We were offered an upgrade for $50/night to a partial ocean view room or $100/night for an ocean view room. I do not think the partial ocean view rooms are worth the extra money. The hotel is set back, and I do not think the view was really better than the garden view room we had. Likewise, the ocean view room is also set back.. but at least you have a direct view of the ocean. I probably would have spent an extra $50 a night for the ocean view.. but our room was very comfortable. The rooms in all three categories are the same and have the same amenities. Getting Around - The hotel does a wonderful job of providing you with free transportation around Wailea. We didn't take a taxi anywhere in Wailea. However, as soon as you go outside Wailea (dinner at Sorento's) you need a taxi. Fitness Center - One of the best that I have seen at a hotel. Cons - $6 a night to pay for internet in a room that costs (at standard room rates) $595 a night??? The Hotel does not nickel and dime you except for the internet. The only service problem we experienced was our first day when the maid service apparently forgot to make up our room. We spoke to the front desk and at 3 pm the room was made up . However they returned for the turn down service at 5:30 PM while we were getting ready to go out for the evening. We went to the front desk, told them our typical schedule and we had no problems for the remainder of our stay. Summary - We are contemplating a return to the Four Seasons Maui at Wailea same time next year The best service.. wonderful location.... total relaxation.... it can't get any better.

Reviews.Title: “A very safe choice for global nomads and discerning travelers everywhere...”
Reviews.Author: Paul-Michael
Reviews.Content: Just returned from ten days at the Four Seasons Resort Maui at Wailea. My wife and I were traveling without our 8-year old daughter, seeking some quality time together in luxurious surroundings without having to worry about the quality of the Kids Club and those other concerns that accompany family travel. The Pros, Cons, and everything in between... Location: Maui is a beautiful little island, lush with beautiful tropical foliage and blessed with incredible weather. During our visit, the weather was consistently outstanding: warm, sunny, with mild trade winds virtually every afternoon. Great weather for being outside, catching some rays, snorkeling, or just about anything else one might wish to do outside. The resort's location is quite good and the beach (public) is conveniently located at the back of the resort, just a short walk down some steps. While it is a public beach, it is not particularly crowded. We stayed in a Prime Ocean View Club Suite (on the private access 8th floor) and enjoyed it. Be sure to check out the photos on the website, because even when paying top dollar for a Prime Ocean View Club Suite room, you'll still only have an angled view of the ocean and quite a bit of "interior courtyard" (which, while relaxing and nicely done, isn't what most of us want to see). We knew this going in, so we were less disappointed than others who might have expected a "true" ocean view. The room was well appointed, nicely maintained, and sufficiently spacious. The bed was very comfortable and provided a reasonable balance of support and comfort. The bathroom was quite large, with a good layout, lighting, excellent water pressure, and a deep tub. The Four Seasons got this part right. The Club Lounge was of a very high standard and compared favorably with any we've experienced anywhere in the world. The team there (including Pat, JiJi, Chris, and all the others) does a great job; they really make you feel welcome and will do their very best to take care of you. The various presentations throughout the day are generous and of very high quality, and for those inclined to enjoy a drink or two, alcohol is included in the price. If one were traveling with a family, this could be a particularly attractive option. On some days, we noticed couples who were virtually having their dinners using the afternoon presentations and evening dessert offerings. The restaurants on-site are generally of high quality. Spago delivered as expected, stylishly presented, tasty cuisine, with impeccable service and a price tag to match. We found Duo to be underrated: here, again, the service was quite good and the food quality very high---they fall down on atmosphere, though. Be sure to try the Gingerbread Peach Caramel sundae---my wife claims to have discovered a new "favorite" dessert. And, if you don't have room for a "full dessert," they offer smaller, "tapas-sized" versions. Very thoughtful. Ferraro's is overrated: while the atmosphere is good, along with nice views of the beach, the service was not of an equal standard and came across as amateurish and a bit coarse for the Four Seasons. There are many other choices available off property of equal or higher quality and within a short drive by taxi (US$10) or for free using the House Car. We strongly recommend Capische---very romantic, great views, and very good food. From what we saw of the Fairmont and the Grand Wailea, we were very happy with our choice. The former came across as very tired and worn, while the latter was sprawling and constantly filled with masses of bodies milling about, particularly large, LOUD groups of companies on business / incentive travel. We could hear the crackle of the PA systems down the beach on a few evenings, accompanied by the monotonous droning of the MC who welcomed "winners from across the globe...do we have anyone here from Europe...Canada, okay, that'll do..." We were very happy to be ensconced within our tranquil sanctuary at the FS. The pools: the adult-only Serenity pool was not our cup of tea. One major design flaw: the tile captures and retains heat very efficiently and will effectively sear the soles off your feet. The US$350 private cabanas seem pointless and designed for posers and newlyweds who are enjoying the largesse of their parents. For anyone else, we can't imagine "why." If you relish "being seen" and enjoy wearing full make-up and jewelry while catching a few rays and speaking as loudly as possible about your last 3 vacations at other FS resorts, you'll definitely want to consider this venue. We strongly preferred the beachside seating, with outstanding, unobstructed views of the ocean and islands, and delightful service throughout the day: endless glasses of ice-cold water, pineapple and other frozen treats to refresh you, cucumber eye wraps and Evian facial spray, someone to clean your sunglasses, etc. These services and treats are truly memorable and distinguish the FS from other properties. The fitness club is well appointed and should meet the needs of most everyone except "hard core" free weight buffs. The spa is small, but of good quality. No need to come early as there isn't much to enjoy beyond your treatment. And the treatments are priced at the higher end of the luxury spa continuum. For those of you who have traveled across Asia or in the Caribbean, you will be disappointed by the price vs. value equation. In terms of activities, one could easily stay at the resort and spend the day sunning, swimming, snorkeling (right off the public beach---my wife and I saw eels, sea turtles, and all kinds of beautiful fish, anemones, and coral), etc. We rented a car for a few days and took the "Road to Hana"---a tortuous trail with relatively little to see as the waterfalls were quite weak. But the weather was great, and we stopped at Paia for breakfast on the way out and an early dinner on the way back. Good food in this funky little "hippy town": outstanding macadamia nut banana pancakes at Charley's (one order is enough for two people); great gelato at OnoGelato; and exceptional pizza at FlatBread (if you're a fan of Mellow Mushroom, you'll really like this organic pizza). Lahaina is also worth visiting: lots of touristy t-shirt shops, but also some good restaurants, great art galleries, and jewelry to suit most tastes and budgets. While we didn't have our daughter with us, the FS Maui definitely came across as very "kid-friendly" and the children we saw here, many in the 2-10 year old range, seemed quite happy. We would definitely consider returning to this resort, especially with our daughter. Overall, a very enjoyable stay. Everything here is done very well and you pay handsomely for it. Rather than highlighting anything that was truly exceptional, what was most memorable about this stay was the absence of anything negative. A subtle difference, but one that should resonate with those who have traveled extensively and enjoyed high-end properties across the globe.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: jcyy
Reviews.Content: There is a reason why this particular hotel gets the best ratings and is one of the best hotels in North America. It's all to do with the excellent service that the staff provides for every guest that enters their property. No matter who you are, whether you are just having dinner or on your honeymoon, the staff are polite, helpful and always smile. It makes a world of difference when the service is this good. The "good" stuff: - The staff. Really, I can't stress this enough. - The property grounds are always spotless, yet you don't ever see anyone cleaning or pruning the gardens. - Great pool service, clean pools, great cabanas, complimentary classes, children's toys and scuba diving taster. - Beach service is just as good. They'll set up your chairs and umbrellas, come round with mini muffins, water and fruit. 1 hour free snorkel hire. The sand is so soft and there's no debris to be aware of. If you can swim out far enough there is a reef with lots of colourful sealife. - Chamber maids do an excellent job. They leave plenty of towels, bathroom amenities, water. - Free tea and coffee outside DUO's in the mornings. - Concierge are efficient and have some great recommendations for whatever you may need. - There is an empty fridge in the room, so feel free to stock it up. - Use of a beach tote was very helpful when it came to days out. Valet will provide you with extra towels and bottled water. - We ate in all the restaurants and thought that Spago's was probably the best. They change the menu daily depending on the produce they get. The food was delicious, the service was not too intrusive and the views of sunset are priceless. The "not so good" stuff: - Paying for wifi. Surely a hotel of this standard would have free wifi for their hotel guests? It seems silly to be that you are charged daily plus an internet tax! - I saw a few ants in the bathroom. They were tiny so I can understand that they may get in . - The safe in our room didn't work properly for the first day so we called for maintenance to come and take a look. Thinking that the battery was flat they changed it quickly and left. The next day the same thing happened so they changed our safe to a different one. Very quick and efficient. Third day....again, the safe wasn't working. We just ended up locking our valuables in a suitcase. - Food and drinks by the pool weren't as good as they should have been for the prices that you pay. Alternatives are to eat at the restaurants or go to nearby Wailea shops and grab something there. Recommendations: - Renting a car. We splashed out on a convertible Mustang which is great with the roof down. Visit some of the quieter towns on Maui, explore other beaches. Valet at the hotel is $20 per night. Valet to other restaurants are around $8-10 (free with validation). Shopping malls are free with validation. - Bring your own snorkel gear and visit the many beaches on Maui. Long beach, Turtle Beach (where you will definitely spot a turtle or two). - Sunrise bike tour to Mount Haleakala. We booked through the Concierge and it was a great experience and lots of fun. - Drive to Hana. If you're brave enough to drive this then ask Concierge and they will provide you with a cd detailing places to visit on the drive to Hana. Do not attempt the unpaved roads, it isn't nice and a lot of car rental companies will not cover you if you breakdown along this stretch of road. Bring plenty of food, drinks, suncream. You'll need flipflops, trainers, towels and swimwear. Bring a waterproof camera too because there are some beautiful hidden waterfalls along the way. - Make reservations for the restaurants early sometimes a week early if you are going during the peak season. Sunset is the most popular times for meals because the views are so beautiful. - Try and make time for the outrigger canoe programme. It's informative and great fun. Again book way in advance as it's so popular. - If you're not keen on surfing then you could try paddle surfing. It requires some good balance but it's lots of fun and a great work out. The hotel hires them out for $35/hr. And lastly, just enjoy it. I know I did and I will certainly be back!

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Maui”
Reviews.Author: ATLTraveler1810
Reviews.Content: We just finished a ten day stay at the Four Seasons for our honeymoon, taking advantage of the stay five get one night free promotion. The resort was a perfect blend of luxury, pampering and beauty. What set's this property apart is the staff. When is the last time you said what a great job the valet does when they get your car? Every person who works at the property wants you to enjoy this special resort, from the valet to the pool attendant. We rented a car and took road trips several days and then truly relaxed the next few days at the serenity adult only pool. We never had a problem getting a lounge chair. The resort was sold out during our stay and it never felt crowded. Five days into our ten day stay we were upgraded from a partial ocean view to a prime ocean view. The front desk knew it was our honeymoon and went our of their way to make it even better when space was available. Restaurants on property were excellent - We loved the menu at Spago which changes daily and also the view from the outdoor patio at Ferraro. It is expensive, but not more so than any other top level restaurant on the island. Only two small complaints - the drinks at the pool bar and lobby bar were just OK. For $16 a drink they were not worth it, and not that special. A second small complaint is charging for Wi-Fi on property - seems petty when you are paying $600+ a night. We will be back and if you are considering the Ritz on Maui - the Four Seasons is head and shoulders above in every way. We had a great lunch at the beach side restaurant at the Ritz after snorkeling at Honolua Bay ( an absolute must visit as this is where all the snorkel cruises go - you can drive there, park and walk to this unbelievable reef). Ritz is nice, but again, you get what you pay for - the Four Seasons is the top resort in Maui if not all of Hawaii. Mahalo Four Seasons Staff !

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: sgcanada28
Reviews.Content: Like everyone else said the resort and the room are very beautiful and the service is really good at the concierge desk, pool, beach and in the restaurant. BUT We found little ants (a lot of them) in both room we reserved. We told the front desk lady who immediately send the room service to spray the place. She told us it is a tropical place and they have problem with ants... We found ants for the rest of our stay and it was all over the bathroom. We never let our things out because we were afraid to have ants all over it. Not a good experience for this type of hotel. Duo restaurant is expensive but considering the quality of the food it was worth it. But the price for room service is terrible. For exemple, if you want 2 toast and peanut butter for breakfast: it will cost about 23$ !!!! A glass of juice: 8$!!! So everything is good but ridiculously expensive. The worst thing for us was the resort location. Don't get me wrong, the ground are very nice but there is nothing to do around except beach and pool game/activities. This is a great resort is you want to stay all your vacation within the resort. We went to Waikiki first and we found Wailea boring (but really nice).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service, First Class Beach”
Reviews.Author: SEJW83
Reviews.Content: My husband and I began our honeymoon at the Four Seasons in Maui. We spent 6 nights at the resort and rarely even left the property. The pool always had chairs available, however the adults only pool was a little more difficult to use at leisure. We did make it up there one afternoon, but found we actually liked the main pool atmosphere better. Complimentary sunblock and ice water infused with cucumber are always on hand at the pool as well, which was such a nice touch! The service is exceptional. Everyone who works there really wants to help you and always greets you with an "Aloha." We ventured to the Shops at Wailea one afternoon and found some great gifts for our family and some things for ourselves as well. You can walk there, but it's a little tricky to find a pathway up to the main road off of the beach access path. We used the complimentary golf cart service to take us to lunch one day at a nearby pizza place. It was wonderful! Spago, Duo, and Ferraro's on property were all amazing. The Reuben sandwich at Ferraro's was to die for. If you like to work out on vacation, their outdoor cardio area is beautiful. You can run on a treadmill or use an elliptical with a view of the ocean. That was enough motivation to get me down there each day! You must rent snorkel gear (free for an hour - that's all you really need!) and swim around the reef right off of the beach. We saw sea turtles, eels, and other beautiful fish without having to swim far at all. We also went scuba diving from the beach. The Four Seasons has their own dive center right on property. So convenient! FS Maui had the best beach and best swimming area of the 3 locations - no rocks or stones to avoid while swimming like other Hawaii beaches. All in all, the Four Seasons in Maui was our favorite spot out of the three FS locations we visited in Hawaii. While it is a little busier and more "LA" feeling than the property on the Big Island or on Lana'i, we enjoyed having delicious dining and lots of fun things to do right at our finger tips.

Reviews.Title: “You won't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: supermom94
Reviews.Content: As usual with Four Seasons, the service was amazing. From the front door to the guys and gals at the pool and beach, the waitstaff at the restaurants and the housekeepers, the service was friendly and so very helpful. Best of all, they seemed to enjoy their jobs. I booked the least expensive room (Mountainview) for my family of four and we were upgraded to a room with a garden and partial ocean view room. It was perfectly roomy for 4 as was the marble bathroom. The balcony was also a good size. There were plenty of complimentary amenities and activiities - L'Occitane toiletries, bottled water, coffee and tea, computers, game room, dvd movies, excercise classes, snorkel equipment for one hour, hawaiian paddling. The restaurants served wonderful food and all served fixed price dinners which were embarassingly reasonable for the quality of the food and service. The beach in front of the hotel is one of the nicest on the entire island. As one previous reviewer stated, if you can at all swing the price, stay here. It is an experience you won't forget or regret. Kaanapali is a zoo, Kapalua is too remote with not much going on. Wailea is the place to stay in Maui, particularly the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, service, all around hotel”
Reviews.Author: dganem
Reviews.Content: What a pleasure it was to stay at this hotel, the staff was on top of every request, the grounds were beautiful, and the pool was one of the most relaxing i've been to. I have heard rumors they have am adult pool since our visit, so it looks like its time to go back!

Reviews.Title: “If you can't afford it, don't stay there....”
Reviews.Author: Inluvwithjapan
Reviews.Content: Wouldn't have stayed here but the event we were going to landed at this property. Not saying that the hotel isn't gorgeous, it is. Service was terrific in all facets. Even had a high profile celebrity playing in the swimming pool (Adam Sandler). But jeez, $500 a night for a basic room? Oh yeah, it had a view of the ocean (you know the type....if you stand on the far edge of the room, tilt your head 45 degrees on your tippy toes, you can see a corner of the ocean). Breakfast was something like $40 per person, a pizza lunch for two came in around $70, and don't get me started about dinners here. I enjoy luxury just as much as the next person, but if its about $700 a day for a room and meals, there's something wrong with this picture. We stayed at the Hotel Wailea also, which admittedly isn't on the water (but the ocean view was much better), was quieter, roomier for something like $300 per night (breakfast and wine reception are free). Would I recommend this hotel to a friend? Yes, as long as his annual income exceeds $1M a year and doesn't have kids to put thru college.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most luxury sesort you should never miss in maui”
Reviews.Author: summer_wang
Reviews.Content: 1.Select the habour view room for your stay, if no other noisy happen, the room is perfect for people who love peace..The ocean front room has better view but a little bit nosiy out out the window because of the poolside activity. 2. The 3 restaurants here in Fourseason are turely good ones for dinner. Don't miss that. 3. The beach is not very good due to the size limited. But you might try the morning beach yoga class. 4.One of the most important feature I would love to strongly recommend is the Fitness center, image your gym time in half-outdoor surrounding with flowers and beautiful ocean view,,,Love that~~ 5. And the swimming pool is super good(especially that higher level one)

Reviews.Title: “Best ever hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: scootertravelfl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from spending one week at the Four Season resort in Maui. The experience far exceeded my expectations. The resort is located in a great location right on a beautiful beach. The staff is exceptionally friendly and never did I experience any "attitude"....NEVER! As a parent, I do base my experience on how my children are treated. Once again, the service from the staff was exceptional. Whether at the pool, restaurants or hanging out in the game room, the staff addressed my children on a first name basis and went out of their way to make them feel welcome. The facilities are world class, extremely clean and safe! Also, although the resort is very luxurious, the feel was laid back...not stuffy! I would recommend this hotel to anyone with children! The only issue I had with the resort was the cost of food and beverages at the pool. I recognize Four Seasons is a luxury hotel, however, food at the pool was over the top expensive. "Reduce your prices and you will more than make up for it in volume".

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: traveler0219
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in June and can't say enough good things. Clean, friendly, professional, etc. etc. This is certainly an exceptional hotel. Was told capacity was about 75% but there seemed to be hardly anyone there. The hotel does a great job of spacing people out so it does not seem crowded at all. No complaints at all that I can think of. I wish the rooms kept light out a little better but frankly that helps you get up and moving in the mornings. Only thing I would change would be that I would have been happy with a Garden room as opposed to forking out for the Ocean View Prime (though I do not regret it in the least). Seeing the water was nice but we would have been perfectly fine without it and the savings is quite a bit. But...I would most certainly get a Prime room over one on the outside overlooking parking, streets, etc. Wouldn't have been awful to not have Prime (I'm sure we would have lived), but the peaceful 'inside' view is worth it to me. I won't repeat all the details as they have been listed over and over in these reviews. Great place. Definitely want to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property, Loud convention crowd”
Reviews.Author: ceilokla
Reviews.Content: April 2010 was our second visit to the Four Seasons, our first visit was 9/08. It is a beautiful property. However, we did notice some changes. The serenity pool can be wonderful. However, during our visit the serenity pool was overrun with a group of loud individuals who appeared to have had too much liquor and also appeared to be associated with a convention. While at the serenity pool some individuals would talk loudly on their cell phones while lounging at the serenity pool and others in the group were conversing loudly across the pool at each other, drinking and getting even louder. It would have been okay behavior at a college bar. On the second day of their continued loud behavior at the serenity pool, I complained to staff. It was suggested to us that we try different times to be at the pool. We followed this suggestion for the next 5 days and found a totally different environment, it was peaceful. The serenity pool was not crowed when it appeared that the convention group was off the hotel premises. We very much appreciated the pool staff's suggestion and assistance in other various ways that made our visit enjoyable. We did eat in the lobby lounge, Ferro's, Duo's, and Spago's. I would recommend all except Spago's. We ate at Spago's when we visited FS 2 years ago and the food during that visit was wonderful. This visit we found Spago's to be average at best. After one bite of the appetizer I let the server know the appetizer tasted awful. The server smiled, nodded and that was that. The food and service at the other restaurants was above average. The valets and concierge went beyond expectations on more than one occasion. I don't know if we will visit this hotel again as it felt to me that the unruly convention crowd at the four seasons, have priority over individuals that are on vacation to celebrate or relax and enjoy the natural tranquility of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Hand's down, the best on the Island.”
Reviews.Author: vvir3d
Reviews.Content: The Four Season's is the top hotel on Maui, and for good reason. We stayed at the Fairmont Kea Lani (next door) for our honeymoon seven years ago, and the property does not even compare. The FS takes extra care and attention to their grounds. The grounds at FS are the most beautiful I have seen, and I have stayed at a lot of 5 star properties around the world. Pros: * When we first arrived the bellman instantly greeted us and took our luggage then showed us where to check-in. The bellman waited while we checked in and then took us to our room. The hotel concierge was fantastic. They were knowledgeable and attentive to help us select the right activities complete with directions prepared by FS. The staff at FS overall were outstanding. You can tell they truly want to help you and are happy to be working at such a nice place. * Wonderful 80 minute hot stone massage at the spa ($560) Relaxing 50 minute beach side massage with Jonath (I think that is his name) * Serenity Pool was calming, but the Cabana rental ($300) was not worth it. We rented one in Vegas at Bellagio and it was fantastic. This one, not so much. I was impressed how staff greeted me by my name each time they interacted with us. Cons: *Regular resort pricing for 2 people at the Breakfast Buffet was $83.07. Fortunately, we got a Bed and Breakfast type promotion. With that said about the high price, the buffet has something to please even the most discriminating guest. A chef prepares pancakes, waffles or omelets on the spot at your request. *I found the parking fee a bit too expensive when you take into consideration the guys expect a tip every time you get your car - leaving or coming back to the FS. If you can afford the hotel, the Four Seasons is the best option. Hands down an incredible property you must stay at if it's in your budget. It is definitely worth the high cost.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: marianne13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the last 6 nights of our Hawaii honeymoon. When I was first looking into hotels, I was thinking of staying someplace in Kaanapali Beach. Everyone on the Maui forums told me that if we can afford it, we should stay at the Four Seasons and that I would not regret it. They were right. We loved the Four Seasons. It's not a huge hotel (we were coming from the Grand Hyatt in Kauai which was much bigger) and it's very simple but still beautiful. We loved the breakfast buffet, the restaurants, the pools, room cleaning service (who comes 2x a day and is very unobtrusive), and everything else. It is expensive but it was well worth it for a honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: susanPerthAustralia
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic experience! This hotel is rated the best in Maui and this title is well deserved. We upgraded our room to a club suite which allowed all day dining and free flow champagne and cocktails morning, noon and night if you are inclined! Well worth the upgarade as the club floor rooms have the best views on the property. We were allowed to take our cocktails and food to our suite to watch sunset...very romantic....our 8 and 9 year old were spoilt with take home toys and their own amenities. We were travelling with another family and all of us had an unforgettable experience. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth!”
Reviews.Author: txtravelinmom7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week in May for our anniversary. We booked a garden view room and was upgraded to a POV room on the 4th floor. We had a welcome amenity of little candies in the room when we arrived. We had breakfast every morning in the room except for one morning when we tried Duo. I highly recommend Duo. For 35 pp you can get practically everything on the rm service menu for a fraction of the price! The hillside cabanas are AMAZING and lend a fantastic view of Wailea Beach, which I found a great compromise since alcohol is not allowed on the beach thus there is no beach service. The hillside cabanas give you a feel of being on the beach but you have the service! Speak of the service, all I can say is WOW! The Four Seasons has service down to a fine art. It's impeccable! They don't ask you for a room number when you charge something to your room, they ask for your last name! How's that for personal? I liked not feeling like a room number! We had noise issues with people screaming to other members of their party in different rooms across the courtyard and we mentioned it in passing to the front desk and within hours we were upgraded to an oceanfront suite! Oh my gosh, what luxury! On our anniversary, they delivered a bottle of champagne and a rose for me. I never expected them to remember the date of our anniversary! Heck, my husband had even forgotten until they showed up! ha! We had dinner twice at the Lobby Lounge which now serves sushi. Sunset from here was magnificent. Ferraro's was our favorite for lunch and dinner. We tried Spago but it didn't live up to the hype. Ferraro's just have a more romantic atmosphere and we liked the food better. We used the gym and outdoor cardio. The equipment is TOP NOTCH and I loved being outside while working out. I did not use the spa but I did go to look at their locker room. They only offer a wet sauna and showers, no other added amenities. I was disappointed in that as I expected their spa to be larger. The frozen mai tais in the pineapples were our fave! The grounds are just immaculate and stunning, everywhere you turn it's beautiful. I was a bit confused at the lack of in room toiletries. We are used to full toiletries in our rooms at other places we've stayed and I didn't even see a shower cap until we got into the suite. Now, don't get me wrong, all I would have had to do is call for it, but I'm just noting this. Valet was great, as was the concierge.
