I used the business center and the in room wireless and loved both. You MUST do the outrigger canoe!!! by far one of the BEST things we did while we were in Maui! We also rented an ocean kayak from 4s and we booked a snorkel scooter tour with Maui Undersea Adventures @ 4s. HIGHLY RECOMMEND them!!!!! PERFECT DAY!!! We swam w/ turtles and manta rays!! so much fun!!! We tried out the serenity pool one day but much preferred the hillside cabanas or the main pool, mostly b/c the serenity pool gets packed FAST and b/c there are only a few chairs that have a great view of the beach versus many more at the main pool. The resort was full while we were there but we didn't have to get to the pool at 7 to get a chair or anything, there was always availability. The rooms no longer have whole bean coffee and grinders, they are auto drip cuisnart makers if anyone was counting on whole bean coffee grinders. The day we checked out, we took advantage of the Aloha Suite. WOW. this room is a shared facility but it is NICE! Loved being able to shower after hanging out at the pool! This resort is a MUST for any couple. I didn't see that many kids and those that I saw were shockingly VERY well behaved!!! it was amazing!!!! I am ruined now!!!! I can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but did not live up to very high expectaions”
Reviews.Author: bobd72
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Seasons during a trip to Maui with my wife in December 2009. After reading all of the Tripadvisor and travel magazine reviews I was expecting to be wowed by the Four Seasons. Although it was a very nice hotel it did not live up to my expectations. The hotel is located in Wailea and is situated on a very nice beach flanked on either side by the Grand Hyatt and the Fairmont. The area is very busy and is a center for upscale resorts and high end second homes. We stayed at the hotel during the busiest time of the year (over NYE) so I think this negatively affected our experience. The hotel has a lovely open lobby with a view of the sea, the grounds and the pool. Our room was spacious and finished in a neutral fashion. There are various restaurants in the hotel including Spago (which had a very nice NYE dinner). There is a fitness center that is well equipped and a very nice spa. Staff are generally very friendly and attentive. The concierge staff is very helpful although we did come across one unhelpful concierge. There is a tennis court located on the roof where we had a tennis lesson with a pro who was more interested in getting ready for his next tennis match than teaching us some basics. My main problem with the hotel is that the main pool and adult pool were always crowded. There is an adult only pool but you have to get there by 7am to get a spot. I know the hotel was at full capacity but you could never relax by either pool as there was no space and everybody was on top of each other. I think the resort could be designed better to comfortably accomodate guests during busy times. In addition, the beach is relatively small for an area with so many large resorts. Some of the other large resorts seemed to have bigger pool areas and I didn't get the impression that they were as crowded. Maui was great and we really enjoyed visiting Hana, Lahaina and doing a Trilogy boat tour to Lana'i. There are a ton of great restaurants but we thought that Lahaina Grill, Gerard's and Mama's Fish House were the best. All in all we enjoyed our trip to Maui and the Four Seaons but the hotel did not live up to our very high expectations. In the end, we have had better resort experiences in the Maldives and Bali.

Reviews.Title: “Sublime.”
Reviews.Author: ToilsToTravel
Reviews.Content: The service at the Four Seasons Maui sets it apart. Every person we dealt with from valet to front desk to pool staff was professional and attentive above and beyond. To our great enjoyment, our expectations were consistently exceeded, including a significant upgrade to an ocean view suite, memorable room service breakfasts served on our balcony, and a gorgeous adult-only infinity-edge pool overlooking the beach. If you're on the fence about booking and money is an object like it is for me, I would much rather spend 4 days here than 5 days anywhere else. The high price is actually an outstanding value in terms of the overall quality.

Reviews.Title: “beyond luxury”
Reviews.Author: bouyrndr
Reviews.Content: I booked our trip to Maui through a travel agent and could not decide which resort to pick. Our agent tried to send us to the Fairmont Kea Lani. I wanted to stay at the Four Seasons. The Four Seasons was more expensive but after comparing reviews, I chose the Four Seasons. This was the best choice of my life! The Four Seasons Wailea is simply ridiculous in their attention to detail and elegance. I have never recieved service this good at any other resort either. It was not very crowded and we were able to upgrade into a oceanfront prime suite. If you are not sure about which resort to chose in Hawaii, you will not be disappointed in the Four Seasons. They also don't nickel and dime you to death. If you want to lay by the pool, relax and be waited on hand and foot this is the place for you! The Cabanas at the adult pool are great also. We rented one to watch the Saints beat Arizona. On the tail end our our trip we moved to Four Seasons Lani city. It was not remotely of the same caliber as the Wailea location. It did have dolphins by the beach in the morning however.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VACATION”
Reviews.Author: fitzjack
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to read Overun with Children's review of this hotel . My husband and I along with our two daughters (28 AND 15) were guests at the Four Seasons from April 18th thru the 23rd for the 2nd half of our trip and our stay could not have been better. In fact, our 28 year old daughter highly recommended this hotel to her friend who will be honeymooning in September as the only place to stay. The grounds, rooms and food are all wonderful but what makes this hotel so special is the staff who go beyond. The service here is unparalleled. We have stayed here before and we had high expectations and we were not disappointed. We thank the Four Seasons and especially their wonderful concierge and Ferraro's beach bar staff for a fantastic stay which was enjoyed by all members of our family.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel - Worth Every Penny”
Reviews.Author: kevinm1848
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from April 19th -24th as the first part of our honeymoon and it was absolutely amazing. It is definately expensive but in my opinion worth the splurge as the staff goes above and beyond to make your trip a memorable one. After we arrived from a 11.5 hour flight they promptly took our bags and car away, greeted us with a lei and refreshing ginger tea, and upgraded our room. The room was very nice (especially the bathroom) and they gave us a complimentary bottle of champagne for our honeymoon. They turn down the room twice a day and in the evening they will put the slippers by the bed and have some nice Hawaiin music playing. The first day we planned on going to see the sunrise at Haleakala and requested the car be ready by 3AM. Not only was the car ready but they also packed a couple of blankets (which came in handy) and bottles of water for the trip. The service by the pool is truly top notch as they would set up your chairs for you, refill your ice water constantly throughout the day, provide sunscreen, and give you multiple treats throughout the day (pineapple, jello, ice pops, cucumbers for your eyes just to name a few). The service is so good they make it hard to leave the resort which can get expensive. Breakfast at Duo was good but it cost us $85 and $95 for the buffet and a la carte respectively which is crazy in my opinion. The lunch fare at the pool is pricey as well with just about every option costing at least $20 (quesadilla's were great). We ate dinner at Ferraro's and I was not impressed with the food but the decor/setting of the restaurant was great. The food at the Lobby Lounge was good (very simple small menu) and it is a nice setting to have a casual dinner and drinks as they have nightly entertainment. We also at dinner at Spago which was excellent. Everything we ordered was excellent but make sure to save room for dessert because the chocolate souffle was A+. We also got an oceanside couples massage in their open aire huts which was amazing and might have been the highlight of our stay. It was definately worth the $400 and the spa runs daily specials so we were able to upgrade from a 50 minute to 80 minute for free. There were a suprising number of families and little kids there but we barely knew they were there. They weren't loud and didn't cause a lot of comotion in the pools. If it does bother you they do have an adults only serenity pool which is also very nice. An extra bonus while we stayed here was Adam Sandler, Jennifer Anniston, Brooklyn Decker, and Andy Roddick were staying at the hotel because they were filming a movie at the Grand Wailea which is next door. All in all staying here is expensive but in my opinion well worth it and I would definately want to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, but overrun by children”
Reviews.Author: crh436
Reviews.Content: Two single girls were looking for a relaxing beach getaway from stressful jobs in a beautiful location. I have been to Maui many times, but this was my first time indulging in a place as nice as the Four Seasons. I had heard nothing but good things about the hotel. Unfortunately the hotel was nothing like I imagined it would be. While the service was absolutely great and the rooms were nice, the hotel is just overrun by families and children. It felt like I was on a Disney cruise ship. There were lines for everything and there was no respite from the families and children. I have no idea how honeymoons occur at this location. The adults only pool is a nice feature, but its tough being relegated to a tiny portion of the property when you are paying $700+/night. Also, the adults only pool was overrun by an on-site convention of adults who were getting pretty loud and drunk all day. There wasn't an attempt to keep the area quiet. We noted our concerns with the manager on the first day and asked to be transferred to another Four Seasons property (e.g., Big Island, Lanai). The hotel said these locations were full and would likely suffer from the same spring break crowds of families in any event. Management said families and this sort of atmosphere was a spring break phenomenon. They did send us free chocolate fondue and a handwritten note expressing regret that our experience was different that we envisioned. I would definitely avoid this place from Feb.15-April 15 if you don't have a family or are looking for romance or serenity. I have to imagine that the focus in on families the rest of the year as well though. If you are an adult, you will be relegated to a tiny portion of the resort and take a backseat to the hotel's efforts to entertain children (e.g., cotton candy machine by the swimming pool). I really regret spending so much money to stay at a place that was loud and not at all serene.

Reviews.Title: “We live far, far, away, but we are definitely coming back.”
Reviews.Author: rll31
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to the Four Seasons Maui after Iceland's volcano ruined our trip to Italy. "Boo hoo - we have to go to Hawaii and stay at the Four Seasons," we thought. It turned out to be the best vacation my wife and I had since our honeymoon. We landed late in the evening, but we were greeted with smiles, leis, and an upgrade to an executive suite. Everything was perfect - friendly staff, impeccable facilities, perfect beach. There is even a "Serenity" pool, separate from the main pool, with no kids allowed. If you do have kids, the place was pretty child friendly. We saw many families with babies, most of whom were offered poolside playpens, beach/pool toys, their own kiddie pool, and a kid's menu at every restaurant. As we mentioned, we were upgraded to an executive suite. This room was about 1000 sq ft, had a bedroom with an en-suite bath, and separate living/dining areas. There were also two balconies overlooking the ocean. The bathroom was huge, with a great shower, separate tub, toilet closet, vanity, and double sinks. The rooms are turned over twice per day, and the staff had an almost telepathic feel for when you left the room. We never heard them knock on our door. We only returned to a clean room. Our only complaint was the queen sized bed. We worked out in the gym several times. The cardio equipment is outdoors and over looks Wailea beach - can't beat that. The weight room featured brand new equipment, and there are several complimentary classes offered throughout the day - yoga, pilates, tai-chi. The on-site restaurants were pricey, as expected, but every meal we had was delicious. If you eat dinner on the resort, keep in mind, there are prix-fix menus at Spago , Duo and Ferraro's for $49 after 830 PM (830 is standard dinner-time for us anyway). The poolside fare was also expensive ($20 for most lunch entrees), but pretty tasty compared to most resort lunch menus. For lighter dinners, the lobby lounge has live music, drinks, and a short menu until 11 PM. We ate off the resort several times. Wailea is a resort town only, and is about 3 miles from the next non-resort town, Kihei. Cabs are expensive, about $16 to Kihei (30 cents per 1/10th of a mile!), so consider renting a car if you plan on leaving the resort frequently ($60 per day for a compact or $315 per week, plus $20 per night if you plan on keeping it at the resort). Keep in mind things close down early. Last seating at most restaurants is at 930 PM and there is little nightlife in Maui. We went to get shave ice one evening after dinner, only to find they close at 7 PM! During our stay, we arranged two outings through the concierge: the sunrise, downhill bike ride on Mt Haleakala and a car rental for the road to Hana. The bike ride was awesome. It starts at 245 AM, so you can catch the sunrise at the top of the volcano. Painful, but well worth seeing. The ride down the volcano is 38 miles, but 99.9% downhill. No pedaling necessary. Amazing views, three different climates, and we had terrific guides. You ride down the middle of the road, but are flanked by one guide in front, and the tour van in back, so you are never threatened by traffic. Overall, an amazing experience. The road to Hana is a must. This may be the most beautiful drive in the world. The road winds up and down the mountainous north, east and southern coastline with breathtaking views the entire way. The hotel concierge gave us a guidebook that pointed out many stops along the way, including many short hikes, black sand beaches, spectacular waterfalls, and scenic overlooks. The road itself is not for the timid driver. There are many hairpin turns, blind turns, and many one-lane bridges. If you continue along the south shore to get home, the road is unpaved for about 4 miles, with another 15 miles with poorly paved roads. Max speed, about 15 MPH unless you get an SUV. Be careful, taking this route voids your car rental warranty. The Four Seasons Maui is a sure thing. Sure the experience was flawless, but worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “Simply wonderful and amazing.”
Reviews.Author: ripresa
Reviews.Content: I didn't want to leave! This was our last stop in Maui for our Honeymoon, and I'm glad it was. I simply loved this Four Seasons. Love it. * The beach is amazing. It feels like powder under you feet. * You're completely pampered with scented towels, cucumbers for your eyes, rice krispees, pineapple slices * The service is amazing. When you arrive, they whisk your luggage and car away while they serve you fresh mint tea, and give you leis. * There are free classes all day. I went on an art tour of the premise and since I was the only one I got a solo tour. * The chocolate croissants are amazing. * They have twice daily turn down service. Some tips: * We stayed in the cheapest hotel room, and as a result had to walk pretty far to get to the elevator. We got a pretty good rate through Expedia for both flight and hotel, so it came to about $380 per night. If you want an ocean view it's another $400 per night. * I would suggest avoiding the food there. There are so many delicious local options in Kihei, like Izakaya Matsu for Sushi, that you can have a great meal for $80 for 2 at a sushi restaurant... Or you can pay $80 per plate at the hotel. I am a major foodie, and I find that a lot of fine dining at hotels, maybe one or two dishes are amazing, but the rest isn't worth $80. For example, we had brunch at Duo, a restaurant in the Four Seasons and the bacon and chocolate croissants were amazing, but the rest of the food was average/good, not amazing. * Rates are highest during the winter season. During the Christmas/NY season, it's like season tickets there. People who stay there before gets a choice to return, and it's a minimum of 7 night stay. Other people go to the waiting list. Is the hotel worth the price? Yes. This place is as good as they say it is.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: carrhodges
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Four Seasons April 15-20, 2010 (stayed at Grand Wailea April 11-14, 2010). Service at the Four Seasons Maui was second to none among my traveled beach resorts. Attendants providing towels, sun tan lotion, aloe, cucumber and cloth eye treatment, jello cups, and popsicles to your pool chair...for free...that says it all. Sightings included Jennifer Aniston and Adam Sandler (staying at the Four Seasons and filming a new movie at the Grand Wailea next door) if you're into celebs. This is one reason i assume the resort is so pricey, expect $80+ for two (lunch/dinner) and $150+ for two (dinner). Ferrraro's is great for lunch but dinner was mediocre. Try the Shops at Wailea for a great burger joint; Ruth's Chris, Longhi's, and Tommy Bahama's Grille are there as well, all within walking distance from the hotel. The ABC Store and various shops in the Shops at Wailea should suit your snacking, shopping, and art gallery needs at fair prices. Shops include everything from Billabong to Louis Vuitton (LV is cheaper in Maui than elsewhere, ask the store clerk). Overall the Four Seasons Maui is an incredible hotel, at a cost. Had an ocean-view room but heard the mountain-view is nice as well. Bring your checkbook, or at least try the Shops at Grand Wailea as an inexpensive alternative. I was staying with my fiance as part of corporate incentive trip; the Four Seasons' staff accommodated everything wonderfully. Hope to go back again and again! Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Well Deserved Top Spot!”
Reviews.Author: BizTraveler1966
Reviews.Content: This is simply an amazing hotel in a beautiful location with staff that genuinely care about providing an unforgettable experience. You can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Still the nicest hotel we can remember!”
Reviews.Author: herseylouisville
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel a few years ago and we still talk about how nice it was. It's worth the money just for the bellman that give you towels and water when you go for a drive. Lot's of places to eat in town. The pool area is great and they pamper you all day and it's included in the price of your room.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Magical”
Reviews.Author: bcarver10
Reviews.Content: If you are having trouble choosing where to stay in Maui, let me make it easy for you--you must stay at the Four Seasons Wailea. It is truly unbelievable. Simply magical. When we arrived we were greeted with leis and iced orange blossom tea. Our garden view room was more than we expected. The room was beautifully decorated and had a huge semi-private courtyard with a partial ocean view. Every day, fresh orchids were put in our room. At night, his and hers slippers were set by our bedside. The grounds are just amazing: lush gardens, tucked-away hammocks and seating areas, and breath-taking views from every angle. No detail has been overlooked. The spa is worth splurging on. We enjoyed a couples massage in a cabana overlooking the beach. It was the perfect way to begin our vacation. If you go to the spa, you must try out the showers in the locker room. Bathing in these high-tech showers is a spa treatment all by itself. The pools, like everything else, are stunning. The pools are surrounded by beach cabanas and comfortable lounge chairs. Pool attendants come by throughout the day and offer goodies like chilled aloe, popsicles, or ice cold water. Yes, the serenity pool fills up quickly, but it is worth a visit at least one day. We dined at Spago and Duo for dinner and at Ferraro's for lunch. All of the restaurants were very good but the service was the highlight of each. The views from the restaurants are spectacular. We ate lunch while watching whales breach and play. What could be better? Our favorite part of the hotel had to be the beach. It is a perfect, clean, and uncrowded beach that is just steps from the hotel. Be sure to go snorkeling near the rocks to the left of the beach. There are some amazing sights in that area. Snorkel gear is free for guests for one hour each day. In addition, for around $30.00 the hotel offers paddle boards, surf boards, and sea kayaks to rent. We loved sea kayaking. Two huge sea turtles came right up to the kayak to say hello. When I daydream about paradise, this hotel is what I will forever think of. You cannot go wrong by choosing to stay at the Four Seasons Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding-worth every $”
Reviews.Author: BCparent
Reviews.Content: Just got home today from 8 days at the Four Seasons Wailea. I can say with no hesitation, that although expensive, staying here is worth every nickel. You should have high expectations when you are spending $1000 a night per room plus food etc. (this was our rate). Absolutely everything was amazing. I have been to the hotel 3 times on group corporate travel, but this was the first time out of my own pocket and with family. Wow. I love the fact that they don't nickel and dime you once you're in the door. Cabanas? No charge. Complimentary chauffeur driven sedan or SUV to the nearby shops of Wailea? No charge. A friendly warning about dinner on property: it will be world-class food and ambience, and it will be pricey. If you are with your kids, you may want to go two minutes away to the shops of Wailea (a big but understated mall) to Tommy Bahamas Cafe, Longhi's for Italian, or the little cheeseburger joint. My only caution would be to avoid the new Sushi restaurant next to the Rolex store-not great... If you want to ensure a 5 star vacation with no surprises in a gorgeous location, plan on the Four Seasons Wailea. You just cannot go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kmcd1114
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about the Four Seasons Maui. Spectacular room, exceptional service, & awesome locations!

Reviews.Title: “High end”
Reviews.Author: Ayvah1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 days on a weeklong trip to 3 islands. The valet ($20/night) asks your name, and takes your car and bags while another person greets you by name and gives lei's, and then drinks and cool towels. They upgraded our room from mountain (which is actually overlooking the parking garage) to garden view and upon arriving there was chilled champagne, a rose and a card congratulating us on our anniversary. The room is connected by glass sliding doors to a small semi-private lawn and chairs. A hedge gives some privacy and you can overlook the croquet court which has a large whale statue. Very beautiful grounds including some more secluded spots. On floor 4 there was a garden, statue, and places to lounge if you want to get away from people - they upkeep the grounds here perfectly. On floor 6 there is a basketball area as well as 2 tennis courts. You can request rackets and play anytime for free, and they offer lessons by a professional for a fee if desired. There are chairs with remote control mist to cool off. They also have cold water available at multiple areas here. We really enjoyed these little hideouts! Duo's for breakfast was very nice, you can get the buffet (different choices up to $34/person) or a single plate for a lower price. The eating area is outside nearby to the children's pool but there were so few kids around that it was very serene. The food was great, you can ask the chef to prepare a number of items including omelets with shrimp, and waffles. They have a variety of fruit and items for kids as well. They bring out a complementary mini drink of the day which is some variant of a yogurt smoothie which was also good. They have newspapers and Times Fax available for free as well. It was a great breakfast. Ferraro's for lunch by the adult pool was also very good, and my husband thinks their burger was the best around. Their blueberry mojito was wonderful. I had the lobster sandwich which was lobster on white bread - good, but I'd recommend trying something else unless you are a big lobster fan. The main grounds is gorgeous and has a heated pool and fountain. The beach is pristine, warm water, not much wind (especially compared to Oahu and the Big Island), crystal clear water that you can see through to the bottom, and a good amount of wave activity for fun. An attendant will come around with water glasses. By far this is the best beach of all the locations I visited during my stay. (I was disappointed in how rocky Waikiki beach is in the water!) Next door is Grand Wailea but this is clearly the place for kids, they've even got an attendant who's sole job it is to bring the tarzan rope over for kids to use. So we were glad to be at the four seasons instead of Grand Wailea since it was just us two. If we were to go back with kids, we'd likely stay at the Grand Wailea instead of the Four Seasons though. They advertised a hula and torch lighting ceremony but we couldn't find it during its advertised time. There is a person singing though. We signed up for a scuba clinic but the water was too choppy for the ocean scuba so that portion was canceled. They said they'd be more than happy to call in an instructor for the pool portion just for us, which was very nice of them, but we declined. All in all this is a pristine place to stay with what appears to be the best beach anywhere in Hawaii. My husband and I are a little unused to all the attention we got there, as we're more accustomed to the 'simple' life, but if you have the money to spend, its a great place to go. We saw two celebrities while we were there, but we understand they are there to get away from the world like we are, so we left them alone and will honor their privacy by not listing their names. Alternatively, we found a small amount of parking just south of the hotel, so one could probably stay at an alternative location so as to save on the cost(we paid $500/night which seems to be the cheapest you can get), and then park here to access this fantastic beach. I'm glad we stayed here 2 nights for the experience, but for an average working class couple, this price is steep for more than just a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect holiday for families with babies”
Reviews.Author: aussiebaglady
Reviews.Content: I think you get a pretty good idea from the reviews on this website that this is a pretty special place so I wont go on and on but I just wanted to add a few comments particularly aimed at anybody travelling with babies (there is so little info about hotels and babies!). We travelled with 2 11 month old babies - our first real family holiday. This place was the perfect spot. The staff could not have been kinder and the trouble they go to to help with making the stay for parents and babies as comfortable as possible is fantastic. A few examples: (a) lots of toy presents for the babies (both soft toys and bath toys); (b) wonderful specialty baby bath products; (c) fantastic cots (not portable cots) and high chairs in the room; (d) great (and very reasonably priced) kids menu available in all restaurants, room service etc; (e) they set up portable cots in the cabanas by the pool etc so your baby(ies) are trapped in the shade but can play, etc. (f) very reasonably priced laundry of all baby clothes, bibs; (g) fantastic babysitting service. For older children there is a great kids club which you can also use with babies but the parent or carer has to stay with them. All in a all an absolutely fantastic resort and location.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ElsieLew
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the FS. Every time we go, I worry that it won't be as amazing as the time before, and every time, it's better! Despite the economy, they have not cut back on any of the amenities. The service continues to be outstanding. Despite the fact it is a luxury hotel, it is a great place for kids. We didn't get to spend much time at the serenity pool because it is adult-only, but it is a lovely addition to the resort. The outrigger program is amazing. Be sure and take advantage of it if you go!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best resort we have ever been to”
Reviews.Author: jerryhub
Reviews.Content: This was the second time to visit this property. From the time you arrive until the time you depart EVERYTHING was outstanding! We were upgraded from a ocean view to a prime ocean view - major difference. Although you could not go wrong in staying in any room at this resort. The room was beautiful - especially the bathroom with so many amentities. The service was absolutely perfect. The grounds are so perfect. They really take care of you at the pool with fresh pineapple, water, treats, etc. WOW! The staff meet our every need. We ate at Duo's for breakfast - outstanding, Ferraros almost every day for lunch and a couple of times at Spago's - OUTSTANDING! We also recommend: 1. Joe's Bar & Grill (close to the hotel) 2. Tommy Bahamas (close to hotel) 3. Ruth Chris' (close to hotel) 4. Gannon's for breakfast (close to hotel and the most beautiful view!) 5. Hali'Imaile General Store Valet service was outstanding, daily artist in lobby, whale watching, lobby bar - it was all fabulous. You cannot go wrong with Maui FC.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Maui Essentially Achieves Perfection”
Reviews.Author: HotelGuestTraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had visited the Four Seasons on the Big Island (Hualalai) twice in the last few years and thought Hualalai was exceptional. We wanted to try something different in Maui, and the Four Seasons Maui did not disappoint. The service at the resort was exceptional. Prior to our arrival, they secured dinner reservations for us, stocked our minibar with some hard to find items (my wife is pregnant and loves diet ginger ale), and made spa appointments. We booked a garden view room which promised no view of the ocean, but we had a stunning view of the ocean from our room. The room itself was very large and quite comfortable. The bed was very nice. The marble bathroom was quite large and nice. The grounds of the hotel themselves were stunning. The pool and beach area were quite stunning. The service at the pool could not have been better. The staff went beyond and above the call of duty in every way. The food served poolside was excellent in every way. Spago's was exceptional, and Ferraros was quite good for lunch and for dinner. To reserve a prime cabana with ultimate shade and top notch views, you had to get up early. But the cabana was free and I was waking up early anyway. The adult pool is somewhat odd. Cabanas are not free and few seats offer views of the ocean. The large pool complex seemed a much better bet for us. Modern Family was filming while we were there. Despite the staff's best efforts to minimize the inconvenience, it was annoying and distracting to have them there. I will say that the novelty was interesting for about the first 30 minutes but the novelty ran out shortly thereafter, let alone the 3 days they were in the pool area. The resort offers only valet parking which was fine by us because the valets were great. We left the resort a few nights for dinner, and the service was always great. Also, I had a computer crisis while there and the concierge went above and beyond the call of duty to help me solve my problem. The spa was adequate but nothing exceptional. The services were great but the facilities were quite lacking. The Hualalai spa is infinitely better in all respects. With that said, they did also offer foot and neck massages while you lounged by the pool which were quite nice. The lobby bar with live music nightly and tapas was quite pretty and quite nice. Highly recommend it. We did not go to Duo's for breakfast or dinner, but others raved about the breakfast. There is a coffee hut at the beach serving coffee, muffins, fruit and bagels if you are not in to the breakfast buffet and you can charge your room. March is a great time of year for whale watching. It was amazing what you could see from the pool area. Also, the weather could not have been better for our trip. As compared to Hualalai, Maui offers a much better beach, more (and to our mind better) food options, and equally beautiful views. It is a bit easier to obtain a prime pool cabana view at Hualalai without getting up as early, but the rooms are much nicer at Maui (except for the fabulous outdoor showers in the lower level rooms at Hualalai). The crowd is different at both. The Maui crowd is hipper and more age diverse than Hualalai. Hualalai is more secluded and private, but Maui is in the middle of the action. There are pros/cons to both places, but the bottom line is that both are fabulous places with different strengths. Relative to the other resort options in Maui, if your budget allows, there is no reason to stay anyone other than the Four Seasons Maui. All in all a fabulous experience and it is hard to imagine a better experience. The crowning achievement at the hotel is the level of service. Every single person was extraordinary. They were solicitous without being intrusive.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific resort - as good as a large hotel gets”
Reviews.Author: ncinaz
Reviews.Content: We couldn't decide whether to stay at the Four Seasons or the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua on our recent trip so we ended up staying four days at the FS Maul and three at the Ritz. While the Ritz's setting is far more dramatically beautiful, there is no comparison between the hotels when it comes to service, food, and overall experience. We were immediately upgraded to an executive suite at the Four Seasons, which was perfect since we were traveling with our four-month-old son. Not only was a crib set up in the room, but so were free stuffed animals, bath toys, and sponges spelling our baby's name. As for the Ritz's welcome: nothing - not even the crib we requested. The television show Modern Family was filming all over the property during our stay, which made things even more fun (and never obtrusive). FS Maul promotes how many free activities they have and they are right to do so. The outrigger canoe trip at the Ritz is about $100 (although it is much longer than the free FS offering). Spago had decent food and stellar service and views. Duo's breakfast buffet wonderful and more or less worth the price. Even the shops on-site were interesting. Every day, local artists would display their wares, some of which were quite good. The only flaw we could find with the resort was its geography and general un-Hawaiian-ness. The setting and beach could belong to a beachside resort anywhere (CA, Florida, etc.). The rooms are just about identical to the ones at FS Las Vegas or Maui - there is really no Hawaiian look to the rooms or public areas (the art collection is very much Hawaiian, though). As for choosing between FS Maui and the Ritz - visit the beaches at the Ritz and walk the Kapalua Ocean Trail - then head back to FS Maui for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Up to Four Seasons Standards”
Reviews.Author: JVC1967
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel...you get what you pay for and the Four Seasons is up there. The grounds are spectacualar and the service top notch. The Four Seasons restaurants are expensive and Spago was at best just o.k. Unfortunately there are very few off property restaurants nearby. All in all though a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “My heart is STILL there! STUNNING perfection on Maui!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fargoguy
Reviews.Content: Kind of a "late" review here! DW & I decided to take our DD on a special trip after HS Graduation. An Honor-student and all don'cha know...! We stayed 3 nights in Waikiki at the SPK, then it was off to Maui! DW and I had been to Oahu b4 on our Honeymoon in Oct. 1987 at the SPK. So, for corny sentimental reasons, we went back there! Wanted to show DD Waikiki obviously! THEN....it was off to Maui! DW assumed we were staying at the Sheraton Maui that we decided on last spring '09. Then I was clued into this site, and found out about the Four-Seasons! So....secretly...I had our TA just make a fake itinerary for the Sheraton Maui. I handed DW the "fake" sheets, and that was that! The REAL reservations were for the Four-Seasons. WOW. Pulling up to the Four Seasons was spectacular! DW & DD were kinda floored. I had splurged at the rental counter at the airport on Maui and rented a beautiful Burgundy CTS at the last second. (looks better pulling up in that, compared to a standard Chevy Impala...!) The valet guys were very pleasant, and unloaded our luggage for us. Wiiiiiide marble entrance and beautiful fountain at the valet-circle drive. Room wasn't ready yet, so they whisked our luggage away to a hold area, and suggested lunch at Ferraro's. Very beautiful ourdoor setting under the BIG umbrella's. Very good food too. Then...off to the room by a very pleasant porter. In the room....WOW. Huge marble bathroom; beautiful, understated room decor; wonderful beds with an I-pod docking-station clock, etc. We didn't eat at Spago, but DUO and Ferraro's were very good. Room-svc. was wonderful. Room-staff come in to your room in the evening for the "evening" bed turn-down, etc. Pool-area: The Infinity pool was still under construction in June '09...didn't get to see it...arrggh! The other pools though...WOW. DW & DD were off horseback riding, so I was lounging at the pool. I had been in the water a little while, when none other than Tori Spelling waded by, not 5' in front of me!!!! Then her husband came by, with one of their little ones! The Maui film-festival was the day after we were leaving I found out, so they were there for it. The pool staff, keep your water filled, spritz you with Evian, and offer popsicles every so often! The free poolside L'Occitane products are awesome and appreciated. Concierges were very friendly and knowledgeable. The resort itself and the grounds are SO IMPECCABLE it's ridiculous. I think all the marble on the planet is here! Workout area, and gaming room were very nice. Very Haute, beautiful shops and Spa....this place is a DREAM. The main Lobby hallways are wide enough for 2-lane car traffic I think... All-in-all...I can't get this place out of my head...OR heart. To me, that's the best compliment of all. That's why I'm taking DW back here for our 25th in a couple years. Faron...FS forever!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sarafisher73
Reviews.Content: Being a business traveler means that I stay in different hotels all over the world on a regular basis. This is by far the nicest hotel I have ever stayed in. It is worth every penny of what they charge. The staff is the best of the best, the drinks are amazing, and every little extra touch is one that is noticed.

Reviews.Title: “Will be hard to stay anywhere else...”
Reviews.Author: MonaJ
Reviews.Content: Wow...that sums it up. What a great hotel / resort. They meet your every need, anticipating most before you even know you need it. Fortunately, this was an award trip, so I was not paying the $750 / night bill. But it will be hard to stay anywhere else on future trips. Service was outstanding in the rooms, at the beach, at the pool, in the restaurants...I could go on an on. If you can afford it, do it.

Reviews.Title: “A-MAZ-ING!”
Reviews.Author: niccel
Reviews.Content: During our honeymoon, we spent some night at three major hotels on Wailea, the Farimont, The Grand Wailea and the Four Seasons. I'm one of those people normally given to adventure on travel. I like to get out and see stuff, explore. The Four Seasons is the only place to ever knock this desire completely out of my system. The only thing I wanted to explore was the menu and drinks in pineapples from the comfort of our little cabana. This was our first time staying at a Four Seasons and it's hard to find the words to express how amazing an experience it was. All we ever find ourselves saying about other spots is "It's not the Four Seasons."

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fmaredia
Reviews.Content: This was an awesome hotel. I had to make sure that everyone who goes to Maui should definitely stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sublime. Simply sublime. Service is the key.”
Reviews.Author: TEME4
Reviews.Content: Words cannot begin to describe the experience my husband and I had at the Four Seasons in Wailea. To say that they provide you with a level of service that is beyond reproach and not replicated anywhere else is an understatement. From the second you pull in until beyond when you check out, they cannot be more helpful. Amazing, amazing, amazing. This is a once in a lifetime treat worth saving for.

Reviews.Title: “pampered and relaxed”
Reviews.Author: paige2367
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I arrived Feb 22nd for a 4 day visit to celebrate my birthday. We arrived at 3:00 in the afternoon and were upgraded to a partial ocean view as part of our Platinum Amex reservation. The room was fantastic with a welcome box of cookies waiting for us. We were in room 442 with a courtyard and ocean view. The bathroom is large and has everything you need. We immediately went to adult pool and were set up within minutes. I will say that I enjoyed the larger pool more as the resort was not crowded with kids and liked being closer to the beach and around a more diverse group of people. The first night we went to the shops at Wailea for dunner at Tommy Bahama's which was very nice. The only issue and wasn't really the Four Season's issue was when we booked the trip with Amex it came with a full breakfast and when we went to Duo for breakfast they told me that it was for continental only and the rule had changed the day we checked in. Amex refunded me the charge in the end, but it was awkward when it came up. We went to the main pool and got a great seat facing the ocean outside the pool area. When we went to the room mid day there was a birthday cake and chocolate covered strawberries waiting for me as my friend had called and told them about my birthday. We went to Spago for dinner and had a great meal with great service. I took a pilates class and thought the gym and work out rooms were fantastic, they also had a great game room that luckily with the weather we didn't spend time in. I felt at ease leaving my ipod and kindle at the pool while we went swimming which I didn't feel I could do at other resorts, the staff was there without being intrusive and who doesn't love having their sun glasses cleaned, ice pops and fruit brought to you while in the sun. I can't wait to come back or try other Four Season's tropical locations.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Time Still As Good as First Time”
Reviews.Author: dcv2002
Reviews.Content: What can I say. I love Hawaii. And I love The Four Seasons. Especially Maui at Wailea. This was my wife's and I second time back to the resort. Our first was back in December 2006, during the reconstruction phase and we had a wonderful time. Never thought I'd be back so soon, but with a amazing airfare deal decided to take the whole family (two children, 7 and 4) for a 5 night stay utilizing the 5th night free deal. It was everything I could have asked and more. Best vacation I have ever been on. Unfortunately, our 4 soon to be 5 year-old daughter wasn't quite old enough to be in the Kids For All Seasons program, but they did do some of it during the day. Basically they have a free program from 9am-to-5pm each day for kids 5-12 with activities and such. However, we mainly spent ours days doing: 1. Buffet Breakfast @ DUO (I miss that) 2. Beach time in front of the resort 3. Pool time at either of the pools. With quick dips in the hot-tubs. 4. Some playtime in the Game Room... Being we came with a family, we did not get to spend too much time in the Serenity Pool. I did venture up there. It was nice, but seemed that when the trade winds blow, you are directly in the wind up there. Beautiful pool however. There are so many positives (and most of them free) with the Four Seasons Maui I'm sure I'll miss them.. 1. You can get a free Kindle from the Concierge. With kids no time for that... 2. Free Outrigger Canoe excursion. This is a MUST. 3. Free One Hour Snorkel use each day... 4. Free use of the Spa Lockerrooms.... 5. Free use of Cabanas (not the Serenity Pool cabanas), and towel service... 6. They try up and down to make the kids feel wanted. Free snacks, kids under 5 eat free, free stuffed animals, etc.... Plus its a beautiful location, beautiful beach. Yes its expensive and the food is expensive, but it was worth it.... We stayed in a Garden-View Room. Room 488. Which was very nice. We were very close to the front of the resort, which is a plus. Plus we could see the ocean from our room anyway... Was supposed to get upgraded at check-in, but being presidents week, resort was full.... The only negative I could think of is that they don't hand out as much grub as the poolside service at the Four Seasons Las Vegas. I think our next Four Seasons in Hawaii will be on the Big Island though....

Reviews.Title: “Almost Paradise .....”
Reviews.Author: Kila14
Reviews.Content: Anticipation level high as we had to cancel and re-arrange a trip originally scheduled for Hualalai on the Big Island in October. You can guarantee that any Four Seasons Resort you go to will have impeccable service and facilities. Four Seasons Maui has rated consistently higher than Hualalai in travel magazines, but I'm going against the grain and rating it slightly lower. New serenity pool is located in a far corner of the hotel grounds but it seems very cramped and having to sign up on a two-page waiting list for a chair or arrive at 7am to reserve a spot, doesn't exactly inspire tranquil feelings. Chairs seem very close together - although you can hide yourself with a canopy over some (not all) loungers. The service and impeccable manners of the poolside staff, however, does make up for any disappointment you may feel. When you're bored with lounging, you must try out the free yoga classes on the beach, and definitely give the Outrigger Canoe lessons a try. Your two crew are knowledgeable, patient and very friendly. I had planned to just watch my daughter as she went out, but they grabbed me from the beach to fill an empty spot - and I'm glad I went. However, somewhat disappointed with the location of our supposedly partial ocean-view room (431). We had a peekaboo view of the ocean through the trees, past the croquet lawn and over the lobby entrance when standing on the lanai, and nothing when we sat on the lounge chairs. In retrospect, we should have asked for a room change - especially after our toilet overflowed one night! If you go in whale-watch season, go on Ali'i Nui catamaran - funny and friendly staff. No fighting for views of the whales, very clean and new boat (but you do have to take off your shoes) Food everywhere is expensive. Walked to Matteo's just opposite the Wailea shops - great value, great location and good casual food. Tommy Bahamas restaurant was better than I remember. Disagree about Spagos being overrated - food was amazing albeit expensive. And I thought the server was joking when he asked for my ID when ordering a drink (I'm 53). Apparently he wasn't! The only time we didn't get a smile. Basically, if you're lucky enough to have the choice between Maui or the Big Island and want true peace and tranquility - go for Hualalai.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel In Wailea”
Reviews.Author: Swhitevancouverbc
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Fairmont Kea Lani as the rooms are all suites and its great for two young kids (ages 2 and 4). We stayed at the Fairmont for the first 6 days of our trip and then moved to the Four Seasons for the last four nights. There was a large conference on the island and the Fairmont was all booked up. Unfortunately for my husband we LOVED the Four Seasons SO MUCH better. The rooms at the Four Seasons are so much cleaner. On this trip at the Fairmont we had tiny ants all over the bar area (where the sink and microwave are) and in our bathroom by the tub and then we had two cockroaches. GROSS I called the front desk and they didn't do anything about it. Once we got to the Four Seasons and were in our suite I didn't want to go back to the Fairmont again. The Four Seasons is EXTREMELY clean; not only the rooms but the common areas, the pools, the pool decks, the pool chairs, the gym, the restaurants, everything. When you are sitting by the pool someone comes by with water or fruit or a menu. You don't have time to think about needing someone or somethign because they just appear. At the Fairmont we were searching for someone and I wished I had a flag to put up so someone could see me. Yes, the Four Seasons is more expensive but it is certainly worth it. To my husband's dismay, I don't want to stay at the Fairmont anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Service at its best!!!”
Reviews.Author: BleeckerStreetNY
Reviews.Content: We checked in late after a 12 hour flight from NYC. Had booked ourselves into a modest room but when we arrived we noticed it was not quiet what we wanted. Exhausted we passed out and set to see the rest of the resort in the morning. After having a true japanese breakfast, hard to do in the US, we spoke to the staff and they treated us beautifully. Putting us in an amazing ocean view suite. While we lounged at the pool they took care of it all and encouraged us to just relax. Speaking of which, the pool is stunning and the pineapple drinks make stress drain away. Unreal beach with tons of activities to be had located on an amazing walkway that goes for miles up and down the beach. We have stayed at many Four Seasons Resorts, all of which have been amazing but this one is the shinning jewel. The staff here no what they are doing and make relaxing possible.

Reviews.Title: “No Ka Oi!!!”
Reviews.Author: Aliveguy
Reviews.Content: No Ka Oi!!! It translates in Maui to: It's the best. Really, that sums up everything about this hotel. It's the greatest resort anywhere. I can't wait to go back. My wife and I had a phenomenal anniversary here. The staff was considerate and attentive, the food was incredible, and the service was impeccable. They pamper you the entire time you are there. I can't say enough nice things about the staff or the resort. The resort is gorgeous. They have activities for children and a gameroom for them to enjoy. The gym is very nice with a mix of nautilus, free weights and treadmills/ellipticals. They provide towels and gatorade. You can snorkel in the water by the resort and observe sea turtles. There is wonderful shopping just minutes away and if there is inclimate weather, they set up different activities like Island drink-making. I'm not sure why my wife and I were the only ones to do this, but it was a lot of fun. A bartender showed us how they make a variety of cocktails at their restaurants, and of course, we got to try them all! Oh yes, try the No Ka Oi by the pool....it's so refreshing and utterly delicious....and the Bomba...a blended hawaiian Mai Tai in a big pineapple....lots of fun. Ferraros was exceptional. A great place to eat as the sun is setting. The lamb was fantastic. It's a great place for lunch as well when you are lounging by the pool. The other places are good too, and there are many wonderful options within driving distance of the resort also. Matteo's and Capische are phenomenal. This is the pinnacle of relaxation and leisure. I will be coming back here as often as possible and know I will enjoy every second.

Reviews.Title: “Magic place but at very high cost”
Reviews.Author: Tk100964
Reviews.Content: We stayed 9 days in a superior room at the top floor with half ocean view. The room is wonderful : very stylish, a lot of space, super bathroom and terrace. Equiped with all latest technical innovations. Just great. Only minus point : very soft beds and too soft for us. The location is wonderful. The view from the room, the beach, the swimming pool view : everything is just perfect. Service is just "right". The way we like it. Only hick-up was when we visited the serenity pool. It was clear that they do not expect different people than we are. We have no grey hair, no big belly, we drink no champagne at the pool and we do not wear a Rolex. Result was that we were considered by the personnel as "intruders". They did several checks to verify if we were true hotel guests. Even when I showed them a token of the hotel, they answered me that this is no guarentee that we stay at the hotel. I was surprised that they did not take fingerprints :). When they were relatively sure that we stayed in the hotel, they told us that the price for 2 seats in a cabane (basically 2 chairs with a roof) is 350 USD per day (till 5 pm). I told the guy that we might pay 3USD and 50 cents which made us definitely drop out of their target group. Though afterwards, we got a seat at the pool and even 2 plastic cups of water. For free ! These were the only free things we discovered during our stay. For 600USD per night, you got a room. All the rest is extra, also the breakfast. But the place is magic. Also the Ferrero's restaurant is great, with excellent service, superb views and topclass food. We lunched there nearly every noon and we truly enjoyed it. In summary : we spent a great holiday there. Service, rooms, location is outstanding. Is it worth the money ? Difficult to say. For sure, you find resorts in Asia of equal quality for less than half of the price.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful splurge”
Reviews.Author: milliegoulet
Reviews.Content: If you are planning a special getaway, this is it. It's a wonderful property and the staff here will grant your every wish. I nearly cried when we left. The cabanas by the pool are pure bliss, the beach and snorkeling are great, the spa is terrific, and there are plenty of great restaurants on site and nearby. Definitely get the bed and breakfast package - the breakfasts are an incredible value. We lingered each morning over a leisurely outdoors breakfast with great food, coffee, smoothie of the day, and reading the Times Digest. Although it is pricey, keep in mind that the Four Seasons doesn't nickel and dime you for every little thing like some other competing hotels and overall provides a bigger bang for your buck. The rooms are wonderful and the bathrooms are beautiful. If you are at all cost conscious, you can skip Spago - it is overrated. Try Nick's Fishmarket down the street. I haven't been since the infinity pool was installed, but all the more reason to return! The Maui Four Seasons should make just about anyone happy. If you are craving complete quiet and relaxation, you could also try the Four Seasons Lanai property.

Reviews.Title: “Truly heaven on earth!”
Reviews.Author: eastmeetswestCanada
Reviews.Content: The nicest hotel I've ever stayed at in one of the most beautiful places on earth. The service and quality are unparalleled; you can tell they take extreme pride in doing things right, not only when people pay "extra". The rooms are pricey but worth it, extremely comfortable and well appointed. The worst room in this hotel is better than the best room in 99+% of the rest of the hotels in the world. The other facilities and grounds are impeccable as well. The restaurants are great as well. Duo is great for breakfast, Spagos is as good as you would expect, but we actually preferred Ferraro's as it exceeded our expectations every time we went there.

Reviews.Title: “Truly has it all!”
Reviews.Author: AEKBS
Reviews.Content: Walking into the Four Seasons Maui, I always sense a collective "aaahhh," a communal sigh of relaxation from all the guests. We have now stayed here twice, most recently for a long weekend in February, and I'm already looking forward to our next visit! Great rooms; beautiful pools; amazing views; good restaurants; peaceful grounds; superb service...this place has it all! Also, my husband and I were ordering room service for lunch, and I wanted something that I'd seen on the poolside menu, but which was not on the room service menu. I asked if they could bring that to me, even though it was not on the menu, and of course, as this is the Four Seasons, they were happy to oblige! The pool area is wonderful, and they have a large section for small kids. For adults who are looking to get away from the sounds of children and relax in relative silence, (and enjoy a swim-up bar), they have an adults-only serenity pool, one level above the main pool area, with an infinity pool overlooking the bay. I remember reading in Fortune magazine that this resort is one of America's top 100 places to work...and it shows. Every employee I encountered, from the greeters to the poolside attendants to the housekeepers, seemed genuinely happy to both be there and be helping you. All of the food we had was good, and we've now tried almost all of their restaurants. The quality is what you would expect from a Four Seasons. We've also used the spa, and had a great massage there. Of course, the spa does not try to compete with the Spa Grande next door at the Grand Wailea, which I highly recommend you try. The spa at the Four Seasons would probably seem fabulous if it were not right next door to one of the top ranked spas in America, but no problem---the concierge is very helpful in making spa reservations for you at the Grand Wailea, and they even happily arrange a shuttle to drive you next door for your appointment, should you not feel like walking. If you're staying here for a spa weekend, it might be best to use the spa at the Four Seasons one day, for more personalized, less crowded service, and then the spa at the Grand Wailea next door on another day, for a quasi-Japanese sento spa experience. All in all, this place truly has it all. It's a perfect location if you're traveling with kids, as there are many kid-friendly activities and amenities. It's also a perfect location if you're not traveling with kids, as there are many opportunities to find peace, quiet, and relaxation. The beds are, of course, Four Seasons comfortable, and the marble bathrooms are spacious and wonderful, with big mirrors and deep bathtubs. The only down side to this resort is that at some point, you must leave, which I guarantee you won't want to do!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best hotel in Maui”
Reviews.Author: travelgill
Reviews.Content: This is our favorite hotel in Maui. We have stayed at the Grand Wailea and really prefer the Four Seasons for all of the cost-free inclusions. In the past, we've generally stayed in a garden view room because we didn't want to spend the money for an upgrade to ocean view since we spend so little time in the room to actually enjoy the room. This time, we had booked our room with an offer for a $100 resort credit per night. About a week before our visit, the FS contacted us with an offer to upgrade to ocean view for $125 a night and we still get our room credit. It was our 5 year anniversary so we figured we'd spluge and do it. The room was really phenomenal. The location of the room is much closer to the pool/spa/fitness center and the view of the garden, resort and ocean was really breathtaking. we booked an airport pick up through the hotel and wished we would have done this every time. We were met as soon as we got off the plane, whisked down and through baggage claim and quickly brought to the sedan -- i think we made it from door of airplane to front desk in under 30 minutes! Our driver, JT, was awesome and provided fun conversation on the way to the hotel. check in was very smooth with lei greeting and personal greeting by Samuel Davis, assistant resort manager. Upon arrival in the fantastic room, we had welcome gift of pineapple bread and also a bottle of champagne for our anniversary -- really nice touch. In the past, we've had issues with housekeeping (not cleaning room until late, not remembering special requests, etc.) This time was totally different and it was really great. Not sure if it is because they've improved or if the service is better with a better room but everything was top notch. In the past, I requested an extra sheet, this was in our room upon check in and there every day after cleaning. Our room was cleaned every day within in an hour of us leaving for our morning workout/walk. The special little touches are really nice here -- housekeeping always bookmarks the tv guide magazine with the current day on the bedside table, they organize your personal toiletries that you've brought on a nice rattan mat. Only downside is that they only provide 3 bath towels and 2 hand towels in the room -- that is just not enough for 2 adults -- every other hotel we ever stay at have at least 4 bath towels and 4 hand towels -- but this was really pretty minor complaint in light of how everything else is so great. We asked for extra towels when we were in the room one morning and they provided, but then they went back to 3 towels with the turndown service. They really market the new adult infinity pool when you check in. I had a chance to check it out when we were on Maui in Nov. and it is really wonderful although the layout is a little strange in that only a few seats have great views of the ocean -- the rest all face each other and if you didn't know better, it feels like you're at any other pool in Vegas or someplace warm. Other problem is that it was so packed this time, we had to go on a waitlist and it took 2 hours to get up there -- just wasn't really worth it as the other pools are just as great and had plenty of great seats with views of the ocean. I always make an appointment for the signature massage at the spa - it never disappoints. A few trips ago, I asked for a larger robe size and since then, they always just provide me with a locker with that larger robe, i no longer have to ask. those little touches are what really make the Four Seasons the best hotel in Maui. We ate at Spago and Ferraros while at the hotel. Ferraros is an old stand by we always go to for our anniversary. It has really great sunset views -- menu seems to be a little tired -- same ole same ole -- but it is consistently good. We had our absolutely favorite meal at Spage -- the wok fried whole fish with thai ginger sauce and rice and veggies -- it is to die for! It is not actually on the menu but a special they have if they have a whole fish or two in house -- we called ahead and asked them to make it for us and they did -- we felt very special as everyone else in the restaurant was jealous as our fish was being carved tableside -- had Steven, the greatest waiter ever! We can't say enough about this great hotel -- we hope to return every visit to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful - one of the best hotels I've stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: JDChicago1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Four Seasons Maui. The island is beautiful but the hotel made our vacation. The staff is fantastic and you are treated like royalty. Our room was very comfortable with a nice view of the ocean. The poolside staff went out of their way providing towels, water and menu items. You cannot go wrong with the FS, worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: saylesliv
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful resort. The best. Perfect for a family vacation (except that you wanted want to spend the $ on your kids for every meal) and perfect for adults. The new adult-only pool makes a HUGE difference. It is lovely and quiet and far away from all the crowds!

Reviews.Title: “Not our favorite Four Seasons in Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: JohnSFDC
Reviews.Content: Let me get this straight,The Four Seasons Maui is a very good hotel. The service and food are excellent. However, the reason we didn't love it is that it really feels mostly like a hotel (albeit a very good one) that happens to be on a very small beach. You'll take an elevator to your room, walk down a corridor, etc. For this type of property we enjoyed our stay at the Grand Wailea next door more. And we don't have kids, if you do then there is no doubt about it, stay at the Grand Wailea for it's giant pool and waterslides, not to do so would just be cruelty to your kids. Fear not, there's a swim up grotto bar for the grown-ups... If you want Four Seasons service, food, etc. then the Four Seasons Hualalai is bungalow style so no corridors, is layed out along the ocean (as opposed to perpendicular to it) so lots of space, views, ocean front pools, etc. as well as the best hotel gym I've ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure what I can add - pretty much perfect”
Reviews.Author: jodydavis617
Reviews.Content: Not sure what I can add to the extravagant praise that this place receives (and deserves), but thought I'd try anyway. This was pretty much the most luxurious hotel experience I've ever had. We stayed here for nearly a week last November for our honeymoon and by the end, were so reluctant to leave. The hotel itself, while absolutely beautiful and immaculate, did not immediately strike us as being that much nicer or grander than other luxury hotels. It's not over-the-top showy or luxurious. But the longer we stayed, the more we noticed all the little differences and details that added up to an amazing experience. The service at the hotel was absolutely amazing. Service is not usually something I notice, unless it is bad, but I now understand why so many folks comment on it. The service, from literally everyone (from the valet, concierge, waiters, pool attendants), was constantly cheerful, attentive, and incredibly competent, all without being obtrusive or pretentious. I was amazed that it could be this consistently high-quality. Every interaction with an employee was positive. This made the entire stay so incredibly enjoyable - the feeling of assurance that everything would be taken care of. And the little touches were amazing, too. Free popsicles, fruit slices, muffins, and spritzes at the pools or on the beach. A huge list of activities at no extra charge. Extremely helpful pool attendants. The concierge desk was terrific at setting up activities or reservations. The grounds were immaculate. Every detail seemed to have been already carefully thought through. Our room was very spacious, elegant, and pretty much perfect. We had an ocean view room with a balcony. The bed was huge and comfortable, the furniture all in tip top shape. And the bathroom was absolutely immense. We spent most of our time at the adults-only serenity pool, which was fantastic. Very calm and quiet. In order to be guaranteed a spot, you did have to get there early, which was a bit of a pain. But if you didn't mind getting a spot later in the day, you could put your name on a wait list, and they would call your cellphone to let you know when a spot opened up. The main pool was also quite nice, though a bit noisier. The restaurants were quite good. We ate at Spago and Ferraro's, which were both uniformly excellent. All in all, this was an amazing experience. I would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “go nowhere else”
Reviews.Author: Hollydcaley
Reviews.Content: All I can say is.... Don't stay anywhere else. Just like all the four seasons, this one stands head and shoulders above all hotels on this island.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Honeymoon Stay”
Reviews.Author: Frienzales
Reviews.Content: I didn't believe the five star reviews could be true, but they were! This place is what a resort should be. Every member of staff treated us spectacularly - everyone really did know our names. The hotel was immaculate. We ate in all of the restaurants except Spago and were amazed. The wait staff's knowledge of the menu and ability to recommend the right food and wine was incredible. My wife and I were on our honeymoon and after so much stress we needed to be pampered and that's exactly what we got - we were spoilt rotten! The concierge was so helpful at all times and the cabana boys got it just right every time. It is expensive, but it is definitely worth it because they go that bit further than anyone else and it makes such a difference.

Reviews.Title: “This is what heaven looks like”
Reviews.Author: Mme_X
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days as well as a hotel in Kanapali. We were happy there, but this place is really outstanding, as well it should be for the price. I have some minor gripes noted below, but would be thrilled to return. Even then, we were upgraded for the same price, so it's hard to complain. A quick summary that reflects many of the comments of other visitors: Room 592 is a very spacious partial-ocean view room with a very large bathroom. I suspect that this might be a handicapped room because the separate room for the toilet is enormous with finely crafted wooden rails. Some object to handicap room, but I wonder why since they are designed to be spacious. Guests might get a slightly better view (e.g. room 590, 588...) because the ocean-front wing obscures part of the view. The king bed was very comfortable. Like many hotel properties, the bedding includes a seoarate sheet and duvet that is often too warm unless you stay at a chalet in the Alps. We immediately asked to have a lighter blanket and were comfortable through our stay. The room is very comfortable and tastefully decorated with comfortable chairs, desk, flat screen TV, coffee/tea setup, iron/ironing board, internet access, etc. that you expect in a hotel of this calibre. The chairs on the patio had hassocks -- a nice relaxing touch. Good storage space in closet and drawers. Dings: the room safe will not accomodate a laptop, and I forget if there is a room charge. There should never be a room charge for internet access, especially at this price. The bathroom is enormous, with separate tub and walk-in shower with seat large enough for two (again, see my comment about the this is possibly a handicapped room.) It was beautifully decorated with marble and glass tile mossaics, had nice toiletries from l'Occitane, lots of high quality towels, etc. Excellent housekeeping that always left orchid flowers here and there. Service is excellent throughout the hotel -- maids, floor staff, concierges, waitstaff, poolstaff, etc. desert best-of-class prize. There is a lot of value here when you consider the pool areas, including complimentary cabana tents. While we usually prefer the calm of the adult-only pools, the main pool had a nicer set-up -- the adult only area only had those shell-like covers for shade unless you wanted to spring for really luxurious wood-frame cabanas, and did not have enough of those to accomodate the guests who wanted shade. The next few days, something went wrong with the adult pool area, so we never got to go back. Still, this was not a problem. The kinds-and-adults main pool area is wonderful, with attentive staff, enough shaded areas for the guests at the time, complimentary treats like ice pops, suntan lotion at the staff stations, etc. The garden setting is sublime. The water was a perfect temperature, unlike the unexpected chillier temperature at the hotel where we stayed in Kanapali. You can easily get lunch from the Italian restaurant served at the pool, and there is a side area from Duo for the pool crowd, I think? For the record: the children's pool area is also really nice with a shallow end and somewhat deeper near a waterfall. Thanks to all the parents who visited at this time for keeping the children's noises her and the main pool to pleasant laughter, and no screeching. We dined at all the resaurant venues at least once, and the quality of the food was excellent throughout. The variety is very good -- the Italian had more Mediterranean items, salads, pizzas, etc. Duo is very good for breakfast, all-around American with Pacific influences. Spago is Spago. The lounge was very good for open-air cocktails and lighter fare. Still, it's quite pricey. The continental breakfast buffet was $27; off-the-menu pancakes $18 and egg dishes in the $20's. Dings: the weak coffee throughout the property really should be better. Spago's food was quite good, except the crab cake served lukewarm. And really -- the semi-rock music at Spago is off for this location. Maybe LA, but not here. But again: service is excellent. The spa looks great, but did not indulge. Wild orchid mani/pedis sound wonderful, as well as a menu of massages and treatments. We also appreciated that the hotel hosts local artists and craftspersons every day. These are high-quality artists, so stop by. The beach here is like many in Hawaii -- close-in surf break makes it difficult to swim, but nice for walking or managing a quick dip. There is lots going on here, from pool tables and Wii game areas, to open-air fitness rooms. Your exerciser machines were never in such a pleasurabel location. Easy walk to Wailea shopping plaza along a paved beachside walkway. The plaza includes everything from an ABC store and General store for reasonable take-out, to Gucci and Bottega Veneta, and some interesting shops in between. It's also easy to walk to other hotel properties for exploring. My only real complaints include the always-irritating mandatory resort fee. It feels unethical to not just include this in the stated room rate, and be clear about what is or is not included. They (and other hotels) never seem clear about what it does and does not include -- and it never seems to include tips for excellent housekeeping staff. FYI: parking seemed like it was valet-only for a $20 fee. While this is not bad, it was never explained whether there was an alternative. Also: local calls get a $1 charge. The nickle-and-diming at this level is irritating. There are other places to dine in the area, but the food is not as good as here. So: in a minute we'd return, but the bill is stiff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing in every way”
Reviews.Author: Peter A
Reviews.Content: To our surprise Maui is a wonderful spot which caters to children in every way, and the Four Season takes it a step further! upon arrival they had spelled our sons name in sponges on the tub. Service is excellent, location is fantastic and the weather is always great!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon was Heaven”
Reviews.Author: BeachPrincess12
Reviews.Content: This review is a little late but like they say better late than never. The only way to describe the Four Seasons is heaven on earth. Everything about it the hotel and staff is MAGNIFICENT. Maui was the 3rd stop for us on our honeymoon, we saved the best for last. We went to Waikiki and Kauai, if we could go back and do it again we would spend all of our time at the Four Seasons in Maui. From the second we arrived everyone knew our names and greeted us every time they saw us. The amenities are wonderful, this hotel gives you so many perks just for being a guest. There are many celebs who frequent this hotel. While there we saw, Joe Montana, Regis, Danny Nucci and Paula Marshall. Denise Richards had left the day before we got there. Pool: The pool and beach butlers are beyond amazing. They will place you in any area you request. They put a nice cover on your chair and if you go for a swim and get the cover wet they will actually come to refresh your chair. While sitting poolside hotel staff come around with chilled towels, ice pops, fruit, jello, and all other sorts of fun things. There is water always available to you and you better believe they will never let your water cup go lower than half full. Try the cucumber water, it is so yummy. There are tons of sunblock dispensers located poolside and their sunblock smells so good!!! The new pool area was set to open a few days after our departure, I heard it was supposed to be fantastic. Beach The beach is just beautiful and the water amazing. You can do great snorkeling right off of the beach. We saw so many beautiful fish. The water is usually calmer in the morning, so try to snorkel early in the day. The tide picks up in the afternoon and so does the wind, so try not too far out in the afternoon. I am about the biggest beach lover, but at the Four Seasons, I was always poolside because that was where you treated like royalty. Food: The food was EXPENSIVE. So worth it though. You have to splurge while you are here. We ate at Wolfgang Pucks Spago which was amazing. The portions are small but you have to def eat here it was worth it. Your taste buds will thanks you. While at Spago my husband and I inquired about Oysters because we expected there would be Oysters on the menu. Our waiter said they did not have them but if we'd like the chef could have them flown in for us. This is a true statement...the staff go so far out of their way in every aspect...it's crazy. We also ate at Duo and I have to say, the steak was probably one of the best steaks I've ever had. After you eat your entree they bring you a big cotton candy puff, which I thought was very different and fun. We had Ferraro's poolside for lunch almost every day but did not eat there for dinner. The breakfast buffet is worth it as there are a lot of choices but you can expect to spend about $100 on breakfast for 2 people. We had heard that 2 chefs that used to work at the Four Seasons had left to open their own gourmet sandwich shops called 808 in Kihei. We heard the sandwiches were incredible so we asked one of the poolside staff members and she said she could get a menu faxed over for us. We were planning on taking a ride there but the staff member said she would call to see if they could deliver for us. She made the call, took our orders and had the delivery person escorted to our poolside chairs. Now if this is not above and beyond, I do not know what is. The sandwiches were fantastic. We also ate off the resort. We did go to Mama's Fish House which is better than everyone has described. We loved it. We ate breakfast a couple of times at the Wailea shopping center. Like mentioned above the food is very expensive in all of Wailea. We were at the Four Seasons for 9 days so we did go into Kihei a few times for some cheaper options and variety and the food was very good. Rooms: Perfection, there was nothing more you could ask for. L'occataine soaps are the best!!! Be sure to ask for an upgrade, we didn't but another couple we met did and their room was an incredible suite. They even had their own eliptical on and treadmill on a balcony overlooking the ocean. Their room was bigger than most peoples houses and they did not pay for the upgrade, the room was just available. We did pay for a partial ocean view and we only had a view of a sliver of the ocean. Because everything else was so perfect we did not complain.
