We filled out the questionnaire before leaving and a week after arriving home the hotel had sent us a personalized letter letting us know that the next time we stayed at the Four Seasons we would receive a free upgrade. Above and beyond again. Excursions: One evening we had called for a wakeup call for around 2am. They asked if we were visiting Haleakala and we told them yes. They told us they would have blankets, muffins and coffee for us in the morning to take with us on our tour. They helped us book all of our excursions. I have to recommend Kai Kanani which is not too far up the road. This was the best tour we took in Maui. We did the early tour to Molokini Crater which is nice because the water is calmer. While there we saw 3 reef sharks and got great pictures. We also did the road to Hana which was beautiful. We did the Luau at the Marriott Wailea which was just ok. The food was not very good and the best part was the flame thrower. Sunsets in Maui are by far the most beautiful thing I have ever seen. Be sure to spend plenty of time outside while the sun is going down. Scuba at Four Seaons: The Scuba team was amazing,. I had never dove before and had every intention on diving while in Maui. We took the free intro class and they spent so much time with my husband and I and they were so calm and nice. If you like the intro you can pay to dive off the beach. We started in the pool and I had a really hard time with breathing. They did not give up on me and they spent so much extra time with me going over everything. In the end I did not do the shore dive. I felt so bad because I felt I had wasted there time. They were completely fine about it and assured me any time I wanted to come back they would spend just as much time with me and go over everything again. I did not go back but hopefully one of these days I will be able to. I don't think there could better instructors out there. My husband and I do a lot of traveling and always choose nice resorts. This is by far the best hotel I had ever stayed in. I do not think another hotel in all of Maui could even come close to the quality and service of the Four Seasons. Spend the extra money, it is worth every penny. My husband had wanted to stay at the Grand Wailea and after our experience he was so glad I had talked him out of it. While there we had met a few couples that had transferred from the Grand Wailea and the Fairmont and said the Four Seasons was by far 100% times better. You will be so happy with your choice. My husband and I would like to make a return for our 5 year anniversary. I think might start counting the days now.

Reviews.Title: “No doubt - This is a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: pkhanna
Reviews.Content: I stayed on maui for 2 weeks and essentially did the tour of the top hotels in the area and also ended up staying at the Ritz Kapulua (see review) on the last half of my trip. I traveled with my wife and 3 children (ages 10,8,4). The hotel is GORGEUS. The grounds are beautiful, the staff extremly attentive and friendly. The kids club is a dream come true as they have every possible desire for children and tweens to keep them busy on indoor days. There is a seperate kids pool that is appropriate for kids 10 years and younger with a beautiful waterfall. The problem is that it gets a bit boring for them and they end up in the general pool, which I didn't like the layout. Generally a big rectangle with a huge fountain in the middle that you could use for shade. The rooms were very sizeable, modern, and we were very comfortable. Could use some more Hawaiin influences, but nice overall. My room didn't have a great view, but it was still relatively quiet. Food/drinks wereexcellent and the restaurant at Spago's was delicious. The beach is public but the hotel does a nice job keeping it clean. Very nice beach. Awesome workout facilities. Overall, I would recommend this hotel highly, more so for couples as you can stay in the adult-only area and its very swank. Great views, very romantic, very relaxing. My kids loved it. I would definately go back. If I was the hotel, I would arrange for more outdoor style BBQ events, especially for the kids behind the kids pool. The hotel guest were your typical middle-age affluent crowd, either professional couples or young families. Very relaxed vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: NYCBegin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Four Seasons as one of three hotels on our honeymoon. Though all the hotels we stayed in were nice and considered high-end, the Four Seasons blew them all away. The service was at another level, the food was incredible, and the location was perfect. We've stayed in a number of very nice hotels from Ritzes to Fairmonts to the Grand Hyatt in Kauai (though this was our first Four Seasons), and this one was hands down the best hotel we've ever stayed in. Pros: - Service. Perfect service - we couldn't believe the difference between the service here and the service in the second-best hotel in which we've ever stayed. It was no contest. Everyone was friendly and helpful, and there were multiple instances of people going above and beyond to cater to us. - Location. We followed a hurricane into Hawaii, and as such were worried about rain, but as everyone had told us it never rains on this side of Maui. It was calm and warm in the morning and windy and warm in the evening, with never a cloud in sight for the five days we were there. Great golf and snorkeling were nearby and not too expensive. - Spa. My wife goes to a lot of high-end spas and this was the best she's ever been to. - Food. We consider ourselves amateur foodies, and living in New York we've been able to eat at some of the best restaurants in the world, and Spago is at the top of our list. Duo was decent, and their brunch was fantastic, but Spago was by far the best eating experience we had - twice - in Hawaii (though it is expensive). - Adult pool. The adults-only pool is nice, with a great swim-up bar and hot tubs, but it's pretty crowded. Cons. These are very minor concerns: - Crowded. You have to get up pretty early to get a cabana. If you're used to East Coast time like we are, it's not hard to do so, but it could be an annoyance to some. - Expensive. Everything costs a lot, from food to rooms. Overall, if we could afford it, we'd stay here every time we go to Hawaii. We might do so even though we can't afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons - Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: Andrew808
Reviews.Content: I just returned from staying at this hotel, I was there for fun, showing some friends around Maui. The hotel itself is very nice, the grounds are amazing, the pools excellent. There were a sizeable number of kids around, but there is an adults-only pool area that is very quiet. The hotel staff were some of the best I've seen, they do a good job of knowing who you are and are very pleasant and were mostly helpful. The rooms are very nice, a good size and well appointed. The bathrooms are splendid and spacious. Food in the pool area was expensive as would be expected. My friends ate at Duo and were very disappointed. They also ate at Spago and met Wolfgang Puck there, whom they said was very gracious and personable. They enjoyed both the experience and food there. My only real gripe about this hotel is that it seems to be a bit of Los Angeles, transplanted into Maui. The clientele seemed like a mashup of some of the worst stereotypes of rich California residents, from the surgically enhanced socialite, to the somewhat sleazy movie director, to the Dr. 90210 type. I felt like I was in the midst of "The Real Housewives of L.A." While some of the staff seemed "local" a significant number were not. I think it would have been possible to stay at the hotel for a week and never actually talk to anybody who was born in the state. The hotel is a resort dream, but it doesn't represent many of the best aspects of life in this great state. I suppose it's unfair to blame that on the hotel, the hotel is exceptional at what it does, and perhaps the target market isn't really looking to eat squid luau or learn pidgin or actually meet the "natives" or do anything authentic. Maybe, I'm just not accustomed to living in that stratosphere, and that's just the way things are done. To me though, those are some of the best parts of traveling. If you're going to come to Hawaii just to sit by the pool, well, then why come? Regardless, my friends (not from Los Angeles) found it very relaxing and had a great time. They would love to come back. Personally, I'd rather camp in Hana and pick opihi off the rocks. Except that the beds at the Four Seasons are oh-so much nicer.....

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons is pur bliss”
Reviews.Author: TaminUSA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Four Seasons for two nights as were were getting married in Maui and all I can say is that from the moment the cab pulled up until the moment it left - we loved every minute of it. The hotel is beautiful and although I am sure the original room we booked would have been nice the upgrade to the ocean view room was pure heaven. I can not say enough about how helpful and friendly the entire staff was. I agree with the review about the salon being cramped - but I understand you have to renovate and it was the down season - regardless the job they did on my hair and makeup was spectacular! The Four Seasons really did make our wedding weekend even more spectacular than it would have been. My friends treated us to the Ultimte Dinner for our wedding night and although I would probably not have dreamed of paying the price - it was truly one of the most romantic experiences! Every detail was beautifully done. The only thing to note is that it is not as much food as you think the first 3 courses are really just a few bites each - but each bite was wonderful! Again a big thank you to the Four Seasons staff for making our stay perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Don't book Mountain View unless you can sleep through traffic”
Reviews.Author: Goldrusswoman
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews here, we decided to book a Mountain View room. As many reviewers have noted, you don't spend much time in the room when you're in Hawaii, and at many hotels (such as Kahala on Oahu) we actually prefer the Mountain View. A word of caution: I don't care about the room's overlooking a parking garage, but the area's main road was SOCLOSE to the room, it was impossible to take a nap our first day, and I knew it would be too noisy to sleep at night. We live in the 'burbs at home, so if you live in a more city environment, it may not bother you. Management changed us to a room on the first floor facing the inner courtyard---I usually don't like first floor rooms in Hawaii (bugs) but we wanted it quiet and it was, and I didn't see any bugs. I will say that the Mountain View room seemed much nicer due ot the high ceiling, but other than that the rooms were the same, and both were very dark. BTW, we were NOT offered an upgrade despite the frequency that reviewers here report an upgrade, even though they knew we were celebrating our 10 year anniversary, we are frequent guests at Four Seasons hotels, and the hotel was nowhere near capacity. So don't count on it. Other than that, the new adult pool makes this hotel given the high number of families, and without it we wouldn't have enjoyed our stay. They offer spa "tapas" at the pool, so if you just want a foot massage, or a head and neck massage, you can have it done right there as you bake in the sun. Snorkeling is quite good right on the beach. Without a doubt, and like most Four Seasons, it's the people at this hotel who make it a wonderful experience. For cheaper food options, the Grand Wailea next door has a nice cafeteria like offering that is open for breakfast and dinner (why not lunch, I don't know) but the other restaurants at that hotel have similar prices to the Four Seasons. Also the Shops at Wailea have many dining options, but it is a good 20 minute walk from the hotel so you may prefer to drive. There are so many nice restaurants on Maui (Haile Maile, Mama's Fish House) that I would avoid the ho-hum, overpriced dinner options at the hotel. If you're foodies, avoid Kihei like the plague (except for Sansei, but it's quite crowded/noisy).

Reviews.Title: “WOW again”
Reviews.Author: gklongo
Reviews.Content: This is now my fourth review of the FS at Maui. Every time we go we say we will never try another location but then we end up doing just that! This trip we spent the first five days at the FS resort in Kona. It was a wonderful property and we enjoyed our time there but it still doesn't compare to the atmosphere and experience in Maui! We stayed for five days in Maui and could have stayed forever! As all the reviews say the property is beautiful! We stay on the club floor which gives you access to a dedicated concierge staff, snacks and drinks throughout the day. It really adds to the experience. The rooms are perfect. Large and very clean. The bathroom is unlike any I have ever experienced!(Except the FS at Kona, which is also amazing and had an outside shower!) Since our last trip the adult only pool has opened and really makes the property perfect(when you are there without kids!) The view from the pool is amazing. Everyone we met had similar feelings about the property. One couple on their honeymoon even cancelled plans to travel to another island after coming to this hotel. Duos if our favorite restaurant when we are there but even a snack and drinks in the lobby lounge is great. Could keep writing and writing but it would all be the same. It is a wonderful place and I wouldn't change a thing! Oh, and the spa is great! Also, the beach is clean, relaxing, and the snorkeling world class!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay........”
Reviews.Author: markd50
Reviews.Content: This vacation was planned for celebrating our 6-year wedding anniversary......After extensive research (such as reading at least 500 reviews on Trip Advisor) in an effort to choose between Hyatt, Sheraton, Fairmont , Grand Wailea and Four Seasons , I am so glad I chose to stay here. This is by far the most fantastic resort around and the service is unbeatable. We ate at Duo and Ferraro's and were very pleased with the menu items and the service. Also had breakfast buffet twice at Duo and it contained so many different foods and they were all wonderful. I had booked a mountainside room and was happy to find out at check-in that we were upgraded to a partial oceanview room. That just was the icing on the cake! I highly recommend not to waste your time or money at other resorts on Maui since this one is by far the best !. Also, we ate meals at other places besides the hotel and quite frankly all of the food was not very good at all. Next time I go to Four Seasons Maui I will bring extra money so I never have to leave the hotel for a meal. As of this moment, I am even opening a savings account at my bank in which I will put money in every month until it is enough to visit this awesome hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of improvements!”
Reviews.Author: Docsknotinn
Reviews.Content: Since our last stay in December '07 the FS Maui has under gone several changes. The staff is still very friendly. The valet service had declined slightly ($20 daily) but was still very good. Internet service was a whopping $50 for four days. The Adult pool was new since our last visit but it failed to impress. The pool is very narrow and just not a lot of fun although the view from the end is stunning. The FS continues to fall behind the other area resorts in pool quality. It is worth noting that the kinds pool is VERY nice. The biggest changes in the last few years were to the restaurants. Spago is still there but there is little left that exudes Wolfgang Puck. I won't be surprised if they change the name in the future. The service here was still very good but the menu is a bit passe (changes daily) for the price. If you have never ate here it is worth a visit. Try to score an out side table at 5:30 as the sun sets. On our last visit DUO was the worst meal we have ever had at a restaurant.....ever!. It was with some trepidation that we returned for dinner and we are very glad that we did. The prime bone in rib chop was divine although service is not on the same level as Spago. When asked a question about the beef our server was un-sure and did not bother to ask the Chef. Still a huge improvement from our last visit. We also ate at DUO for the B'fast buffet. $34 PP including juice and coffee. Food quality was very good although they lacked any exotic fruit or juice. We found this to be a good value. The lobby lounge has nightly entertainment and now offers sushi as well. The salon is currently working out of a room on the third floor as renovations are under way on the salon. One complaint I have about the FS is their stores. They are dismal at best. It is not even possible to buy a soda or ice cream unless you call room service. The Fairmont is about a ten minute walk and they have some great shops and a full deli with wine, beer, munchies etc. The beach at the FS Maui remains the high point. This time we booked a Garden view room. A few nights before we arrived we received an offer to up-grade to a Ocean View room for another $125 per night which we accepted. This turned out to be $200 per night under rack rate with the fifth night free! We were then up-graded to an ocean view prime with a very nice view. (Thank You! :) The rooms are getting slightly worn and were a tad less than spotless. No doubt there is less staff on property than years past with the lower occupancy rates. We declined an offer to up-grade to an ocean front suite for an additional $375 per night. These rooms are usually over 3k a night so that might be a good deal for some. Check in was fast and efficient although the champagne never arrived. Room cleaning and turn down times varied considerably from day to day. One thing that has not changed is that you can not view your bill in your room on the TV even thouygh the system has the ability. When you sign a room charge they do not give you a copy of the receipt. It seems the FS would rather you not think about your total until you leave. ;) Over all a very pleasant experience. Five stars? No but an honest 4.50-4.75 depending on the value you place on select services. There are also local artists each morning on the LL out side of Duo. I'm sure we will return again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go the beauty shop in the hotel (Orchid Salon)”
Reviews.Author: aprilgirl76
Reviews.Content: This beauty shop is a total ripoff. We booked a wedding party months ago. We called the day before the wedding and were told "oh by the way, the shop is closed for renovation". They put us in a "suite" in the hotel which was basically a hotel room with a sitting room. We booked this place to make it special for the bride, but we ended up in a cramped hotel room. They only had 2 chairs to style hair in, so they didn't get done in the 3 hours they told us it would take. There were only 6 of us, one of whom was a little girl. One of the stylists took over an hour to do an 7 years olds' hair. It was ridiculous. The mother of the groom had to go into the bathroom and curl her own hair with her own curling iron because we ran out of time. In almost 4 hours two stylists could only do 4 heads of hair and one little girl. They did not wash, cut, or color. They charged more than they quoted. The limo driver had to wait 45 minutes for us because we were done so late. We made the wedding, the bride looked beautiful, but the added stress was not appreciated. They said on we do wedding all the time and are mindful of the time, but you could have fooled me. Save your money and don't go to this hotel beauty shop. Wedding parties beware.

Reviews.Title: “I've been 4 seasonized for life! Spoiled! Pampered!”
Reviews.Author: hyperchickmom
Reviews.Content: What can I say that has not already been said? LOVE this hotel! LOVE this location! We orig booked the lowest price rooms..mountainview and had requested high floor. We arrived approx 10:30 pm and were given Rm 752 (top floor mountainview overlooks covered parking lot, but still lots of greenery). However, our first minor "problem" was tiny little ants crawling all over the box of goodies left on the table. UGH! Management immediately transferred us to another room (Rm 769) YES! We now had inner courtyard and part oceanview! (Thank goodness for those tiny little sugar ants!) Needless to say, we were really thrilled with our new location..although now it was about midnight! We took dip in the pool, and hot tub..as there was no way we were going straight to sleep yet! Room was fantastic...bathroom large and spacious with music. Amenities! Breakfast buffet pricey, but worth it! Canoe Outrigger program (complimentary) was fantastic! Make reservation! Snorkeling at Wailea beach was awesome! Love the beach service...they set up chairs, umbrellas, provide towels, water, etc.! Pool service was top notch! (we were there week before Thanksgiving, so basically had the place to ourselves). We barely choose a lounge chair each day, when someone already was on their way with lounge chair covers and towels. Besides water offered each day, we had pop-ices, fruit, sliced cucumbers with cool damp wash towel for our eyes! TALK about being SPOILED & PAMPERED! Lets' see....I can go on and on....SPA was amazing! Couples Massage in an oceanside thatched-roof hut! You cannot get better than this! The SERENITY pool was fantastic too! We enjoyed the pool...but kiddie pool is small, and does not compare to some other resorts...but we traveled with teenager and he enjoyed the regular pool, game room, and especially the SCUBA clinic. You do not need to be certified to go into ocean! We were so glad we signed up for this! Also, we did enjoy the Weight room and thought the Fitness center is one of the nicest. You are not stuck in alittle room in basement with mirrors..but you can work out in the open-air facing gardens with ocean in background! Many days they had complimentary classes, which we did not have time to take..but thought this was nice touch! We also enjoyed the Gryotonic demonstration! We missed the Manager's Reception unfortunately...so make sure you know when it is..as it is only one night during week. Also, fantastic was SUNSET dinner at Ferraro's! We did NOT want to leave! We will definitely stay here again on our next Maui vacation!

Reviews.Title: “This place is fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Love2TravelinStyle
Reviews.Content: Our stay was relaxing and trouble-free - just like a vacation should be. EVERYONE - staff at all levels - was friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. Our room was great, maid service exceptional and front desk staff and concierge very helpful. I spent time at the spa and cannot recommend it enough. The Hawaiian Healing Wrap and Hawaiian Ceremonial Lomi Lomi were AMAZING!! I tried a few other services as well and was never disappointed. The beach is really nice as is the walking/running path along the coastline. Don't miss the art tour! They have an amazing collection of art (beginning of Hawaii statehood onward). They have a docent-lead tour once a week but I had a conflict. Instead, I borrowed an iPod from the concierge and did the tour on my own. The iPod tour is wonderful - narrated by a local man, it also includes interviews with some of the artists. The hotel also brings in excellent local artists - about five each day on a weekly cycle - who display their work on the lower level. Internet fee is reasonable and the internet is fast. We decided not to rent a car - good choice! - made the stay more relaxing. The hotel shuttle will take you to local restaurants and the concierge has rental cars (easily) available. We ended up renting a car for 24-hours and driving up to Lahaina and beyond. Great place, great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Thanksgiving Stay”
Reviews.Author: WeHoGal
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons in Maui is every bit as fantastic as the countless reviews on this site claim. The grounds are beautiful, the rooms are generous, the pools are well maintained, service is top-notch at all times. I'd like to offer some tips for those who are planning a stay. We found a lot of helpful information on Trip Advisor before our visit, but there were a few things I discovered during our visit that I wish I would have known in advance. 1. Between the (economy) car rental and parking fees @ the 4S we spent about $700 on transportation charges while in Maui. The 4S will transport you free of charge anywhere in Wailea. You can also rent cars by the day from the 4S for days when you want to leave Wailea, avoiding a charge on the day you don't use the car and the parking fee. 2. We were at the resort over Thanksgiving, so I can only speak for holiday weeks, but during high-season visits, expect that you need to be at the pool at 7AM to reserve prime seats. If you don't mind a seat with a less than ideal view, you don't need to worry about this. 3. Free coffee is out every morning in front of Duo 4. I think the breakfast at Duo was fantastic and a much better value than lunch at Ferraros. I found Ferraros to be the least impressive of the resorts dining options, at least in terms of food. (the view is amazing). In terms of dining in Wailea outside of the resort, you should check out Joe's and Matteo's just down the street from the hotel. We went to Nicks at the Fairmont and were less than impressed. Sansei Sushi in nearby Kehei was another nice meal for a fair price. Mama's Fishhouse, although not close, was AMAZING and very easy to find. In summary, if you can afford it, you will not be disappointed by the Four Seasons in Maui. Enjoy & Aloha!!!

Reviews.Title: “Still exquisite!”
Reviews.Author: CO_travel
Reviews.Content: Second visit to the resort (first being in 2005); went for a week as an easy trip to celebrate my birthday. Originally I hadnâ€™t planned on coming here â€“ but my reservation at the Four Seasons Nevis had been canceled due to the ongoing delay in hurricane repairs being made at that property. I was worried that coming back here might be a letdown: Sometimes part of the excitement of visiting a high-end resort is discovering it for the first time, and I didnâ€™t know if a return would be somewhat boring and a quick descent into a, â€œbeen-there-done-that,â€� attitude. No need for the concern â€“ in the past four years the resort has made significant upgrades at the same time that they have kept the overall place as great as I remembered it! We booked (and received) a Garden View room â€“ no upgrade this time â€“ but we were in an excellently-situated double on the 3rd floor with a private lawn overlooking the porte cochere and out towards the ocean. We were close to the elevators and access to everything was great. The room was of the standard FS Maui variety: 600 sq. feet, with a large marble bathroom, great beds and tastefully furnished. No complaint about the room or the furnishings. There have been a few changes since I last visited: Thereâ€™s now a $20/day parking charge (used to be included in the rate); the Pacific Grill is now DUO â€“ a change for the better, in my opinion; the spa has been enlarged and enhanced; and, most notably, a second pool for adults only has been added. These last two elements were of the most interest to me personally â€“ beach/sun vacations for me are focused on spa and pool, so these upgrades were perfect. Also the expansion of the resortâ€™s art collection is noteworthy and the tour (self-guided or with a docent) is highly recommended. The TA comments about the new infinity pool are correct: Come early or come late â€“ otherwise it will be near impossible to secure a spot. Overall itâ€™s a terrific (and sorely needed) addition to the resort, and people appeared to enjoy the new space immensely. There are actually two salt-water pools here, each complete with hot tubs and water-and-air â€œbeds.â€� There are a half-dozen private cabanas and a swim-up bar â€“ and the views from the infinity edge over the beach and ocean are remarkable. The music underwater is a nice touch (they play Hawaiian music, so nothing too chaotic or distracting; in any case you canâ€™t hear it unless you submerge your head fully under the water). We did reserve a private cabana ($300 plus tax) at the new pool on my actual birthday â€“ and I will say that it was nice in the respect that itâ€™s yours for the entire day, so thereâ€™s no need to hurry to get there before other early risers make the standard mad rush for chairs/casabelles. You could actually enjoy a leisurely breakfast at DUO and then head up to the infinity pool at your own pace. The friendly staff will already be expecting you â€“ and they set you up for the duration in your cabana (a three-sided structure with chaise lounges, a sofa, refrigerator, ceiling fan, and flat screen television/wireless headphones). You do get preferential treatment when they distribute the poolside amenities (and even get a couple of cabana-only treats), but other than that thereâ€™s really no difference between getting a cabana and not getting one. If you like the idea of being able to commandeer the space and spread out, then by all means do it. The spa has been upgraded, expanded and enhanced. I hadnâ€™t pre-booked any treatments prior to arriving, and they were running some specials promoted in the daily resort activity bulletin the turn-down folks leave in your room at night. The day I took advantage of this the offer was for a complimentary 25-minute Wailea water ritual with any standard treatment of 50 minutes or longer. Basically this was a private room with a bathtub, shower and steam room with ambient lighting and spa music playing for you to do your ablutions in prior to receiving other treatments. The room was great â€“ but at $125 I wouldnâ€™t have elected to get this if paying for it; that said, it was a nice prelude to a massage and if you can score this promotion I would recommend it. Spa prices are high here â€“ so take advantage of any break you can get. One of the nicest things about the FS spa is that you can use the amenities at any time (Iâ€™ve been to resorts that charge an exorbitant fee to use the spa if you donâ€™t have a treatment scheduled for that day). Additionally, theyâ€™ll gladly lend you a fresh FS T-shirt at any time to work out in or wear around the resort â€“ great for those days that youâ€™re at the beach and expect sand and water and donâ€™t want to muck up your resort wear. I used the spa to take a shower and steam in every afternoon following the pool or beach â€“ and the tranquil environment hit the spot for winding down the day. The restaurants here are ok (well, the breakfast buffet at DUO is extraordinary, but not cheap at approximately $40 pp. if not on a room package that includes breakfast). We had dinner at Spago that I felt was mediocre at best, and the ocean- and poolside lunch at Ferraroâ€™s is pleasant but nothing to write home about. We ventured mostly to the Shops at Wailea for dinner â€“ itâ€™s just up the hill and has a nice variety of venues from which to choose. If you donâ€™t have a car the resort staff will gladly give you a lift (no charge) in the resort SUV, and theyâ€™ll pick you up if you call them later for a return ride back. My favorite eatery here is the Tommy Bahama Cafe â€“ great selection, excellent quality and nicely priced. I did the guided art tour after calling the concierge to request it. It turned out that I was the only guest doing it that day â€“ but they didnâ€™t cancel on me and still had their guide come on property to give me an hour-long tour of the contemporary Hawaiian art collection. Recommended if you are into art and have the time. A couple of other small changes â€¦ they have gotten rid of the stocked mini bars in favor of empty ones that you can customize via the chit they provide for you to fill out, and in the rooms are nice canvas and leather beach totes that you can cart around with you on the property and then take home with you afterward for a fee. They sell them brand new and wrapped in the spa â€“ but the nice fellow working there told me not to pay full tariff for it at the spa, but rather have housekeeping bring up one that â€œlooks newâ€� and take that instead for a reduced fee. He called housekeeping for me right then and there and I got what I suspect was a never-been-used bag with a tag still on it for $15 less than I would have paid in the spa. Little things like that make the service at FS special. In sum, it was a great trip and a relaxing way to spend my birthday. If you are considering coming here and debating this property against others because of cost â€“ do yourself the favor and spend the extra money to come here. No, itâ€™s not cheap â€“ but nothing in Hawaii is â€“ and it may make the difference between an ok vacation and one that youâ€™ll remember long after you return home. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “World class location, people to make you feel world class speacial!”
Reviews.Author: williammontreal
Reviews.Content: If in Maui, do not miss the opportunity to share an extraordianry experience with your spouse! Our dining experience at Ferraro's was not only gastronomically exquisite, but it was one of our most romantic dinners ever! We are blessed.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in paradise”
Reviews.Author: sallygutierrez
Reviews.Content: Warm gracious staff, beautiful setting. Everytime that we have stayed at the Four Seasons it has been a wonderful experience. Best if you rent a car so that you can enjoy the island.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful; with a price”
Reviews.Author: WASaMATTR
Reviews.Content: Since this was our first trip to Hawaii we wanted a name you can trust and that is what we found with the Four Seasons. My wife and I stayed here for 10 nights for our Honeymoon back in May and it was beautiful. I booked a partial-ocean-view room for 9 nights and had to move to a mountain-view room for the last night (due to booking issues). Overall both rooms were beautiful. Upon check-in we were asked if we wanted to pay for an upgrade (we declined since we didn't think it was worth it) but when we got to our room we had free Champaign and cookies waiting. In any case, the view was very partial ocean view but we weren't going to spend a lot of time in it anyway. We wanted to explore the resort and island. We looked at the restaurants on property and decided to try out Ferraro's. The seating was quick and came with a nice view and the food was good but pricey. We did room service one night for dinner and had a pasta dish. The preparation was nice, but the amount of food was small and again pricey. (We found little eateries in towns like Kihei & Lahaina that were nice and reasonably priced. Like - Cheeseburger In Paradise, Bubba Gump Shrimp Co, Moose McGillycuddy's Pub & Cafe, Fred's Mexican, WOKSTAR, Matteo's Pizzeria, and even Denny's. All reasonably priced and good food.) We also journeyed over to adjacent hotel Grand Wailea for dinner twice - to Bistro Molokini and the little eatery inside the hotel in the Lagoon wing -- but again not the greatest and affordable. In any case the Four Season resort was a great find: The Pros: nice clean room, nice grounds, friendly staff, open lobby, nice restaurants, game room, nice beach, free cabanas. The Cons: We were never told or had free slippers in our room until the last night, we weren't told about the $15 per night valet parking extra cost until the last day (and that wasn't including the tips we gave to the valets daily. On a side note the valet attendants were very helpful we were asked if we needed directions, water, umbrella, towels, etc... they were awesome!), price of the rooms, menu choices, pool area was pretty small and crowded. Would I stay here again; high possibility. It was very romantic and a nice memory for my wife and I for our first trip to Hawaii and our Honeymoon. Note: I was like you, reading reviews to decide if the FS was a place I can trust, it is. The place is beautiful, safe, and clean. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite, Most Wonderful Hotel, love it”
Reviews.Author: vicki3
Reviews.Content: Hats off to the FS Maui!!!! Top shelf staff, service, rooms, ect!!!! We had stayed 2 times now, and many staff know us by name, and on our last trip it was our anniversary and they upgraded our room and we had cookies, champagne sent to the room!! They really go out of the way to think of everything you would need!!! It is hard for us to try new travel destinations now as we have found our oasis!!!! thank you FS maui!

Reviews.Title: “The best of my last 50 stays at any hotel/resort”
Reviews.Author: bphilipnyc
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at numerous other resorts and hotels and what sets this apart from the rest is the service. From check-in, we were warmly welcomed and our reservation was handled quickly while our bags were ushered up to our room. The room itself was very good - marble bath, spacious living area, comfortable bed, clean carpet. The sliding door to the balcony showed some signs of aging, but I'm really reaching for something negative. They also charge for wireless internet, but it's probably a good strategy to discourage use of a laptop at a place with such great activities. The people at the resort always took the time to answer our questions. Definitely a friendly group. The restaurants, though pricey were great - but the poolside and beach service is exceptional. My wife and I loved the activities (sign up for tennis and outrigger canoeing in advance). The snorkeling is good too - but the water can be a bit rough, so go early in the mornings when it's more calm. There are tons of fish and underwater life past the rocks. I used the gym on our last day and I regret not using it every day. The locker room had every amenity you'd really need - shaving needs, deodorant, and even foot spray. My wife claimed that her oceanside massage was the best she's had. General tips for Maui: -If you bring a GPS, make sure that it has maps for Hawaii. This worked out well for us in general. -Mama's Fish House. It has some of the freshest food around and the service is great. -Sushi Paradise is a good local, inexpensive sushi restaurant. We ate there, but I'd recommend taking it back to the resort. There was a wait on a random Tuesday night, so plan accordingly. -If you rent a convertible, I'd opt for the Mustang over the Sebring. The former has greater trunk space and a more fun ride. -Pick up an underwater camera/case before you arrive. -Snorkel Bob's is not worth it. You can get the gear from the hotel. -We went ziplining near the crater. It was ok having never done it before, but I wouldn't spend time doing it again if I had access to a resort like the Four Seasons. As a consultant, I've spent a considerable amount of time in hotels. This one takes the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Libby25
Reviews.Content: We spent our honeymoon in Hawaii and the Four Seasons Maui was our last stop. We wished we would never have to leave! It is paradise on earth. We stayed on the club floor, which was worth every penny. Amazing service and great snacks and drinks. We spent most days at the adult only pool and loved it. Go early though because the chairs are taken quickly! Although we very much enjoyed the restaurants close by, Mamaâ€™s Fish House was well worth the drive. We have had some amazing vacations (including at other Four Seasons resorts) but this stay topped it all. We will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: blak77
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip with a great rate that I found on Costco travel. The service is impeccable. We were upgraded to an ocean view suite upon arrival (all suite hotel). I recommend joining the President's Club. There is no cost involved but the perks are definitely worth it for the stay. We mainly chose this resort because of the "adults only" pool. We will definitely give The Fairmont strong consideration when returning to Maui

Reviews.Title: “great hotel but............”
Reviews.Author: boston02215
Reviews.Content: Great hotel............. but buyer beware!!! DO NOT USE EXPEDIA TO BOOK THIS HOTEL! they did not honor their promoted package that we booked. Their practices are false and deceptive.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise on Earth”
Reviews.Author: Nijamik
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the resort two years in a row - for our first and second wedding anniversaries....and we're already booked for a third. Once you've stayed at the Four Season Maui, you will be spoiled forever because nothing else on earth compares! Wailea is naturally beautiful and lush, a true tropical paradise but it's the resort that really makes you feel pampered and totally indulged. The natural surroundings are magical and the actual hotel and property are magical - very romantic. I cannot rave about Hawaii and the FS Maui enough. They've renovated in the last few years and everything looks updated. Here's a quick run down of the major features: Service - The rooms were impeccably clean and all staff are friendly and very accommodating. Everyone loves a good tip, but this is true in all resorts. We relied heavily on the concierge to coordinate activities and make reservations, etc, etc....the concierge is knowledgeable and very helpful. Facilities - The gym is small but there is a variety of equipment. Regular group classes (loved the spinning and yoga). Massages are pricey but I had such a wonderful deep tissue massage with Aubrey when I was last there that I had to book a second longer session before leaving. Restos - LOVED, LOVED, LOVED Spago. Order anything off the menu, you can't go wrong. My hubby loves calamari - the chef prepared something especially for him after he asked the server whether he could get a simple pan fried calamari dish. Duo has great steaks. We did try the Italian restaurant once for dinner but didn't like it so much - great for lunch. I highly recommend the Oka Noi smoothie if you like smoothies. I had one everyday while sunning by the pool. The Duo buffet breakfast is good if you don't want to go off the resort. Not great value, though, if you are not a big eater. However, there is a shopping plaza about a 15 min walk away where you can get an amazing greasy spoon kind of breakfast at Longhi's. (BTW, this plaza has every kind of shop you could want from designer store to hair salon.) You must eat at Mama's Fish House (about 15-20 mins past airport)....the food is unbelievable. It's not fancy but the food is so hearty. Pool - The resort is family friendly so expect kids to be running around. I understand that there is a new adult only pool. However, we were never bothered by the noise level - it just feels like you're surrounded by activity. Getting a chair or even cabana was never an issue for us in February. The cabanas are nice for privacy, but I prefer being in the sun to being in the shade. Excursions - The drive to/from Hana is long and winding. Your passenger should take a Gravol. It feels like you're driving through a rainforest. Whale watching was awesome because we had two whales swim under our boat and we got to see them up close. If not for the whales, not sure if it would've been as fun. In general, we spent most of our time in and around Wailea. We went on just a couple of excursions. It's very easy to spend the majority of your time on the resort simply relaxing. However, we would recommend renting a car. It's nice to have that freedom because only the shopping plaza is close by. Kihei is a great spot for finding an evening meal. Sansei has decent sushi and there's an Italian restaurant in the same plaza that is very good value. There's so much more one could say about FS Maui but the most important emphasis belongs on the feelings that will be inspired once you take it all in. The resort is truly magical and super romantic. We left wanting more each time after staying 10 days. The second trip was even better than the first and we can't wait for our third! If you're hesitating, don't - the surrounding resorts don't have the same ambiance. FS Maui truly stands out.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding in Paradise!!!”
Reviews.Author: josie015
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were married at the Four Seasons. We had our ceremony at sunset on the beach in front of the hotel. It was a dream come true.! The wedding department, and especially Carin, takes very good care of you. We had flowers waiting in our room when we arrived. They remembered it was my birthday, while I was there - and they set out a special treat for me. It was awesome - everything was elegant, but never ostentatious or snooty. For once in your life, splurge and stay at this hotel It was worth it, especially if you have a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel - Bit Pricey, but worth every penny.”
Reviews.Author: linuxtech09
Reviews.Content: Went to the Four Seasons with 4 friends for the Halloween weekend. From the moment you step into the FS Maui Wailea you're immediately greeted by friendly enthusiastic staff who truly make you feel like royalty. I sent myself a package 2 days ahead, and it was waiting for me in my room, I've never had such great service. Also a beautiful little basket of freshly baked pastries was waiting in the room. The entire hotel / especially lobby area is an open area, giving you amazing views of their pool and the ocean, yet it also has an amazing fragrance to it. I've never had to wait more than 10 seconds or so for lobby staff, and the concierge was very friendly in getting me a taxi. The new serenity adult pool is great as well, offering private cabanas (really more like rooms) daily for rent. They include very personalized pool side service, and as many amenities as you can imagine (cold eucalyptus towels & cucumbers for the eyes), as well as some amazing views of the ocean with an infinity edge pool. Returned to Ferraros one night for dinner, but wasn't quite as amazed as I was with DUO where a great steak can always be found (third time back to DUO) - Room service was great, but if you're going to get food service past 12AM, don't except the brulee to be quite as on par as it was during the day. Stick to a burger if you're ordering at 2AM. This hotel is more than anyone could ask for, and even offers L'Occitane products (and a whole lot of them) in the bathrooms. As for the bathrooms? Great (almost jet powered) showers, and a very spacious 100% marble bathroom with a tub that does not disappoint. If this hotel is within your price range (or even on the high end) , make the right choice and choose the FS at Wailea, it will not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: yellow1NewJersey
Reviews.Content: We were staying at the Marriott close by with a group and were having our meals at the Four Seasons. On our last night we decided to splurge and stay there. Our expectations were well below what we experienced. The resort is wedged into the Wailea resort area. However, once on the property it feels spacious, special and private. The service is outstanding. The rooms fabulous, quiet, clean spacious and luxurious. The restaurants (3) serve unbelieveably good food at an appropriate price point. Had not thought of going back to Maui until our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Service in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: bunnygirl97
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an ahh-mazzing holiday in Maui with family. We stayed at the Four Seasons for my mothers birthday. From the moment when we arrived at the hotel and were greeted with lai's, tea and a warm welcome to when we bidded farewell upon our leave with a beautiful sunset, hula dancer and fabulous dinner, everything about this hotel is perfect. The grounds are immacculate, the adult serenity pool offers break taking views, the hotel is not too crowded (a great balance of staff to guests) and the staff are willing to cater to every single need (including going to another restaurant on premise from the restaurant you are at to get you what you need). All tour groups they reco'd were also first class - loved Bike It Maui (sunrise bike execursion down Halleakula) and Hula Girl (sunset catamaran sail). I don't think I can ever stay at another hotel brand for any future vacation. Four Seasons is simply unrivaled.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: sfrun
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel is outstanding. No request is too big or small. I was greeted at the door with a cold towel and water after finishing a run. People walk around with pineapple chunks, cold towels, muffins, otter pops (!), etc. while you are lying by the pool or on the beach. Rooms are tastefully decorated. The bathrooms are huge. We were only going to stay a few nights and then go to another hotel, but ended up returning.

Reviews.Title: “The Ultimate Resort”
Reviews.Author: phxtravelguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the concierge floor - less than 20 rooms up there. Private club room with truly outstanding service. Amazing resort... great beach - but very, very expensive. Wish the pool was heated - but otherwise - incredible. We have stayed there 4 or 5 times now and it's always great - actually got upgraded to a huge 1 bedroom last time. They always know our names and we feel like kings here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach & Golf!”
Reviews.Author: IrixGuy
Reviews.Content: Although Kapalua features fantastic golf, Wailiea is impossible to beat. The views from Wailiea Old Blue are stunning. My favorite was the hole where Molokini was visible in the backdrop. The beds at the Four Seasons are luxurious. I've tried to find their mattress online but they don't sell their hotel beds. Breakfast in the hotel was fantastic. I fell in love with the fresh omelet. The pool was great but both it and the beach were very crowded. This is a beautiful but not private-feeling resort. The Grand Wailea (Waldorf Astoria) hotel is right next door. It has an amazing pool with waterslides and such. The downside of this is that it attracts families and children. It can feel a little crowded at times but is still wonderful. For the amount of cash required here, I'd recommend the Four Seasons on Lanai for a more private and romantic experience.

Reviews.Title: “definitely worth splashing out on!”
Reviews.Author: jc11235
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were given fresh flower leis and drinks, and quickly taken to our rooms. After reading such mixed reviews here, I was a little apprehensive, but I would find it very difficult to criticise anything here. We stayed in the most basic mountainside room and it was just that â€“ a nice view of the mountain in the distance, and the (covered) car park in the foreground, as explained on the website. The car park was well covered, and the noise from it was minimal when we were on the balcony, once the balcony doors were closed you didnâ€™t notice it at all. The room itself was of a very good size, very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was spacious, with the nice finishings one expects in a top end hotel. Toiletries were high quality, and replaced every day â€“ they even included after sun cream. When we arrived, they had left gifts for the children in their room â€“ stuffed toys, and their names spelled out in sponges in the bathroom and an underwater camera and frame for my teenager. They also left candies and cookies for the adults! Breakfast in the restaurant was the best we had in Maui â€“ lots of choice â€“ all beautifully presented. Although not cheap, it was a similar price to other Maui hotels, and the best we had there. The first day we arrived we must have gone down to the pool at 2pm and I was very surprised that the pool attendant found us a cabana right by the pool. Perhaps we were lucky because I did see others arrive on other days, who were disappointed when nothing was immediately available. We generally went and reserved our cabana just before breakfast and they would set it all up for us. The pool staff arrived at 7am each morning, and you reserve your cabana with them â€“ they will keep it if you are going for lunch, but said they would reassign it if you left for more than an hour. I did notice one day when I was down at 6.30 that all the cabanas overlooking the ocean had already gone, if you are happy to be by the pool it was still possible to get one at 8 or 9am. The pools themselves were lovely â€“ not the Grand Wailea, but then no where near as crowded. The new infinity pool is spectacular â€“ the photos I have seen really do not do it justice. Much to my childrenâ€™s disappointment they are very strict about not letting children in any of the infinity pool area - definitely very peaceful and relaxing there! Plenty of sun beds, but also some luxurious cabanas with HD TVs etc . (extra fee, $300 I think). There was sunscreen for those who had forgotten theirs and little snacks and water brought round to your cabana during the day, at no extra charge. It was also possible to get a massage by the pool (paid extra). We spent most of our time at the general pool, and although we stayed during the peak season I was never unduly crowded, and although many children they were generally well behaved. We tried the outrigger canoe, from the beach, included in the price, it was fun, and we saw some turtles. We ate at both Ferraros and Spagos â€“ and were very impressed. Food was delicious, service excellent, view spectacular. We booked 24-48 hours in advance, both full every time we went, so I imagine you do need to book in advance. They were also very flexible with the childrenâ€™s food, varying items on the menu to make them more child friendly. Both are excellent places from which to watch the sunset â€“ and as the sun sets there is a rush to take photos! We didnâ€™t have a car whilst we were staying there, but were very impressed with the staff at the front of the hotel. All very welcoming and professional. When we said we were going to the Shops at Wailea, they drove us done there, and told us to call when we wanted to come back. Whenever we left the front entrance we were offered bottles of water. Although our rooms were the most basic in the hotel, they were the most comfortable we stayed in whilst in Maui, and although the view was disappointing, it was what I had expected. The staff were generally excellent, in a very unobtrusive way â€“ all in all making a very relaxing stay. Would we return? - We are already trying to plan a return trip! As others have said, it is nice not to be nickeled and dimed here at the Four Seasons, and it is their attention to detail which really sets them apart from the other hotels we stayed at in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: Treepalm
Reviews.Content: We had read all the glowing reviews and were still blown away. This was our first time staying at a Four Seasons and I think the bar has now been set fairly high. We spent 5 nights there with our two kids and we all felt just so at home. I thought the hotel was going to be all about the service but the decor, ambiance and setting were just magnificent as well. The details throughout are outstanding. Service like we have never experienced before. Beautiful beach with fantastic views, great pools, fun game room, spacious rooms, I could go on and on. Even if you stay in the least expensive room you still feel like royality. Although not cheap, they do not nickel and dime you. For example, there is no charge for any of the cabanas around the main pool (this is something that the Grand Hyatt on Kauai charged $100 per day to use). Some tips: - For those who enjoy snorkeling (and there is some very good snorkeling along rocks to the south if not too wavey and visability is ok) bring or rent your own gear as even though the hotel provides for free they only lend it out if the seas are perfectly calm which is not all too often. - Although they do have many loungers throughout, this is a hotel where many people are up early (working out, time change) and hence take the best spots. By 7 AM many spots were already reserved. - Expect to potentially do a fair amount of walking from the main lobby to your room and then from your room to the pool. The layout seems to be short an elevator or two but no major deal. Four Seasons Maui - Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: captainjg
Reviews.Content: We went to Hawaii for our first time and was recommended by many to stay at Four Seasons Hotel. By Far one of the best hotels with great service and amenities! They added an infinity adult pool recently which has great views with a swimup bar and underwater music if you submerge your head. It gets crowded later in the day so arrive early and reserve a chair. I had a 30 minute massage next to the pool which was relieving after playing golf at next door Wailea Golf Course. They also bring you fresh scented cool towels during the day as well as little treats and cold ice water. The Duo restaurant served a great breakfast buffet which could last you until dinner! We also ate at the restaurant and the manager Barry was a great host. it was my wife's birthday and had a great meal with delicious appetizers and fresh fish and steak for the main course followed by an array of desserts with a special designed dessert for my wife. truly a memorable dinner experience which we thank Barry! There is so much more but most are already said in previous comments.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Abagail
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing getaway at the Four Seasons Maui! We had never stayed at a Four Seasons before. I had done a lot of research on where to stay and it seemed like a great place so we decided to splurge and stay there. We booked adjoining rooms since we were traveling with our children ages 10 and 14. The rooms were extremely spacious and comfortable. The bathrooms were huge! The beach was private, beautiful and a great place for the kids to swim and boogie board. We rented a kayak for a couple hours too and that was fun. Wailea beach is second to none! I would go back in a heartbeat. The service was impeccable and non-intrusive just like many other people had commented on. We had the Easter buffet and it was crazy expensive! That was probably my only negative...$85/person. The food was great of course but still crazy. When they took our drink order, I ordered a mimosa and was told it would be an extra $10 for that...what? At that point though, what's another $10...lol! All in all, it was fantastic and we loved every minute of our stay there. We did the Big Island after that and felt like we should've stayed in Maui. If you can afford it, do it! You won't regret it. I can't wait to stay at a Four Seasons again. I almost forgot....one of our favorite things was the paved path that ran along the beach side for miles. We would grab a coffee in the morning and go for a long walk. Paradise and an amazing view!

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon spot to unwind after a hectic wedding!”
Reviews.Author: sonz14
Reviews.Content: The service by the poolside and at the beach was out of this world. Love that sunblock and magazines were provided, they came around with samples of tropical drinks & cold hand towels! The hotel wasn't dead quite but we enjoyed that there were other people around and that the evenings felt festive without having to leave the hotel. It's a family friendly hotel. The restaurants all had great views of the ocean and a perfect sunset every night. Only drawback was price and that we had to pay $20 a night to have our rental car parked!

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected...”
Reviews.Author: still_call_aust_home
Reviews.Content: I was very wary heading to this resort. While all the reviews on Trip Advisor were extremely positive, the size of the resort and the potential for the pool/beach area to have a million screaming children around worried me. Especially after I had spent the previous week at the Secret Beach Hideaway in Kauai. I shouldnt have worried. The resort was very good. Rooms were very large and very comfortable. I am with others, I dont think its worth paying the big bucks for the Ocean View rooms (as they are generally still a decent distance from the beach. The garden view is perfect compromise. Gym is a decent sized and there werent queues for the equipment. Tennis Pro was excellent and great for those looking to perfect those groundstrokes after a long day by the pool. Food offering is great and diverse. Ate at Spago and Ferraros. Yeah they arent cheap, but you are on an island in the middle of the Pacific. Service by the pool is amazing. Didnt have to wait very long for someone to come and fill my water cup and ask if i need anything. The negatives? The pool was pretty crowded and noisy at times (but we just went down to the beach which wasnt as busy). There are more than a few kids about...so if you are looking for that really quiet getaway...well this isnt for you. But the key is...if I was going to Maui again, I would stay here in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing - Top Notch Service”
Reviews.Author: cruisernut
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons after a stay at Fairmont Kea Lani and while there was nothing wrong with the Fairmont, the different in service levels was quite obvious. As the saying, it's the small things that count. I have never seen such a friendly a accommodating staff at a resort - there was not a single staff person who failed to greet or smile at you as you walked around. The staff who set up the beach cabanas, change towels, bring you your drinks etc. were super friendly and it was great having little treats every hour. The new serenity pool was great - we got a kick out of the underwater music! As expected, the resort was immaculate and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. We had an excellent and relaxing time at this resort and I would have no hesitation about returning.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay- will be back!”
Reviews.Author: nickied
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at the four seaons. What a great time. great deal. We checked in seamlessly. upgraded to ocean view room (really a partial view). champagne welcome. The entry area is beautiful and well designed. Leis upon arrival. Juice and coffee out for free. Business center at the entry area with 5 computers and lots of printers. The room was spacious and very clean. Typical four seasons bathroom with a huge soaking tube, glass shower. double sinks. marble everywhere. The L'Occtaine bottles were huge- they replenish twice a day, so hide them and they leave more- so great. Had piped in music of your choice- we listened to Hawaiian music almost exclusively. Robes in room nice. Wet bar area with clear refrigerator- you can bring your own, or you can order packages for the mini bar. The bed was nice and sheets so nice. The TV large, AC and fan nice (especially after staying in Hana and No AC!). The living area was adequate. Had plantation shutters, so some light came in in the morning. The balcony was very nice- kind of an angle view of the ocean, but still nice. Could not hear the ocean. heard neighbors only once... They turn down the rooms with foot slippers, bed turned down and music playing. The restaurants were less impressive at the hotel- ate at Duo- was pretty much just like Ruths Chris, but not as good. The breakfast brunch was very good, but expensive. Made to order omlettes and waffles. At 6pm they had a guy go around blowing a shell and lighting all of the torches- very nice. Sunsets were gorgeous. the itialian restaurant has a better ocean and sunset view. The beach was wonderful. They will put out chairs and umbrellas for you. there was almost no one at the hotel when we were there and had absolutely no trouble getting chairs at the beach or pool. they come around with water and fruit and juice throughout the day. They have free snorkels and snorkeling along the rocks on the left have some great fish and we saw 5 sea turtles! They also have paddle boards and you can go on an outrigger canoe as well. There is a 2 mile paved walkway along the edge of the beach from one end of the resort row to the other- ran it twice and it was absolutley beautiful and neat to see the back of the other resorts. Run in the morning- already hot and humid. The pool was undergoing renovations from 2-5pm- did not use at all. The relaxation pool for adults only looked very peaceful and nice with great views. We couldn't find a pool or jacuzzi to use after 6pm- they appeared to close... Tube in the room worked fine. The shops were reasonable. Had a wonderful pedi/mani. Did not use the spa. There is an activity room with pool tables, Wii and PS2/3 and guitair hero avaialble with a large TV for sports. There are outdoor exercise equipment and a private room for training. We spent a lot of time away from the resort too- ate at the Waterfront- very good. Ate at the Pineapple grill- very nice, but long drive. Went on a triology trip to Lanai- the best snorkeling ever. It was a drive to each place, and going 40 pmh is hard to get used to even after a week. Also went surfing at Lihue (rented a board and brought our own rash guard- beginners) and did lots of shopping there. Also more upscale shopping at the grand wailea- did not go there Definately would come back in a heart beat and would stay only at the four seasons- it was the best by far!

Reviews.Title: “Stupendous!”
Reviews.Author: KiraMexico
Reviews.Content: We went to celebrate our 25th wedding Anniversary and decided to split the 6 days at 2 resorts. One was Starwood Sheraton and the other Four Seasons. I can only say that I would rather have gone for ONLY the 3 nights at Four Seasons and bagged the Sheraton! Since we were celebrating we had a bottle of champagne on ice upon our arrival with a very nice card. Everything is first class, the location, the rooms (large), ambiance, service, restaurants (Wolfgang Puck's Spago has fantastic food), morning yoga, HUGE breakfast, top of the line gym, the renowned SPA. The pool area is class by itself. Friendliest staff await you with arms full of towels to layout your seating of choice. Jars of sun screen around the pool for your use, on the house. They spoil you rotten by bringing little treats every couple of hours, i.e., cold towels and cucumber slices for your eyes, chilled water refilled every time you take two sips, ice lollies, Rice Krispies treats. If all that was not enough you can have a mini SPA treatments of your choice right there (this one you have to pay for). No nickel and diming here. One night we went to dinner at another hotel about a mile away and the Concierge very sweetly told us to let the valet know and he would be happy to take us there in the hotel car and when done he would return to pick us up! I call that service. Since all rooms are exactly the same I would recommend one not pay for the partial ocean view rooms - splurge on the SPA instead. Stupendous! Since life is not supposed to be perfect............. Our negative was a dinner at Ferraro (the Italian Restaurant) which has a fabulous location by the water. The food was TERRIBLE. How can you ruin a pasta and a pizza? Next day I mentioned our experience to the Concierge, which she apparently took very seriously, and within an hour the Manager from the Restaurant called and apologized and comped the dinner! A CLASS ACT

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in the world..simple as that.”
Reviews.Author: shay23
Reviews.Content: We stayed for nine nights in the FS on our honeymoon. We where upgraded on arrival. The sevice, the staff, the location, the rooms, the sunset, the infinity pool, duo, ferraros, the outrigger canoe, the yoga, the gym, the weather, the poolside treats, the free car to and from anywhere in wailea, the spa, everything is brilliant, incredible, superb, class. This is where all hotel managers should be sent to show them how to run a hotel, what it actually takes to have people write reviews like this. Thankyou four seasons for making our honeymoon one to remember forever. I gaurantee that when you are checking out, with all the extras that you get complimentary, the price is incredible. Thank you, Thank you, Thank you..............

Reviews.Title: “The Four Seasons on Maui has the best and friendliest staff!”
Reviews.Author: MattAndIsaacsDad
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we've ever stayed at the Four Seasons in Maui. Positives: + Staff is super-friendly, from the welcome lei greeting to our departure. Their staff just looks happy to be there and ready to help, unlike some other hotels where the staff seems always stressed out and too busy. The 4S staff always seems to greet you first so that you don't have to look for them. When you have twin toddlers like we do, this is especially helpful. I remember getting out to the beach area with one toddler in one hand and a heavy beach bag in the other, and my wife was in the same predicament. What a relief to have two of the staff welcome us and ask us if they could help set up chairs for us on the beach! Same wonderful experience at the kiddie pool area! + Our children (2 1/2 year old twins at the time) were treated very well. The hotel staff went over the top to make sure they were comfortable. They provided us with fruit platters every day in our room (at no charge) instead of their regular snacks, because our boys have food allergies and can't have wheat. They provided us with a microwave. They had robes just for them and they both rec'd stuffed animals along with other toys. When we had drinks in the lobby lounge, they made sure the boys had crayons and paper. I can't remember all the things they did for our kids, but I do especially remember the staff spelling out our twin sons' names in sponge letters over the tub. + As it should be, most activities and other amenities at the hotel are included in the cost of your stay. I took a yoga class by the beach. It's nice to do yoga in the morning on the sand with the fresh air and waves just a few feet away. Their gym equipment is top notch. (The treadmills overlook the patio or you can watch TV. It's nice to look at something when you're running on a treadmill. The weight room is separate and tucked behind, but it has an adequate mix of free weights and machines).. The pool cabanas and beach lounge chairs are complimentary too! + Beach and pool areas are beautiful and well-maintained! Views of the ocean from the kiddie pool area is still amazing. + All the small details. Complimentary sliced pineapple and other fruit were passed out along with water throughout the day at the pool and beach areas. Our room always seemed to have been cleaned, even if we were only away for an hour or so. The staff always addressed our sons, in addition to us. The valets always asked us if we needed any directions or any additional items for our day trips. Negatives: - $$$$ (but it's worth it). - When you stay at other hotels after staying at the Four Seasons in Maui, you realize how incredible the Four Seasons Maui is and you can't go back to regular Maui hotels. This happened during our most recent trip to Maui (Sept 2009). We stayed at a very reputable, decent 4 star hotel in Kaanapali. But that's just it. It's a decent 4 star hotel. It's not the Four Seasons. Try the Four Seasons in Maui sometime. You'll notice the difference. We're already trying to plan a trip back to the Four Seasons (Maui) in Spring or Fall 2010. -------------------------- Btw, during our most recent trip to Maui (Sept 2009), we did dine at the Four Seasons twice with some friends who were staying there. The tab is pricey, but the experience is well worth it and views are just amazing from their restaurants! Our friends had a 2 year old and a 1 year old. We had twin 3 year olds. The staff was incredibly accommodating and VERY ATTENTIVE to our children, especially ours with the food allergies. They checked back regularly to make sure that the children were doing okay with the specially prepared food. Also, they didn't make us feel uncomfortable when our children made spills, as most children will do. Some restaurants fail miserably in accommodating small children, especially those with food allergies, but not the Four Seasons Maui. The staff at Duo and Ferraro's are amazing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall, best hotel in Maui”
Reviews.Author: 7travelnyc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and loved every minute of it. The service is fantastic, our room was luxurious and the food was delish. The location is also excellent, we had perfect weather since we weren't on the rainy side of the island. The hotel's pool and beach area aren't too crowded. Nice touches, waiters came around with cold water, pineapple slices and cool towels. We pretty much ate lunch by the pool every day. The portions are large and the prices very reasonable. We had a couple of spa services which were totally worth the extra $$. All in all, this hotel cannot be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort and location, but AVOID paying up for partial ocean view executive suites”
Reviews.Author: das60657
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed 9 days recently at the Four Seasons Maui and generally had a great time. The restaurants were good, if not pricey. The new Serenity (adult only) pool was fantastic. Spa services were very good. Our only issue was the room. Given the length of our stay, we wanted to pay a little more for a slightly larger room. We ended up deciding on a partial ocean view executive suite so we'd have two separate spaces. Big mistake. These rooms are located at the back of the hotel overlooking a parking lot and the delivery entrance for the hotel. Yes, there was a sliver of ocean you could see, but you couldn't spend any time on the balcony to enjoy it with the number of deliveries. There was constant truck noise, including that annoying beeping sound when trucks back up. So as far as I can tell, they took regular rooms, where people would complain about being over the delivery entrance, and combined them to make a small suite and charge twice the normal rate. Anyway, very disappointing. We ended up spending even more money to reserve cabanas at the serenity pool to get away from the room. We'd have been better off reserving one of these cabanas each day of our stay and reserving a regular room with a better view for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful...but not "wowed"”
Reviews.Author: micdeb78
Reviews.Content: We decided to splurge for a few days on our 12 day trip to Maui. We stayed the first 5 days in a beautiful luxury VRBO in the Maui upcountry where we had a wonderful stay. However we were extremely excited about staying at the FS for 3 days! The review titled "A Crowded Splurge" below really captures our sentiments about the resort. Don't get us wrong it is a very trendy beautiful resort with wonderful amenities, we were just not wowed! The decor was well kept, although did not reflect the rich Hawaiian culture that is so embedded throughout the island. The resort pools are beautiful, there are three of them and the beach area of course is beautiful. The new Serenity Pool is spectacular....although very crowded. The service at all the pools is spectacular and probably is the best thing about the resort. The luxury cabana's at the Serenity pool are premium price, unlike the complimentary ones by the general pools and beach terace area. In order to have a claim chairs by the Infinity you have to get up at 6am to rush down to the pool/beach and get your reservation in. We had read good reviews about the food in the Lobby Bar and was disappointed that our experience did not reflect the same. It was probably the worst food we had on our trip. We ate at Duo's another night and the food and service was very average. There was an extraordinary amount of children at the resort and they were not well behaved...they ran the halls and played hide and seek in the bar/lobby areas. I understand they have a wonderful children's program and I love children dearly, but when the purpose of the trip is a romantic getaway....it was a premium price for the opportunity to be forced to "enjoy" other's children. There are many fabulous accomodations on the Island of Maui, and although we had a nice time....we will not likely stay at the FS next year. After leaving the FS we stayed our final four nights at the other luxury hotel in Kapalua and except for the pool service enjoyed our stay and would have to say we would select that hotel over the FS.

Reviews.Title: “A luxury resort that pampers you.”
Reviews.Author: edeenl
Reviews.Content: We stayed on this concierge level of the hotel. With it, of course you pay a lot more, but you get a great place to hang out when ever you like with great food all day and an attentive and friendly staff that can make awesome drinks! Try a Laheina lemonade. I liked our spacious room, but it was nothing special. Elegant and modern, I could have been anywhere. I loved the spa with special native to Hawaii treatments. The pool is lovely and all the restaurants are good. Spago's is where I had Thanksgiving dinner. The staff is always looking for ways to make you feel more comforable. They come around offering waters and icy pops by the pool. The bring you sunscreen and the rooms have L'occitane tolietries. A nice place to relax!

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons sets the standard”
Reviews.Author: c00ldad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons Maui at Wailea as part of the second of three islands (the first being Oahu and the last being Kauai). This hotel selection was the one I did the most research on and TripAdvisor really helped me. In the end, it came down to service and the Four Seasons really delivered. My wife and I celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary so I really wanted this trip and each hotel to be special. The Four Seasons attention to detail was fantastic. Everyone seemed to know about our anniversary. We received so much wine and champagne we knew we couldn't drink it all and began to worry about airline weight issues! A good problem to have. First, we were double upgraded to a Deluxe Ocean View. The room size was very nice and the bathroom huge. The hotel itself is shaped as a "U" so the view out the lanai consists of an ocean view as well as a view of the pool and gardens. Very nice. When we arrived we were welcomed to a lei greeting and personal escort to our room. Once again, the luggage arrived before we did (always a nice touch). I had planned to take this vacation/anniversary during the first week in September to cut down on the crowds. It did. While we weren't alone we didn't have to contend with any crush in terms of getting dinner reservations or pool lounges. As I mentioned we were escorted to our room which was typically Four Seasons spacious. The bathroom was fantastic. L'Occitane products everywhere. Shower was wonderful. We had activities planned for most of the 5 days we were on Maui and the concierge and staff could not have been better. They helped with my initial planning before I left home and then stayed engaged throughout the process even though I had made the activity reservations myself. We had a sunrise/bike tour set for 3am and the staff still made sure we had water, blankets and coffee even at that ungodly hour. All amenities are included when you stay at the Four Seasons (no separate resort fee) so the cabanas we used didn't cost us anything. Unlike another reviewer, I didn't see anything approaching any issues as to pool space. We went to the pool early, mid and even late afternoons and were pretty much able to get anything we wanted pool side. The pool staff is fantastic.
