They escort you to the pool chairs you'd like and slip on a nice pool chair cover in addition to towels, water, etc. I had read horror stories about other nearby Wailea hotels that made you get up at 6am just to get a pool chair (forget about location). I am happy to report that was not the case at the Four Seasons. Once again, the service was/is fantastic. Very easy to get spoiled. The pool staff was very attentive to our needs. We never had a problem getting food or drink. The free food they dispense was also very welcome on the warm/hot days we had. We stayed by the main pool and didn't see a need to visit the "adults only" pool. There just weren't that many kids during our stay. They also have a family and adults-only hot tub, which we did use, on opposite sides of the pool. Everything is very easy in this hotel. Just adds to your relaxation when you don't need to worry or get upset over anything. Our breakfasts were equally fantastic at Duos. What a buffet! As our breakfasts were comped I can't speak to the price/value. Personally I just don't eat enough to justify the charges most hotels make for their breakfast buffets. I can say there was huge food selection and we always got a wonderful table and received great service. I'll review Duos and Ferraro's were we ate dinner separately. However, both restaurants were great. Pricey but great. I used the valet service to park the car and the service again was fantastic. I had rented a Jeep for the "Road to Hana" trip and the valet staff made sure we had plenty of water and also helped me with the windows and roof of the car in terms of opening it up as a convertible or closing it up. The hotel itself is quite lovely. Very spacious. The gardens were very nice. I was able to make an appointment for a massage at the Spa in short order at the time I wanted. The Spa area itself is quite nice and very similar to other spas I've frequented. The massage I received was very relaxing and my only regret was that I didn't have more than one! As I've mentioned, the Four Seasons has a lot of very nice amenities one of which is a complementary scuba lesson. The lesson was great. The introduction is in the pool area and consisted of a free private lesson. The lesson went so well I took my first ocean dive! Just a fantastic experience. I would recommend this hotel without any qualifications. I really debated between a few of the other Wailea hotels but in the end you just can't beat the service. Kudos to the reviewers at TripAdvisor who were right on with this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The "pursuit of perfection" has been reached”
Reviews.Author: journ3eb
Reviews.Content: I travel often, and my boyfriend and I try to make 5-star hotels work as often as we can. This resort tops our list of all resorts & hotels we've been to together, period. Here are the areas where I'd rate it the highest possible score: 1. Quality of service: Every single person we encountered gave us the highest level of attention and service. I never had an empty drink, whether at one of the excellent restaurants or at the pool. Every staff member we came into contact with asked often if there was anything else they could do for us. There were many surprises along the way (a crumb cake delivered to our room 20 minutes after check-in, fresh ice delivered without request every single day during cocktail hour, a huge dessert plate delivered on our check-out day, a hand written thank you note from the restaurants the day after dining...). We also had a spa treatment and were greeted by enthusiastic, super-friendly masseuses. 2. Cleanliness and beauty of the property Inside and out, the perfection of the grounds is common at most Four Seasons (or all of them), but in this case, the natural beauty of the Hawaiian west coast, its sunsets and palm trees and over-the-top amazing climate are all accentuated by the perfectly manicured landscaping, impeccably clean rooms and general areas. Large, open spaces. Everything in the design of the place was well-thought-out and has a purpose. The interior layout of the lobby spaces is all open to the coast so that you can see the ocean from almost every area. 3. Excellence in cuisine and menus They have the classic Wolfgang Puck restaurant, Spago, on the grounds - a sister to the LA hot-spot. The food here was so good, we had to go back a second time (which is something we rarely do when in a new place). Try the tomato soup. It's amazing! We also dined at Ferraro's, an Italian spot that's all out-doors just over the ocean with an excellent view of the sunset from every table. The penne arrabiata and excellent wine list both stand out here. We had room service often, and it was excellent. They consistently aimed to give us the best table possible just because we asked for it. We often had 2 - 3 different servers or runners coming to our table often. The pool menu is pretty extensive on both meals and tropical drinks, and the service there was consistently great as well. The beach was very private since it was at the end of the beach before a lot of rocks, which kept people from other resorts from causing too much foot traffic as you enjoy the view. We could hear a fair amount of commotion down at the Grand Wailea due to its large percentage of families/kids, whereas the Four Seasons was much more of a couples resort by nature. Quiet, serene and professional. Above and beyond everything, you will notice at the Four Seasons the beauty and grandness of the property and the way it calls your eyes to the view of the other side of Maui across the water, the waves, the clouds, the neighboring island Lana'i, the sun....everything that is beautiful about Maui. We did a lot off the property to experience the island, but we often felt we could have spent 24 hours a day at the resort and still felt like we really had a relaxing vacation and truly experienced Maui. We will definitely be back to this property, and soon!

Reviews.Title: “A Crowded Splurge”
Reviews.Author: Explrjunkie
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I decided to pamper ourselves the last two days of our honeymoon by staying at the Four Seasons. While it was a perfectly nice resort and had the typical amenities you'd expect at a Four Seasons (personal attention at check-in, turn-down service, comfortable amenities), we weren't particulary impressed in comparison to the more culturally authentic, cozier, and less expensive options we had chosen throughout the rest of our wedding/honeymoon. Reasons we'd be reticent to return: The 3 pools and beach location are lovely, but extremely crowded, even the "adults only" serenity pool. One shouldn't have to get up at 6am to rush down to the pool/beach and stake a claim on chairs. There really should be at least one more pool (I know the serenity pool was just added, but they need another one). The spa is too small for a resort of this magnitude. Walking into the changing rooms is like an airport at rush hour, which defeats the whole point of "relaxation". Too many ladies jostling for space to preen. And the steam room is alarming loud and the constant entrance/exit of people empties the steam and hampers the effect. Maui has such a rich and unique cultural heritage and unfortunately the Four Seasons doesn't do much to capitalize on this asset. While there are some great art pieces scattered among the premises, the rest of the resort looks like every other Four Seasons: same white sheets, same marble bathrooms, same robes (though they at least have Yukata, probably to appease their Japanese clientele). Make sure to keep your window curtains open at all times to remember where you are. We stayed on the Club Floor and while it was nice to talk with the staff during snack times, we didn't see any other benefit of being up there. The view would have been nice anywhere on the property (it's Wailea, the whole area is gorgeous) and being on the Club Floor didn't give you any sort of advanced access to the restaurants or other amenities on the property. Would not recommend the Club Floor and the cost associated with it. There are many great hotels on Maui, especially if you are fortunate enough to afford a more upscale getaway. The Four Seasons Resort at Wailea is certainly a nice place, but I think we'll choose something different when we return for our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise and Beyond!”
Reviews.Author: wychanger
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel we have ever stayed in, and we have stayed in many! The attention to detail was magnificent, from the orchid placed in a floating coconut in a fountain, the quietly left gifts for our four children and ourselves. Large spacious rooms with equisite views of the sea, mountains and 'Palace of Versailles' style gardens. A discreetly placed hammock, here and there. This is just a fraction of the beauty of this gem, The Four Seasons, Maui. The online photos do not do this place justice. Am frightened to write too much more in case this piece of paradise becomes like the rest of the world! I asked my fun loving 16 year old son if it was maybe a little quiet and would he like to meet some other teenagers. His reply was, 'maybe when I ger bored'!' He never was! Nor were the other teenagers at the resort. Fabulous, fabulous, fabulous. Don't bother with any other place on Maui - this really is value for money!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Honeymoon - Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvmarissa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wish we were still at the Four Seasons! From the moment we pulled up and were given leis and blossom tea and had our pictures taken from our ocean front view by the bellman (he offered), we knew we were in a fantastic place! The Four Seasons is out to please! The grounds are stunning and very well-kept. Our room was large and immaculate (except for one night when the turn-down service was not very good). We took advantage of the hotel grounds - got amazing oceanside massages (Peter was a fantastic masseuse), enjoyed the best poolside food we ever had, absolutely loved dinner at Ferraro's, enjoyed a yoga on the beach class, and had a great time in the outrigger canoe (the canoeing is free, but seemed to book up very fast - may want to make reservations for this before you travel). We did some exploring of Maui and the hotel was very helpful in planning - you can even order picnic baskets through the hotel which was delicious and perfect for our drive to Hana. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone willing/able to pay for such a fantastic trip!

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive, very luxurious”
Reviews.Author: DCglobetrotterJW
Reviews.Content: If you want to be pampered at a resort with great service, lots of amenities, and a beautiful location, this is the place to go. Warning: it is very expensive. I loved all the poolside and beach-side service: they bring you cold towels, cold water, and other goodies like muffins, cucumbers for your eyes, etc. on a regular basis. The service is very attentive everywhere except at the restaurants, Duo and Spago, where the service was quite slow. It was especially nice how they have 3 different pool areas with lots of beach chairs and cabanas everywhere- one main "fountain" pool, a kids' pool with a nice waterfall area, and totally separate serenity pool area. The serenity pool is fantastic - you must be 21 to get into the pool area as there is a swim-up bar. It has an infinity edge overlooking a beautiful lawn and then down to the beach and ocean - perfect for watching the sunset. Also, if you lean your head back into the water, there is music playing into the water (you can only hear it underwater). But the best part: no kids! Very serene! Another thing we enjoyed was how various local artists came to showcase their work every morning. It was a great way to talk with the artists and bring home some high quality souvenirs without having to leave the resort. We found the resort a little bit "clunky"... as in it doesn't blend in with nature very well (from the massive fountain over the main pool to the overall architecture of the buildings). It is very indoor-outdoor and there are beautiful flowers everywhere, but it does not achieve a harmony with its natural surroundings. Also, the hotel recommends Maui Wave Riders in Kihei if you are interesting in surf lessons - but they were pretty terrible. Our instructor was more interesting in hanging out with the other surfers and riding waves himself than showing us what to do. Also, there were beginners all over the place and they would crash right into you. Not the best experience - and even a little scary (our instructor would literally push us into other surfers in trying to get us a wave). If you are vacationing here - stay here and enjoy the amenities (you're paying through the nose to be here, so enjoy it!)

Reviews.Title: “Another great encore performance!”
Reviews.Author: alohachick
Reviews.Content: Every time we come here, we feel so taken care of and pampered. This time was no exception but they have exceeded our expectations! The last time we were here was during Spring Break this year and since my husband though the weather was a tad too cool during that time, he wanted to come back but this time with a twist. We started on the Big Island and we stayed on at the Four Seasons Hualalai. I also have written a review on that resort too. Anyway, this time we were coming in after Tropical Storm Felicia blew through and it was definitely a pretty packed resort where they were running in the 80-90 percent occupancy rate. All the staff members we talked to said they were very blessed to have a busy season this year. When we checked in, our room was not quite ready but after visiting the concierge desk to book our reservations and so forth, our room was ready. We were ushered to our room where we actually beat the welcome treats from the resort. As usual, the resort sent us a welcome refreshment plates of some great fruits for our daughter as well as Mom and Dad. The daughter also received stuffed animal from the resort which this year is a green gecko. For those of you with kids, they do provide kid-sized robes and their names spelled out in colorful sponges in the bathroom. As stated before, the youngest of guests are treated very well here and sometimes they become repeat guests later on in life. Watch out dads...your daughters will grow up to let you know they want to get married here! New services that I wanted to share and they are henna tattoos poolside at the Fountain pool and the fabulous new sushi offered in the lobby lounge. A sushi chef was sent to the Four Seasons in Tokyo to train for a month to learn the fine art of making delicious sushi. In addition, the staff has been trained about sake as well so for you sake connoisseurs, please do give the lobby lounge a try. Duo's has a new prix fixe $49 menu which is perfect for those of us with smaller appetites because usually their standard filet mignon starts at 7oz. For those of you who like the Moi fish, which was usually reserved for Hawaiian royalty, this is also another entree item on the prix fixe menu. You can also add half a hawaiian lobster or scallops to this menu for $10. Of course there is the surprise ending of the wonderful cotton candy that is flavored differently for each day of the week. It definitely will bring out the kid in the biggest of kids! Ah, the new Serenity adult pool. Very nice and a good getaway for the honeymooners and folks who just want to relax. Bravo on the pool addition! It is a very beautiful pool but when the trade winds pickup in the afternoon, there is a bit of wind up there too. For those of you with kids, their Kids for All Seasons program is great! There is a structured program everyday and the activities are different from day-to-day. One day there is a tide pool visit over at the Grand Wailea tide pool area, on another day there is a gecko hunting adventure, and so forth. If your you or anyone in your family has food allergies, please do let the staff know and they will take care to ensure that your foods has not been cross-contaminated with the items that you are allergic to. My daughter has a nut and shellfish allergy and here at Wailea as well as Hualalai, the waiter or waitress had told us that the kitchen is using a fresh batch of oil to fry her fries so there is no contamination and that it would take a bit longer to get her food ready. All the restaurants you eat at are pretty much alerted to the food allergies. Also during the evenings, there are scheduled kids programs about once or twice a week so you can sign your children up with Crab Hunting, Spy, or Pirate evening. The cost is $65 for this night evening program that includes dinner and it runs from 6 to 9pm so moms and dads and schedule a romantic dinner for two! The only main drag is the fact that one parent needs to get up at the crack of dawn to stake out the family cabana during the busy season. This is where you see the dads sitting down with their laptops on the cabana seats waiting for the pool attendant to start service at 7am. Then the families start coming out to the pool. Other than that, another fabulous stay and we are looking forward to returning here and at Hualalai.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon at Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: aoneil1975
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons Maui for part of our Honeymoon, and at the Grand Wailea using points for the remaining nights. The Four Seasons has exceptional facilities and expectional service to match. You will spend a great deal of money to stay here, but FS really does deliver. Our room was large with a separate sitting area, the bathroom was large and plush, and the lanai was big and had a nice view of the ocean. Everything about it was high end, as expected given the price. Service from front desk to concierge to housekeeping to pool attendants to waitstaff was first rate, consistently and without exception. There is a genuine enthusiasm for customer service. The staff shows a lot of initiative in addition to being polite and professional, absolutely first rate in every regard. I equate the staff and service to that of the greenbrier, operating on a different level and exclusive to only the highest end properties in the industry. The great thing about the FS Maui is, once you are there, you're not paying for a lot of add ons. Granted you are paying a great deal to stay there, but once you're in you are not being nickel and dimed (outside of internet access, which was $14 a day and inconsistent with so many other amenities that were free). Cabanas, umbrellas, etcetera were all free. The proportion of guests to cabanas and umbrellas was well conceived, so you we were always able to find a great cabana. If you want a choice spot overlooking the beach you will have to get up early (which is great, we loved getting up early and having complimentary coffee and socializing with other early risers, there is a wonderful sense of good cheer among guests), but all are plush. Poolside service is professional, non-invasive, and very gracious. Sunscreen, water, pineapple and watermelon, and water spritzes are all readily available and complimentary. FS just built an adults-only pool, its an infinity pool. Cabanas here are actually sheds and cost money but have big screen tvs and climate control, fridge, etcetera. If you don't use these, you have plenty of beach chairs/beds with plenty of umbrellas/overhangs provided if requested, at no charge. The pool is beautiful and has a swim up bar. Really a great place to relax. Lots of great stuff for kids we noticed, plush game room, kids buffet at lunch, great stuff. Grand wailea has a pool kids would prefer, but FS does do a lot of great things for kids. Restaurants are first rate but very expensive. Ferraro's is very close tot he beach and we recommend having dinner while watching the sunset. Workout facilities were high end and mostly outside overlooking the beach. The lobby bar was really great. There is a general store at shops at wailea, and a safeway @ 10 minutes drive, we recommend stocking up on essentials to reduce cost. We liked the grand wailea too, but did our island exploring while there, because cabanas and everything else costs additional money, and there is really no contest between the two resorts. The reviews about each are accurate from what we found on tripadvisor. It was free for us using hilton points, so we can't complain, and the service was very good. Facilities were nice, lots of walking though because it is a big resort. However, It does not cmpare to the FS, if you are going to spend the moeny to go to Hawaii and stay at one of these resorts, FS should be your choice.

Reviews.Title: “WOW, WOW, WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: randyoneseattle
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at some top notch resorts but this one was the topper!!! The Peninsula Hong Kong, The Ritz Naples, Raffles Singapore, Plaza Athenee Paris, The St. Regis New York, The Park Hyatt Tokyo, etc.etc.etc. ...they can't come close to the service I received at the Four Seasons Maui. Our white rental car was covered in mud after a downpour one day. We had the car parked by the valet and when we requested our car the next morning, it was washed and cleaned. I asked for a certain type of jam during breakfast and it was not part of the hotels choices so I happily had my second choice. The next breakfast, the same waitress brought me a jar of the jam that the hotel didn't carry and said she picked it up at a grocery store on her way home. I had some BBQ sauce spilled on my white Tommy Bahama shirt and hung it up by the bathtub so as not to spread the sauce on the other parts of the shirt. After returning from dinner, the housecleaner left a note and some Woolite with directions not to dry clean the shirt but rather soak it in cold water over night with the Woolite and it will look new in the morning. I did as directed and sure enough my shirt was spared. A server at the breakfast buffet overheard us saying that we preferred our bacon crisp and a bit over done and before we knew it, it was brought to our table side by the restaurant manager. We requested a secluded table for lunch but because the restaurant was so busy and we did not have a reservation, we could not be accommodated. To our surprise, when a table did open up on the patio away form the entrance, the host informed us and the staff moved everything to the table all in a pleasant manner. It was more work for them but they were genuinely happy to do it. I liked the chilled aloe vera gel at the poolside and mentioned it to the poolside servers. When an attendant returned with a chilled towel 15 minutes later, she had the information about the aloe gel written on a piece of paper for me. My partner and I had noticed that there was some construction going on on a secluded part of the hotel. When I inquired about the construction to who I thought was a groundskeeper, he informed me that he was the project manager for an new adult pool that was in construction and was to open in a couple of weeks. He then took me and my partner on a tour of the facilities as workers were busily hammering away. His brief 15 minute tour and description was such a pleasant effort as he was obviously busy. In general, every employee at this hotel seemed to want to go beyond what was expected and anticipated our needs. As I said before, this went beyond all of my expectations and I am a very very demanding traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon was fabulous thanks to Four Seasons Maui”
Reviews.Author: citychicgal
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 8 days in Maui at the Four Seasons Resort, nothing but great things to say! Yes, the price is jaw-dropping, but they are also doing stay 3 get the 4th night free specials, so that makes it worthwhile. Also, once you get there, no nickel and diming on the chairs, cabanas, poolside service. The only thing you pay for is food and drink service, as well as the uber-private cabanas up at the adult pool (that come with a flat screen and wi fi - 300 bucks a day). They aren't worth it - get up early, get a spot at the Sereneity (read: adult) Pool, and enjoy a free gorgeous view with the same level of service. We stayed in a Garden View room - 418 to be exact. The rooms on the 4th floor for Garden View are great, you have a little grass area that extends past your patio/lanai, and there is a nice hedge that blocks the view from the grounds into your room. We saw the partial ocean view, and for an extra 250 a night, the view is not worth it. Plus, everyone can see into your room from the courtyards at night unless you close the blinds. Use the extra 250 and splurge on a great dinner or drinks in the hotel. Yes, valet service is 20 dollars a day. No, I do not know why they charge for that when rooms start around 550 a night. The valets do a great job at making you feel welcome. They put water in your car, clean out trash/coffee cups, and offered us a cooler with ice for the Road to Hana trip. The best part came when we took a walk over to the Shops at Wailea, and called for a shuttle pick-up. Well, the shuttle wasn't going to come for another 20 minutes, so they sent a valet with the Four Season's Cadillac CTS to get us! We almost giggled ourselves silly to see the lovely valet get out and call our names. The little things FS does to make their customers feel like royalty really does work. Some tips: Get up early - around 7-8am, and go down and make a cabana reservation. They are pretty forgiving on the time frame. As long as you are back within an hour and a half, your chairs are reserved. You get 2 hours during 11-2pm. Yes the drinks are pricey (think 10 for a smoothie, 12 for a cocktail), but when else will you have your drink hand-delivered to you in a chair by a handsome FS pool attendant?) Breakfast at DUO is 35 a head, and we ate there 4 mornings and were never disappointed. If you are in Kihei for surf lessons or such, try Kihei Cafe for a great inexpensive option to the DUO FS breakfast. We liked the mixture, and it kept our budget in check. Ferraro's at the FS is great for lunch if you don't want to spend the $$ for dinner. The view can't be beat and the breeze in the mid-day is lovely. One of the best views in the house for your dollar is the lobby lounge. Starting at 5, they have a heavy appetizer menu and a limited dinner menu, with drinks and dessert. They have half priced full bottles of wine after 8pm. Live music is playing, and you can watch the sunset from really comfy chairs. We did this several nights and were never disappointed. The rooms were very spacious and we never felt cramped. I loved how you didn't immediately open the door into the bedroom, there is a little hallway with a minibar before you get to the room that made it feel more private. The bathrooms were great and always stocked with L'Occitane toiletries each night. Twice-daily housekeeping makes sure your things are always kept nice. We walked over to Grand Wailea next door, and while it is a beautiful hotel with an awesome spa, we were happy to be staying at FS. The Grand Wailea is just too loud and too many kids to be relaxing for honeymooners - go FS all the way! FS also has an outrigger canoe program (only 1 of 2 on the island) that is free to all guests. We learned how to canoe, took a trip out, and saw a lot of sea life - it was wonderful! Concierge service was lovely and always sent directions for our next day's travels the night before. They also did a wake up call with a 15 minute follow-up call just to make sure you were awake. : ) For those departing on an evening flight, they have an "Aloha Suite" that you can use to freshen up. It has male/female dressing areas and showers complete with all toiletries and robes. There is a lounge area and tv/computer access as well. It was much needed and appreciated! Go FS! You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “It's all true!”
Reviews.Author: farawayNJ
Reviews.Content: Everything you've read in the previous reviews is true. Four Seasons is not just about the spectacular property/rooms/views (and believe me they are spectacular!), it's about the service. From the moment the valet opened my car door upon arrival to the moment we left, I felt like a princess at my summer palace. All of the staff make a point to ask your name and use it whenever they see you. "So Mr. Jones, can we find you some chairs by the pool? Would you prefer to be in the sun or in the shade? Would you like to face the beach or face the pool?" Once you are seated, the offerings begin. Ice water? Sliced pineapple? Watermelon? Ice pop? Cucumber slices for your eyes? Chilled wet towel to refresh? I couldn't help giggling every time they came around! Twice daily housekeeping service, treats left in the room your first and last nights, large plush towels for beach/pool that don't have to be signed out/in like at other hotels, no additional fees for cabanas/beach umbrellas, top-quality toiletries, jugs of sunscreen everywhere (in 3 different strengths!), well-equipped game room. There is even a bookshelf by the pool stocked with the latest best-sellers for you to borrow. I could go on and on. As for meals, yes they are costly but well worth it. We ate at the Lobby Bar, and also had lunch and dinner at Ferraro's. All were outstanding. Negatives? Forget about seeing sights on Maui because you won't want to leave the resort! We never made it to Haleakala...oops. And I agree with the comment made in another review: the outdoor fitness facility is charming, but I found it too hot to enjoy my exercise time and sort of missed my air-conditioned YMCA. I do have one small word of caution though: We booked a room on the Club Floor in order to take advantage of the Club Lounge, all-day access to snacks/drinks (included in the cost of the room), and personalized concierge service. When we arrived, the price for our room had mysteriously increased by $300/night over what had been quoted and confirmed. We learned that there is an additional fee of $150 per child per day for the Club Floor, but this charge is not spelled out anywhere on Four Seasons' website or on the booking confirmation we received. Thanks to our travel agent and the superior service provided by ALL Four Seasons staff, this additional charge was removed from our bill without a fuss. In my opinion, it's only the most highly-skilled professionals who understand how to provide great service without being intrusive. Four Seasons employees have mastered this art. Thanks to them, this was an unforgettable vacation and I hope to have the opportunity to go back someday!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: LVgirlLasVegas
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this hotel. Service was perfect. We were considering many resorts and read the reviews on this site. We chose this hotel because of the reviews about the cleanliness, staff, and care given to small details. It was a special occasion and they welcomed us with a handwritten note and bottle of champagne. These touches continued throughout the trip. Everyone on the staff was helpful. They go the extra mile. For example, I left my sunglasses in my car and the valet found them and brought them to me at the pool. Also, the scuba center (Maui Undersea) was terrific and the divemasters professional, safe and fun. I would stay again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Our first choice for a vacation”
Reviews.Author: brinaheidi
Reviews.Content: We keep coming back to the FS Wailea. Our first visit was in 1991 and we have returned regularly since then. There are lots and lots of repeat visitors here. We brought our extended family along with us this time to celebrate our 40th anniversary. Each time here, our experience has been outstanding in every way. The best part is always the staff. They are so friendly, helpful and accommodating. In a world that has often become so rude and uncaring, this hotel is like an oasis. We have never found a hotel with a staff like this. The facility is gorgeous, the rooms lovely, beds very comfortable, and large bathrooms. We ate multiple times at Duo and Ferraro's. All meals were delicious. The Duo breakfast buffet is outstanding. Ferraro's is right above the beach with stunning ocean views. The beach is wide, long, spacious and beautiful. Expensive, yes. Worth it? To us, absolutely! Only downside-the high internet charges.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Wailea is all about being spoiled and pampered... you should try at least once in your life”
Reviews.Author: CeciSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: Yes, the price tag is expensive, but you do get what you pay for and it was well worth it. We stayed at the Four Seasons from July 31 through August 5. Our family included three young kids, all between the ages of 5-10, and the resort caters to both couples and families. As soon as we arrived, we were greeted by smiles, orchid and kukui lei, complimentary iced tea, cool oshiburi towels, and a toy basket in which each child could select a small toy of their choice. Toys included a mini "nerf-like" football, sticky squids, and the list goes on. We reserved the garden room, which was over 600sf. Our kids names were each spelled out on the beautiful marble tub with colorful sponges. In addition, the coffee table in the dining area included kiddie drinks (chocolate milk, capri sun) and other treats like rice krispies drizzled w/chocolate, dark chocolate turtles on a bed of graham cracker sand. Little blue bathroom tub toy whales accompanied the children's snacks and my kids were absolutely thrilled. For the adults, we had snacks that were served in a "woven box and orchid" and included dried mango and cookies. My kids, all boys, just loved their bathrobes sized especially for them. They placed a gecko stuffed animal for each of my boys on top of the bed, and again, my boys were impressed. It's this attention to detail that is just one of many factors that guests appreciate. The room decor was simple and tasteful and the bed/sheets/pillows were extremely comfortable. The large flat screen tv was nice, although, we didn't watch too much tv. They even provided us with a booklight for any late night reading. The oversized tub, large marble shower and dual vanities helped the family to get ready alot quicker than usual. Bathroom shampoos/soaps/conditioner/shower cream were premium quality--L'Occitane. We took advantage of the fitness center, "martial arts boot camp session", spa facilities, kids programme, wailea shuttle, and the list goes on. Spent most of our vacation hanging out poolside at the kids pool, am walks on the beach. We had buffet at DUO restaurant almost every morning and dined there one evening. We also tried out Ferraro's, the Lounge, and lots of orders for poolside lunches and cocktails. Again, food is expensive,and it is tasty (not outstanding) and convenient. I would say that the prices and quality of the food are reasonable for that area. Kids under 5 eat free at DUO and Ferraros (DUO is closed at lunch while Ferraros is closed at breakfast). I also had the foot/scalp massage at the spa and it was heavenly. I also enjoyed another foot/scalp massage poolside (cabana). Including tip, the two massages were about $500, which is pretty standard for a hotel of this caliber. The steam room in the spa facilities were complimentary and I enjoyed my "mini-breaks" there. Iced water flavored with mint or lemons also were provided for spa users in addition to use of lockers, robes, slippers, shavers. The complimentary cabanas are unheard of in Hawaii and it made our stay soo relaxing. Yes, it's true, the poolside attendants were very attentive to our needs, refilling water, frozen pops for the kids, watermelon slices, pineappples, mini banana muffins, cool scented oshiburo towels, saw them set up play pens for toddlers, clean sunglasses for some of the guests. We didn't opt for the evian spritz--though available..Just be careful around the kiddie pool area, it can get very slippery. It is also true that you need to arrive very early in the morning to get prime cabanas..I'm an early bird, so that wasn't any issue for me. Checked out the serenity pool (the pool requires your hotel key card to enter/exit and is for 21and over). The cabanas in that area are not complimentary and I think costs $300, and include a plasma tv and other luxe items... They do provide complimentary coffee, tea, hot chocolate and pastries very early in the am by the lobby area and complimentary newspapers (ny times fax, maui newspaper and honolulu advertiser) at the concierge and restaurants. Most of the hotel employees knew us by name, though not all. Worth noting that they try to memorize guests names. We did encounter a few celebrities during our stay, and the environment was low-key..no papparazi at the hotel (they hid at the beach) and hotel guests were very respectful of the celebrities' privacy. Again, when you take into account all of the complimentary amenities and exceptional service, this hotel is worth every penny. Like I said before, I encourage all of you to at least try it once in your life. My only recommendation is that the hotel have self-parking, Other than that, I'm ready to come back again before year-end as well as summer next year.

Reviews.Title: “expected more”
Reviews.Author: MyHowILove2Vacation
Reviews.Content: While the property itself (pool, grounds) are very nice, the rooms had average decor and very limited view (partial oceanview room). We expected more from the rooms at 660 a night. Food overall was very good - we ate at Ferraro's, Spago, by the pool and room service. Have stayed in past at Fairmont Kea Lani and would go back there vs staying here again. The rooms there are larger and the resort feels less crowded. The cardio equipment was located outside so it was too warm some days to use. The free fitness courses were nice and the outrigger adventure (free) was fun.

Reviews.Title: “A Splurge for an Unforgettable Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: beram63
Reviews.Content: Typically when I choose hotels I go for value with this philosophy in mind--if I'm spending enough time in my hotel room to justify a high price tag then I'm not making good use of my vacation. For the honeymoon we wanted a once in a lifetime 5-star resort experience so we could bask in the lap of luxury. I'm fairly certain that no other hotel would have offered the kind service and beauty needed to compete with the Four Seasons. We were greeted upon arrival by smiles, leis, sweet green tea, prompt bell and valet service, and a breathtaking lobby. This hotel offers every amenity your imagination could concoct: chilled lavender scented towels, Evian mist, fresh fruit, and ice pops all served complimentary pool-side; complimentary champagne to celebrate our honeymoon and Belgian chocolates and a card delivered to our room for my husband's birthday. The staff at the concierge desk was knowledgeable and helped us design an itinerary to meet every fantasy we'd imagined on our first trip to Hawaii along with confirmations delivered to the room equipped with written directions from the hotel. When we drove the road to Hana, room service provided a cooler full of ice for our picnic at no charge and coordinated with the bell desk to set us up with towels and blankets for the beach. This hotel, unlike other places on the island that would have offered marginal savings with substantially inferior service, did not nickel and dime us for every little thing. The cabanas, for example, cost nothing--as opposed to the Hyatt where you'll pay upwards of $100--and they will hold them for up to an hour, longer during lunchtime, should you want to head out for a massage, a swim, back to the room, etc. The rooms were likewise phenomenal. Every other hotel I have ever stayed in has seemed to have a fascination with hideous drapes, but the furnishings at the Four Seasons were simple, airy, and delightfully beautiful. Our partial ocean room included an over-sized bathtub and large stand-up shower, a king-size bed with lots of pillows and fluffy white sheets, and gorgeous wooden furniture on the lanai with a lovely view of the sunset over the ocean; I supposed the palm tree or two that swayed along the vista is why it was a partial and not a full. I did yoga on the beach each morning, which was one of many complimentary offerings by the fitness center in addition to the outdoor cardio room and the weight room. They have a game room with computers, video games, pool tables, and a flat screen TV for families and rainy days, though you won't likely get one of those since the hotel is located on a desert section of the coast. I could go on and on here all day. If you want luxury, this place is unrivaled! My one and only complaint is that it's simply not affordable to eat or drink on the resort. We did eat wraps at Snorkels Cafe, a quick odds-and-ends type of place right by the beach. We also had dinner and Spago and Ferraro's once each. As a New Yorker and a foodie, I was not impressed in the least with Spago, particularly since it came with a $500 price tag and was far from transcendent, but that's a separate review. Luckily we discovered Roy's and other more casual places in Kihei-- a surfer town just down the street--that made it possible to keep some sort of a budget. It just started to get annoying to have to go out constantly to eat and drink because a sandwich at the pool-side restaurant cost $30 and a mojito was $12. We ended up buying beer and liquor in town and drinking our own drinks covertly while we sunbathed since ordering from the bar was unsustainable. Again, we're a couple of young newlyweds just starting our lives together, so if you're not working with a budget at all, I say go for it! The place is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning, great for little kids”
Reviews.Author: dmccann1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the four seasons maui from july 17 to the 27th. I was a little concerned about my small children staying there (2 and 6) but when we arrived I have to say it was an amazing exp. The staff at this hotel where by far the best I have ever encountered. My children LOVED both the beach and the pools. Its pricey buy so worth the money. The night manager (forget his name) is by far one of the best. Took care of my family and I at every early morning turn. Even the bellman had great local recommendations for fun trips and food. If your a family with small children I would recommend the suites, they are great.

Reviews.Title: “An experience to remember”
Reviews.Author: LifeisGood09
Reviews.Content: I will preface by saying that I am very particular and extremely critical regarding resorts. We have stayed at many 5 stars over the years and I must say that this resort tops the list of one of the best three. The Four Seasons Wailea is magnificent. From your arrival to your departure you are greeted with genuine warmth from everyone who works here. The hotel is reminiscent of a small palace with gorgeous plantings and artwork adorning the entire resort. The grounds, pools, beach and views are breathtaking and extremely well attended. Upon arrival we chose to upgrade our room to an executive suite with a prime ocean view. The cost was a bit steep, but worth the space and views. The Spa was a serene experience where I indulged in the best facial I have ever had. The serenity pool with the swim up bar is also a must do. We had just stayed at the Ritz in Kapalua and there is simply no comparison. Trust the reviews. This is truly a 5 star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort!”
Reviews.Author: KAD10
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending 1 wk at the Four Seasons at Wailea. I was there for a medical conference being held at the Grand Wailea. After reading reviews about the Grand Wailea and the Four Seasons, we decided to stay here. That was the best decision we made. The Four Seasons is a much nicer resort. We have 2 small children - ages 3 and 6 yrs. I found the pools at the Grand Wailea a bit overwhelming to keep track of young children. Additionally, I saw many people staking out places by the pool at 6:45 am at the Grand Wailea, which was absolutely not the case at the Four Seasons. I agree with all the other reviews that this is a very family-friendly resort. Our children were treated so well that they didn't want to leave. We ate at all 3 restaurants and liked Spago the best. Every meal there was amazing. My husband and son LOVED the Uku. We have stayed at 5 star resorts all over the world and this resort was definitely the best one we've stayed at for a family with young children. Their service is amazing and they really attend to every detail. My only negative would be the cost of food and the fact that they charge you $10 per day per computer for internet access. The lack of free internet was really surprising to me and I was flat out shocked when they charged us double because we had 2 laptops in use. Regarding food.. my husband and I don't drink alcohol and our bills for dinner were always over $150 - even without the children. But after speaking with other people from my conference, it sounds like the food at the other resorts in Wailea are also very expensive. Overall, we had a fantastic vacation and would return to this resort in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING, AWESOME, the BEST!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: torainca
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons met all of our expectations, and then some. From the time we checked in and were upgraded to a partial ocean view without having to ask, to enjoying the new adult only pool. The only small problem we had was on our first full day there after hanging out at the pool until 2pm, we came back to our room and they were just getting ready to clean it, a bit annoying. We hung out on our lanai while they cleaned the room. We called the front desk, and asked that our room be cleaned between 9-10am every morning, and turn down service between 8-9pm every night. We never had a problem after that. Back to the great stuff. Breakfast or dinner at Duo's was great, wonderful outside patio area, delicious food, pricey, but you are at the Four Seasons. We had dinner a few times at Ferraro's, we highly reccomend it. The food and service were always great, and you MUST have their Tiramisu, delightful, yummy. We even rented one of the cabanas at the Adult pool, ($300), and it was well worth it. Try to get one of the two in the back, better sun all day long. You were never longing for service whatever pool you were at. They fixed up a couple of lounge chairs for us, provided us with ice cold water through out the day, popsicles or outterpops, and even cold jello. Towards the end of the day someone would come by with aloe vera for you to put on your skin. They also had sun screen lotion stations free of charge. And sometimes came by with an Evian spritz to help cool you down. The rooms were wonderful, just like everyone said. The staff was outstanding, and called by name once they got to know you. Take a walk or shuttle to the Wailea shopping center, go to ABC or the General store, and stock up on munchies or beer and soda for your room frig, while there, enjoy a wonderful breakfast at Longhi's, or lunch/dinner at Tommy Bahama's. and then take the nice walk back to the hotel cutting through the Grand Wailea hotel. Or if your too tired, call the Four Seasons and they will pick you up. They even gave us a ride to Matteo's for pizza one night. Great little casual place, order at the counter, sit down, and pizza is delivered. Loud and lively, great food. We also hitched a ride from the Four Seasons to the Wailea Golf course to play the Emerald course, I highly reccomend playing that course, and if you play early, stop in the cliubhouse for a great lunch. We also booked a tour on Blue Hawaiian helicopter, our first time. It was great, we went over west Maui and Molikai, our pilot even detoured us over the Ritz Carlton Bay golf course, because we were playing the course the next day. We spent the rest of that day cruising to Paia, if you want a casual day shopping, go there, nice little shops, great fish tacos at the Fish Market, we heard Charlie's is also great. If you want a fancy expensive lunch or dinner with a fantastic view go to Moma's House just past Paia. Want to try something different, take the road upcountry, and go to the winery, yes a winery in Maui, if you can bring a lunch, and enjoy the grounds, very peaceful, and relaxing, the air is much cooler, and refreshing up there. The wine is ok, the pineapple wine tastes like a cold fruit sweet drink. Thy also have regular wine they make. For sushi we wetn to Sansei in Kihei, an easy taxi ride there, the hotel can make reservations and give you directions. The concierge staff at the Four Seasons was wonderful, they booked our trips, had tickets, directions delivered to our room, whatever we asked for, they made it happen, and most of the time, they just billed it to our room. We are now officially spoiled and will find it very hard to go to another resort. We hope this review helps anyone wavering on where to stay. We also saw that they did some wonderful things for kids.

Reviews.Title: “A truly great hotel”
Reviews.Author: eam149
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel mostly based on the rave reviews on TripAdvisor, and they were right on the money. We pulled up to the front entrance after driving around Maui all day (8 hours in the car!) and did not get in the car again for 4 days! We just did not want to leave the hotel! We reserved a Garden view room and were upgraded to a Partial Ocean View room- the view was really just from the Lanai- I would not have wanted to pay the POV price. The room itself was really nice, with a huge bathroom. My strategy for the trip was "nicest hotel, worst room", and in the Four Seaons, the worst room is still really great! I am so glad we stayed here instead of the other hotels in Wailea- it really was just so luxurious, with tons of attention to detail. Here's what I loved the most: Beautiful pool and beach area, with the beach being so close to the pool, you didn't have to decide which one to swim in. The cabanas and chairs with umbrellas were "free", and while the prime ones get snatched up early in the AM, there were plenty of good seats to be had all day. And lots of people to come by to fill your water glass, offer fresh fruit, etc. The restaurants, while expensive, were beautiful with amazing food. We had lunch at Ferraro's every day, and the view was perfect. We had dinner at Duo one night (The $49 price fixe is a good deal) and Spagos another night (we splurged for the 9 course tasting menu!) The fitness center is outdoors- very cool! The lobby bar has a great view for sunsets- just really relaxing. The whole place just has a great feel. My only complaints: If you want to eat at the hotel, you have to spend a lot of money- there was a snack bar at the beach, but it wasn't that great. There's a great walk along the beach that leads to the shops at Wailea, so you can pick up snacks there. The main pool was nice, but the adult only serenity pool opened the day after we left....we checked it out and was awesome! Swim up bar, cool cabanas (I think they cost extra). We were sad to miss out! Only complaint about the room is that all the bathroom lights are on one swich with no dimmers, so it's either super bright or totally dark. All in all, it was the nicest hotel I've ever been to and I'd go back in a minute! I'm jealous of anyone who is thinking of going, and I would say to definitely pick it over the others!

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great”
Reviews.Author: daches
Reviews.Content: I have been to several fourseasons hotels around the world and found this one a notch below just because of the size. I thought it was very nice and was glad we stayed here over anywhere else on the island we visited. However, I think maybe I would have rather gone to a smaller resort on another island. I was surprised how many kids were there. They did just open the adult pool which helped, and was very nice. I do agree with others that it seemed to get very crowed early at the pools and beaches. We would get to the pools and beach around 9am and most of the prime cabannas or chairs were taken. With so many people at the beaches and now the adult pool, it felt as though the staff was spread a little thin. There were many positives. The rooms were very nice and the service was great. We only at Ferraro's on site which was good. Off site we had a light dinner at Tommy bahamas at Wailea shops which was surprisingly good. We ate at Mammas Fish House and Kiehe beach cafe for breakfast. We had a dinner at Murphys Pub which is at the Wailea Blue course which was a nicce change of pace. We also ate a lunch at the Pizza place accross from the Shops at Wailea. One activity we liked was a hike at a stop along the Hanna Highway that was about 45 minutes from the hotel. It had several waterfalls and you could go and swim. There were a lot of tourist there, but worth it to find the hidden pools. The front desk has a map of how to get there. In closing this is a big resort, almost 400 rooms. I have been to the FS in Costa Rica, Great Exuma, Jackson Hole, and Bali. These are more intimate resorts of around 150 rooms. I felt this was the best resort on the island(don't go to the Ritz-windy, isolated.) You will enjoy yourself. It was close to a lot of other places to go and see and eat. The weather in this location also was better than other parts of the island. If you want total quiet and easy chair finding, go to a smaller island FS.

Reviews.Title: “best ever!”
Reviews.Author: NDIrish12
Reviews.Content: like most readers here on tripadvisor, i did my homework for our first trip to hawaii. after consulting various friends, family, coworkers - Maui was the place to go. When it came to picking the hotel, I searched the internet and read as many reviews as possible. FOUR SEASONS was the hotel we chose. We stayed at the Ritz-Carton, Cancun for our honeymoon(9 years ago) and were blown away there. We decided to try their competition in Maui and we weren't disappointed. Bottemline, you get what you pay for. We opted for a gardenview room and stayed for 7 nights. When we arrived, they upgraded us two levels to deluxe ocean view without even asking! the service here is unbelievable. Everyone says hello to you and treats you like a king! The housekeeping staff even stop in their tracks and say 'hello' to you whenever you pass them in the hallways. the only thing that wasn't complimentary was the parking(only valet, $20/day). beach umbrellas, cabanas are all first come first serve(and since it wasn't very busy there, we never had a problem getting one with a great view). all in all, best place we've ever vacationed. a couple told us they had stayed at the four seasons hawaii(big island), and said it was even better. can't wait to try that out!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in every way”
Reviews.Author: grazipat
Reviews.Content: Wekeep coming back to this hotel not only because it is beautiful but because the service is top flight. This is our fifth time at the resort and our room was clean and beautiful and the grounds are still immaculate and the service, in a word, is amazing. Case in point, my fifteen year old son was playing a game of pool in the gameroom and after his game he turned to watch ESPN for about two minutes, pool cue still in hand. He was totally taken back by the fact that when he turned back to the pool table the staff had already reracked it for him! That made quite an impression on him and on us. Service at the pool and beach are first rate and we have stayed at the Ritz in Kapalua where pool and beach service are lacking in a major way. Not only were we offered cool towels and Evian spritzes, we were constantly having our water glasses replenished, offered fresh baked mini muffins in the morning, ice pops, pineapples, watermelon, tropical jello and rice krispie treats through the day as we lounged poolside. I even had a staff offer to clean my sunglasses. I don't know about everyone but I know that going on vacation for me means to be totally pampered and that is how I feel at the Four Seasons Maui. Yes, the restaurant prices are very pricey and aside from ordering some drinks and snacks poolside and a dinner at Ferraro's we did not eat at the resort. We left for most meals, most notably breakfast. I would have a complaint that the breakfast prices are just too much. We traveled with a teen girl and boy and the girl doesn't even eat breakfast and my husband and I are fine with something light but our teenage son is an eating machine and just for him to go get breakfast at the restaurant would have been $34 for him and they did not offer a teen menu at Duo though they did have a children's menu for under 12. So if I were to change anything it would be to make the breakfast food a bit more reasonable. Otherwise we drove to Stella Blues in Kihei.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service!”
Reviews.Author: globetrottingfool
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights at the end of June/beginning of July with my parents, my husband and 2 children (ages 6 &3) to celebrate my parents' 45th anniversary. We were pampered throughout our stay! We arrived late in the evening and were greeted by the valet staff with fresh flower leis for the girls and shell/nut leis for the boys. We were led inside by one person to check in while another unloaded our car. At check in, my kids were asked to choose a toy from a basket while we were informed that both our rooms had been upgraded, and would be connecting. Once in our rooms - wow! They were both so spacious, with nice lanais and beautiful bathrooms. As previously reported, our kids' names had been spelled out in sponge letters, bubble bath and bath toys had been laid by the tub and they had their own robes to lounge in! On top of that, they'd left a nice bottle of champagne and anniversary card for my parents, milk and cookies for my kids and some really yummy goodies for my husband and me. The ice buckets had been filled (and would continue to be filled every evening) and plenty of water bottles had been left in the fridges. I loved that there was no pre-stocked minibar, which saved us the hassle of trying to keep the kids out of the goodies! Plush robes for everyone, comfortable slippers if we were so inclined and even a tote bag to use while we were there. We spent the next day playing in the pool and at the beach in front of the hotel, and were very happy to see that getting a cabana was no problem. Poolside service was great - they even send someone around to clean your sunglasses! The kids loved the little treats they provided - fresh fruit, made from scratch jello, popsicles. I loved that there was also plenty of water brought around and that they had provided organic sunscreen in 3 different SPF factors, just in case you forgot to bring your own. Unfortunately, my mother had an accident that day - a couple of big waves smashed her into the sand while she was wave-jumping and she suffered some scrapes and bruises along with a very sore neck (where she landed). When we asked for some ice, they not only gave her the ice pack, but they sent someone from security to check on her and ultimately called an ambulance to take her to the ER to make sure she hadn't broken any bones, which she luckily didn't have. Needless to say, spending our first day in Hawaii in ER was not fun, but the security staff at FS were great. They called several times throughout our stay to check on her and ask if there was anything she needed. BTW, the doctors and nurses at Maui Memorial were great! The next day, Mom rested while the rest of us got up at 3 am to make the trek to Haleakala to watch the sun rise. They had hot drinks and pastries in the lobby! They had blankets for us to take on the trip! And the sunrise was glorious...the kids got a kick out of having to wear hats and mittens in Hawaii, and we got some great pictures. And when we went on a snorkel/cruise, the bell desk had all the towels we'd need and plenty of water bottles for our trip. All the employees were so friendly and helpful. They greeted us with warm smiles and took the time to talk with my children. They all helped to make this a truly relaxing vacation. We ate breakfast at the hotel one day, and lunch in Ferraro's - the food was very good. But with so many great restaurants to choose from, we usually ate off-property. We were very impressed with the quality of our meals on Maui. Definitely make a trip to Stella Blues Cafe for breakfast, Koiso for sushi and Sarento's on the Beach for a sunset dinner! The only objection we had during our stay was when they started fertilizing the plants around the resort - man, that was stinky! However, with the ocean breezes sailing through, it wasn't too unbearable. I guess they've got to do it sometime in order to keep the property looking so lush, and it certainly was better to be a privileged vacationer than the guys laying the stuff down! The day before we had to leave, they left a book for each child for us to take, with a note to come again. With the experience we'd just had, we will definitely be visiting the FS Maui again!

Reviews.Title: “Deeply Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: BambiM
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Four Seasons from 7/5 - 7/10 because we had such a positive experience during our first stay in 2004. This stay however was quite different. While we were thrilled to be upgraded to an oceanfront prime one bedroom suite (we had booked an oceanview), the excitement wore off quickly. I noticed tiny fast crawling ants on the floor of the water closet and all over the bathroom sink, and my stepdaughter saw ants crawling all over the lamp next to the sofa. My husband asked for a manager to call us in the morning. No one called, so he asked someone at the front desk to have a manager call. By the next day, no one had called, so he asked yet again for a manager to call. He also emailed one of the managers, who had given us her card when we checked in. (We never did receive a response from her). All the while, the ants were still there, and I had also noticed one in the shower on the ledge and some in the bedroom. Additionally, I saw ants crawling on my husband's toothbrush and toothpaste. The moment I first saw the ants I began packing my things away - what a pain that became. Finally my husband was able to speak to a manager in person. He promised to have housekeeping spray. It didn't seem to have any effect, so he called the manager again. His only offer to us was that I could receive a complimentary massage. Huh? Were we really staying at the Four Seasons??? As we checked out, we were asked about our stay. Even though it was too late, I mentioned about the ants, that the sofa bed was only made up 2 out of 5 nights (for my step-daughter), and that housekeeping never placed washcloths in the bathroom that my stepdaughter was using. There could be no mistake that it was being used for bathing, along with the fact that the presence of a shower demands a washcloth in addition to the bath towel and bath mat. I left quickly, as we had a flight to catch. No sooner had we reached the car, a young man called after us. My husband explained the entire situation and we were offered 15% off per night. I also received an email from yet another manager that we could receive a free night during our next stay. Are you kidding me? Where were these offers while we were still there?What about just getting rid of the ants? What about returning phone calls as soon as possible? My mind was already made up that we would never return, nor would we ever go back to a Four Seasons Resort. We had a much nicer stay our first 3 nights at the Grand Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a place one should experience once in their lifetime.”
Reviews.Author: Smooth_Obturator
Reviews.Content: Like many other people my wife and I spent the 2nd half of our honeymoon in Maui, and also like many other people we decided to stay at the Four Seasons based on the overwhelming number of glowing reviews found on trip advisor. I found that the reviews found on trip advisor of the Four Seasons were pretty accurate, but like most reviewed places on trip advisor one needs to sort through the dross in order to obtain a complete picture. The good reviews fail to point out obvious flaws, and the bad reviews are a bit too harsh. The truth is somewhere in the middle. This is a list of the positive things I read on trip advisor that I found to be true: - The greeting upon arrival is warm & is the right way to begin your stay. - You canâ€™t pass a single employee on the property without them saying hello to you. - The rooms & bathrooms are immaculate. - The food is made with quality products & is well prepared. - The attentiveness and amenities received poolside is a wonderful touch. - The spa & the services provided there are top notch. Overall our stay was amazing, but youâ€™d have the expectation from a 5 diamond resort. Now I must be fair and acknowledge some of the negative things Iâ€™ve read and found to be true. - Although one can find a cabana with ease without waking up at the crack of dawn to reserve one, the prime ones overlooking the ocean always â€œmysteriouslyâ€� appeared to be reserved even really early in the morning. - An ocean view room does not necessarily mean that you will be able to actually see the ocean from your room. Your room may be located very far from the ocean. The room may not face the ocean directly. There may be trees occluding the view. This is for an ocean view not a partial ocean view. Those were pretty minor things and some people may stay here and never encounter those problems. All in all this place is definitely a resort to benchmark other resorts. Dr. Endoâ€™s Top 3 Doâ€™s: 1. Make a reservation at Ferraroâ€™s for a sunset dinner and request one of the tables closest to the ocean. 2. Find a way to get a cabana overlooking the ocean. Itâ€™s much more peaceful & relaxing than the ones next to the pool. 3. Reserve spa treatments early as the prime hours tend to fill up quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Made my honeymoon spectacular”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaNY
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon and it was amazing! Yes, there were some children around but based on the caliber of people who stay at the Four Seasons, their children were not disruptive. If this hotel is #2 in Wailea, I can't imagine what #1 is....if it's the hotel next door, that place is kid central! So steer clear if you are going on your honeymoon and definitely stay here!!! We actually went on a cruise after staying for a few days and wanted to get off the ship and return here.

Reviews.Title: “4th July”
Reviews.Author: fasdaddi
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to HI. We chose Maui and 4 seasons based on reviews on trip advisor. We booked a regular room and were upgraded to an ocean view room. What I liked about the resort was the grounds and beach were beautiful, complimentary outrigger boating, room and bathroom were well equipped, and the rec room/spa/gym was very nice. What I didn't like was that the pool was small, some of the concierges were not informative, and lastly it was difficult to get pool/cabana seating if you don't come very early to reserve it. I hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “The best.”
Reviews.Author: llcoolal
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were married here in June. It was perfect...and as the title of the review states...it's the best...period. At least the best I've ever had anyway. I could write a book on the services alone. Suffice it to say, you'll want for nothing. The staff is top notch and you always feel taken care of here. Amenities are also superior; from the grounds to the pool to the spa, everything was extremely well done and maintained. If there's any downside it's the price. My only recommendation here (unless you've just got gobs of money to spend) is to go with one of the lower end rooms (I think the Mountain View is the least expensive). The price difference between a mountain or garden view versus a partial or prime ocean view is substantial. Unless you're a fan of staying in your room on vacation for extended periods of time, the ocean view just isn't worth what you pay for it. You'll still receive the same great service and be able to enjoy all of the amenities no matter the room, so why not save a few $? Beyond the room cost, we realized at checkout that we were getting charged an additional $20/day for parking. While this is not uncommon, I felt we got a little nickel and dimed given what we were paying for the room. Same holds true for the in-room Internet (which we didn't use), it's pay per use. Again, not a major negative, just seems silly to me to charge extra for these things when the cost of the rooms are as high as they are. A special note, for anyone considering a destination wedding here, seriously consider it. Our wedding coordinator (Carin) was awesome and took care of everything down to the last detail. I can't say enough good things about her and the wedding services as a whole.

Reviews.Title: “Top Maui Resort”
Reviews.Author: asilee
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the second half of our honeymoon at the Four Seasons Maui. This is another beautiful Four Seasons property! We were greeted by one of the managers that escorted us to our room. We stayed in an Ocean View Prime â€“ One Bedroom Suite. This was a very nice room offering a very large living area, large bedroom, and a great bathroom. As a honeymoon gift we were left pineapple and a bottle of champagne. The room offered more space than we could use, and the views of the ocean and gardens were great. We used room service for breakfast several times and the laundry service once. The staff was polite for all services, offering most anything we wanted. We used several of the resorts services including the spa. We took advantage of a couples massage that was much needed. The spa was very clean and the staff friendly and helpful. We did have lunch at Ferraro's which was very good, and enjoyed several of the resort stores. The pool area looked nice but we did not take advantage. All in all this was a great resort. I would defiantly come back and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “I'm still relaxed ...”
Reviews.Author: eyehearttravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Seasons Maui after five nights at the sister property on the Big Island. No one doubts that this is an amazing hotel, impeccable service, unbelievably well maintained and in a great spot on the beach. We were on our honeymoon and were upgraded to a one bedroom ocean front suite. Our views were breathtaking. We ate at Spago, Ferraro's, Duo's, the bar/restaurant area by Spago (twice) and had poolside and room service. The food in every instance was amazing - we never left to eat anywhere else! We really enjoyed the bar/restaurant (I can't remember the name) on the same floor as Spago's. There was live music, hula dancers and great views of the sunset. You could order off of any menu at the resort from here and it was a more mellow experience. You have to try the fish and chips. I know it doesn't sound fancy but my god it is amazing! We used the Spa facilities and had a couples massage which was very relaxing. MAKE SURE you do the morning outrigger trip. It's free, the FS staff on board are beyond knowledgable about the sport and we saw at least 5 turtles. But I would like to note a few slightly different things about this place. Yes the resort is bliss, pure luxury and very relaxing but I felt that it lacked a Hawaiian feel to it. The FS Hualalai dripped in Hawaiian vibes and I missed that here. The rooms were beautiful but generic almost, no color or warmth or any reminders that you were on a tropical island. Also, I almost felt like I was in LA, not Hawaii, because every other guest was from the city and the resort again lacked a Hawaiian vibe. Being from Chicago, this put me off, I'm just not used to it. I love LA and really enjoy visiting that city, but I'm in Maui! Again, not a horrible game changer, but it was a bit of a culture shock after the mellow Big Island. And the resort space itself is quiet small, if the resort was at full capacity and I was fighting for space by the pool, I would not have enjoyed myself. At full capacity this place would be a nightmare. There is not a lot of room to move around and FS recognizes this apparently because they are building a new adult pool area to be opened at any moment. Would I go back, yes in a second, but not during high season!

Reviews.Title: “An unforgettable honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: BubbyK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons for our honeymoon and were VERY glad with our choice! We were thinking about staying at the Ritz Carlton or Fairmont Kea Lani and we saw both during our stay and were especially glad that we weren't staying at the Ritz (it's on the northwest part of the island which had lots of evergreen trees and didn't really look like you're in Hawaii and it wasn't on the beach at all). Obviously the service was great. The staff will bend over backwards for you. I mean, they are used to taking care of celebrities, so no job is too big! We just got really tired of having to shell out tips for everything- especially since you're forced to valet park and pay $20/day for it. If I was given the choice to valet park I would have no problem with tipping valet if they put water in our car and give us directions! I definitely recommend getting the bed and breakfast package (includes the full breakfast buffet for two and is $35 per day). If you don't have that package and decide to have the full buffet, the cost is $85 per day! You will not regret it- best breakfast ever! We arrived to find a bottle of champagne in our upgraded room! The bathroom was almost as big as the room itself! We did not eat dinner at any of the restaurants in the hotel. Instead, we went to Capische (very good italian and sooooo romantic) in Wailea, a place called I'o in Lahaina (upscale seafood), Cuatro in Kihei (upscale seafood with Asian and Latin fusion), and Cafe Olei in Kihei (had a sushi and raw bar). The only one we weren't totally wild about was Cafe Olei- not too memorable, but good if you want to eat at Sansei and the wait is too long. We also had the BEST mexican ever at a place called Cilantro in Lahaina. It's a very casual place and we were wowed- we went there twice we liked it so much. We went up to the crater/volcano to watch the sunrise- thumbs up! An intense, but once in a lifetime opportunity. We also snorkeled at Molokini crater and it was excellent- saw a gigantic eel! For sure check out Lahaina and have some shave ice as well. We hope to go back some day for a shorter stay (unfortunately, I don't think a 7 night stay will ever be able to happen again), but every penny was totally worth it! It was a surreal experience- we ended up going during the Maui Film Festival and did not expect to see celebrities around every corner! I never thought I'd be working out in the same gym at the same time as Jillian Michaels!

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to expectations....”
Reviews.Author: pbgvluv
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights earlier this month. We travel a lot for business and leisure and are lucky to have stayed in world class properties. The Four Seasons Maui ranks near the top of our list. Yes, it is expensive....but you get what you pay for. The staff is delightful and so helpful. Our room was huge and nicely decorated. The bathroom was so large - nice when you are sharing it with a teenage daughter! The concierge staff was the best - assisting us with tours and transportation. Food was fabulous in all the restaurantes, though we were a bit disappointed with Spago (did not reflect badly on the hotel - just Spago which is way overrated). We loved the spa and pool side foot massages! The pool was serene (it wasn't very crowded while we were there), and the cabana's and cliff lounge areas were great - and service out there was really good (slow sometimes, but nothing too bad). The beach is gorgeous. We loved every minute...

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: tommybahama1004
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here for our honeymoon and I have to say it is truly the most incredible place we have ever stayed! The grounds are unbelieveably beautiful and everything is immaculately clean and landscaped, not even a blade of grass out of place! The service is outstanding but was never intrusive. A lot of the staff remembered me by my name after just seeing me for the first time and continued to greet me by my new Mrs. (new last name) the entire trip which was very charming and thoughtful. We booked a partial ocean view and were upgraded to an ocean view room. The rooms are very large and very comfortable and the bathrooms are outstanding... complete with everything you could need! The restaurants on property not only serve fantastic food but the ambiance of each one of them is what truly makes them sooo special (Ferraro's was my favorite, VERY romantic!) The pool is wonderful and the cabana areas over looking the ocean are so private and lovely... and the pool attendants do everything possible to make your time by the pool as comfortable as possible. The brought around mini muffins in the morning, fruit and pop-sicles in the afternoons... as well as cold towels, evian spritzes and they never let your water glass go empty! The pool menu is great as well. There are a variety of great shops in the hotel and local artists set up in the lower lobby in the mornings which was very nice. Shops at Wailea next door has tons of great things as well! There is no way to describe all the fantastic amenities at this hotel, the best way to say it is that it is worth every penny and you truly do get what you pay for! We definitely plan to return to the 4 Seasons Maui in the future and recommend everything about the hotel! ENJOY! And and we saw a few celebrities during our stay which was fun!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: peak80
Reviews.Content: I looked at every other hotel option from Oahu to Kauai - the FS Maui ended up winning the other for half my stay (Westin Maui for the other half). I've stayed some nice places, and this was by far the best. The pool / cabana scene was as close to perfect as I could have imagined. Restaurants were great, and they each had a good discount menu in honor of the economy. I vividly recollect gazing at the ocean from the cabana thinking whatever the price is it was worth it. Current promotions make it an easy yes. I stayed for 5 nights but suggest at least 7.

Reviews.Title: “Easily the best hotel in Maui, if not one of the best anywhere”
Reviews.Author: exbrc
Reviews.Content: Top notch service, as expected from a Four Seasons resort, however, also as expected, at a price...if you can stomach the cost you must stay there for your trip to Maui. It offers unmatched grounds, beautiful views, a great location in Wailea and pretty much anything else you could hope for in your trip. Be mindful this is largely a honeymoon spot, especially given the price, because couples will splurge for this resort in lieu of a more family or singles spot elsewhere (but then again, alot of honeymooners go to Maui in general). Regardless, I was traveling for some solo R&R and still had a fantastic stay -- its impossible not to given the breathtaking sights and top tier service.
