Some suggested "to do's": 1) take the road to Hana trip -- its worth it; 2) take an early morning trip to the Molokini crescent for some great snorkeling; 3) take a helicopter tour of the island -- its a great way to see some parts of the island you may not make it too - I suggest blue hawaiian helicopters but the concierge at the Four Seasons will always guide you in the best direction regardless. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: Going2Mexico
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons Maui for 5 nights during our Honeymoon in July 08. It lived up to our expectations. The room was immaculately clean, the bathroom huge and luxurious, comfortable beds and furnishings. The service at the hotel was amazing....fruit, popsicles, water mists by the pool. Someone always checking to make sure everything was okay. We loved the complimentary outrigger canoe ride/lesson. Concierge was very helpful. Would definitely go back. For comparison, we stayed at the Hyatt in Kauai which does not even compare (hyatt was such a let down next to the 4S!).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Malta_explorer
Reviews.Content: I very very rarely write reviews, but felt that this place offered such good services that I would make an exception. We was celebrating our first anniversary, and this turned out to be a perfect place. Upon check in we was given our leis and upgraded to a sea view room without even asking. The hotel only found out it was our anniversary upon check in when they asked us. Everything was really good from the front desk check in to the service we received from the concierge. Our room was spacious and was always clean. On our first night we tried eating at Spago. The food was great, but my only minor complaint was that it took quite long for the food to come out considering the restaurant was only 2/3 full. But this didn't tarnish my experience at the four seasons. We also tried scuba diving for the first time, and as my wife is a non swimmer she was quite nervous. Our instructor (Phil) picked up on this and held her hand throughout the whole dive. To me this is a sign of someone who cares and gives top quality service. We also tried a his and hers treatment at the spa, and I would say it was good. The changing area had just about everything a person could need in terms of grooming. I would also say, having driven around the island that this is the best location on Maui. Overall, top hotel. Would definately come back.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: drsoul
Reviews.Content: If you wish to feel pampered, treated well, and have your every request honored and expectations exceeded, look no further than the Four Seasons Resort Maui. I've recently returned from 12 days here. It is all that you can imagine and dream of in a Hawaiian vacation resort. I have stayed at this property annually for the past seven years and it is always a wonderful and relaxing time. Other reviewers rightly note the excellent (and many complimentary) services, magnificent spa, nicely and comfortably appointed rooms, and the exceptional beach, views, and restaurants. They are all really fabulous. I'd like to point out that what sets this property apart is its service and attention to both details and its guests. Those employed here recognize that they are in the service industry and they do their very best to make you feel comfortable without fawning and fussing over you. They are respectful, courteous, and, most importantly, helpful. They know the property, they know the island, and they truly act out the idea and spirit of Aloha. The concierge desk is great at suggesting restaurants, activities, and securing reservations; the staff at all restaurants goes out of their way to accommodate culinary and other requests; housekeeping is thorough, detailed, and timely; and the list goes on. Significantly, all management staff are available and visible on property, referring to you by name (as does most staff - I would love to take the course that gives them the skill to remember everyone's name), and making sure you are comfortable and enjoying your stay. They are happy we're there, and they want us to have the time of our lives. In addition to all of the wonderful aspects of this property, isn't this really what we all want - to feel like those employed at a resort are happy we're there?

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel.”
Reviews.Author: emsmcq
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our honeymoon at the 4S Wailea. Obviously, it's a fantastic hotel. The service is great. We were upgraded to an amazing suite. Pool and beach service are wonderful. Love the L'Occitane bath products. Sunset is beautiful. All in all it's perfect. The restaurants were not that great, so I'm leaving them out of this review and reviewed them on their own. But we have already said we will not stay anywhere else in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to all the hype. Amazing resort.”
Reviews.Author: njgalinwt
Reviews.Content: This hotel lives up to it's 5-star rating in every sense. All the reviews are very accurate as to how great it is. I have stayed on other resorts on Maui, and this is THE place to stay if you are willing to spend a little extra. We were able to get a good deal with 5th night free. We also booked the lower room (mountain view) and were able to upgrade to a partial ocean. If you are going during a slow time, I wouldn't spend the extra money for a better view. There are very few rooms with exceptional straighton ocean views, and you get a better view pool side for sunsets. Rooms: Very large. Pristine condition. Beds are very very comfy. Bathrooms are huge, bigger than my bedroom at home, with every amenity you need. They came twice a day and refolded all of my clothes I had laying out. Lined up all my bath products. Really exceptional attention to detail. Service: Top notch. Our car (valet is $20/day) arrived right away whether we called ahead or not. These people hustled. Pool service was amazing. Set up our towel on our chair each day. And what I loved is that it's first come first serve. You can get any chair you want, with a cabana or without. No extra $$ for shade. And there were more than enough seats. And anyone who is gone more than 2 hours they pick up the stuff. The pool attentants came by with ice water every 15 minutes, pop cicyles at 2:30, aloe at 4, etc. It really never ended. And they remember your name from the beginning. I left my watch at that pool and they knew I was sitting there and called me later to tell me I left it. Pool/Beach: Property is raised from the ocean so you can't see the beach from the chairs, but I think it provided more breeze. You either sit poolside and face in, or a little aways from the pool facing the ocean. They are building a new adult-only pool which is very needed. Was supposed to be completed early April but they seem a good 5-6 months away from the look of it. The pools just aren't big enough for the size of the resort currently. The beach is fantastic with attendants there to help you get a chair or umbrella (no extra cost). Spa: My massage was great, but I was very upset there was a coed relaxation room. The robes are paper thin and the women sit clutching themselves while the men sit with their legs wide open with nothing on underneath. Not very relaxing. Plus you need to walk outside into the spa lobby in front of other people milling about to get to the relaxation room and your treatment. The layout of the spa is just designed correctly or efficiently. HOwever l liked that tip was not automatically included as some other spas do so you can give based on the service. Grounds/Property/Gym: Pristine. Beautiful fountains. They also have a game room with pool tables, etc. which is great to kill a few hours here and there. Also good for kids, however I couldn't find any. I think FS squirrels them away in FS camp or something. The gym has everything you need (no extra cost) with cardio completely in an open door area. There are free fitness classes each day too. Can't beat it! Restaurants: Had breakfast at Duo one day. Buffet was $80 for two people. They mistakenly charged us $160 upon checkout. Check your folio! I wouldn't say any breakfast is worth $40 per person but that's Hawaii. Lunch and Dinner at Ferraro's is well worth it. Meals are huge and the view is exceptional. I would recommend only doing Lunch or Breakfast. You really don't need both. We had very bad service one day at lunch, but the manager could tell and was all over us with apologizes. I think our waiter was new and not up to FS standards. If you need a cheap eating night, go to Matteo's pizza right near the resort. They have pasta and pizza very very cheap. You have to order at a counter but the bring the food to you. Two people ran $27 for dinner. Overall, I say spend at least a few days here. The only negative it has spoiled me for any other resort.

Reviews.Title: “Only negative was...”
Reviews.Author: nealson77
Reviews.Content: that the weather in Maui is so nice that the pavement around the pool is too hot to walk in with bare feet. Aside fror that this was the best hotel experience we've ever had. No better place to spend a week on your honeymoon. You read the reviews and think you know what to expect, and you end up still being amazed. Its as if they feed their employees happy pills every morning when they show up from work, from the valet staff, to the concierge, to the front desk, to the cleaning staff to the waiters to the pool attendants. The breakfast, while a bit pricey at $34 for a buffet is very very good and if you like a late breakfast you won't need to eat lunch. The views from ferraro's their Italian restaraunt are great for a sunset dinner and just fine to grab a good lunch for $20/person plus drinks. Rooms are huge and recently renovated, bathrooms might as well be a 2nd bedroom they are so large. the suntan lotion stations are a nice bonus and if you like to drink water while you sit n the sun, your cup will never be empty as the staff are constanly refilling your cup along with coming around with other little snacks throughout the day. yes its an expensive hotel, but if I were to ever spend the money again, it would be at this hotel. Only other negative is it makes every other hotel seem like there is something wrong with it.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Spoils You for Every other Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NHTina
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Maui and our first to this Four Seasons. We stayed at the Four Seasons on the Big Island two years ago- and at the Ritz in Kapalua on our last visit to Maui. This part of Maui looks so different from Kapalua- almost like one is at Palm Beach in Fl- very built up- beautiful road to the hotel. All quite posh...and doesn't really feel very Hawaiian. At Hualalai, the property is so much more an intregal part of the Island experience. But never-the-less this is a lovely setting with a very wide, long beach with the Island of Lanai in the distance. And the beach is very swimable- relatively gentle waves, easy access, soft sand. The pool at the Four Seasons is a litle small- they are just finishing another. It does get a bit crowded but they are outstanding at finding chairs and have great chair policies...all free...what a novel thought! We had a welcoming check-in and were upgraded. After the bellman left us, we began to notice that the room had an unpleasant musty odor. I called the front desk and she simply said she would call housekeeping. We were tired from traveling and just wanted to go to the pool. Housekeeping never came or called and after a bit I was feeling a little desperate so I called again...and may have sounded a tiny bit close to tears. Within 5 minutes the Front Desk Manager was at the door and moved us himself to a beautiful, fresh room with a fabulous view. Any hotel can have problems, its how those problems are solved that makes a great hotel. We received two notes apologizing from Management and a box of chocolates. Nice job. We had a lovely stay. The food is outstanding at Ferraros- best setting. Another couple told us not to go to Spagos- not worth it so we didn't. We ate once at Duos- good but not as good as Ferraros. All terribly expensive but they are happy to split meals- a great way to enjoy appetizers, entrees and desserts without leaving the table too full to walk! Excellent wine- there's a perfect Rose for lunch- don't miss it. All in all, the Four Seasons experience is the most civilized anywhere. The staff manage to make you feel like they really want to help you and enjoy doing it- always friendly without ever being pretentious. Its just SO pampering and delicious! PS. We stopped by the Ritz on our way to the Airport...it recently had a big renovation...VERY disappointing.....I would choose the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven”
Reviews.Author: tbari
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon for 5 nights, followed by another 5 nights in Kauai at the Grand Hyatt. This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at (I have stayed in many). The decor and ambiance is very clean and luxurious, but the service is by far what makes this place amazing. We lounged poolside for most of our time and the service at the cabanas was unreal (and everything was free). Workers would prepare our chairs with towels, ice water was constantly replenished throughout the day, there were light snacks passed around, sunglass cleaning, avian mist spray...the list goes on. The pool facility was great -- many open chairs with different views and options (poolside, beachfront, privacy, etc). The hotel is also located in Wailea and on a great beach with impeccably clean sand and calm water. Last thing - the rooms themselves were great, especially the bathrooms, which were all marble and huge.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: havegoodgetgive
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to maui and the Four Seasons. We got a great rate on a mountain view room. We didn't mind the mountain view because not much time is spent in the room and hotel service is the same regardless of your room choice. The rooms are nice and not decorated in cheesy colors. The bathroom was awesome, with marble on the floors, shower, and sink area. The toilet had a door on it which we really thought was cool. The bed is incredibly soft. The sitting area was nice and simple, a couch with a coffee table. We used the internet access at a charge of $60/5 days. I wasn't able to get the wireless working but a cable was provided so that wasn't an issue. I really liked the robes and wanted to take one home but we didn't have enough room in our luggage for it. Our only complaint is how far the room is from the elevator. Since the elevators are near the ocean side of the hotel, if you stay in a mountain view room you have to walk halfway around the hotel to get there. All of the staff was awesome, with friendly and attentive service. When we go back again, we will definitely be staying here again. Highly recommended. You MUST do the complimentary outrigger canoe program they offer in the mornings. They are not highly publicized but it is one of their best amenities. The weight room was adequate but the cardio room is awesome. Its open air with TVs on all machines and they have plenty to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't get better for Maui”
Reviews.Author: UPtraveller1
Reviews.Content: Hotel is amazng. Extremely kid friendly, but als geared toward adults as well. Spag is great if you sit outside. Must get cabanas reserved if you can. The beach is great. Kids pool was fantastic. Had a yearly board meeting here and the meeting space was great as well. The concierge is outstanding. They arranged a private loau with fire twirlers, band and the whole 9 yards. Kids had a blast and so did the adults. Golf at wailea is good, although be prepared for a long round as they have some less than average players. We had a one bedroom ocean front prime suite. We have stayed in this room twice now and it has a larger balcony/terrace than the other rooms. DVD player in roomwas great for the kids. They had a crib set up for our infant with all sorts of baby goodies. It really doesn't get any better in hawaii. Scuba off the beach was great- we got certified at the hotel. breakfast on the terrace every morning couldnt have been more relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiciously wonderful to us and our son”
Reviews.Author: Seattle234
Reviews.Content: My husband and 2 1/2 year old little boy just got back from a vacation in Maui and stayed at the Four Seasons (4/29 - 5/4). We were supposed to go to Mexico, but due to the swine flu, we canceled our trip last minute and decided to go to Maui. We were considering staying at the Fairmont next door, since it was going to be $200/night cheaper for the same 1 bedroom suite room, but I had heard from coworkers that the Four Seasons could not be passed up, so I forked over the extra $200/night and do not regret it for one minute. From the moment we got there the service was impeccable. I was nervous that such a nice place wasn't going to be great for a toddler, but while I was checking us in, someone had already come up to my husband and son with a basket of toys asking him to pick one. Also, they had upgraded us to a partial ocean view suite without me having to ask. Within 10 minutes of us settling in to our room, we got a knock on our door and they had a basket of goodies for my husband and I and for my son, they had bath toys which were filled with cookies, gummy bears and some chocolate milk. I had also asked them to bring me a crib, and when I got it, it was a beautiful brass crib along with a diaper genie, a basket of swim diapers and regular diapers as well as organic baby bath products! We spent our days at the pool (free cabanas) where they brought us muffins in the morning, watermelon, jello and cold refreshing cloths in the afternoon and aloe vera in the evenings (all complimentary!) They also brought you cold water throughout and set up your towels and chairs for you. We saw lots of families with babies and they would even bring you a pack & play for your baby if needed. The staff was so friendly and willing to help with anything. The night before we left, they had brought a book and some animal crackers for our son. When we checked out, the valets gave us water for our ride to the airport along with printed directions and jelly bellys for a snack. We only ate brunch at the hotel, which was delicious but pricey at $35/head. Kids under 5 eat free at all restaurants in the hotel except Spago. We tried brunch at the Fairmont and it was nothing compared to the Four Seasons...definitely not worth it. The property was gorgeous. Elegant and classy and not "hawaiian" cheesy at all. The rooms were clean and simple. Our room was a 1 bed suite with 2 flat screens and 2 dvd players, dining table (inside and one on the deck). The bathroom was HUGE and there were all L'Occitane products which was fantastic! I could go on and on about the resort - it was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: mkg623
Reviews.Content: Worth every penny. You will be spoiled like you've never been spoiled before. Expect to pay top dollar, but you knew that when you booked. The pool, the beach, the service, the location, everything you can ask for right in paradise. I would not recommend the Italian restaurant...it's outdoors and all sort of crawling things can get near your food. Aside from that, it was a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Vacation Hotel, #1 Service”
Reviews.Author: Sindhurs
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 6 night trip at the Four Seasons Maui. We had booked an executive suite and were upgraded to a ocean front suite upon arrival. Personalized bath sponges with names and an ocean front suite, with the beach bag and a view that was breathtaking. Room was impecable. Service was superb. Kids club was a hit with the children. Cabanas and beach materials were free allowing you to relax right on the ocean. Great location to run . Running about 4 miles on the path between the Fairmont and the Marriott and the beach was a breath taking experience. Breakfast at DUOs is fabulous and one can skip lunch. Not a lot of options of picky vegetarians but staff do go great lengths to make sure guests needs are addressed. Had a late checkout and the staff went out of their way to provide us with an alternate room till 4:00 p.m Expensive but well worth the money as lots of complimentary services are included such as the kids club, beach chairsand cabanas. A memorable experince that is worth saving for.

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfectionâ€¦”
Reviews.Author: nairb9
Reviews.Content: The service we experienced was simply flawless, to the point where my wife and I would occasionally start laughing since it was simply so over the top, in the very best sense. At one point my wife phoned-in an early wake-up call, and the observant receptionist asked if we were planning for sunrise on the volcano summit. When my wife confirmed, she preceded to askâ€¦ â€œâ€¦shall we have your car ready for youâ€¦â€� â€œâ€¦would you like two blankets in the car, since it gets cold up thereâ€¦â€� â€œâ€¦might it be helpful if we put bottled waters in the carâ€¦â€� â€œâ€¦do you think youâ€™ll enjoy warm banana bread and coffee that weâ€™ll have in the lobby for youâ€¦â€� Finally, she asked the one question that defines the full extent of customer orientation for a wake-up call almost anywhere else: â€œâ€¦would you like a second wake-up call a little laterâ€¦â€� Again, when my wife put down the phone she looked at me and just laughed. No doubt some other hotels will provide water and blankets and valet service, and maybe even warm banana bread, if you ask. The point of this gracious, proactive level of service is that we didnâ€™t even need to ask. We simply asked for a wake-up call. This is just one tiny example among dozens we could share, where the staff was over-the-top attentive and helpful. After 30 years observing all sorts of businesses, it seemed to me this hotel has brought customer service to an art form, unlike anything I had ever experienced before. We found the facility to be beautiful, perfectly maintained, and adorned with interesting art. Our room was spacious and sparkling fresh, as if brand new. The pool area is perfectly tuned for adult relaxation, and the attentive poolside service is at once constantly pampering yet unobtrusive. The open-air lobby bar, overlooking pool and ocean, is a perfect place to relax and enjoy the nightly entertainment. Of all the restaurants, we especially liked Ferraroâ€™s â€“ great food and excellent service. For most of us, Four Season prices seem like crazy-money. But if you can find your way here, ultimately youâ€™ll discover your stay is worth every penny. If youâ€™re looking for the perfect, memorable place to relax with your significant other, stay at the Four Seasons Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtakingly splendid”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkLuxtraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our one year anniversary, and we were completely enamored. Every detail was wonderfully taken care of. Excellent service, the concierge booked outings and took care of all our needs. On site the restaurants were great, Wolfgang Puck was a bit of scene. We lunched by the poolside restaurant daily. The room was amazing, clean and the softest sheets ever! We loved it, it meets all that you expect from a Four Seasons property.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: h2opolodad
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the FS on Maui annually since 1994, and I keep waiting to be disappointed. But year after year, the FS Maui impresses me just as much as it did the first time we stayed back in 1994. From the staff to the pools to the fitness center to the beach, I can see why this hotel receives awards year after year for its' services. For us, it is like a home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Has spoiled me for anything else!”
Reviews.Author: jblehner
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and two young children (ages 4 and 2) and thought it was wonderful! The staff, from the valets to the concierge to housekeeping to the waitstaff, were all, in one word, impeccable--and not in a fake, obseqious kind of way. Everyone seemed genuinely friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable--and really made a point to make one feel like a valued guest and not just a room number. I think it is very difficult to find a high-end hotel that is as family-friendly as it is luxe--but the Four Seasons has managed that balance beautifully. Our kids were two young for the children's programs at the Four Seasons, but they were treated so, so well--they got to pick out special toys upon check-in and when we first got to our room, there were welcome baskets with yummy snacks and pool toys--and their names spelled out in bath sponges on the edge of the tub. They ate free in each of the hotel's restaurants and got to enjoy the heated kids' pool and the concierge very efficiently arranged babysitting for us a couple of nights--the one we had was very competent and both of our kids really liked her. I really can't think of anything I didn't like here. The only thing that wasn't perfect was the somewhat long wait for room service--about 45 minutes--which was much longer than service in any of the restaurants. The hotel was upfront about how long it took, though. That's about it, though--otherwise, this is by far one of the nicest places I've ever stayed and I would recommend it enthusiastically and without reservation to a friend. The service really makes it the experience that it is, but the property and location are lovely and the food was uniformly delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Paradise”
Reviews.Author: SunsetKakes
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Four Seasons, after spending 5 days here. This was our first trip to Maui. I did extensive reviewing of hotels on TripAdvisor, and after reading all of the positive remarks, decided to book our stay here. This hotel is everything that has been stated in the previous remarks. From the minute you arrive, to the time you leave, you are pampered and made to feel welcome. The staff cannot do enough for you. When you read the Four Seasons core values/mission statement, you will understand why! Yes, it is expensive to stay here, but one has to keep "cost" in perspective, between the tangible and the intangible. I would recommend that you call the hotel personally to book your stay - we were able to negotiate the stay 4 nights/ 1 night free, plus the breakfast buffet at Duo, while staying on the club floor. This option was not available on line. Do not be afraid to negotiate, if the requests are fair and not outrageous, they appear to be most accomodating. The one downside to the stay was dinner at Ferraro's. It was most disappointing - pasta that was served cold and molded to the bowl it was served in, and somewhat tasteless besides. The waiter knew that we were not pleased, and as a gesture of good will, waived the bar tab. That was only one night though, the other nights we ventured out of the hotel for dinner. The buffet at Duo will keep you going the entire day - you will not need to eat lunch! My husband used the exercise equipment, and they have all sorts of classes throughout the morning. There is plenty to do if you so desire, you will not be bored. The location is perfect, along a nice walkway between several hotels and a high-end shopping center. I believe it is about a 3 mile circuit, so it's nice to walk it , without much effort. The location is also very convenient from the airport, pretty much a straight road and easy to navigate, especially at night. Although the Four Seasons is fairly large, the way it has been constructed does not give you that feeling, in comparison to the Grand Wailea next door, which reminds me of a mega resort in Vegas - very circus-like, and noisy. We enjoyed our stay immensely, and would not hesitate to return here.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, location, and fine service.”
Reviews.Author: Travels4workand4fun
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this wonderful resort for a corporate meeting mixing work with pleasure. Dinner at Spago featured local fish, superbly prepared and presented and served on a luxurious outdoor terrace. The breakfast buffet at Duo is the perfect way to start the day. Poolside and beach service runs from 10-6 each day, and it's easy to spend the whole day under a free cabana (first come, first serve) drinking wine and eating delicacies from Ferraro. The conference facilities almost make attending business meetings while on Maui half the fun. Banquet services are among the best I've ever had. There are free amenities everywhere you turn... scuba lesson at 1 p.m.? Free. Tai Chi class at 8 a.m.? Free. Outrigger canoe lesson at 9:45 a.m.? Free. Every day they give you a list of fun things to try out. The free goodies almost make up for the $12 tropical drinks and $24 chicken quesadilla you ate poolside. Upon check-in we were delighted to receive an upgrade to an Executive Suite (Room 786 - see my posted photos). The suite had a dining room, living room, bedroom separated by plantation shuttered doors, large bathroom with private w/c, tub, shower, dressing mirror, and double vanity, two plasma televisions, ipod dock, and DVD players with built in card-readers for reviewing your digital photos in the bedroom and living room. The suite also had balconies, one with a table for four, the other with two chaise lounges. The suite has a connecting door to room 788, and can be made into a 2BR/2BA suite as a result. The only drawback was that in addition to a fine ocean view, you also have a view of the Grand Wailea resort and its car-park. Each morning the noise of recycling trucks and groundskeepers started around 6 a.m. - fortunately we were rising early each day for activities.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great week”
Reviews.Author: mcgee_w
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week while my spouse had a conference at the Grand Wailea. We were here with our preschooler and our infant and had a great time. The resort staff was professional and always there when we needed them. Our kids had a great time splashing in the kiddie pool (not as warm as we would have liked) and playing in the sand. The pack & play and free cabanas were a big plus - we didn't have to pay for anything and it was nice to be able to come & go as we pleased - we didn't feel like "We paid $200 for a cabana; we need to stay here all day to get our money's worth." We were there for 8 days and our kids probably got snacks in our room on 4 or 5 of them. The fridge was great for storing water & milk. The bathroom was huge, with kid-friendly toiletries and an infant tub provided. The kids amenities in general were great - a crib w/actual crib sheets, diapers, stepstool for the bathroom, infant tub, etc. The hotel staff were friendly and accommodating - our preschooler fell asleep during an early dinner at Spago and I didn't have a blanket - staff brought out a tablecloth for me to use as a blanket till we got back to our room. The pool staff were wonderful with extra towels and treats - fresh cut fruit, popsicles, water, etc. I second the call to attend the manager's reception - they have maitais, water, and wine, but brought out milk for our kids. The hotel restaurants were tasty, but we only ate at Spago once and Duo (for dinner once and breakfast twice). The food was great, though expensive. We paid a lot of money for a steak at Duo - but it was excellent and the service was impeccable. We had gone to Cafe O'Lei in Kihei the night before for steak and left more than half of it - it was inedible, unseasoned, and tough. I'd rather pay $50 for a steak I'll eat than $25 for a steak I won't. The breakfast was great - and they gave us to-go containers for snacks for our kids (fresh fruit, a bagel). If you eat the breakfast, you won't need to eat until 6 or 7 at night. My spouse went over to the Grand Wailea every day and commented on how huge it was. I loved the scale of the Four Seasons. I wouldn't hesitate to go back - we just need to save up the money first!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!! You won't want to leave.”
Reviews.Author: Mleighp1
Reviews.Content: WOW!!! Great experience here. From the moment you walk into the lobby, you know that you are in for something special. This architecture and design of this place is very classy but casual. They did a fabulous job of making you feel like you are at the best resort on the island without making it feel stuffy and pretentious. I loved the open airy feel of the lobby and lounge. Its a great spot for a drink to watch sunset and listen to live soft music. We paid for a garden view room and were upgraded to a partial ocean view one bedroom suite. The room was so nice, almost too nice because it makes you want to spend more time in your room and less time at the beach! The bathroom was huge and had an awesome makeup area for the ladies. The alarm clocks have an ipod docking station which was really nice. Oh, and in the bathroom there is a sound system with four or five types of music you can listen to. I put on the Hawaiian music every night while I got ready for dinner. Very nice touch. The rooms had two large plasma tvs, two closets, a dining room, a living room, a large bedroom, large bathroom, and two lanai's facing the ocean. The only thing I didn't like about this room was that it was on the outer perimeter of the hotel and in the morning around five thirty you could hear a faint beeping noise from the delivery trucks backing in the service area of the hotel. It wasn't extremely loud though and everything else about the hotel made it seem very unimportant. The pool was gorgeous!! The attendants at the pool are great. You walk up to the pool and scope out a spot to sit and they instantly come to greet you with towels in arm and find you a spot, set up your lounge chairs with the towels, and then the bring you ice water. There are stations with free suntan lotion in SPF 8,15, and 30. Throughout the day the attendants come by with fresh fruit, cucumbers for your eyes, popcicles, jello, muffins, etc. They wait on you hand and foot and bring you food and drinks if you want. Poolside lunch doesn't come cheap though. Expect to pay $12 for a mai tai and $30 for a burger and fries. I got the mixed sushi and shrimp platter each day which came with four pieces of sashimi ahi tuna, four pieces of a california roll, and four pieces of shrimp and it was $34. There are two large hottubs at the pool that are kept at the perfect temp. The pool was too cold to swim in, for me but I did see a few brave souls tough it out. There are three restaurants on site as well as a lounge area in the lobby where you can order food. We ate in all four locations. Ferraros was by far the best meal we ate. The setting was amazing. Spago was a disappointment. Duo is where we ate breakfast and it was nice, but also very expensive. Basically, don't come to this hotel unless you are comfortable with spending $1500 a day on room and food, at a minimum. The beach off the hotel is very nice. The best sand I've ever walked on! Some nice scuba and snorkel there as well. We also rented kayaks and saw some whales; there are tons just playing around in the water right off the resort. I believe the kayaks were free for the first hour and are $5 each hour after. The food and rooms at this place are expensive, but they do not nickel and dime you for stuff and there are a lot of great amenities that come with this place. You will have tons of L'Occitane products in your room, the snorkel and kayaks are free to use, you get free suntan lotion, free internet, free exercise facilities and classes, you get spoiled and pampered at the pool, and when we left, the valet packed water and towels in our car for our ride on the road to Hana. I said, "But we arent coming back, so we wont' return the towels" and he said to me "you spend 10K on a trip here. we don't care about a few towels". One of the things I liked the most about this place is how small the resort feels. We walked over to Grand Wailea next door and that place felt so big, almost like walking through a casino in vegas where you are totally lost and disoriented because its a maze and so big. Not to mention, their ground were run down and after a half hour of walking around there, I was like "Get me out of this ghetto!". The Four Seasons is so much nicer and feels a lot more intimate. If you are trying to decide between the two, go with Four Seasons. There is no comparison. Overall, there is so much to love about this place. If you can swing it financially, definitely give this place a visit. You will want to move in, I promise you that!! I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Incomparable!”
Reviews.Author: JazzManSeattle
Reviews.Content: We love staying in luxury hotels and resorts and love to try different places. Last year we stayed at the Four Seasons and by the second day we were ready to book again! This second stay was even better than the first. Members of the staff remembered us by name. Comfortable beds, We are treated like Royalty by all staff members. To put it simply. I have favorite restaurants that I frequent and, even though I know they have several great entrees, I always order the same one over and over. Maui is the restaurant and the Four Seasons is the entree. We'll be back again next February.

Reviews.Title: “Very NICE and worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: gypsymoth05
Reviews.Content: We stay here and at the Grand Wailea next door. Four Season is EXCELLENT. Very clean and beautiful. Close to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “indulgent and beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: Geetika
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the four seasons feb 23-26. We received a complimentary upgrade to an ocean view room. The room, the service and the location was flawless! I went to work out and someone brought me a drink and a towel and head phones! Everyone greets you with a smile and a warm welcome. If you are sitting at the pool, attendants offer towels, water sptrizes, watermelon pieces, water, even sunscreen all for free! They also have a drinks and snacks for purchase. There are also 5-6 free classes offered every day, free internet (computers in the game room) and hula dances in the evening in the lobby. The Four Seasons gets it right! Complete luxury and indulgent pampering. The only "negative" is the quality of the food. My friends and I are foodies and the quality of food and service at Spago's was underwhelming - especially for the price. Orchids in Waikiki was far superior all around as far as restaurants go. I would definitely visit the Four Seasons again; a phenomenal experience.

Reviews.Title: “The ultimate getaway!”
Reviews.Author: seetheworld006
Reviews.Content: From our first time on the phone with them to the day we checked out...the service at this hotel is impecable! These people remember your name everywhere and great you accordingly. Hello Mr. so and so and the pool, hello Mr and Mrs. so and so at the front desk. Everyone there knows your name! It makes your experience awsome! Not only are the facilities and location absolutely gorgeous! The spa, pool, and beach are amaxing. I cant wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “What recession?”
Reviews.Author: M-man11
Reviews.Content: With hotel occupancy down at so many properties in Maui and the state as a whole, the Four Seasons at Wailea manages to maintain an average of 70 to 75%. Of course, this might explain why the scores in Zagat are so high and why the hotel received its 5th star from Mobil, the only Hawaiian property to do so. But I am now fully aware of the mystique that pervades this place. Even though my wife and I regularly spend a month in Maui, it has long been a wish to spend a few nights here. This time we decided to spend the last three nights before flying back to the mainland. Neither my wife nor I had a birthday nor were we celebrating any special occasion. We just wanted to be here. We booked a partial view room and were given an ocean view room, with a peak of the ocean from the pillow. Because so much has already been said (and these reviews were really the factors that led me to book this place), I wish simply to point out some information that hasn't really been discussed. By all means, arrange your visit to fall on a Wednesday so that you can participate in the Manager's reception. Here you get to mingle not only with other guests but mainly with the staff. And the staff use this opportunity to find out for themselves how everything is operating. Brian, the food and beverage manager, introduced us--and the guests around us--to three chefs from the three main restaurants here (Duo, Spago, Ferraro's). Each chef brought out an appetizer for all to try. Another "Brain" does not usually get much recognition. He is the operator of the Business Center and can offer a wealth of information on cameras, computers, I guess anything! Check out the photos he's taken--they're for sale at realistic prices. He is the one we should have asked about battery chargers since the Concierge was unable to provide information. And by all means ask for the self-guided Art Tour booklet. Even though the Grand Wailea has a wealth of Western art, check out the collection here at the Four Seasons. Better yet, arrange for a tour on Friday. Many have written about how generous the hotel is. Did you know that a free whale-watch tour is available at Ma'alaea Harbor? You just have to contact the Concierge and arrange to be at the harbor before 2:00. Although several of us might raise our eyebrows at a $32 breakfast buffet, you will not need to eat until dinner. And please consider the Lobby Lovel Bar. Yes, it is a bar and there are bar and food menus, but one can order anything off of any menu from the restaurants at the hotel. What kind of place offers that kind of service?? And if the two of you share a salad and main course, the bill will be almost affordable. But then again, guests do not come here based on the affordability of the hotel. But when we checked out, I noticed that our original room rate quote had gone down $50 per night. Somebody is performing alchemy and trying to draw us back.

Reviews.Title: “Best week of my life”
Reviews.Author: PatUNH1980
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing place. Be prepared to pay through the nose for meals/drinks/etc, but it is worth every penny. If you don't like it here, you will never find a hotel you like. We were upgraded to a Jr. Suite without asking. Everyone knew our names. Unbelievable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: junybee
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was truly amazing. I stayed from Jan 18- 23, 2009 and I can tell you the waters were calm enough for me to swim and snorkel. I even took a free scuba lesson from the hotel and upgraded for an ocean swim off the beach of the hotel. I got some great pictures of me swimming next to a sea turtle! Anyway, you are pampered here. The massages at the Spa are amazing. Ask for Kanoe (pronounced Kanoy). On the beach, you are treated to free suntan lotion, free pineapple, served ice water. If you want shade, they set up the umbrella for you and bring you a table. One evening, we had late reservations for dinner, at the Fairmont, next door. Since we were running late, we decided to fore go the 10 minute walk and asked to be driven there, even though we had a car. No problem, were were chauffered by a lovely lady in a fancy SUV. Upon hearing that it was my birthday, she immediately got on the phone, even though we were pulling up in the drive way (It was only a 3 min. drive) and announced that we were arriving and that it was my b-day, and to please make sure someone greeted me. I was greeted by the valet who knew my name, with leis and escorted to the restaurant. That was amazing coordination with the Fairmont. Anyway, when we returned to the Four Seasons, they had laid out a tray of fancy chocolates with a realistic white chocolate seashell, overflowing with brown sugar to similate sand. It accompanied a personally signed happy birthday card from the resort manager It truly put a fantastic touch to my birthday! Kudos to 4 seasons!

Reviews.Title: “Can I Live At The Four Seasons Maui?”
Reviews.Author: delena76
Reviews.Content: I've read reviews about this hotel before and after my stay which was from January 23-26, 2009 and any one who has any complaints about this hotel is a complete nut. A co-worker convinced me to convince my SO to change hotels (he wanted to stay at the Ritz) because the Ritz was on the rainy side of Maui and also because they charged to stay in a cabana (4 Seasons cabanas are FREE). Although I haven't traveled as much as my SO and this is my first time in a 5 star hotel, my SO has traveled the world and he has stayed at top level accomodations and even he was impressed. Let me tell you about my stay and experiences from before we even arrived in Maui. They emailed before we left to find out when we were going to land. I told my co-worker that and she said they want to make sure everything is ready for you as soon as you get to the hotel. We rented a car and were immediately greeted by staff with leis when we pulled up. They took our luggage out of the car and the bellman waited for us while we checked in (took less than 5 minutes). We were greeted with warm friendly smiles and I felt as if they were so excited for us to be there. The staff didn't seem phony or pretentious at all. While we walked to check-in we were greeted by another staff member with a small cup of a delicious fruity drink/tea. I wish I could remember what it was but it was refreshing. My co-worker told us whenever she came they always upgraded her but I wanted to come right out and ask. At check-in they had ALREADY upgraded us! We booked a mountainside room which is the lowest they have at $500 a night and we were upgraded to an ocean-view room, right in the center of the u-shape with a straight view of the courtyard and ocean - it couldn't have been any better! Also, before we went upstairs our bellman gave us a 3 minute tour of the property. The room was HUGE. High ceilings, double sinks, separate shower and tub, separate toilet area. Two terry cloth robes were in the bathroom as well. At the desk there was a box of delicious desserts. The balcony was big with two lounge chairs, ottomans and a table. The pool was a great size. We were told the cabanas were hard to come by and that some people have the nerve to put their towels, etc. on the chair and then disappear. But we were told by a staff member who greeted us when we were walking towards the pool that after I believe 45 minutes if they don't come back the cabana is up for grabs. Instead of us having to walk around and search for one a staff member searched FOR US. She gave us a menu and we ordered drinks and lunch from Ferraro's (delicious by the way). During our stay in our cabana facing the ocean, they came by numerous times to make sure we were okay. I loved the fact that I didn't have to wait forever before someone came to check on us. Three times they came by with: a spritz of water to our faces to cool us off, watermelon and popsicles. I mean, can I get this treatment at home?!?! By the way - order the frozen mai tai served in a pineapple - it is to die for! One morning we took a trip to watch the sunrise at Haleakala and took the road to Hana and the concierge was very helpful with that. They gave us blankets (because it's freezing and windy up there) and they gave us towels in case we wanted to go to the beach. They also gave us two bottles of water. Food: as stated earlier for lunch in the cabana we had food from Ferraro's. Our first night we ate at Spago's and I remember I had pork with caramelized onions and it was absolutely delicious. Our last night we ate at Duo's and once again it was awesome. I had the crispy free range chicken and for the first time ever at any restaurant I finished the entire thing!! Yes everything in Hawaii is expensive and I'm not sure why but I wouldn't complain - it wasn't like it was unreasonable. Every waiter we had at the restaurants was very knowledgeable and friendly. And the drinks are on point! During this time the temperature is only about 65 degrees but each restaurant had heaters and they put one near me at Duo and I warmed up right way. FYI during the winter pack more than one pair of pants and more than one sweater/long sleeve shirt. Bring a jacket too. I also loved the fact that every day they had complimentary coffee, tea and hot chocolate with a breakfast muffin/pastry near check-in or in front of Duo. So I got to have my hot chocolate before I went up the mountain. We are a young couple (I'm 32 he's 37) and we did wish that there were more young people like us to hang with. During our stay there were people in their 50's and 60's here - but I would still come here again regardless. As far as location we were about 30 minutes from OGG airport and the center of town was about 25 minutes away (where Kmart/Wal-Mart are) and the shops at Wailea Village are just a quarter of a mile up the road. When you walk towards the beach from the 4 Seasons property there is this path that takes you to other properties. We walked one way but didn't walk the opposite direction and it's a great walk. Most people used this path to jog and speed walk. It makes for a great stroll and there are great views of the sun setting. After all of this if you decide not to stay here you are out of your mind. I'm sure we received the upgrade because it is off season and it isn't that crowded and that is a perfect reason to travel in the off season but the friendly staff and the little touches just makes it all worthwhile. I was so upset that we didn't get to stay longer, one because I wanted to see more of Maui and two because I knew we weren't going to get this treatment at our next destination in Honolulu. This is my first time staying at a 5 star hotel and my SO paid for this entire trip but now that he has spoiled me I am finding it hard to want to stay at anything less (I'm actually typing this from the Hilton Hawaiian Village in Honolulu which stinks by the way - see my review later next week!) and I wish there was a 4 Seasons on this island so I can stay there instead. I can see why the 4 Seasons has been voted by Tripadvisor members as the #1 hotel brand in the world and best for romance and luxury. DON'T STAY ANYWHERE ELSE!! If you would like more pictures of the property (I can only put up 10 I believe) feel free to send me a personal message and I will send you a link with more pictures! Aloha!!

Reviews.Title: “3rd time at the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: looper63
Reviews.Content: What can I say, the Four Seasons Wailea is one of the best hotels in the world. They know how to do it all, accomodations, service, staff, restaurants, they overachieve in all categories. Thanks again for another wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: am470
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights in the Four Seasons Resort Maui. I must preface my review by stating that my husband and I are frequent luxury travelers. I am a hard sell when it comes to hotels. We got upgraded to a partial ocean view. The actual room is beautiful and large. I would not pay for a partial ocean view. In order to see the ocean, you would need to stand in the corner of the lanai. You could not see it from the room. I wasn't crazy about how the hotel was laid out. It is very large and sprawling. If you want beachfront and ocean views this might not be the hotel for you. The hotel is set back on a cliff. So your view of the water is really obstructed even when you are laying by the pool. The beach was also disappointing. The sand isn't white and powdery. It is brown and grainy. The water was also too rough and cool to swim in, but that was probably because it was January. The buffet breakfast is pricey but definitely worth it. It was probably the best buffet breakfast I have had at a hotel. We ate dinner at Spago. It was good, not great. So the resort is far from bad, but it definitely did not meet or exceed my expectations. Perhaps, this is because I have become accustomed to a higher level of service with other hotel chains (CC Africa, Oberoi, etc.). The concierge was definitely subpar. They made a number of mistakes with our bookings and seemed ambivalent when answering our questions.

Reviews.Title: “True Luxury”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTravellerSSV
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in April, and we had a fantastic time. Four Seasons is amazing! We stayed in a partial ocean view room - the rooms are a good size with a huge stunning bathroom. The room was very luxurious though the views could have been better...you could only see the ocean view when stepping out on the balcony. The hotel grounds and pools are beautifully maintained. You can reach the beautiful beach by just walking down the stairs at the main pool. We tried two restaurants at resort Spago and Duo - both served great food though Spagos should not be missed - everything was delicious. The hotel offers a free shuttle to wailea shops however to reach the larger shopping centre(which has Macys dept store!) you will need to take a 30 minute taxi ride. The staff were extremely friendly, professional and very accomodating - excellent service! Overall, we had an amazing experience and l would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Orchid Salon”
Reviews.Author: CanTrav7938
Reviews.Content: Be sure to visit the Orchid salon - fantastic cuts and colors. Even the well heeled locals go there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- My joint favourite in Maui along with Hana Ranch Hotel”
Reviews.Author: britinnyc30
Reviews.Content: Quality! I really enjoyed this hotel. We stayed here after four nights at the Hana Ranch Hotel and even though I missed Hana's seclusion and the villas this place was great for sheer opulence and great service. I definitely recommend it. Best accommodation in Wailea and my joint favourite in Maui along with Hana Ranch Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay anywhere else in Maui”
Reviews.Author: JBG&JGG
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this simple -- if you're looking to live it up in Maui, this is your place. It's on the South side of the island, sunnier side (which is key if you're going in the winter months). The hotel overlooks a beautiful beach with spectacular views; the service is as good as it gets -- hands down the best we've experienced; and the rooms are spacious and very well appointed. It exceeded all expectations and we will certainly go again. Guests who had stayed at both the Four Seasons and Ritz Maui said they would definitely choose the Four Seasons over the Ritz. You can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons for ANY season”
Reviews.Author: propertymanagerfour
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a family trip to the Four Seasons and it was outstanding. Many thanks to the Trip Advisor readers who were very informative in their repsonses to questions I had. As mentioned the resort is terrific. The pluses and minues: Minuses: 1) Very expensive, but as is everything in Wailea. 2) It can be somewhat crowded at the pool area but a new pool is being constructed and will open in May that will alleviate the problem. 3) Daily newspapers not delivered to your door. Just ask and they will deliver a wide selection of papers. Pluses: 1) Hands down the ONLY five star resort on the island. We contemplated staying at the Kea Lani and does not even come close. Kea Lani is definitely in the Marriott class. Grand Wailea to me looked like it was somewhat run down, dated. Trust me, the extra $$$ are worth it to stay at the Four Seasons. 2) Again hands down although expensive by far the best selection of restaurants at any resort on the island. 3) As many have mentioned the level of service leaves little to be desired. I would rather pay 15% more here than being disappointed at the other resorts. 4) Excellent workout area and game room for the kids. The other resorts don't compare. 5)The property I think has the best location on the beach. 6) The concierges were terrific. They had pre-printed maps to every restaurant, sighteeing location that we desired. They were really on top of everything. I don't think you find that at the other resorts. 7) Is suitable for all ages of kids, grownups to infants. During the holdiay season when we were there families have come for years and years. I can see why. Summary: Without a doubt they deserve their reputation. It is THE best resort on the island and one of the top resorts in the country .

Reviews.Title: “Itâ€™s Always Going To Be Like This, Right?”
Reviews.Author: ctb101
Reviews.Content: When I booked the trip, it was difficult to justify the extra cost for the Four Seasons over the nearby Marriott. I mean, the Marriott had free breakfast. But I put my inner cheapskate in a chokehold and booked 5 nights at the Four Seasonsâ€¦..and did not regret it at all. We figured we wouldnâ€™t be spending too much time sitting on the lanai admiring the view, so we booked a garden view room and got the fifth night free. The Four Seasons was the second stop on our honeymoon, and after Hana it was going to take a lot to impress me. The last thing I wanted was a crowded beach and a snooty staff. Fortunately, we didnâ€™t find either in at the Four Seasons Wailea. Everything I heard and read was true. We were greeted at check in with cool towels and tasty orange blossom mint tea. The bellman gave us the nickel tour, offering some good suggestions. The room was, by far, the nicest Iâ€™ve ever stayed in. Large living area, HUGE bathroom and the garden view was very nice with a sliver of ocean thrown in. The entire resort was spotless. Our room was attended to twice a day and every single employee was friendly and helpful. We actually saw a guy cleaning the baseboards of the hallway outside our room. In the morning, we would grab complimentary coffee in the lobby and make our way to the beachwalk. The walk was nice and gave us easy access to the neighboring resorts, and as we walked through them we were glad we sprung for the 4S. Not that the others werenâ€™t nice, but the 4S just attained another level of quality. This was reinforced one morning when stopped by the Marriott for breakfast. I wanted to see what we were passing up by not staying there. It was a small, simple buffet more suited for a holiday inn express. Not bad, but far from spectacular. Breakfast at Duo left it in the dust for a mere $5 more. It wasnâ€™t even a contest. We ate at all the restaurants at the 4S, with the standout being Ferraro. We made an early reservation and had ringside seats for sunset. Absolutely incredible. One evening we decided to forego a proper dinner to hang out in lounge for drinks and appetizers. Overlooking the couryard and pools, we saw a torchligher make his way through the property at sunset. A great experience all the way around. The restaurants were not cheap, but not completely out of line with prices we saw at nearby resorts. The beach was very nice and the pools were immaculate. The staff was very attentive without being a nuisance. As we relaxed on the beach or by the pool, they would come by with cold water, small snacks, sunscreen, etc. The property was far from crowded (we overheard that occupancy was very low, even for low season). Every afternoon, we raided the lobby early and often looking for the orange mint tea. There were gamerooms and internet access downstairs, alongside a sweet gym and shopping. Of course, you are in Hawaii, so who needs that stuff? Seemed like they had lots of activities for kids, but we never really saw many kids. The Shops at Wailea was a short walk away, but it lacks access to the beachwalk, so you have to get to it from the main drag. There are a few places to eat there. Cheeseburger in Paradise was good and hit the spot when we wanted big food. Although usually good, we skipped Tommy Bahamaâ€™s CafÃ© and Ruth Chris because we have those nearby at home. While I preferred the casual relaxation of Hana, the Four Seasons was definitely my wifeâ€™s favorite. We are not really Four Seasons typical customer, but it was our honeymoon and for a special occasion we decided to shoot the moon. In retrospect, this may have been a mistake, because Iâ€™m afraid now she has pretty high expectations for the rest of our marriage. Nodding happily, she kept asking me to reassure herâ€¦.â€œIts always going to be like this, right?â€� â€œSure hon. No problem.â€� Now if I can only find a good recipe for orange blossom mint tea.

Reviews.Title: “Prepare to be spoiled!”
Reviews.Author: KranJams
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. Large & quiet rooms; extremely kid friendly; impeccable grounds; one of the best beaches for swimming and snorkeling on Maui; and amazing service that's not just responsive but anticipates your needs (I won't spoil the surprises except to say the mid-afternoon poolside fruit popsicles were delicious). But here's the thing - the hotel is also a good value. What would typically cost extra at other resorts - such as snorkel gear, scuba lessons, kid's camp - is included in the room price. The only downside is the restaurants will give you sticker shock, even for Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: seattlegirl3
Reviews.Content: This was a gorgeous hotel! We went for our honeymoon and it turned out to be amazing. First, they upgraded us when they found out it was our honeymoon and left us a bottle of champagne in the room. The room was beautiful and the bathroom was huge! The pool was amazing and so was the beach. Great service. We did couples spa treatments and had to go back for a second treatment another day because it was so wonderful. The only downside to this resort is the price... for everything. Food, room service, spa treatments, any snack, anything will cost you... a lot. But I would say it was well worth it if you have the money. We will probably never take another trip like this and will stay at a condo the next time, but for this one time experience I wouldn't have wanted to stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place”
Reviews.Author: Lorin75
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Season in August, it was the most magical hotel I have been too. my boyfriend and I will be coming back thats for sure. from the service at reception to the house keeping. 5 star all the way. Four Seasons chain is now my favourite hotels !

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: kimberlynyc120
Reviews.Content: We went to the Four Seasons Maui to get married and honeymoon from Dec 5-13th. The hotel was really amazing, the service is definitely tops, they do a great job of making sure you have everything you need from water at the pool (your cup is never half empty!) to directions if you're driving to any little thing. They come around the pool with fresh fruit, ice pops and cold towels. They don't say the word "No" a lot, which is the mark of a good hotel. You can get snorkeling equipment for free for an hour at Snorkels. We checked in, got our lei's and our orange mint tea and got upgraded to an Oceanview room which was nice. The bathroom was almost as big as the main room! Loved the L'Occitane toiletries, loved that you can put on music in the bathroom. We were also welcomed with a bottle of my favorite champagne (Veuve Cliquot) and some beautiful truffles. A great start to our trip. Our wedding was pretty low key, just as we wanted it, it was just my fiance and I and it went off without a hitch. Carin, our wedding planner, was amazing. We took photos all around the hotel adn on the beach. I got my hair and makeup done at the Orchid Salon, I cant remember my stylists name but she did a fantastic job. We had the Ultimate Romantic Dinner afterward which is ridiculously expensive on its own ($400...per person!) but I think, totally worth it. It was included in our wedding package so that steepness of the price was a bit masked but we sat down with the head chef of the entire hotel and just talked about our food likes and dislikes and he put together an amazing meal of 5 courses (plus amuse bouche and a bottle of champagne to start) paired with 5 equally amazing of wines to go with each of our courses. We had everything from oysters to hamachi, rib eye, kula greens, ostrich, ono, chocolate souffle and coconut sorbet. We sat nestled in a table ocean front with our own server and music and it was the most romantic dinner I've ever had. Truly a spectacular thing to sip champagne staring out at Wailea Beach. We dined at each of the restaurants in the resort once, they were all actually really good, I was surprised. My husband and I are total foodies and we're a bit hard on restaurants coming from New York and San Francisco respectively. Duo has great sides, the pasta and risotto at Ferraro's was yummy and Spago is just amazing! Try to get a table for two along the right rail overlooking the ocean. Some of the other off site restaurants we went to that people have raved about were just ok I thought like Sansei, I've had far better Japanese (but you cant beat the freshness!) and Capische?, which was Italian, super huge portions, but the food wasn't a 10, it was more like a 7. However, the atmosphere at Capische? was really nice. We sat in the garden and it felt like we were the only table there. If you book the restaurants via the Four Seasons concierge and it's a special occasion the restaurant will recognize it. Also, any restaurants in the Wailes area, like Capische? and Seawatch, the Four Seasons driver will take you to complimentary, which is nice because cabs in Hawaii are expensive. The fact that the hotel was as expensive as it was does create a bit of a damper, as newlyweds. Breakfast at Duo's is really great, a lovely buffet with anything you can ask for, but it's about $75 for breakfast, just for two,which doesnt work for 9 days. We got bagels, fruit, muffins and coffee at Snorkel's which is right on the path to the beach a few morning,which was nice. We also ate at Longhi's at the Shops at Wailea once for breakfast, which was good. We did take advantage of the beach yoga the first day since we were so jet lagged and up early, that was a great start to the trip, very relaxing, light, easy yoga. The Shops at Wailea are about an 8 or 10 minute walk from the hotel. There are also shuttles that go there but we walked, it's a nice walk if you go along the beach path and then through the Wailea Grand (which reminded me of Vegas, and is undergoing a MAJOR, unsightly reconstruction of their largest pool currently, as a side note.) The Shops have everything from high end shops like Louis Vuitton and Tiffany's to smaller surf shops and Hawaiian souvenir shops. Definitely try the Tommy Bahama Tropical Cafe and Cheeseburger in Paradise is a nice change if you are craving some American grub. We rented a jeep one day and drove to Kihei to go surfing then around the West Maui mountains, which is one of my favorite drives in the U.S., great ocean views, to Lahaina and Kaanapali. We did get a couples oceanside massage at the hotel and it was really great too, I would recommend that. The spa is pretty expensive but when else can you do a massage on Wailea beach with your brand new hubby? It did rain one full day and was cloudy a few other days but other than that the weather was great, low to mid 80's all week. As a last note, they are building a new Serenity Pool to open in May of 2009. We didn't even know it was happening (there's no noise or anything, at all, I saw a construction truck once)but it looks really great. It's 2 pools, adults only, one being an infinity pool and they are building cabanas with flat screen tv's in them. So if you're going after May of '09 you're in luck!

Reviews.Title: “Not a burden and truly special”
Reviews.Author: nymad64
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th times visiting the resort and it was predictably a fantastic experience. My husband and I travel frequently and we usually switch between Four Seasons and Ritz. This trip finally set our foot down and Four Seasons stood out to be the winner. The resort in Maui is like a dream coming true, spacious guest room, great pool, outstanding service and delicious. What really helped us making up our minds was the personal service that the management extended, as in the title â€œNot a Burden, but truly Specialâ€�. My husband has a very special diet. We are accustomed to calling the hotel ahead of time and let them know his allergies and preferences (my husband is fatally allergic to nuts). With no surprise, the hotel has all the records of his dietary requirements in their files. A usually 30 minutes reservation with other hotels only took 10 minutes with Four Seasons. We arrived at the hotel, the check-in was a breeze and the resort was beautiful as always. Coming from freezing NY, the pool, of course, was the first place we visited. We parked ourselves by the pool and decided to give the hotel a call to make sure our â€œfoodâ€� requirements were acknowledged before ordering our lunch. Our call was diverted to the food and beverage manager, Brian (forgot his last name, Asian guy from Singapore). 5 minutes after we put the phone down, he was there by our chairs and assured us all our requirements were addressed to all his kitchens and they are ready to serve us anywhere in the resort. His level of service was expected in Four Seasons, what impressed us most was his attitude, hospitality, sincerity and most of all, his willingness to accommodate us. In most hotels, our long list of dietary requirements easily turns us into a burden to the hotel, but let me assure you, he made us feel like royalty. Of course, the lunch turned out to be exceptional. Brian introduced us to one of the chefs from Duo restaurant. A local Hawaiian chef name Noel. Like Brian, his eagerness and friendliness was remarkable. He checked on us every now and then when we visited his restaurant. He inquired about where we planned to have our next meal and making sure our â€œspecialsâ€� were in place even if we were not dining in Duo. I can go on and on about the rest of the stay. The first time we felt we were not a burden was just amazing. These days, you find beautiful resorts every corner of the world, but service level like this is hard to find. My husband and I are from service industry, we understand that genuine service can be trained, but very hard to maintain and time consuming. It has to come from top down and Four Seasons did it. Hats off to you all!

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Stefsims
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about how fabulous our stay was at the Four Seasons Maui! From the moment we arrived, we were treated like royalty. Four Season's quality is unsurpassed. We had a little issue with our room and they immediately offered to move us to another room, without question. The Four Seasons Maui is a bit pricey, but well worth it if you want to save up for a fabulous vacation. We look forward to going back next year (we are starting to save now :-).

Reviews.Title: “The Best for Service in all of Maui”
Reviews.Author: Travellady22
Reviews.Content: I love the Hawaiian Islands and have been to Maui many times in 40 years, and stayed in so many different properties depending on if it was a family, business or couples trip and budget. This time we decided to stay at the Four Seasons, and we loved it. This is the best service on Maui. That old saying you get what you pay for is true. At this stage of my life, I like excellent service, the type you don't have to keep asking for, it is provided before you ask. Yes, the price is high, but it is like buying a Lexus or Mercedes, you expect quality and the Four Seasons is that. And we don't take a trip like this every week. It was my birthday and it had been a long hard year at the office, and I decided we deserved a stress free trip. When you arrive both car doors are opened, and they have some one escort you to the front desk. I had left my adapter for my cell phone on another island prior to this. My nice hotel there could not do anything. While my partner was checking in for our rooms, I went to the concierge desk, and in less then 30 seconds, she came back with a box full of adapters, and the 3rd one worked, she tried it right at the big desk. Then I asked for the DVD list of free movies and selected a few for our room, and also looked at the CD list and got a few of those free for our cd player. When we arrived in our rooms, they were immaculate, and quite honestly almost as big as a suite at the next door hotel. I am picky about bathrooms and this one was pristine and huge. The size of a room at some other hotels. Seriously, you could have 4 people in that bathroom and not be crowded. Separate glass enclosed shower, huge bathtub, double sinks, separate closet for the toilet with phone and a long second counter with stool for makeup, etc. The room was overlooking the ocean, with chaise lounge, 2 comfy chairs, table, and drying rack for bathing suits. King size bed, flat screen tv, dvd, cd, and ipod radio and some other electronic gadgets, plus a sofa, coffee table, and desk, even a reading light OVER the bed, and two phones. Nice furniture and pictures and comfy bed, fell asleep in a heartbeat and I don't sleep well in some hotel beds. The service was obvious again, when we called down to have them make a reservation for Joes, a local restaurant where the meatloaf is famous. It is always packed and hard to find because they don't have parking right in front. Not only did they get us a reservation when I could not, but as we were leaving the hotel, we asked her to call them, because they have a golf cart that picks up in the tennis court parking lot, and we have waited a while in the dark for it on previous visits. 3 minutes later we were in the dark parking lot, and there was the golf cart and we had a great private table. Joes is not cheap but a great upscale casual place, with comfort food done well. I did not want fancy food, had it all week, wanted meatloaf and my partner had their pork chops. The game room and 2 gyms one looking outdoors and one inside in a/c at Four Seasons I love. Various books, games, and 2 free computer stations, plus coffee, tea, and water complimentary early in the morning, with many stations. Outside at the pool, even the cabanas are complimentary, as well as chairs and towels, and they put it on for you. And they are constantly coming around with ice water, free evian spritzers. They are NOT forcing you to buy a drink, and the first morning, I forgot my rubber hair band to put my hair in a pony tail, and our water guy ran to the spa, and got me one of theirs. They have complimentary water aerobics, as well as other classes in the morning. The beach chairs, towels, everything is very nice and clean, as well as the pools and the beach. My partner signed up for their introductory scuba, and had his learning session in the pool, then the instructor was honest enough to tell him the water was getting very wavy and cloudy, and could he come back the next morning to scuba. He did, and actually swam underwater with sea turtles and they took a video of this, which he bought and it was the highlight of his trip. The breakfast buffet, which we indulged in twice, was the nicest breakfast on the island, items first rate, and real squeezed orange juice, which I loved. They do not have the bird problem most hotels and restaurants there have, and if you leave your table, they put lids on your plate. When you go off anytime in your car, they give you two ice cold bottles of water, and they have that in the room fridge complimentary, unlike some hotels on that island, which charge you for the water bottles in your room. It is expensive, but I have decided, that even if we stay in the least expensive room there the next time, looking at the parking garage or shrubs, versus being at another hotel in a suite or junior suite for the same price, is worth it. And I am a very particular lady. My only gripe, is that they have NO adults only pool, but they are building one as I write this, and it should be open by May in a private area away from the main pool and the kids pool. Have you ever left anything at a hotel when you checked out and either they never find it or it takes a while to get it. I left one dresser drawer with some things it. Hours later, I realized this, we came back, they already had it noted on their computer, in a nice bag all folded, brought it to the concierge desk, and we were on our way. This was the best service at a resort, that I have had in a long time, and we travel a lot for business and stay in many nice hotels. Instead of feeling stuffy, this felt like a nice home. I only wish mine was this clean and organized.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in every way”
Reviews.Author: travelfan199
Reviews.Content: This hotel is probably one of the best beachfront hotels I have ever stayed in. Location: Right on the beach at Wailea, the hotel has unobstructed sea views from the rooms, along with clear and seemingly clean sea. It is also very close to a small upscale shopping centre, and local eateries, to which the hotel will happily chauffer you for no charge. Check In: We arrived at about 11AM and were on the club level. We had arranged a transfer from the airport (we'd flown in from Honoloulu) -we were met at the gate by the driver who helped us with luggage and drove us to the hotel, whilst pointing out landmarks en-route. We arrived at the hotel front door, and were welcomed by name and escorted straight to the club floor, without having to say a word. In the club lounge, we were passed over to the staff there (more on them later!) who sorted us out with a drink and proceeded to check us in. Our room was not ready, but within 30 minutes, it was. The Room: A sea facing room, rather large, with a work desk, king bed, and huge bathroom with seperate shower. There were some delicious, fresh confectionary items in a lovely box, and fresh flowers. The ice bucket was full of ice, and replenished twice daily. TV had a number of international channels. Our Lanai (balcony) had a table and chairs and was also spotlessly clean. The A/C was very efficient (quiet but effective!) The Food: All restaurants we ate in were first class, with excellent service and mouthwatering food -they really didn't miss a beat. The Club lounge had breakfast, afternoon tea, canapes and desserts in four presentations daily. This was also great. A note on service: every member of staff, without fail, went out of their way to make each and every guest's stay remarkable. The pool attendant would come to check on you (by name) every half an hour to bring some iced water or cold fruit/ice cream/sun cream/after sun/whatever you wanted, the club staff knew our names and were very friendly. At the same time, the service wasn't intrusive; the staff seemed to know when you wanted to read the paper quietly, or, conversely, if you needed something, they were there. I think that's what distinguishes this Four Seasons from other five star hotels -true service is all about anticipating needs and flexibility -all of the staff at the FS were true professionals and never failed to have a smile on their faces, but equally, it didn't feel forced or over formal -shorts/t-shirts were fine and you didn't feel uncomfortable being yourself.
