Resort: the resort facilities are good and you don't feel as if it is overcrowded. No, it's not an isolated retreat, but you can find tranquility within the resort (on the beach or by the pool). Conclusion: all-in-all, this really is a fabulous resort which I would return to again at the drop of a hat.

Reviews.Title: “An Incredible Experience”
Reviews.Author: GEPJKthree
Reviews.Content: Want to be taken care of in every way imaginable at a beautiful property in a beautiful location? Stay here. This resort is the finest we've ever experienced. From the moment we arrived until the day we (regretfully) left we were wowed by the staff as well the property and grounds. Our room was huge, the restaurants were incredible, the pool and beach areas were awesome, and the employees were off-the-chart friendly and helpful. We stayed for 7 days & 6 nights. Next time we'll stay longer. Be sure to enjoy each one of the on-property restaurants (Spago, Ferraros, and DUO) as they were all very, very good. Off-property we enjoyed Mama's Fish House and Capische. For those who question the expense, yes, you could save money elsewhere, but you likely will not receive the level of service and quality in everything you do like we did here at the Four Seasons. For us, it was absolutely worth every penny and we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “First-Class All the Way”
Reviews.Author: DevMarc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Wailea next door last year, and this hotel was far superior, in that a lot was included. At the Grand Wailea, they charge for EVERY LITTLE THING, including using the computer in the business center, but here, computer use is free; and the cabanas out at the pool are included, they come around with ice water, pineapple on a stick, Jell-O, cold towels, and other niceties periodically, and they sit you up in your chair with towels. Just tip a little and you'll be fine. Also, this was a more adult experience, as the Wailea had too many kids, because they have the pools with slides, etc. The rooms at the Four Seasons are huge (600 square feet plus), and everything is truly lovely, with a lot of fitness-center activities included in the overall price, too (including yoga on the beach). However, if you want reasonably priced food, the only place to get it on-site is at the little outdoor cafe by the beach that has pastries, soda, candy bars, etc., until 4 p.m. Also, if you split a meal at Ferrero's by the pool at lunch, the prices are okay...there's definitely enough food for 2. However, after 4...there are only 3 restaurants, and they're all very pricey. For reasonably priced meals, go to the Wailea Shops, which are about 3/4 of a mile down the street. You can walk, or the hotel will take you wherever you want to go within a mile or so, and they will also pick you up. We stocked our little refrigerator with food from the General Store at the shops, and this worked out well. Overall, this was a 5-star experience...one more thing...the whole property is permeated by the scent of fresh jasmine flowers...and it's really a treat

Reviews.Title: “Best of Class”
Reviews.Author: NJ-Eric
Reviews.Content: As everyone here says, service and facilities are first rate. The service is more than great; it is as friendly as anywhere in the world. The staff makes an effort to recognize guests by sight and address you by your name, always with a huge and genuine smile. What I like best of all is that though the hotel is expensive, they do not nickle and dime you. Water is free. Coffee is available free. Newspapers are basically free. Internet on their computers is free. Much beach equipment that others charge for is free. The fitness club is free. The food was great, the grounds were topnotch, and room service was flexible. One could go on and on. The sole thing not perfect is that the housekeeping staff refuses to let any tiny changes stand that you make in your room . You would like your books piled next to the bed on the nightstand---nein! (that is where they want the pad and pen). You want the clock radio angled so you can see the time from the bed: nein! You want your own bookmarks in your books, rather than theirs---even if you substitute back daily: nein! You want to put the pile of travel booklets out of the way after the first day: nein! However, given how special everything else is, the housekeeping absolutism comes off as a quirk rather than as an irritant. I would return to this Four Seasons in an instant. Its a treasure.

Reviews.Title: “"ABSOLUTELY THE BEST"”
Reviews.Author: jbhnlh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 50th anniversary at the Four Seasons Maui and we both can't say enough good, positive things about the hotel. From the time you check in to the time you check out you are treated with such care and respect. The entire staff is very friendly and are there to serve you in any way they can to make your stay a wonderful experience. We were graciously upgraded and when we stepped into our beautiful suite a plate of delicious chocolate covered strawberries welcomed us. What expemplary service!

Reviews.Title: “Go Go Go for a special occasion”
Reviews.Author: 212Girl
Reviews.Content: Our honeymoon stay at the Four Seasons in Maui was nothing short of perfect... coming from NYC we arrived tired and late in the evening. We were greeted warmly by reception. The porter brought our bags up quickly. He gave us several recommendations for restaurants and activities off the hotel site. The room is very typical 4 Seasons and did not disappoint. We had a jr suite with partial ocean views, was very nice and comfortable and well sized for a 6 day stay. The next morning we hit the beautiful if not smallish beach, we had no problem as we got there early. The staff was equally welcoming and set up lounges. I would recommend getting there early. There is a grocery store about 5 minutes away, called Foodland, try to get a card as there are significant discounts for cardholders. We picked up some snacks and were happy we did. Spago is an amazing treat, but there are other excellent restaurants nearby. The pool is a fun way to spend the late afternoon, we found the mai tai a real treat! We went next door to the Grand Wailea for a spa treatment so no comment on 4 Seasons there, but GW was out of this world. The hotel has tennis courts on the 6th floor, take advantage if you are a player. We also used the gym, the equipment and space is great. All in all an amazing stay, exactly what we were looking for and will hopefully be back someday!

Reviews.Title: “magnificent hotel with exemplary staff”
Reviews.Author: travelloveraus
Reviews.Content: we arrived at FS Maui to be told they had no booking in our name. the staff were not very helpfull. after a few minutes the manager on duty reassured us all would be taken care of, not to worry they will sort it out - and suggested we have lunch in Ferraros. Lunch was simply superb. Delicious with an extraordinary view of the hawaiin waters...sand and glorious sunny skies. Upon finishing lunch we were told by our waiter that our lunch would be complimentary from the manager- great PR !! We were then shown to our upgraded rooms on 6th floor - again outstanding...linens towels decor and service. our stay was brief - 5 nights. we had breakfast every day - yes expensive but the service and food were 5 star. dinner at the hotels 2 restaurants Duo and Ferraros were beyond reproach. We stayed with 3 teenagers who also felt that this has been our best stay at any hotel to date.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Year & Still our Fave Globally!”
Reviews.Author: Sassypants01
Reviews.Content: Last year the Maui 4S blew us away. Could they repeat? We stayed at the 4S on da Big Island first & it was beautiful, really beautiful, but we remembered Maui as a tiny bit better. Could it be? Oh hallelujah, yes! The beach is perfect & not too crowded. The pool is fantastic & laying in chairs being pampered with fruit, sunglasses cleaning, free suntan lotion & keeping our glasses filled with ice water was so lovely. Never had to fight for chairs either. Duo had the MOST AMAZING breakfast buffet each morning with fabulous quality fruits & other wonderful options. Ferraros was a super choice for a nice lunch. Again, an issue of quality & the chef's work is flawless. Out kids, 6 &10, begged every day to go to Kids Club. We had to drag them out for beach time to make sure they got a nice mix of family time. But that left dh & I with the best surprise of all...time to be grownups ALONE. HEAVENLY!! This is an amazing place for kids with the kid robes, kid welcome gifts. Kids Club, etc. I'm sure the honeymooners would love to convince everyone otherwise, but the reason it's not insane with kids is that the Kids Club, beach & kids pool leave the atmosphere not too wacko like the Grand Wailea nuthouse next door (last year we tried that...not again) Also the spa is my favorite & I've visited a few. It's so filled with aloha & no haughty spirit that taint some. This whole property is the stuff vacation dreams are made of. Bottom line, the impeccable service can't be properly described in one of these reviews. This hotel is a splurge that leaves you feeling it was worth every hard-earned dime you spent.

Reviews.Title: “Top Shelf - Have No Worries!”
Reviews.Author: totravelnice
Reviews.Content: FS- Maui is original FS resort and pride of ownership is evident in many if not all of the staff. Many have more than 10 years at property. Everything is splendid, every detail. If I were to pick a single problem with the property is that it begs for adult pool and tiki style bar. Of course they serve drinks, but there is no place to gather other than the outdoor bar venue at the Ferraros and that is not appropriate in your swim suit. Prices are FS grade, but so is the food. Ferroros was best food on property, simply outstanding! Breakfast buffet is equally well done with a very large spread of choices and outstanding service.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than last year, is that possible?”
Reviews.Author: montana43
Reviews.Content: Amazing! If you need a place to chill out and just do nothing and enjoy paradise this is it. We had the pleasure of staying here last year and I didn't think it possible, but it was even better the 2nd time. What can you say about the service that hasn't been said yet, the best I've ever experienced! Friendly courteous and they really care, not just lip service. No nickel and dimeing here. Already looking forward to next year! Spago ate there 4 times, you can't find better food anywhere, culinary perfection! Duo was good not a Ruths Chris but good. Sarentos was fantastic! All in all a fabulous stay, if you decide to splurge on a vacation you will not be disappointed! Simply the best!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, but had better for less”
Reviews.Author: Snorrido
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in May after a conference in Honolulu. This is a very good 5 star hotel and everything was right on. However I know I can get better for less so IÂ´m going to spend my money on something else in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: froggy4
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel we have stayed at , the four seasons caters so well to children, we have 2 children aged 8 and 11 years the suprises for the children when they arrived were great it made the children feel very welcome also the staff accommodated the children around the pool ,setting up sun shades for them bringing them water ,fruit on sticks and popsciles even cold face washers, and also for the adults as well,the kids club was amazing different craft and activities every day it was hard to keep them away, the food at DUOs for breakfast was fantastic the best french toast I have tasted!!We were there to relax so most days we ate pool side and the food was OK at night we ate out of the resort mostly at the Wailea shops the icecream shop there is amazing . The resort staff at four seasons were eager to please and very knowledgeable about the resort and its surroundings, day trips etc .....the valet staff always had our car ready when we needed it and would always give us bottles of water .I could go on and on but I wont .......Just stay at this resort it is truly amazing.

Reviews.Title: “World Class Service”
Reviews.Author: eteyemd
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Four Seasons Resort in Maui was truly fantastic. The service is truly unbeatable and you can tell that the staff takes great pride in the way the provide service. The food was wonderful as well (although be prepared for high prices....but if you are staying at a Four Seasons you are probably expecting that right?). The beach was beautiful with a wonderful view. The snorkeling off the beach was actually better than we expected. The workout facilities are great. We thought the Spa next door at the Grand Wailea was superior to the spa at the Four Seasons (you get more bang for your buck). One thing that caught me off guard was being charged extra for internet access. I mean come on! I can get free wireless internet basically anywhere in any city in the USA. It just seemed like a petty money-grab to me coming from such a highly regarded resort. This was our first time staying at a Four Seasons and our experience truly makes me want to try other locations for his resort chain.

Reviews.Title: “maui vac”
Reviews.Author: cnatht
Reviews.Content: I took a trip with my mom and this hotel was beautiful. We wanted to get away and it was the perfect place to do that. The hotel was absolutely amazing and breath taking. The staff was great and got us anything we could possibly need or want!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: NikkiSoo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Four Seasons back in 2006 and it was beautiful. Friendly staff, Great restaurants and prime location! Beach front property with great soft sand and warm ocean waters. I would highly reccommend this hotel to honeymooners or people who would like to be around adults. The Grand Wailea Hotel next door is more for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: vcurtis82
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Seasons Maui in August 2008 for seven nights. Overall, my experience was highly positive and I would certainly return to this resort ... the caveat being if and when I have children. Otherwise, I will buy or rent a condo a few minutes down or up the beach. Here is a quick recap: Positives - beautiful grounds, beautiful beach, amazing service, top notch food, large and well appointed rooms [very comfy bed!]. Duo's & Spago were great. Ferraro's, the Italian restaurant, was disappointing - the food was really bland. The pool side menu is also very tasty. I often ordered from the kids menu as the adult portions are very large. Very Kid-Friendly Resort - If you have kids they will love the Four Seasons. This is great for some and those who love kids, but the management needs to do a better job of designating "adult only" areas and enforcing these boundaries - i.e. an adult pool and lounge. I think this would help balance the experience for both families and single guests or couples. Pool Area - The pool area is relatively small compared with the number of guests. People were literally camped out at 6:45 am to get a spot in prime real estate. Don't get me wrong the service was great and the staff would always be willing to set up a chair for you on the "lawn", but I think it is time to invest some extra cash and build an additional pool area so that all guests can enjoy the same level of attention and service. It is important to note that I stayed at the resort during high season, so I expect it would be a little easier on the pool and the kid front during the off months.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons is the Absolute Ultimate”
Reviews.Author: Rockwater
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Four Seasons. The experience was 5-star fantastic in every aspect. At check-in we were greeted with leis, cold clothes and a cool drink. Our oceanview room was the most luxurious I have ever stayed in (and I travel and stay in nice places frequently). Furnishings were lovely, the bed and pillows were very comfortable, the bathroom was palatial and very very nice. There was a 50" LCD TV in the room with a DVD player and the lanai was very spacious with nice, comfortable furniture. The pool area was lovely with many chairs however, we chose to use the most-beautiful-beach you have ever seen every day. The beach staff was awesome, placed your lounge chairs for you with chair overs and towels, brought umbrellas and table, circulated frequently with cold water, cold towels, fresh fruit, evian spritzers, muffins in the morning .... I could have stayed there and enjoyed being pampered for the rest of my life! We like to snorkel and the snorkeling off of the beach was very good. Many, many different tropical fish, large and small, octopus, green turtles ... We did the expected tourist trips to HAna, etc but the most unexpected and best sightseeing was to be had by turning right out of the hotel, drive to the end of the road (about 4 miles) and you will find yourself in a natural reserve which is actually a lava field that flowed from Haleakala over 200 years ago down to the ocean. The drive through the lava field continues for two miles and is an absolutely amazing sight. Not advertised in any of the "things to do in MAui" but DO NOT MISS IT. I utilized the gym which is outdoors with a view of the ocean. The staff was very nice, also bringing towels and cold water as you exercised. WE used the game room several nights - a nice diversion with pool tables, ping pong, shuffleboard, video games etc. We ate at Spago which was very good but exceptionally expensive. Had lunch twice at Ferraros which was very good. Otherwise, the hotel restaurants were very expensive so we ate off property every other night. The local restaurants we visited in Kihei were all excellent (we good terrific local recommendations from the valets). Ate at Stella Blues which was terrific food and reasonably priced, Thailand Cuisine - also very good, Cafe O'Lei which was fantastic and Roys. The four seasons is an expensive, luxury vacation but if you can afford it, there is no other experience like it.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Resort!”
Reviews.Author: sfmags
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an incredible stay at the 4S Maui. Nearly everything was perfect, and no detail went unnoticed. I can't add much to the details already provided by the other reviewers here -- the rooms and grounds are beautiful, service outstanding, etc. Here are a few things that I thought were just great that might not already be commented on in previous posts: 1. I love the attention to detail this hotel has. For example, they put good quality hair dryers in the rooms. They also water down the sand on the small hill leading to the beach, making it easier to walk up and down there. 2. They don't nickel and dime you for things like coffee and water. They also let me take a muffin from the buffet early in the morning while I was drinking my coffee in the lobby area, two hours before my husband and I would return for the buffet. I also love all the goodies they bring around at the pool and the smoothie samples at breakfast. 3. The spa is heavenly. Their treatments are to die for and if you take a look at the daily schedule, they often offer specials. Also, as nice as the bathrooms are in the room, my husband and I both liked showering and getting ready in the spa locker rooms to take advantage of all the great perks -- professional hair dryers, top quality hair and facial products and heated shaving cream (or so I'm told by my husband). 4. Take advantage of the free, varied and abundant exercise classes! I took spinning twice -- it was great. They also offer yoga, pilates, and new things like Urban rebounding (I'd never heard of it). Some of them do charge a nominal fee. I took a yoga class one evening and was the only student, which meant that I got 90 minutes of personal training! A only few downsides: -We had some trouble with the timing of housekeeping. We always left the room before 10am and twice when we returned at 3:00 the room hadn't been serviced. This was solved on future days by calling housekeeping before we left and asking them to service the room before 3:00. This also happened with our turndown service, which we didn't get on two nights during our 5 night stay. -One doesn't go to the Four Seasons to save money, but good god is it ever expensive, especially the dinner options. They really need a slightly lower priced grill restaurant (at dinner, not just at lunch) where you can buy a burger or grilled fish without paying $40+ per entree. To get around the outrageous charges for lunch, I sometimes ordered off the kids menu, but be warned, if you donâ€™t specify â€œIâ€™d like the carrots and celery sticks from the kids menuâ€� theyâ€™ll give you an adult size portion (even though itâ€™s not on the menu) at adult prices. On a positive note, our dinners (we ate there twice) at Duo were terrific, if expensive, but worth it. Ferarros was not good, especially for the price. Lobby bar is a good dining option too (you can order off any of the hotel menus there).

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Fivez
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights for our 10th anniversary and absolutely loved this hotel. From the moment we arrived, we were awash in excellent views, an upgraded suite and fantastic service. Everything was top-rate, albeit quite expensive, but totally worth it. There's fresh (and free) coffee in the morning; great restaurants (the lobster risotto at Ferrarro's was a 10); excellent pool side service and every amenity you could ask for. We paid for an oceanview and was upgraded to a deluxe suite with two balconies--one overlooked the volcano and the other viewed the ocean. And upon arrival, we found a complimentary bottle of champagne and chocolate truffles. There's a 1 1/2 mile walking path and I ventured into the adjacent hotels. Beatiful, but the 4 Seasons was definately a step up. Free yoga on the beach was a great way to start the morning and the snorkling right off the beach was just as good as the Molokini snorkel tour. At sunset each night was a torch lighting/hula ceremony. The only thing I didn't adore was in the spa. After changing into my robe, I had to stroll through the spa reception to get to the relaxation room. As much as we loved touring Maui, we couldn't wait to get back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “heavenly bliss”
Reviews.Author: el1717
Reviews.Content: my two girlfriends and i were celebrating 50 years of being freinds and we picked this very luxurios paradise to celebrate...service was to die for..i even had a pedicure beachside...and the food was the very best!! my only complaint woudl be it was all couples and abolutely no nightlife...

Reviews.Title: “Poshest place so far!”
Reviews.Author: bella_f
Reviews.Content: The final 2 nights on Maui for our 10th anniversary were spent at the Four Seasons Wailea... what a place! It will be hard for any place to live up to this stay..We were upgraded to oceanview room, double the cost of the room we had booked... Evian spritzing, suntan lotion and popsicles all brought to your umbrella-shaded lounge chair on the beach.. poolside service... romantic dinner by sunset at Ferraro's, and gourmet breakfast buffet at DUO's..Complimentary champagne in our room on arrival...couple's hot stone massage in the spa... Every single moment is locked in, and I'll never forget the hospitality we were offered in this hotel.. it is is the #1 romantic place on earth to kiss!

Reviews.Title: “Not my kinda hotel”
Reviews.Author: NSL76
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a huge resort. With it comes no privacy and tons of people. The room we had was nothing to brag about and it was a large suite. The view from the balcony was at an angle and next door was construction. The pool area is nice and huge but getting a great spot to sit is a task of it's own. Make sure you get there early in the morning before the crowd. There were many large families which took away from the romantic experience we were hoping for. the best part was the beach. The sand was so soft and the water was perfect. However it was packed. The food and dining experience was great. It's a great place for a family vacation but not so great for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, but...”
Reviews.Author: ShanaL
Reviews.Content: Yes the resort is beautiful. We stayed on the club level and found the service to be just excellent. However, there were a few flaws in the diamond you should know about before you go. The first is the deck chair policy. We were surprised that you had to get up at 7am to get a cabana or a hill-side nook and could not leave the chairs for more than 30 min except between the hours of 11am to 2pm. While we understood that the policy was to prevent folks from taking up the best seats while being somewhere else, we thought with the amount of money we were spending, that there should have been a less draconian way of going about that. Perhaps increasing the number of chairs with a sun shade would help. The second is the number of young children at the resort. This resort is just excellent for families, but if you are looking for peace and quiet I would consider another place.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly”
Reviews.Author: Sherie-L-
Reviews.Content: We just returned from several days at the Four Seasons-Wailea; it was truly paradise. The staff - from the minute we arrived - were so very courteous, gracious, accommodating and welcoming. The rooms were well-appointed; our terrace offered a breathtaking view of the courtyard and the ocean. The staff met our every request. The wait staff in the restaurants and lounge were all impeccably well-mannered and friendly; the food and cocktails were fabulous. The concierge arranged our adventures and each excursion was flawlessly planned and executed. (We highly recommend doing the volcano zip line adventure and luau.) The pools were great and the pool wait staff was excellent. They were attentive and catered to our every request. A visit to the spa is a must; whether as a couple - or solo - the spa service and facility were top shelf. The hotel offered many on-site attractions, including snorkeling and scuba diving classes. My husband preferred the on-site snorkeling over the snorkeling trip he took off-site. The ONLY downside was that our trip had to end - it was truly heavenly.

Reviews.Title: “In Wailea, there's no better place...on Maui though....”
Reviews.Author: dangrelecki
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a WONDERFUL Maui experience. It was my second time, and my wife's first, so I wanted everything to be wonderful. We stayed in Wailea for the last 5 days on the island. I contacted the 4 seasons directly, when asked if we were celebrating anything I let them know it was our 1st anniversary. Upon arrival, our room was not yet ready (we came early), so they took our bags and directed us to the shopping (SCARY). After hitting the wonderful shopping just down the street (high end, Gucci, etc.), we came back to the hotel. We were greated with fresh flowers, cold scented towels, and the manager letting us know that we've been upgraded to a suite for our anniversary. The bellman came around with our bags, congratulated us on our anniversary and showed us to our room. In the AMAZING 2 room suite, with champagne and two big screen tvs we were blown away. In an effort to keep things short, the only thing we didn't like were some of the other guests. The staff is fantastic, attentive to your every need, the other guests however weren't nearly as friendly as you would hope for. Another thing was the fact that a lot of native Hawaiians don't work here, seemed like a lot of 30 year old Californians. It didn't seem nearly as "Hawaiian" as our first part of the trip. (see Kapalua) The Duo breakfast buffet is FANTASTIC, and my wife is still talking about the pineapple spritzer drink. The golf on site is great, but everything is a tad expensive and "resorty". Overall, a fantastic experience, great staff, wonderful location, but not as Hawaiian as we would have liked. It's not one of the top resorts in the world for nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Total pampering without nickel and diming”
Reviews.Author: ScarlyAngel
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay. (First in 6/03.) We were so happy to return here for our 1st anniversary after staying here on our honeymoon. We were upgraded both times (we'd booked a Mt. View) and received an Oceanview this time!!! (Garden view last time.) The pool is nothing "spectacular." Serene and quiet - 2 to choose from. The pool cabanas are amazing. They are free (whereas GW charges over $100/day). You just have to "reserve" early - 1st come 1st served in the morning. We did tip the guys and they told us we could go eat at DUO and not have to kill ourselves rushing back. (You're only supposed to leave 30 min. at a time, but it doesn't seem to be strictly enforced, esp. if not a full hotel.) Then between 11 and 2, you can leave for up to 2 hours (w/ no "penalty") in order to eat lunch. They bring you muffins, fruit, popsicles, evian spritzes, cold towels, ice water -- total pampering. Poolside drink and food service too of course. Wailea Beach is beautiful - not huge perfect for a short walk. Good snorkeling right in front of the 4 Seasons. We ate at all 3 restaurants. Highly recommend the Breakfast Buffet at DUO's - you won't need to eat lunch! Spago's was amazing - I had the tasting menu. Ferraro's setting can't be beat - lobster risotto yum! Rooms are perfectly spacious and lovely. Colors are not my favorite (too many earth tones). But the beds are comfy, the lanais are adequate and the bathroom is all marble with double sinks, big tub and separate toilet. Everyone is friendly, welcoming and the service is fantastic. Always tell them if it's your anniversary, special occasion etc. Champagne in the room upon arrival. Lots of amenities are included like the cabanas. Free snorkel gear rental for an hour. Free intro scuba lesson in the pool. Free outrigger canoe paddling -- which is so much fun and not toooo much work. Video and board games, pool. Free use of pack n plays for kids. I really can't say enough nice things about it; we don't want to stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: louise_thompson
Reviews.Content: HONEYMOON... We have just returned from our honeymoon, the first leg of which was at the Four Seasons in Maui. We absolutely loved it, arrived to our room to find champagne and a card congratulating us. The room was spotless we had a partial ocean view room so you could see the ocean and some of the gardens we were impressed with the location of the room. The staff are amazing friendly and referred to us as mr and mrs seabrook which was nice on our honeymoon. The staff could not do enough for you, when you were sat at the pool the staff came round with cool towels, spritz water to cool you down, cleaned your sunglasses, the list was endless. The food was lovely slight overpriced in the resturant by the pool. The food at the resturant near to the reception was very expensive but the best meal we had the whole time we were away on our honeymoon, proba\bly not helped by the amount of champagne we consumed. The rooms were cleaned twice a day and the concergices were extremelly helpful even booking us in for our return flights. The only slight downsight was that everything closed at midnight, which I suppose was not too bad considering it is sunny enough to start sunbathing by 7am. Hawaii is expensive but worth it, we are planning to return for our anniversary!! If you are going to this hotel you are very lucky, enjoy!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: sybilsinmaui
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out - the 4S is top notch. We were greated with our lovely lei and cool towel. We had three guys around our jeep helping with luggage. There was hardly anybody staying on Maui when we were there (Aug 31-Sept 4) and all the employees were willing to bend over backwards to help you. (We stopped on the road out after picking up our car from valet to take the roof down and the valet guys drove over to help us after they saw us struggling!) This was our 5th Anniversary - we stayed here exactly 5 years ago for our honeymoon. I called the mgr prior to the trip and explained it was our anniversary and what could he offer us? We rec'd a partial ocean view room for the garden room price, nice! They've made some upgrades to the hotel in those 5 years. Like music in the bathroom and LCD TV's. The lanai is HUGE! You could have a party out there. We did two treatments in the spa - one oceanview and one in the spa. They cater to you SO MUCH during the service. Like they asked us which of 3 choices of music would you like? Who does that?? Only 4S. Ferraro's is awesome. Don't worry about driving anywhere b/c the concierge has typed directions for EVERYTHING on Maui. Pool-side service is unbelievable. My every wish was granted. I felt so spoiled. We left 4S for the Marriott on BI and that isn't a bad hotel either - but man, you can really tell what that extra "star" means. If it's just the two of you looking for some peace and quiet - stay here. You will be spoiled and will feel like millionaire.

Reviews.Title: “Started out great and went downhill....”
Reviews.Author: UsaIowatraveler
Reviews.Content: Our check in experience at the 4S was average. We were transfering from the Fairmont so the fact that our room was not ready at 10am was not a problem for us. We parked ourselves at the pool and had some drinks and lunch. Lunch was mediocre and overpriced. The service, however, was excellent. Our room was well appointed and extremely comfortable. The Housekeeping staff was the best I have ever encountered. That is where the positives end. Lunch at Ferraro's was completely average. I developed a bit of a cold on our last night and wanted nothing more than a night in and a movie. Our TV was not working properly so we asked the front desk to send someone up. they sent someone who spoke little english and did nothing more than give us a new remote (not the problem). After two additional calls to the front desk, we were finally informed that the resort's on demand system was down. They offered for us to select some DVD's from their library. Their "Library" consisted of a few older movies. Nonetheless, we selected a movie and attempted to watch it. Our DVD player did not work properly so we called the front desk yet again. They tried to tell us we just needed to plug it in. Wrong! They ended up having to send up a technician to fix it. The whole ordeal took about 2 hours to resolve. To top it off, the room service we ordered took over an hour and arrived cold and tasteless. Some Do's: -Spago -Reserve a Cabana by the pool or an umbrella at the beach -drinks in the lobby lounge -Walk next door to the Fairmont if you just want to pick up a great gourmet sandwich The staff at the front desk was inhospitable. No self parking was available so you had to wait for your vehicle instead of being able to just get up and go. We expected more from the 4 Seasons and were roundly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: ChiTravelgirl42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons for our honeymoon, and it couldn't have been any better! The service was out of this world, it was amazing. The hotel itself is beautiful, very pristine and the grounds are kept immaculate. The service at the pool was great....complimentary water, sunscreen (best sunscreen ever!), evian spritzers, fruit, chilled towels, cabanas....I really liked that the pool attendants would help you find a spot, instead of letting guests put their towels & books down in the morning to "save seats", which I see at alot of other resorts. It was never an issue finding a spot at the pool or beach, anytime during the day. Our room was quite large, very modern, clean, and we had champagne & a handwritten note waiting for us when we arrived. The only restaurant we ate at was Ferraro's, which was excellent. Best calamari ever!! The view at sunset was amazing also. Every time we called down for the car, it was ready for us and they will provide you with towels, and bottled water (complimentary!) for you. The thing I liked best about this hotel (besides the excellent service) was that we didn't feel nickel and dimed. Almost everything was complimentary (except the valet parking, which every resort charges you for). Thanks Four Seasons for making our honeymoon beyond wonderful!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Visit To Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Momof3Ss
Reviews.Content: August 28, 2008 Momof3Ss Long Island, N.Y. My middle daughter thought that a week in Hawaii with her family would be nicer and more meaningful than a huge blow-out Sweet 16. So mom, dad, and three teenage daughters spent 8 days in Maui! We have been fortunate to travel to some beautiful resorts and amazing places but we all agreed that this was by far the nicest place we have ever stayed. From the minute we were greeted by the staff when we pulled up,( they even greeted the girls by their first names when they gave them their leis.) we knew this was some place special. The view in the lobby was just breathtaking. The property is kept immaculate. The entire staff goes out of thier way to make you feel welcome and extremely pampered. The first day at the pool, one of the staff came over and asked if they could clean the girls sunglasses. Every few minutes a member of the pool staff is bringing you water or refilling your cup. They also come around with a bowl of fruit and spritz Evian on you to cool you off too. The same treatment is offered at the beach. Sometimes they come around with a cold, wet, lavender smelling towel to cool you off. Was I dreaming or was this real? Even the valet staff couldn't do enough for you. They would ask you where you were going and depending on your answer they would give you towels or water for your trip that day. There was not one staff member the entire trip that I found any fault with. The breakfast buffet at Duo is fabulous. Great food, tons of choices, beautiful views. Dinner there is delicious but we enjoyed Ferraro's the best. The views from this restaurant for a sunset dinner are spectacular. This will be one of my all time favorite family memories (watching the sunset over the Pacific with the gentle breezes and enjoying a delicious dinner with my family). The service is excellent here too. After the dinner the game room is a great place for families. We played pool, ping pong, wii, and shuffleboard. We all looked forward to it every night. There were only two things I would not recommend on this trip. We were disappointed in Spago's. Also, the concierge recommended the Luau at the Marriott. We left before it was over and we never do that anywhere because I think it's extremely disrespectful. This was that bad though. My daughters and I were all crying in the limo on the way back to the airport. It's not easy leaving Paradise. We hope to come back one day. It might take a few years because of the cost, but we can't imagine any vacation comparing to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: vin2998
Reviews.Content: I know this review is really late....but we had to write about a wonderful resort that had not only great but surperb service. I never imagined to have been treated the same way since the first day to the very last day. We travel all over and found this hotel to be one of the top resorts. The food was great.....ferraro's restaurant thats a must !!!just one negative comment here it goes I had to say it but wolfgang pucks restaurant was ok....overrated !!! thats my opinion

Reviews.Title: “Get Yourself Pampered”
Reviews.Author: interterra
Reviews.Content: This resort is everything a FS is supposed to be. I was a little overwhelmed with the size of the property at first, having stayed at the Kahala, in an ocean front room away from it all. At first I found the property to be busy, impossing, but it began to grow on me, the service, the service and the service. A mishap at check in was handled with so much attention that I almost apologized to them, that is what the Four Seasons is all about.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: RFitsgerald
Reviews.Content: The staff is amazing, the location is ideal and the rooms are immaculate. My wife and I had a wonderful anniversary week! We will be back again in the winter!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: scholarma
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Four Seasons Wailea and it was great. We were greeted with leis, lavender towels, and felt like we were truly welcomed. The staff was polite, the room was well appointed, orchids were everywhere. We did not have an ocean front or view room, but it mattered not, the ocean is only steps away. Duo was great, we had each had a huge prime rib for $25 each and it was delicious. Drink are $12 a piece... There was never any problems finding a cabana, there are plenty to go around and there is no charge. The hotel grounds have stunning views of the ocean and other islands. If you want to avoid screaming kids and very crowded pools (the Grand Wailea), then stay at the Four Seasons; it's quieter, better staffed, and the service is simply unparalleled. Well worth every penny spent...

Reviews.Title: “All I can say is WOW!!”
Reviews.Author: dfrombklyn
Reviews.Content: I know this review is a bit late but after joining trip advisor I had to share it anyway! My wife and I travel pretty extensively to Europe and the Caribbean. We've stayed at large 4 or 5 star hotels, small boutique hotel and I must say that the Four Season's Maui combines the best elements of both. FS Maui was the second and last leg of our honeymoon. The fist half was adventure on Kauai and the intent was the second half would be pampering on Maui. I gotta tell you, I have never been so pampered in my life. As a matter of fact I was so pampered that I often felt guilty at the level of service and amount of attention we received. From the Evian misting at the pool to the great turn down service to the front desk greeting us by name we felt like we were in paradise.. Here's a more direct example of service. Our first night in Maui we went to Ruth Chris' steakhouse for diner down the street. As usual my eyes were bigger than my stomach and as a result I had 1/2 of my sirloin left which I had to take with me. The next day I woke at 11:00 and had a taste for my leftover steak. I called room service and asked them to heat it up for me. They came to the room, picked up the left over and when the brought back my leftovers I was stunned. Not only had they heated up the steak perfectly but they included some rolls and a bit of sautÃ©ed spinach as well, and off course the presentation was impeccable. I would highly recommend this hotel for any travelling purpose. Oh did I mention that this the first hotel I've stayed at that you can snorkel from the beach and see an incredible abundance of sea life. I've snorkeled of a boat in Jamaica and Puerto Rico and not seen as wide a range of fish. Incredible experience that was worth every dime!!

Reviews.Title: “Complimentary services makes this beautiful resort great”
Reviews.Author: Branford_Family
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Fairmont Kea Lani (beautiful grounds, but the rooms are in desperate need of renovation) and the Grand Wailea (beautiful ... but too busy around the pool), we decided to try the Four Seasons. We made the right choice! The rooms are nicely furnished ... large bathrooms, flat screen tv's, and a small frig. The hallways and lobby areas are clean and filled with beautiful artwork and lots of places to sit and enjoy the view of the ocean. Everything you would expect from a Four Seasons Resort. What we enjoyed most about this hotel were the complimentary services. There was an outstanding game room for the kids to use (I posted pictures) with pool, ping pong, video games, large TV, etc. (great to use at the end of day when you've had too much sun) They had a wonderful outdoor gym; Yoga on the beach, scuba lessons or water aerobics classes every day. You can use their snorkeling equipment (great early in the morning when the water is calm) and they offer a free canoe ride 3 times a day (if you give them your camera they take a great shot from the water). My boys are 17 and 19 and they also enjoyed playing tennis using the automatic ball machine. They have over 300 movies your kids can borrow and watch in the room at night. Little muffins, pineapple and other fresh fruits are served everyday by pool. There is no charge for use of the cabanas. When we left for day to take the kids for surfing lessons, they had towels and waters ready for us when we picked up the car. The concierge not only makes reservations, they send you a reminder letter with the date, time and directions. The staff is attentive but not over baring...many are very familiar with the area and have great recommendations on places to eat. Other than an occasional lunch by the pool, we ate out in the local restaurants (so I can't comment on the hotel food). The best local places were... 1) Kihea Cafe for Breakfast (inexpensive - banana pancakes, eggs, etc) 2) Alexander's fish also in Kihea (inexpensive - grilled or fried ono and mahi mahi with rice or fries) 3) Hali'male General Store (expensive) excellent blend of flavors ... we missed Opra by a day (she has a home nearby) 4) Mama's fish house (expensive) food is good not great, but the view is the best on the island ... take a camera (lunch is less expensive than dinner and it is a similar menu) 5) Matteos Pizza (inexpensive) - excellent pizza and pasta dishes (shuttle ride from hotel) 6) Cheeseburger in Paradise in Shops at Wailea (inexpensive) great burger place (there is a similar one in Lahaina). The Maui information TV channel (great source of information) is now available online at www.mauionline.com. The only negative we found was that the hotel could use an adult pool. They have a lovely salt water pool, but it gets a bit crowed in the afternoon. We found out that they have plans to build an adult pool in the future. They could also use a "general store" to buy light meals for the kids. Overall, we would definitely stay there again and I recommend the hotel highly. We had a wonderful vacation at the Four Seasons Resort in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort with Impeccable Service!”
Reviews.Author: sherilah
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fabulous stay at the Four Seasons Resort in Maui. We booked a Garden View room for two nights and had mentioned we were there for our four year wedding anniversary. We also mentioned that we had a travel business (jdubtravel.com) and were upgraded to an Executive Suite! It was GORGEOUS! The room was beautifully decorated...had a dining area, separate living room and balcony w/table and chairs for 4, separate bedroom with another balcony with two lounge chairs, and finally, a very large bathroom with 2 sinks, separate vanity area, separate toilet, large tub, with a separate glass shower. Not only was the room amazing, the service during our entire stay was impeccable. We were always greeted warmly at the pool with attendants waiting on us hand and foot. It was NOT difficult to get a cabana. The pool is on the simple side, but it did not matter. It was all about the vibe, view, and the fabulous service! We ate at both Spago and Duo, both which were delicious. If you like steak, then I highly recommend eating at Duo. It's worth the splurge. We tried the Kobe Beef appetizer at $42 and each bite was worth every penny; simply mouth watering! Before we booked our trip, my husband and I kept going back and forth between staying at the Grand Wailea and the Four Seasons. I read almost every Trip Advisor review and finally came to the conclusion that it's always best to go with the 5 star resort if that's what you are looking for. We ventured over to the Grand Wailea and had wonderful spa treatments. That's about the only thing we found appealing about the hotel. Yes, the pool looks amazing, especially if you have kids, but it was a complete zoo....and yes, the cabanas there are extra & not a lot of shade. (no extra charge for cabanas at the FS) If you are trying to make a decison between the two resorts, go with the Four Seasons, especially if you are looking to be pampered and treated like royalty. The GW looked a little gaudy and dated, in my opinion. One of the highlights of the FS is the game room. In this room they have pool tables, foos ball, ping pong, as well as Guitar Hero, Wi, and other various video games. We had so much fun going over to the video game room (all of which are free of charge for guests) and playing the various games. All in all, we loved our stay and highly, highly recommend the Fours Seasons Maui Resort!

Reviews.Title: “Totally Amazing Wedding!”
Reviews.Author: seafairy
Reviews.Content: We were married at the FS on 7/10 and it was an absolutely perfect, amazing and magical day! We stayed from that Tuesday to Sunday. Our wedding coordinator, Denise, was the best and she made every minute special and stress free. For example, Denise knew that my husband is a huge fan of spam musubi (which you can get at only the "finest" convenience store located at gas stations lol). After the ceremony, we spent a good hour taking pictures. When we returned to the wedding site for dinner, Denise surprised my husband with a spam musubi that she asked the FS chef to make! It's the little touches that make the FS so special. We want to go back every year to celebrate our anniversary! I also wanted to provide some restaurant recommendations. We went to Da Kitchen so many times - awesome. Aloha Mixed Plate was excellent too. Also, Sorento's on the Beach was delicious. The reason we know it's delicious because just before dinner at Sorento's, we went to Da Kitchen for a "snack" and was stuffed by the time we sat down. Still, we tasted all the dishes and everything was yummy!

Reviews.Title: “Pampered”
Reviews.Author: claw73
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights there and left feeling very pampered and not quite ready to face the real world. Beautiful pool with lovely cabanas, which you had to call a pool assistant to set-out for you - no plonking your stuff just anywhere! Should you feel every so slightly dehydrated by the pool, you could always partake the icy cold water and the watermelon, mango, and pineapple on cocktails sticks being distributed every 5 mins. You can also order a coffee to go for the pool. Breakfast was feast and I have to say the best meal in the hotel. If we were disappointed by anything at all, it was the food. A little pretentious at times but they couldn't get a quatre saison pizza right! Our ceasar salad at the poolside restaurant came with so many little dishes to compile ourselves that we felt like asking for a discount. Fish at the upstairs restaurant (forgot its name) were beautifully cooked but it looked like bits of food on a very large plate, with 1-2 pieces of vegetables and small portion of sauce to go with it. We asked for more of course which the waiting staff jumped to, but we couldn't understand why we even have to ask in the first place. Overall the food was overrated and pricey. They could also have done with a Japanese or Oriental eating place. But hey perhaps we should just saviour the fruits on cocktail sticks! I have given it 4-stars because it was just a beautiful place (never mind the food!).

Reviews.Title: “Problems Problems Problems.”
Reviews.Author: girlbird
Reviews.Content: I used to adore staying at this place, and at all Four Seasons. On my most recent trip, I just have to say that it has gone downhill. The service, experience and quality just isn't 'the top of the top' that it used to be. And therefore, it's hardly worth the Four Seasons price. It's still great. But not what it should be for a Four Seasons. They lost our luggage, overcharged for dinner once, didn't have the room ready, the staff seemed distracted. I never do this, but I sat down with the manager. Things improved and he comped us a delicious meal, which was nice. I still think it wasn't the grand experience I'd remembered. I recommend Lanai or the Big Island Four Seasons if you want to pay for the real deal. Oh, and Spago's menu was just ridiculous. They should stop trying to be so creative and silly with all the mixed up combinations. Simple and elegant is better.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, service and location”
Reviews.Author: Im4FunTravel
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons was the last stay for my wife and me on our honeymoon. When we arrived, the lobby was even more spectacular than the pictures on their web site. Upon arrival to our Ocean Prime View room, there was Champagne and chocolate strawberries waiting for us. The view from the room was directly looking the ocean and the center courtyard. We also had our pre-arranged spa, luau, surf lessons, dinner and sunset cruise reservation vouchers sent to our room the day before they occured. We had a rental car to drive around the island, which we did one of the days. Most of the time, the hotel provided free transportation for activites that were within 5 to 10 minutes of the hotel. Most activies can be accessed within hotel transportation. Food was great at the hotel and their suggestions from Concierge were excellent. One restaurant, Capische, was very romantic and each food course was outstanding. The menu was a little limited, but has something for most everyone. We will go back to Capische when we return to the Four Seasons. Even the food at the lobby bar was great. The lobby bar will also provide food from any of the 3 restaurants. Each time we left the resort, we were greated by name by almost every employee. They made sure that if we needed anything beyond what they provided, they would get it for us. The Concierge tried to get us a table along the patio for a great sunset view at Capische, but they said they had no tables with a sunset view that night. We could over hear the Concierge ask Capische to do somthing for a Four Seasons guest, but the restaurant said they had nothing. When leaving for dinner, the Concierge told us that he knew we would love dinner and the view. When we arrived, we were sat on the patio for a sunset dinner. The day we drove to the North Shore, we found a restaurant called Mama's Fish House. The food was great and should be visited when you travel to the North Shore. Great time, great service and great everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: sheanell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited the Four Seasons at Wailea on our 1st anniversary. I had never stayed at a Four Seasons before, but I knew it was supposed to be really nice. It exceeded our expectations. Everything was 1st class! We were welcomed to the hotel with cool beverages and taken to our room quickly. Our room was really nice with a nice view. I love nice hotels and this hotel ranks toward the top of my list. This hotel is really pricy, so my husband and I couldn't afford to stay there the entire time we were visiting the islands, but a few nights at the Four Seasons was definitely worth it. I would definitely recommend the hour massage by the ocean. It's the best massage experience I've ever had. My husband had a great time playing the Plantation golf course up at Kapulua. We did not have a great experience with snorkling here in Maui. The snorkling was GREAT on the Big Island. If you like luxury hotels, it's hard to beat the Four Seasons at Wailea. Just come ready to spend some money, cause it is all very expensive. We both hope to go back some day!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: DstirmVet
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Maui splitting our time between the Ritz and the Four Seasons. This was our first experience with the Four Seaons. We loved our stay at the Ritz. For sheer beauty of the hotel and it's surroundings, you can't beat the Ritz. They had the advantage of building the hotel on large piece of land so they had room to put in a huge pool and the vistas from the hotel are breath taking. The Four Seasons, on the other hand, seems to have been shoe-horned into a small piece of land that was available after the Grand Wailea had stopped expanding. As a result (I believe) they have a tiny little pool. Almost disappointingly tiny. The hotel seems to have recognized this, they told us they were planning another pool but from the map they showed us, the new pool will be small too. That being said, the Four Seasons has the beach right in front of them. Unlike the Ritz, it's not a hike down to the beach. Choose your cabana right and you can take advantage of the beach and the pool all day long. From the pictures I saw of the beach on the Four Seaons web site, I thought I would be disappointed but I was not. It's a gorgeous beach. The Four Seasons is also located in Wailea where the weather tends to be milder than up in Kaplaua where the Ritz is located. There were days when you would get wind and rain at the Ritz and see sunshine a few miles down the road in Lahaina. For that reason alone, we decided to try the Four Seasons. The service at the Four Seasons is incredible. We were met at the front door with a lei and a bead necklace and guided to the front desk where there was no waiting. (We had to wait 15 minutes at the Ritz to check in). And the staff all seem to make an effort to remember your name and give friendly service. The beach and poolside service was what impressed us the most. I've never ever seen so many attendents working so hard to please you. The cabanas are free to use. At the beach, they set up a chair and an umbrella for you. The Ritz is slighly less expensive (relatively speaking). And it offers one of the most beautiful hotels I've ever seen. The Four Seasons has the advantage of being in Wailea, and the service is outstanding but you do pay for it. After comparing the two hotels, we plan on returning to the Four Seasons next time we are in Maui. P.S. My wife loved Spago. I loved the steak at Duo.

Reviews.Title: “Everything Perfect”
Reviews.Author: funcouple222
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to the four seasons maui for our honeymoon. We have stayed at several other four seasons hotel's and I must say that the service specifically at this hotel is above all that we have experienced. Everything from our arrival, to our room which was a prime ocean view room on the club level(not worth the extra money if you ask me, our first room was not on the club level (789) and was around 1 thousand per night, the club level was basically the same room with a touch better view of west maui from our balcony and was almost 1400, needless to say both were great..... Duo was great in the morning, Feraro's lunch was good as well. Poolside or cabana service was unreal, drinks on command, cold towels, evian spray, fruit, everything great. Spago is a wolfgang puck restaurant which was very good, the sunset from the restaurant is breathtaking. Actually went to the four seasons lanai, we were supposed to stay there for five days after we were at maui, it was such a downer that we left lanai and went back to the four seasons maui for our last 3 nights. Overall, honeymoon was fantastic, great service, beautiful well manicured grounds, I would recommend the place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “4 Seasons Wailea - Still the best on Maui!”
Reviews.Author: vinceonthemove
Reviews.Content: After a 10 year hiatus, my return to the FS Wailea was long overdue. It was an absolute pleasure to arrive at this beautiful property after the long journey from New York. The entire property is immaculate, and very well maintained. It looks as great as I left it in 1998. A testament to the FS Mgt., and their staff. We were met with the traditional lei greeting, and tropical juices in the gorgeous lobby. Valet and bellmen were right on point. (Overnight valet parking $18 a day). At the front desk we met Yarnell, a transplanted gem from the Bronx, NY. We were upgraded to a partial ocean view room. We stayed on the B&B plan which included the great buffet breakfast at $655 a night including all taxes and fees. (Note: If you book a few months in advance you could get this plan on the FS website for under $500 a night.) Our room (#436) was very nice, large flat screen tv etc., and had a great lanai overlooking the putting green, and croquet lawn. With the ocean in the distance, the room actually faced in the direction of the main entrance of the hotel, but was obscured by the beautiful tropical foilage (very quiet). The sunsets from the lanai were breathtaking. The only issue with the room for me was the long walk from the elevators, but after a couple of days in Maui who cares. Room service was quick and delicious (burger and cobb salad). Twice a day housekeeping was excellent. Alert!***One room amenity the FS missed is the ol' "chocolate on the pillow" at turn down. Call me old school and a chocolate addict, but I did miss not having my nightly chocolate fix. Come on FS Mgt. chocolate please! The bountiful buffet was great! Made to order eggs/omelets, pancakes, french toast, and all of the other breakfast staples. Service for breakfast at DUO was wonderful, quick and polite. There was a service charge included on the bill bringing it to almost $80 for 2, but covered in full with the B&B package. For those with kiddies, they even set up a kids buffet at the entrance of DUO so kids can share in the FS breakfast experience. The pool, aaaah the pool(s). Main pool centered with a beautiful fountain, spa included. Waterfall pool, and adjacent kiddie pool. They may not be the biggest, but were never crowded and were a great place to lounge and relax. The pool service is second to none! Bright and early the pool staff awaited your arrival. Here we met Kanoe, and Javier. These great guys met our every need with speed and a smile. We loved the mini-macadamia muffins. Note: There were some guests that pulled the very, very early "put my towel and book" in the best cabana scam, but this was held to a minimum by the policing of the staff. Trust me, you don't mess with Kanoe! Try and land the seats on the mini-cliff facing the ocean...awesome view! Food and drink at the pool was very good and service was fast. Some of my favorite pool fare were (veggy pizza, the burger and steak fries, and the chicken quesadilla). $7 dollar Heinekens, but Hey! your on vacation. For dinner we dined at DUO, and Ferraro's...missed Spago. At DUO we had the grilled catch of the day, and the filet mignon very delicious. At Ferraro's we had the fried shrimp and calamari (excellent), bruschetta and the signature lobster risotto, and the seafood pasta also very good. Service and ambiance at both restaurants were right on target. The FS gym (accessed through the spa entrance) was very well equipped, with the ellipticals and treadmills (w/tv's) outdoors which I enjoyed. The Spa was modern with Hawaiian flair, enjoy a glass of the ginger blast water. The Men's steam room was awesome! the hottest I ever experienced...time to sweat out the pool cocktails. We really enjoyed our massages, ask for Giselle she was absolutely wonderful. From Saimin (soup) to Macadamia (nuts), we truly enjoyed every aspect of our stay at the FS Wailea. I give the FS Maui 5 Hoku's (stars). The hotel property, and surrounding Wailea area is beautiful. Don't forget to check out the Shops at Wailea. There's a local ABC store for water, wine, sundries and souvenirs. Also, a Gap and Banana Republic to the high line shops Tiffany & Co, Louis Vuitton & Fendi theres something for everyone. I promise not to wait another ten years before returning to this paradise. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Bitterly Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: nappieb
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at most Four Seasons' resorts in the US and some abroad. I expected a comparable level of service at this hotel in Wailea, Maui because it bears the Four Seasons' name. I was sadly mistaken! I reserved a "Club Level" room which I believed to be a significant step up from the luxury suite that was featured in all the literature with which I had been provided. Indeed, the "Club Level" room rate was 60% above any other room except for their special suites and I was assured that this room was the top-of-the-line room ranking just below the Executive Suites. Imagine my dismay when I disovered that: (a) the Club Level room was about one third the size of the lower tier luxury room, (b) the Club Level room had hardly any ocean view compared to the panoramic ocean views of the lower tier rooms, (c) the Club Level room had just one small lanai (balcony) compared to TWO LARGE balconies for the lower tier room, (d) the Club Level room had no dining area versus a spacious dining/entertaining area in each lower tier room, (e) the Club Level room had just one TV set in the bedroom vs a total of two in the luxury room ... and the Club Level room cost 60% MORE than the lower tier "luxury" rooms!!! Are they nuts!! I asked to be downgraded (yes, DOWNGRADED!) to the lower tier luxury room. The Four Seasons front desk grudgingly agreed to do this (gee thanks!).. and I spent the rest of my stay in a decent suite for a fraction of the cost of their "superior" Club Level accomodation. I get to Hawaii often, I thought I was treating myself but I'll never stay at the Four Seasons again!

Reviews.Title: “4 Seasons, 4 Stars not 5”
Reviews.Author: blubear
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Four Seasons for the last 2 nights for our honeymoon in the beginning of June. Our room was not ready until 3:15 when check-in was 3pm, but that was not too big of a deal except when you see everyone else checking in and going to their rooms. The room itself was great, with a patio and one of the best bathrooms that we have ever seen. Like everyone says the pool is great and we did not go to the pool until about noon each day and we were able to get cabana's. Contrary to another reviewer we really enjoyed the fitness equipment being outside, it was a different touch, especially nice to get out of the sun for a little bit. The weight room inside was not that big but very nice, and nicer than the other hotel gyms we stayed at. The food at Spago was superb!!! Great service and a great meal. The breakfast at Duo was not very good, and we had a problem with service one morning and they ended up comping our breakfast because we ordered off the menu and they took 45 minutes. It was a very relaxing hotel to stay with a great beach, and you do not have to leave if you don't want and can be very happy. My biggest complaint is the service seemed "forced". We stayed at the Hyatt in Kauai and felt that the service was better and friendlier the entire time. Many of the employees of the Four Seasons were not locals, they were from mainland US or Europe. They were too in your face and it felt they were helping you because they had too, not because they wanted too. There was no "aloha" spirit at the Four Seasons, it all seemed fake. Overall it was a great place to stay and end our honeymoon, but it was not as incredible as many people make it to be.

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon bliss”
Reviews.Author: AmeliaS
Reviews.Content: This is absolutely the most amazingly perfect place on Earth. My husband and I went several years ago for our honeymoon. I stumbled across the reviews while planning another trip and felt compelled to write a little as the pictures brought back so many perfect memories. Obviously, The Four Seasons is still as wonderful as it was while we were there. We arrived in Maui late in the day and were exhausted. After hasseling with the car rental place and picking up our rental, we arrived at The Four Seasons and immediately went to our suite. Hawaiian music was playing in the background. Champagne was chilling on the table. A bowl of fresh fruit welcomed us. We were finally able to relax after the long flight from Dallas. We booked an executive suite the first few days but had to move to a regular room for the remainder of the trip. The suite had been booked by someone else prior to our trip--my husband's fault in planning. Moving was not that big of a deal as they handled it all. We were in Maui for a couple of weeks and --once we recovered from the exhausting wedding and began exploring Maui--we spent the latter part of our trip at a Bed and Breakfast in Haiku. We felt pampered and relaxed and everything was so peaceful and perfect. This was absolutely the cure for our wedding and dealing with stress of it all. We needed to recover from our wedding and this was the perfect place to be with each other and to enjoy our first days as a married couple. We love adventure and really enjoyed renting a jeep and exploring the Up Country... We opted to purchase gourmet snacks at Safeway (and champagne) to keep in our room. We went to Tedeschi Vineyard...many churches and hidden beaches. We definately loved the CD recording to Hana and it led us to find places we never would to explore. We went on a hike and found a waterfall in a bamboo forest. Every day should be a day at the Four Seasons in Maui. This was absolute heaven. We noticed a few celebrities but it was nothing. We did not care or make a deal out of it. We felt like celebrities while there and were treated as such. We ended up with a special souvenier of a honeymoon baby. The Four Seasons was an amazing beginning to our marriage and the best place to start our life together.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found!”
Reviews.Author: CarsonsMommy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the week of May 29 - June 5th at this gorgeous resort. I had read mixed reviews in the past, but found our experience to be beyond compare! We were greeted with leis, ice cold beverages and chilled lavendar scented towels. We did not receive an upgrade from our oceanview room, but were offered a $3,000/night oceanview suite for $500 extra. We decided to stay with our orignal room, which was quite lovely and roomy. We spent most of our on-property time at the pool, hanging out in our cabana - we usually came down around 11:30 or in the afternoon, and never had a problem getting one. Although I was told that at Christmas week, people sneak down at 4 am to snag one! The service was great - Evian spritzers, ice cold water, yummy beverages (try the Key Lime Colada and the Lava Flow) and delicious lunches. My favorite was the Margherita Pizza. They also bring you frozen icees and cold fruit - such as watermelon or pineapple. We enjoyed our lunch at Ferraros', and dinner as well. Our 1st night in Maui, we were exhausted, but had an oceanfront table for sunset, so we tried it - and loved it! I had forgotten my sunglasses, so the waitress brought me a platter with 4 pair to pick from - talk about service! We toasted the sunset with a glass of Prosecco. I like my Lobster Risotto (not the best I've ever had, but really good), but my husband said his sea bass was the best, freshest fish he had ever eaten. The view was so amazing, that we had to pry ourselves away after dinner, remembering that the Road to Hana would mean an early start! The morning of Hana, we had a delicious room service breakfast, and they packed us a picnic basket, complete with cloth napkins and silverware, which made for a wonderful picnic on Hamoa Beach. Other days we ate at Duo - the breakfast buffet was wonderful! $28 for continental, $32 for hot. The made to order shrimp omelette I had the 1st day there was delicious! We also ate at Spago's, which I loved. Service was great, even though we had pushed our reservation back due to a late return from Hana. I loved the heirloom tomato salad, and the Chinese Pepper Scallops. I had a drink called Lush that was yummy as well. My husband did not like his dinner as much as Ferraro's, but this type of high energy, see and be seen environment is more my style than his. Our best dinner at the resort was the Ultimate Dinner. Pricey, but worth every penny! You get to plan your own menu, filled with all of your favorite things, in a planning session with the chef. You get your own private waiter, secluded dining area overlooking the beach, a bottle of champagne, a different glass of wine paired with each of the 6 courses, and even a violinist! What a way to spend an anniversary! We also indulged in the couples massage in the oceanside hale- the Wailea one left us feeling as limp and relaxed as rag dolls! The gift shops were really nice. I found 2 really cute beach coverups, and even found out that a photo album with a turtle on it I got at the Shops at Wailea, was a few dollars cheaper at the resort. All in all, it was an unforgettable experience - by the end we were trying to figure out how long we could stay if we sold everything we owned. Unfortunately, it was not long enough!

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons in Maui is nothing short of incredible!”
Reviews.Author: ericbaum
Reviews.Content: My wife and just returned from 8 amazing nights at the Four Seasons in Maui at Wailea. I do not have too much to add here other than that everything wonderful you have ever heard about this resort doesn't give it enough justice. From the bellhop boys to the the waiters/waitresses, to the help by the pool everyone was gracious, accomodating and provided absolute impeccable 5 star service! There wasn't one instance where we walked by an employee of the 4S and they didn't smile or say "aloha". Before we booked our room, we had reservations about which type of room to stay in. To have at least a little view of the ocean from our hotel room was our goal. We chose to stay in the partial ocean view room and never regretted it once. If you choose this route you will actually have a view of the ocean while lying in bed. Man! What a way to wake up by staring out at the most royal blue water I've ever seen! The room provides more than enough room for 2 people. The bathroom is huge with seperate deep soaking tub and marble shower. The room has a little refridgerator that we were able to put some snacks in. One last note on the room. The beds are the most comfortable we have ever slept in! We have been fans of Westin's Heavenly Bed but they don't touch the bed at the 4S in Maui. It was so awesome to wake up, go for a walk on the path on the beach, have breakfast at the buffet at Duos then go "veg" out by the pool or beach and be waited on hand and foot. They come by every half hour or so and offer you fresh delicious orange slices or pineapple as well as offer a cold towel and spritz if you'd like. What pampering! If you can afford it, there is no doubt that 4S will leave you completely satisfied. It is pricey, but worth every single penny. It is located in Wailea which is an upscale area in itself with beautiful golf courses, restaurants and shops all within 5 minutes by car. My wife and I absolutely treasured our time in Maui at the Four Seasons and cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great with Kids!!”
Reviews.Author: Ilovetotravel12
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons was amazing. We arrived on 5/7/08 and we stayed two nights. From the moment you arrive you are greeted by the valet, opening your door and helping you with your luggage. They greet you with orchid lei for the women and leaf lei for the men. We travelled with our two girls ages 1 and 2. They even greeted them by their names and gave them shell lei. At check in they had cool lavender scented towels to freshen up and they came out with a basket full of toys for the girls to pick from. When we arrived to the room they had baby proofed the room like I had requested and had snacks with tub toys for the girls and a bottle of Champagne for us for our anniversary. They also had Whale stuffed animals as souvanir gifts for the girls. The room was set up with a crib and extra diapers, swim diapers and toiletries. We had a mountain view room, which I'm glad we got because you hardly spend time in the room anyway. And the view of the mountains is nice. They do face the road and the AC units, but you can't hear anything with the doors closed. The room of course is huge and they have complimentary robes and slippers for your use while in the hotel. They also have a beach bag that you can use while there and if you want to purchase it you can as well. The bathroom is gorgeous. They had the girls names spelled out with sponge letters. They spelled one of the girls name wrong, which was not a big deal, the bell boy right away got on his walkie talkie and had someone send the right letters. They have a little refrigerator with water and it came in handy for the girls milk and juices. The pool, is everything you have read and seen, but since I spent most of my time in the childrens area I will speak about that. The children's pool area is nice with a toddler pool and two other pools with waterfalls and a small slide. They have cabanas free of charge of course and if you like they bring out a pack n play with the little ones to nap. We did have trouble finding a Cabana by the children's area since its smaller. They also have beach chairs but they are in the sun. The beach is beautiful and they have sand toys for the kids to play with. They set up your chairs with umbrella and we never felt pressured to tip even though we did. For our anniversary night we hired a nanny from The Nanny Connection. She was great! The Four Seasons recommend this nanny company as well an they use them for baby sitting services. I was a little hesitant but quickly became comforted when she came in with a bag full of new toys and the girls took right to her. They didn't even notice when we left. We also had her for a snorkel trip we took. She came to our condo after the four seasons. We ate at ferraros for lunch which was good but I have never spent almost $100 for lunch. We knew it was going to be pricey but we didn't want to leave because the girls were tired after a morning of fun in the sun! For our anniversary dinner we ate at Duo's. We loved it, the food was great and we loved the plate full of cotton candy that they give at the end. We asked if they could bag what was left for the girls and the waiter was nice to bring us a whole new bag. I wrote a lot about what they had for children because when I was researching I felt that the majority of people that gave reviews spoke negative about the children or stated that it was not a good hotel for children. My fears were calmed when I arrived and realized that The Four Seasons caters to everyone and there were many families with children.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: jaztuck
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay. Intelligent staff who remembers you and your needs. No request is questioned and they have the best brunch we have ever had in our lives. Even when fully booked, it did not seem very busy.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon! Go Here!”
Reviews.Author: randy74
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed every single second we had at the FS Maui. It was truly an amazing experience. We have traveled to many of the most wonderful resorts around the world and this was by far the best. The service is dynamite. The pool staff works so hard to make sure your every need is met. We had no problems finding space in the morning. We loved the beach. It was very quiet when we were there - no kids, no noise. It was so peaceful.
