We checked out the neighboring hotels and they do not compare. The rooms were gorgeous and huge. The grounds were clean. The only complaint I had with the room was with the carpet. We saw some stains on the carpet (which I see some previous reviewers also saw). I know the hotel just went through major renovations so we were a little surprised to see that, but hopefully management can get that under control. This hotel is the very best. We can only say wonderful things about it. We ended up eating every meal on property - all were great. Enjoy your time here.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing! Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Missshopper
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely wonderful hotel in every aspect! From the moment we checked it, we were made to feel special. We arrived after spending time in Australia for our son's wedding and needed some relaxation after the long trip there. I wrote to them ahead of time and told them we were celebrating three occasions (our son's wedding, our anniversary, and my birthday). They upgraded us from a garden view room to an ocean view room. The room was specious with a large, opulent bathroom. The view was very nice and we enjoyed our balcony- even had room service breakfast one morning! The staff looked after you at all times. I did as suggested and tipped the cabana boy $20 each day. I was up and down there at 7 to get a cabana facing the ocean. Several people took cabanas but also held chairs in the sun which I felt was a little unfair when people had a hard time finding chairs later on in the day. I think it it was fully booked, it might be hard to do this. We had lunch twice in our cabana and drinks. They constantly bring water and check to see if you want anything. This is all done with a smile. I never had to look for anyone when we wanted something. Drinks are expensive there (from $12 to $18) but they are good! We ate breakfast at Duo's and the buffet was very good. It was $35 each but the food selection was large. Everything cooked was delicious. We also ate dinner there one night and it was our best meal there. We had drinks at Ferraro's several times as well as dinner once. It was very good (at about $200 with just one salad,2 entrees, and splitting a dessert with 2 drinks). I had the lobster risotto which was wonderful. I am glad I did my research and chose this hotel, rather than the Grand Wailea which was very noisy and crowded or the Fairmont which looked shabby and needs an upgrade. We hated to leave here!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded All Our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: linekelei
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons Wailea from May 24-May 31 and had a wonderful time. The service was the best we have had anywhere and the property is absolutely stunning. We were always able to get a cabana with an ocean view, and the service around the pool was outstanding. Fresh fruit, Evian "spritzes," sunglass cleaning, etc. The concierge is extremely accommodating. Every time we called for the courtesy car to pick us up from local restaurants, it was waiting for us the moment we stepped outside. We highly recommend the breakfast buffet, which is huge and changes daily. Spago and Ferraros were both great. We did not try Duo only because we didn't feel like eating steak in Hawaii. It looks good, though, if you're craving red meat. If you like to run, there is a beautiful beach path right outside the hotel that wraps around the coastline. It's about 1.5 miles, so you can do a quick 3-mile run going down and back with beautiful views of the ocean. The workout room also has great cardio and free weight equipment, along with as much free gatorade and water as you want. I did the Wai Aulia (cocoon bed) at the spa and recommend it highly. It feels like you're floating in the ocean while you get your massage. I also recommend the free outrigger canoe activity and the (not-free) scuba dive experience. Both were outstanding, and the staff were very friendly and accommodating. We saw four sea turtles during the outrigger canoe trip and all kinds of tropical fish during the scuba dive. I have no complaints at all about the service. The only minor annoyance was a corporate convention that the hotel was hosting. They did "team-building" exercises on the beach using a loud microphone that everyone could hear at the pool. We were surprised the Four Seasons let them do this, but it only lasted an hour or so. The only other thing to note is that there are a lot of kids, and a lot of parents that have no qualms about letting their children scream through meals and scream at the cabanas. Again, this was more the exception than the rule, and there's not much the hotel can do about this. But it can be frustrating. We had just a fabulous a time and wish we were still at the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to every expectation!!”
Reviews.Author: mainash
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Four Seasons Wailea for the first leg of our honeymoon. It exceeded every expectation that we had of it! Upon our arrival we were greeted and each given a lei. Check in was very easy and, because the hotel wasn't packed, they upgraded us to a partial ocean view room. It was our honeymoon and when we got to the room the manager had sent us a bottle of champagne. The property has three restaurants and that night we went to dinner at Ferraro's which was our favorite restaurant because of the wonderful outdoor seating overlooking the Pacific. The next day we enjoyed the beach, the pool, took a water aerobics class and just had fun at the property. Everything was 5-star but not stuffy. There was always someone bringing water or fresh fruit while we were laying by the pool. There was complimentary sunscreen and always someone to help you. The second night we were there we dined at Spago. The food and ambiance was excellent, but our service was bad :( We were slightly annoyed and made a small note about it on our bill. The next day, the manager sent us a complimentary bottle of champagne as an apology!! That's some amazing customer service. The gym isn't big but it has everything you need, the spa is beautiful and the grounds are well kept. Yes, it costs a lot, but it is totally worth it! We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “The Four Seasons was absolutely amazing”
Reviews.Author: Brooke2
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons was definitely the most beautiful, amazing hotel I have ever stayed at. I found the hotel overwhelming right from the beginning, from the impressive entrance to the hotel, the lobby and hotel interior, the large pool area, waterfall and the manicured lawns. I felt like royalty simply being there. The staff were very attentive and since we were staying in a Club room, we were given a 10 minute introduction by the manager at the beginning of our stay. Our room was nice, large in size with a huge bathroom and private balcony overlooking the ocean and lawn. At the pool, I felt a bit in awe at first because of the other people who (to me) seemed a bit like celebrities. There seemed to be quite a few ultra-wealthy people staying there (no wonder, as we paid over $1,000 for one night). However by the second morning I felt more comfortable in the surrounds. The pool was awesome, huge with a large waterfall in the middle. The whole view down the lawn through to the pool and then down to the beach was outstanding. There were numerous cabanas around the pool too, so finding a seat was not an issue. Just down from the pool was Wailea beach, which was beautiful. The water was very clear and aqua-coloured, with no waves which I liked as the south coast tends to be quite sheltered. One of the things which surprised me, and made the stay even nicer, was the hotel's attention to detail. There were different types of sunscreen available at different locations around the pool. There was plenty of good service and refreshments in the pool area. Even at the beginning when we were checking in, they gave us refreshing hand towels. The little things like this made the stay even more enjoyable. They had several restaurants, however we only went to Ferraro's, an Italian restaurant on the water which was absolutely beautiful. It was mostly outdoor, with a lot of candles so it was really romantic. The food and service was outstanding. I would go back to the Four Seasons in an instant. Everything about the hotel and the area was amazing. The only issue was the cost - if I could find a cheaper room, even if it was not "ocean view", it would still be worth it as using the hotel facilities would far outweigh being in the room. I think some celebrities have been there. Someone said Arnold Schwarzenegger and maybe even Paris Hilton. Anyway it was definitely the best hotel I have ever been to, and I'd say most other people would feel the same way.

Reviews.Title: “Highlight of my honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: lexxis
Reviews.Content: I stayted at the Four Seasons during my honeymoon. This hotel is fantastic, actually the best that I have ever stayed in. The room was big, modern and very well maintained and I had a garden in the back. The staff was friendly and very helpful, especially by the pool and the beach. As you enter the pool/beach area, their staff would come greet you and walk you over to an available beach chair and set a towel on there for you. From time to time they would come over and spray some evian mist water on the guest's face to cool down their guests from the heat. Aside from that -the waiters are walking around with a tray of complimentary fruits and ice water to give to the guest. I cannot compliment more on this hotel as everything was fantastic. This hotel was the highlight of my honeymoon! Overall, you get what you paid for!

Reviews.Title: “The BEST Hotel we have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: gidgster
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week's stay at the Four Seasons in Maui. Our stay could not have been any better! The rooms was large and cleaned immaculately. The service by the pool was EXCELLENT! In the morning the pool staff sets you up with towels on the chair or cabana of your choice. They come by and clean your sun glasses and provide you with a cool glass of water. They also provide a cool wash clothe scented with lavender at various points during the day. Then throughout the day they come and refill your glass. Delicious lunch options (my personal favorite was the turkey wrap) are served poolside. Oh.. I almost forgot the Breakfast buffet.. the best ever! My husband is a huge connoisseur of eggs Benedict.. he has it everywhere we go.. this was the best he had ever had. The concierge was very helpful gave excellent recommendations for dinner and excursions. All in all this was the best vacation ever.. and this hotel experience was FANTASTIC.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best”
Reviews.Author: SBFTX
Reviews.Content: We cannot say enough good things about FS Maui! We can't wait to go back. We have 2 boys - 14 & 10 - they loved it too. They are too old for the kids camp but they have a fabulous games room with PS, XBox, pool tables, flat screen TV with movies, lot of games. We stayed on the club level which is just unmatched anywhere else! The food and drinks were fabulous. The concierges on that floor are the best there is - Gigi, Pat - all of them. They were all so friendly - knew our names, talked to us and the kids every day. They make fabulous martinis by the way -- just to your order! Premium wine selections too. I have never seen such great food at a club level - 4 presentations a day - you can almost eat there only! The beach is wonderful and service is great throughout the property. Took a great snorkel trip. Our room was fantastic too - large bathroom - large lanai with beautiful ocean views. The kids stayed in our room too - they made sure to make up the sofa bed for them and would their things cutely arranged for them every night. The FS does not disappoint in any way - we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Like being at a wealthy friend's villa!!”
Reviews.Author: Aurora22
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin.....I have stayed at many 4 and 5 star resorts.....but this one has got service, hospitality, beauty and cleanliness down pat!! Even before we arrived, we could call a 1-800 number and speak to the hotel directly about any questions/concerns we had. How many hotels can you do that with these days? You usually get central reservations. From the moment we arrived, until the moment we left (I believe I had tears), I felt like I was being taken care of by a good friend at his extremely beautiful villa! This place has what I could only describe as 'grace'. It will pamper you and make you feel relaxed without being snobish, or expecting anything. They continued to amaze me with their hospitality, from the gifts for the children when we arrived and left, to the fact they went out of their way to buy my son special Almond milk as he has a sensitivity to cow's milk and every staff member seemed to know this at every restaurant. They were never intrusive but always seemed to be gracious. My husband and I were always amazed at how the hotel seemed to think of everything - even providing a small outdoor hanging rack to dry your bathing suits on your lanai. My son and daughter especially liked the Kids for all Seasons program and the gentleman in the games room who would be around every night and help my son with any of the games if he got stuck. The housekeeping staff left the room spotless (I am a clean freak) and just because I was curious I ran my finger on the baseboard in the hallway and it was CLEAN! I don't normally do that but was just curious as it seemed so clean! The artwork and furniture in this hotel are truly beautiful but we never felt like our kids could break anything - maybe because of where it is placed or the type they chose but it didn't feel like a museum. They seem to love kids here and always knew our name - the pool staff were always there to help you. Just to give you an idea of how I felt about this hotel's care, I once brought my towels from the pool up to my room as we were still wet and although normally I would never even think of this, at this hotel I actually brought them back down to the pool as I felt they were always so kind to us that I wouldn't leave them for housekeeping. Strange maybe, but they were really amazing to us. The beach is great here also and of course they set you up with umbrellas and chairs there as well. They also have magazines, water, and the best sunscreen available to the guests to use at each pool stand - that was a wonderful treat as we'd often forget ours upstairs. It was so good I bought some of it at the spa to take home! I can honestly say this hotel is doing something right, and this is seen with its' employees as every employee knew exactly how to treat guests. Good for you as this is a reflection of your company as a whole. It will be hard to find service, beauty and grace at another hotel after having experienced this one without staying at an exclusive villa! Good for you Four Seasons!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoSandman
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a wedding in April and can't say enough good things about it. They treated us like royalty the entire time. The food was outstanding in every restaurant. Worth every penny. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Midwest14
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Maui was superb!!! The hotel grounds and pool area are beautiful. We reserved a garden view executive suite (about 850 sf) for 7 nights. When we arrived they greeted us by name and directed us to the check in gave us a lilac scented wash cloth and then showed us to our room. The room was beautiful plus we had a box of cookies plus fresh candy waiting for us. For my daughter, they left an underwater camera and a "beachy" picture frame for her. Nice touch. The bathroom is ginormous with a deep tub and great bath products. When I made the reservation I contacted the hotel directly. Please be aware that they will make you give a 2 night deposit when reserving a room. We didn't have any problems with that but I could see where some last minute changes in someone's plans could cost you a night or two without refund. We loved the pool area. We didn't have any problems with getting a cabana when we needed one. One of the pool guys named Shawn was a real standout. Always ready to help with whatever you need with a smile. Basically, we never wanted to leave the resort. We rented a car for one day to drive to Lahaina but it's a real tourist trap. It was described as an old fishing village but it's a main street with t-shirt shops and stores. This wasn't a big deal but I'm not sure that we will ever go back. The food at all 3 restaurants was above average. It was good but for these prices it should be outstanding. Breakfast is $32 for the full buffet and $28 for Wailea buffet which is more of a continental fare. We ate at the buffet every morning and started to tire of it a little bit by the end of our trip. Don't get me wrong, it was tasty but would have liked to venture out to try something else. We loved ordering lunch by the pool. That was a real treat. My daughter and I made reservation for a hiking trip which is totally worth it. It was a three hour trip down a mountain and back up. If you go hiking make sure to bring insect repellent. Those mosquitoes are man eaters out there. We also had the concierge make reservations for a luau at the Marriott Wailea 2 properities down the beach. The food was good and we enjoyed the show but now that we experienced it once not sure we would do it again. The true test of the resort came when I sliced my foot open while on the beach. Security came down to help and realized that the cut was much more than could be handled by a band-aid. They whisked me over to the Grand Wailea next door where there was a Dr. on call. 12 shots and 13 stitches later I was all patched up. Luckily this was our last day and were leaving for the airport a couple of hours after this happened. Also, if you have to see the Dr. at Resort Medicine with will cost you cash or credit card. They don't except insurance and it was $545 out of pocket. But I was grateful that they were there. Since we had to check out of our room before our flight and I wasn't able to walk, the FS resort let us use the Aloha suite until we were ready to leave for the airport. Overall, we loved, loved, loved, the resort and had a wonderful time and would definitely return. The staff is top notch and so friendly. They work their rears off to make sure that everything is just perfect for you. I don't have any complaints. If you're not happy here, you wouldn't be happy anywhere. ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Fantastic Food and Service!”
Reviews.Author: rickh710
Reviews.Content: I concur with all of the glowing reviews about Four Seasons at Wailea. The resort is classy and stylish, with beautiful, airy public spaces and large, comfortable guest rooms. The beauty of the place cannot even compare to the customer service, which is fantastic: the staff is constantly smiling and calling you by name. Just the service poolside, with cold towels, tropical drinks, offerings of fresh fruit and sunscreen is worth the room price. The "Partial Ocean View" room my partner and I shared was great - you can see from the attached photos that it was spacious and had a terrific view of the gardens and ocean beyond. Bed is super comfortable, the bathroom HUGE and the balcony large enough to lounge and enjoy a meal on. Air conditioning is super cold - add the ceiling fan and you can comfortably sleep on even the hottest Hawaiian evening. Only complaint about the room (and the whole resort) is that the carpet (which was recently replaced as part of an overhaul of all guest rooms) was filthy dirty, with spill stains throughout the room. Very un-Four Seasons. Food was great throughout the resort. Spago for dinner was well worth the money: terrific service, mouth-watering entrees and a super view of the beach and ocean. Ferraro's for lunch poolside was also very good, if pricey - the turkey club I had was piled high with freshly-roasted turkey, avocado and thick bacon. We had the breakfast buffet at Duo as part of our package - it's large and filled with a lot of good stuff, but probably not worth the pice of $35 per person. Spa experience was only average, in my opinion. I was not escorted to the locker area ad shown the facilities, and I think it's odd to ask guests to go to the locker rooms behind the check-in desk, then emerge with their robes on and cross in front of the check-in (where others are arriving) to then go into the treatment waiting room. I had the scrub, wrap and massage package, and the first two segments were enjoyable, but the "Mele Wailea" massage was perhaps the most odd and uncomfortable treatment I have ever experienced. The therapist seemed to be concerned mostly with pushing on my pressure points with all of his strength, to the point of it being unbearable. Took the recommendation of the concierge to eat at Capische, a restaurant located at the Diamond Resort a short distance from the Four Seasons. It was TERRIFIC - romantic setting, beautiful views and excellent food. All in all, a great resort and well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in the world! Got married here!”
Reviews.Author: blckscream
Reviews.Content: I got married on the seasons lawn with a group of 50 people. It was absolutely amazing. Every detail was considered. The property is gorgeous. Very well appointed. Service is impeccable - outstanding. Staff was great - every single person. The rooms are a little small, but very well taken care of. Food in the hotel is great - best brunch ever! Spago is fantastic. The spa was luxurious. Gym is awesome - they have gatorade in pretty canisters and towels soaked in lemon water. Lemon water, sunscreen, sunglass cleaners, fruit balls, water spritzes, fluffy lounge covers - all available the pool & beach. Not a single complaint. Worth every penny. Raised the bar very high for what a luxury hotel should be. Will be back many times in the years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: FlyingFrequently
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons Maui is splendid. There's plenty of great, thorough reviews so I will hit the highlights from our week there: We had an ocean view room and I would recommend that for first timers - otherwise the various "mountain side" packages that they occasionally offer would be suitable for a return trip if the view isn't that important to you. Spago's is great. Having dined at Spago's in Palo Alto and in Southern Cal, we feel Spago at FS Maui is the best. We dined here twice and especially enjoyed the ahi tuna cones. We dined our first night at Ferraro's and then returned for lunch once. It is a nice, quiet atmosphere accented with tiki torches. We went to DUO once at the end of our trip, but wish we tried it earlier - in order to return. Spago is wonderful and was always full (yet no issue with service), while DUO was less crowded. DUO's food is great and the service impeccable. If you are looking for a light dinner, try appetizers and small plates in the lobby bar. We really enjoyed it and there was live music. The beach is great and the pool is similarly wonderful. We rented a convertible and made it to Hana, to the top of the volcano for sunset (excellent). The FS staff will pack you a blanket and other goodies if you mention to them in advance that you are heading up there. We were pleased to have the blanket as it gets quite cold up there. We also drove up through Lahaina; we spent 5 mins there and found that too much time! I recommend buying the book Maui Revealed as it has great tips. After Lahaina, we navigated up the northwest side of the island and enjoyed a very laid back casual day hiking into waterfalls, enjoying banana bread at a little street side stand and buying fresh fruit. On our return, the FS noticed us carrying in mango, papaya, pineapple, etc and they offered to prepare it for us whenever we would like. Another nice little extra. As we were there for a honeymoon, they sent delivered at least one special gift every day - usually 2 or more. Champagne, fruit, chocolates, etc. It was very nice. The room service here is outstanding. Strongly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: lovegoodhotels
Reviews.Content: We had one of our best hotel experiences here at the Four Seasons Wailea. We were on the club floor, which is in the south tower on the eighth (top) floor, in an ocean view prime room. We had views of the courtyard gardens, pool and ocean. It was the priciest room available at $1200.00 a night but we decided to splurge on this trip. The last time we were here, we simply purchased a garden view room and still had a good time. This hotel makes sure you feel comfortable no matter where you are. Because of an earlier visit to FS, we were aware that even our room category was set back a way from the beach. But we still saw the beach not just the ocean from our room and heard the waves crashing when we opened the lanai doors. But we were never disturbed by sounds out at the pool or even in neighboring rooms. In fact, our room seemed sound proof. Either that or the guests are extremely quiet. No kids running down the halls or people partying and not knowing when to keep it down. Just peace. And we really needed it. When we first arrived at the hotel, our room smelled really musty. Our neighbors next door complained of the same thing. We talked to the manager on duty and they arranged for us to stay in a lesser category room for the night while engineering cleaned off the mildew on the air vent and replaced the air filter. What a difference that made! The manager arranged for our dinner to be paid for that night to make up for our "trouble". The rest of our trip was without inconvenience. All of the rooms here are unbelieveably comfortable. They have different color schemes in either green, gold, blue or coral. The beds are pillow topped, the plasma t.v.'s have beautiful, clear pictures and the bathrooms are pure endulgence. There is a bench and a whole side of the bathroom where ladies, you can sit and leisurely primp. The sinks are so far apart, you'll never bump in to whoever you're sharing the room with. And the lanais are really large and well set up for two people to comfortably lounge or eat. The lounge level is what made this trip extraordinary for us. Not only will the concierge on duty make dinner and excursion reservations for you, they will do just about anything you ask of them, from summoning housekeeping, engineering, or a manager to your room to fixing you any drink you want (as long as it isn't blended) to drink there or to take to the pool or just your room. They provided unparalleled service and treated you like you were one of their best friends in the world. I've never experienced service like this. They serve a lovely breakfast which they call continental but includes a specialty item everyday, such as eggs benedict, pork hash, french toast and blueberry crumble, to name a few. They also serve hard boiled eggs in addition to the wonderful pastries, breads, bagels, fresh fruits, cereals and hot coffee and tea. In the afternoon, from 2:00 'til 5:00 p.m., they serve "tea". This includes delicious sandwiches, scones, desserts and of course, the tea of your choice. Then there are hors d'oeurves serve from 5:00 until 7:00 p.m., with items served such as short ribs, shrimp, crab, various appetizers such as bruschetta, hummus dip and flat bread, unique salads and always fresh veggies with ranch dressing on the side. Then at night, delicious desserts plus a sorbet or ice cream and again, whatever cocktail you may fancy. We almost never needed to eat or drink any where else on or off the property, with the exception of dinner. And even there, we paid for no wine, dessert or coffee. It was wonderful! The lobby has beautiful views and relaxing entertainment at night. It is always fun to sit there and enjoy a free show with a pupu or a drink. The spa treatments were so relaxing and the therapists very good. The spa itself is a bit small and has no hot tub or splash pool but it has a steam room and fully stocked amenities for your pre and post massage needs. My husband and I had two 2 hour massages, one on the beach and one inside. We liked them both ver much. The restaurants here seem to be controversial. We could see why when we noticed that ordering the right dish can make all the difference. At Spago, where the service was quite slow, the opakapaka was dry but the lamb chops were moist and delicious. At Ferraro's, the spaghetti and pizza were so so but the lobster risotto was very good. At Duo, we recommend the filet mignon with the bernaise sauce. It was out of this world delicious. The lobster there was a bit chewy, though. So, a little inconsistency but all in all, we thought the food was very good. By the way, room service was also perfect. The pool is beautiful but was quite cold when we were there. We overheard a few other people mentioning it as well. And it really difficult to find chairs near the pool. Three things that might help to know here. The first is that half, if not most of the chairs by the pool become shaded by 11:00 a.m. because of all the palm trees surrounding it. The second piece of info is that you can almost always find an unshaded chair on the lawn between the pool and the beach. The third is that you can snag a cabana between 1:00 and 2:00 p.m. because that is when a lot of people begin to leave. Just ask an attendant to scout one out for you and set it up. Despite the crowdedness, the experience there is still pampering. The attendants come around with cold spritzes, icy towels and fresh fruit on a stick and ice water. The work out facilities are top notch. The game area is also fun, even for us adults. But for me, the best exercise was taking a stroll along that walkway by the beach before sunset, peeking at other hotels we've once visited, admiring the ocean and the islands in the background and then returning to what we think is the best hotel in Maui. Aloha.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!! Love the view from lobby!”
Reviews.Author: mcwedding
Reviews.Content: This is how a four seasons should be! Great in every way. Love the pool, love the view from the lobby. The breakfast buffet was delish. The service amazing. We were right on time for check in but they were running behind, which wasn't that big of a deal because it was only a 20 minute delay, so they sent us to the restaurant by the pool, for lunch on them! The game room was so fun, the gym was a really pretty outdoor facility with excellent service. The rooms are so comfortabe and plush! You will not regret staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort/Hotel on Maui with one big flaw”
Reviews.Author: Hellooooooo
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Maui every year for over 15 years until four years ago and decided to take a break. I have stayed in all types of hotels and vacation rentals over that time from private beach houses, condos and resorts on both sides of the island including the Hyatt (which I still like) Sheraton, Kei Lani, Grand Wailea (horrible and last choice) and the Four Seasons. While this was not our first time visiting the Four Seasons I would have to say that based on experience this really is the best choice available and while not cheap at close to $1,000 a night you really do get what you pay for here. We booked a partial ocean view room on the club level. What I liked about this room, it faces the outside of the Resort towards Makena. The prime ocean view rooms on the club level face towards the pool area and the Grand Wailea (disneyland) next door and you also see the rooms across the courtyard. I'm at the pool all day or on the beach and see that view, so it was nice to face towards the Molikini crater to get a different look so I would say a booking tip here is not to pay for the prime ocean view rooms. Another nice option about the Four Seasons is you can fax a shopping list and have your in room frig. stocked with the items you want. This is not as important if your on the club level as they have food service four times a day and an open bar at all times, no cost and if you need anything you can just take it to your room, for example bottled water, chips, sandwiches and so on. The club level food service had a continental breakfast in the morning that varies every day with a combination of the usual items and a few new ones like french toast, egg fritata, eggs florentine as a few examples, mid day or afternoon tea as they call it was a mix of sandwiches, quiche, cheese, deserts and other finger foods. The happy hour also had a mix of the same items everyday and a few new hot and cold appetizers. The fourth service was around 8:30pm to ? which was all deserts and really, really good. With food service like this every day you don't need to go down for breakfast in the morning at $35 a person. Other items included on the club level are your own private staff to arrange day trips, rest resv's free use of the internet and business center on that level, use of binoculars to view any whales going by and many other perks. I would say that as with all resorts at this level budget and bring some $$$ for tips, they go a long way. The beach staff, pool staff were great. The cabanas by the pool fill up fast. People were going to the pool a laying stuff out early, I mean early 6am. They have a policy that at 7am when the staff shows up you check in with them and regardless if there are items already out they will be removed and the cabanas and chairs given out, this is important as people would put stuff on chairs leave and come back hours later. I found it best to show up at 7am hand the attendant $40 get a cabana and be taken care of all day. Now if you think that sounds expensive I will tell you my friends were staying at Disneyland (Grand Wailea) next door and if you want to reserve a cabana there for the day it will cost you over $350 They really do bring you cold evian, frozen fruit and drinks. They will also stop by and detail your sunglasses for you. The beach has toys available for the children, cold water and both the beach and pool areas have free suntan lotion so don't bother buying and hauling lotion around with you, another tip. The gym and cardio equipment were top quality and in great condition. The spa is really relaxing and the treatments were some of the best I have had. We had dinner at all three restaurants and were never let down by the service or food. At Duo they have mixologist and drink menu that is worth paying some attention to. Spago is great place for a meal and drink and another tip is to book Feraros for dinner at around 30 min before sunset. The restaurant is outdoors and overlooks the beach. In my opinion the three best restaurants on Maui are all located at the Four Seasons, Spago, Duo and Feraros. We were traveling with children and the perks were cribs, toys, diaper bin, changing supplies, strollers and many other items available at no charge. Other items to cover not about the Four Seasons. What ever you do, stay away from the Grand Wailea next door, this place has gone to rock bottom. The restaurants there are as bad as they get, the spa is really dirty, I walked out of it. You can take a short walk to the shops at Wailea where you will find the Tommy Bahama bar and restaurant. It use to have a great view until they built condos in front of it about three years ago as I'm told. The bar is fun, the food is just okay, but for an easy casual meal it's good. There is also a Ruth Chris steak house, however I find this strange, who wants to eat a heavy meal in hot weather. Another cheap eats if you want to leave the resort is Maui Tacos down the road in Kiehi. We also tried Joe's for the first time. The ribs are good but not really much to the place, it's close and kid friendly. I remember reading some reviews regarding the long road to place and needing to get a ride in the golf cart, this is the most absurd thing I have read. If you can't walk from the parking lot to restaurant and back, you have more important things to worried about, like your physical condition and possibly the need to get personal trainer, my 3 year walked there and back with not problem. If you like good wine and would like to buy a bottle at reasonable prices across the street from Joe's is Wailea wine. It's only a three minute drive from the resort. We always stop there for a few bottles to have around if we want to go down to the beach at sunset on our own or with our friends. The kids camp was great for our older children, lots of activities and a climbing wall. They also have a large game room with a couple of pool tables, ping pong, and a gaming room with several gaming systems. This was nice as our kids and their friends went there after dinner and the adults were able to have a relaxing after dinner drink. The Four Seasons brand has always been reliable. Other than the issue of digging for a cabana or pool side chair every day this place is first class. Even the group and very small convention people that come here are a cut above most that you would find at other resorts and blend well with the paying guest.

Reviews.Title: “3rd trip to FS Maui and I continue to be impressed.”
Reviews.Author: winelover2
Reviews.Content: Well we just returned from our 3rd trip at Four Seasons Maui. This place is so so wonderful. Each time we leave we are already disussing our next possible trip. This time we were with our first child who is 7 months. The staff is so helpful with kids, they set up things in your room as requested such as bottle warmer, high chair, diaper genie, crib, extra refirg. ect. They also had toys in the tub and our daughters name in colorful sponges. We booked a Garden View with 5th night free program which is what we received. Housekeeeping was great and since we left at different times each day I would call usually when leaving the room. I was very impressed that they remembered our preferences such as extra coffee, splenda and red wine glasses each day. These small things are so nice. This trip was different with our daughter however we really enjoyed it and look forward to returning. We only scheduled dinner 4 of the 7 nights. Twice at Spago, once at Ferrero and at Capishe at Diamond Resort. I am so glad we did not schedule more dinner reservations with our baby. The one night we dined at Spago with her it was challenging. She did not want to sit still and we did a lot of walking around with her. I also did not feel like this was fair to others dining. So we decided that was the last "nice" dinner with her. Other nights we had appetizers at the open air lobby bar and listened to music, we also picked up food from Cheeseburger in Paradise and dined at Longhis; both located in The Shops at Wailea. We did use The Nanny Connection for 1 day and 2 nights. I was slightly unseasy about this however we had met many of the nannys on our previous trips plus ready great reviews about them. It was really nice for us to be able to get away as adults for 3 hours which is their minimum. Spago was excellent, I think this is funny since we did not even try it our first trip because of mixed reviews, we discovered it our 2nd trip and love it. Ferreros is my favorite at sunset however this trip we had it planned for our last evening; unfortunately they closed it due to bad weather. Thankfully the concienrge had made back up reservations at Spago for us. Our favorite this trip was Capishe. We were so impressed with the service, food and view. They even called the nest day to check up. I was a bit unseasy beacuse we have tried other places at nearby resorts in the past and been dissapointed. We will try Capishe again it was a great experience. We spent most of our days out by the pool in a cabana since we now have a baby. Most days we were able to overlook the ocean and still be close to the pool. They set up pack-n-plays for kids if you request. The pool staff is so friendly, most of them remembered our name each day which is nice. We had luch out there each day and it was quite good and reasonable. We had a couples massage one afternoon which was great. I am always impressed with the spa services. The resort was quite full towards the end of our stay and it was harder to get a cabana so we went out around 8am and had one set up and then alternated until we both came out with our daughter around 9am. I was a little annoyed with people who would get a cabana at 7am and then show up at 10. The staff will only hold a cabana for 30 minutes unless it is between 11-2 and then it is 2 hours however most people were able to keep their cabanas even when gone for extended period of times. I just think this is rude. If you point it out they will remove their items and open the cabana but I did not want to be "Cabana police" Yes the resort is expensive however if you are looking for great service and a relaxing beautiful vacation this is it!!!!!! We can not wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Fix the Room Descriptions”
Reviews.Author: K&SRanch
Reviews.Content: If youâ€™ve stayed at lot of high-end hotels worldwide (other Four Seasons, Ritz, Obreroi) this one gets a B+. If you are comparing to other vacation hotels in Hawaii on a strip it would have gotten an A (except for the disingenuous marketing of its rooms.) It has all the great things you expect from a Four Seasons â€“ most noticeably a gracious, caring staff (even during the Easter Break.) Unlike some of the other reviewers I was pleasantly surprised by the restaurants â€“ we ate in all of them. Spago, Duo, Ferraroâ€™s and I must say that Spagoâ€™s â€“ overpriced as it is â€“ was a wonderful experience. Every dish at Spagoâ€™s was terrific, service was attentive yet transparent and we ate our appetizers as the sun was setting. The other restaurants were also fine. BTW, if you get a chance leave the premises one evening and have dinner at Sansei in Kihei (a 15 minute drive) one of the most innovative Sushi restaurants on the islands. The rooms themselves were quite nice, but nothing extraordinary for this class of hotel. They were large, comfortable, with a nice bathroom and balcony, etc. One of the downsides is nothing they can change easily. The pool area is just too small to handle holiday crowds. The staff handles all poolside requests with panache, but you are packed cheek to jowl with your neighbors. Same with the sand beach below. This is a physically large hotel like the Four Seasons Hualalai on the Big Island. But on the Big Island that hotel had enough property to design the room layout so most of them face the ocean. Here in Maui, the property is much smaller, so the hotel is designed as a U-shape, with the majority of the rooms facing the courtyard with a small view of the ocean if you crane your neck. Hence the hotels biggest downside â€“ if youâ€™re in your room youâ€™re looking at the other rooms across the courtyard. The good news of course is that if youâ€™re in Hawaii your not hanging out in the room much. So that would have been fine if they tell you what youâ€™re getting. However, having never stayed at this hotel I called by phone and asked reservations for an ocean view room. They said they had one and would I like an ocean view prime room. What a surprise in checking in to find out that a $1000/night â€œocean view primeâ€� room is a room with a view of the courtyard with a small peek at the ocean if youâ€™re angled correctly or sitting on the balcony. (In fairness to the hotel the website describes the room view honestly, but the phone reservation people never mentioned it and I was nowhere near a web browser.) My suggestion to management is that this is a great hotel offering a great product - you donâ€™t need to market the hotel like the Marriott. There is nothing â€œOcean View Primeâ€� about these rooms. It tarnishes the brand and makes the Four Seasons seem like another over hyped Hawaii experience. So if you know what to expect room wise or donâ€™t care, this is a five-star hotel for a Maui resort experience.

Reviews.Title: “Will NEVER be outdone!”
Reviews.Author: SurfingDoc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Four Seasons in Wailea for 16 days for our honeymoon in an oceanfront room. I honestly don't know where to begin... As soon as we got there, someone ran over to our Jeep to open our doors. I will never forget when one of the young women who greeted us put her hand on my arm and said, "Relax...this is your vacation. We do all the work here." That simple comment summed up the entire vacation for us. We were treated like royalty EVERY day, and by every single person who was on staff at the Four Seasons. Everyone was kind, warm, and went out of their way at all times possible to make sure that we were happy, comfortable, and relaxed. We enjoyed Duo for breakfast, Ferraro's for lunch, and Spago, which was by far the standout, for dinner. We ate at each restaurant several times, but Spago was still the best. Marvelous views, delicious food, well worth every penny spent. Our room was stunning - when we arrived there was a plate of fresh fruit and fresh juices on our coffee table. The bathroom was spacious. The bed...God, the bed was heaven. The open-air layout of the hotel was one of the nicest things about our stay. You never felt like you were locked inside. You always had views of the ocean, you always felt the breeze. Just fantastic. We really enjoyed the live music they have nightly in the lobby lounge. People have complained that drinks and food were expensive - well...you're at the Four Seasons. I'm not sure what people expected. The drinks and food were pricey, but delicious. Every evening my husband and I got to the lobby lounge at about 5 PM to get a good seat and would watch the sunset - what an awesome, awesome experience. We only had one issue while at the hotel, but it was promtply recitified, and in an over-the-top way. Every afternoon at about 3:30 PM, but husband and I would take a nap (we were getting up at 6:30 every morning to get prime seats with a great view of the ocean!), and our room was always made up, the bed always fresh. Two days in a row, our room was not taken care of. We called housekeeping, and after that it was a crazy thing... That night, someone came to our door with a HUGE plate of fresh fruit, breads, and a fondue pot filled with chocolate "for our trouble", which really wasn't any trouble at all! Then the housekeeping manager met us out by the pool the next morning and informed us that we could have a poolside massage of our choice free. We did take him up on that, and then had another one a few days later! And on the subject of massages, we indulged in a couples Lomi Lomi massage at the hotel's spa in one of the oceanfront hales. Words cannot even describe... We were there for the better part of a month, and it really started to feel like home! My husband and I still talk about it every single day and can't wait to return. What more can I say? Stunning, superb, beautiful...and missed every day!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: doyoulikeluxury
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at FS Maui four glorious nights (3/2 - 3/6). We were upgraded to a garden view from a mountain side upon check in (the hotel was not booked to capacity). Everything was perfect. The service, the spaciousness and cleanliness of the room and facility, water and complementary sun block stations everywhere, tasty drinks served poolside...I could go on and on! The weather held steady at about 82 degrees and cooled off nicely at night. We took the beach path to the right of the hotel and made our way down through some rocky terrain to where the ocean pushed through protruding rocks and made little pools near our feet. Just off these rocks is said to be some of the best snorkeling. Unfortunately, we didn't snorkel much but from this spot we saw little colorful fish being trapped in the pools, big black crabs running around and a turtle even popped it's head out of the water in front of us! We watched a mother and her baby whale(s) from here at dusk one night too. The outrigger excursion is a must. The FS offers it as a complimentary service; all you have to do is sign up with (I recommend at least 24 hours before you want to go). We saw whales surfacing in the relatively close distance and saw some even jumping totally out of the water! Lots of tail action. The instructor told us that earlier that morning a pod of whales swam right under the canoe! We weren't as lucky, but just being out there is calming and serene. I had a message at the spa and it was one of the best I had ever received! She gave me some pure aloe vera (not the green stuff!) for my sunburn to put on after I showered. Ahh. FS, we've been back two days and I miss you already! We did the road to Hana, which, I would recommend for people who don't get motion sickness, really like to be in the car with the people they are traveling with and love the outdoors. It's a long trip (took us about 7 hours round trip...only stopping three times), but you should do it once. I would not suggest going too far past Hana. Guide books will tell you that there is some cool stuff this way, but it's really at your own risk. You can't see or hear cars coming around the corner toward you and it's a two lane road big enough for 1 1/2 cars! I'm glad we did it, but next time we'll do more exploring around the west side (top) of Maui. And, we will definitely be doing this from our "home base" at the FS. What a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular!!!”
Reviews.Author: PARSROK
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from our trip to Maui. For the first three days we stayed at the Four Seasons Maui. This portion of our trip was for our 5th wedding anniversary and could not have been better. From the moment we arrived we were treated like royalty! It is very strange to have someone you have never even met call you by name but that is what happend after we first met the valet at the front entrance. From then on it was Aloha Mr. or Mrs. Anderson. Very cool!! I have always been a proponent of booking the worst (not really just the least expensive) room at the best hotel, because really, when you are in Maui how much time do you spend in the room anyway? Also, all the standard rooms here (non-suites) have the same layout and size the only thing you pay extra for is the view. With that being said, we got the mountainside room for about half of what you would pay for an ocean view. Once again, when I wanted to see the ocean I just went outside. Our mountainside actually had a golf course view which was great. The rooms are huge and the bathrooms are the biggest I have ever seen at a hotel, with a seperate tub and shower. There were plenty of cabanas at the pool available, however, as stated in many other reviews if you want one of the prime ones on the cliff overlooking the beach you need to get there early (7am or before) to camp out and wait for the attendants to set it up for you. After that, they will usually watch your stuff for you while you eat breakfast or lunch. The rules say that you can not leave for more than twenty minutes without losing your place (except for lunch when you are granted two hours) but, I never saw anyone lose their spot if they were gone longer. Besides, as I said before there was plenty of space to go around. We had our anniversary dinner at Ferraros. WOW!!! In my opinion, the view from dinner at sunset is the best on the island. The food was great as well. I am a meat and potatoes guy and the filet with gorgonzola was perfect. My wife had pasta with clams and it had so many clams she could not finish them all. Since it was our anniversary, they brought us a free desert to top off the evening. Another great aspect of the hotel is they don't nickel-and-dime you. There is no "resort" charge per night like at many other resorts. Yes, it is expensive, but once you get your room rate that is it nothing more. And well worth it!! Any time you needed a ride somewhere weather it be shopping or dinner they have a driver take you. So if you just stay in the Wailea area you don't even need a rental car. All in all, the Four Seasons Resort at Wailea, Maui is the best there is on the island. I would suggest everyone stay there at least once even for only a couple of nights to see what true service is all about.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: DownDiver
Reviews.Content: Its just not worth the price. First, the positives: the rooms are large, all with sitting area, sofa and large, luxurious bathroom with deep tub, separate shower and w/c. Good towels, toiletries and linens rounded out the quality of the room. There are four places to eat in the hotel, not including room and poolside service. All the food was good, but Spago (as expected) was a stand-out. IMHO, our meal at Spago was the only thing in the hotel that was worth the price - and I'm not a big foodie, frou frou guy. The wine list is just OK, with relatively few decent vintage bottles to be had. The waiter explained that they are rebuilding their cellar??? huh? The pools are great, with one big for adults and a smaller one with a small slide for the kiddies. They're not like the Grand Wailea or Hyatt (virtual theme parks), but they work just fine. You should get your butt out on the beach anyway, which is fantastic! The hotel is located on one of the best swimming beaches in Maui and is prime location for whale watching and sea kayaking. This area generally has the driest weather in Maui, according to locals. The Kids for All Seasons room is great for kids 5-9, was clean and safe. At $16 per hour plus tip, the Four Seasons Nanny Service was another great bargain. We got a very nice, qualified, 30-year-old woman who took great care of our toddler while we snuck away for a couple dinner dates. The staff at this Four Seasons was generally very good and went out of their way many times to make us happy. The not-so-goods: first, the prices. I know its the Seasons and people here don't need to look at prices but, really, $27 for a glass of mediocre Santa Barbara zin at the lobby bar? That's just insulting. All the food and beverage prices, as a matter of fact, were just plain grotesque. $48 for a medium-sized platter of broiled snapper and root veggies at the main hotel restaurant is not reasonable on any island at any hotel. Sorry. And I don't care if you call the snapper Hupu Hupu or Ono Bono or whatever - I know snapper and I know it jumps in your boat if you hold up a picture of a worm. The spa is small and lousy with a steam room like a closet and no tubs, sauna or whirlpools. This is a not a spa resort, disregard the adverts. The gym is also small and lousy. Rent a sea kayak, go for a run, or do the beach free beach yoga instead. The "cheap rooms" they advertise - $500/nt with Mountain View - are really overlooking the car park and an industrial chiller that sounds like a diesel semi outside your hotel bedroom. Forget about sitting on your balcony or leaving your window open for fresh tropical breezes. All rooms that I saw, save the highest priced suites (in the $thousands/nt) had only partial ocean views or worse. The hotel is refurb'd, but they didn't make the views any better. Summary: Its a beautiful hotel on a fantastic beach with the best weather in Maui. That said, this recently refurb'd Four Seasons is not worth the price. Save some money and stay at the nearby Marriott or Grand Wailea or, better yet, rent a condo at the Wailea Beach Villas where you'll get your own kitchen, an ocean view, but share the same beach as the Seasons. Then walk over to Spago oone night for an amazing meal that's worth the price... maybe...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Service and Ambience”
Reviews.Author: jaypea
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons in Wailea for 4 nights after having stayed a week in Kaanapali at a conference. We have stayed at condos in the area for many years and decided to splurge by ending our holiday with a few nights of luxury at the Four Seasons Wailea. From the moment you arrive at the front entrance, you are greeted with excellent service that this hotel is known for. Fresh flower leis for the ladies and green braided leis for the gentlemen were presented. We were escorted to the front desk and offered a refreshing glass of orange blossom iced tea as a refreshment. Upon checkin, in recognition of our 25th wedding anniversary, we were upgraded from a mountainside room to a garden room. When making our reservation directly through the hotel's website, I mentioned that we were celebrating our anniversary and requested an upgrade, if available not really expecting it. Upon entering the room, which was beautifully decorated with a huge bathroom, there was a complimentary bottle of champagne on ice waiting for us and a card from the manager. Very classy! Our room was 408, which did overlook the lovely garden with the croquet lawn to the left and the front entrance to the right. However, our balcony also had an excellent view of the ocean through the palm trees. At the time of year we were there, the sun was setting in the middle of our ocean view. It was fabulous and totally unexpected. As a couple travelling alone, we liked this hotel for its small and exclusive atmosphere. There were still many familes with small children and there is a small kid friendly pool. Families with older children and teenagers might prefer staying at the Grand Wailea for the waterslide activies and larger pool. The service at poolside is impeccable. Comfortable lounge chairs are set up by pool attendants who are ready to bring water and take food or beverage orders. The food was expensive for 3 meals a day yet excellent quality and presentation. With a fridge in our room, which is filled with 2 complimentary bottles of water each day, I purchased some fruit, cereal and milk, so we had breakfast on our lanai each morning. Otherwise, the breakfast at Duo restaurant would cost you about $35 per person for the full buffet or you can order a la carte. A few cocktails and lunch by the pool cost about $100/day but we enjoyed this treat, as we relaxed in the sun. There are also cabanas and umbrellas available free of charge should you wish a shady spot. We had dinner at Spago on one night and at Ferraro's on our last night. The meals were excellent. Ferraro's has the best view of the sunset as it is located on the lower level with uninterrupted views of the beach and ocean. The day we checked out we put our bags in storage. There is a hospitality room where my husband showered and changed before our last dinner and sunset before heading to the airport. I had a spa appointment booked for 3 pm, so I brought along a change of clothes so I could shower and change after my treatment. I would highly recommend this to anyone if you have a late flight out. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel for its location, service and quality. It does have a high price tag attached for all the wonderful things you get for staying at a Four Seasons, but definitely worth it. When we go to Maui with our 3 kids, we usually rent a condo or add on a few days at the Grand Wailea. Since we were by ourselves, we found the Four Seasons Wailea was an ideal place to celebrate a special occasion at a beautiful resort at one of our favorite holiday desinations.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not nearly up to FS Standards”
Reviews.Author: andrew_branham
Reviews.Content: I am a very frequent FS guest and can honestly tell you that I was a bit disappointed in this property. The property itself is stunning....great views, nice rooms, and very wonderful grounds. I was upgraded to a suite and the room was outstanding. Having stayed at many FS resorts as well as many One and Only properties, I can say that this does not stand up to the O&O. The service was average, the food was not very good at all, and the pool was overcrowded and small. Everyone we talked to agreed that the food was very sub-par (no one we talked to loved their meals) I am writing this review as a non-bias opinion. I was really hoping that this property lived up to the FS hype, but it honestly did not . Spago and Due were very poor. Lunch at the pool was very good. Rooms were outstanding and service was ok. In summary, I would chose the O&O over this property any day. The OO La Palmilla (Cabo) and the Ocean Club are far superior. Overall, the location was great and this made the vacation still very good.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Wowie”
Reviews.Author: bacigalupiman
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about our 5 night experience. The setting, the food, the pool, and the beach, all perfect. The quality of every employee we touched was superior to most places we visit, and we've been to them all. Only one negative, the in room coffee machine required an advanced degree in machanics, my bet is they replace those soon.

Reviews.Title: “Four Season Maui...top of the line.......”
Reviews.Author: ccwilshire
Reviews.Content: I joined my brother and his wife and kids at the Four Seasons and I have to say, I can usually find some fault in a hotel. ( I am really picky) but the Four Seasons was flawless. The rooms are spacious and lovely. The bathrooms are enormous, as everyone says, and have piped in music, which is your selection. I have to say, by the time I arrived, my brother had switched rooms( he has a newborn and his first room was close to construction) they were upgraded to the Honeymoon suite, which we decided was bigger than our humble homes in Marin County, Ca . Literally, there was a living room, dining area, den and a Jacuzzi hot tub between the bedroom and bath, that could have easily fit 6 people. My niece thought it was a pool! Spago was great, the $75.00 Kobe steak is not to be missed! Pool service is wonderful, although the morning rush to get a cabana gets old..Breakfast is fantastic, great pastries. The beach is nice but is quite crowded in the Afternoon. I started every morning at 7:00 with beach yoga that always had whale sightings. The service over all was top notch. My newborn niece had a really high fever and the doctor was in my brothers room within an hour, only to later return that night when her temperature spiked again, this time accompanied by security, who was very reassuring that if we needed anything, including an ambulance, he could have one there in 4 minutes! Thankfully, the baby was fine the next day! All and all, our experience at Four Seasons was spectacular we all agreed that this will be a yearly vacation spot!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed being pampered”
Reviews.Author: Lyndar1422
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a stay at the Four Seasons and loved every minute of it. All of the hotel employees we encountered were friendly and professional, obviously they have received impeccable training. We had a 5:45 pm dinner reservation at Ferrares which was beautiful - from the sunset, to the food, to the wine, to the amazing server. If you are looking for a romantic get away and are looking for a little pampering the FS is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Four Stars”
Reviews.Author: Astranova
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons in Jan08 for a week. Upon arrival we were greeted and given lei's made from leaves which I thought was very tasteful - not the typical orchids you see everywhere (which I still love!). Checkin was smooth and effortless. Started out in a "Mountain side" room (not Mountain "View "room which we learned upon arrival). The view was so disappointing that we asked to change rooms to the next level - "Garden View" which the mgmt. graciously accommodated us at no charge. The view from the Garden View room was of the ocean and W. Maui mountains. Even though we were at the back of the "U" the view was stunning. Unless you don't care about your room, don't book the Mountain "Side" room. The interior of the room was elegantly furnished - large flat screen TV, desk, sofa, chair, dresser, large closet with safe, wet bar, fridge and Tassimo coffee maker (incl. coffee, tea, hot choc disks which were replenished daily). A welcome box of cookies and confections greeted us - very delicious. The bathroom was almost the size of the main living area, all marble, separate soaking tub, shower, double vanity and toilet closet. Robes and toiletries (l'Occitaine) were top notch. A choice of in room audio channels. Turndown service every night included an orchid on the pillow, printout of the next days events as well as slippers placed bedside and hawaiian music playing. The pool areas (2) are very nice with lots of private cabanas. In addition, there are very private cabanas/alcoves on the hill over the beach. Get there early to secure one. Two jacuzzi's on either end of the pool. Service at the pool is excellent and I found the food better here than in some of the restaurants (more on that later). Staff are friendly and attentive. they circulate with ice pops, fruit pieces and water for your enjoyment. We spent our time on the sun lawn near the ocean stairs. Great place to watch for whales while you tan. "Snorkles" is a full service water sports "concierge" who will plan your trips and adventures (located near the beach). They also sell snacks, sunscreen, sunglasses etc. Beach attendants provide free lounges, snorkling equipment and boogie boards for guests. Gym is small but very well equiped with top notch equipment. Cardio area is separate but nice because it's semi-outside under the veranda near the Spa. Take advantage of the croquet lawn and play a few games - we had a blast. Can't speak to the Spa but I hear it's the best on the island. Also can't speak about the tennis courts as I didn't play. Restaurants: "Duo" is the resort's newest addition. Very similar to a Ruth Chris or Mortons. Steak and seafood with anything else a la carte. Good but nothing to write home about. "Spago" is of course Wolfgang Puck's signature restaurant. Service was good, food was good but not exceptional which I was expecting. Wine list is very good. "Ferraro's" is Italaian and average. The draw here is the view which is poolside and the place to be at sunset or for lunch. Explore Nick's next door at the Fairmont. Concierges are excellent abeit a bit too "fake" nice most of the time. Very thorough and good communication/knowledge. Use them - great resource. All in all, a great experience. Resort is beautiful, emaculately kept and excellent service. Be sure and visit Ricky and Lucy, the in resident macaws that live near the fountain!

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Maui sets standard for 5 diamond hotel rating”
Reviews.Author: DeDeChooi
Reviews.Content: After reading so many positive reviews on the Four Seasons at Maui, I decided to book 6 nights there for my husband's suprise birthday for 2nd Feb. First impressions - absolutely stunning, they had everything down to a T. Lei and drinks welcome, led to front desk for check in where we had beautiful aromatherapy hand towels to freshen up with. I'd originally booked the Garden view room, but due to many correspondences with the hotel in preparation for my husband's suprise birthday, they gave ME the best suprise - they upgraded us to an Executive Suite (which worked out to be an extra $300USD per night if we had to pay for it)!! I also booked with their special promotion at the moment - book 5 nights and get the 6th night free - so i was stoked! We were led to our room by Eric our bellhop who gave us a grand tour of the hotel, and all the info you could want, plus showed us where everything was around the hotel and our room - really went above and beyond. Our suite was spacious and absolutely stunning (they just renovated a few months back), with its own dining, living room, bedroom, and ensuite which was bigger than the bedroom. See photos. We had welcome platters and a selection of mini pastries from management to wish my husband a happy birthday - very nice touch! You would have read all of the above so it may come as no suprise, but what my husband and I felt really put the Four Seasons ahead of the pack is their attentiveness to customer service. The staff is so well trained, and even though the hotel is owned by Micheal Dell, owner of Dell computers, (he personally stayed there and loved it so much he bought it a few years back), it is still run by Four Seasons with their signature excellent service. Little things like free poolside cabanas, complimentary orange blossom and mint juice stations set up around the hotel really adds that special touch. Everywhere we went, EVERYONE greeted us by our names, even down to our limo drivers and the guys at the pool and the beach (Darrett at Snorkels down at the beach deserves a special mention - he rocks with his great personality and service!) We just felt like the most special people whilst staying at the Four Seasons! Restaurants wise - we really liked Ferraros - please try their lobster risotto, it is their signature dish and it's the best we've had. Wasn't too keen on their Mai Tais, we preferred the Lava Flows for cocktails. Duo's was great, customer service there fantastic - but food probably could be better. My Fillet Mignon was great, but my husband's Porterhouse cut was way below standard - not sure if we're picky coming from great Australian beef, but his was rough, dry and tasteless. We didn't go bk to Duos, but Ferraro's, we dined there 3 times. Didn't try Spagos due to bad reviews i've read. Shops at Wailea def worth a visit - we had dinner at Longhi's and it really was very average - people told us we should have gone to Ruth's Chris' Steakhouse instead. One last thing - we experienced one bad experience whilst staying at the FS, and this was at the Spa there - my husband had a massage treatment done as part of his b'day present, and i went and waited for him to come out after my gym session. I was in the Spa front section for over 15 mins, and NO one single staff came out to ask if they could help me - and i was standing and browsing not more than 3 meters away from the front desk. I almost thought that the Spa was not owned by the FS, it was that bad. In particular, one staff, a local, spoke to us in a really condescending manner - so we were extremely suprised after all the superior service we've experienced. Despite the Spa experience - everything was superb at the FS, and I highly recommend the hotel to anyone who wishes to be spoilt - big time (but who also is not watching their wallet either!)

Reviews.Title: “Umm Paradise!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tb1711
Reviews.Content: There is not much to say. This place is simply paradise. I have stayed at dozens of four seasons resorts and hotels. This is either the #2 place to go after the Big Island property. -Rooms are unreal -Lobby is simply breathtaking -Service is as good as you will ever get at a four seasons -3 unreal and I mean unreal restaurants (and I am not usually a fan of hotel restaurants). -Pool is breathtaking -Beach is beautiful but not as private as you might expect from a four seasons. All the hotels are right next to each other and there is a lot of foot traffic. This is the only reason I rate the Big Island property higher bc they have a secluded beach. -Fitness center overlooks the ocean! Don't hesitate and just book this property if u are going to Maui. My wife and I have traveled all over and stay at 5star hotels everywhere. This is simply a top pick of ours

Reviews.Title: “Treat you like a star”
Reviews.Author: funfamilytime
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the 4S after being caught in a rainstorm in Hana (on the other side of the island). We had been on an amazing hike through a bamboo forest when the rain started and we were a little self concious of our bedraggled state! Wailea, in contrast to Hana (which we loved), was warm and sunny and the valets at the 4S were as welcoming and helpful to us as they were to the more polished family with designer luggage that were also arriving. The 4S staff should be commended for their incredible attention to detail, initiative and responsiveness. On our first night, we asked the valets the best way to get to the nearby mall. Their response was that they would be happy to give us a ride. Within a minute, they had a luxury SUV and driver (complimentary) pulled up to take us there. Whenever we went to the beach or pool, staff were quick to set us up in a cabana with towels and cold water (also complimentary). They regularly came by with lovely pieces of fruit for us to enjoy. My daughter had had an allergic reaction to macadamia nuts earlier in our stay and the front desk registered that information into their data base. Whenever we ate on site, the restaurant staff always took the initiative to find out which one of our daughters was allergic and advised us on nut-free selections. The restaurants (particularly Ferraros), albeit very expensive, had such excellent service, food and ambience that we felt more that we were treating ourselves instead of being taken advantage of. Our girls appreciated the 'teen' and 'keiki' menus. They also enjoyed the games room and the special treats left for them upon our arrival. I liked being able to take in a Yoga class. While the hotel is pristine and well-maintained, we were somewhat surprised to find a little gecko in our room. Luckily, we thought it was pretty cute and didn't bother to complain. From a systems perspective, the 4S is exemplary in that they employ very positive and responsive staff who treat each guest as though it is their distinct pleasure to help them. It's obvious that the 4S caters to a very high end clientele; however, their service is not discriminatory and they make you feel as valued as any other guest. We had an incredibly relaxing last few days of our holidays and were so glad that we had made the decision to try the 4S. It was a definite highlight of our holiday. On an aside, we also highly recommend the Kai Kanani snorkel charter to Molokini (that leaves from the Maui Prince Hotel, also in Wailea). Instead of leaving from 7 am at the Maalea Harbour, this charter leaves at a leisurely 9 am, and includes an additional snorkel at "Turtle Town" and seasonal whale watching. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a capital S”
Reviews.Author: ctribbs
Reviews.Content: We had the privilege to stay here from 1/24/08-1/26/08. We hopped over to Maui from the big island and were transported into a completely different experience. We checked in early and were promptly greeted w/leis and escorted to the check in desk. Rooms were not available yet - and we didn't expect them to be - but they took our cell phone numbers and called us at 1:15 to let us know our room was ready. My husband waited for about 10 minutes for the bellman to bring up our bags. We were able to use the facilities until our room was ready so we hung out at the pool. The pool is very nice and clean. The poolside cabanas are first come first serve - and free!!! The pool attendants were on the ball and set us up right away. They were good about clearing out chaises that were left for a long time and not returned to. The pool attendants come by very often w/fresh ice water and fruit. The temperature of the water was perfect as was the hot tub temp. The room was beautiful. We had a king room w/a sofa and a table and 2 chairs The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The bathroom was huge. There is a vanity, double sinks, a full soaking tub , separate shower, and separate toilet room. There were plenty of bath towels, facecloths, etc. The l'Occitane bath/hair products were of excellent quality. The bathroom was cleaned up and replenished every evening as well as every day. They have a hairdryer, q-tips and cotton squares as well. I really liked the light up makeup mirror. The resort is very pretty - Very upscale - marble floors and quiet elegance. There are plenty of areas to relax and enjoy the quiet. There are several stations of coffe/water/tea throughout the resort also. The valet attendants offer bottles of water every time you leave or return. I really appreciated that. They have a nice game room w/pool tables, foosball, pingpong, shuffleboard, 2 complimentary computers, tvs, and a 6 station x-box room. All complimentary. They offer several fitness classes - a couple of which have a $10 charge, but many of which are free. The workout room/weight room are more than adequate. They provide towels, water, gatorade, headphones, fresh fruit. Again, no charge for using the workout area. There is alos a business center next to the concierge w/free computer usage and copying which is helpful in printing out boarding passes. The concierge is very helpful as well. The restaurants are pricey. Dinner for 4 w/2 apps, 4 entrees, 4 salads,1 dessert, 5 drinks, tax & tip came to $500 at Ferraros. Breakfast buffet was $32/pp. Dinner at Duo and Spago will run you as much if not more than Ferraros. This is an awesome resort. The finest place I have ever stayed in and w/the best customer service I have ever received. You wont be disappointed if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wedding & Honeymoon at the 4S”
Reviews.Author: HockeyFan09
Reviews.Content: I was married July 2007 at the Four Seasons Maui. We stayed one week at the 4S (where we were married) and then finished our honeymoon visiting two other islands. The property and service was outstanding. We had a wonderful time at this property. I almost cried in our limo ride back to the airport. I really did not want to leave. The rooms are outstanding. We had an executive ocean view suite and I think it was the nicest room I've ever stayed in. It was huge. Killer views. Two flat screen tvs. Wonderful bathroom. The room provided us with more than enough space for all of our wedding related items and room to get ready the day of the wedding. Lots of space. We ate breakfast a number of times at the restaurant/buffet by the pool. The breakfast was expensive, but soooo good! We really enjoyed it. We had our wedding dinner in the private dining room at Spago's and it was awesome! My guests are still talking about it. The food was outstanding! We had a number of celebrity encounters. It is a bit of celebrity hang out, which is neat, but you get used to it pretty quick. We spent an afternoon at the 4S spa and it was great too. I highly recommend the ocean-side massages. Manicure/pedicures were very good too. All in all, a great spa! The valet guys were great. Very quick and helpful. I would simply phone down for my car and within 10 minutes my car would be waiting out front. My husband and I found it refreshing that they weren't waiting around expecting a tip. We always tipped, but sometimes I had to call them over for it. They didn't hang around with their hands out, that's for sure. We thought that was really classy. The service is the best I've ever experienced. They are all about the details. The day after the wedding, they we already calling me by my married name. I was so surprised. They really don't miss a thing! The wedding, by the way, was perfect. We had a perfect day and we are so happy we got married at the 4S Maui. I'll end this review, by saying that the 4S isn't cheap, but I believe that you get what you pay for. At the 4S you will pay alot, but get a lot in return. I highly recommend the 4S maui!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Families”
Reviews.Author: captainswife
