Reviews.Content: The Hotel is stunning: meticulous landscaping, attentive staff, great service.The drawbacks were the lack of an adult pool if you didn't care to hear children all day while trying to relax in the shade. this is definitely the place to go and show off your significant other and her latest elective surgery. I've never seen so many "enhanced" people in one place in my life! the entertainment in t he lobby lounge in the afternoon was wonderful if you don't mind strollers in the isle and kids running through. The restaurants were pricey but worth it. The housekeeping was slow so I asked for our room to be cleaned immediately when we left in the morning. The rooms are beautiful and the bathrooms are huge. The large mirrors are a plus. The business center are really nice and the breakfast buffet every morning was terrific. Yes, the prices are outrageous, but its the Four Seasons and it doesn't get that way by asking bargain prices. the spa is beautiful, but watch that pull down seat in the shower!. It made a bruise on my leg but they didn't feel the slightest desire to compensate me in any way for it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: bcmom_7
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a great trip to Hawaii. The second week of our trip brought us to the Four Seasons in Maui and I have to say that I am so glad we stayed there. First of all, it is not a place to stay if you want to visit on a budget, plain and simple...just go there and enjoy! The service we found was exceptional along with everything else about the hotel. We were greeted at the front entrance by a hostess who presented our famiy with leis and she escorted us to check-in. The bellman then escorted us to our suite and made sure we were happy with everything before leaving. The suite itself was beautiful, clean and welcoming. We had fruit, water and dessert left on the table near the bar. The kids each recieved a picture frame, disposable underwater camera and snacks. The Lanais overlooked the quiet courtyard and beyond that we had an awesome view of the ocean. I also liked the fact that the mini fridge wasn't filled, so that you could easily put your own items in there. Overall, we were very happy with the room. Housekeeping kept the room very clean, the bathrooms were always staightened and fresh towels brought in at turn down each evening, so we never ran out of towels (and with two girls that really easy to do). Also, the fruit was always being refreshed and restocked so that you didn't end up with brown bananas and dry grapes, although my girls love fruit so it was quickly eatten for snack. The pool area is nice, although we spent most of our time on the beach. At the beach, you can get complimentary lounges set up for you. The girls loved the beach and had a wonderful time. You can get an all day pass for $30/pp on the beach for boogie boards, use of the bouncy waterslide and some other things. Just a note that they won't rent out items if the water is too rough, which is a bummer because the boogie boarding is the best at that time. They will hold the lounge chair for you for up to 30mins or 2hrs between 11-1pm for lunch break. We didn't have problems with chairs, but we did come after the New Year. They do pass out water and fruit. There is also a food shack right before the beach if you want drinks or sandwiches. They have several restaurants at the resort and all are very good with the exception of Ferraro's. I personally didn't care for it. The setting is nice because you're sitting outside, but I felt that the food was ok and so was the service. I think our waitress was on a coffee high or something. She talked so fast and moved around like Speed Racer that I couldn't relax and enjoy my food. So, maybe with a different server I would have had a different impression of the restaurant, although the food was just ok. DUO is a steak and seafood restaurant. The service was excellent and the food was delicious. They have nice steaks that we all enjoyed with the exception of our 15 year old, who doesn't like meat. We all had a good laugh when the pasta alfredo she ordered off the kids menu came and it was served in a child's Sponge Bob bowl. The main course is served like most steak houses, with side dishes ordered separately and served family style. The kids enjoyed the cotton candy that was served with the bill so no dessert was needed. The last restaurant is Spago. I will say that the price that you pay is partly because you're eatting at Spago. Appetisers start at $20 and a main course meal $40-75. That said, I had read negative reviews from other tripadvisor contributors and a friend of mine who went in October had said it wasn't worth a visit, so we didn't go there during the week. We did, however, end up eatting there our last night, partly because we were too lazy to drive somewhere for dinner and partly because we had eatten at Ruth Chris the night before so we didn't want to do steak again. I have to say it was really good! The tomato soup my family had they really enjoyed and the Ahi Tuna Poke that I got as my first course was really delicious. Our main course meals were equally enjoyable and even our picky 15 yr old enjoyed her meal. We were glad that we ate there anyways and that we didn't miss out on a really delicious meal. Another great place to go while the kids are in the gameroom or hanging out in the room is the lounge area. They have musical entertainment everynight and its a great place to get a coffee or cocktail at the end of the day. For other food choices there's Ruth Chris, Tommy Bahama Cafe and Cheeseburger at the shops at Wailea. There's also a touristy giftshop in the same shopping area that serves up deli sandwiches and has some grocery items. Also, in nearby Kihei there are restaurants and a grocery store. Theres a great Mexican restaurant called Freds. Just one warning, if you like good sushi, don't go to Sansei (recommended to us by the concierge). The hotel also has a salon and a spa. The spa was really nice and the Hawaiian Health Wrap I had was wonderful, ask for Kristine, my husband had ?Janice? and he didn't enjoy it as much. The facilities are good and the women's bathroom was stocked with all the personal items that you may need after a treatment. The concierge service is excellent (with the exception of the sushi recommendation). We booked all our reservations through them and also our excursions. My husband and daughters went snorkeling at Molokini crater and my eldest and husband went horseback riding at Haleakala volcano. They helped out with all our questions and needs. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay there. It really was the little extras like the goodbye gifts they gave our girls, that really made us feel pampered. We also loved eatting lunch on our lanai and the atmosphere was laid back and felt like the tropical paradise that we were expecting.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: yreme
Reviews.Content: We were staying at the Fairmont next door when the storm hit knocking out power at both hotels. After watching how both hotels took care of the guests we decided to move to the Four Seasons. We had a ocean front suite at the Fairmont and a Ocean View Suite (not much of a view) at the Four Seasons for about $400/night more and it was worth the price difference. In fact we enjoyed ourselves so much we continued to extend our stay. Loves: Exceptional customer service from check in to pool service to dining service every staff member was very nice and looked out for our needs (traveling family with 3 yr old and 5 mo old). Duo is one of the best restaurants on the island we went back more times than I care to admit. The fitness room is very solid as well not as good as the Ritz was but very good overall. Likes: It is nice to have a free cabana available but the mad scramble is silly. I would rather pay for a cabana and not have to scramble to find one. The overall resort is very nice, but room orientation is not spectacular views are better at other resorts. Needs help: Spago is not owned by Four Seasons but is on main floor. We were greatly dissapointed by the quality of food there. Valet was the major misstep for us. No need for detail but get a copy of the sheet that shows the condition of your car everytime you return it to valet park, we did and it saved us. Overall we will go back (I will just really watch the valet guy).

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Maui, Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: fstraveler
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Four Seasons in Maui for four nights. I will say that despite the long flight (we flew from Washington, DC), Hawaii is one of the most relaxing places to visit. We have also been to the Big Island and both trips were wonderful. We didnâ€™t do as much sightseeing this time as we truly just wanted to relax and enjoy the amazing weather. Below is my feedback: ** Location ** The location of the Four Seasons is superb. The other parts of the island are windier and the beach is actually better in Wailea (my wife use to live in Hawaii so this is coming from her). There is also a high-end shopping center right next door that had a Gucci, Dolce Gabbana, Fendi, etc. Great place to go to get out of the sun and do a little shopping. The restaurants at the hotel were excellent so not much need to leave, but there are other hotels nearby (Fairmont, etc.) if you wanted to eat elsewhere. As youâ€™ll notice, most of the high-end restaurants in Hawaii are located in hotels. ** Pool ** The pool was great. Most areas get sun all day. The only minor complaint is that the pool doesnâ€™t overlook the ocean when you layout. There is a grassy area that overlooks the ocean so we spent our time split between those two areas. They have work-outs you can do in the early morning in the pool (water aerobics of sorts), which is a nice way to kick start the day. If you tip the people down at the pool first thing in the morning, they will save your spot throughout the day if you wanted to step away for a run, eat lunch, etc. ** Gym ** I thought the gym was awful. It was locked away in a little room with no windows. Very small. They had treadmills outside, which was nice but why not run outside in that case? They did have a great running path along the beach which every runner/walker should definitely use. That made the gym issue a non-issue. ** Spa ** We got massages outside which I actually would not recommend. It is right by the kiddie pool and the walkway by the beach, so between the kids hollering and the people walking along the path, it wasnâ€™t that relaxing. And it was quite hot. It would be better to use the spa services indoor, which are great. ** Rooms ** We booked a partial ocean-front room but we ended up with a full ocean front room. The rooms are fairly standard by the bathrooms were quite large. The balconies were also a great size to have drinks at night or breakfast in the mornings. It really is amazing to look at the ocean every night and morning. It was very peaceful and relaxing. ** Beach ** The beach was wonderful. The waves were small so not great for someone who would want to do serious surfing or boogie boarding. They have outrigger canoe trips in the morning that I would highly recommend. We were there during the whale season and were told, that if lucky, you can see the whales up close in the morning (we didnâ€™t but we did see them when we were going for a run one of the mornings). The beach is shared with a few other hotels so you can walk along the beach and do a little people watching while you swim in the ocean. The water temperature was perfect. ** Food/Restaurants ** We left the hotel only once to eat out as we had all our meals there. Because you are not going to Maui for nightlife or people watching, donâ€™t expect to do anything but be pampered and relax. Otherwise you will get bored ï�Š All in all, it was an amazing trip and a wonderful hotel. I really donâ€™t have anything negative to about our trip or the Maui Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly smart hotel management results in flawless stay.”
Reviews.Author: Johnny_No_Lies
Reviews.Content: Opening: To its credit, The Four Seasons franchise has managed to accomplish one thing that is poignant in my mind: hire well trained, friendly and professional staff who care about one thing; the customerâ€™s comfort. The exemplification of this achievement was reached at The Four Seasons Resort, Wailea, Maui. Hereâ€™s whyâ€¦. Location: Those who have been to Maui know that it is genuinely an island paradise. An island paradise with a kicker, the weather can be freakishly tempramental in some parts and astonishingly perfect in others. Wind, rain, overcast conditions curse some parts of the island, while remaining seemingly oblivious in others. Wailea is a small part South & Central of the Island that is protect by mountains and is inside a bay. Alas, the weather is beautiful and the garden surroundings are equally well manicured and exclusive. The Checkin: After renting a jeep at the airport through the hotel (which was flawless in execution) we drop into the grounds of the hotel after I got us lost in the mountains at 9.30 at night for a good two hours. I donâ€™t know what it is, but whenever I rent a car in a foreign country, I take on the persona of Clarke Griswald. Letâ€™s just say that if it wasnâ€™t for the stars in the clear sky and the fresh air, my Beverly Dâ€™Angelo would have been unimpressed, alas our first introduction to the serene Maui environment rescued me from my own geographic embarassment. When driving into the Four Seasons you canâ€™t help but be instantly struck by the careful attention to detail. The perfectly cleaned gleaming white walls of the exterior of the buildings, the meticulously manicured tropical gardens, the soft glowing lights positioned in and around the greenery and palm trees. All this creates a terrifically lush, warm, and magically exclusive setting. Bell staff were a mix of locals and mainlanders, all very friendly, who showed us pearly grins as they took the car and disappeared with the bags through the separate bell desk area. On approaching the lobby you get a feeling of relaxation and calm. Almost as if the sprawling white marble, fresh flower arrangements and eclectic furnishings which melt into the open air setting fail to intimidate, but rather subtley impress with elegance. Desk staff were very professional, drinks were soon in our hand and lays (while I think a little tacky, but hey, when in Hawaii go with the flow) were placed around our necks. Alas, at this point I wasnâ€™t even remotely tempted to hang myself with the lay â€“ surprisingly for anyone who has read some of my previous reviewsâ€¦! The Room: We stayed in an ocean front king room on one of the top floors. It was very well done. The rooms were modelled with a twist of caribean influence such as large plantation shutters, clean white lines throughout, large generous cane and solid timber furnishings. Again, somehow this hotel managed to create a sense of opulence without overdoing the grandure â€“ very smart. A critique though, and this is a double edged sword. Choice is generally a difficult balancing act; I personally like to choose from a bar fridgeâ€™s contents and â€˜rateâ€™ the hotel against whatâ€™s in there. The best Iâ€™ve seen so far HAS to be the Soho House in New York City, incredible variety and a wild imagination from the staff who put them together. In the case of the Four Seasons, they donâ€™t actually stock their bar fridges or cabinets. You have to pre-order what you would like. Iâ€™m not a big fan of this approach as first, it obligates me to a buy at a high price. Second, I like to pick and choose randomly. No big one, but the service was not for me in this case. Brand new, initialled bath robes were beautifully boxed and placed at the end of the large (and super comfortable bed with big fluffy duvet and ample pillows of various size and shape to ensure a good sleep). The balcony was at a slight angle from the beach, rather facing in towards the hotel. So it was more like a â€˜beach slighly askew front roomâ€™ than a true beach front. Lighting, centrally controlled thought out â€“ offered soft, medium and bright settings and either one appealed to whichever mood you were in. Yes, you can tell, I am being very picky here, as these guys had me scratching for negativity rather unsuccessfullyâ€¦.. Damnâ€¦ Bathroom: In a word, massive, and not at the expense of the room size either, both were huge. A very large bath tub (no spa jets) with an equally large shower (perfect for two if you get my driftâ€¦). The in-room music system was a very cool touch by the engineers. Basically you use two knobs, one for volume and one for your selection of music (classic rock, classical, jazz, contemporary, nativeâ€¦whatever) and it plays a surprisingly good mix of music in surround sound. Marble and wood finishings were heavy and well constructed, no expense was spared here, it was obvious. Water pressure fabulous, controls easy to work, an abundance of fresh/fluffy towels and a critique: I would never have used Lâ€™Occitane products in the hotels. Those who are familiar with the brand may like them. I find them pungent, over-creamy and lacking charm. A surprising choice by management as I wouldnâ€™t have been surprised to find a signature brand like Bulgari in there (my favourite bath products). The food: Here is where we enter the danger zone. The food at this place was, hand on my heart, was ridiculously good. Incredible freshness of ingredients, amazing variety, prices on the expensive side but worth it. Truly worth it. If you want to enjoy fresh fish, salads, favourites like crab cakes, pizza, sandwiches, wraps, fresh juices â€“ itâ€™s all there and it tastes divine. We didnâ€™t have a single bad meal, bar one, which Iâ€™ll get to. I personally cannot stand buffetâ€™s, breakfast buffet here though was never crowded and offered almost endless choice of fresh food. Pastries are baked fresh onsite and taste amazing, fruits are all freshly prepared, breakfast chefs make wonderful creations of omelettes, wafflings and pancakes. A few critiques though â€“ food at such a consistently high level spoils guests, why take the level down by using concentrated juices for table service and why use tea bags rather than fresh teas? Again, I am striving for negativity and failing to find it, yes, I am aware, I now look petty. Now, the bad meal. Wolgang Puck has a restaurant within the hotel and I have to say Iâ€™m not a big fan of his cooking. Particularly since he sold out with a chain of airport pizza restaurants, I mean, how can you maintain a solid credibility as a five star chef with such a monstrosity? If I were him, I would also disregard my aforementioned critique as I count my millions to be sure, however when you see the food quality at a key restaurant in the hotel as bad as it was, it does make you think that he has sold his standards down the river. We ordered (as we usually do) five or six different starters or mains to get a good sense of the menu. While the restaurant had a great bar (particularly for cocktails), excellent staff, an indulgent wine list, the food was simply over done in terms of subtlety of taste, texture and flavors. Way too many rich sauces and dressings for my liking. The italian restaurant â€˜Ferrarosâ€™ was incredibly good, as was the poolside restaurant. Overall, plenty to talk about here and a positive experience. Concierge: Almost to the point where they were excessively helpful. Thatâ€™s a good thing, sure. But I always left padding down my pockets to see if one of them hadnâ€™t mugged me while the other was charming meâ€¦! Alas, they were on the up & up and I was pleasantly surprised by their knowledge of not only the â€˜standardâ€™ spots for tourists to go, but fanstastic local restaurants (in other words they donâ€™t blindly guide you to their own and partnerâ€™s restaurants which I appreciated) and creative things to do. Example: we wanted to do an island hop. That was our statement: â€œWe want to do an island hop and hereâ€™s howâ€� (we were specific to say the least). Within around 20 minutes they had flights booked, rental cars arranged, an itinerary with directions prepared together with picnic baskets (complimentary) full of fresh turkey wraps, bottled water, diet coke and fresh fruit, all in a chilled bag â€“ very stylish, very classy service. Hat tip to them. P.s. All of the golfers out there will be very happy with their knowledge of local courses, pro shops, and instructors/professionals. Theyâ€™ll be able to get you the best tee off times and a shuttle to the courses which is complimentary â€“ in short, golferâ€™s paradise. Conclusion: For $850 per night for such an amazing room, with a jeep included in the rate, this place deserves to be number one on my list of places to go. I will be back as often as I can, this place has me completely sold and I would not contemplate staying anywhere else. Again, anyone who has read my previous reviews will be thinking I am on a prozac, zoloft, zanex cocktail and who knows I might be, but it would be thanks to this hotel. Great job. They also have fantastic poolside service, it is well thought out, efficient and makes relaxing in the sun easy. Another important point, while there are some families staying here, you donâ€™t get the sense that it is a total zoo full of rampaging litte ones and rebellious teenagers. The hotel was very smart in â€˜segregatingâ€™ many of the areas kids like to go and to eat. So we never got the feeling that our meal was ruined, our poolside stay was annoying or our ears were ringing from screaming babies. Now if you go across to the Grand Wailea, youâ€™ll see the difference between smart management (as is the case with the Four Seasons) and more wholesale management in this regard. Prognosis: Stay here. Youâ€™ll be relaxed, happy, refreshed and healthy at the end of it. These guys could easily charge double and youâ€™d still get value for money. Where instead: The Grand Wailea next door, but itâ€™s a distant second.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaLA
Reviews.Content: It was amazing - beautiful rooms, the beach was the best (sand, water, everything). Service was amazing. The Good: - Rooms (clean, big, new) - Service - concierge desk is very helpful. You call ahead of time and your car would be waiting for you outside when you get downstairs - Beach - wow. Microscopic soft sand, nice water, reef to snorkle - Free rentals for snorkles, boogie boards, unbrellas. Free water brought to you by the beach and pool. - Amazing foot massages by the pool, nice spa - Duo restourant is great - very tasty - we went back 3 times. Pricey though. - If you let them know you have a special occasion, champaigne and treats would be left in your room. - Notify the hotel you are bringing a kid, and you will get a toy, cookies and the child's name spelled out with spongy letters in the bathtub. Also, kids get tiny bathrobes too - so great. -Bathroom needs it's own review - HUGE! All marble, comfy bathtub, separate shower, amazing shampoo, soap. Even radio! I want one like this at home! Minor issues: - Spagos restourant - don't waste your money, go to Duo's. - I called in advance letting the hotel staff know that we are arriving at 12 PM so if possible to have a room ready for us then, not at the usual 3 PM check in time. They made us wait until 3 PM even though on the phone they said 12 would be fine. I had a 5 year old with me who needed to nap after early wake up and flight, so that was not good. I am sure they had rooms open, so I don't undrestand why not give us that perk. - Requests for upgrades are mostly declined, don't believe what you read on getting those easy. Not only us but others were declined several times. - This hotel is pretty expensive. - Pool cabanas are free but always taken - get them early or you will be sitting under the hot sun. - We had to get out of the water several times due to shark warnings. - Last day there the waives were huge - they covered my standing up 6ft husband with my 5 year old sitting on his shoulders - that's pretty high for a waive. - Maui itself is a bit boring if you like nightlife/shopping/great food - not much to do there. Not too many nice restourants either, so leaving the hotels ground was not too fun. Overall though - best vacation stay we ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Luxury Vaca”
Reviews.Author: amidu
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Four Seasons Maui for 5 nights in an Ocean View Premium. At over $500 a night, you expect a reasonably good view of the ocean. Not here. Our balcony mostly overlooked the other rooms with a slice of the ocean. The resort is in a horseshoe shape, so most of the rooms have views of the other balconies. The only way to get a 180 degree, uninterrupted view is to shell out more than $2K a night. Sounds appropriate considering most of their top customers are the Hollywood types escaping here for weekend trips. The room itself wasnâ€™t impressive. The dÃ©cor was a tad staid with the usual tropical tapestry and cane furniture. The bed was not the most comfy, the space was tight, and the balcony seemed more Mumbai than Maui. The bathroom was spacious (big enough to be its own room) and nicely done in marble and gold fixtures, but expected. I wish they had incorporated more Hawaiian elements â€“ little details go a long way to show that thought was put into bringing the essence of the surroundings into the room. The Post Ranch Inn and Inn of the Anasazi both are fine examples. Whatâ€™s hot: The breakfast buffet at Duo was the best food and the best deal amongst all the restaurants. The ocean front cabanas, with the fantastic bar menu and poolside services, were the best part of the hotel and where you should spend most of your time. The views are pristine-- manicured lawns, white beach, blue water, and mountains in the distant. The snorkeling is superior right at the beach. In fact, it was better than Mokolini crater. The equipment is free, a nice little perk. You can rent Kayaks inexpensively which is a great little adventure without having to drive somewhere. Overall the property is stunning very well maintained. The lobby bar overlooking the ocean and pool has a great view, is the best place to relax at anytime (much better than spending time in your crummy balcony). Whatâ€™s not: Mostly the food was OK, including Spago. The pool and grounds are manicured and beautiful, but very much resemble Beverly Hills or many of the high-end properties along the California coast. There isnt too much Hawaii here. In fact, Hana Hotel, is the only place in Maui that captures the essense of the island. Our room wasnâ€™t cleaned until 4:00pm and when Vur threw a fit, we only got a box of six truffles. Lots of brand flaunting and bling, the pool area is a â€œsceneâ€�, so if youâ€™re the low-key, private, vacationer, youâ€™re better off going to a secluded spot by the beach or staying somewhere else. In short, this is a great resort to come with family or if you're used to the luxe amenities and services, or if you want to see and be seen.

Reviews.Title: “A True Five Star”
Reviews.Author: CynthiaThompson
Reviews.Content: The rooms and grounds are beautiful and meticulously maintained. The rooms were just renovated. There is a major problem during the Christmas- New Year high season finding a cabana or a lounge chair at the pool. People come down at 3:00am to place items on the loungers to save their spot. The rule is if a cabana or lounger is not used for 30 minutes it will be reassigned. Get the pool staff to assist you and they will assign you a seat that was saved. If you go to lunch notify the staff and they will save your cabana or lounger for two hours. Room service is fabulous and the sunsets are magnificent. The entire staff ensures your stay is perfect. A true five star.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Phillychic
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons certainly has the pampering down to a science. We arrived on December 9th for the first leg of our honeymoon for 6 nights. There was champaign waiting for us in our room. We had an ocean view prime room (room 689-had a great view of the courtyard, pool, and ocean and was one of the rooms closer to the ocean because some are set far back). The bathroom was amzing-very spacious with music and great bath products. The bed was very comfortable and the large flat screen tv was heaven. The balacony was nice. My only complaint would be that the decor could have been more Hawaiian but it was still lovely. They have a fridge which is open for you to fill and there are shops a mile down the road that has a great general store to fill up on waters and sodas and even wine and such. There was a great beach tote in the closet for you to use during youur stay. We actually decided to keep ours ($60 charge) as a memento. Room service was great and efficient. Maid service was a little slow on the first two days but I called and asked them to come earlier and they did for the rest of the trip. Laundry service was efficient but very expensive. The pool was nice but we wish it was bigger or maybe that they had more. The best part of the hotel is the lounge areas overlooking the ocean. It is absolutely amazing-you do need to get up somewhat early but we were jetlagged and were down before 7:30am every morning and had great spots to choose from. These spots are so private too! The best part is the service during the day. People come around with evian spritz, eucalyptus scented cold towels, fruits, and waters. There is a great ocean side jogging path that makes you want to work out every day. The beach was small due to a storm that washed most of it away so we did not lay out on the beach at all. The food at the hotel was great too. Duo was delicious but Spago was the best dinner we had in Hawaii hands down. We were reluctant to go because nothing on the menu was jumping at at us but everything was delicious and well worth the price. We did not eat at Ferraro' becuase they had alot of their meals on the room service menum(lobster Risotto was great!). Sansei was a great dinner about 10 minutes or less from the hotel-it was the best dessert we had and excellent sushi! I have heard that the Waterfront is great too and also Mama's Fish House. We did the 3 hour snorkling cruise from the Maui Prince Hotel and that was great- really fun crew although the snorkling was just ok. Swimming with Sea Turtles made it worth it though! The Road to Hana is a must- we did not think we were going to do it but we are glad we did- it is beautiful and you get great pictures. (The valet was great- when we said we were going to Hana they provided us with driving directions, towels and water bottles.) We only did about 16 miles of it because we did not want to drive at night- this is a very very windy road and you need to drive carefully through it. Hope this helps. IF we go back to Hawaii we would most likely try out the Big Island Four Seasons becuase we heard it is the best but this would be our second choice. We loved Maui. We went to the Hyatt in Kauai after this and I will write a review for that too. It was nice but the service was not as nice as the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Heaven... except for one thing”
Reviews.Author: Mike55129
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutely gorgeous. Staff members couldn't be more courteous and friendly. The rooms are very nice and we loved the setting. The only drawback is that Four Seasons Wailea encourages people to bring their children, and we had more than one romantic dinner disrupted by the screams and food-throwing of toddlers. Other than that, we wouldn't hesitate to come back. You pay a lot here, but you get what you pay for. This is a sensational hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One word......WOW !”
Reviews.Author: TheBullBoston
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the 4S Maui for one night prior to heading over to Lanai (see review). In hindsight, I wish that I had stayed here instead of there. Location: Wailea is the "expensive" area of Maui. Absolutely incredible stretch of property in the dryest, sunny part of Maui. Gets very little rain and the beach is prime. It's a 35 minute drive from the airport. Check In/Staff: I was only there for one night but it was top notch. Pool: Can't get any better than the pool/beach scene here. It was relatively quiet/empty the day I was there but I hear that it can get crowded on the beach as guests from other hotels in the area come over to that stretch because its so nice. Keep in mind, the Grand Wailea borders the 4Seasons so you can hear the kids screaming over at the pool at the GW and such but it's still the place to be in Maui. The beachwalk area that connects all the hotels on that stretch of Maui if beautiful. Summary: If you can afford it, this is the address to stay at when in Maui/Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation!”
Reviews.Author: LetsPack!
Reviews.Content: What can I say? We visited the Four Seasons as a first "flight" vacation with our 11 month old baby. The Four Seasons (4S) was unbelievable to us. They treated our infant son with such care and concern. He received a baby lei, toys at the front desk upon check in, cookies, milk and a book during our stay in the room, and toys by the pool. They baby proofed the entire room and bathroom and tub. They provided a diaper genie in our room's bathroom and in the public bathroom by the pool. The crib had a basket of diapers and swim diapers in it. There were also swim diapers by the pool. The pool attendants also provided free sunblock SPF 8, 15 and 30. The bathroom had all the necessary baby toiletries as well as the sponges that spelled his name. The poolside attendant provided a pack and play (play pen) every day in our cabana. Everything was included and complimentary. The restaurant by the adult pool "Ferraros" gave him building blocks to play with while we had lunch. I actually vacationed and read two books with a busy crawling baby! I could have never done all of that at another hotel. Yes they charge a lot, but boy do they take care of you - it is well worth it. The pool side salads are delicious and are served from Ferraros. The only disappointment we had (which leads me to give the hotel a 4 1/2 rating if I could) was the breakfast buffet at Duos. It is absolutely horrible compared to for example the Hyatt at Kanapali or any 4 star hotel which was very very disaapointing. We actually even went to Duos for Sunday Brunch - no different than a Holiday Inn! The food was left out in very small quantities. The cheese looked old, hardly an artisan bread assortment, fruit was sub standard, and not many choices at all. Not worth $35 for sure. I was shocked. We were invited to the Manager's cocktail mid week and attended. They served free wine, mai tais and delicious appetizers. We spoke to the property managers who were more than cordial and wanted feedback whatever it may be. many guests were present. It lasted half an hour. They want to please their guests which is refreshing. We walked over to the Grand Wailea property - quite trashy and the people all had tattoos. It looked like Disneyland with people just sprawled all over the place. Glad we did not stay there! The common walkway goes in both directions so it is a good work out in the mornings or evenings. There were beautiful private cabanas in between the beach and the pool at the hotel that had private steps and were enclosed between bushes. They are very romantic if you want o grab a bite from a neighborhood market and have a picnic at sunset! There was a Safeway very close to the hotel (7 min drive) so we were able to get sandwiches from the deli, baby food, water, etc.......... This is the perfect hotel for a romantic getaway or a family vacation. The babies have their own pool so they do not disturb those honeymooners. However do not expect the waterslides for those with older children. This hotel is all about class and service.

Reviews.Title: “Three tips that may help”
Reviews.Author: constantlearner
Reviews.Content: When making reservations I suggest asking for a room that does not have an adjoining door to another room. It's like that person is in your own room. You can hear everything; tv, snoring, belching, etc. The hotel did manage to move us the last night we were there so at least I had one night of decent sleep out of 4 nights. Another recommendation, when making reservations for any of their restaurants ask for a quiet table. For some reason the hotel seems like Disneyland Hawaii. Families, babies and kids outnumbered the couples. It was hard to have a nice quiet romantic dinner with babies crying at the table next to you and kids playing with toys at another one. My stay ended 12/15 so it wasn't like Christmas time. I do have a glowing recommendation for the complimentary outrigger experience. Sign up for it. You are only in the water 30 minutes and you can see turtles and experience rowing an outrigger. Tip the instructors, they were great.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel but not wort $1k/night”
Reviews.Author: Neil-from-Dallas
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 day stay - ocean view conceige floor during the slowest period, before the holiday rush. Many things about the hotel were great but overall when you are paying $1000/night I expect more. The food was excellent, we ate at Duo and at the Italian rest., and had great treats in the conceirge lounge (worth the extra to stay on this level). Pool and beach were great, plenty of chairs but we were told that it can be a problem getting lounges during the busy season. The staff was friendly, nice and helpful. Rooms were well decorated and in great shape. Ok now for the bad: We always stay at the top resorts and usually book through amex platinum paying the full rate we expect an upgrade when available but at least the room should be the best room available. The Ritz was under construction (it is on the Platinum fine hotels list) so we decided to try the 4 seasons. we paid for an ocean view room and the first room that we were shown had a sliver of an ocean view and was over the noisy road into the hotel. The only other room that we were told was available and that we settled for (825) was at the end of the courtyard and had an angled view of the ocean. The concerige level of the hotel was empty and they would do no better. An ocean view at an ocean resort is why I pay $1000/night - i don't expect to have to sit in the corner of the balcony and crane my neck to see the water! Another issue was with the housekeeping staff. They dont do the best cleaning job and they forgot to deliver the paper to the room and also forgot to bring the extra pillows that we requested. It was tough to decide if we would ever return or if we would recomend this property. The food is great, staff is great and the grounds are lovely However, I would not return unless I knew that i had a full ocean front room. I was told that these are only 2 bedroom suites that are $3300/night. So next time we go back to Maui we will probably go to the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Honeymoon to Remember”
Reviews.Author: lesm1
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. I don't have a negative thing to say about it. We arrived and were upgraded from a partial ocean view, to an ocean view room. Our room was a bit of a walk from the elevators, but it was nice to get a little exercise. They had a bottle of complementary champagne in the room, to celebrate our honeymoon. The room was wonderful. Everything is new. The TV is great, with DVD player too. The bedding and bed are so comfortable. I wanted to buy the sheets, but was afraid to even ask about the cost. The bathroom was amazing. And the bathroom goodies are to dies for. L'Occitane hair and body products in a great verbena scent. We tried Ferraro's and Spago restaurants, and both were great experiences. They also have a little beach side snack shop which was great for bagels and fruit in the morning. Try the rootbeer floats poolside. They make their own vanilla gelato, which made for amazing floats. Facilities were excellent all around. You can book and hour of free tennis per day, and they even provide racquets. The fitness center was nicely put together. The cardio machines were outside, which made for a really pleasant workout. The pool and 2 hottubs were perfect size. The beach was sandy, beautiful, and had great snorkeling. We saw turtles out there everyday. They really have the little touches down pat. Always calling you by name... Mr. and Mrs. So and So. Service is the best. They will cater to your needs and requests 24 hours a day, and quickly. I would recommend this hotel to everyone for a great overall experience. And those cool eucalyptus towels that they offer all over the place were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible, Incredible and Incredible”
Reviews.Author: Daytripp-r
Reviews.Content: Brilliant, Awesome and Perfect. These are some of the words that come to mind when I think about the Four Seasons Maui in Wailea. We were there for only two nights, but they were two incredible nights. We arrived in the evening after a very long cross continent journey for a two week Hawaiian vacation and immediately I decided that we made the perfect choice of hotel to start our adventure. The Valet had the bell man take our golf clubs and store them and deliver our bags to the room with in minutes of our arrival. The Front Desk staff gave us a scented towel that was wonderfully refreshing and check in was efficient and friendly. She let us know when the restaurants were as well as the pool and the beach. She explained the amenities and spa/fitness activities that were available and how to access them. Overall it was a very informative and painless experience. The room was one of the most comfortable I have been in. The Bathroom was huge and had a great shower with lots of pressure to get all the sand and sun screen off at the end of a day of play at the beach. The bed was the best I have ever had in a hotel. And the room was quiet. We had a balcony that looked out over a beautiful courtyard and had a partial ocean view with a great sunset. The Beach is groomed and clean. The Beach Boys look after you by setting up a lounge chair and umbrella if you want. They also come around every so often and offer ice water and fruit slices to help you enjoy the beach even more. I am not much of a Beach dweller, but this was very enjoyable. The Restaurants are great. We had the best meal of the trip at Spago. The Waitress steered me away from one item and suggested a different dish... which turned out to be exquisite. Mac Nut crusted Mong Chong stuffed with Crab and Lobster. It was prepared perfectly and looked brilliant. The taste was amazing, great service and a nice decore made for a perfect evening. Breakfast each morning was a nice buffet on the patio overlooking the pool. Big selections of nice fresh fruits, breads and pastries, eggs any way you like, meats and sausage, and fresh juices of alll sorts. The hotel itself is lovely and spacious, well laid out and inviting. The staff will always finish by asking if there is anything else they can do to make your experience more enjoyable... and they are very helpful. Everything about this four Seasons is first class. It exceeded my expectations in every way.

Reviews.Title: “An above average large hotel”
Reviews.Author: CustomerBoston
Reviews.Content: Overall, I would call the Four Seasons Maui an above average hotel, for a Four Seasons. The positives: Overall majestic layout of the building, consistent service of the staff that works at restaurants (especially DUO for breakfast), friendly pool staff, generally friendly activities staff, helpful valet. Mixed reviews: Housekeeping has a huge building to service, but there were a couple issues. On one day, they did not take the trash out of the room. On another day, they did not replenish the soap. Again, I realize that housekeeping works very hard to maintain this hotel; if they could remember these little things, it would make the experience that much better for the guest. Also, some members of concierge are very helpful, though others are less so. This hotel definitely has the look and feel of a BIG hotel. If that is not an issue, then this is probably one of the best on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Maui”
Reviews.Author: TCTLTT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a 13 day honeymoon in Hawaii - 4 nights in Four Seasons Maui, 5 nights in Four Season Hanelei (Big Island), and 3 nights at Secret Beach Hideaway in Kauai. The Four Seasons Maui exemplifies the service that defines the Four Seasons brand. Between the valet, bellhop, waiters, and pool service, the staff at the hotel was some of the best I've ever encountered in any top hotel I've visited around the world. We reserved an Ocean View Prime Room. If you come to this hotel, just get the most basic view. We paid up for an Ocean View Prime room and we had such a limited view that we basically had to crane our necks to see the ocean. It's simply not worth it. Given the limited amount of time you spend in the room, facing the parking lot for $200 less would have been worth it. The room itself though, is fantastic. The bedroom is very comfortable and tons of little details that someone that appreciates luxury hotels would notice - alarm clock that plays your ipod, dvd player that can play your digital camera pictures, huge flat screen tv, massive bathroom (bigger than some NYC apartments), L'Occitane products, excellent coffee/tea maker (like a Nespresso but forgot the name), comfortable robes, etc. When we drank wine in the room and called for wine glasses, they asked us if we were drinking red or white wine so they could supply proper glasses. How thoughtful! The gym is really big, although not as impressive as the Four Seasons Hanalei. The cardio is outdoors so you have a much more interesting view than watching yourself in a mirror. Of course, every cardio machine has it's own tv. There are a few daily yoga and pilates classes (no charge, I believe) and lots of activities including dance lessons and canoe rides. I didn't partake in this, but the list of daily activities did make me realize that I actually didn't ever have to leave the hotel if I didn't want to. The pool is impressive in pictures, but chaotic in reality. There were kids everywhere (although many spend time in kids camp and the game room as well). By breakfast time, the pool chairs were all taken. And note that with all the beautiful palm trees, half the chairs are shaded in the morning, so chair location becomes even more competitive. I found this frustrating, but not unlike any other experience I've had at a big hotel. I personally don't like feeling jammed up like sardines around a pool, but found the beach to be incredibly windy after the late morning, making for an uncomfortable experience laying out. However, the pool staff worked hard to get us chairs in an area we were happy with and repeatedly came by to refill our water glasses and see if we needed anything. Again, Four Seasons service at the top of its game. The restaurants were very good for hotel restaurants, but not comparable to simply good NYC restaurants. I found the food incredibly overpriced and was surprised that all the restaurants used the same bread supplier (this reminds me of all-inclusive hotels that share the same kitchen for 3 different restaurants). The wine lists were vast but incredibly overpriced ($256 for a bottle of Heitz Cellars Cabernet..retails around $45). I heard really good things about Spago. Maybe we went to late (7:30 or 8pm), but we were not impressed. It took about 30 minutes to take our order, another 30 minutes for the appetizer, and probably 30-45 minutes after the appetizer to get the entree. My mahi-mahi may have been good right out of the oven, but tasted a bit dry when it came to me. My husband felt the same about his $60 lamb. The Thanksgiving day buffet at Duo was actually excellent and well worth the fixed price. We spent a good 2-3 hours doing small courses of everything they had to offer and enjoyed a delicious bottle of wine recommended by the sommelier. The concierge was incredibly helpful in recommending restaurants and activities. All in, we had a really nice stay at the Four Seasons Maui. If you like large hotels with lots of activities and excellent service, this hotel is for you. If you're looking to go on your honeymoon and want some R&R, I would recommend Kauai and Big Island (or Lanai, but I've never been there) instead of Maui. If you want to go to Maui, I think the Four Seasons is the best hotel on Wailea (I peeked through all the hotels).

Reviews.Title: “ChaChing!”
Reviews.Author: nasusb
Reviews.Content: Thats right. Get ready to spend some serious money here. But you get what you pay for. Period. Everything was fabulous from the location of the resort, to the room, to the food, to the spa and to the service. And if it wasn't fabulous you just had to say the word and it would be. I think this place is best enjoyed if you're not worried about the cost and if you can spend a week to soak it all in. There's miles of beautiful sandy beach to walk right in front of the resort and if you are feeling antsy to leave the reosrt (gasp!) you can spend a day or two in Hana to go hiking and rough it up a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: IlliniRon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night to see if it was worth the price, and I must say, this property is the best we have found on Maui thus far. The hotel property and room were top notch, five stars. The staff was extremely responsive to any needs, and very helpful. On-site restaurants were flawless. We enjoyed the beach, which is very accessible for guests, with organized activities such as kayaking, yoga, etc. The kids pool area is very well designed, and perfect for the younger kids to play. The game room was also unique to us, with a full complement of video games to keep kids entertained. About the only complaints would be having the room available for check-in, and having the bill correct without requiring the guest to find errors (although this was quickly corrected). We would definitely stay here again, since it sets the standard for Maui properties.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is very overrated”
Reviews.Author: tlynette
Reviews.Content: I should preface by saying you probably wonâ€™t appreciate portions of this review if a) you have small children that you plan to take on your Hawaiian vacation or b) you typically enjoy staying at large, densely populated hotels. My husband and I just spent 2 nights at the Four Seasons at Wailea as part of a 12 day excursion to the Hawaiian Islands. Our trip was fantastic but this Four Seasons was a huge let down. We usually try to find small boutique hotels--as it is our preference to experience serenity and seclusion when weâ€™re on holiday--but when we couldnâ€™t find one in Maui we opted to stay at the Four Seasons, figuring, â€œItâ€™s a 5 star hotel â€“ sure itâ€™s big but it can only be so bad.â€� Our mistake. I wonâ€™t detail every disappointment but will say that the beach was very crowded and there were lots of kids frolicking around the hotel, which is cute for the parents but kind of annoying if you just want to unwind in calm surroundings. The service was not great. We ordered room service once that never arrived. We rented a car that was dirty when we picked it up. Our concierge also gave us the wrong sheet of directions for traveling to Halekala. Another thing: Beware that â€œocean view rooms,â€� which run close to $800/night are more like â€œpartial ocean view rooms,â€� and youâ€™re pretty far from the ocean. I realize that Hawaii is expensive but this hotel was absolutely not worth the cost in my opinion. Iâ€™ve given a 2 star rating because I must credit the bellmen for being very personable and helpful, and the room was clean, and the bed was comfortable. But thatâ€™s about it. These are things you should expect of a 5 star hotel but there was truly nothing magnificent about these accommodations. If youâ€™re looking for a quiet, peaceful place to vacation I strongly recommend Lanaiâ€™s Lodge at the Four Seasons â€“ much, much nicer place to spend your holiday.

Reviews.Title: “What's not to like”
Reviews.Author: boots07
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this resort for a few days on our way back from Japan. FSM is a beautiful resort with all the details of a luxury hotel. The service was excellent, the spa was amazing and the food was delicious. The beach is nice and I swam with a sea turtle for a good five minutes right in front of the resort. I particularly liked the outdoor excersise room and the chilled scented towels after your workout is a great touch. What more can you ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: DDT-HK
Reviews.Content: Overall I was unimpressed, I did not think it is worth the hype and certainly not the money. Sure, in general the hotel grounds and amenities are nice, but they are not exceptional and would be outdone by many top-end island resorts in Asia and the Pacific. The service was efficient but again, nothing special. Most unacceptable is how they choose to describe their rooms, as each room class carries a significant cost increment. I had booked a "Full Ocean View" room (the 2nd most expensive normal sized rooms) and upon arrival was informed I had been upgraded to a Suite. Upon entering the Suite, it had no view and was right next to the Hotel's utility area and a parking lot. It was ridiculously noisy and this problem is faced by almost all the rooms on the 'outside' of the hotel's northern wing. I asked reception to give me back my original room class, only to be told no such room was available. Hence the reason for my "upgrade" was clear. They then tried to upsell me an even more expensive room. I was not impressed and was finally given my original "Full Ocean View room" after several hours wait, only to find the "full ocean view" is a slant of blue through a tunnel of buildings and other impediments. Clearly not worth $700. Other brief comments: Positives: rooms were spacious and comfortable, restaraunts were good, generally well maintained and recently renovated. Negatives: little privacy and view from the rooms, the pool is tiny, the beach out front is crowded and small, way over priced.

Reviews.Title: “The best of Maui”
Reviews.Author: explorerATL
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Four Seasons Wailea during our honeymoon and enjoyed every minute of it. Granted, you're paying top-dollar for the experience -- you know that going in...but we had no regrets. The service was amazing, from the concierge to the housekeeping staff to the spa and restaurants...and it's just a really beautiful place. One thing that surprised us - more families with young children (and nannies!) than we'd expected. I highly recommend this hotel if you're going to Maui and want a scenic, pampered, luxury experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven....”
Reviews.Author: Bigsylou
Reviews.Content: Amazing service, amazing resort, best hotel we have stayed in. We were upgraded to a huge suite because it was our honeymoon. Service was impeccable in the restaurants, poolside and throughout the hotel. Loved the Evian Spritzer, fragranced wet towels, sunscreen, iced water, fruit by the pool, Great snorkelling (free equipment), my husband saw a turtle, we also saw Nicole Richie and her boyfriend with the accompanying Paparrazzi. Yoga on the beachside was beautiful and very relaxing. Spago was great, go to Mama's Fish House nearby, breakfasts were nice and lunch at Ferraro's were great too. The only bad thing was that the room service dinner one night was not perfect, the steak was overdone and a bit tough and they didn't have bubble bath but overall AMAZING EXPERIENCE and we would love to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Why all the hypes???”
Reviews.Author: HuntBch
Reviews.Content: I agree with one of the other reviewers, I give this resort a rating of 3.5 stars. My husband and I just returned last week after spending 11 nights at this resort. We chose this resort because the hotel choices are limited if you want to stay in south Maui (Wailea). We also felt it is our only option for a quiet resort without a lot of kids. Here are my positive and negative views on this resort. Negative â€“ Resort: None of their rooms have a great view of the ocean, unless you pay $2K plus per night for one of their ocean front suites. We paid almost $800 per night for an Ocean View Premiumâ€¦$800 is the off-season special rate. From our room the ocean can only be viewed slightly at an angle. The grounds are not that nice for a resort of this caliber. Not enough tropical lush, too much of straight/clean lines for Hawaii. Lobby and surrounding areas inside the hotel does not have a Hawaiian feel, very little tropical flower arrangements and plants displayed. I feel the same as the previous reviewer - it feels more L.A. rather than Hawaii. Valet parking at $14 a day is outrageous. Other resorts offer the option to self -park or valet: this place forces you to valet and charges you for itâ€¦Itâ€™s about the principle!! Itâ€™s almost as extreme as airlines charging you for the use their dirty blankets. Food: We had dinner at DUO on the first night because we didnâ€™t want to drive after the long flight. It expensive for just okay food. There are so many wonderful restaurants around the area for dinner. If you love fresh sushi then â€˜Sanseiâ€™ in Kihei is a must!! Reservation is â€œhighlyâ€� recommended, they are very busy. Another must is â€˜Mamaâ€™s Fish Houseâ€™â€¦A+++! You will wonder why youâ€™ve wasted your money at DUO or Ferraroâ€™s. For lunch we did eat at Ferraroâ€™s everyday. There are not a lot of options if you want to sit down for lunch and the convenience of not having to leave the resort. Lunch for the two of us each day averaged $75 including gratuity. I donâ€™t understand why all the fuss about their breakfast buffet, it is very standard. The croissants (butter and chocolate) are dry, not moist like any standard croissants you can get anywhere else. Maid Service: The first day we returned to our room about 4:00 p.m., the room had not been cleaned. I then called maid service and arranged for our room to be clean at 12:00 p.m. and turn down at 7:30 p.m. Yes, our room was cleaned when we usually returned at 4:00 p.m. However, almost everyday they would bang on our door before 7:30 p.m. for turn-down service, which got really annoying after weâ€™ve told them several times that we had arranged for 7:30 p.m. Also, a couple of times they gave us â€œUSEDâ€� shampoo: how cheap and cheesy is that!!! Service: Most of the pool attendants are nice and helpful, but some make it obvious that theyâ€™re only helpful if tips are given. Tips are given only after good service has been renderedâ€¦not before, come on people! The front desk check in/out girls (yes, theyâ€™re nothing more than a receptionist) are snooty. I put up with this type of behavior at some of the lesser grade hotelsâ€¦but not at the Four Seasons! Positive - Beach is beautiful. The workout facility is nice because the machines are set in an open lanai, not in a confined room. Bathroom in the rooms are larger than most hotels. We also spend 11 nights last year on the Big Island at the Fairmount Hotel. The Fairmount is a much nicer place. The secluded beach they have is so spectacular. Rumor is that the St. Regis will be opening soon in Kauai, we will try it next time if itâ€™s true. We only hope it will not be another L.A. resort like the Four Seasons in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Ok?”
Reviews.Author: garyc44
Reviews.Content: We thought the hotel overall was nice but did not have that Hawaiian feel. In my opinion this hotel is over rated, yeah it does have it all but it kind of feels like Hollywood meets Hawaii. Over the past three years we have been to Maui twice & once to the Big Island. I would have to say this trip was my least favorite. We stayed two weeks at the Four Seasons Maui we had fun but felt as though we were surrounded by city slickers from Vegas or people trying to emulate Hollywood. If youâ€™re looking for this type of Hawaiian vacation then stay at the Four Seasons Maui, me I go to unwind and relax you know the Corona on the beach. I don't want to slam this hotel the service is above average but not excellent, the rooms are very nice but like some say not the best views of the ocean. We had a premium ocean view and really did not get a great view. The three restaurants on the premises arenâ€™t great for what you pay but Maui has plenty of choices. The beach is nice and large plus the cabanas and pool side you have plenty of space even when itâ€™s a tad crowded. The spa and gym where above average, however I expected it since we were spending a couple of hundred dollars more per night compared to surrounding hotels. Bottom line this hotel chain has done an excellent job marketing its brand; we are all buying in to if we stay at Four Seasonâ€™s weâ€™ve made it. Here is my advice stay somewhere else save the money you would not be missing a whole lot. P.S. Bring lots of tip money they charge 14.00 a day valet parking you really don't have a choice & pool side help won't be to helpful without tipping for set-up. ...â€¦GC

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: woojinah
Reviews.Content: If you can forget about the price, this is the place to be in Wailea. The guests that stay at this hotel probably range from middle class to extremely affluent so expectations may differ but I think that most will find the Four Seasons to be top notch. After learning that we were on our honeymoon, they sent up a bottle of champagne with a card to our room (within 10 min of us settling in). Poolside service is amazing, like everyone mentioned, and because we went in Sept/Oct, the hotel did not seem to be crowded. We never had a problem finding a Cabana, even the ones that lookout into the ocean. They offer alot of things complimentary. Snorkeling along the left side of the beach is actually very good as well. When you get here, just relax and get pampered because thats what they will do! The only thing is that the food was average at best (considering the price) and because Wailea is a bit isolated, you need to drive out a little bit to find cheaper food. However, breakfast at DUO's was great. Spago was just ok, nice ambiance though. Rooms are more spacious than some 1 bedrooms apartments here where I live. Bathroom is huge and spacious. Staff were some of the friendliest people we met in Maui. Overall a great experience. For you sushi lovers, drive up to Kihei (next to the foodland) Sundays/Mondays for their early bird discount (starts at 5pm but line starts before that). We stuffed our faces for two for under 50 bux, tip included.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend the Four Seasons Maui”
Reviews.Author: Deacs24
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that my wife and I enjoyed 5 wonderful days and nights at the Four Seasons Maui. I am hard pressed to think of negative things to say about the resort, but since the point of this site is to help other travelers make important decisions, I am going to try to list both the good and the "bad." I will also try not to repeat a lot of the things that you already know about the Four Seasons Maui. First, some perspective: My wife and I are in our early 30s, late 20s, and we were here for our 1st anniversary. In the past year, we have stayed at the Peter Island resort in the Caribbean (which is in many ways still our favorite place) and the Four Seasons Hualalai. With that as a backdrop, here goes: ROOM: We had an Ocean View room. The hotel was at 100% occupancy while we were there -- a little bit odd for October, I would have thought, but maybe that was because there was a large wedding occurring at the hotel. The room had a nice view. Yes, it is an angled view and yes, it is a bit further from the ocean than some hotels, and no, I don't think it is worth paying a lot extra for. (Luckily, we had booked Garden View and got upgraded to Ocean, but it's really not that big of a deal). The room was beautiful, large, clean, elegant, and had no offensive odors. Our room was on the 6th floor and overlooked the crocquet lawn. As you may have read in other reviews, there is a dorm-sized refrigerator in the room, and you can either have the hotel stock it for you or buy things on your own. The bathroom is large and luxurious, and the overall feeling you get from the room makes you feel like the money you're spending is well worth it. Should you pay extra for the view? Only you can answer this question, but in general, I would say No. Here's why. If you don't care about the view, then why pay extra? And if you do care about the view, then there's a good chance that the views here will fall a little bit short of your expectations. I would probably avoid the mountainside rooms unless you're doing the mountainside package, but we'll book the Garden View next time and not think twice. The Club Level might be an option if you are staying on side 90% of the time, but we wouldn't have wanted to go back and forth from the Club Level to the pool, etc. POOL/BEACH: As you can tell from all the pictures you've probably seen, both the pool(s) and beach are stunning. Both are great places to relax, although they are very different. The pool is more of a "scene," while the beach is less crowded and a bit more family oriented (but still great for couples). My #1 concern heading to the hotel was over the pool/beach chair situation, so let me address that. I was very pleasantly surprised by the availability of chairs. It is always easy to get a good spot on the beach. You may end up in the 2nd row of chairs/cabanas, but you'll still have a good spot. As far as the pool is concerned, here's how I would rate chair/cabana availability: 7am: Just about anything you want, including the most prime cabanas overlooking the ocean 8am: Maybe a few prime cabanas remain, the best chairs (without cabanas) all remain, and several very good pool cabanas remain. 9am: Most of the best cabanas are gone, still a few by the pool available, and still several prime chairs still available. 10am: Not much left other than scattered chairs. Coming from the East Coast, we never had a problem getting something in the 8-9am range, but I paid attention throughout the rest of the day because I had worried about it so much prior to the trip. Do I think they do a good job enforcing the 20 minute rule? No. Saw lots of people reserve spots and then head to breakfast for an hour...but at least when this was occurring there were still plenty of spots for everyone else. Seems like they enforce the policy a little more at the 10-11am range. Bottom line, if you want one of the best spots, then yeah, it's going to be a competition. If you'll be happy with a "good" to "ok" spot, you have nothing to worry about. The pool/beach service was nice, although slower and not as attentive as I would have thought. We enjoyed lots of water, pineapple, Evian spritzes, and cold towels, but it was often hard to place a food or drink order, and when you did, there was quite a wait. The hotel has an LA feel to it, especially around the pool. I'm not saying this is either a good thing or a bad thing, but it's there. One last thing. When you check in, you get a map of the property. On the map, it shows an area called "Adult Pool Site." I had heard that they were going to put an adult pool in at some point, and it looks like they are, but I couldn't get anyone to tell me when. Pay attention to this b/c you might not want to be there during the construction, but it will be great when it's finished. FOOD: Food was no better than OK, which I think is pretty typical of Four Seasons. Our dinner at DUO was worth the money, but was not exceptional or overly special. Do not order the potato "spuddies" -- although they have a cute name, you can do without them. I was pleasantly surprised with Spago, after having heard mixed reviews. It was expensive, but very good, and I think they give hotel guests the best tables. Poolside food was OK. The selection was maybe a little bit more gourmet than we would have wanted, but that's partially my fault -- I could have ordered a burger and didn't. We didn't eat any other major meals onsite, instead opting for Mama's Fish House, Longhi's and Roy's. I recommend all 3 of those places, in that order. My wife and I really enjoyed the Lobby Bar, which has a great hostess named Melissa. Our favorite drink was called the "Lush." I highly recommend either this or a lava flow. PRICES: Our dinners at DUO and Spago were about $250 each, including cocktails (2), appetizers (2), entrees (2) and one bottle of wine. Although it's hard to spend that on dinner where we live, I felt like it was decent value there. Cocktails run from $12-16, beers from $5-7, and lunch entrees from $18-25. KIDS: Everyone wants to know whether there were a lot of kids or was the hotel kid-friendly. First, every child I saw at the hotel was very well-behaved. I don't have kids yet, so I don't know anything about what kids want or need, but in my opinion, kids CAN be happy here BUT it is far from the best hotel to take kids to. The kids at the Grand Wailea seemed to be enjoying themselves a lot more than the ones at the Four Seasons, and why not -- there's tons more for kids to do at the Grand Wailea. So if you're planning this trip primarily for your kids, maybe look elsewhere. If you're planning it for yourselves first and foremost, kids will do OK, but would probably have more fun on the beach. My wife and I will return to this hotel some day, but I'm not sure it would be our choice if we have kids at the time. All in all, we loved the hotel. We didn't love the food, but it was more than adequate. I just wouldn't plan to eat all of my meals on site if I were you. The valet was always prompt with the car, and I would always call down in advance. The entire staff -- with zero exceptions -- was very welcoming and accommodating. This is a great place to visit for a special occasion. Please feel free to email me at redsock @ aol.com with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Maui - Great, but not Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Daleed77
Reviews.Content: I would like to give the Four Seasons 3.5 stars, but the system won't let me. I would like to divide my review into 2 sections - resort and hotel. Resort - 5 stars! The pool and service was amazing. Sean, one attendant, walked around with us to find a spot that was good for us. All week long we continued to say hello. The food service was very attentive and present when we wanted to order and when we just wanted water. The beach was perfect! The guys who set up the chairs were very friendly. The sand was very soft and the snorkeling was good. We saw turtles, huge fish, eels (scary), and lots of other fish. I would highly recommend doing the outrigger - a truly unique experience. The only down side would be the spa. The massages that we both got seemed adequate at best. The layout of the spa was very confusing. The locker room attendant was non-existent and you had to walk back through the check-in area to get to the relaxation area. It would be better if you could go directly from the locker room to the relaxation room. The hotel - 3 stars. I fully admit that this review is my fault. I booked the mountainview package which included a car and breakfast. The room as really great - large, wonderfully decorated, elegant. The bathroom was huge and exactly what you expect from the Four Season. My major issue - the lanai. You really cannot use the mountainside lanais. The noise from the air conditioner and the road are not acceptable. The Four Seasons should warn people when they book the this category. If you put me on this balcony before this experience and told me to guess the hotel, the Four Seasons would be my last guess. The back of hotel is too close the road. The management of the hotel, especially Amy, really tried to make us happy. She should be commended on her service. Food mentions - the breakfast was amazing! I would not have ordered the buffet otherwise, but I'm really glad I had a chance to try all of it. Ferraro's was good. The setting and service was amazing! The food was good, but great, and overpriced. The fish was overcooked and the risotto was a bit starchy. Being from NYC, you expect great food for those prices. A special mention for the lobby bar - the food and service were better than expected. Overall, the Four Season is a great set of hotels. As I've read, Maui was the first resort of the chain. You can definitely see the places where they have learned from their mistakes and limitations by the location. Would I go back? Yes, in a minute. But, I would not stay on the mountain side.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the 4 Seasons”
Reviews.Author: jwalc50
Reviews.Content: What do you say about the Waliea Four Seasons! Unreal Hotel .. We spent 12 nights in Hawaii 6 on Kauai and this was our last 6 nights in Maui. The staff at the four seasons treated us like celebrities. From handing out Ice water to sun block to you name it they did it. This is the nicest place we have ever stayed. All the restaurants located in the hotel our 4 star. is it expensive yes.. but it is a four seasons and you expect to pay for your surroundings. It was worth every penny to me and my husband. The new renovations to the Hotel were so nice.. out ocean view room was Gorgeous. the bathrooms where are marble. We would go back in a second. 1 tip get to the pool early if you want a cabana.. they are first come first serve and people get up early to get them!

Reviews.Title: “Liked... didn't Love this property”
Reviews.Author: AZjkk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 days to begin our Maui/Lana'i vacation. Perhaps my expectations were too high after reading so many reviewers touting "perfection". We found the property to be very lovely with an excellent location! The valets and front desk staff were very pleasant. The rooms are well-appointed and the bathroom is spacious. The first night we opted for room service, which turned out okay for my husband. Unfortunately, I ended up with the worst seafood pasta dish of my life...no exaggeration. Keep in mind that I am not a whiner, and was too tired to call and complain. That evening, we let housekeeping know that we didn't need turn-down service, as we would be going to bed early after our long trip. Within an hour, someone was entering our room after we had just fallen asleep. We started the next day with a wonderful breakfast buffet and excellent poolside service. The beach here is the BEST I've experienced in the Hawaiian islands, and we've been to all of them. This is the main reason for my above average rating of the property. Our last day on Maui was spent sightseeing. Returning to the hotel, we wanted to relax by the water with some food and drinks, and watch the sun go down. After tipping a pool attendant to set up our chairs an hour before pool service ended, we asked to place an order. She gave us a menu and never came back. Overall, it was a nice weekend...I would still recommend this property. Our experience just shows that it's impossible to be perfect 100% of the time. Just keep this in mind as you set your expectations and you'll have a better time!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Four Seasons!”
Reviews.Author: Sam0825
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Four Seasons Maui for the first week of our honeymoon and we cannot say enough good things about it. The service was incredible. The staff was very friendly, helpful and attentive. They seem to anticipate your every need with ice water, cold towels, Evian spritzes and fresh fruit. We had a partial ocean view room and it was perfect. We had a nice view of the croquet court and the ocean behind it. The room was very spacious and the bathroom was amazing - huge, great L'Occitaine products, music. The pool and beach areas were beautiful. Get up early to reserve a cabana with a nice view. We never had a problem getting one and one of the staff will set it all up for you, plus some lounge chairs in the sun. We ate at all of their restaurants and liked them all, especially Duo their new steak house. The drinks in the Lobby Lounge were very good as were the little snacks. Since breakfast a la cart is pretty expensive, it's worth getting the buffet. The only downside is the expense. We spent a small fortune on food, but there is a little beach snack shop where you can get a bagel or a muffin and some reasonably priced sandwiches for lunch. You can also head over to the Fairmount [in a complementary chauffered car], which has good restaurants but are pricey as well. But, if you are looking to live it up on your honeymoon and willing to spend the money, this is the place to do it. Some food aside, you will feel it's worth every penny. And the room cost covers everything other than food so you don't feel like you're being nickeled and dimed (beach chairs, cabanas, umbrellas are free). My one suggestion would be to do the Four Seasons last on your trip to Maui, because, once you leave there, your next hotel will not measure up (we went to the Westin second).

Reviews.Title: “Ultra Luxury”
Reviews.Author: misctraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Four Seasons for second half of honeymoon. This hotel is what luxury is all about...for a price of course. The service was perfect, all of the staff was very friendly, helpful and went above and beyond. They are always asking what they can do for you, which is really nice and surprisingly not irritating like I thought it would be. From the valet people to the beach attendants, this one of the very few places I've been where I actually wanted to tip generously because they were actually earning it. The hotel is clean and up to date, I believe it was just renovated before our arrival. Stayed in a room that overlooked the driveway/putting green but still had an ocean view (no beach view though). Room had large plasma tv, DVD player (with memory card reader to look at photos), 3 phones, sitting area, mini-bar area, large bathroom with soaking tub and separate glass shower, big closet and large balcony. Only three complaints with the room... The cordless phone didn't work and the HD TV channels only half worked. The worst problem though, was the noise of people opening and closing their balcony shutters and doors above and below us. It sounds like a freight train was going by outside every time someone would move them. The pool area is very nice, with cabanas for all guests available. They have complimentary water, pineapple slices and various other nice stuff to keep you comfortable in the sun. The beach is very quiet here, most people retreat to the pool by the afternoon. Also, the beach chairs, umbrellas and canopies are set up for you by the attendant which was very nice. The drinks and food are as expensive as you would expect for a hotel at this level. Quality of food and drinks was excellent though. Ate at Ferraro's one night, and the food and service were excellent. Make your reservation well in advance if you want a good view of the ocean. Compared to Kaanapali, this part of Wailea felt very quiet and out of the way. Didn't seem that crowded and there wasn't much in the way of ocean activity (sailing, diving, etc.) near the hotel that I could see. Worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Married At the 4S Maui”
Reviews.Author: Youngins
