Reviews.Content: My wife and I were married at this property in Wailea in June of this year and spent 8 days at the resort at the start of the honeymoon. The Resort: This property will literally take your breath away when you view it for the first time. It is akin to a beach palace that I envision a monarch would own. The grounds are perfectly manicured, the decoration opulent, the structures flawless. The pools, spas, and water features are glorious. The Fitness Center and Spa is half inside and half outside in the luscious greenery and are well equipped. The rooms are expansive and have been updated with wireless internet and flat panel TVs. The L'Occitane toiletries are fantastic. Do not even for a second think the Fairmount or Grand Wailea (neighbors) are even close to this place. While they too are nice, this resort is leaps and bounds better. The Service: This was actually lacking, given the audacious pricing for our wedding and stay. The housecleaning service sometimes never came, came late, or did terrible jobs. We complained and the manager was not very accommodating. Given the enormous amount of money we were dropping on this trip, I would have expected much more. The service by the pool is another story. Here, they bring by all kinds of goodies. Including: free Evian Misters, free fresh fruit, free snacks, free otter pops, any food order you want, massages, beverages, etc. The Wedding: Our wedding was flawless. My wife and I did very little planning, 50 guests, and the ladies who run their wedding department do a splendid job. I seriously can not imagine a more perfect picturesque setting for a wedding. They moved us to the oceanfront lawn and it was spectacular. The food was delicious, the servers/bartenders were great, and the people they use for video and photo are incredible. Our DJ actually does Oprah's parties. If anyone is getting married here or thinking about it in the near future, pm me and I will gladly give you some more inside information. Finally, this place is a celeb hangout. While we were there, we saw, Claire Danes and her brit boyfriend, William Hurt, Meg Ryan, Luke Wilson, Matt Damon and his wife and their kid, and the president from the show 24. In sum, this is a magnificent place, that, if you can squeeze it, is worth the money. It will be a unforgettable place. For comparison's we stayed at the other 3 4S properties in Hawaii for the rest of the honeymoon so read my other reviews if you are interested in getting a comparison of the places.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: afc76
Reviews.Content: It has taken me almost a year to write this review, but reading the other reviews brings back memories of our amazing honeymoon. We had a quiet, partial ocean view room at the edge of the property (to the right of the driveway as you go down into the property) with a lovely, large lanai. We could see the ocean in the distance and manicured grassy areas in the foreground. We loved lounging by the pool in a cabana getting delicious lunches and cool drinks delivered to us. We also dined at Spago one night and Ferraro's on several occassions, as well as in our room through room service. The breakfast buffet was wonderful and my husband still compares all other hotel breakfasts to the Four Seasons'. All restaurants and food were excellent. The service was wonderful. The valet always was available to give directions, provide water and towels, and inquire about our outings. The concierge also made reservations for us at Mama's Fish House and gave us directions to Haleakala and Lahaina for the luau. The spa was lovely. Our oceanside couples' massage was not possible due to construction noise (not horrible, but too noisy for a massage) and we got a couples' massage indoors instead. The couples' massage was complimentary since it had to be done indoors--- to our surprise when we went to provide our room number to settle the bill. The spa relaxation area, shop, and locker-room are all top notch and I have had a hard time finding any spas in the Washington, DC, area that compare. We were there during the October 06 earthquake. The emergency system wasn't so great as they only started to test the loudspeakers about 15 minutes after the earthquake, so we had to rely on calls to the probably swamped front desk for updates since our power was out. (This is in comparison to the Halekulani on Waikiki, where we recently stayed, where apparently at the threat of a fire, the fire alarm immediately sounded and a recorded message in both English and Japanese followed). The power was ourt only for a few hours after the earthquake but our outgoing flight was cancelled, so we enjoyed the Four Seasons for an extra two nights - not complimentary- but even the Four Seasons can't control earthquakes! They quickly had the place back up and running by the afternoon after the quake. We have wonderful memories of the Four Seasons at Wailea and cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded All Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: dawnd92
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Four Seasons celebrating our 10th anniversary. We had selected the hotel based on previous reviews on this site and then booked a garden view room throught the hotel's website. The hotel offered a 5th night free promotion which lowered the overall price of our stay below what we could find on other sites. We had noted that the trip was for our 10th anniversary when we booked it and had a bottle of champagne and a card from the manager waiting for us upon arrival. Our renovated room exceeded all of our expectations. The plasma TV, DVD player, sound system in the bathroom, clock with a docking station for our ipod were all fantastic. So was the view out our windows of the garden. I had a massage and facial at the spa one morning while my husband did a free snorkeling lesson at the pool and then an additional excursion out in the ocean. The spa is defintiely worth a visit. The snorkeling excursion was great. For an extra charge, the guide provided a CD with pictures and video from the dive. We also enjoyed the complimentary introductory tennis lesson with the tennis pro, Collin. He did a great job helping us learn how to play. On the advice of several others, we stopped at Wal-Mart on the way in from the airport and picked up soft drinks, bottled waters, and food for breakfast and lunch. The refrigerator in our room was empty, so we had plenty of room to store the food. We did not eat all our meals in the room, but eating a few there certainly helped out. Next time, we would probably stop at the Safeway a little closer to the hotel to get a better food selection. The hotel staff really take care of everything for you from setting up your beach chairs to providing bottled waters and beach towels for trips off site. We had a fabulous meal at Ferraro's for our anniversary. Be sure to ask for a table at sunset if you book a reservation there. We found a great price on a rental car from Thrifty. We checked prices every week before the trip and they actually came down by almost $100 the week before we left. We would definitely return to the Four Seasons for our next trip to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: rain2
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay for the 3rd year in a row. The newly renovated rooms are wonderful. Grounds are beautiful. Poolside foot massage was great. Pool food is just ok, and I was sad they changed the breakfast menu at the main restaurant. Again, this hotel is 99% perfect. To me this hotel is always worth the money, but I did have a few (very minor) complaints this time. I had to ask for a standard size pillow twice, and our room wasn't cleaned by 3pm, and turndown service didn't show up until 9pm the last day of our trip. Per housekeeping it was a busy day. I must be getting spoiled after staying here to complain about these things. I'm sure we'll be back for years to come. This hotel in my opinion is the place to go if money is no object or you just want to splurge on a vacation. We always stay somewhere less expensive for the first part of our trip (Hyatt Kaanapalli) so we really appreciate the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Experience - never wanted to leave”
Reviews.Author: C6PVP
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking forward to staying at the Four Seasons, Maui having stayed at the Four Seasons, Santa Barbara a few years back. We were not disappointed. We reserves an ocean view room. The room was located near the back of the hotel facing the inner courtyard of the "U" shaped building. We did view the ocean, but were not as close as other "ocean view" room that we have stayed at other hotels. Never the less, the balcony are well laid out providing privacy. The room itself and bathrooms are well appointed. Wife loved the bed while I looked forward to every shower. Room was serviced twice a day. It was magic with the bed turned down, lights turned on, and favorite music playing every night we returned to the room. Wife and I did a couples body wrap and massage spa package. Service was excellent. Spa area seemed small and a little cramp when waiting with all the people for the next phase of the treatment. Pool area seem relatively small for all the guest. Finding a pair of chairs can be a challenge. Pool staff is extremely helpful in finding a location and setting them up for you. Once you find a chair, the experience is heaven. Beautiful view of the pool or the ocean, with attendants bring around water, cool towels, and Evian mists. Food was also very good, strongly recommend the pineapple ginger ice. It sounds weird but it's really good! Dinner at Spago's was a wonderful experience but is very expensive. We both had the sampler with the wine accompaniment. Tomato soup and kobe steak were the favorites from the wonderful combinations of flavors. Like everything else at the Four Seasons, service was outstanding. Four Season, Maui experience was everything we hoped for. Service is impeccable, always anticipating your needs. Hotel facilities are wonderful, although it can feel a little crowed at times. Overall experience changes your perception of what a hotel should be, clearly raising the bar. We can hardly wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: jwb1
Reviews.Content: Folks, if you're looking for the best place to stay in Maui, you've just found it. By far the best location, service, ambiance, service, beach, restaurants, and "wow" factor! My wife and I stayed here in August for our honeymoon. The Ritz was closed for a remodel so our travel agent called wondering where to rebook us. After some checking, we decided to spend the money and stay at the 4-Seasons. We were happy we did! The property recently completed a major renovation and has all the bells and whistles. State of the art everything, 50in plasma w/HD in the room, fitness room and spa facilities are simply amazing. The beach area might also be the best on the island. Great smooth sand, and snorkeling that's right in your backyard. We're talking snorkeling that others are paying hundreds of dollars for. You'll see all the big tour companies with their catamarans here. But all you have to do is get your free daily snorkel gear, head off to the left (they call it turtle town) and voila.....amazing coral, fish and turtles. Again you'll see the Triology and other tour boats in this area because it's the PLACE TO BE. And again, the people on those boats are paying big money! You....free. Okay they give you a free one hour rental everyday. But thats plenty of time, at least it was for us. The service was also top notch. We did encounter some slow service by the pool (twice) however. But the first time they comped the lunch and the second time a manager profusely apologized. We weren't mad or anything and we're only talking waiting 10 mins to order lunch from our poolside cabana. But to these people I guess thats unacceptable. They always use your last name and the concierge was the best of anywhere we have ever stayed, ever. And folks I travel, I'm an airline pilot. Overall, yes it's expensive but the key factor is that it's worth it. We saw some other hotels which were also pricey, but to us, for almost the same amount, the 4 Seasons blows everyone else away. If you're staying in Maui and want the best experience possible, you have to stay at the 4 Seasons, period.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Honeymoon Look No Further”
Reviews.Author: arodri70
Reviews.Content: This is the best resort that I have stayed at in my life. My wife and I spent 7 nights at the Four Seasons to finish out our honeymoon and loved every minute of it. It was clean, the food was wonderful, service with a smile and they always knew our name. The beach was beautiful and we were waited on hand and foot. If you are looking for a place to spend your honeymoon do not look further. I cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Hands Down...The Best Place to Stay in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: stephfromATL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 10 days at the Four Seasons Resort Maui at Wailea for our honeymoon in Oct 05 and it was absolutely perfect!! We did extensive research on several contending hotels before and during our stay. Hands downâ€¦the Four Seasons Maui was the best by far. We were checked in quickly and were given gorgeous orchid leis. The ocean view room was very nice and clean. But the huge marble bathroom was the most impressive we've seen of all the other Four Seasons resorts we've stayed. On the first evening, he managers hosted a cocktail reception with mai tais around the pool. Local artisans were on hand displaying beautiful art and jewelry. They were also hand during our entire stay around the hotel. The service during our stay was amazing and consistent. The restaurants were fabulous...especially Spago. One of the best meals I've ever had. Make sure you eat on the patio during sunset...the sunsets are breathtaking. The pool and grounds are immaculate and well manicured. The pool attendants mist you with Evian while you lay out and hand out frozen fruit and ice cream. Of course with all this service and atmosphere it was very expensive but worth every penny. We will definitely be back for our 5th anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing....go on spoil yourself!”
Reviews.Author: bp98
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the first leg of my honeymoon and really set the benchmark. The last memory of this hotel was 4 valet staff helping us into our car, 1 on each door handing us the seat belt, one with the luggage and one handing us clear printed instructions on how to get to the airport. The service in this hotel is second to none. From the arrival greeting, to the valet, to the concierge and i cannot forget the amazing pool side service. It is pure four seasons, always there but never intrusive. Pool service, where the attendants always would find you sun beds, to lay them with fresh towels and provide regular tops up to the ice water as well as evian spritzers and popsicles. The staff really look like they enjoy workng at this resort, they make you fell very welcome and even remember your name by face so that over a few days staff do not even need to ask you your name. The mountain view room we were in, overlooked the valet car park but it was covered and never disturbed us. The rooms were recently renovated and were beautiful. It was very large and the bathroom with separate bath/shower and twin sink was esquisit ! The room service was also great with the room always being cleaned early in the day and once before the evening where the bed was prepared for the night. Food on the resort is a little limited for a 5 night stay and is admiitedly expensive. However, there are a number of fine restaurants in other nearby hotels so you will never get bored. Spago was my favourite. A little note thank the hotel as well. When we left the island we realised that i had lost my mobile phone. The hotel helped track it down (from the snorkelling tour i had left it with) and they shipped it back to the UK. THis was truly great service and i couldn't beleive that the hotel actually made a lot of the effort and we had to do no chasing. So a big thanks to Claude in security. I have to say it is not cheap, but it really beats any other hotel i have ever stayed in (globally) including many 5* hotels. This place will make your holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Down -- Wouldn't Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: ZacP
Reviews.Content: I can understand why many people like this Four Seasons Resort. It feels exclusive, the food is good, and most of the staff is eager to please. For a number of reasons, however, my wife and I did not enjoy our stay here, and we will not return. Some of the problems that we had were not the Resortâ€™s fault, like the size of the pool and the beach. And perhaps we became biased after we found feces (someone elseâ€™s) on our roomâ€™s toilet seat on our first night. But for the price we paid and the reputation that this Resort enjoys, we thought that too many problems were, in fact, the Resortâ€™s fault. First, the positives. The food was very good. We had breakfast at Duoâ€™s once, and lunch at the restaurant by the pool two or three times. We would have eaten at Spago, but were unable to make a same-day reservation. Plan ahead if you want to eat there. We also attended a wedding at the resort, along with a reception at the Resortâ€™s banquet facilities. Each time the food was excellently prepared and delicious. Perhaps the prices were on the expensive side, but certainly not outside the range of comparable restaurants that we visited on Maui and Kauai. Other positives? Our room (mountain view double) was very quiet and well furnished. NYT and WSJ newspapers were readily available for no charge. Outrigger program was great fun. And judging from the number of kids that were there (90% of whom were very well-behaved) and the number of kid-friendly activities the Resort advertises, the Resort could be a good choice for families. On to the negatives. Our visit got off to a bad start when, after a full day of flying from the East Coast, we check in, get to our room, and find feces on the toilet seat in our bathroom. Absolutely gross. Called Housekeeping, and the good news was that they did come within 10 minutes (although 10 mins feels like forever when you have to use the facilities!). The bad news was that they didnâ€™t do a very good job, and my wife ended up cleaning the toilet again herself after they left. We also found the closet doors in the room to be dirty, and found several notes/items that the previous guests left behind when we were unpacking our things. We informed Housekeeping of our disappointment, and they promised to do a thorough cleaning the next day. Turned out to not be very thorough, as the doors were still dirty for the rest of our visit. The Resort sent us a small box of chocolates as an apology, but when poop is involved, I expect a more significant remedy. We also had a problem with the Resortâ€™s concierge. We booked the Molokini snorkel trip that leaves out of the Maui Prince Hotel (great trip - highly recommended because you get there first in the a.m.). We asked the concierge the day before the trip to book us a taxi to bring us there, but the concierge told us that the Resortâ€™s shuttle would be able to get us there with no problem. Great, we thought. However, we show up back at the conciergeâ€™s desk the next morning, and they tell us that the shuttle isnâ€™t running yet and theyâ€™ll have to call us a taxi. We almost missed the trip. It would have been nice if the concierge had offered to pay for the taxi trip (they said it would only be â€œa couple of dollarsâ€� for the ride; ended up being $20 each way), but that never happened. Other minor problems were being brought the wrong drinks at the restaurant by the pool (but being told they were the right ones â€“ the bill proved us right, though), and I also thought that the two ladies at Snorkels (the beachside cafÃ©/gift shop) were condescending and prickly. Also, be aware that the property is quite small for the number of rooms it has. This means that when the Resort is full (as it was while we were there), it really feels full. Prime seats by the pool were gone by 8am, and if you werenâ€™t on the beach by 10am you were sitting behind two rows of other people. Second, and I know this sounds silly, but I didnâ€™t really feel like I was in Hawaii at this Resort. Just looking at the rooms, the lobby, the restaurants, the cramped pool area and the cookie-cutter concrete buildings, this Resort could have easily been in Miami, Las Vegas (minus the beach, of course), or L.A. Very little sense of any sort of Hawaiian or other exotic culture. If youâ€™re planning your honeymoon, PLEASE do me a favor and at least consider French Polynesia. Itâ€™s so much more exotic, less crowded, more exclusive and more beautiful. Itâ€™s only a couple more hours travel time, and if youâ€™re already considering the Four Seasons, itâ€™s in the same price range. Staying in an overwater bungalow is an unforgettable experience; you wonâ€™t regret it. Back to the Four Seasons. The beach in front of the Resort was nice, but also had its share of issues. Being small, expect to be right on top of people on your right and left. Not very relaxing, especially when a family decides to play bocce right next to your chairs. The beach attendants wouldnâ€™t let us move our chairs to get away from people (when we did they just moved them back when we went in the water), and by late morning there is nowhere left to go anyway. Also be aware that beaches are public property everywhere in Hawaii, and the beach in front of the resort is very popular with other tourists and locals. Public access to beaches is a wonderful thing, but part of me was annoyed when a big family plopped down right in front of us. Another problem with the beach (at least in summer) is that by 2:00 p.m. the winds start to blow pretty hard. Sand gets blown into your face and you are pretty much forced to retreat to the pool. Of course there are no seats left by the pool because everyone is doing the same thing, so you end up sitting in your room. If you have a mountain view (aka parking lot view) room as we did, it sucks. It was too hot (no breeze here) and too noisy from the giant air conditioning vents to sit on our small balcony, so we were stuck inside our room. Looking back, we should have either sprung for an oceanview room or rented a car and driven around in the afternoon. Not a lot to see close by, but it would have been better than sitting in our room every afternoon until dinner. Apologies for the length of this review, but I hope you find it helpful. Bottom line: if you get an oceanview room, if you like being part of â€œthe sceneâ€�, if you donâ€™t mind crowds, if you are looking for a relaxing time without having to experience much of any culture, if you get excited by turn-down service and people who call you by name, and if youâ€™re lucky, then you will probably enjoy this Resort. If youâ€™re like us, though, I would recommend staying somewhere else. We visited the Grand Hyatt on Kauai during our trip, and they seemed to get it right. Much larger property, but beautiful facilities and beach, and much more traditional Hawaiian atmosphere. We also much preferred the Ritz Carlton on Grand Cayman for a relaxing beach holiday, if thatâ€™s what youâ€™re looking for. And French Polynesia (check out Manihi) canâ€™t be beat for an ultra-romantic honeymoon destination. In any event, good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons , incredible as expected”
Reviews.Author: BrentD
Reviews.Content: Where to start? As others mentioned, we were greeted immediatly by a hotel guest greeter, and whisked us off to the front desk, along with smiles, leis and lemon water. (taxi from OGG to hotel about $60). Once they asked your last name, you will be called this by everyone. Owning my own business, I can say remembering names is a great attribute, but to remember names on an ever changing rotation of guests......impressive. Our room was on the mountain side. It was very nice, marble bath, super ammenities as mini bar, coffee maker, safe, iron, dial up choice music, phones in bath, shower and seperate tub, on and on. The bed was so comfortable, along with 2 maid services daily. On this being our honeymoon, a bottle of champagne was waiting for us upon our entry. Nice touch! Also plasma and about 60 channels, along with an ipod station. The grounds were immaculate.Breath taking. Pool area has a huge pool with opposite jacuzzis,one for adults and kids.Also a kiddy area. There were a fair amount of children here, most well behaved. The children seemed to stay close to their parents, hence about 30 percent of pool patrons are kids from 1 to 15. There are about 40 cabanas surrounding the pool, with then about 100 lounge chairs with covers etc. If you want a cabana, I HIGHLY suggest getting to the pool area before 8 am. The pool staff will start to come out at 7, and at that time you can have your cabana made.They have a 20 minute rule, that is if you leave and are gone over 20 minutes(except between 11 and 2 for lunch), you run the risk of losing your spot. I never saw this enforced my whole 6 days. I usually was up by 6:30(due to my body time zone change), was at the pool cabanas by 7, reading a book, awaiting for a pool attendant. They will come by frequently with lemon water, Evian water sprays, cold towels, popsicles, and will get you anything you askthroughout the day. We opted for a bottle of champagne daily, and was there waiting for us by the 4th day. Service here is the best. Always smiling, talking to you, and overall feel that they were there for you. Great poolside food, drinks etc. If you wanted to sit all day, you could, as all can be brought to you. Wife had a poolside foot massage and loved it. There is a massage menu for pool side. Had dinner 1st at Spago. Had asked 2 weeks in advance for a table as close to the rail as possible for the sunset/honeymoon dinner, but was given a table on that level, but 30 feet from where I had requested. being jet lagged, and not to be bothersome, we ate, and still had a wonderful time. Food at Spago, Duo, or Ferraros will set you back an easy $200 plus nightly for 2. Martinis throughout the resort are about $17, and beers run $7. It is the Four Seasons, and didn't mind the price because the service matched the price. Was offered a ride to the shops down the road by the valet staff. There are your share of shops, such as in Rome, Venice, NY, like Gucci, Tiffanys, etc....saw no Prada. Had dinner at Tommy Bahamas. Great dinner, nice bar, dinner for 2 was around $160 including drinks. Average plate 30-40 dollars. At night we would watch the ocean, have a cigar and martini, then drift off to bed awaiting the next days adventures.Breakfast is a wonderful buffet. We ate there each day. Buffett runs $37.00 per person. We did snorkle 1 day. You can get the gear at " Snorkels" a beach store, 1 hour is free, every hour after is $5. Also, serve as a small deli shop. Drinks, sodas, turkey sandwiches, ect... Over all great time. Was there for 6 nights, ate out days and nights, and spent approx a thousand a day. $500 for the room ,and $500 for lunches, drinks and dinner. I feel it was a great value, and must say Ashley at the poolside cabanas was so nice. Leon, Kevin and Dave were always on the top of their game. Thanks. Would I stay there again? Without a doubt!! Worth every penny. Thanks to all the people at 4S, you made our honeymoon special.

Reviews.Title: “Room selection is crucial/booking with hotel is cructial”
Reviews.Author: bennyj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the four seasons maui for 6 days in august.We have stayed at this hotel before and we go to wailea twice a year.This year when we booked.there was no rooms available in the partial ocean catagory for the 6 days. So..we were in partial ocean for the beginning and mountain view for the end.The hotel room manager said the hotel was sold out and he couldn't help us stay in the same room. We even offered at check in to take a garden view for the whole time or a mountain( a down grade) to avoid the move.we were told it was not possible.The move was a complete nightmare.The room wasn't ready, somethings were not moved, and the room keys did not work. After we got to the mounatin view, it was over a smoke/steam pipe so the balcony was not useable.We called the front desk manager, jeff hill, and recieved no call back at all.we were told he forgets to pick up his voicemail.This was not good service for a four seasons. Do not stay at this hotel unless they can give you the same room for the entire time. In the mountain view..stay over the tennis courts.we have stayed there before and it is lovely. Last, this time we booked through a package. I was told at check out that it matters on the level of service you get..book direct with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect honeymoon location”
Reviews.Author: WebboLondon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week in May as part of our two week honeymoon in Maui. After a fairly disappointing stay at the Fairmont a few doors away, the FS was just what we needed. From our warm welcome on the reception desk through to our complimentary room upgrade and bottle of bubbly in our room. This hotel is what honeymoon'ing is all about! We were treated like we were the most important guests the whole time we were there, whether it be at the spa, by the pool or at dinner. Our room was modern, tastefully decorated and in a superb location within the resort. Everything we could possible need in our room was at hand. The first night we treated ourselves to in-room dining which was superb and well worth every cent. We had dinner at Duo's which was nice but we loved Ferraro's for lunch and dinner. We dined there often. The crab cakes were to die for! We also had a massage and scrub at the Spa which was heavenly. It was also sweet, although a complete 'its a small world' coincidence, that my husband's masseuse originated from a town about 20 mins from our home town in England. Yes, the Four Seasons is expensive but then so is every hotel along Wailea. I begrudged paying more for a room at the Fairmont that was far inferior to the one that we stayed in at the Four Seasons. I thought that for the quality of room and service that this resort offered was worth every cent (it also helped that the exchange rate was over $2 to the Â£1!!). We would love to go back if only it wasn't so far, far away!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: MrMrsTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the second half of our honeymoon and were so thrilled with our choice! Yes, it's very expensive, but it is truly a wonderful spot, especially for a special occasion! Right from the start everything was amazing! We loved the special lei greeting upon check in and then having our greeter escort us to the check in counter, at which we were greeted with a nice cool ice lemonaid/tea drink. Our room was great! The bathroom was incredible! It was so huge, like a room in itself! And the room is very modernized with a big plasma tv and dvd player and an ipod speaker system! The view wasn't so great, but we didn't complain about it. I'm sure if we had we could have been moved... We paid for garden view, but really we had a view of the service path (constant hotel workers walking back and forth) and a chain link fence, covered in shrubbery... not really a "garden view". But we weren't really sitting out on the balcony anyway, so it didn't matter too much. We loved the turn down service too. Whenever we came back from the dinner the room was all ready for a cozy night! Parking is valet (no choice), but really reasonable! I was quite surprised actually - $14 a night for valet is great!! The concierge desk is amazing! Wow! Make sure to make use of them! They have driving directions on little pieces of paper, for every attraction/area in Maui, so ask for them when you head out! Plus if you're doing the road to Hana, ask them for their info. They put together this super package of the best places to stop and great details as to what's there, complete with photos. This together with the Road to Hana CD that we bought at the Shell Station, made for the best, most comprehensive guide for the road to Hana! I agree, get the bed and breakfast package when you book! It's a great value! We paid $30 a day more for the package. If we had just paid to eat the breakfast buffet it would have been $73 a day for the two of us! The breakfast buffet is amazing by the way! And they are super great with letting you take extras with you! We usually asked for a to-go cup to take come juice with us, and this was never a problem. I also usually grabbed an extra danish for later. On our Road to Hana day we asked for the whole breakfast to go as we were off for this drive and they quickly supplied us with 5 to-go containers, and to-go cups and even sent bottled water with us! This was super! The beach was great too! They set up chairs for you on the beach (no additional charge) and bring you cold water to drink! The snorkelling was super in front of the hotel - although you have to out a ways, to the reefs, and go in the morning before the waves pick up! In addition to many fish, we also saw a sea turtle sooooo close up!! It was amazing! But ask the concierge again too for some other great snorkelling places. They sent us to one bay that was absolutely amazing too - sooo many fish there, in shallow water, so you could get really close up!! The games room is super here too! Great for kids, and adults! We enjoyed nightly games of pool and table shuffle board! There are also two computer stations there where you can use the internet for free. All in all it was a truly memorable honeymoon, and we look forward to returning one day on one of our anniversaries!

Reviews.Title: “Just aewsome”
Reviews.Author: Orchids
Reviews.Content: Everything is just perfect at the FourSeasons. The staff is very attentive, be warned that you will feel pampered. The rooms are very spacious and very well appointed. We had booked a garden view room, but the room actually had partial ocean view and was on the 4th floor. The pool could be a little larger I felt. The cabanas by the pool are awesome. The staff takes a lot of trouble finding something free and setting up a spot for you (setting up with towels, water etc). They have a beautiful beach that is not crowded (the Grand Wailea side gets crowded). They will setup beach chairs with towels, water and umbrellas if you want for no charge at the beach. Some people were snorkeling at the beach as well.... though I found it hard with the waves. We chose to snorkel at some calmer bays/coves further south. We had the bed and breakfast package (with the room booking) and I would recommend asking for it. The buffet breakfast is large and worked as brunch for us most of the time. The location is a little ways out if you are planning to spend time in Lahania, so make sure you plan for the drive time.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish. Elegant. Heaven...”
Reviews.Author: kisstina
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE the Four Seasons Maui. The hotel grounds are gorgeous, the staff was superb, the rooms are immaculate. We had dinner at Spago and the food was nothing short of spectacular. Everything about this resort screams excellence! I can't think of one thing that was not above and beyond my expectations (and since it is the Four Seasons, I expected A LOT!!). We drove out at 3:30 in the morning to watch the sunrise over Haleakala and the staff correctly assumed our destination. When valet brought us our car, they lent us blankets b/c they knew it would be cold. And they were right!! If not for their thoughtfulness, we would have frozen atop the volcano. If you like to be pampered and enjoy the finer things in life, you can't go wrong with the Four Seasons Maui. Its heaven on earth.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal honeymoon in the States”
Reviews.Author: amwerewolfinlondon
Reviews.Content: We took our honeymoon in Maui because for visa reasons we wanted to stay in the US. We had a relaxing and wonderful 6 night stay at the Four Seasons. Everything about this hotel says luxury. The decor, room, service, pool, location... it doesn't get much better. We had oceanside massages that knocked us out for hours. While at the pool we were often asked if we'd like popsicles or were sprayed with fresh evian water to cool us off. Plush cabanas that were never fully occupied. The food is also fantastic whether you eat poolside or at Spago. Each room has it's own private balcony. We also had lovely chocolates and champagne awaiting us when we arrived. As a tip someone suggested visiting the Maui Safeway and stocking up on drinks and snacks. The hotel provides your own mini-fridge if you decide to do this. Not only did they bring it up while we were at the pool, they unpacked our groceries and stocked the fridge for us. Overall a very memorable and happy honeymoon. Highly recommended especially for couples looking for a romantic holiday without kids running around the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like a VIP!”
Reviews.Author: lcaz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is top notch. If you want service from people who actually look like they enjoy making people happy, this is the place. It costs a ridiculous amount but the grounds are stunning and the rooms are luxurious. They have thought of all the extras because it really IS all in the details. The restaurants are pricey but artfully dellicious. The nearby Ulua beach has excellent snorkeling. Only down side is the rooms are mostly located quite a ways from the beach so ocean view is over quite a bit of ground. I would go back in a heartbeat if I could justify spending the money again! In response to an earlier review- most things are included- snorkeling, tennis, work out club (top of the line equipment!), hourly outrigger lessons, even scuba lessons for beginners! Even if it's once- GO!

Reviews.Title: “very good - not great”
Reviews.Author: LZ&TZ
Reviews.Content: Just back from the Four Seasons, Maui and we were not that impressed. Maybe the hype and the five star rating made us expect more but we did not have a five star stay. First, let me say the room was very nice although our room overlooked the parking area and the air-conditioning unit for the entire hotel. This created a constant noise which could have been very disturbing from the patio. It didnâ€™t bother us much. The bathroom was very large and the entire room was spotless as were all the grounds. The pool was also very nice and we never had a problem in getting a cabana, which are free (nice touch). The beach is very nice although, no fault of the hotel, we were unable to swim there until the last day of our trip due to jellyfish and rough currents. The valets are great and always ready to help with towels, bottles of water and directions. Additionally, the food is very good although VERY expensive. On the other hand, being early risers, we tend to get out of the hotel early and are back by 4-5 PM. On the first day our room was not cleaned by our return at 5 (after being out of the room all day). We spoke to the front desk and housekeeping who assured us that they would clean our room earlier the next day. They didnâ€™t. Our room was not cleaned by 5 the next day. Additionally, we had room service glasses at our door for 3 days. Finally, we had asked for tea service in the room instead of coffee service. They didnâ€™t provide this until we asked a second time. We meet with the assistant manager about our problem and they were corrected along with a free dinner. Also, he wrote us a personal note of apology and had the floor of the room sprinkled with flower petals and sent chocolates (very impressive and respectful). But we still had to ask to have our tea service refilled every day. These are little things but for these rates and with a five star rating they don't seem unreasonable. All-in-all a very nice hotel but not five star and if you expect perfection (at these prices you should) this is not it. We had read that the staff gets to know your name and addresses you that way. No one we met had that experience and the other people we met all seemed to have a four star experience as we had. I would highly recommend Sorrentoâ€™s on The Beach for dinner and Warren and Annabelleâ€™s for a great night out while on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: LT2007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose the Four Season Maui based on a recommendation by my cousin that had been there 2 years before for her honeymoon. We were so happy that we chose the hotel! The hotel was absolutely beautiful! The pictures on the website do not do it justice! We knew going in that the hotel was under major renovation- after be assured by the hotel that we would not even know there was construction going on- we proceeded. in fact- it was a blessing in disguise! They had one whole wing closed and so the hotel was not overcrowded. Everything from the staff to our newly renovated room was amazing! We were happy to learn when we arrived that we were being upgraded to an ocean view room. There was a bottle of Champagne waiting with a nice note congratulating us on being newlyweds! The pool area is very nice.. each time you interact with the staff they address you as Mrs. or Mr. "" -which was fun since we had just been married.. The beach is also very nice- coming from Southern California - we are used to very large beaches- this was not- but it is tucked againts a cove- so it really feels very private. There is a great ocean front path that runs about a mile or so north of the hotel and south of the hotel. We went for a run every morning - taking in the beauty of the area. We would then end our run with a bagel at the beachside shop- Snorkels- we are not big breakfast people- so this was a nice alternative to the big buffet served at Ferraro's each day... ( and much cheaper!) The concierge service at the Four Seasons was also great! Anything you needed was arranged without a second thought. We had poolside massages every few days and really indulged in the 5 star service. We did not indulge in many sightseeing trips- in fact we only left the resort one day! We just felt that the hotel had so much to offer- it was beautiful and well we loved just relaxing by the pool or beach... We golfed one day- There is a course just up the way from the hotel.. Can't remember the name... but we played the ocean course- I think it was either the Emerald or Gold course- every hole had an ocean view! We had a blast!! I highly recommend the Four Seasons- it is a wondeful hotel that does not have a crowded feeling and for the most part-you feel like you are their number one priority! not a lot of children there- at least not when we were there- which was great considering we were newlyweds!! My husband told me he would take me back when I was pregnant with our first child- well it came a little sooner than we thought- so we are going back in November for a last get away before the little one arrives in January. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: KJet
Reviews.Content: By far the best hotel we have ever stayed at and I do mean EVER. Room(s) were great! Staff was great! Restaurants were great! Expensive but worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: brennamt
Reviews.Content: After leaving the Fairmont in two hours, we booked a room at the Four Seasons and were greeted by the Asst. Property Manager. He upgraded to an ocean front superior room. It was very nice after a horrible start to our Maui leg of our 2WK honeymoon in Hawaii. The room was very nice and quite large. Frankly, there is no need for a suite if you have an ocean front room like this if there is just two of you. It has a very long hallway with a large closet. There is a extremely spacious bathroom and the main room has room for both a desk, couch and large coffee table. Very happy with the room. I will have the one main negative out there: the pool is like going on a cruise because one needs to be there at 8AM to get a good seat overlooking the ocean by the pool. It is somewhat of a joke. So, you work around it. Get a work out in at 6/7AM and head over there to get a spot. The Italian place is best on the property. We had two dinners there and both were excellent. Spago is very good as well, but nothing amazing. DUO - the steak place is not good. You have the breakfast staff trying to serve a steakhouse...not a good formula. The steak was also a weak cut of meat for the price. I would not recommend it at all. The breakfast is great though in the same location. Staff is great. Service is impeccable. It is not cheap, so expect to spend.

Reviews.Title: “Scottsdale by the Sea -- checked in and out the same afternoon.”
Reviews.Author: ljlSanFrancisco_Ca
Reviews.Content: Why bother going all the way to Hawaii? Windy, overcrowded, nickle-and-diming beach ($1000+/night to be charged for use of snorkel gear?) and "lei greeting" aside, this hotel might just as well be located in Palm Desert, Beverly Hills or Scottsdale. We have stayed in Four Seasons hotels all over the world, and this one is a stinker. Two hours after checking in, we arranged to check out and fly home early instead -- and this was even before we knew the hotel would agree to refund the $1045/night we prepaid for our executive suite -- we were that heartbroken that we'd checked out of the Hotel Hana Maui (HHM) that morning in favor of finishing our trip at the awful Four Seasons Wailea. Where the HHM was uniquely Hawaiian, understated, naturally beautiful, relaxing, and really something special, Wailea itself is not at all scenic (basically a giant parking lot in the middle of a desert-like landscape), and the Four Seasons was windy, overcrowded (shoulder-to-shoulder at the beach and the pool), cookie-cutter, and filled with obnoxious guests yelling (over the gusty, sand-blowing wind) into their cellphones and checking their Blackberries. As I mentioned a few sentences back, the hotel did agree to refund the $2000+ we prepaid for two nights (booked thru the hotel website), and offered us use of the room anyway until we left for the airport -- this was the only thing we liked about it!

Reviews.Title: “Rigourous Dedication to Guest Service!”
Reviews.Author: guerillatraveler75
Reviews.Content: Of all 5 star properties around the world, The Four Seasons at Wailea stays a cut above for good reason. The quality of the guest service is simply beyond outstanding. From the minute you walk in, you are greeted and pampered by staff that look like they are paid well, clearly love their jobs, and have a genuine desire to see that guests are happy at all times. We did our wedding there, so we might be a bit biased. Nonetheless, we received several bottles of champagne, chocolate, free services, and house comps for our non-staying guests that were well beyond the requirements. The property itself is also impeccable- well manicured, with good views to the beach and a pretty impressive marble lobby/courtyard. This place is not cheap, but if you're willing to forget the pocketbook for a while, the Four Seasons is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Best holiday ever!”
Reviews.Author: geribeau
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Four Seasons Maui and we loved every minute of it! The service is out of this world and the food and drinks were amazing (but very pricey even when converting into GB Pounds). THe pool was great and the white, soft sand made it a very pleasant beach. We received a lovely bottle of champagne on arrival (but no room upgrade). We opted for a mountain view room as we wanted to save a bit of money. The room was very spacious and beautiful but be aware of the construction work on the other side of the road. This didn't bother us though... To sum up, I would really recommend this hotel for honeymooners who would like to splash out!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: kstraveler79
Reviews.Content: My new husband and stayed at the Four Seasons for part of our honeymoon from June 17-June 27. We were looking forward to a wonderful experience, and we were somewhat disappointed. Here are my opinions, both good and bad... Positive: My husband and I loved the interior of the room. We stayed in an executive suite and the room was very luxurious. As other reviewers have mentioned, the bathrooms were huge and the rooms were very clean. The staff was exceptionally friendly, especially the valet staff and the room service staff. We enjoyed, and took advantage of, the beachfront cabanas most every day we were there. The extras like that water, towels, fruit, etc. were great after a hot day on Maui! I still cannot believe those cabanas were free. However, I advise getting there by 9:00 am or earlier to get a good spot. Negative: The biggest negative we had, which nearly ruined our vacation, was that we were placed in a suite directly above the resort's loading dock! Every morning, starting at 6:00 am, you could hear the large trucks rumbling up, the "beep beep" as they reversed, and cargo being offloaded...it was impossible to sleep after that point. Also, there seems to be absolutely no soundproofing to these rooms. Finally, it was a "partial oceanview" but you had to crane your neck to see a bit of the ocean. Now I know they get a lot of honeymooners, but why would you put them in a suite above a loading dock???? I complained several times, only to be told "our hotel is full, we will call you if anything opens up". They finally called us to let us know we could downgrade to a regular room. I explained we had pre-paid this vacation through a tour company. Finally, the woman at the front desk (who was very nice) went back to the GM (who wouldn't even come out to talk with us) and let us know he would give us a food and beverage credit for the stay. I did appreciate this, and that kept us from giving the hotel a one star. It just upsets me that I ended up being exhausted most of the time I was there. My only other complaint was the food. Don't get me wrong, the quality was wonderful, but there were only three main restaurants on property. I agree with another reviewer; it would have been nice to have a beach bar with hotdogs, or sandwiches, etc. They did have a menu you could order from, if you were sitting at the pool, but it was limited, and expensive. After we left the Four Seasons, we stayed for four nights at the Hyatt on Kauai. I have to say that was one of the most wonderful hotels we have ever stayed at. It was gorgeous. No, the rooms weren't as nice, but the variety of food (and food prices), the spectacular grounds, the number and size of pools, and the number of restaurants made us regret we stayed at the Four Seasons for so long. I know I am one of the only ones on this board to give the Four Seasons a mixed review, but this is my honest opinion!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: NoWareMan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Four Seasons a few years ago so this review is a bit tardy. The Four Season on Maui is what one would expect out of a Four Seasons. Superb, friendly and helpful staff. Graciously appointed and clean rooms. The grounds were well maintained, and the on site restaurants were above average. We ate at DUO? every morning and the buffet was impressive...made to order omelets, pancakes, waffles, etc. I highly recommend Ferraro's for dinner, and at most for drinks, olives, and nuts at the bar. The private cabanas down towards the beach provided a real sense of privacy along with regular, but not too regular, service for drinks and food. If I had to list one drawback it would be the distance from the rooms to the beach. It's a decent walk, but when walking through the Four Seasons interior and grounds who cares? Oh yeah, all the Wailea golf courses are about a 5 minute drive away as well as the Wailea shops. Enjoy....

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL in Waliea”
Reviews.Author: brichick
Reviews.Content: This hotel does everything right from the rooms, services, staff and restaurants!! We stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon and couldn't have asked for a better experience. The rooms were cleaned twice a day and the bathroom was amazing. The pool area is very clean where staff comes to set up your chairs for you and are always around to provide you drinks, etc.. The conceirge desk was the friendliest most helpful we have ever come across. The gym area is top notch where they provide you with complimentary fruit, gaterode and water and also allow you to use their spa locker room and suana as well at NO extra cost. We stayed in Hawaii for a total of two weeks and the BEST place we ate at was Spago at this hotel.....expensive but well worth every penny as the food and service is amazing!! While staying here we ventured over to the Grand Waliea which is right next door....this place is kid central and wasn't nearly as appealing as the Four Seasons; even though there were kids at the Four Seasons it didn't feel like romper room like it did while we were having lunch pool side at the Grand Wilea! If I could give this hotel 6 stars I would...splurge on this hotel and you won't regret it I promise!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: lisapico
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a five night stay and absolutely loved the service that the FS provides. The rooms are beautiful, staff delightful. When we checked in there was a basket of fruit and chocolates for us and underwater cameras, picture frames and necklaces for the girls. Loved the twice a day maid service too. The staff at the beach and pool were stellar even when treated poorly by some of the guests. I was appalled by what I saw at the beach and the staff handled it without blinking an eye. After witnessing this we went out of our way to tip immediately upon arrival as they were setting up our chairs. A note to travellers, be prepared to tip at least $30/day for maid service, chair set up, and valet. It adds up quickly. Duo restaurant - one okay meal one absolutely delicioius meal. Did not eat at Spago but heard from some of the guests that the food was great. Buffet breakfast was good but pricey. Since we're not big breakfast eaters we were satisfied with a cup of coffee and some fruit. That being said, if you do like a big breakfast then you can't go wrong with their buffet as it had everything. Front desk staff and concierge were top notch - friendly, knowledgeable and always glad to see you. We left feeling refreshed and rested. Five days was just the right amount of time for us and we're going back in January.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: JJJTC
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel- my husband and I stayed here as a treat after wedding festivities all week for our daughter. The service was great-everyone was friendly and offering any extras you would want. The water at the beach was really clear-you can use their snorkel equipment free for one hour if you don't have your own. We had a mountain view room that was just remodeled. I was worried it would be a parking lot view too, but it wasn't. I also went to the spa for a massage which was so relaxing. Highly recommend getting some kind of service there. This was the best way to end our busy week.

Reviews.Title: “Only one negative”
Reviews.Author: SeattleD_7
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a six day stay at this property, and the only negative we experienced was some jack hammering during the day. If you wanted to sit out on your patio during this time, be prepared. Other than that, the service we experienced was impeccable. From the concierge, pool staff, front desk, the fitness room attendants, cocktail/restaurant servers, to the fitness instructors. #1. We had room service several times during our stay, from a piece of cake for dessert, to late breakfast, dinner. All delicious. We enjoyed a few spinning classes, urban rebounding, Pilates, yoga on the beach, Core on the ball, weight room as well as using the elliptical and treadmills in the garden area. We also booked personal training time with Catharine who was excellent. I highly recommend her spinning class. Our room was on the 4th floor, the only issue in the room was a stain on the carpet. Other than that, the room was perfect. Twice daily maid service, anything you need during those times is delivered or taken care of promptly. We especially enjoyed Mama's Fish House for lunch which was about a 40 min drive. Took a cooking class from the owner of Joe's/Haliimale General Store which was great. Had dinner at Joe's, lunch at the General Store. The rest of the time various meals at the Four Seasons. Make sure to try the outrigger canoeing (free) as well as the snorkeling (free first hour). We did some spa time at Grand Wailea spa (facial/massage both excellent) and next time we'll try the spa at FS.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and Incredibly Kid Friendly”
Reviews.Author: FredOhio
Reviews.Content: We just finished a week's stay at the Four Seasons Maui, and this hotel definitely lives up to the hype. We had heard that the Four Seasons was kid friendly, but were nevertheless overwhelmed by just how much that was the case. In the end, perhaps more than anything, because the resort made our son feel so welcome, we could relax and truly enjoy our vacation as a family. Our son is 21 months old and too young to take advantage of the main "Kids for All Seasons" program (ages 5-12), but don't let that discourage you from bringing your toddlers. As we were escorted to our room, the housekeeping staff was already greeting our son by name before we'd even met them. The room was fully kid-proofed--including protective netting on the railing of our lanai--and also stocked with milk, cookies, and bath toys (including our son's name spelled out in colorful sponge letters on top of the tub). The Kids for All Seasons room has plenty of toys for toddlers, including a play kitchen, basic puzzles, a Little Tikes-like slide, and doodlers. You can check out the toys and books to your room if you'd like. For older kids, there's a rock climbing wall, air hockey, and a basketball hoop. There's also an incredible video game room in the general recreation area with at least eight large TVs dedicated to video game play. Moreover, all the restaurants, including Spago, have kids menus. And while you'll spend a great deal on food when eating at the resort (a piece of salmon from the room service menu costs $35, with side dishes an additional charge), the kids prices are very reasonable (for example, I think a generous serving of chicken fingers and fries cost $6). I'm not sure how the other rooms are arranged, but we stayed in a "partial ocean view" suite on the north side of the property. The suit had a good ocean view from the balcony, but not much of an ocean view from the room itself. We did not hear any room construction noise, but we did hear construction noise from beyond the property, where a large development of some kind is being built across the road. I assumed that a courtyard view room would have been quieter, but that may not be the case based on what I'm seeing from other reviews. That said, the noise we heard was not that distracting--just a little bit bothersome at times. The suite has two bathrooms. One off the bedroom, which is huge. And another off the marble entryway, which is also spacious, but has only a shower and no tub. The suite has doors to the bedroom so the bedroom can be closed off, but we still put our son's crib in the master bath (it fits easily) so we could have full access to the bedroom while he was sleeping. The crib does not seem to fit through the the smaller bathroom's doors, but you might want to check with housekeeping to see if it can be assembled inside the smaller bath so that you can have full access to the master bath. I'll leave the more adult-oriented details to other reviewers, but it is worth emphasizing just how exceptional the staff is. They could not be any more friendly or helpful, and all of them go out of their way to welcome your children. The hotel also provides quite an array of complimentary activities. There are several yoga classes, exercise classes, snorkeling, and outrigger canoeing. The outrigger canoe class is quite enjoyable and allows you to see some marine life as well. Overall, we had a terrific experience at the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: slynnro
Reviews.Content: Ignore the negative reviews- I would hate to meet the people that write them, as they are likely impossible to please. My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon in October, which was during the construction period at the hotel. You would have never known there was any construction going on. Initially, we were given a room that was very far from the working elevator bank. The hotel provided us with a $50/day resort credit. The walk was very far and we asked for another room, which we were given the next morning. In fact, we were upgraded from partial ocean view to prime ocean view without making a request. Everything about this hotel is absolutely top notch. We ate on property for almost every meal (we did have dinner at Longhi's, which I highly recommend), or we had room service. The room service presentations were impeccable- your meal comes with flowers and a large basket of bread (no matter what you order) and your meal is presented to you wherever you would like. The service is attentive without being overbearing. I highly recommend Ferraro's for lunch- the soft pretzels they serve prior to the meal are delicious, and you cannot beat the setting. We also had dinner at Spago, Ferraro's and the Pacific Grill. Surprisingly, my favorite meal was at Pacific Grill, which looks like a fairly cheesy hotel restaurant, but the food and service were excellent. The breakfast buffet, however, leaves something to be desired. The food was cold and it was kind of dirty, though I suspect this is because we ate there towards the end of the breakfast rush. The staff at the hotel simply will not let you do anything for yourself. When you are at the pool, they bring you water and food (free of charge) constantly, if you go to the beach, they offer to set up all of your stuff for you. I also made a few trips to the impeccable spa. It was wonderful. I also highly recommend taking a day trip to Lanai with Trilogy. As far as people complaining about the prices of things- HELLO! IT IS THE FOUR SEASONS! Everything is going to be expensive. You have to pay a high price for this kind of service. If it is not worth it to you to pay $20 for a sandwich to be treated like a queen (or king as the case may be) perhaps you should choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best on Maui”
Reviews.Author: CraigDallas
Reviews.Content: Nice room, very comfortable. Flower or Tea Lea upon arrival. The feeling is very laid back. There are pool tables and kids areas on the ground floor. Room service was excellent. The concierge arranged windsurfing lessons on short notice. I'd definitely stay here again. I had them show me different types of rooms for my next stay, and some of them were oddly laid out, so ask. My room was very normal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spa Treatment”
Reviews.Author: bpert
Reviews.Content: A GREAT spa treatment is the Cranio Sacral massage. You go early in the morning and they take you out into the calm ocean and do the treatment there. It is peaceful, relaxing and so cool to be in the water! i loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon Destination”
Reviews.Author: charlesmith
Reviews.Content: There is nothing else but to say that this has got to be the best in class on Maui. Though I have not stayed at any others in the top tier, we just returned from the last half of our honeymoon in Hawaii that we spent at this FS and the service, rooms, amenities, food / dining etc... were all outstanding. The renovations are still underway and are on schedule or so it appears. We had to put up with some jack hammering everyday, they were repairing what I think they call their reflecting pools. The major work should be done with the hammers this week and that will be that. Also the final rooms under renovation should be complete by months end. I hope to get a FULL trip review in sometime soon. Yes, it was our honeymoon and we went all out so for the budget minded travelers this is not for you, those wanting a fantastic honeymoon spot or can afford the FS on a regular basis, I will live in envy of your next trip! C Smith

Reviews.Title: “What's not to love?”
Reviews.Author: kab1234
Reviews.Content: UNBELIEVABLE! this is the place to be pampered! We asked for a room on the inside (not over the driveway) and it was gorgeous! There is maid service twice a day so your room is always clean (I'm a little bit of a neat freak so to me this was great:) At night they leave soft Hawaiin music playing and dim the lights so you come home and it's so romantic. The service is perfect - the staff is friendly and helpful and you don't get the feeling they are always looking for tips. Wolfgang Puck's Spago is amazing!!! This was our favorite meal we had (out of many many delicious meals). We made a sunset reservation for a front row table and it was great. Also, we booked a couples massage in their beach side huts - it was sooo relaxing! However, I would book later in the day (maybe 4-5:00) because it's a little noisy during mid-day since there are more people on the beach and stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: triptakerSanDiego
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Maui is and has been under renovation. One wing of the hotel is closed for complete room and hallway renovations. There is internal wall reconstruction noise if you stay in an adjoining room. The week of the 15-18 of May or even longer if rennovations are not complete consists of jack hammering and refurbishing reflecting pools and water features. If you are into intensive constuction noise and I mean intensive with jack hammering then do not book a room facing the inner courtyard. All the constuction noise reflects up and into the rooms. The Manager told me that the final stages of the hotel refurbishment will continue on until September. If you want to stay at a resort that costs a fortune and put up with the noice, more power to you. The Hotel is lovely although not in any sense an authentic Hawaiian experience. It is an 8 story concrete and glass hotel with beautiful grounds overlooking the ocean. The food at the hotel is extremely expensive even by Hawaii hotel standards. While the food is excellent, you certainly know that the food and bar are the profit centers for the hotel. Yes, expect outstanding Four Seasons pampering and attention to detail BUT BEWARE of the construction. We came home early from our vacation rather than put up with the dust, noise and mess. For over $800 dollars a night for an oceanview room, home seemed a better alternative.

Reviews.Title: “The Absolute Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: am1Lafayette
Reviews.Content: Look no further, this is the absolute best hotel in Maui. The service at the Four Seasons is exceptional. Every employee knows your name and will go out of there way to make your stay comfortable. The rooms apply all of the high standards you'd expect and are equipped with 42" plasmas. All restaurants are outstanding. It is worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Easter Week at FS”
Reviews.Author: rocknty
Reviews.Content: My wife and our 7yo son spent 4 nights at the Four Seasons hotel this spring during Easter week. Here are our comments: Check In: Private check in was on the club level. Mention your name to the car folks and they instantly know you full name and escort you upstairs to the Concierge Club. Hostesses greeted us there and worked with us to get the right room (see below) and the club is gorgeous. Room: It exceeded all of our expectations. One should be aware that the non-suite rooms are further back on the U shaped floor than the suites which take all the front facing space. As well the concierge club is pretty far forward and takes up several rooms worth of space alone. We asked to see several rooms before deciding to go with the south side of the hotel (opposite the central courtyard) as the views of the ocean were much better. The room itself was large, bathroom enormous and the lanai was roomy (just a few rooms have a large lanai).The rooms have all been recently remodeled and are fabulous in every way with flat screen and very comfortable bedding. Room Service: Whatever we wanted whenever we wanted it was provided instantly and with a smile. Food was awesome and hot. Towels, Robes, Dry cleaning, Shoe shining were all handled with ease. Club Level: As mentioned our hostesses were fantastic. The food was provided at several intervals during the day. The food was amazing: highlights included: crab legs, sushi, rare roast beef sandwiches, crab cakes, shrimp, amazing cheese and fruit. Full bar at no cost, water in bottles, soda. Cocktail hour was awesome with the view from the club on the 8th floor. Desert and after dinner drinks (cognac, etc) were flowing. There was nothing the hostesses couldnâ€™t do. My son was always treated like a king and with great kindness. We had a party in our room at one point and they brought a steady supply of items to keep it going. Wow is all I can say about them. They rock. Hotel Property: A complete renovation has been completed and this hotel sparkles. Wow. Hotel Pool: What a scene this is! The first thing you should know about this hotel is the pool scene is intimate and outrageous. The first decision you need to make every morning is where youâ€™re going to sit. By the pool proper and join in social scene, or close by on bluff overlooking the sea or on a secluded in a hillside dugout with day beads. The reason you need to make this decision is all the good spots are gone by 8am. The good news is that if you live on the mainland youâ€™re up early anyway. There are rules: You canâ€™t leave your seats for more than 20 min or loose them, except between 11am 2pm when you can leave for lunch. However this wasnâ€™t really enforced strictly till later in the afternoon. The trick is to send someone down to get that seat at 730-ish to claim a spot, leave some stuff on your chair and then head to breakfast and watch your chair from DUO. After breakfast the rest of the crew comes down you then switch off and go work out. Its not all skin, we are talking a great combination of normal folks like me, killer hard bodies and their kids. The adults near the pool seem to groove into a giant cocktail party where everybody knows each other after a few days. All the while be waited hand and foot by an army of attendants who bring you drinks ($), food($), spray you with evian (free), ice cream(free), fruit sticks(free) and dry towels. This is the only pool with twice daily snack food buffet for free. We noticed several people had â€˜cabana nanniesâ€™ as they are called to get the primo seats. Out pool experience was resplendent with star power â€“ rocker Tommy Lee and Pamela Anderson paraded around with their kids. Apparently itâ€™s the norm here, so that made it extra fun and our stars couldnâ€™t have be nicer and more accessible. Hotel Beach: Beach boy service in small cove thatâ€™s got very gentle waves. Kids can boogie board and snorkel. Very safe and very nice. Great path to walk on past other thatâ€™s a must do. Game Room: Nice pool table, foosball and TV room where kids hang out adjacent to a massive array of Playstaions systems. My son was in heaven. The hotel was small enough and secure enough that we had no problem letting him bop from pool to the game room by himself. He soon met up with other kids his age and had a blast. In a bigger resort I would never be comfortable with this but here with the security and all it was no problem. Restaurants: FERRARO'S was our favorite the classic northern Italian restaurant was a dream. Oceanside seats must be requested. Just tell them you will wait at the bar until they free up. A guitarist and cello player provide amazing music thatâ€™s amplified and discretely projected from hidden speakers in the shrubbery. Romantic with an R. Wine list isnâ€™t outrageous, especially the whites. Also this is great for lunch. Spago has the best view and the coolest interior and the food was goodbut not great. DUO is the lower level steak and seafood restaurant also good but not as special as its feels like 'the hotel deafult restaurant' because it is, as you eat breakfast there evry day. Gym and Spa: Bikes and joggers are outside under fans which is really nice. Inside is free weights and machines. Again a small area but enough equipment. Classes for yoga on the beach which my wife did that every day and loved. You get free access to the steam and showers which is great. The spa treatments were fabulous and the facility while small is very nice. If you want a mega spa go next door to the Grand Wailea. Kids Club: We used the Kids for All Seasons once during our stay. The days and hours were very limited.They did a nice job with the kids however. Things we would like to see: Kids club needs to be open more evenings during peak holidays and longer hours. There is no place to go at night but the lobby bar which is just ok. They need something open on Fri and Sat besides the lobby acts which frankly put me to sleep. We notcied a killer lounge area inside Spagos that could have DJ but it was unused. Many people expressed the same concerns to me. Where is the rock and roll at FSM? We guests can t all hang out in Tommy Lees room. Without any question the FSM is truly a Five Diamond. It is not a mega-resort with a theme pool but instead a luxurious exclusive boutique resort. Cost wise itâ€™s very expensive but you get a lot for your moneyâ€¦just be prepared to spend double what you plan. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Service”
Reviews.Author: ckobran
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the FS Wailea for 5 nights in early April. The weather was perfect, the room was fantastic, and the food was great as well. We had booked a std mtn view room but were upgraded to a partial ocean view room with direct garden access. being our honeymoon, the staff, who ere very friendly, had provided a nice bottle of champagne for us upon arrival. The pool and beach were great. it was the week before Easter so it was kind of crowded, but never annoyingly so. We hung out in the hot tub with the Guvanator (Arnold) and saw some other celebs (which the wife loved). We ate at Spago on the first night and had a surprisingly mediocre meal. Mt wife's chicken dish was served cold. They took the item off our bill with no questions and provided us wit ha free desert..but still a surprise for Spago. The new steakhouse - DUO - was very good! The rib eye I had was out of this world, and the souffle after dinner was splendid. There was some construction going on some mornings that woke us up, we called down and it stopped. Another day we came back for an afternoon nap, and it started again, we called again, and this time they just comp'd us a night ... they were very apologetic, and made sure we felt like they cared

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort By Far On Maui”
Reviews.Author: grahamcrackerBend
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 25th Wedding Anniversary at The Four Seasons April 20-25th and loved every minute of our relaxing stay. The room was great, the beach exceeded our expecations, the open air lounge and lounge entertainment exceeded our expectations. The newly renovated room was refreshingly clean and has a flat screen television as well an Ihome clock radio that allows you to use your IPOD for playing your own music. The giant bathroom has it's own sound system with a selection of music channels. Being able to play our own music choices while sitting on the balcony enjoying a glass of wine as a treat. We especially enjoyed the variety of options for sitting at the pool or on the beach without paying "extra" for an umbrella or cabana such as the neighboring Grand Wailea charges. The pool and beach staff were very attentive and made this an exceptional vacation for us. The mojito cocktails were superb. We spent our last night on the island at The Grand Wailea next door just to see what that hotel resort was like. While the room cost was less - the resort wasn't nearly as clean as we would have liked. We were also very disappointed to learn that the equivalent cabana arrangement to the Four Seasons cost $200 a day at the Grand Wailea - the Four Seasons doesn't have this tacky unexpected add on. There were also far too many birds landing on chairs in the bar and dining area at the Grand Wailea. Last but not least, The Four Seasons environment was subdued, relaxing, clean, with professional staff and fewer groups or kids than the neighboring resort. It was a treat for us to experience and we will return to The Four Seasons at Wailea!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: wmozart5
Reviews.Content: Well, what can one say? It's pretty much everything you could expect from a luxury resort...you're waited on hand and foot and pretty much treated like nobility (if not quite royalty). This can be good and bad depending on your personality (DIY types may feel bothered), but it is what you expect from such a hotel, and you can be sure it's what you get. We were upgraded to a suite at no charge, and although it was on the outer (northeast) side of the resort and thus did not have a great view off the terrace, the suite was large and lavish (esp. the bathroom). A room facing the inner courtyard would be preferable for viewing purposes, but it's hard to knock a suite. The poolside and beachside service is impeccable...lay back and allow the offerings of water, fruit, etc. come to you. The only downer, albeit very minor, is that the parking situation at the time was such that you could not park your own vehicle. This meant $10/day plus tips for the valets, and having to walk all the way to the farthest side of the building to get to our room. Whereas it was clear that the parking layout could have allowed us to park very close had we only had the option. After several days, it became kind of cumbersome to leave the resort. Still, an experience that is worth having, and a very classy place indeed. Prices are high, yes, but you can be sure that you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute PARADISE”
Reviews.Author: jaidakiss
Reviews.Content: We loved to read these reviews before our trip so I feel I have an obligation to write one for all of you planning a trip to 4S maui!!! The place is MAGNIFICENT-- the grounds are amazing-- we stayed club level prime ocean view suite for our wedding/honeymoon for ten days then traveled to costa rica for 7 days following!!! MAUI was my favorite. The island is so full of life, and you gotta love that it is americanized!!! Club level was great-but have to say the only reason is that you are on the top level and we had an amazing view!! Looks as if the lower levels don't have the view.......We really disliked the food at the hotel (DUO,SPAGO,FERRAROs)so we found ourselves leaving the place alot. I mean the food is not HORRIBLE but we were on vacation ,,,and it was far from GREAT!!! I suggest Longhi's at the wailea shops good breakfast lunch and dinner, and waterfront was amazing tooo... lots of GREAT food away from 4s.
