But the place really is amazing-- the pool and beach are great they really pamper you, we never had trouble finding a place. Look for Mercedes she was the best!!! And pick the valet (jason) brain before touristy trips, we found them MUCH help!!! The gym was being set up our second day-- so I do have to say WE LOVED IT, I think that we were the very first people to use it!! We workout 4 times a week at home so we LOVED the fact that they had PLENTY of free weights and equiptment for everyone!! So much we did in our ten days, and I am soooooo missing it there. If you can handle being pampered(and paying for it) THIS IS THE PERFECT PLACE.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth?”
Reviews.Author: VJWIndy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from five wonderful days at the FS. The management of this property clearly is doing something right. The staff tirelessly strives to anticipate and exceed the guests' needs and expectations. The pool area is beautiful and the service staff makes an enjoyable venue almost heavenly with prompt service, great food, refreshing cold towels, tasty pineapple, and excellent drinks. The rooms are large and bathrooms even more spacious. The bed and bedding was very comfortable. The large plasma tv was very nice. The in-bathroom music with genre selector was luxurious. The tennis courts are complimentary for one hour each day, including ball machine. The weight room is sufficiently sized and equipped. The spa treatments and facilities are first rate. The concierge is very helpful and valet parking was prompt. We've stayed at some very nice resorts, bu this was the best to date. The Princeville in Kauai may enjoy a better natural setting, but its facility and staff are inferior to the FS at Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Another fabulous visit”
Reviews.Author: A36traveler
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th visit to the FS, Maui and it just gets better and better. We stay on the club level which is expensive, but has the most wonderful service with a friendly, enthusiastic and knowledgable staff. The hotel renovations were nearly all completed during our stay, and although we didn't think it was that bad before, it is even better now. The only downside to the FS on Maui is the main swimming pool which is obstructed by a huge fountain in the center. This takes up a lot of space which could be better suited to actual swimming. Also, it would be nice to see better enforcement of maintaining a separation between the kiddie pool and adult pool. There were often toddlers and babies in the adult pool which we folks without children did not appreciate.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort - careful selecting a room category”
Reviews.Author: JtravelerDallas
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice in early 2007. Best resort on Maui if price is not an object. I'm convinced Wailea Beach is the best location on the island for a beach stay. Four Seasons and Grand Wailea share this excellent beach. This entire area is master planned as an upscale community, lovingly maintained, and central to most of Maui. As a result this area doesn't seem nearly as crowded as the other main resort areas. On the flip side the town of Kihei is just 5 minutes up the road when you want to escape the master planned atmosphere and wander around kitschy shops, funky restaruants or find a fast food place or grocery store. If you are a sun lover the pool areas/cabanas/beach facilities are amazing. Four Seasons service is outstanding. Rooms are large and all have balconies. The only tough decision is choosing a room category. Because of the design of the buildings, only a few very expensive suites on the ends of the two wings have direct beach views. Everything else is an angled view across the beautiful courtyard and pool areas with a glimpse of the ocean. Unless you are on floor 5 or higher you won't even see much ocean. In my opinion, only the ocean view prime category has a view worth paying for. If you don't want to spring for these $800-900 rooms, I would seriously consider booking the cheapest room in the place and simply spending your time lounging in the many beautiful common areas with chairs and tables, or by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: DCbeachgirl
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is amazing from the staff to the food to the view to the pool to the spa!!! I can go on and on but I assure you, you won't be disappointed. We spent two and a half weeks traveling through all of Hawaii and this hotel was one of our favorites. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing - Best Place to Stay in Maui”
Reviews.Author: blsandler
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the FS in Maui (my third time there) and felt compelled to write a glowing review. This hotel is amazing and cannot be beat by any other on the island. While the Grand Wailea and Fairmont are nice, both are massive and impersonal. The FS, on the other hand, is intimiate and more luxurious -- truly awesome. The lobby and pool are gorgeous, and exercising in the outdoor gym, while overlooking the Pacific, is incredible. The rooms are well-appointed, each with large plasma televisions, ipod players and dvd players that read from our camera memory chip to play photographs that we recently took. We found the food to be amazing (the waffles were incredible - great breakfast buffet) and everyone was attentive and helpful. Spago is very pricey dinner option, but Duo is a nice, new alternative that is about 15% less in price. We loved that you did not have to rent cabanas (first come, first serve) and that the staff came by frequently with fresh water, frozen grapes, cold towels and otter pops. Internet access in the business center and the adult game room make connecting with home very easy and convenient. It was an amazing trip - we will continue to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort - but choose your room category carefully”
Reviews.Author: BlueSkiesPlease
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 7 nights here on our honeymoon and had a lovely time. The hotel location, atmosphere, grounds, beach, rooms, and service are near-perfect. We are very picky, unashamed "hotel snobs" and we still loved this hotel. Don't worry at all about the ongoing renovations - they are being performed in a completely inobtrusive manner. You are NOT booking into a noisy, dirty construction zone! Wailea is definitely the best area to stay in Maui for an upscale resort experience, and the Four Seasons seems to be the best choice among the upscale Wailea resorts. Both the Grand Wailea and the Fairmont Kea Lani are much bigger and have some buildings a long way from the beach and restaurants. The Four Seasons and Grand Wailea share the best beach in the area. The only thing to be VERY careful about is your room category. We initially booked an "Ocean View Deluxe" room. Seems reasonable to expect a good ocean view, right? Sadly no - just a distant view of the ocean over the entrance driveway and trees - not even a glimpse of the actual beach. For anything like what you are expecting, the key word is "prime" - as in "Ocean View Prime". Even this doesn't mean a full front-on ocean view, but you should get to see the ocean and a bit of the beach over the nicely landscaped hotel courtyard. Don't even think about booking "Garden View" or "Partial Ocean View" - better to save your money and stay home. Don't expect that you'll get upgraded because you are on your honeymoon or wedding anniversary - almost everyone in the hotel is on their honeymoon or wedding anniversary. So they will congratulate you, give you a nice bottle of bubbly wine, and leave you in the room category that you booked. The rooms themselves are very large and very well appointed, with big comfortable beds and very large marble bathrooms. There is absolutely no reason for a couple to book a suite in this hotel. We upgraded to a suite to get a better ocean view and never made any use of the extra room. In summary, if you choose at least an "Ocean View Prime" room and you are mentally prepared for the cost of the stay, you'll have a fabulous time at the Four Seasons Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Expectations”
Reviews.Author: khaug1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a prime ocean-view executive suite for 10 days in late Feb - early March '07. On the breakfast plan, we paid $1290/night. It needs to be said up front that the Four Seasons Wailea is a large facility that is set well back from the beach. Our 6th floor 'ocean view prime' suite was probably 250 yards from the water, and even the 'oceanfront' rooms aren't much closer. That said, our view was spectacular, looking out across Maalaea bay to the west lobe of Maui. Our balcony was spacious, and we could watch whales cavorting in the bay most afternoons. Bring your binoculars! You may be aware that the 4S Wailea is currently renovating, and it appeared that 20-30% of the rooms were being upgraded while we were there. At no time was this any sort of problem or concern for us; the most obtrusive sign of the work was a very occasional, distant whine of a power tool. Probably as a result, the resort appeared very empty, and we never saw more than 50% occupancy of the poolside cabanas or the beach umbrellas. We watched the grounds staff work with warm amusement; they are clearly on 'Hawaii time". We arrived late in the evening and were greeted by name by the staff (a practice that was to continue for our entire stay). Check-in was immediate, and we were upgraded to the next larger suite. We were both given a lei, and bell staff escorted us to our rooms, which contained a bottle of champagne in honor of our (belated) 42nd anniversary. The suite we'd reserved had been renovated, and the suite we were upgraded to had not, so we requested a move to the original suite after the first night and were accommodated without any discussion. The un-renovated suite was vast, but showed signs of wear (minor paint damage on furniture, minor wear on carpet, elderly TV sets, etc). I have to say that the un-renovated suite was NOT shabby, and we would have been content to stay there if the renovated suite we reserved had not been available. The 4S houskeeping standards are very high indeed, and remained so during our stay. The suite we ended up in was spacious, all new and comfortable to a fault. There were two (!) 42" plasma HD TV sets, and more HD channels than we have on our home satellite service, as well as a DVD player, several DVDs in the room and a reasonable library of loaner DVDs available from the concierge. The room included a fruit plate which was refreshed or replaced every morning. Our bottles of water were replaced once per day, and a "towel visit" from housekeeping occurred each afternoon to tidy up and replace any towels we may have used. Turndown service was offered every night, and was a bit odd in that the maid invariably turned on the bedroom TV set and cranked the ceiling fan up to max, as well as turning down the linen. We quickly learned to leave the "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door when we went to supper. Breakfasts were excellent, with many well-prepared choices on the buffet, including custom-made waffles, French toast and omlettes. We signed a check for $66.00 each morning, but were charged less than half that on our B&B plan. The breakfast restaurant was right on the edge of the beach with spectacular views. Donna, the breakfast hoistess, learned our name after our first visit and used it for the rest of our stay! We ate at Spagos restaurant one night, and felt the food was good, but not a great value. We ended up eating most of our dinners at reataurants in The Shops of Wailea, just up the road from 4S. Ruth's Chris Steakhouse and Tommy Bahamas were our favorites, although not notably less expensive than Spagos at the resort. I have to say at this point that the staff at 4S was beyond all expectations. Every staff person we met was warmly friendly, and most greeted us by name. We experienced several minor physical plant problems (A/C stuck on, toilets clogged and leaking), and in each instance they were dealt with within the hour. The bell staff always had our car within 5 minutes of request, always asked if we needed directions and always were the soul of warm courtesy. The concierge was always warmly helpful, providing us with maps, directions and advice for the trips we took. This was our first experience with Four Seasons. We aren't wealthy, and the fact that we were here at all reflected years of savings. Would we do it again? Was it a good value? So much was well beyond our expectations that I'd say we certainly would like to return. As to 'value', it's hard to imagine anything surpassing this experience, price notwithstanding! I feel we got our moneys worth, and more!

Reviews.Title: “Very Beautiful Hotel - A Bit Crowded”
Reviews.Author: Taipei-JMS
Reviews.Content: if you go to maui, there is only one hotel to stay at and it's the four seasons. Despite one of the wings being closed for renovation, i found the beach area to be quite crowded. if you get to the pool after 11, the best cabanas and chairs are all taken. i love the complimentary sunblock that they provide! Service was first class, the pool staff were very helpful and took pride in making sure their guests in their section were happy. My only gripe is that I felt the pool area was quite crowded. Beach is very nice, but you expect that in Maui. Overall a very relaxing and enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “It's the Four Seasons for a reason!”
Reviews.Author: lovemypup
Reviews.Content: It's always so interesting to read what other people have to say about a place where you have stayed too. I recently returned from the 4S Wailea. . .and it is, truly, spectacular. Last year I stayed at the 4S Hualalai (Big Island), and people warned me if I liked that one, I would find this one quite ostentatious. I am happy to find myself flexible enough to truly enjoy both experiences! The Big Island is definitely more understated and laid back, but this hotel does have a quiet elegance about it that is special. I say this having gone for a spa appt at the Renaissance Hotel, which is another big, fancy hotel. But there is something about the 4S. . .something intangible that really makes a difference there. Now, to my stay: I stayed on the Club Level. A truly spectacular experience. The rooms are gorgeous. The views are breathtaking. You don't have to lift a finger for anything. The food presentations are delicious, and constant. Drinks are great. Whatever you want, they will get for you. The concierge staff is phenomenal--especially Margaret, who is simply delightful. I will say that staying at the hotel when 1/3 of the rooms are under renovation is kind of nice since there was NEVER a problem getting a seat at the pool, beach, etc. However, I did not have the same exceptional pool service that others wrote about on this site. I even asked if they had any fruit at the towel table and was told (a bit abruptly) that she had "just finished and won't do another one until 1:30)." Oh. And I never saw the infamous Evian spritzers. But, fortunately, that was the exception during my four days there. I was celebrating my 40th birthday and they delivered a beautiful dessert tray to my room, including a conch shell made out of chocolate and filled with brown sugar (to look like sand). It was amazing (and yummy!). I got a manicure at the salon, which was quite good. Pay the extra $10 for the enhanced manicure. . .it's worth it. I got a wonderful massage at the spa--the cocoa butter one, which they graciously changed around for me 4 times since I kept changing my plans. And I used the treadmills (which are open air--very nice idea to take advantage of the natural beauty) and the fitness room. . .a nice assortment of weight machines, free weights, etc. I ate at Ferraro's and Spago. Go early for Ferraro's so you can get a nice table for sunset. Spago continues to be very good, with none of the attitude you find in LA. All in all, a special treat for me. . .I only hope to be able to do it again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons..best hotel in Wailea”
Reviews.Author: calgary88
Reviews.Content: Having visited the island of Maui twice, have stayed at several hotels. The Fairmont Kea Lani for 10 days. the Grand Wailea for 4 days and Hyatt Kaanapali for 7 days. Staying at the Four Seasons was the best. Service From the moment you get out of your car, you are greeted by the valet, who kindly asked if I was checking in and what was the last name. Informed him and he immediately had the hostess greet us and take us directly to the front desk. Greeted as Mr. and Ms..... the entire conversation from valet, hostess, front reception, and bell man. Very professional, and respectful. felt like VIP right away. Room requests for highest floor and quiet location was met. Most hotels do not guarantee requests will be met however the 4S gave us our room exactly as requested, no hassle at all. Parking. Parking is Valet only, I believe it is $12 US/day, not expensive. Service was quick as they do not seem short staffed, even during peak times. Very friendly staff and polite, addressed us as Mr. and Mrs.. the whole time. if you are staying at another resort they have short term parking avaliable for those who chose to dine at the 4S. The mountain view rooms are next to the short term parking so if you book one of these rooms it may be noisy. Room We were greeted with a welcome gift, we did not mention any special occasion so I assume this is routine. The had left us hawaiiin sweets/pastries. Really special welcome. we booked a Parital Ocean View room. I guess if you were lucky you got the POV that allowed you to see the sunset from your balcony. But the hotel is a good size, so walking down to the lobby /beach is close. Very clean room, no dust, soft bed, tall ceiling > 9 ft which gave the room a grand feeling. Loved the bathroom, 2 large mirrors, 1 mirror over a separate vanity area, 1 mirror over the his/her sinks, separate tub and tile shower, l'occitane bath products... and plus built in speaker system with 6 channels of preset music ranging from classical, jazzz, hawaiian...really cool. bathrobes were soft. and even mirror on doors. Really easy to make a romantic night. Pool Not a large pool, there is a kids pool, pool service was excellent. you are constantly being offered cold ice water, cool towel , evian spritz, sometimes even fruit all complimentary. some cabanas are free and so get up early to reserve them. People seemed to love the poolside footmassage. Beach Wailea beach is one of the best beaches in Maui. sandy bottom no rocks on feet or shells or seaweed. Shallow water, some people were snorkeling on the beach, they did not see much but there are other places to snorkel around Wailea such as in Kihei or you can go to Moolokini for the day. You share the beach with the Grand Wailea but you are on one side of the beach. The beach service was excellent, again the moment you step onto the beach you are quickly greeted by the staff who will set up a chair and umbrella for you. greeted again by Mr. and Ms. the entire time. given ice water, fresh fruit often... Beach can be windy at times. If you get a chance take the beach walk along the wailea coast. beautiful walk and you can see molikini from the beach. Attractions nearby/Shopping Shops of Wailea are within walking distance along the beach. High end labels. but if you venture into Kihei, very short drive you will find markets and Safeway. Wailea is a high end shopping district so that is what to expect. Spa Tried it and loved there facilities, very clean, has all you need to change/shower if you have a late flight. Bottom line, loved the 4S all staff were respectable and professional. yes, it is a five star hotel but it lives up to its reputation. We paid the same price /night approx 500-600 US/night for the room as did in the Grand Wailea and the Hyatt but the Four Seasons was our favourite.

Reviews.Title: “high class hotel”
Reviews.Author: anellapia
Reviews.Content: My husband and i went to the four seasons for our honeymoon. The rooms are spacious but couldve been a bit more luxcurious like the rest of the hotel, the beds are very comfy, you get greeted by hawaiin music when entering the room! The food was okay! the only good food was breakfast, the prices are a bit expensive 6 dollars for a glass of orange juice??? the beach was nice and clean, the pool was great and the pool staff made you feel like a million dollars. At night time the hotel was slightly boring we just spent most of nights in room. But above all the hotel was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: suntop
Reviews.Content: We were delighted to stay at the Four Seasons Maui when our ferry ride to Lanai was cancelled. We finally made the trip to Lanai and were quite dismayed to find the rooms at that property smelled of mildew and mold (even the renovated rooms at Lanai). We are grateful we were able to go back to the Maui Four Seasons for a delightful, much needed relaxing few days. We wish we had reserved on Maui the many months before instead of Lanai, so we could have enjoyed a beautiful newly renovated room (and we would have saved the stress of renting a car twice and riding the ferry twice in very rough water). We enjoyed a lovely new room on our first night but they didn't have one when we moved back there the same day we ferried from Lanai. The older room was still a blessing compared to the Lanai rooms we were offered. The whole feeling of the Maui Four Seasons is awesome and relaxing. We loved the architecture, the staff, the service and the beach (especially the cabanas and the pooside service).The new rooms are beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “will return to 4 seasons Maui”
Reviews.Author: valentinew
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Four Seasons, Wailea for 10 days in January. Awoke each morning well rested because of the quiet and luscious pillows, mattress & bed linens. Then walked down to the beach for complementary sunrise yoga class. Followed by fabulous breakfast at Farraroâ€™s (overlooking the ocean). Took complementary outrigger canoe lessons twice. While out we were surrounded by whales. It was totally quiet except for the sound of whales frolicking. Took walks along the beach and swam in pool, read books in cabana, and had yoga class again in the afternoon. Spent one afternoon at the Spa, one of the best. We did not want to rent a car since we had been to Maui many times. Hotel provides complementary transportation within Wailea area. Had dinner at Capishe, Joeâ€™s Bar and Grill, Seawatch, Spagoâ€™s and Ferraroâ€™s. Ferraroâ€™s was our favorite. Service and food could not have been better. The violinist and guitarist played perfect music. Definitely will return.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good, but Service a little spotty”
Reviews.Author: nyc.tula_couple
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons on Maui was good. Property is very, very nice. Great pool, beach and food. We had a renovated room in north tower which was nice. We checked out late our last day and moved to a non-renovated room in south tower for the day â€“ room smelled, old furnishings, horrible access (have to go outside across terrace to reach tower). If we had gotten stuck in a non-renovated room in this tower for our entire trip, we wouldâ€™ve been very disappointed. I donâ€™t know if itâ€™s possible to avoid getting stuck in the south tower, but a phone call might be worth it. Restaurants are good, but be sure to make reservations otherwise you could end up waiting an hour or two (or being told to look elsewhere as we were one night). Several other restaurants nearby (we enjoyed Capiche at nearby Diamond Golf Resort) and very accessible either by foot or car. During our time we found the service to be very spotty (and at times, just rude), but of course your mileage may vary regarding that Most offsite activities are very accessible â€“ Lahaina (1 hour), Road to Hana (1.5 hours), Haleakala (1.5 hours) â€“ plenty of nearby beaches to be found. Shops at Wailea for in-room snacks and drinks is just a short 10 minute walk or Safeway is a 15 minute drive.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Maui Jan 29 - Feb 2nd, 2007”
Reviews.Author: 92103Traveler
Reviews.Content: Wow, this resort was one of the best experiences I've ever had while traveling. From the moment I checked in, I was impressed. Now, I travel often for both work and pleasure. The staff was amazing from the moment I checked in. Maui has a lot of hotels, it's clear that the Four Seasons only hires the best of the best, and probally pays more then the other hotels on the Island. My room had the most comfortable mattress (I'm a total snob when it comes to beds), down pillows, soft sheets, and if it wasn't for the time change, I would have slept the day away! The room had a very large bathroom with a soaking tub and seperate glass shower with marble tile. The room also had a large 50" Plazma TV which really nice to have. The grounds of the property are beautiful, with tons of areas to relax throughout the property. Unlike some of the hotels in Wailea, I didn't seem to see tons of loud kids running around. Yes, there were some kids but they seemed to be under control by parents that were good parents....I'm sure everyone knows what I mean by saying this. Sorry, I don't have kids and don't want to relax with loud screaming kids running arround like some of the hotels. My only complaint was that the coffee in the hotel rooms isn't that good and that drinks were a little on the pricy side. My martini was $18.00 at the casual restaurant that overlooks the ocean. However, it was worth paying the $$ to be at this beautiful hotel, with staff that really cared about making sure all my needs were being met.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CC-Toronto
Reviews.Content: ok listen people I'm a bit late with this review as we were in Maui for part of our honeymoon back in May (2006), but any newly married couple knows how it is... OMG can I just say that though I travel a lot, our trip to Hawaii was THE BEST trip I have ever taken in my life...and the Four Seasons in Maui helped a lot! Let's just say, within 1 hour of being there, we said we would have to come back. ok so maybe we were on a honeymoon high but it's approaching a year later and I still daydream about our Maui stay every other day... In all honesty, no hotel is perfect, and different people will always have different opinions and expriences even at the same hotel, but all I can say is that from our one experience (7 nights in May 06) this was the most incredible hotel EVer!! ok the place is GORGEOUS - just look at my photos - and the only thing casting a shadow on the facilities was the impeccable service! I've never had anyone wait on me hand and foot like at the Four Seasons. Honestly - I wasn't able to lift a finger. No one by the pool let anyone lay their own towel down or look around for more than 30 seconds before someone asked what you needed... and Evian sprays in the face, fresh cold fruit, FREEZIES (did you hear me? freezies!!), cold towels, smoothies, etc. all free by the pool as you soak in heavenly Hawaiian rays. Our original room was ok - corner - partial view of ocean...was fine but we wanted to see if we could score a full ocean view - so we simply asked nicely. And within an hour we were moved to a gorgeous ocean view room (see our view from photos) - didn't have to leave our terrace if we didn't want to. And DO order room service for breaky - OMG it was an amazing breakfast!! Esp while the sun came up... Great room service - fresh flowers, diligent replenshing, prompt response to any request... Coffee grinder and whole kona beans in room were cool... great coffee. Niiice bathroom. Clean facilities. Open concept workout area - refreshing. Pool was disappointingly small and shallow - not a lot of space. But who cares - go explore Maui!! We had SO much fun doing activities together - including renting snorkelling gear (so cheap - like $5 for couple days) and driving around finding our own spots. Driving into Lahaina for luau was fun too! Beachside highway...never enjoyed traffic so much! Conceirge and all staff are most helfpul and friendly. No stuck-up snobs among staff - warm and kind - the Aloha way. Excellent management of hotel. Very $$$$$. As soon as we can afford it again, we'll be back!! So far, best stay I've had at any hotel in the world...will continue to travel and let you know if I come across better! Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Maui !!! We'll be Back!!!”
Reviews.Author: chicagoland
Reviews.Content: My husband, our 10 month old daughter, and I stayed at the Four Seasons Wailea for 7 nights in January 2007. We were there for a conference for my husband. We initially planned to stay for 5 nights but extended our stay to 7 nights. Because of this change in our plans, we were able to understand the discrepancies in some of the reviews because we stayed in 2 different rooms -- a new renovated room for the 1st 5 nights, and an older room the last 2 nights. First of all the service is phenomenal -- after arriving on a long transcontinental flight with a baby we were exhausted. It was wonderful to be greeted by the courteous staff, we placed leis on us and gave us cool towels at check in. By the time we were in our room, our bags were already there. Our 1st (renovated) room was sensational! It had a full unobstructed ocean view, a huge 50 inch flat screen plasma TV showing photos of the resort and playing relaxing Hawaiian music. The lanai was the perfect place to hang out while the baby was sleeping. They totally when all out for the baby also! The bathroom was decorated with colorful sponges spelling out her name, she was given bath toys, and there were separate baby toiletries, and diapers (including swim diapers!). The bathroom is amazing! The twice daily maid service is phenomenal. Pool service is amazing -- within minutes of arriving they set up chairs for us including a pack and play for the baby! They are always coming by to offer water, Evian spritz, Icee popsicles, and fresh fruit . After 5 days, we had to switch to the unrenovated mountain view room. We had been spoiled for 5 days, so it was a disappointment. The carpet was older as were the room furnishings. But the wonderful service continued. According to the hotel, by May 2007 all the rooms will be renovated! By far, the best hotel I've stayed at to date.

Reviews.Title: “A bit over priced”
Reviews.Author: therap4paws
Reviews.Content: Honeymoon trip. Rooms were great but we had an invasion of ants in our first room, they sent in the maids who dusted the table but didn't get rid of the problem, after a few more calls to the front desk, we got our room changed and there were no more problems. Pool is ok, not much as far as fancy goes. Have to get out early to get a good seat though. Restaurants in the hotel, not great. No vegetarian selection. Breakfast is great though. Room service is great, we ate in more then once. Gym accomadations are fantastic, bonus yoga classes on beach, well worth getting up early for.. Spa is more then fantastic, definatley recommend splurging on a massage and enjoying the spa accomadations. Staff is great, typical Four Seasons professionalism. For the price, I would look at other hotels though, I really like adventure pools for ambience!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing”
Reviews.Author: JetSetter16
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons resort is AMAZING! My family and I stayed at for one night in mid-January and my only regret is not staying longer. The resort is very pricey but more than well worth it. To say that nothing was overlooked is a mild understatement. Immediately upon arrival, we were each presented with a lai and while checking in we were given a cool towel. The room was gorgeous and huge! We were upgraded for free to an ocean view room and the view was stunning. The bathroom was stocked with absolutely everything you could ever want. I have to say that the shower is one of the best I've ever used. The bed was incredibly comfortable, there was a flat screen TV, an iHome (to play your iPod) and a huge lanai (balcony) overlooking the ocean. The resort is beyond words. It's right on the beach and there's also a beautiful pool. The staff goes out of its way to make you feel pampered and relaxed. A few minutes after check-in a staff member knocked on the door and set up a beautiful box of cookies and snacks as a complimentary gift. Once you step foot on the beach you're directed to your own beach chairs (shaded with an umbrella). Every 30 minutes or so we were offered water and a cooling spritz. The only negative about the resort was that construction was underway while we were there. It was quite loud while we were hanging out on the beach. Our flight out of Maui wasn't until 5PM, so we had a few hours to kill. As an added bonus, the resort let us store our belongings after we checked out so that we could stay on the beach. They let us use the spa facilities to shower and change after leaving the beach. The spa was fabulous and we felt so relaxed. This is one of the nicest resorts I have ever stayed in. I would highly recommend staying here while in Maui. As a sidenote, we also had a star sighting - Steven Tyler (Aerosmith's lead singer) was staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Very Miami-ish, but beautiful”
Reviews.Author: AngelinaChicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property Dec. 8th for 5 nights and the timing was perfect (because its still considered low season and there weren't too many kids); I was definately not impressed with the room (though the hotel is currently renovating all rooms and I'm sure when they are done, they will be much nicer)...the bathroom was the only nice part of the room; we had a partial ocean and it was not much of a view, but not too bad. If you are debating between this property and the Big Island Four Seasons, GO TO THE BIG ISLAND!! (you can read my review there)...the beach was nice but small and you can't walk very far; the snorkeling at the coral right on the beach was excellent...the service was great and Spago was to die for. Other restaurants on the island that were at that same caliber were Mamma's Fish House, Hailemailee General Store, David Paul's all were excellent. Definately do the road to Hana, its well worth the trip, but you will be gone all day...I also highly recommend having a car the entire time in Maui because there is so much to see and do. The hotel is beautiful and what I mean by Miami-ish is the white marble flooring everywhere, huge fountain (like the Fountain Blue), flower patterns on the carpets etc. When I think Hawaii, I think more like what I saw at the Four Seasons on the Big Island; wooden roofs (rustic but very highend), the property there blends in more with nature, just like the Four Seasons in Costa Rica (another great property)....would do 4-5 nights here and definately go back to the Big Island! One more thing I just thought of, the spa is really not a full spa, like steam, sauna, hot pool, cold pool...its basic, massages and a small steam room; not really what I expected...Big Island Four Seasons, AMAZING SPA!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Kinsa
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a very nice hotel, up to par with other Four Seasons, although the rooms are in need of renovation, which of course is happening now. If you get an unrenovated room, which we had, the television is seriously laughable. I know, who goes to Hawaii to watch tv, but for the down times you do want to watch it (my hubby is a football fanatic, so had to watch the games), we could barely see it due to poor reception and tiny size. Other than that, the rooms are nice. I found everything to be "nice", but not as "amazing", as other people have reviewed. For example, we arrived at 3:45, but our room was not ready, and we had to sit and wait 40 minutes for it. No biggie, but at the Four Seasons, I expect the room to be ready if I check in after check in time. And if its not, I expect to be given a drink while I wait, etc, which we were not. I mean, we are paying top prices for top service, right? Then we were just handed our keys and sent on our way, at other hotels of this caliber, a bell person would escort you to your room. When the bellman came, he brought our luggage, but didn't bring us ice, etc as is customary in a nice hotel such as this. Again, not a big deal as I am capable of getting my own ice (which I had to do every day), but I am used to a bit better service at the FS. The in room coffee is so so good! Grind the whole beans, we loved it. Poolside service is nice, the new manager of the poolside area (he is from Mexico, I can't remember his name off the top of my head) is fabulously nice, seek him out if you are there. Was there the first week of Dec. and the pools were COLD, really too cold to enjoy, the poolside staff kept insisting they wer heated, but no way, no one got in them because they were too cold. This was a big dissapointment. Jacuzzis were nice and heated though (and crowed because of the cold pools!) The ocean was warmer than the pools! The beach is beautiful, the snorkeling right in front of the hotel is AMAZING!! This is one amazing thing about this hotel that I will rave about, I had a great time snorkeling there every day, saw lots of sea turtles, etc. Fabulous. Hotel is in a nice location for walking to the shops at Wailea, where you can get a nice meal at several resturants. Although I pointed out the few negatives to make this review complete, I really did enjoy this hotel. Just want to point out the few faults I saw, as everyone else points out the posiitves. I would definitely return here if we go to Maui again, and I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great property, less emphasis on personal service.”
Reviews.Author: VermontGolfer
Reviews.Content: I also stayed at the Halekulani in Oahu and the Four Seasons on Lanai. The Four Seaons on Maui was very good. Property is very, very nice. Great pool, beach and food. Room was nice, but not as nice as 4S on Lanai. Go with the gardenview here. Oceanview doesn't get you that much more (you'll believe me when you see the differential between garden and ocean rates). Ferraros was magnificent. Around the corner from the hotel was Sarento's. DO NOT MISS IT and call ahead for reservation of table near the water at sunset. Fabulous wine list to boot!! Don't wait until you land for dinner reservations. Try to get sunset reservations at Sarentos. You can go with a later time at Ferraros (more romantic with less beachgoers around). Pool is great to lounge around, and the lawn area is also very nice. Get down to the beach early for good seats. If you plan to go to the Luau in Lahaina - call a month early to be sure you get seats. You can catch a celebrity here. We bumped into Denise Richards a few times (she's shorter than I thought). You do feel like a bit of a number here. So many people here that is hard for you to feel like you are getting extra special treatment. However, the pool/lawn attendants are pretty good (well - let's say the tip to service ratio works here).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: SharonMcC
Reviews.Content: My husband, my daughter, and I just returned from nearly a week at the Four Seasons. What a fantastic experience! So many of the activities are complimentary, and this is the most kid-friendly hotel you'll ever find. My daughter was delighted to find toys, candy, rice krispy treats, and sponge letters spelling out her name in the tub upon our arrival. The staff at Kids for All Seasons is AWESOME and they have so many fun activities for the kids. My daughter literally cried when she had to say goodbye. We had a whale sighting from the hotel and also a celebrity sighting--Billy Joel seated at one of the cabanas. Service is fantastic. The only bad experience we had was one time the housekeeping staff entered our room for turndown service after we'd already gone to bed. Slightly awkward. Overall though we absolutely LOVED the experience and fully plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “5 stars for 4 Seasons!”
Reviews.Author: blissun
Reviews.Content: I joined my then boyfriend in Honolulu (as he was there for a business trip), and then we flew to Maui for 4 nights. Our first night in Maui, he set up through 4s, a sunset picnic at Baby Beach. They provided a basket with sandwiches, smoked salmon, crudites, champagne, etc. and we drove to Baby Beach. There, during the sunset, my boyfriend knelt down on the sand beside my chair and proposed! Of course I said Yes, and I suppose that set the stage for a wonderful experience in Maui! We returned later that evening to our "oceanview" room (which by the way you had to lean over the balcony and nearly break your neck to see the ocean!). 4s was supposed to have the bath drawn, with candles, flowers, etc. (which I did not know of). The next morning my boyfriend complained to the manager and we got upgraded to a Ocean front suite. It was a very nice gesture as you propose once in your life, and they made every effort to make it special for us. The room was nothing short of what royalty would expect. A huge balcony, 2 bathrooms, living room, 2 TV's, breakfast/dining area, etc. They also gave complementary chocolate covered strawberries and champange the 2nd night, and a fondue pot on our last night there. In Maui itself, we went to Warren and Annabelle's magic show which was amazing. We dined mostly at the 4s, and just loved the food there. One of the must-do's is the Feast at Lele Luau. The food was gourmet and the show was just incredible with a romantic setting on the beach. Probably more for couples than for families, however. We spent time shopping in Lahaina, which was great for souvenirs and t-shirts. Our last day, just before our fight, we had lunch at Mama's fish house, which was a quaint place on the north shore with great food. Overall our Maui experience was fabulous. We loved that you could make local US calls, and spend US currency, but still get that island feel!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful...Treated wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: LC11
Reviews.Content: Just returned from FS Wailea...All I can say about the service is wow!!! We had booked an oceanview room with the bed and breakfast package and were upgraded to a Prime OceanFront One Bedroom Suite....I have no idea how we got this...maybe as we just came over from the FS Manele Bay??? (we had a regular room there). The room had a bedroom with sitting area, living room and 2 bathrooms...it was great!! We were told the hotel was at full occupancy but 40% of the rooms were not occupied due to the renovation which we knew about. The hotel was not full at all and it was very easy to get chairs at the pool and/or beach. I agree with a previous reviewer who wrote that the pool area is more of a "scene" and the beach was alot more informal. The water was really calm and snorkeling was great. You would never know the hotel was undergoing a renovation, there were no construction noises at all. Spago was the only restaurant closed and due to reopen on 12/10. Breakfast buffet was very good too. Service was top notch and the employees ended every conversation with "is there anything else we can do for you?" Also ate at Ferraro's which was very good for both lunch and dinner. Of course it was expensive and if we ate lunch there which was only a couple of time, we usually split something. The guys at the valet were super nice and very quick and helpful. I do hope to return one day to this hotel and can't wait to see what it looks like after the renovation. This was a truly enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing End to Our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: travelduck111
Reviews.Content: First, I apologize for the late review. Our honeymoon was last May. "Travel Duck" usually promptly reviews his hotels. However, my wife said that she wanted to review this hotel along with the Grand Hyatt Kauai. She obviously had better things to do like play poker or suduko :) Okay, on to the hotel. It was spectaular! Upon check in, I was greeted by name, ushered to the check-in counter, given a warm towel and lai, and upgraded from a garden view room to a partial ocean view room. The rooms were amazing and bathroom was huge. Because this hotel was so nice, we need to go back to Maui because we really did not leave except for going on the Road to Hana (which made me car sick). The pool was fabulous as were the restaurants. We ate at all three restaurants and liked Ferraros the best. The pool food was also very good - the ambence was so nice I did not mind spending $17 for a hamburger. We are excited to return to the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “The best!!!!”
Reviews.Author: parrotmom50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons from Nov. 2-7, 2006. We were lucky enough to get the 5th night free special because they were renovating the children's pool area. I am completely spoiled now. The hotel is beautiful, and the service was fantastic and everyone was so nice. We had originally booked a partial oceanview room and because we checked in at night we took it for granted that it was. The room was gorgeous, but in the morning we could see that the view was of trees, the Grand Wailea, and the island of Kahoolawe, but no ocean. So my husband took a pix of the view with his digital camera and showed it to the manager at the front desk. The manager moved us to a full oceanview with his apology. It was fabulous. The pool attendants were fabulous and the ice water never stopped coming. I loved the fact that the cabanas are included in the price of your room. If the cabanas remain empty for about 20-30 mins. (towels or not), they are reassigned to someone else. My husband also had a great time ocean kayaking. Also, the 4S seemed so much more intimate than the Grand Wailea and the Kea Lani, and the walk to the beach was much shorter. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. It is the best. I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Best Maui Option”
Reviews.Author: ocGlobetraveler
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Maui is a sensational option for those guests looking for a busier vacation experience. On my most recent trip, I had an opportunity to experience both this property as well as the Four Seasons Hualalai, located on the big island of Hawaii. The Four Seasons Maui is located on Wailea, which has a reputation of being Maui's most desirable beach. The weather is almost always ideal, lacking the sometimes annoying trade winds found more commonly on other areas of the island. Immediately adjacent to the FS Maui is the Fairmont Kea Lani and the Grand Wailea Maui. In addition to numerous resorts, Wailea also features an amazing upscale outdoor shopping mall with high end stores and restaurants. If you are looking for peace and quiet, this might not be your place. We found that although service was excellent throughout, you are often sharing your resort experience with other guests. Pools were often crowded, as well as most common areas of the hotel. This was at a time that 1/4 of the rooms were out of service due to a rooms renovation. That being said, the common areas of the hotel were beautiful. From the moment you arrive, you are greeting in true Hawaiian spirit. The lobby area is tranquil and offers a stunning view of the water. We were given a room that had not been renovated. We were still however impressed by the overall feel and appearance of the room. Standards rooms are spacious, measuring approximately 600 sq. feet depending upon location. Each standard room features a marble bath with separate tub and glass enclosed shower. I would imagine that the hotel will be upgrading the bathrooms as a part of the renovation. Additionally, beds are typically Four Seasons, with extremely comfortable mattresses and Frette linens. Lanai's (outdoor patio's) are spacious and feature a candle, table & chairs. Our ocean view category room was private and captured beautiful views of the Pacific Ocean. Service throughout was impeccable, perhaps even beyond that of your typical Four Seasons. Even at a property with numerous guests, you feel that your satisfaction is always their top priority. The resort has several dining options on property. My personal suggestion is the outdoor Italian restaurant, Ferraro's, which offers a spectacular array of Italian offerings. You can dine under the stars while listening to the waveâ€™s crash. I would highly recommend a Breakfast package, as the hotel offers a wonderful morning Breakfast spread! If you're looking for a fine hotel experience, with plenty of activities, this might be your place. The Four Seasons Wailea does a wonderful job all around, with wonderful facilities and a stunning location. The pool may be somewhat of a "scene" but it's a wonderful property indeed. Once the renovation is complete, the guest experience should be amazing, with all rooms featuring wireless internet as well as flat panel televisions and updated furnishings. On another note, if you desire something more intimate and relaxing, you may want to opt for the Four Seasons Hualalai on the big Island of Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “10 days is not too long”
Reviews.Author: KSS
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our second trip to Maui, after relentlessly considering all options, all islands. Worried we had spent too much time researching our trip. My husband thanked me everyday for the time I put in on our decision to stay at the Four Seasons in Wailea. The staff and service were great. The public areas were relaxing and classy. We like to beach hop and cruise the island; location was perfect. Not crazy about room renovation, as walking past a huge widescreen TV is not our idea of paradise, but we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: dee99
Reviews.Content: The service is incredible, they treat you like a queen/king. The food is OK. The pool is horrible, very small and crowded. Not my idea of a vacation. It usually lightens up in the late afternoon. The families come out very early. I'm from the east coast so it is a long flight to Maui, it felt like I was in Florida. I guess Hawaii is the west coast's florida. There were people every where, I felt like we did not have privacy. The beach was crowded, row after row of beach chairs. The hotel was nice, but needs a renovation bad. The spa was nice, had a very good massage. We had a partial ocean view, because we don't stay in the room much. But if you like a good view, don't get anything below ocean view.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort”
Reviews.Author: williams44
Reviews.Content: It's been a while, so unfortunately, I can't remember all of the details, but we loved it. The resort is absolutely beautiful. We stayed for 2 nights. It was my birthday the day we checked in. There was a card and sweets waiting for me. And the second night they upgraded us into a suite. Now that's service! The valet was always prompt in getting our car. The openness of the resort is great. Four Seasons in general does a good job in incorporating the environment into its resorts. They were undergoing some renovation but it didn't bother us at all. We enjoyed snorkeling and sitting by the beach. All snorkeling equipment is free for an hour. We also spent some time in the pool and the jacuzzis. The fitness area is outside, which is nice, and each machine has its own screen. We also enjoyed walking on the beach and the walkway to the other nearby properties. We saw the Fairmont, the Grand Wailea and the other one whose name escapes me now, and we felt we had made the best choice. In terms of dining, we only ate once in the hotel for lunch. It was at the Italian place by the beach. I can't remember the name, but the view was amazing. The food was just okay. All in all, it was our favorite place in Maui, and we would definitely go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Our three days at the Four Seasons made our trip!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AGalagrr
Reviews.Content: It has been said so many times before, but this was truly a 5 star experience. Although we were only there three days, it made our trip entirely magical. I have stayed at both the Grand Wailea and Kea Lani and will never stay anywhere else but the Four Seasons, except when I have kids of my own I will venture over to the Grand for the pool. I did not tell my boyfriend that we were staying here as it was a birthday surprise. From the moment we arrived we were warmly welcomed. At check in my boyfriend was roaming around in shock and I made a passing comment to the front desk lady that it was a surprise to celebrate our birthdays. Later that afternoon when we returned to the room there was a lovely plate of chocolates and desserts with a note wishing us a happy birthday. The Four Seasons Touch! We stayed in a mountain side room and I am not that picky about views since we are not in there that much, but I am picky about the quality of the rooms, beds, pillows, ect. I had nothing to complain about whatsoever. Granted you can see the parking lot below, but they have done a nice job of trying to protect your privacy. I think this room is a bargain for what the property offers and I will certainly stay in the same category when I go back. Loved the bathroom and the sound system is such a great touch for the ladies especially. I definitely took my time having a bath and getting ready with sounds of the island playing. A glass of champagne really adds to the mood as well....and that was all possible since I arranged to have a mini fridge in the room to chill beverages. It is true that you do have to be up and out at the pool at about 6:45-7am if you want to get a beach cabana. I highly reccomend them since there are some that are secluded. You cant beat staring at the ocean all day! One guy told me that he goes every Christmas and is out at 3AM to claim the prime cabana and that it is wall to wall people. That sounds like something to avoid :) The gym is AMAZING! It made me even want to work out and I loved it. The cardio area is open air and overlooks the pool and ocean. Each machine has a TV. Fresh fruit, chilled water and gatorade. I miss that gym. Yoga on the beach was "ehhh" for me. Its very basic and I got very bored. I was jealous of all the people going to snorkel in the perfectly calm ocean wishing that the class would end. My boyfriend loved it though....so it may be your cup of tea. Pacific Grill breakfast is great. The mac nut pancakes are yummy and irresistible. I had the mac nut pancakes at The Gazebo and I liked these better. Granted the breakfast is pricy but you will be full all day. Ferraros was just okay in my opinion. The view is spectacular but I liked the lunch menu much more. The service was a bit slow too but I think our waiter was just slow in general. Spagos on the other hand....excellent food and wine menu and a great view too. I will end with saying that one of the reasons the Four Seasons is so wonderful is the STAFF. They really care about how you are doing and making sure you are taken care of. Our bellman, Chaz was one of those people. Chaz was also our "driver" in the complimentary car service to the Wailea Shops. He told us to have Tommy Bahamas (Fantastic Food!) call him when we were done, and there he was waiting for us. He also passed us in the hall when we were leaving and ended up walking us out and helping us load up just because he wanted to.......the best part is that when we returned home I had an email from Chaz making sure we made it home safely and that he enjoyed meeting us. Who does that??? The Four Seasons wonderful Staff does that. Not to say that is the norm, but these people love their job and it shows from the front desk staff, to house keeping, and the pool staff...everyone was wonderful! I know there are people out there reading these posts and teeter-totering between staying here or someplace else. STAY HERE!!! You will not regret it, even if it is for just a few nights...

Reviews.Title: “Jackhammering AWFUL”
Reviews.Author: jimmycorn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our honeymoon from October 8th thru October 17th. Before I describe the construction issue I do have to say that it is a very beautiful location and the staff service of the resort is impeccable. The problem we both had was that we were never notified by the hotel that the week we would be staying there the hotel was going to be conducting daily jackhammering of the kid's pool. When I say jackhammering, I mean two large machines operating at high decibels from 10 am until 5 pm from Monday thru Thursday. This was completely annoying given the fact that, had we known about the planned construction, we would have planned to do our golf, snorkeling etc those days rather than try to unwind from the wedding lying at the pool or beach with constant drilling going on 30 feet from your lounge chair. If the construction was not occuring it would have been a much more enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay, with a few problems”
Reviews.Author: Wuzzo1
Reviews.Content: I have agonized over rating our experience at the Four Seasons Wailea as a four or a five, finally settling on a four. I will preface this posting with the assurance that the four-star rating relates purely to a few unfortunate experiences and an opinion of one restaurant. You cannot go wrong by staying at this fabulous hotel. It is simply wonderful. We stayed at the Four Seasons for five nights in mid-October. Check-in was smooth and a genuine welcome awaited us. We were upgraded from a partial ocean-view room to a suite. (However, the suite was directly above the delivery area at the rear side of the hotel and we wakened to the racket of trucks backing up and beeping, people "chatting" etc.) If you can, try to request a room further to the front. Also, there is a huge condo complex being built behind the hotel and the noise from this is very loud at times. No way could we sit outside on the lanai. Another nice touch was the bottle of champagne that arrived an hour or so after check-in and a "Congratulations on your anniversary" card from the GM. The pool area is just amazing. Beautiful and large cabanas (no extra charge) and plenty of beds. When you arrive poolside, you are greeted by a staff member who helps you decide on your spot for the morning. The beds are cushioned (none of those plastic strap beds) and the attendant places a fitted velour towel on the bed and rolls a second towel for under your head. Iced water is constantly poured for you, Evian sprays, pineapple slices and popsicles are also delivered along with cold hand towels. It's heavenly. The keiki (children's) pool was under construction, so there were a few drill noises, but the Four Seasons handled this one by coming round with a tray loaded with earplugs. Too funny! There were few kids running around and those who were, were actually polite and well-behaved. Our room was spectacular, noise notwithstanding. The bathroom was a suite in itself, with double doors leading to the bathroom proper, a change area with hairdryer, lighted hand-mirror, etc., and a separate WC with door. L'Occitane produts were a nice touch. The bed and linens were superbly comfortable and there were four robes, two terry and two light cotton, which I practically lived in. Three jars full of coffee beans (macadamia, regular and decaf) are supplied with the coffee machine (situated in the bar area), with a grinder and some coffee-bags for those who didn't want to grind their own. Creamers were in the fridge. There were also two TVs that we never turned on (my orders!). So what were the problem areas? First, the restaurant that serves the breakfast buffet. We went there twice, hoping that the second time would be better than the first. It was worse. The food was nowhere near as well-prepared as the breakfasts and buffet at the Renaissance or the Hyatt in Ka'anapali. It was significantly inferior in our opinion. The second day, the server was very brusque. We were seated right next to a fence, on the other side of which was the keiki pool and several workmen hammering away. I asked if it would be possible to be moved. The server said, "Well, you'll hear the noise wherever you sit," in a very unfriendly way. She did move us. I ordered a French Toast brioche which had been lightly whisked through the egg and was as dry as a bone inside. SInce I had to eat (I suffer from debilitating migraines and have to keep my blood sugar up), I finished it by the time she reappeared. When the server finally came over to ask how everything was, I mentioned, politely, that the brioche had not been as pleasant as I had hoped for. Her response was, "Well, you finished it!" This is NOT Four Seasons service or quality in my opinion. I have to contrast this dish with a similar dish at the Hyatt. The Hyatt's version was so very superior, with fresh blueberries, strawberries and pecans and whipped vanilla butter. I could honestly barely eat the breakfasts we had at the Four Seasons. They were dried out or greasy on both occasions. (Not the case at Ferraros or Spago, where the food was excellent.) The setting is very boring too. The breakfast buffet was average and just couldn't compete with the buffet at the Renaissance either in variety or quality. Next little issue: One evening, after pulling up to the front in our car, a valet ran over, opened my door, then spotted a limo (evidently of greater importance) draw up beside us. At this point, he let the door go and ran to open their door! Unfortunately for me, I had already extended one leg out of the door, which fell back onto it. I was very bruised afterwards. My husband called the fellow over and told him nicely what had happened and he was very apologetic. This is a minor thing but, as in the case of the server with attitude, it suggests to me that the staff are perhaps lacking in training. Final little issue: Before spending time at the Four Seasons, we stayed 9 nights in the Sheraton, Ka'anapali, and three nights in the wonderful Renaissance. Our rooms were made up during the morning, usually before 11:00 a.m. Twice at the Four Seasons, I had to call because they still hadn't been made up at 3:30 p.m. Once, we called THREE times as the room wasn't made up by 5:30. I think that is very poor. When we called for more creams, it took 45 minutes for them to arrive on two occasions and once, we had to call twice. More good stuff: The Quattro Stagione pizza is great! Try it for lunch at Ferraro's, overlooking the ocean. The restaurant opens for lunch at 11:30. The Bento Box is also wonderful. You HAVE to dine at Spago. I believe this restaurant is operated independently from the hotel. It's fabulous. If it's raining, don't plan on eating at Ferraro's in the evening. They phoned to cancel our reservation due to rain, leaving us with no reservation for our last night in Maui. Very disappointing. There are a number of lovely sitting areas in the hotel, bars, etc. overlooking the fountain. There is usually entertainment going on and it's very good. THE GYM ROCKS! Wow! I loved the cardio area and the weight room. We didn't go to the spa as this was a long trip and we didn't want a huge Visa bill afterwards. However, many guests told us it was wonderful. We loved seeing the beautiful arts and crafts displays and chatting to the artists every day! All-in-all, a delightful experience, aside from the bruises and below-par breakfasts! We can thoroughly recommend this hotel and will certainly visit again when the renovations are finished.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing honeymoon experience”
Reviews.Author: Brookline30something
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights here on our honeymoon and were blown away by how fabulous our stay was. We were upgraded (complimentary) to an ocean front one-bedroom suite upon arrival! Everything about the Four Seasons was superlative. We especially enjoyed the freshly squeezed juices at the breakfast buffet (and the fact that they freshly whipped cream for us when there wasn't any available!), the Lava Flow drinks at the pool, and the attentive service. We also stayed at the Four Seasons on the Big Island and found the two quite complementary (though it seems that the food service at the pool was a little quicker at the Maui resort). While the Four Seasons isn't exactly budget, it was worth every penny and was the perfect way to spend a honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Best Ever Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: MDK38
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary on Maui and stayed 10 nights at the Four Seasons. Every single day we would be amazed at something the staff did that was over and above any hotel we have ever stayed at. Not only did they make us feel welcome, they were fun, interested and extremely helpful. It continued in their stores, resturants, business office, concierge, walking down the halls, room cleaning, pool...and never pretentious...We knew from all the great reveiws, pictures and their reputation that we would be happy but seriously until you stay at this hotel it's hard to explain how special they treat their guests. Yes we did get a room upgrade, champagne, and every day we returned from our adventures to a warm welcome. Only thing we would change is it would be nice if they had some self parking vs the valet. It wasn't just the $12.00 a day but sometimes you just want to come and go but there never was a long wait and of course - the service was great. Water, blankets for Haleakola, more cabanas at the pool than any other hotel, L'Occitrane products (soap,etc.) towels for our beach days were all extras that made a difference. Favorite restuarants in order - Mama's Fishouse (go early 4:30 for best table - make reservation) Ferraros at the Four Seasons and the Waterfront! If you like sunsets get an early seating and have a drink before dinner if you like best seats in the house.We were not crazy about Nick's next door when it compared to the above. Also had a good meal at the Grand Walaia when we ordered the chef's special flight special. For two people we got used to splitting appetizer, soup/salad, main course and dessert - of course drinks when we weren't starving. We left 1-1/2 days before the earthquake so have no tips for that experience. So if you are thinking about where to stay and you have the choice - there is no choice - Four Seasons 100%.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: michellebarrett
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just great for families. We spent 10 days here with our 18 month old son. The hotel child proofed our room and left bath toys and sponges spelling out our son's name. The staff make a point of learning your name and they remember it! The hotel was undergoing some renovations during our stay, so a good portion of the rooms were closed. This made for a less crowded pool. We had no trouble getting the cabana of our choice. Although, if the hotel is crowded I can imagine things get a bit tight around the pool as it's a bit closed in. The Four Seasons isn't cheap, but they don't charge extra for things that cost more at a lot of hotels. The cabanas and kids club are no charge at the Four Seasons. I think the kids club is is something like $60 per day at Fairmount. I would really recommend that you consider booking one of the packages that include breakfast. The buffet is nice and on it's own is $28 per person, so it could add up quickly. Another note... The earthquake occurred during our stay. It was quite scary as we are from Illinois so not used to earthquakes. The power went out at the hotel for about two hours. Of course, this didn't stop the Four Seasons staff from cooking omelettes to order on a propane stove!! It's expensive, but worth it for a nice treat!

Reviews.Title: “4S Maui is AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: jmuemos
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to this hotel for the second stop on our honeymoon (we stayed in Oahu first). This hotel is very pricey and we were nervous it might not be worth it...well, let me just say that it definitely is!!! The hotel is located in sunny, beautiful Wailea on the southern part of Maui - in my opinion the best part of the island (and we saw a lot!). Upon check-in, we were upgraded to a suite and it was soo nice - the biggest bathroom I've ever seen in a hotel and the most comfy bed! Loccitane amenties are really nice, along with cozy robes and slippers. (Only complaint: the hairdryer was tiny and pathetic - ladies bring your own or go use the ones in the spa). Since it was our honeymoon they sent up complimentary champagne and sparkling cider and some treats with a nice card from the manager. Service was unbelievable...all staff calls you by name and actually act like they want to help you. Anything you want - they'll do it for you. Housekeeping comes twice daily and was excellent. Everyone complains about the pool - we thought it was awesome! The children's pool was closed and there was some mild noise but it didn't bother us. We never had a problem geting a cabana. The cabanas and poolside service are the best part! The staff immediately greets you and sets up your chairs, bring you ice water, and offer you fresh fruit and other treats while you are there. The beach is beautiful - the softest sand and the most blue water you'll ever see! You never want to leave the Four Seasons. We did the Road to Hana - take the concierge's advice and do it backwards- it was amazing! The valet guys are so helpful - they know how to get everywhere and are super nice. Room service was excellent, poolside food was good, and the breakfast buffet at the Pacific Grill - yum! We got the breakfast package and every morning had a delicous spread of made to order pancakes, waffles, omelettes, fresh fruit, pastries, you name it - they had it! We did a couples massage at the spa and it was great! There are too many awesome things to go into - just know that yes, this hotel is expensive (as is everything in Maui!!!) but it's so worth it if you want a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel”
Reviews.Author: bpotthoff
Reviews.Content: This was just an excellent hotel. We had a stay 5 night pay for 4 promotion that was available on the hotel website. Mountain view was not available so we had a garden view but I think the least expensive rooms here would be a great deal. They provide a nice lei greeting, cold water and towels for your day trips, frig in room on request, manager reception with drinks and appetizers, evening hula and torch lighting, coffee in rooms and at exercise area. The spa and workout facilities are great and there are all sorts of free classes. The cabanas and ice water are really necessary because the sun is very hot. I cannot imagine not having shade. The service was impeccable. The grounds and amenities are wonderful. The beach is gorgeous. If you splurge and stay here make sure to spend lots of time at the hotel. I wish we had spent the day here rather than take the road to Hana. It was pretty but fairly tedious even with both of us splitting the driving. We went to a great restaurant in Kihei, Thai Cuisine. Very reasonable. We did not like Nick's Fishmarket at the Fairmont. They had difficulties preparing my husband's fish meal with olive oil instead of butter - a seemingly easy request. We did the Old Lahaina Luau and Warren and Annabelle's Magic Show. Both are worthwhile. There is a good little restaurant by the airport, Da Kitchen. We were celebrating our anniversary and they were nice enough to provide a bottle of champagne. A great place to vacation. They are to be commended for an outstanding property.

Reviews.Title: “FS Can't Be Beat”
Reviews.Author: OCPaddler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Four Seasons Wailea from 10/1/06 - 10/8/06 for our tenth anniversary. This was our second trip to the property (stayed a week last year w/ the kids) and once again we were blown away. The Four Seasons does not disappoint! Service was exceptional from the moment we pulled up to valet parking. The initial greeting and check in set the tone for the rest of our stay. The staff without exception were incredible and the services and facilities really can't be beat. Based on our stay last year at around the same time, it would appear that the renovations have scared some people away from the hotel. During the first half off our stay there were considerably fewer guests than we had previously seen - lots of premium seating available around the pool and beach, lots of extra attention. We were not impacted in any negative way at all by the work they're doing although we were told that work on the keiki pool was schedule to begin on 10/9 and that it should be pretty loud. We will be returning in the spring for a family trip and I can't wait to experience the new and improved Four Seasons!

Reviews.Title: “Hawaiian Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Shopgirl27
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Maui is wonderful. We spent a week there for our honeymoon. I highly recommend it. The spa and gym are wonderful, the restaurants are sublime (Spago is amazing-- I wish we had gone there twice! And the restaurant by the pool is outstanding too!). We didn't do a breakfast plan, so we found cheap breakfast places that were close by and locals go to-- like Kihei Caffe-- 100% recommend. We're not big breakfast people so it worked out. Concierge service is also excellent. We were told by our travel agent that since we were honeymooners we would most likely get upgraded, so we booked a mountain view room for a much lower price (though still pricey of course!) But we got there and the hotel was booked and we didn't get upgraded! In retrospect, it would have been worth more $$$ for some type of a view. If you are traveling in August, beware-- it is primetime for this hotel and upgrades don't come easy. The other thing about August was the amount of children. I love kids, but it was our honeymoon-- and they are everywhere. Because there is no adults-only pool, they are literally everywhere. . . jsut something to think about if you're planning a trip for August. Otherwise, everything about it is amazing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: ChefDeb
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fabulous 5 nights at the "Four Seasons Resort" A beautiful place to stay, great service, food and atmosphere. Golfing at Wailea was the best. We will definietly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Compares”
Reviews.Author: whitleybh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had an amazing experience during our week at the Four Seasons. In fact, it was so good, we actually extended our stay and changed flights. While in Maui we dinned at the Fairmont and drove to the Ritz to take a look. Neither of these properties compare. Albeit we did not see the rooms. The Ritz was windy outside and the pool was not a nice as far as the chairs and you even had to get up and get your own water. Could you imagine? Everyone at the Ritz was wrapped up in towels to stay warm by the pool and the lobby just does not compare. If you are even the most picky of all travelers, the Four Seasons will not let you down.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and style at the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: gengrace
Reviews.Content: After three nights at the Ritz in Kapalua (which we loved), we spent one night at the Four Seasons. It's every bit as fantastic as the glowing reviews here. We found it to be more modern in style and amenities than the Ritz, but a little less private and personal. I'd recommend both hotels and would return to them in a heartbeat! Pros: * Compared to the nearby resorts (Kea Lani, Grand Wailea, etc.), the Four Seasons has genuine elegance and style. Everything about the resort is top-notch, yet you don't feel like you're in a flashy, over the top amusement park. It's very classy. * I am sure we had the worst room in the hotel (way in the back and facing the covered parking lot) and we STILL felt like we were in paradise. The room was spacious and light, the bed was heaven, and the bathroom was the most exquisite bathroom we had ever seen! Beautiful marble, dual sinks and showers, a separate water closet, and music. I loved the L'Occitane soaps and shampoos, especially the "after-sun balm" to soothe a sunburn. * As with the Ritz, we found the service at the Four Seasons to be excellent. The staff were always friendly and attentive. The bar man let us take our cocktails down to the beach chairs, where we watched the stars and listened to the waves. We were the only two people out there and it felt like we had the whole island to ourselves. * The pool and hot tubs were lovely. We swam and soaked while watching the sun set into the sea - dazzling! At night, the fountain is lit up and the whole resort is a perfect, romantic place to stroll. * Wailea is known for its beaches and they didn't disappoint. The Four Seasons is close to a lot of snorkeling spots that were great even though we had rainy weather. We didn't do a lot of sunbathing or lounging -- next time! The cons: I can't think of any cons other than the rain we had during our stay -- but that didn't diminish our experience of this luxurious hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: atlmom2
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Four Seasons in late August for 5 nights. The week before we were on Oahu and the Big Island. We were upgraded from a partial ocean view to an inside room where we could see the pool, ocean and garden area. Never requested it, we just got the upgrade. We did not eat dinner at any of the restaurants but had lunch by the pool. We ate the buffet breakfast 2 days but it is not really worth the price. Buy a little snack breakfast elsewhere. They tell everyone that if their things are left unattended for more than 20 minutes they might be removed from the lounge chairs by the pool or beach but that is just not true. I saw many chairs unattended for hours and never saw anything removed unless someone complained which I saw happen just a couple times. If you want a cabana, get to the pool early and stake out your spot. If you just want a lounge chair by the pool you may get a canopy put over it and still be out of the sun when you want to. I would say anytime the resort is pretty full if you want a chair at all you need to be out at the pool by mid morning. We had some pooside massages that I can highly recommend. They allow children or teens to get poolside massages also. Our girls that are 12 and 15 both enjoyed them. My husband and I went to the spa and he enjoyed a massage and reflexology. I loved the oxygen facial I got.

Reviews.Title: “great service, spotless rooms”
Reviews.Author: thekid26
Reviews.Content: We plan at least one if not two trips to maui every year. We have a three year old and my wife will not stay anywhere if the rooms are not spotless. I can't say enough great things about this hotel. The Grand Wailea is nice if your kids are a little older and can enjoy the pools/slides. The Grand is just too big for us and it takes a long time to get anywhere in that hotel. They seem to nickel and dime you for everything(gym,valet)The kea lani is nice if you have a need for a suite but the beach out front is in my opinion not as nice for swiming. The grounds at the four seasons are very nice. The pool is just big enough and never seems to be too crowded. We spend 90% of our time on the beach out front bodysurfing or chasing crabs so the pool is not a huge priority. The beachboys are great and are alway quick to help when you need water/towels/umbrella's/chairs. I've seen some complaints about "rooms over the parking structures".
