We always stay in a mountainside room and yes it is over the parking structure but we are never in the room so it doesn't bother us. The noise hasn't ever bothered us. The money we save staying in a mountainside room vs a partial oceanview are enough to cover our large bar tab after a eight night stay so it makes sense to me. I don't know who wouldn't check their room location when booking a room that is $400 a night and not ask what the room is like and what are the negative aspects of that room. Just my opinion... Did I say how clean the rooms are? The hotel is doing a extensive remodel and i'm sure the rooms are going to be even better. We have stayed at other resort properties on Maui before we stayed at the Four Seasons. The Hyatt, Kapalua, The Grand, they all are great hotels. But for the last five years the only place we will stay is the Four Seasons. I hope this helps and in my opinion there is not a better beach on any part of the island for the little ones so close to world class accomodations. One other thing, my son loves music and somehow ended up with a ukulele from one of the convience stores that he would not put down. The valet (and I kick myself for not remembering his name) every time we returned to the hotel would play songs to him from his ukulele. It was really unbelievable that the valet took the time and the effort to do this. The aloha spirit is alive and well at the four seasons. If you never have been to maui don't fall for the "turtle town" snorkeling trips. They are expensive and you can swim a very, very short distance out to the turtles right off the point to the south of the hotel. There is always quite a few of them out there. Pros- great service from Valet, bellman, beach boys, housekeeping, front desk. Beach pool rooms gym hotel general manager great snorkeling Cons- they need a bar like the "library" at the Hyatt in Kaui Expensive, but we knew that. Food is ok but not great, We don't go there for the food. No surf out front for surfing or anywhere close except La Perouse

Reviews.Title: “Rooms without views do exist at Four Seasons. Beware!”
Reviews.Author: Dives
Reviews.Content: I must confer with the previous reviewer who expressed dismay at being put into a "mountain View" room that overlooked the parking facility. I, too, have suffered this fate, and it's a real mood killer--not to mention waste of financial resources. Just be aware when booking online--sepecially at heavily discounted travel sites--that these type of rooms do exist, and sometimes hotels and resorts tend to stretch the truth about room categories and views. You can minimize your pre-arrival anxiety by talking to the onsite reservations department, or the front desk manager, prior to arrival. World class facilities such as the Four Seasons should show some compassion and remorse for sticking it to those of us who get assigned inferior accomodations!

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Maui - Best Honeymoon Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: DWUK
Reviews.Content: I can't rave enough about this hotel. Coming from London, it was a fair distance to come - but for our honeymoon it was perfect and well worth the trip. Travelling in from Oahu, from the hustle and bustle that is Waikiki we were both very pleasantly surprised with Maui and the Four Seasons. The service was impeccable, even down to helping me track down my lost luggage! Everybody is polite and calls you by name, very impressive, cannot say the same for the Halekunali or the Bellagio (places we also stayed at on our honeymoon). Champagne, dinner reservations, spa treatments all were booked perfectly. The staff and hotel are excellent and we will definitely recommend the Four Seasons Maui to anyone. Top tip - Ferraros is by far the better one of the three restaurants on site, and has by far the best views at sunset! Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Best Services I've ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: DCTraveling
Reviews.Content: Don't want to bore everyone with the same positive remarks you've already read about this hotel, but I can confirm it's all true. Service was outstanding from top to bottom! I will go down the list of great free things offered by this hotel: Yoga classes Cabanas at the pool (Just show up by 7 AM if you want to get one) Outrigger Canoes Tennis court time Shoe shine Use of game room (pool, ping pong, shuffleboard) Newspapers in the morning Scuba Lessons Snorkel Gear Someone help me out if I've missed anything. I highly, highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely, Always 100% Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Muntz73
Reviews.Content: Everything that can be written has been written. Only thing I can say is everything is always perfect everytime we stay there. Hands down the best service and attention to detail I have ever received at a 5* hotel. Well worth the $$$

Reviews.Title: “Never wanted to leave”
Reviews.Author: chimom3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week-long stay at the Four Seasons Maui. We stayed on the club level of the hotel (Room 822) from August 7-14 and it was honestly the best experience I have ever had at a hotel. We were in Maui to celebrate our 10th anniversary and my birthday and the staff really helped make it special. The minute we drove up to the valet area in front of the hotel, we were greeted by a valet and given lovely leis by a hostess who asked our last name. The hostess immediately knew our first names and that we were staying on the club floor. They told us to leave the luggage and it would be taken care of along with the car. The hostess then whisked us away to the 8th floor club lounge to hand us over to the wonderful concierge staff. The concierge seated us comfortably, gave us chilled towels to refresh ourselves and offered us drinks. I had a great Mai Tai and my husband tried a local beer. Very nice way to start our visit to Maui. We were checked in to our room as we sat in the lounge enjoying our beverages and some treats from the tea that they had in the lounge. The club lounge offers a nice continental breakfast (fruit, cereal, yogurt, pastries, boiled eggs, and cheese blintzes), tea (sandwiches, tea sweets, chips), appetizers (varied but my favorite were the chilled shrimp and crab claws) and desserts (also varied but I saw homemade ice cream, chocolate eclairs, chocolate mousse, creme puffs) as well as beverages all day long. We really enjoyed sitting at the club lanai and having a cocktail while looking at the ocean and pool. Very relaxing. The club concierge staff were incredible and really did everything they could to ensure you enjoyed yourself. They made all of our dinner and entertainment reservations for us. They arranged for picnic lunches and coolers when we needed it. Somehow we managed to have prime seating at every restaurant that had a view and we had reservations at the perfect times for seeing the sunset. They also arranged for the chef to come to us at our favorite lanai in the club lounge to meet for our Ultimate Romantic Dinner. One night I mentioned that I really wanted something chocolate for dessert and that we would be stopping back by after dinner. There happened to not be a chocolate dessert offering that evening, but when we stopped in, I had a special chocolate mousse waiting for me. Simply amazing service. Our room (822) had a lovely view of the ocean from the bed and the lanai. Upon arrival in our room there was champagne chilled and a nice note congratulating us on our anniversary. The radio had Hawaiian music playing in the background and the concierge opened the door to the lanai so we could hear the ocean right away. The room itself was nice and included a really comfy King bed, a desk, a sofa and table, and a nice-sized lanai. The bathroom was also very large with nice toiletries. There is a wet bar area with a coffee maker, coffee bean grinder, snacks, and beverages. Since we receive all the snacks and beverages we would like right down the hall, we never used these amenities. During our stay we ate at Ferraros for lunch and Spago for dinner. Ferraros for lunch was very nice, especially if you could get one of the terrace seats overlooking the ocean They have a wonderful lobster salad that I ordered each time we ate there. The also have great breadsticks that are like soft pretzels. Spago was great for dinner and we really enjoyed the sunset from the terrace at Spago, as well. We also did the Four Season's Ultimate Romantic Dinner on our last evening there and the chef from Pacific Grill prepared a wonderful 6-course meal based on our meeting. It was the most romantic thing we have ever done. They only do one dinner each evening and you are seated in a lovely private alcove overlooking the beach. Very nice. We sat at the beach one morning and I spent a few days at the pool area. I agree with other posters that the immediate pool area gets crowded. They do say there is a 20-minute time limit you can be away during the morning hours, but they allow you to be away from 11-2 for lunch. Many people take advantage of the leniency of the pool people. I think it is hard to tell who is in the pool or other areas and they don't want to upset people. I did witness them cleaning up some cabanas when it was clear no one was using them. I ended up finding some lovely spots in the pool area along the walking path that is above the beach. These areas offered secluded half-cabanas that few people seemed to notice. I could always get a spot there if I was down by 9:00 am. The pool service is outstanding. They set up your cabana area, bring ice water every 20 minutes or so, bring frsh fruit and popsicles in the afternoon and have the lovely Evian spritzes. Really a great way to relax. There never seemed to be a problem getting a chair at the beach at any time of the day. The exercise facilities were nice and we used them almost every day. I enjoyed the cardio area that was basically an open-air area. My husband used the weight room frequently and liked it as well. They offered water, towels, headsets and fruit in the work out areas. Also, my husband didn't bring sneakers to work out (which are required) so they gave him a pair of sneakers to use throughout our stay. Only at the Four Seasons. We really enjoyed our stay here and especially the club floor. I will never stay anywhere else when we return to Maui. I am already planning to bring our daughters with us on the next visit. The hotel is so wonderful about preparing rooms for children and making their visits special. They were preparing a club level room for a family of four and they let me see how they set it up since we want to bring our small children next time. Everything was childproofed - bumpers on all corners of tables, lanai had netting stretched around so small fingers and feet couldn't poke through, bath tub had the faucets protected and they spelled the kids names with sponges on the tub, kid-sized robes that were like the adult robes, diaper pail, diaper holder, pack-n play, etc. They also had these rubber duckies with snacks for the kids along with milk and cookies upon arrival. The club lounge also made sure to have kids cereal and snacks available as well as kid-favorite sandwiches and gummy bears at tea time. Very cute. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time at the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Atl-Lily
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed at the hotel for a few nights in the beginning of August. I wasn't sure what to expect due to the mixed reviews on the website. However, my worries dwindled away as my husband and I arrived to the hotel lobby. The lobby is small but beautiful. The staff is extremely attentive and nice. Be sure to tip housekeeping, valets and guys who set up your umbrellas and cabanas. Oh, and stay away from the rocky area near the left side of the beach during the afternoon. My husband couldn't get back to shore due to the heavier currents. Snorkeling is wonderful during the morning. However, the current really picks up during the afternoons. We didn't eat at the hotel since we wanted to try other restaurants in Kihei. Believe me, there are plenty to try. The spa was great. Probably the best spa experience we've had. You can also use the shower and steam room whenever you want. The pool area was not crowded. Try to go early in the morning to save a seat. You don't have to wake up at 7am to do so. We got a seat around 10am. My husband and I never stayed at the Four Seasons before. After this trip, we've decided that we will try to stay at a Four Seasons whenever we travel. It is truly worth the money. You can't get better service and courtesy anywhere else. It was heartbreaking to leave the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Service in Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: tomaui
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful stay at the Four Seasons Resort Maui and can't wait to return! We were greeted as we got out of our limousine and taken by our concierge to the Club Level for check-in. The room was very spacious and the bathroom as everyone mentions was beyond compare with luxurious amenities. The Club Lounge is accesible any time of the day with complimentary continental breakfast items, daily snacks and afternoon tea, evening hors devours & cocktails and late night cordials & deserts....you could actually stay here on this floor your entire stay and never leave---but we didn't! The restaurants are just too tempting. We ejoyed lunch and dinner at Ferraro's more than once and you can't go wrong with the beautiful views while dining with them. The service and food were both excellent! We ate at Spago and once again were more than pleased with this as well. Overall, you can't go wrong with this resort for pure relaxation and service beyond compare. The conceirge staff on the Club floor was always ready to help with any questions we had and their outstanding service made our stay most enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth!!”
Reviews.Author: EddieDean
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons Wailea from 7/31-8/05 after spending four nights at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel (see that review separately). While I was sad to leave Ka'anapali and all the wonderful restaurants and things to do, all of my tears instantly evaporated the second we drove onto the premise. I have stayed in Wailea twice before at the Renaissance and Kea Lani, but the Four Seasons was far and away the most phenomenal hotel I have ever stayed in. We booked the "Romance for All Seasons" package, as we were getting married at a nearby beach on August 1st and wanted this to be the most amazing trip of our lives. We were NOT disappointed. The minute we drove up in our mustang convertible (which was part of the package, with free overnight valet included), someone came and put fresh, beautiful leis on both of us. They took our bags and lead us to the front desk, where we were instantly greeted with cold towels (which was just what the doctor ordered after a long ordeal at the rental car pick-up). As we checked in, they informed us that they were upgrading us from a partial ocean to a deluxe ocean view room. I was COMPLETELY shocked by this....I have read lots of reviews on here and know better than to expect an upgrade, especially since they were booked to capacity. I have no idea why this happened, unless it was a perk from booking such an expensive package. Or, it may have been because we were scheduled to be in a room with two double beds and we requested a king bed since this was where we would be spending our wedding night. In either case, we were both so excited that the check-in ladies could probably see us jumping up and down. Our bellman took us to the seventh floor (room 714, which was just perfect!) and gave us a tour of the room. There was a bottle of champagne and a nice note congratulating us on our wedding, as well as a jar of dried fruit and petite-fours that we instantly enjoyed on our balcony! The room was very clean and larger than I imagined. The bathroom was also pristine and functional with two sinks, a large vanity and mirror (great for doing hair and make-up!), a walk-in shower, and a jacuzzi tub. There was even a phone next to the toilet!! I almost wish I had used it just to say that I did! One drawback was that our particular room did not have a fridge. I would suggest requesting such a room in case you have leftovers, as we did. We ended up putting our leftovers in the mini-bar since that was refrigerated. There was a coffee grinder and whole beans which we used only once, as breakfast at the Pacific Grille was part of our package. This was a wonderful way to start the day.....they had everything you could imagine from made-to-order macadamia nut pancakes to fresh fruit to purple potatos and hash browns. The BEST item was cheese blintzes....they had these only once and I wept every subsequent day that they weren't on the spread. For kids they had a tot-sized buffet with Finding Nemo plates and powdered donuts...so cute! It was so nice having a large breakfast every morning, and all we had to do was sign the slip since the meal AND gratuity was included with the package. That was a $60 value every morning, and allowed us to snack through lunch most days. Plus, they gave us boxes on the morning we went to Hana so we could pack things up and didn't have to buy any lunch at all! They always referred to us by name, joking around about how our name changed after the wedding on Tuesday, and were eager to help in any way they could. One day my husband went to order a pancake and they covered his tray so the birds wouldn't get at it. Excellent, friendly service no matter who we met! Also included in our package was a couples massage at the spa, which we did our last full day (we chose lomi-lomi....mmmm!!!). The locker rooms were wonderful with a steam room (great for the sinuses!) and delicious ginger-flavored hot tea and lemon water. They had everything a girl could want, from make-up remover to a hair drier....even cold cucumbers for your eyes!! The massage itself was wonderful, though it went by SO quickly! These were obviously professionals with a lot of experience. Tip is NOT included with the massage in this package, so it was one of the few things we paid for the entire time we were there. That evening we had dinner at Ferraros, also a part of the package. In many ways, this was the biggest positive surprise of our trip. From the outside, this doesn't look like a very romantic place. It's right next to the pool! However, now we know why it won an award for "most romantic restaurant!" We had made reservations before we left for Hawaii, and asked for the best table at the best time to see the sunset. Upon arriving at the restaurant they noted that we had the best table in the house and took us to a beautiful spot that overlooked the ocean. I completely forgot the pool was even there! Our waiter was top notch....one of the best I've ever had, actually. When our wine came (which, incidentally, is included in the package up to $75!!), the cork was wet and instead of having us try it, he got another bottle on the spot. Later, when my husband asked for a good dessert wine recommendation, the waiter gave a suggestion and later came back to change his mind because he'd thought carefully about it and came up with a better pairing. Keep in mind this dinner and tip were already included in our package....he was just doing this because he's an excellent server! We told him up front that we wanted to enjoy the experience and had nowhere to be, so he took things slow and let us enjoy the evening. However, he always seemed to know EXACTLY when we were ready to order and gave us just enough time to enjoy everything. I would turn to say something to my husband and would turn around to find I had a new napkin or my glass had been filled. It was unbelievable! The food itself was unique and delicious. I had the lobster risotto which was probably my favorite meal of the trip....I was so sorry I couldn't finish it! We also had great soups, a complimentary calamari appetizer (sometimes calamari can be chewy but this was out-of-this-world!), and split a great dessert because were too full to have our own. At one point, someone sent the violinist who had been playing all evening over to our table to serenade us since we had just been married. It was little touches like that which made us feel that the restaurant was open for us alone. We even got to see the conch-shell ceremony, as he comes around and lights the torches right in the restaurant. As we were leaving we stopped and spoke with the manager, and it was obvious she takes a lot of pride in the restaurant and the service they provide. They didn't even have us sign anything upon leaving.....we probably racked up a $300 bill and were just able to walk out and enjoy our evening. It was an experience I will never forget! For our wedding dinner all 10 of us went to Spago for dinner. We had labored over this decision because we wanted it to be an incredibly special night, and it certainly was. That having been said, I think ANY place would've been special on our wedding night....we were so busy trying to enjoy every minute, every toast, and every bite that in many ways it was completely impossible to capture the moment. The service here was wonderful, and the decor was very cool....it had a much more formal, big-city feel than many of the open-air restaurants we ate at on the rest of the trip. Everyone agreed that the food was delicious, and we went all out from champagne to appetizers to dessert. The wine was specially chosen by my husband's parents and both the red and white were phenomenal!! All and all this was the perfect place to do such a dinner because the service is great, the food is top notch, and it was in our hotel so travelling was not an issue. Also as part of the package they do a bougainvillea trail with champagne and bath soaps in your room. We had them do this on our wedding night instead of our Ferraros night, and it was just beautiful! We left an extra tip for the maids because of this....I can only imagine cleaning up all those petals! Every night they did a turn-down service so we'd walk into the room and hear quiet Hawaiian music playing. We'd go on the balcony and watch the stars (the light pollution is SO much less there!) and realize that this is paradise! I will say, I had read about the pools being crowded and cabanas being hard to come by. This is definitely true. One morning we looked for a cabana around 7:30 and there were only a few left. You really need to get down there around 6:00-6:30 to get a good one. They do NOT enforce the 20-minute rule....lots of people claimed cabanas at 6:30 and never came back until 10:00. It was kind of weird around 8:30 when people were looking for cabanas and even though tons of them were empty, none of them were available. That having been said, there are lots of beach chairs available throughout the day and service is just as good at those. We had drinks and lunch in our cabana one day which wasn't cheap, but certainly was delicious AND fun. We even tried the mai-tai served from a pineapple. *sigh!* I had also read that guests can be very snobby and kids can be unruly at this hotel. We noticed no such thing. In fact, I'm a teacher and am super-sensitive to annoying children, and all the kids I saw were extremely polite and friendly. One little girl bumped into someone at the breakfast buffet and was so cute in apologizing over and over. One day we saw the kids on a scavenger hunt at the Kids for All Seasons program.....they were so well-mannered and sweet! As someone who was there for a honeymoon when they were at full capacity, I never thought the kids were in the way or annoying at all. Some of the adult guests were a little stand-offish, but most of the ones we encountered were friendly and glad to be on vacation just like us! I knew going in that the service would be impeccable, and I also knew most of the amenities and treatments we would receive. That having been said, it's a completely unique experience when it's actually happening to you.....I can't imagine a nicer stay! From the friendly valets who ask about your day to the breakfast staff greeting you with a smile at 6:00 AM, it really is a surreal world where everything is just perfect! There were many times that I felt we were honored guests, receiving special treatment that was for us alone. I have a feeling ALL of their guests feel this way because the hard work they do to make it seem as such. I would HIGHLY recommend booking a package as we did, if you can swing it. It was so nice being able to do things like get a massage and valet park the car without worrying about the bill that we were racking up. We barely got our credit card out the whole time we stayed there because everything was included....even monogrammed bathrobes that we're wearing all over the place! I also would recommend booking things, like dinners, massages, etc. in advance because we were able to get the best tables and times because we didn't wait too late. Finally, I would recommend bringing lots of kleenex because you will cry your eyes out when you have to leave. We sure did....what a way to start a marriage, I don't know how the rest of our married lives will compare to the first few days!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, only problem is the crowds”
Reviews.Author: joeinnyc
Reviews.Content: My new wife and I stayed here on our honeymoon during the last week in July. We found the Four Seasons to live up to its hype as the best hotel on Maui. Here's what I thought: Rooms: They were fine, and I didn't think they were outdated at all. We had a garden view room that could have easily passed for a partial ocean view. Both the main room and the bathroom were very large and spacious. After getting the idea from other reviewers, we asked for a mini-fridge so that we could stock our own wine, sodas, and water, and the ability to grind your own coffee made for the best in-room coffee Iâ€™ve ever tasted. Housekeeping and turn-down were well done, with my only gripe being that they didnâ€™t clean the room until the late afternoon on several occasions. Iâ€™m certain that a phone call would have fixed that if it was a major inconvenience. Food: We ate at Spago and Ferraroâ€™s and thought both were good, if slightly pricey. We also had drinks at the hotel bar and Spago, both of which were excellent. We were also on the bed & breakfast package, which I highly recommend. For what I recall being an extra $25 a night per couple, including tip, we both enjoyed the breakfast buffet. While the selections didnâ€™t change much from day to day, there was plenty to pick from including a lot of fresh fruit, pastries, made-to-order eggs/omelets/pancakes and everything else youâ€™d think to include with breakfast. Amenities: The gym was a mix of outdoor (cardio equipment) and indoor (weights). The view was great and there was plenty of water & towels. Each piece of cardio equipment had a TV which comes in handy if you get bored of the view of the pool/ocean. The only problem with having the equipment outdoors is that itâ€™s hot/humid in the afternoons. We both had nice massages at the spa, which had nice locker rooms available to guests at no charge. The steam room was great although the gym was lacking a sauna or whirlpool. (As an aside, we both went over to the Grand Waileaâ€™s spa and were blown away with what I like to call their water park for adults. My massage wasnâ€™t quite as good but their water treatments more than made up for it, and Iâ€™ve never seen anything else like it.) The game room is actually two rooms; one for video games and one with two pool tables and some other stuff along with a big screen TV. It looked great for both kids and adults. Pools/Ocean: The pools were nice but nothing special. The ocean was great. My biggest complaint, which has been repeated on these reviews, is the competition for the chairs. They will tell you that they do not give towels until 7am, and that if you leave for 20 minutes you will lose your chair. What we found was that if you show up at 7am, you will find books, shoes, and whatever else (we saw a really long deflated float stretched across four chairs) on a lot of the cabanas and good pool chairs. Youâ€™ll also find people who have been up for a while sitting in the other chairs (which is the right thing to do). If you leave your stuff in the early morning without sticking around, theyâ€™re usually nice enough to put a towel on your chair, which kind of defeats the system of not holding chairs. While we did see some things removed, it usually didnâ€™t happen until the other chairs were all taken, so if you want a good view, an umbrella, or a cabana, get there early or be forward enough to remove someoneâ€™s leftover book from the chair you want (we were always early because of the jet lag but I wouldnâ€™t have felt bad doing this). Also, the chairs are very close together, but thereâ€™s not much they can do about that given the space constraints. If they were smart, theyâ€™d get rid of the garden in the middle of the U-shaped building and replace it with a â€˜quietâ€™ pool, which would allow for a more spacious feel. Service: This was the best part. With a rare exception or two, all of our service was excellent and very professional. The pool service was frequent and very cheerful; the valet guys looked slightly overworked but were always happy to help with directions, and everyone else along the way was great. Clientele: Contrary to other reviews, every child that I saw was very well behaved, without exception. Some of the parents on the other hand were not. The pool area had some flavors of an â€œL.A. sceneâ€� which I didnâ€™t care for, but I found that if you avoided those with plastic surgery-enhanced chests, you could also avoid most of the rude people. All & all a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time in Maui”
Reviews.Author: resorttraveller
Reviews.Content: I had been to this Four Seasons twice before, but not for the past five years. I was a little worried about some of the comments here about the rooms not being updated. That being said, we had a great time. The rooms were fine, although they could use updating and will in fact be getting a makeover in September. The hotel is getting ready to add an adult's only pool in January or so. The service at the pool area is unbeatable and standard for any Four Seasons. The only problem is that you have to be down at the pool by 6:30AM to get the location of your choice if you want shade. The cabannas are done on a first come first serve basis and there are probably about 50 of them. I wasn't happy with being far from the elevator when I had requested a room towards the front of the hotel and I thought the bed was too soft. They took care of both problems, upgrading my room to the ocean view at no charge and replacing the mattress. My family and I had an unbelivable time and the week went by too quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Rude security!”
Reviews.Author: AvidTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: While on our honeymoon last week, my husband and I were rudely stopped by two men claiming to be Four Seasons hotel security after we took a couple of pictures of the ocean near the beach (similar to some of the scenic photos posted here). They demanded to see our "film". Shocked we were stopped from taking pictures of the beach and totally intimidated (they were bigger and threatening looking), we quickly showed them on our digital cameras that we are just taking snapshots of the beautiful Maui, nothing else. They did not apologize, told us to leave (we were going to have lunch!) and continued to follow and harrass us until we drove away! It was horrible! It ruined a perfect day. As a disclaimer, our experience with the Four Seasons was limited to that one morning, when we decided to check out their restaurant by the beach. However, that was no excuse for rude and unprofessional behavior from Four Seasons personnel. What a shame. I know where I WON'T be staying or dining at the next time I'm in Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For Families-- Great For Couples”
Reviews.Author: Bongo1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned to the Four Seasons five years after we spent our honeymoon there. This hotel is about as good as it gets. It is every bit as luxurious as it was five years ago and offers the same privacy, picturesque views, tasteful decor and engagement with the water that couples on a romantic retreat crave. That all the rooms have ocean views and that the marble bathroom is as big as a N.Y.C living room complete with a wall length vanity mirror, shelf and seat are extremely appealing. The common areas (restaurants, lobby, galleries) of the hotel are all open air, but not guerrishly so -- also very attractive. But, it is the service that really sets this Four Seasons apart from the other luxury hotels. Ask for a restaurant reservation? It's made promptly and then directions are slipped under your door in an addressed and sealed envelope. Call down for your car? It's there before you can walk down to the driveway. Leave your breakfast table to get more food? A waiter covers your plate to keep the flies away. They know what you need before you ask. The service is almost sublime. We came with an infant. I can't imagine a better hotel for families with young children. They gave us a special fridge for keeping the baby's milk cool; a microwave for sterilizing bottles; a diaper dispenser; a crib with bumper and stuffed animals; a baby's tub and a plastic hippo mouth over the tub faucet to keep the baby entertained while bathing. They baby-proofed the room from head to toe!! The room was safer than our house. And the bumpers matched the room so well that we could barely tell they were there. Oh, and every day they leave a door tag that says "Baby asleep, come back ______." Stroller, sun shades and other accessories for travel with a baby are provided on request. I agree with the other posters about the hoardes of children that take up residence here in the summer. They take over the main pool in the afternoon, leaping off of rocks and swimming into people like drunk sea otters. But, except in the main pool itself, they aren't a bother at all. They don't intrude on the cabanas or swarm through the restaurants. The upper pool, in fact, is typically empty. And there's a hot tub that's exclusively for adults. Frankly, the most forceful human presence is the 40+ crowd -- bronzed, lotioned and on display, sometimes frighteningly so. The spa needs to improve a bit -- facilities are nice but the massages are too much oil and too little massage. And the gym is a bit of a dungeon; they would do well to integrate it with the pools and ocean much as they have done with the stationary bikes. Other than that, the Four Seasons is almost flawless.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: rroxyggurl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Four Seasons for our honeymoon and had a wonderful experience there! As soon as you walk in you know you are going to enjoy your stay. Gourgeous lobby area with a view out to the fountain and pool area. Our room was large, and elegantly furnished from the couch to the paintings, and the bathroom was fit for royalty with lots of marble, two sinks, a deep tub, and glass shower. The lanai had nice lounge chairs, not a stunning view, but some pretty flowers. The resort is kept in immaculate condition, and our room was always extremely clean. The staff is fabulous, and they will take care of your every need. You walk onto the beach and they have a path sprayed so you won't burn your bare feet on the sand. They set up your lounge chair however you want, sun or a shaded cabana chair, umbrella, either towards the ocean or hotel, however you'd like. They give you comfy towels, and then come around with water throughout the day. They also come by and offer fruit, if you are by the pool they come around with ice pops and even offer to spritz you with evian if you want to cool down!! There are lots of complimentary services too: free child care (we didn't need that but heard parents talking that were very happy with it), free cabana chairs at beach, free snorkel gear for 1 hour a day, free scuba lessons, free aerobics classes, free coffee (you can even grind the beans), free valet parking, and more. There are so many activities offered throughout the week as well. The game room has huge screens with free video games, there's also a pool table and shuffle board. The fitness room is also fantastic, it's very open and faces out to the gorgeous view, and many of the machines have TV's on them! Here's the negatives we found: -$12 a day overnight parking, which we were most disappointed about; there is not a free lot, so you're stuck paying -expensive breakfast, $20 per person for continental, we didn't get it and ate elsewhere, so you can avoid this one All in all, the Four Seasons Maui is a wonderful resort where they really want you to enjoy yourself, and you certainly will!

Reviews.Title: “Utterly Amazing”
Reviews.Author: marci0914
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had recently stayed at the Four Seasons Maui for our honeymoon and I have to say that I loved every single minute of it. From the minute that we checked in the the minute that we checked out every single need as completely taken care of. We sat out everyday on chairs overlooking the ocean, the staff took care of setting up the chairs with towels and even opening and closing the umbrella for you. Ice water was poured about every 15 minutes and the staff came around with fresh fruit, ice pops, cold towels and water spritzs all day long. I have to say that I felt completely pampered the entire time I was here. We had a partial ocean view room on the fourth floor and it was great, we had a wonderful view of the ocean, a mountain in the background and of the beautiful gardens. We had a huge lanai with two lounge chairs and a table with two chairs. The room was great and well spaced out and the bathroom was huge. The only problem that we did have during our stay was with some appetizers that we had ordered in the lobby lounge, they were very bland. But after being asked how everything was and complaining about the taste, we were invited back to the bar after dinner for drinks and dessert, which was fantastic, try the triple chocolate dessert. YUM!!! All in all we had a great time and plan on returning next year for our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful, memorable vacation.”
Reviews.Author: Artlauren
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 10 days at the Four Seasons in Maui, July 7-16, where my wife and I â€œcelebratedâ€� our 40th birthdays. Before we selected the 4S, we did a LOT of research, including reading the postings on this site every day (thank you everyone for your wonderful, candid reviews!), and decided that this was the hotel that offered the best combination of luxury, comfort, service, and an atmosphere that is kid-friendly (for our 6 and 12 year old daughters), without the carnival atmosphere. We were not disappointed and would highly recommend this resort to anyone (and have recommended it to everyone since our return). The service was truly world class!! We booked a partial ocean room, but were pleasantly surprised to learn upon check-in that we were given a complimentary upgrade to a Prime Ocean View Room on the 7th floor (Room 765 to be exact). (p.s., I don't know what the art or science is of getting a complimentary room, and I certainly don't take any credit for how we got the room, but it probably has more to do with availability than anything else). The room was amazing with a stunning full view of the garden and the ocean. As you can see from the pictures, we were treated to gorgeous sunsets from the comfort of our lanai. The only hiccup was that the room was not ready until 4:00, but Mandy from the front desk more than made up for whatever inconvenience we may have experienced by providing us with a complimentary dinner at Ferraros (which we neither pined nor asked for). Our girls thoroughly enjoyed their time at the Kids For All Seasons program. They made new friends (whom they still keep in contact with), bonded with the counselors (special kudos to Stacy, Molly and Nikki), and loved all the activities. They learned how to hula dance, created leis, built sand castles, had water balloon tosses, searched for geckos, built a â€œvolcanoâ€� on the beach, had a pajama party, participated in an introductory kickboxing/yoga class, scrapbooked, and created arts and crafts. They didnâ€™t ever want to leave!! (TIP: make sure your kids sign up at least 48 hours in advance for the kids evening programs as those programs are sometimes cancelled if they donâ€™t have at least 8 kids signed up the day before). I read many reviews that were critical of the pool size. I have to partially agree that it would have been nice to have a larger pool, but I never found the pools to be overcrowded. We also never had a problem finding a cabana. The outrigger canoe was a lot of fun. We signed up for the 10 am trip and were able to see a number of sea turtles. The guides were great: informative, funny and lots of personality. We ate at many wonderful restaurants. We especially loved Mammaâ€™s, Nickâ€™s, Sansei (went twice) and Royâ€™s at Kihei. The cheeseburgers at Tommy Bahamas are awesome (juicy and tasty) and, ironically, better than the ones at Cheeseburgers in Paradise. For excellent fish â€˜n chips and fish tacos, go to Kihei and look for the â€œFish and Chipsâ€� eatery next to the Starbucks. The Sweet Spot (also in the same area as the Starbucks) has the best shaved ice. Breakfast buffet at the resort was great, although I would probably not do the bed and breakfast deal again. Although the food was always delicious and I have no complaints regarding the food or the service, 10 days of buffet style breakfast is a bit much. Some days, I would have been happy with a small bowl of fruit and a cup of kona coffee. If you do go, definitely try their macadamia nut pancakes (yummy) and donâ€™t forget to ask for "to go" containers (which we filled up with fruit and danishes and later enjoyed on our lanai). Like other reviewers have said, it was difficult to leave and return to reality! In fact, we missed it so much that weâ€™ve already booked our next trip back in 10 months! Mahalo Four Seasons for a wonderful and memorable vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “Must Read”
Reviews.Author: deedub77
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and 7 year old son spent 5 July nights at the resort and this resort Loves kids, and adults. Pros: The Welcoming Staff - efficient, friendly, helpful, attentive, and overall stupendous. Bell Desk and Greeting Staff â€“ Super attitude and always cold water coming and going. Concierge Desk â€“ We used them daily, they possessed a â€œwillâ€� make happen attitude, and never faltered from day trips (rental cars onsite) to shipping services. Kids Four All Seasons - Our son wanted to attend all day, every day (a first for him), this IS the best kids club ever. The facility was top notch - the teachers were inviting and carefully included every child in each activity from Hawaiian history, crafts to sandcastle building. Iâ€™m also sending a letter to the GM to amplify our appreciation and gratitude. BIG kudos to the Kids Four All Seasons management and staff. Housekeeping - Over the top service. The cleanliness was flawless, even the lanai, every day. We flew to Oahu on the day of checkout and realized we had left some medication in the minibar cooler. Housekeeping found the medication, and kept it chilled for us. A housekeeper offered to meet us in Oahu the following day, Sunday, and bring it to our hotel in Ko Olina! How gracious and helpful could a person be ?! She had a previously scheduled visit with her brother in Oahu, but I challenge anyone reading this to find that type of service in the states. Thank you Rebecca. This level of service was typical of the entrire resort staff. Poolside Cabana â€“ great service, plenty of cool water every 20 minutes, or you may self serve at a hut always a few yards away - lunch and drinks served , we spent three days in pool/ocean side cabanas. Only one day was the service thin for about 1.5 hours. Restaurants â€“ Ferraroâ€™s and Pacific Grille had awesome food and unlike Spago were accommodating to kids. Spa - only purchased gift items. Staff very friendly and welcoming. Beach - Great for swimming, snorkeling, kayaking, yoga, and walking. Cons: None noted. Overall: No brainer, we would definitely stay again. If you're pricing other resorts â€“ check the extra fees, everything at the 4S was included. We also stayed at Ihilani Ko â€˜Olina Marriott in Oahu, and extra fees prevailed â€“ Kidâ€™s Club($65/day), Cabanas($50/day), Daily Resort $20/day).

Reviews.Title: “Won't return!”
Reviews.Author: WaterSkipper
Reviews.Content: Booked a mountain view room, our view was of the parking garage cover, hotel service road and vegitation fence, no mountains to be seen. We were very closed in. The room was nice but depressing to stay in. The courtyard /ocean views from other rooms are very nice. We found ourselves sitting in the hallway enjoying the views from there. We were very very disapointed in the Four Seasons for selling us a room such as this. It was an enourmous amount of money and we got took. Do not book a mountain view room, there is no such view.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous! But what's with the crowd?”
Reviews.Author: HL950
Reviews.Content: Wow!! I was here on my honeymoon and it was a truly fabulous vacation! So relaxing, luxurious, etc, etc. We stayed in a garden view room - and we could actually partially see the ocean, which was a surprise. The room itself was very spacious, but definitely is in need of some new furniture - the couches and chairs look straight out of the 80's! There is VERY little to complain about, however. Very clean, wonderful amenities, excellent and friendly staff. We ate at all three restaurants - Spago was an incredible experience and the breakfast buffet was excellent! I was so excited to eat at Ferarro's and it was disappointing - they forgot about our appetizers altogether and our waitress seemed much more interested in chatting it up with the couple next to us about her personal life. I could barely get my water refilled! Too bad. Funny, I had some of the best food on the trip while I was lounging by the pool - the menu is great (albeit, ridiculously expensive for basically snack food, i.e. $18 caesar salad!!!!) and perfect for the heat! Salads, light sandwiches, drinks. The pool and grounds are GORGEOUS. We had a blast. Now, the crowd was a completely different issue. Since the hotel is relatively small, you really do see the same people over and over. I'm guessing that most people don't venture around the island, but sit by the pool all day. We kept getting stuck by the most annoying, loud, arguing NJ couple on their honeymoon. Trust me, these people are everywhere! Hard to get away since the pool is small and the lounge chairs are practically on top of one another. It seemed to be mainly wannabe millionaire East Coast young couples, OR..... young families with their obnoxious, pampered 0-7 year olds running around, cannon-balling into the pool. Not much in between in terms of demographics. All in all, I would go there again in a HEARTBEAT. Best Hawaii vacation ever. We're already planning to go back as soon as we can! I don't think I could ever stay anywhere else on Maui ever again! Thanks for a wonderful, relaxing stay!

Reviews.Title: “Crowds, dated rooms and overall chaos overshadow a great FS experience”
Reviews.Author: SFGRL3731
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Four Seasons after spending 4 amazing days/nights at the Four Seasons Hualalai in Kona on the Big Island. What night and day difference! While the island of Maui definitely offers more for the tourist (Hana, Lahaina, Wilea , Kihei and other sites to see), the island is just completely overrun with tourists and everywhere we went we saw crowds---a big contrast to the Big Island experience we had. Anyone looking for a comparable experience to the Hualalai's quiet, peaceful relaxation will be in for a shock at the Maui Four Seasons. Our shock first came when we checked in and a woman in her 60's in a bikini and stilleto heels came trotting to the front desk with a young 30-something male quickly following behind her. Immediately we got visions of LA and Vegas (after this experience, I really believe that this is where THAT crowd goes if they go to Hawaii). Then we were showed around the property by our bell boy, who did a fantastic job giving us an overview of the grounds, the beach and even the swimming conditions in the ocean! The focal point of the entire resort is the swimming pool, and on this particular Thursday afternoon, it was a complete circus, with kids running around and loungers and bodies on every inch of grass, tile or beach you can find. I've never seen so many strollers in one property! Then we got into our room. Our room, while immaculate and nicely appointed as you would expect form a Four Seasons, was definitely dated. The bathroom, with floor to ceiling white marble and gold and brass fixtures reminded me of an early 90s Vegas hotel. The WC area also faintly smelled from years of use. Our "lanai" barely had an ocean view and was dark, small, and not inviting at all. The layout of the room, with its extra large bathroom, made the entire place seem significantly smaller than the airy and light-filled rooms at new Four Seasons properties. In fact, the layout of the entire hotel (probably because they have less property to work with at this location) gives a feeling less of a resort and more like an extra-large, upscale hotel. I suppose it is a little unfair to compare this property with Hualalai, which is world-class by every stretch of the imagination, but I suppose this is also why this particular property is closing in September for a multi-million dollar, multi-month renovation. They understand that by other FS standards, they are behind the times here at Maui. But it wasn't all negative. Service was bar none, as again, you would expect, particularly at the restaurants we ate in (Ferraros and Pacific Grill). We got the bed and breakfast package and by the 2nd morning we were on a first name basis with the staff at the Pacific Grill. The valets were also excellent and always timely with getting our Jeep ready for our daily or nightly outings, and even with restaurant recommendations (thanks Jeff!). I got an absolutely fabulous facial at the spa (recently renovated) and my husband very much enjoyed his massage. While getting a cabana in the morning was a circus too, we managed to get one on the "sea walk" (?) away from the craziness and actually enjoyed the service there too, and for most of the day, managed to forget the chaos behind us! The beach is fantastic (if you can ignore the crowds) and you can't beat all the fun things you can do in and around town and on the island that makes the entire trip worth it. Overall, typical great service, food and ameneties are to be enjoyed at this Four Seasons. If you can find relaxation amongst the crowds, it is still one of the best choices for luxury accommodations in Maui. But for the money, I would wait for the renovation to go back to this Four Seasons. Maybe try the Kea Lani next door? We had dinner at Nicks on our last night and food was fabulous. I doubt they're any more peaceful or relaxed though, considering there are crowds EVERYWHERE on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “The real deal”
Reviews.Author: BigdaddyJules
Reviews.Content: Ignore all negative reviews. The sole issue I had with the hotel was the lack of cabanas and pool chairs that created a frenzy at six a.m. with everyone fighting over the limited space. Otherwise, this is truly a 5 star hotel, with 5 star service. We stayed at the Kahala in Oahu (an alleged 5 star resort) after leaving Maui and I can say from first hand experience that there is no comparison. The Four Seasons actually makes you feel like you're getting a deal for $500+ a night.

Reviews.Title: “Kudos to Four Seasons Maui”
Reviews.Author: Aunty Jane
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Four Seasons Maui earlier this year with my sister who was on Maui for business -she's opening a store at the nearby and fabulous Shops at Wailea. I had such an incredible time and thought I will definitely return - the next time on a romantic trip. I just got engaged and I'll get my wish - going now in Nov for my honeymoon. My fiance has never been to Hawaii -of all the islands I think Maui is the best - great beaches, weather, restaurants, shopping, activities and absolutely beautiful I was very excited then heard the resort is doing a renovation of their rooms. When I went this past April, the rooms were spacious and I thought in great shape. But my initial reaction was one of panic so I called the resort and got the lowdown. They need to install cabling for high speed wireless access/new technology and while they're at it will re-do all the rooms with new furniture including 42 inch flat screen TVs!!! Sounds like it will be even better and a nice gal in Reservations told me about a website they created www.fsrmaui.com that answers all the questions I had (without alot of the usual PR fluff). After looking through I am definitely staying at Four Seasons - wouldn't dream of anywhere else and know that my honeymoon will be super - great guy, great hotel, great lava flows at the FS Maui pool!! I've been to other hotels where they either never said a word about any work going on or tried to cover up and by the time you find out (usually when you arrive) it's too late. Kudos to Four Seasons Maui for being upfront and also having an AMAZING hotel and staff....I can't wait to return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons, Maui is a romantic vacation resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 nights at the Four Seasons Resort in Maui. It was wonderful because the staff made it so. The day we checked in we had 3 bellmen helping us get out of the car, walk us to check in and then escort us to our room. Along the way, a bellman explained where the pool, spa, garden areas and restaurants were. It seemed every time we left our room, someone came in to replace towels and leave orchard blossoms in the room. The first night there we came back to our room and dessert treats had been left to welcome us to our first night. There was a coffee pot and individual packages of Kona coffee for us. I liked the coffee so much I asked where I could buy the individual packs myself and the concierge said she'd simply have as many as I wanted delivered to my room! That's service! The day before we were to leave the resort, the managers had a special reception for a few of us and asked how they could have made our stay more pleasing. There was nothing to say because any request we made was more than fulfilled by a staff who puts guests comfort above everything else. The pool was simply lovely in front of the beach access and the restaurant meals were fabulous. In the evening there were very accomplished jazz musicians playing in the lounge. This is not a place I would take my kids, even though they provide a wonderful kids program and a kids pool, because it's such a relaxing pampering place for those of us who need a romantic, quiet, pampering vacation. I understand the hotel is in the process of updating the rooms but our Garden View room was clean, spacious and had a very large bathroom. We really enjoyed the Four Seasons and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The service is amazing, but....”
Reviews.Author: jr0777
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here last month as part of a four night Maui getaway after spending some time at a family reunion on the Big Island. Our first two nights were at the Kapalua Villas (I have completed a separate review for that as well) and the last two nights were at the Four Seasons. We were greeted at the entrance by the valet staff very professionally and while we had arrived before the room was ready every person we dealt with was the picture of service and gracious professionalism. Front desk staff was friendly and helpful and the concierge staff was also good and assisted us with reservations at the on-site Italian restaurant, Ferraro's for our second night. We decided to go off-property for lunch and then returned when the room was to be ready. True to their word, the front desk staff called my cell phone while we were on the property to tell us that the room was ready. Multiple staff members inquired as to whether we were celebrating anything (each separately and at different times so it must be a universal thing to ask by the staff) and after we let them know we were belatedly celebrating an anniversary we were greeted in our room by a cold bottle of champagne on ice. We had a partial ocean view room that was actually angled toward the ocean from one of the side towers and not looking straight onto the water. It was a bit of an effort to get to see the water and you couldn't see it while sitting down on the furniture on the deck due to shrubs that blocked out the view. While standing, you could indeed see the ocean. We had dinner off-property in Kihei at Roy's the first night (great food) and the next day got up early to get a cabana down by the beach located in small groups surrounded by the bushes near the coastal walk (sidewalk that runs parallel to the beach along the front of all the resorts nearby). Basically just relaxed all day and had some lunch at the cabana and then went to the room later to get ready for dinner. Early morning and mid morning was very calm at the beach, good snorkeling water, but by noon the wind starts picking up and by the afternoon the furthest left hand portion of the beach in front of the Four Seasons was closed due to the wind and swell near the rocks on the side of the beach. While the conditions were something to pay attention to it seemed a little extreme to be closing that part of the beach and that you would really have to not be paying attention for that kind of water to be a danger to you. Of course, in the past people have probably not paid attention and that is why they did that but it serves to cut off about 25 to 30% of the beach area directly in front of the Four Seasons when they do that. I also noticed that they removed the umbrellas from the beach lounges and started to collect the lounges from the beach by mid afternoon in those conditions. I don't know if it is a rare occurence that they did this, but it's something to be aware of if you intend to spend your whole day on the beach when the seasonal winds are like they are now. We had dinner that night at Ferraro's and showed up early to get a good table close to the beach. We got to see the nightly torch lighting ceremony which starts in the lobby lounge with conch-shell blowing and some hula dancing and may be a good photo opportunity for you if you want to take pictures of that sort of thing. The food was very good and the wine suggestion was excellent by our server. Everything went well and we ended up leaving early the next day to see the summit of Haleakala before our afternoon interisland flight to the Big Island. PROS: 1. Service is amazing. The little details like addressing you formally by Mr. and Mrs. and your last name by every person on staff to each person asking you what you are celebrating to make sure they take care of you appropriately. 2. Attention to detail. Little things seem to be what separates the Four Seasons even when you are not talking about people and service. Small decorative orchid floats in the fountains to Sony DVD players in the rooms (with free 48 hour rental of DVDs available from the concierge) and Mitsubishi televisions are signs that just the normal Costco brands of equipment will not be appropriate for this hotel. 3. Ferraro's food. It was very good, but of course there was a price to be paid (just like everything else). PRO/CON: PRO: Game room. 2 pool tables, 1 shuffleboard table, 1 ping pong table, 1 foosball table, 1 large TV with some chairs and a video game room all by itself with 6 TVs make the game room a pretty impressive thing to witness. CON: We used the game room for a couple of ping pong games and shuffleboard once. The shuffleboard match was stopped when an 8 year old boy (in the game room with three brothers or friends I couldn't figure out which and his dad sitting in a chair nearby watching baseball) continued to come up and grab the shuffleboard disks off of the board as we were playing. After the third time we asked him not to do that -- and the Dad who saw what was going on did nothing to stop it -- we decided it wasn't worth further aggravation and quit the game. Beware that this is not the only example of children behaving badly and adults behaving worse that we witnessed, but some of that has already been addressed in other reviews and I can only say that I either saw myself or agree with 80 to 90% of what is in those reviews about some of the folks you will run into here. CONS: 1. I'm not sure what the occupancy rate was for the two nights we were there, but it seemed very crowded. We are not big pool people, which is good because the pool was also very crowded and it's a pretty small pool. If you went early to get your place in a cabana or on the beach you were fine. But if you waited too late your pickings would be very slim. Seats later in the evening in the lobby lounge were also hard to come by and it seemed like there were just so many kids around, but I may have been seeing the same ones again and again because the kids that I did see that were in the age range of 6 to about 15 were basically allowed to run wild there. If you like your privacy, I suggest scouting the property for some of the more secluded cabanas or chaise lounges down away from the pool (unless you WANT to be seen) and getting one of those early in the morning. There is a 20 minute rule about abandoning your cabana (which doesn't apply between 11 am and 2 pm so you can get lunch), but I never saw anyone evicted and some cabanas were definitely unoccupied -- but with things there -- longer than 20 minutes and outside of that 11am to 2 pm window. 2. Prices. I know I shouldn't be surprised at the Four Seasons, but it's shocking nonetheless. Of course, if you are staying here you either don't care how much it costs or hopefully you have planned ahead for the cost or you plan to spend your money off-property. 3. Operating Hours. While at our cabana one day I was surprised to learn that drink service didn't start until 10.30 am and lunch service didn't start until 11 am. That means if you want something to drink before 10.30 you need to walk and go get it yourself. Hopefully this doesn't take you more than 20 minutes if they are enforcing the don't-leave-your-cabana rule. And I'm perfectly capable of walking to get my own drinks, but once relaxed in my cabana with a nice book I don't mind paying a few more dollars for an orange juice at 9 am to be brought to me. It won't happen unless you go get it yourself. Same with food before 11 am. Heads up. Also, the lobby lounge doesn't open until 5 pm which leaves only one bar (Ferraro's) down by the pool to get a drink. So if you have spent your day at the pool or beach with some sun and good reading and you would like a drink before dinner your only option may be the bar at Ferraro's which was full the evening we went there, so we couldn't get a seat or a drink. It would seem to me that when one is paying what they are paying at a Four Seasons it would be possible to get an orange juice at 9 am brought to your poolside cabana and it would also be possible to get a glass of wine at 4.30 in the lobby lounge before you have to be at your 6 pm dinner reservation -- especially if the only other bar is full. To be honest while the service and attention to detail are some of the best I have ever seen in any type of setting anywhere, I doubt I would stay here again. This being my first stay at a Four Seasons -- but with experience staying at other high end hotel chains such as Shangri-La and St. Regis -- I expected a better visit. It's not really the fault of the staff at all, but more of the crowding and the guests for me. Other resorts in Hawaii seem to have more space (especially on the Kona side of the Big Island) and less of a crowded feel with good quality service and a cheaper price tag. Of course, if you want people to wait on you (when their operating hours are in effect) and money is no object and you like to be around other people like that then this is the place for you. Maui is a good island, hopefully you will enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Crowded, over-rated”
Reviews.Author: lyssak
Reviews.Content: My husabnd and I stayed here for two nights after spending five days at the Four Seasons Resort at Hulaulai, (it was great! reviewed separately). I would never come back to this hotel--what a dissappointment. We would have left right away if we could have. Just to be fair, let me say that the staff is very friendly and helpful. However, many things disappointed. Our room (ocean view, 6th floor) smelled so musty that we had to keep the door to the balcony open at all times. The pools were a complete joke. They are tiny, and it is very, very cramped around the pool area. It is not very relaxing to sit by a noisy, crowded pool, six inches away from complete strangers. Also, the hotel was really, really crowded and felt that way. The lobby was like Penn Station. The small beach area is shared with many other hotels and condos, so it too is very crowded. The first night we were there, there was a "luau" at the hotel next door. Imagine 500 people sitting at plastic folding tables with an open bar 100 feet away from where you are trying to watch the sunset on the beach. Also--I am sorry to have to say this, but the behavior of some of the guests really is not what one would expect at a hotel in this price range (loud, obnoxious partying late at night; groups of loud, beer-swilling guys at the bar). Is this the Hawaii experience you want? Then you might like this hotel. If you want to relax in a quiet, beautiful environment, try the Four Seasons at Hualalai or the Hotel Hana-Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is top notch. The service is an example of what all hotels, other business's should strive for. We stayed here recently for our honeymoon, and were blown away by this hotel, by far the nicest we have ever stayed at. I would highly recommend this hotel to those looking for a great honeymoon hotel. Yes, it is very expensive, but if you know that going in, you will not be disappointed. We requested a Garden View room, but received a room with a partial ocean view, and a complimentary bottle of chilled Champagne in our room upon arrival. The concierge desk took care of all of our restaurant reservations, and provided printed directions to anywhere we wanted to go in a moment's notice. Walked over to Grand Wailai Hotel next door, looked very busy and croweded, and many more kids than the Four Seasons. Snorkeling right off the beach at Four Seasons was very good, although you have to go out about 100 yards into the water to see the good stuff. You will not be disappointed with this hotel...... if you are, I doubt you would be happy anywhere. Slice of heaven, although an expensive one. Well worth it. JC.

Reviews.Title: “OMG, what a dissapointment. Overrated. Reluctant to give this 2 stars.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a partial ocean view for a week in June (see pics of what they call a partial ocean view). After staying in the Hotel Hana-Maui for the previous two nights and then going to the Four Seasons pool prior to check-in, it was immediate that my wife and I wanted to return to Hana. For more info on Hotel Hana-Maui, please see my recent review. This review is intended to help people make a decision as to where to stay and rreceive the best value for their money. I, like many people, used previous reviews to make this hotel a choice of stay for us. I personally made the wrong choice. It really depends on what you want to do and what fits your lifestyle. My rating score of this hotel consists of the following and I reluctantly give this hotel 2 stars: THE GOOD: 5 Stars - exceptional service from the concierge desk, beach guys, and breakfast staff in the Pacific Grill restaurant. If you want to go anywhere or do anything, the concierge will happily let you know about the activity and provide you with details and directions. Probably the best service I have ever witnessed. Fantastic staff!!! THE OK/NOT IMPRESSED: 3 Stars - The bed was huge and comfortable (Cali King). The room was nice, not overly impressive; the bathroom was a good size. I am not really impressed by big bathrooms since I really only use the sink, toilet, and shower in most bathrooms. I'm not sure why people have gone ape nuts raving about the room and bathroom at this hotel. The rooms are on par with a Mariott or Westin. 3 Stars - Ear swabs, nice shampoo, etc. Not enough to make me go OOOH since we travel with that stuff anyway. 3 Stars - Too many kids, teens, 23 and under adults. Where do these kids work for a living? I want a job. THE BAD: 1 Star - Four Seasons management. We asked for a late check-out due to our flight not leaving until 6pm. Checkout is at Noon. We were told that we were not allowed to check out late because people were arriving for the room. For some reason, I think it's because we weren't spending any money at the hotel (because we were off doing things and visiting Maui). This wasn't surprising to learn of the rejection since they never acknowledged our honeymoon, our robes, or our request for an upgrade. However, upon a second request and telling the hotel that we checked in late without any incidence or worries, that the hotel should return the favor. The second request was granted but we shouldn't have had to ask again. THE UGLY: 0 Stars - The room that we paid a lot of money for was described as an ocean view. See the picture. You can get a partial glimpse of the ocean through the leaves when the wind just blows the right way. When we originally booked this room two months prior, we requested an upgrade because it was our honeymoon. No luck in the upgrade but the front desk person said she would take our name down and upgrade us to another room if it becomes available. She didn't type anything or write anything down so I assumed she had a tremendous memory. I then realized that there wouldn't be any calls for an upgrade. 0 Stars - When we originally booked, the lady from the main office told us that we would receive robes with our initials embroidered on them for our honeymoon. When we arrived and inquired about the robes, management said that they were not included in our package. This wasn't worth fighting for so we said OK, thanks. The truth is we wouldn't wear the robes anyway. In fact, I would have probably used them to wax my car. What did bother me though was that we received two follow-up calls asking us if we wanted to buy the robes for $125 each. Do I need to worry about a car dealership mentality at a resort hotel? 0 Stars - Internet access. $10/day or $9/day for a week. For us, it was $45. Perhaps this isn't a big deal to you, but a little excessive for me to check email 15 minutes a day. 0 Stars - $12 overnight parking. I didn't see any free parking lots available. Again, some people might not mind, but the course of a week, it came out to $105 to just park and check email (not including valet tips). 0 Stars - $5.73 domestic beer. With tip, $7+. Great deal. 0 Stars - The pool. Small and overcrowded. I'll get to the guests here in a sec. 0 Stars - The beach. Overcrowded, jellyfish warnings. This was the worst beach that we went to over our 16 day trek across three islands. We went to 9 other beaches and each one had their own personality. I don't know how this beach ranks up so high with reviewers but it's lacking something. There just isn't any WOW factor with this beach which could be said for the rest of the resort for that matter. 0 Stars - The Guests. Where do I start with this topic? The reviewer who said something about pompous was dead on correct. Cases in point: Exhibit A: Little girl (about 6) runs in front of her father to press the elevator button. No problem. Little girl steps in to elevator where another couple is standing and tries to press a button. Little girl then realizes that the button is already pushed and lit up. Little girl, in a serious tone, tells couple to never do that again. Father laughs. The couple then approaches us and we both agreed that her father will be the one to blame when she becomes a teenager. Exhibit B: Lady walks in to one of the shops and places crackers on the counter. Her credit card is declined. She has them placed on her room account. She's probably mopping floors now. Exhibit C: Who takes a 3 month old baby to Hawaii and lays them on the beach? First of all, did your baby/pregnancy get in the way of your vacation plans? I'm sorry, but if I have a 3 month old baby, a) my wife and I are probably not going to Hawaii or b) our in-laws will watch over our baby in case we had non-refundable plans that we made a year or so prior to delivery and had explored all options to get out of the plans. Exhibit D: The Soprano's Wannabe's. Have you ever met anyone from Jersey (not that all people from New Jersey are bad) and they were loud, rude, obnoxious, and they just keep talking and talking and talking? Meet the Sopranoâ€™s wannabe's coming to a Four Seasons near you. Not only did their ---- smell like roses, but they were grossly overweight. They need to be in a TrimSpa instead of a Four Seasons spa. Exhibit E: The pool area. This was the biggest joke that I have ever seen. Very comical. People who fly thousands of miles to Hawaii to sit on a chair next to a pool every day. It only took us 3 hours and a day at the beach and pool to figure this out. These people talk about getting fruit and service and blah, blah, blah. Pay me (cash only) and I will come over to your country club or community pool and throw some pineapple your way. Just the thought of people traveling to lie at a pool is mind boggling to me. No road to Hana, no day spent at the world famous Ka'anapali Beach or Whaler Village, no sunset from the west side of Maui, no fish taco's from Jawz, no snorkeling with the turtles at the turtle towns, no mingling with the locals, no magic show? --- is wrong with you people? One lady told me the beach at the FS was the best in Maui. LOL. Again, the reviewer who said that the guests were pompous hit it dead on. These people are lying on top of each other at the small pool and you can just about hear them screaming for attention "look at me, see me, it's all about me, I am the only one, look at me". Very sickening. This is not a place to relax. In fact, it's downright stressful. +++ Are you seeing a trend here? Hint: Taking responsibility for the priorities in your life. I am not filthy rich but I do make a very good living. I don't try to convey myself as someone who thinks they are important by yelling on a cell phone at the pool, wearing my collar up on my neck (which looks stupid BTW), or investing hundreds into the latest swimwear. If it were not for the arrogance (and ignorance) that spewed from most of these guests, my rating may have gone to 3 stars. Enough of the guests because these aren't my problems even though it does make me feel great being around these types of people! Given our recent experience at this hotel, we will never go back to the Four Seasons again. Instead, the next time we are in Maui, we will stay in the Ka'anapali Beach area. That is probably the best beach that I have ever been to. Its kid friendly, amenity friendly, activity friendly, shopping friendly, and diving friendly. The only negative there was the lack of parking. We will definitely stay in Hana again too.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, dated rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights for a wedding. Expected much more out of the Four seasons. The rooms were dated and paid $500 per night for a PARTIAL ocean view which was not. Good service but food was very expensive for the quality. Tried Spagos one night and was good but not worth $45.00 per entree. Drinks were outrageously expensive!!! Beach was nice but nothing like the Caribbean.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Tana_Sam
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Maui for our Honeymoon a few months ago. First I booked us at the Grand Wailea next door.. as a child I had fond memories of the pool and vacationing there with my family. We discovered there was a 4S there too and I went back and forth on what to do as we are partial to the 4S. I must say we made the right decision! In fact I think this was one of the nicest 4S resorts we've ever stayed at! The service is outstanding. The rooms are spacious and clean regardless of type. The L'Occitane products are so thoughtful. The dining was fabulous- but we only ate at the Italian restaurant, Farralon- few times for lunch and once for dinner. It was delish! The breakfast is wonderful- i reccomend doing the all inclusive which includes b'fast. We never ate at Spago. If you're trying to decide where to stay- you can't go wrong with 4S maui! Also, we took a walk over to the Grand Wailea and it was swarming w/ kids! *Not for honeymooners! * If you need any help or ideas of what to do while you're there I'd be happy to help!

Reviews.Title: “Cant say one bad thing!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Husband and i went there on June 5th, for our honeymoon. We stood there 8 days, and we thought it was the most amazing place ever. We travel all over, and I must say that I am so picky when it somes to hotels, and have the highest expectations when checking in to a hotel. The fs certainly surpassed all expectaions. The service was amazing, the food was delicious ( and being from new york we are used to the best resteraunts) , the rooms were very clean and didnt seem as outdated as others had expressed. The workers were the most accomodating that I have ever seen, at the pool they were the best. Tip them a few dollars every day, the really work very hard, they set up cabanas for you, put your towels out, spritz you with evian, give you frozen grapes, great poolside service (as far as drinks and food) etc. Ferarras and spago were both unbelievable. Now heres the deal, everything is very expsensive, but well worth it. I feel like although it is very $$$, you get so much in return, such as the gym, cabanas, beautiful lobby, concirege that will do anything you need( in fact we were heading to vegas and they made all my dinner reservations for us ), and impeccable service. Cant say one bad thing!! enjoy! just get to pool early to reserve a cabana.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMan577
Reviews.Content: Not impressed. "Full Ocean View Room" means if you look real hard, and crane your neck out of the balcony, you may see ocean. "Lunch" means $75 for an overcooked burger, gross resort pizza, and two average tropical drinks. "Resort" means cramped grounds with too little lounging space and rubbing shoulders with 500 pompous guests. "Service" means welcome to the Hilton, but you look rich so give me an extra $200 a night.
