Things do happen, we understand. However, we expected more from managament recognizing this inconvenience. When you have things to do on your honeymoon, the last thing you want to do is spend the time in your room packing your things up again to be moved. 2) The breakfast buffet in the hotel was not very good. After eating other breakfast buffets at the other hotels, we were disappointed at the quality and selection of food plus the fruit flys and birds flying around didn't add much to the ambiance. 3) The staff were nice, pleasant but it never seemed sincere. The service was great at the Ritz and Kapalua Bay Hotel and always seemed sincere. I expected the same at the Four Seasons. 4) The pool always felt crowded, even when it was not full. The cabanas are very close to each other and you feel like you are on top of other people. If you are looking for seclusion, quiet and a beautiful area, the Ritz-Carlton in Kapalua is the better choice. It did rain and it was windy but it was not crowded at the pools or in the hotel. The beaches weren't as nice as the beaches in Wailea and the restaurant selections were not as plentiful, but the quality of the hotels and service in Kapalua won us over. If you are looking more for convenience of location and great beaches then stay at the Four Seasons. Hope this helps in your planning.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: cgalpin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons Wailea for six nights and had a fabulous vacation. We had a garden view room and enjoyed our patio which was perfect for room service breakfast, quiet reading and drinks before dinner. Our friends had a mountain view room and were equally happy. The rooms are large and have the best bathroom set up I have seen in a resort hotel, very large, lots of counter space. The staff were excellent and anyone we asked for assistance was extremely helpful. We tried all of the restaurants. Ferraro's is the best for lunch or dinner. Seats by the ocean are first come, first serve but well worth showing up for at 11:30. We had drinks one night later in the lobby bar. The entertainment was pleasant but the service on drinks was very slow. Waited 15 mins to be served even though we asked twice. Spagos was very disappointing. It is highly overrated and I recommend you do not go there. The service was average and after we sat in the bar for a pre-dinner cocktail and I watched all the plates coming from the kitchen by bare handed servers, it was clear the plates were not hot. When ordering dinner, I specifically requested my plate be "smoking hot" and was advised it would be no problem. Appetizer of lobster risotto was served luke warm on a stone cold plate. Dinner came on the same, so I sent it back. Should not have had to. A restaurant of this calibre should never serve hot food on cold plates. To their credit they gave us our desserts complimentary but overall we were very dissatisfied with the whole experience. If you want an excellent dinner, go to Capische. It is in the Diamond Resort which is only a 5 minute drive from the hotel. Excellent food, service and view. Plan to arrive just before sunset. All tables are outside and the view is fantastic. Pool scenario was great. We really liked their system for assigning chairs. When you arrive at the pool you pick your location and it is yours for the day as long as you don't leave it for more than 20 minutes. None of the get up at the crack of dawn and rush down to get towels to save your chairs nonsense. At lunch they hold it for two hours which is very reasonable. Great paved walkway along the beach. We would all definitely return to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: Kendie
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 9 night stay in Hawaii. 5 nights on the Big Island and the last 4 nights on Maui at the Four Seasons. As is the case with most Four Seasons resorts, the service was superb, the common areas beautifully decorated with floral designs and artwork, the room was beautiful with a large bathroom and exellent bedding, and the staff was very easy to work with, giving us late check out, etc. Breakfast was included with our package and was delicious with so many choices on the buffet. Previously we have stayed at the Grand Wailea and the Kea Lani, after leaving the Kaanapali area when we felt it became too crowded with hotels and tourists. Unfortunately, the same thing is happening in Wailea. We chose the golf/mountain view after having an oceanview room on the Big Island, realizing we would not have that same experience. However, the hotel should make guests aware, that if you choose those rooms you will be: (1) Very close to the main road in Wailea and will hear cars zooming past your balcony (2) Adjacent to the parking garage with it's noise (3) Directly in view of a huge construction project just across the road. Heavy earth moving equipment woke us up most mornings by 7:00 AM. This is not the quiet Hawaiian experience we have come to appreciate on our visits to the islands. We did not sit on our balcony at all because of the noise. The mountain view was OK, but after the townhouses are built, that will change as well. The pool area is VERY small, and quite shaded. The beach was also crowded and you needed to be there before 10:00 AM to get an umbrella. The beach attendants did their best to put shade canopies on lounge chairs and accomodate us, however. It is a nice swimming and snorkeling beach. It seems, however, like a large resort on a small tract of land between two larger, more expansive hotels. The townhouse project (175 units) across the street will only add to the congestion in this area. The Shoppes at Wailea is a nice addition to this area and we enjoyed Ruth's Chris and Cheeseburger, Mai-Tais and Rock n Roll. This was our first, and probably our last stay at this Four Seasons. We will choose to stay at the Kea Lani on our next visit, or the more quiet area of the Ritz Carlton. Altho the Kea Lani is the next resort to the Four Seasons, it is set back farther from the road, and does not have construction, but a golf course across from it, as well as more lawns and pool area. It does not have the same level of service or staff, but will provide a quieter, more relaxing experience. We were not offered an upgrade, and did not complain too much about the noise, but management should not put anyone in these rooms as long as there are rooms elsewhere in the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect wedding at the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got home from our wedding at the Four Seasons on Maui. This place is so beautiful, and we highly recommend it. We had such an amazing time and a perfect wedding. The wedding coordinator was so sweet and did a great job, and we didn't have to worry about a thing. We got married on the Seasons lawn, overlooking the ocean. It was truly our dream wedding in a magnificent place. We can't stop talking about it! Some quick misc. feedback: The restaurants were all very good. You really can't go wrong. We tended to go to Pacific Grill more than any other. My family really liked the staff there. My mom was addicted to their souffles, which change nightly. I started to worry about fitting into my dress, but they did have healthy options everywhere we went. :) There is some decent snorkling off the beach at the resort. They have snorkling gear that you can rent on site. We didn't have time to go out, but heard that it is also fun to take a boat to better snorkling sites. The resort is in a good location, close proximity to the rest of Wailea. There are some fun places to check out nearby, like Maui tacos, Roys, and Hilo Hatties (if you are feeling touristy). Other than that, I don't have much to say. The staff were pleasant and professional, the rooms were wonderful, the spa was fantastic, and we really didn't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Objectively speaking, one of the be$t.”
Reviews.Author: sbags
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property twice in the last month; once for four nights and once for only one night. Both stays were in my personal top ten of hotel experiences. In summary, the highlights of this hotel are the amazingly nice, down-to-earth people that work at hotel and the first-rate amenities. The only negative aspect of visiting here is the very high cost of drinks, snacks and spa treatments. Ultimately, at the FS in Maui, you get what you PAY for. Point by point: 1)Rooms: Spacious with hugh marble bathrooms. The carpet and furniture is slightly worn, but luxurious nonetheless. All rooms have balconies, but beware of "partial" ocean views which will have you hanging from the railing to spot the surf. We were upgraded to the Honeymoon suite on my first visit....ridiculous 1800 SF room with its own large ocean view terrace. I can't really fully explain that room. 2)Service: There are a few rules like no drinks at the beach or in the game room, but, within reason, they pretty much facilitate whatever you want to do here in a professional fashion. They rarely say no to anything. The poolside service is very, very good. 3)Pool: I agree that, for the price tag, a larger pool may be in order. However, the overall pool experience is top notch and provides a respectfully social atmosphere that only rarely deteriorates into a sardine-like event. If it gets crowded, you can go down to the beach and have much more space or back to your lanai to enjoy some solitude. 4)Dining: Expensive, but Spago and Ferraro's are excellent. Request table #75 at Ferraro's for 6pm and enjoy an amazing sunset and dinner. The host and hostess at Spago were a little full of themselves, but the rest of the staff was very helpful and nice. 5)Concierge: Helpful but not overbearing. They don't try to sell you on packages or tours, but they can arrange whatever you need. The beach concierge gave sage advice on where to snorkel and we saw a turtle and eels right off the beach in front of the FS. 6)Extras: Putting green, lawn bowling, snorkeling, outdoor fitness area, spa, game room with video games, pool, ping pong, big TV, kids activities, fitness classes, etc. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: HinChgo
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the Four Seasons on Sept 20, 05, we were tired, jet lagged, and frustrated from getting lost on the way from the airport, but the Four Seasons put us at ease. We were on our honeymoon and they not only took care of us and treated us like first class guests upon arrival, but they also upgraded us to a suite (which was double the price we reserved per night). Now for the REALLY good stuff!... Every day around 10AM starts their beverage and food service poolside. Nevermind the fact that anyone will get you what you need at any time, but at 10AM they will bring you lattes, cocktails, food, anything! They pass fresh strawberries before noon, frozen grapes around 1PM, and popsicles at 3PM every day. They assist you with setting up your chairs and bring you fresh towels when you don't even ask. Not to mention the view is MAGNIFICENT! The food was good, Ferraros was nice, pretty view, overpriced, but so is everything on this island, so in comparision it was on par. Spago is great - food, ambiance - but make resos early! They have a lighting ceremony every night around 6 or so which is kind of neat, kind of cheesy; we just happened to be witness to it because we had a glass of wine in the lobby bar. The concierge is great. Top notch. Took care of all reservations off site, including restaurants and private surfing lessons. They send you off with a map and directions every time. They even gave us bottles of water and towels when we went to our surfing lesson when we didn't even know to ask! Spa was fantastic. I had a Lomi Lomi massage in the spa and I get massages every week, but I have never felt so relaxed and pampered. My husband and I also had one of the foot massages that they offer poolside. Both were great! (I wish I could say the same about my experience at the Grand Wailea - that was horrible - so much so I wanted to leave and pay for services not received!) We LOVED this hotel and would stay there over and over. It's great because I can find flaws in anything - seriously, and I was hard pressed to say anything negative about our experience there. They had turn down service and maid service twice daily so when we returned from dinner we came back to music and wine, I can't say anything bad! I wish there were more chairs overlooking the ocean, but we were up early so it wasn't a problem. I never saw every chair taken by the pool, only overlooking the ocean. In summation, AMAZING and well worth any extra cash you have to spend. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons from September 27th through Ocotber 4th for our honeymoon. It was beyond what we expected! This was the best vacation my wife or I have ever had. The service at the Four Seasons is incredible. The will do ANYTHING to make you happy. The rooms are large and beautiful. We had an oceanview and I was happy we spent the extra money as the view was great. The pool and jacuzzis are amazing. The breakfast buffett is awesome and worth the money. Spago was the best restaurant we ate at and we saved it for the last night. Nick's Fishmarket at the Fairmount was HORRIBLE. The service is the worst I have ever experienced and we are not people that complain. The food was only average. I would not recommend going to Nick's. You must go to Mamma's Fish House....Excellent food and beautiful setting. We also did the helicopter ride........must use Blue Hawaiian. It was worth every penny and the people at Blue Hawaiian were great. If you are adventurous then you must do the Road to Hana. It is worth the all day trip....beautiful watrerfalls and beaches. Make sure and see the sunrise from the mountain (Haleakla?). It is VERY cold, but is was worth it. The view is amazing. I would recommend the Four Seasons to everyone. We had the best honeymoon possible. You will not be disappointed with the Four Seasons. Also, we attened the Luau at the Marriott next door. The Luau was great and the food was wonderful. We will definitely be going back to Maui and the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “A Slice of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons met my wife and I's expectations and more! As soon as you arrive on the property the hotel staff take you away to paradise! We were met in our room with desserts from the hotel along with a quality bottle of Champagne. We were celebrating 12 years of marriage. The breakfast Buffet at Pacifice Grill is wonderful the view of the ocean is worth the price. We ate at Spago's also and loved the service and their drinks but the entree we ordered was terrible. We believe we just ordered the wrong item. Nice view of the Ocean with the sunset. If you don't mind driving to Lahaina go to David Paul's. It was the best food in Maui. Awesome and worth the price. The Four Seasons Resort sits right on Wailea beach which was voted the best beach in America. The beach attendant treats you like you were a king or queen. They bring you water and slice of fresh pineapple. The Four Seasons has the best part of Wailea beach. We went Snorkeling every morning after breakfast to the left near the rocks and saw tons of fish. The mornings are the best time to snorkel because the water is calmer. The trade winds tend to start blowing in the afternoon which make for rougher waters. The water temp. was 83 degrees right in Wailea. I asked and the hottest it gets is 84. It was pefect. The conceirge service in Four Seasons were great and assisted us with all our outtings but they forgot to inform us the fee that they do charge if they book an event for you. I would recommend booking your own event unless you don't mind paying the extra fee of 6 bucks and change. We highly recommend the couples massage at the Spa it was worth every penny. We are already making plans to visit the Four Seasons Resort in Maui next year. It was the best and more!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DBE
Reviews.Content: Spent part of our honeymoon here in September - fantastic hotel and service. Nice large rooms with huge marble bathrooms. Food - expect to spend 100 - 150 dollars for an evening meal for two at the resorts in Wailea although the food is excellent. The Breakfast buffet was 28 dollars but great tip that they give you containers to take away food for any day trip. Enjoyed Spago's and especially Nick's Fishmarket at the Kea Lani. The Pupu Seafood lounge and grill in Kihei was a good cheaper option. Really good sandwiches at the poolside and at Tommy Bahama's. Really enjoyed the Luau at the Renaissance Wailea. The best time at the pool seemed to be 8:30 - 12 as the wind does tend to pick up after that. Bring your sun cream as the sun can be very strong ! Enjoyed the trip to Hana but not so much the bumpy part that they don't insure hire cars on - went with Polynesian adventure tours and would rather have seen more of the waterfalls etc before that part of the road if possible.

Reviews.Title: “one word... awesome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Imagine laying by the pool, Pacific Ocean waves crashing in the distance, and a pool cabana attendant walks by and offers "cool towel, Evian spritzer, fresh pineapple?" I work in resort managment and know great service when I see it. The service at the Four Seasons Maui is amazing. My friend and I returned to the hotel from taking a scenic drive, and when we pulled up, one of the many doormen came to open my door. For some reason, the door would not open, they told me, "we will take care of this." When we got back to the room less than 30 minutes later, there was a message from the concierge "we have a new rental car for you, the keys are being held in your name at the valet." At the Four Seasons Maui, every need was anticipated, before I even knew I needed anything. I attended a wedding there in August, and my only regret, is that I didn't stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional accommodations and quality service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there (surprise, surprise) for our honeymoon. We knew right away we were going to Maui, but were not sure where we wanted to stay. We received all kinds of recommendations on hotels, but in doing my own research, I had zeroed in on the Four Seasons. Everything I read about it just gave it more and more appeal. I liked the fact that it was a little harder to check availability (ie., couldn't find dates we wanted on Orbitz, Travelocity, etc). We ended up contacting a travel agent (Julie Bridle @ McCoy Travel) in Maui who coordinated it all for us. We were 100% pleased with everything...from the ocean view room we had to the level of service with everything. We enjoyed every facet of the hotel. The dining is phenomenal...from the brunch in the morning to the dinners at the restaurants on the property. Many people had referred us to stay at the Grand Wailea, but didn't hold any appeal for me. Once we got to Maui....I am SO glad we chose the Four Seasons over the Grand Wailea. Especially for a honeymoon, the Grand Wailea was overrun with kids and had a family vacation feel...looked a little run-down if you ask me. The Four Seasons had some children, but you would never now. Overall, I cannot say enough about the Four Seasons, Maui! It was an exceptional trip with exceptional accommodations! Worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: jamesmoSurrey
Reviews.Content: Went to the FS in August for our honeymoon. Upon arrival we were immediately upgraded from ocean view room to ocean front suite which was amazing. Ate at all the restaurants and enjoyed them all. Beach is lovely and has good snorkelling near the rocks too. The staff were all really friendly and the sevice is excellent. Only criticisism really is that the pool is a little small but the beach is so close that it doesn't really matter. I would definitely reccomend the four seasons to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: AnnieNovak
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the FS Maui for our Honeymoon (9/11-9/17) and we had a fantastic time. We booked a partial ocean view and were upgraded to a deluxe ocean view. We had just come from the FS Hualalai on the Big Island. The FS Maui isnâ€™t as breathtaking or elegant as the FS on the Big Island, but we still very much enjoyed the hotel. The entire hotel is spotless, the grounds are perfect and there is an incredible view from every public space. The pool area is beautiful and the views of the ocean are fantastic (the hotel is set up a bit higher from the beach). They have tons of umbrellas and free cabanas and they set you up on the beach too. Everything about this hotel just works well. Itâ€™s elegant and the service is professional. We had drinks and walked through the Grand Wailea Resort next door and while their pools are more grand (water slides, rope swing, swim up bar), the hotel wasnâ€™t as clean and the lounge chairs and bar service wasnâ€™t as good. The Grand Wailea just felt less elegant and more casual. The crowd at the FS is a mix of young and old. There were some â€œbeautiful peopleâ€� but the place is not overly pretentious or stuffy. We were in very casual clothes (cotton dress/skirts/shorts with flip flops) most of the time and we didnâ€™t feel out of place anywhere in the resort. Rooms: Huge beds and the biggest hotel bathroom Iâ€™ve every seen. The housekeeping was very good and the room was in great condition. Nice, but I didnâ€™t think the dÃ©cor was all that outstanding. Beach & Pool â€“ fantastic! The pools are a little small, but we didnâ€™t go there to do lap swims (go to the ocean just a minute away!). The service around the pool is friendly and the chairs are super comfy (we never had a problem finding a spot). I also used the gym in the morning and used their beautiful complimentary spa locker rooms to keep my gym/beach clothes in for the day. Food: good, but expensive. $18 wines/$48 steakâ€¦Spagoâ€™s wasnâ€™t all that good and the service was mediocre for what you are paying for â€“ we were disappointed. Ferraroâ€™s is very good and had excellent views of the ocean. Pacific Grill was also excellent (very good buffet breakfast-$28). Lastly, the FS Maui is beautiful hotel (the best on Maui) with a great staff and service. If we come back to Maui we would probably stay there again. I highly recommend though the FS Hualalai on the Big Island. Itâ€™s less â€œhotelâ€� and more of a stunning resort.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: Brecon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Four Seasons and thought it was fantastic. The service from the check-in to the check-out was impeccable. My only critism would be the food at Ferraros, neither my husband or I thought it was up to much, although the setting was perfect. Both at Ferraros and Spagos we were given prime tables as it was our honeymoon. The food at Spagos incidently was amazing. The buffet breakfast was also top notch and the waffles were to die for. The hotel sits right on one of the best beaches in Maui and both the poolside and beach attendents were extremely attentative. My only critsism, as with the previous review, is that there is not a lot else there apart from other big hotels. But if you want to get away from it all then this is the perfect setting. The rooms are very luxurious as is the hotel. I would also recommend a spa treatment while you are there. Within driveable distance I would also go to Big Beach (we were lucky enough to snorkel with eagle rays at sunset) and Secret Cove, where we literally did have the beach to ourselves for a large part of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Quality”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We agree with other reviewers that the hotel is luxurious, the service is outstanding and the pool/beach areas are very nice. Here are a few other thoughts/highlights: - We loved the cabanas near the pool with views of the beach - free of charge and we never had to wait (although admittedly we did arrive quite early each day, due to jet lag!) - Ferraro's Lunch and FS Buffet Breakfast are excellent - definitely ask for the breakfast package (we did not do this and regretted it) - Treat yourself to an ocean or partial ocean view room. We went for a lower end, mountain view room and were disappointed. The view was of a parking lot and the room was slightly dark. If you want to save some money, check out offers at the Ritz Kapalua - we also spent 2 nights there and loved it. If you go for the FS, spend the extra money for the real thing! - Overall, best service we have ever experienced. The valet attendants are particularly good - they think of everything (e.g. beach towels and water for the road trip!). Other comments: - We were disappointed in Wailea itself. It feels like a country club / Florida setting - everything perfectly manicured with very little "culture". The beaches are fine but there are nicer places on earth. In Hawaii, we preferred Kapalua Maui and Kauai. - We would NOT recommend the road to Hana unless you have 1 week or more in Maui. We spent one of our precious 5 days on the road and were completely underwhelmed! If you do do it, at least drive a little further than Hana to Ocho Gulch waterfalls/pools - touristy but nice/fun. The FS is top notch - we would definitely consider going back.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: Millzo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Seasons in Maui last week for 5 days. While it is a nice resort there is nothing that makes it that outstanding. I stayed at the Kea Lani last year and the rooms were so much nicer and spacious. I found nothing about this hotel to be remarkable. There was nothing that made this resort stand out for the price that was paid. It was simply average and ordinary. Next year I will without hesitation go back to the Kea Lani and not the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Planning our next trip!”
Reviews.Author: redmoon11
Reviews.Content: We are already planning our next trip! We stayed 9.1.2005 - 9.10.2005. The FS is an island paradise all by itself. From check in to check out, we had nothing but great service and great times. The grounds are wonderful, the view - of course is fantastic. Every restaurant as well as the bar/lounge has a view. The room (the "Garden View" was more than you need. Huge bathroom) was perfect. This is a place were you could go and never want to leave your whole vacation. Where else can you get fresh fruit, â€œotter popsâ€� and a Evian misting as you lay by a ocean front pool. Every morning in the lobby they had different local artists displaying the art. We enjoyed the feel, the look and the staff of the FS. Everyone we met (from Mission Viejo to Baltimore) where just as happy as we were to be there. In reading some of the other (not-so-good) reviews, I say this... â€¢ ...as you have planned this escape to the FS you should plan your stay, and if it includes dining in one of the restaurants at the FS them make your reservations early upon arrival and or before you depart for your trip. â€¢Restaurants can be pricey - sure, we ate at all three places at the FS, Ferraros, Pacific Grill and Spagos and did not have a bad meal. Eating at any "nice" restaurant on Maui we found the prices to be comparable. We ate at several - from Mamaâ€™s Fish House to Leilani's On The Beach, all had fairly comparable prices. --FYI - Maui Tacos is fantastic for fish tacos and enchiladas, dinner for 2...$13.50! â€¢ We were there for 9 days and never had a problem getting a cabana by the pool - 8 am, 9:30 am, 10:30 am, or 1 pm, never. Grant it it was â€œoff-seasonâ€�. â€¢ Drinks can be pricey (I suggest hitting the Safeway on your way in and stocking you own in-room bar), though it is inevitable that you will have a drink (try the Lahaina Lemonades) at the pool. You going to the FS... remember, you will spend some money. So... - Remember where your going. - Plan ahead if your set on dining at the resort (though, not necessarily needed) - You will spend some money - Shop at one of the grocery store for booze, suntan lotions, and snacks! All in all, the weather the food the service, AND the Four Seasons was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The FS is a beautiful resort, service is very good (but not great). During check in, we had to make it to our rooms on our own b/c the front desk/bellhops were backed up. The pool is nice, poolside service is wonderful. The restaurants on site are average to good. The Italian restaurant is average at best, we've had much better and cheaper Italian food elsewhere. Spago ranged from average to good in terms of the food, however the service was average at best-not at all what you would expect. The rooms are nice and spacious. We noticed that by afternoon, many guests from the neighboring resort were taking up cabanas by the pool-which got to be a little annoying- perhaps if the pool staff asked for names/rooms it might help to alleviate the prob. All in all a beautiful resort and a great stay but in terms of service the halekulani in oahu was better.

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as what I expected...”
Reviews.Author: Lovedlanai
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from two weeks in Hawaii for our honeymoon. I used this site so much during my planning I figured itâ€™s the least I can do to write about our experience and to offer our perspective. We spent our first 6 nights on Lanai at the Manele Bay Hotel, followed by 5 nights at the Four Seasons on Maui. My â€œgoalâ€� in planning our trip was to spend the first part of the honeymoon at a more secluded spot (ie, Lanai) and then move to a more active/developed area (ie, Maui). We loved the Manale Bay hotel - unfortunately our stay at the Four Seasons on Maui was not as wonderful. It almost doesnâ€™t feel right for us to write this review, because we are not negative people at all and are hardly discriminating travelers. Weâ€™re relatively young, 27 & 25, and are not picky at all, but do have some expectations at the price-point of the Four Seasons. Now donâ€™t get me wrong â€“ this is a Four Seasons from top to bottom â€“ the facility is beautiful and immaculate, the food is superb, the service is the best on any island, and the pool service is outstanding. The problem is, this resort is just a little too big for its own good. I think it has around 400 rooms â€“ and when itâ€™s at capacity, you can feel it bulging at the seams, especially around the pool. I can see how if the place was maybe half-full, then it would be wonderful â€“ but if itâ€™s full, be prepared to get a little close with your neighbors. People get to the pool starting around 7am to get the best spots. Anytime after 11 and you could be in trouble. We arrived at 1pm and had to wait a bit for our room to be ready. Went to the pool to just sit and relax and wait but were told there were no chairs available. Definitely a disappointment. Aside from the Four Seasons, I was a bit disappointed in how the whole island of Maui is developed in general. Wailea is basically a planned resort development, as are most of the places on Maui. They are all very nice and clean â€“ just a bit generic. It sort of felt a bit like Florida â€“ except with better weather and clearer water. The Four Seasons shares Wailea with several other large hotels, the Fairmont Kea Lani, the Grand Wailea (aka Wally World) and a Marriott Renaissance. It shares the beach with all but the Kea Lani. There is a shopping district in the middle, with several high end stores (ie, Louis Vetton, Tiffany, etc) and some restaurants. I can see how some people would enjoy this type of amenity while on vacation, but being from a big city â€“ I go on vacation to get away from stuff like that! Also, the Four Seasons is definitely a kid-friendly place. I would guess that over half of the guests there were with children. The Four Seasons does a good job in programming activities for them, it seems. My wife and I werenâ€™t really bothered by all the kids â€“ except at the morning breakfast buffet. The food area is a bit too small and just isnâ€™t big enough for roaming hungry adults and children running around, trying to reach everything. I wonâ€™t complain about the prices, because thatâ€™s just the way things are at the Four Seasons. I actually thought the food was pretty reasonable. We had lunch twice at Ferrarroâ€™s which was excellent, and the best service we had anywhere. They definitely get you with the drinks though - $13 mojitos â€“ ouch! Glad they made them strong! I really donâ€™t mind the prices and was expecting that, but when a cocktail gets in to that mid-teens pricing â€“ I start to count how much money is left in the wallet!!! We would have eaten at Spagoâ€™s just to see all the hype â€“ but couldnâ€™t get a reservation at a decent time (which was a bit disappointing). Spagoâ€™s is a destination in and of itself, so youâ€™re fighting for reservations with the 400+ guests at the Four Seasons, and also the thousands of people staying in Wailea! I really hate to be so negative â€“ because at the end of the day my wife and I had a decent time. We enjoyed the spa (which is top notch), snorkeling at the ocean, and the workout facilities (although since everyone is a health-nut who stays at the Four Seasons, be prepared to share that too!). During most days we got off the resort â€“ took the road to Hana one day (you have to do it), also did some shopping in Lahaina â€“ which is a typical tourist trap, but does have some character. Everyone we talked to told us to eat at Cheeseburger in Paradise in Lahaina â€“ so we did â€“ but must admit the burger wasnâ€™t anything special. We played the Blue Course at Wailea and had a great time â€“ very forgiving course, and beautiful. The Four Seasons has some kind of deal with them, and we had a great discount on greens fees. There is a great Irish restaurant in the clubhouse called Murphyâ€™s â€“ typical Irish pub with nightly entertainment and a lot of character. At first the thought of drinking a Guiness in Hawaii stuck me a bit odd, but after that first sip â€“ it was great. Best view from any Irish bar in the world Iâ€™m guessing. While I havenâ€™t been, I think the Four Seasons on the big island would have been a better bet for the second leg of our Honeymoon. Again, we had a decent time â€“ but we will likely not go back to Maui again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ajmilitello
Reviews.Content: This was a great idea for our 3rd anniversary! As always, the staff of the Four Seasons was superb and the amenities were abundant. I especially encourage all those that do attend to get a spa treatment done while on site. It was truly one of the best parts about our stay. As far as being a romantic get-a-way, you simply won't beat the weather, the views, and the pampering offered from this hotel. The only "complaint" we had, was that our bed seemed soft and we awoke some mornings with a sore back (as I said before, though, the spa took care of that). Regardless, if this is the worst complaint that I can come up with, I would recommend staying here to everyone that I know. We look forward to going back very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it but may not be for everyone...”
Reviews.Author: Missbotess
Reviews.Content: Our family, with a range of children, ages 8 yrs, 19 yrs, 22 yrs, absolutely LOVED our week here...However, this may not be the perfect resort for everyone. First of all, it is a small resort (which we like) therefore the pools are small, pretty simple, and if you want to sit around them, be prepared to rub elbows with other guests. We always opted for a cabana above the beach and got up early to claim one of the more "private" ones. (If you sleep in and/or shop first, the prime cabanas start opening-up around 3 pm). Or you can sit down at the beach which is beautiful and less crowded; get up in the morning for perfectly calm and crystal clear water to go snorkeling. Note:around 12 noon, the wind and the waves pick up significantly! We used to stay at the Grand Wailea when our older kids were young, but my 8 yr old loved the FS; the kid's program is great plus she made friends around the pool (somehow FS manages to make honeymooners and families happy!). For the person who complained about lack of "Hawaiian" culture, my reply is that the weather, the water, the views, and the food (Ferraro's and Spago's were great) are what FS Maui is all about. Book a luau and take a drive around the island to get a culture fix. Yes, the FS is pricey but remember there is no resort fee, valet parking is complimentary, the kid's program is complimentary, beach equipment/snorkel gear is complimentary, the Spa is out of this world, and the service thru-out the resort is abosolutely top notch! I don't think the word "no" exists in the vocabulary here. We've already made our reservations for next year! Other off-site notes: good food at Pacific O in Lahaina and Sansei Sushi in Kihei, Nick's Fishmarket was a disappointment. If you've seen one too many luaus but still want a show, try "Ulalena" in Lahaina...it's like a Hawaiian Cirque du Soleil. Snorkeling is wonderful at the FS beach but if you want a boat trip to snorkel at Molokini, I recommend the Kai Kanani which departs from the Maui Prince. It's a nice small boat with a great crew. The 6:30-8:30 AM trip is great...Molokini gets really busy with large boats and lots of people after that.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooners - Great Service, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: fivetools
Reviews.Content: It may sound redundant but it is really true - amazing service at the FS. From the moment you get out of your car, to the front desk, to getting directions, dinner reservations, activity reservations - the whole nine yards. Our favorite part was being led to covered chairs overlooking the beach and having servers bring drinks and free water refills and even an Evian spritz if you need it. We dined at Ferraro's and Spago. Skip Spago and definitely reserve a table overlooking the ocean at Ferraro's for the amazing sunset. Great service at Ferraro's too. I would also recommend: David Paul's (chef's tasting menu), Sansei, Mama's Fish House, Jawz Fish Tacos, Old Lahaina Luau, Blue Hawaiian helicopter tour and biking down the volcano. Stay clear of the Road to Hana. I would definitely go back to FS in a heartbeat as long as I don't drop dead from the prices.

Reviews.Title: “Maui-ed at the Four Seasons Wailea”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Skydiver
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a first class hotel with first class service for an intimate getaway in Maui, look no further... Four Seasons Wailea is the perfect location. We not only stayed at the FS, we held an intimate wedding there in July. Everything was absolutely phenomenal. FS vs. Other Wailea Resorts: We were having a hard time deciding between FS and the other resort in Wailea and Kapalua. In a nutshell, this is what we were told and, we confirmed it after visiting the different hotels. Kapalua is very beautiful, peaceful, and private. They have some very nice hotels there (Ritz, Kapalua Bay); however, the weather is often wet up in that part of the island. At Wailea, we were torn between the FS and the Fairmont Kea Lani. We selected the FS for the intimacy and the service they provide, especially for weddings. We were not dissappointed. The Kea Lani is a more impressive looking hotel (the grounds, the lobby, the room size, the pool). But the FS is more intimate and provides the personal touch. The Grand Wailea is good if you want a lively party like atmosphere or if you have kids. But it's a bit busy for us honeymooners. Avoid the Renaissance Wailea. It's okay if you can get a great deal but it's not what I would call a five or even four star establishment. We stayed there for 2 nights after we checked out of the FS and regretted it. The Four Seasons Wailea: The grounds are beautiful but the lobby and entrance is a bit tame compared to some of the other Wailea resorts. The rooms are equally comfortable and well decorated, but the "ocean view" is only partial. Not too many rooms directly face the ocean. We had an Ocean View room on the Club Level and our room has a view of the ocean from the side. It directly looks into the Courtyard but you can see the ocean on the left side. It's a gorgeous room but just wanted to set the expecation that it's not oceanfront even though we paid $800+ a night. But what we liked about the FS is how they treat you. The service is not pretentious, not intrusive. Just very polite, friendly, and efficient. They provide you pretty much whatever you need and want, even though it's not on the menu or not a typical request. And the concierge staff is absolutely amazing. The beds are very comfortable, furniture very modern, and the bathroom was amazing both in size and decor. Great toilettries too. The best part is, everything is included in your stay (e.g. the cabanas, nice cushioned beach and pool chaise, snorkel rentals). The Spa and Restaurants: We dined at Spago and Ferraro's. We liked Ferraro's more than Spago. The ambiance is nicer (outdoors under a canopy of stars with tikki torches all around you and Don and Vance playing romantic music as you dine well prepared and efficiently served food), and we thought the food was better. What we had at Spago that we thought was amazing is the poke. That was to die for. My wife who does not even like sushi loved the poke. We had a couple massage at the Spa and used their facilities a couple of times. We thought is was only okay. We did the oceanside bungalow massage and kinda wished we did the indoor one instead. It was a bit noisy outside.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: msiqbalmd
Reviews.Content: Wife & I just returned after spending five wonderful nights at Four Seasons in Maui. The words just can't describe what a fabulous place it is. The grounds are beautiful and meticulously manicured. The beach is beautiful and not too crowded. The Fountain pool and waterfall pool, both are superb. Rooms have every possible amenity you could think of and many you couldn't even think of...shoe horns, umbrella, "itsy-bitsy book light", free shoe shine service, DVD player, etc, etc. The food at Spago's is out of this world. Very pricey, of course, and the portions are pretty small, but probably the best food I have ever tasted. Food quality at the other two restaurants is just average to good. Four Seasons does not nickle & dime you. Parking is free, as are the beach umbrellas, chaise lounges, poolside cabanas, avian spritzers at the poolside, ice water drinks, chilled fruits, etc. But the best part of this resort is impeccable service. You are treated like a royalty. The staff goes out of their way to please you. I could give you dozens of examples but then it would sound like a paid commercial. How about the Bellman who, after loading up our car as we were leaving the resort, ran in and brought us two chilled bottles of Avian for our trip to the airport! We had a minor problem. On our last evening, all of the three restaurants were completely booked and room service was so overwhelmed that it took them almost 90 minutes to bring our dinner. Of course, I complained. The room service manager called & "profusely" apologized and waived the charge for the dinner. The next morning, at the check out, the cashier apologized too. As soon as we got back home, someone from Four Seasons management called our house to again apologize and ask if there was anything else they could do for us! Four Seasons, Maui is often rated as the best resort in maui and rightly so.

Reviews.Title: “No disappointment at the FS”
Reviews.Author: cavfilr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the FS in July for 3 nights, 20th anniv. Had lovely partial ocean view room overlooking the croquet grounds. Ground level room with walk-about the beautifully landscaped grounds. The staff sent a complimentary bottle of bubbly, and I had a $100 flower arrangement sent beforehand. The flowers were ordered throught the concierge and were fabulous! Do the couples beach massage! Ablolutely wonderful. Rec. the bed and breakfast package, as the breakfast is $28 ea. ala carte' , and a great deal with the room. Service is FS quality, and room attentiveness was addressed very quickly with a "Jackson" and written request of the times that I would like the room turned down and made up. Treat the staff well, they will really take care of you. Ferraros food was very good, not great. The restaurant area by the beach is beautiful, but alot of the patrons there want to go get their picture done as the sun goes down, this interrupts everyones dinner, and the staff's routine. Also did dinner at the Seawatch restaurant, don't waste your time. Service was terrible but food was ok, not terrific. FS is one of the nicer hotels I've stayed in. Pricey, hey this is HI, and the Four Seasons. Very highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Late reveiw...just found the site a few months ago.... Went to the four seasons for my huneymoon. I had been with my family to hawaiian islands several times before. I was disapointed in the four seasons...esp for the rate and price of just about everything. Lunch at the pool was $100.00. What I did n0t like was; a tiny pool and very little space to relax, lack of culture (I felt like i was at a four seasons in LA), Spagos i did not enjoy one minute, the hotel room was fairly old, the valet got my name giganticly wrong every single time...I would not usually mind...but on a h'moon you want your wife being addressed by the correct name. What I did like; the bed, the people working the hotel (minus front desk), the food by the pool, the gym, lots of extras they do not charge for....the bathrooms... What would really make this hotel for me would be another pool twice the size maybe an infinit pool and nicer set up at the beach. To me this hotel could use some work.

Reviews.Title: “Never experienced anything like this... Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: DC_CoPi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Four Seasons for 5 nights of our 10 day/11 night honeymoon. We have traveled a good amount and spent time in luxury hotels with our parents, but we were blown away by the service, the beauty, and the sheer aura of this resort. We were not upgraded as the resort was quite full, but we knew that ahead of time, and spent the extra money for the view we wanted. Within minutes of getting to our room, room service arrived with a complimentary chilled bottle of champagne. The room was well appointed, spacious, and had a huge bathroom. It also included a good sized balcony. The pool area is somewhat small, but there are multiple nooks (on a grass lawn and elsewhere) where cabanas are also available, and these views are even more spectacular than sitting RIGHT by the pool. Beachside service with complimentary cabanas is also available and quickly turned into our favorite place to lounge. There is also excellent snorkeling off the Four Seasons beach. The spa and steam room facilities are to die for, with an oceanside "lomi lomi" massage the ultimate in relaxation and luxury. The food and drink, as others point out, is pricey, but it is also quite good. We opted for a "bed and breakfast" package which included a large buffet each morning, and it more than paid for itself. The famous Spage and less famous Ferraros were very good. The cost of the few amenities you do have to pay for still makes the experience worth it. The resort - and any time spent on maui - is a definite "splurge," but an excellent way to celebrate a special time or event.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Service and Stay”
Reviews.Author: KelleyinAustin
Reviews.Content: By far the best experience I've ever encountered at a hotel. My husband and I stayed here in June of 2004 for our honeymoon and had a remarkable experience. The service was a 5 star experience where the staff referred to us by our names everywhere we went and remembered us each day at breakfast. The room we stayed in was facing the courtyard area on the first floor. It was very clean, spacious enough and had the most luxurious bathroom I've ever encountered in a hotel (marble everywhere, large jacuzzi w/separate shower, ladies vanity, etc). The pool was beautiful, clean and any possible need we had was well attended to. The staff was extremely attentive and courteous. I believe we ate at every restaurant in the hotel and all were pricey but delicious. Wait time at dinner can be long so make reservations when & where possible. This hotel is a must stay in my opinion. There were other personal touches the staff did to make it memorable for us but I don't want to reveal them because they are better as a surprise. If you have the money, don't miss out on this luxurious resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from two weeks at the Four Seasons on Maui. I found the reviews here to be really helpful and accurate. Beautiful hotel, great setting, fabulous service, superb restaurants, gorgeous beaches. Complaints are as follows: - Pool is truly tiny so not much more useful than a place to cool off in. Swimming is not a real option - Good pool seating is taken early and hard to get - The beach (and pool) is very windy in the afternoon Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: mrintellec
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Four Seasons in Maui from Aug 4 - Aug 9 2005. Everything was wonderful...from the time we arrived until we left. We arrived to find out that they offered complimentary valet parking. We were then notified at check-in that we were being upgraded from a Gardenview to a Partial Oceanview! The Staff was helpful and courtesy. Our room was very nice and when we arrived to the room there was a chilled bottle of champaign awaiting us. Housekeeping was EXCELLENT! It was if we were being watched as to when we left, because every morning when we returned from breakfast the room had been cleaned. Turn down happened every night. Pool side and beach side cabanas, water, fresh cut pineapples, and cold towels were all complimentary. There is NO RESORT FEE. We ate at Ferraro's one night. Wonderful sunset view, excellent presentation, but food portions were too small. Our last two nights Aug 9 and 10 we stayed at the Hyatt in Lahaina...We wanted so bad to go back to the Four Seasons!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons - Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: FloridaGirl2
Reviews.Content: We got to the 4 Season early this day because we took the little puddle jumper (Hawaii Taxi) and it left Kona at 9:30 am. We arrived at around 10:30 and couldn't check into our room, but we were notified that our garden view room had been upgraded to partial oceanview suite. Oh my, was it beautiful. Separate bedroom, 2 full baths (not that we need 2), large livingroom, 2 TVs and 2 wonderful balconies - one with lounge chairs and one with a nice table. Service here was great. There is nothing to complain about here. We went into the Grand Wailea just to check it out but it was too spread out for us and the pools do nothing for us. But it was also a very pretty hotel. I like the coziness of the 4 Seasons and the architecture of the outside. We also ate a Nick's Fishmarket at the Kea Lani and got a look around. That would have been my second choice. Unique building design, but again bigger hotel than the 4 seasons. Bigger pools etc. Just more spread out. The lounge entertainment at the 4 seasons was very good and we would sit in the bar area and just relax listening to the music. Ahhh?.. this is the life. We stay here again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “There's absolutely no comparison to the Four Seasons Maui”
Reviews.Author: kikki3
Reviews.Content: First of all, let me apologize for this extremely tardy review. I just found this wonderful website a month or two ago. Now on to the review itself. My husband and I had our wedding, reception and honeymoon here two years ago and I cannot rave enough about the resort. Yes, it's on the pricey end but the quality and intimacy is unrivaled on the island of Maui. My husand, who's probably the pickiest most stubborn man to ever walk the Earth, LOVED this hotel and raved about the impeccable service. He said "you definitely get what you pay for... and then some..." It's one of those places that I hope everyone has the opportunity to experience at least once in their lifetime. So far, I'm campaigining for a repeat on our 10th anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Like a dream”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon. Everything was excellent and worth the expense, would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Too Big for Maui”
Reviews.Author: Marcmarc
Reviews.Content: I often stay at Four Season Resorts, last July I was on The Big Island at their resort at Hulalalai (may have added too many vowels there) that is a fabulous resort I much preferred that over the Maui location. When I checked in with my wife got off the elevator and started walking to our room, now this is a 4 Star resort, it shouldn't take us seven minutes to walk down a monotonous hallway to reach our room. The folks are nice that work there and the food is good but too big, if I wanted mamoth I'd stay at The Grand Hyatt, a gargantuan joint that requires a packed lunch to travel from the beach to your room. There are worse places then the 4 Season in Maui but there are better.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Wailea Four Seasons Resort is not worth the money. It is in deperate need of a remodel. We stayed there once in February 2005 and went back again in March 2005, assuming it was just our room in particular that they had not gotten around to remodeling. It wasn't. There were stains on the carpet, the furniture was mismatched and had endured a multitude of visitors. The bedding is lovely and it is still a Four Seasons with all the wonderful bath accoutrements that go with, but I would not recommend it until it is freshened and redone. It is too dated and feels too "used" at that price range.

Reviews.Title: “Maui's #1 Resort”
Reviews.Author: SC_Hawaii_Traveler66
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a weeklong stay at the Four Seasons Resort Maui at Wailea, and I certainly agree with this month's issue (August 2005) of "Travel and Leisure" magazine that this hotel has been ranked as the #1 hotel on Maui in its 2005 World's Best Hotels list. Indeed, the Four Seasons inhabits its own separate world. This was my second trip to Maui. Last year I stayed at the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua. I thought I would never find a better resort. Well, lucky me...I did! This is, without a doubt, the classiest resort of the island. When you walk in, you can actually feel the jet-lag dripping off your limbs. The Four Seasons Maui has done everything right! They have anticipated the smallest details. The grounds are immaculate...dead leaves do not have a chance. And the grass is greener than the grass in "Charlie and the Chocolate Factory." One day, we enjoyed lounging the day away in the casbah-like tents and really enjoyed the Evian water spritzes and chilled towels. When we were ready for lunch, a delicious lobster sandwich was delivered to our cabana. Oh, yes, we have arrived! Another spritz, please? Some more water? And could you bring back some more of those yummy pineapple slices when you get a chance. Josh, our poolside server, gushed with friendliness and seemed genuinely eager to please us. And all of this at no additional charge! (Other resorts charge $50 or more per day for cabanas.) Our ocean view room was very large (about 650 square feet including the lanai). And the butterscotch bathroom was fit for a king! Lots of marble, a soaking tub, separate shower, double vanity...ahhh...Calgon take me away! Housekeeping would make an operating room nurse proud. Dirt is simply not tolerated! If the housekeepers do not come at the time you like, simply give them a call and they will gladly accomodate you. Wailea beach, in my opinion, is one of the best on the island. It's an absolute dream! We enjoyed a morning snorkel expedition each morning of our stay (it gets windy most afternoons, and the choppy water reduces visibility). Oh, did I mention that you get the snorkel equipment for free for an hour each day? Let me summarize by saying that if money is no object, then this is the place to stay. The $650 per night rate may sound high for a regular ocean-view hotel room, but I hope I have explained why this is not just any hotel. It's the number one resort on Maui! And they do not nickel and dime you to death! Believe me...it's worth every penny. Can you really put a price on enjoying a Mai Tai from your lanai while watching the golden sun set over the Pacific? (Well, actually yes. Twelve dollars for the drink; the sunset is free, though.) My partner and I enjoyed every single minute of our stay at this modern version of a Hawaiian palace by the sea. I'm sorry one of the other gay reviewers of this hotel did not feel comfortable. We certainly did! We even met other gay couples in the restaurants and by the pool. Hawaii is a very laid-back gay-friendly place, and all people, regardless of skin color or sexual orientation, are treated equally...as long as your Platinum Visa is not maxed out! We really enjoyed our stay at the Four Seasons. And if you are like us, you will weep when you have to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: partyofour
Reviews.Content: ***Winner: TripAdvisor's Best Review with Photos Contest, week of July 28th, 2005*** We just returned from a weeks long stay at the Four Seasons Wailea in Maui, July 23-30th. We highly recommend this resort to anyone,and can't imagine staying anywhere else in Maui from this point on. We were a group of 4 adults and 2 toddlers, ages 2 1/2 and 3 1/2. THE ROOMS: We stayed in partial ocean view adjoining rooms on the 4th floor (435 & 436), which happened to be the bottom floor of the wing we were staying in. Because we were on the bottom floor we had an exceptionally large patio off of the backs of our rooms that had 2 chaise lounges and a table and 2 chairs. These patios are much larger than those on all of the rooms above. The kids really enjoyed the exta outdoor space, we even ate some of our meals there . Because we were traveling with toddlers we arrived to find the furniture fitted with bumpers, a hippo cover on the bath spout, the children's names spelled out in colorful bath sponges, a really cute toddler bed for my daughter, a crib and a crate with all of the essentials (diapers, swim diapers, powder, lotion, & baby wash) needed for my son. There were also 2 Four Seasons logo stuffed owls on the bed with crayons and coloring books, and several rubber duckies and fresh baked cookies, milk and candy waiting on the coffee table for the kids to enjoy when we arrived. They didn't forget about the adults either, there was a nice selection of cookies on the dining table for us too! We really had a nice view from the room, palm trees, the blue sky and the ocean. The rooms are around 600 sq feet, inside you'll find a king bed with a nightstand at each side one with a cd player/radio/alarmclock, large armoire with television and DVD player, sofa with pull out sleeper, coffee table, dining table and 2 charis. There is a small area with fully stocked mini bar, fresh coffe beans and grinder, coffee pot, and all of the bar essentials. We asked that the mini bar be emptied for our stay(this was actually suggested to us by the reservations agent after we booked), that way we were able to keep juice and water on hand for the kids, there isn't a store on site that sells beverages, it's room service or the closest store at the Shops at Wailea, with kids the 30 minute wait for room service doesn't always work! The closet is huge and contains several hangers, a safe, and an iron & ironing board (starch is also in there!). The bathroom is very large, it has double sinks, a seperate tub and shower and a seperate commode area with a frosted glass door. The air conditioning cooled the room perfectly, it automatically shuts off when you open your sliding doors. THE POOLS & BEACH: There are 2 pool areas at the Four Seasons, the Fountain Pool - i'd say this is more of the adult area although we did see a few children there most days. This is a large rectangular pool with jaccuzis on each end and a large fountain in the center. The second pool is the Waterfall pool - this is also called the "children's pool". This is where you'll find most of the children and their parents. This is actually 2 pools connected by a small waterslide and rock waterfall. There is a shallow area for toddlers with buckets and watering cans to play with. The remainder of the pool is around 3 1/2 feet deep. The pool above with the large waterfall is from 3 1/2 to 5 1/2 feet deep. We were at the pool varying times each day and we were always able to get a poolside cabana. The beach is beautiful and clean! The sand does get extremely hot so keep the shoes on the kids! We were able to get umbrellas at the beach if we made it there by 11am, after that they were usually taken. We just hit the beach early each day to ensure we'd have shade for the kids. The attendants at the pool and beach were extremely helpful and friendly. They passed out iced water constantly and fresh pineapple and strawberries on occasion. My daughter's favorite thing was the Otter Pops they handed out at the kids pool, she looked forward to that daily! FOOD: We ate at Spago for my brother in law's birthday on Sunday night. Entrees are in the $30+ range, apptizers $12+, drinks $9+ desserts $15. I can honestly say this was the worst meal we had the entire week. The menu is very limited, we were told that it changes daily, guess we picked a bad day. My fish(Onaga ?) was dry and the sauce was supposed to be a spicy thai, but tasted like barbacue sauce. We also tried the Mahi Mahi, which was just OK. I will say that the crab cake was fantastic, but tiny. We all tried the Pinapple Upside Down Cake for dessert and wished we hadn't, the sauce tasted burnt, and the cake was overly soaked in some liquer that tasted awful! I really can't recommend this restaurant, I wouldn't go back. There are too many other great places to eat in maui (Humuhumu - FANTASTIC!, Nick's Fishmarket - Really good too!, Mama's - Perfect). We tried Pacific Grill on our last night in Maui and the food was very good. Prices here are comparable to Spago (actually everywhere we went prices were in that range). We tried several of the appetizers, fish dishes and the filet & lobster too, everything was tasty. We didn't order dessert because I surprised my husband with a birthday cake (the pastry dept. at the 4Seasons will make whatever you'd like, just call and order in advance) it was excellent as well! Our waitress brought it to the table with the candles lit as the evening's entertainment sang "Happy Birthday"! It's was really nice! We had room service several times, the food is expensive but really high quality, it's worth it when traveling with kids! The room service menu is available 24 hours a day (due to the time difference between Maui & LA my son was eating pancakes at 3am the first morning!) and includes an excellent children's menu with lots of choices. Children's meals are $5-$8, very reasonable! Adult entrees $17-$40. 18% gratuity and $4 delivery charge is added to your bill. There is a nice cemented beach walk that stretches between the Kea Lani, 4 Seasons, and Grand Wailea, take the 15 minute walk over to either of the other resorts for some really great food - Humuhumu (Best meal we had), Nick's Fish Market (Best service, great food), Cafe Ciao, etc. You may get a little wind blown so if you're worried about your hair, take the car! We made reservations for our meals for 6pm and always saw the sunset as we were eating our dessert! We also tried Tommy Bahama's and Cheeseburger's and Mai Tais in the Shops at Wailea, Tommy Bahama's was excellent, great entertainment at night too! The cheeseburger's at Cheeseburger's and Mai Tais were just ok, I probably wouldn't go back for lunch, but we tried their breakfast and it was excellent!We also stopped at Mama's Fish House for lunch on our first day, the food was just OK, way overpriced for lunch, but the views were spectacular as were the drinks! Service was excellent too. KIDS CLUB & BABYSITTING: For those of you thinking of coming to the resort with kids, this is the place for you! Kids club is available 7 days a week from 9am - 5pm, children over 5yo can attend alone, under 5 must be accompanied by a parent or other responsible adult, the kids club is complimentary to all guests. You can get a schedule of the weeks activities when you check in, they do crafts, make snow cones, learn the hula, make leis, play frisbee, build volcanos on the beach, etc. They will keep your kids entertained all day long. I took my kids on 3 seperate occasions for a few different activities, the staff is excellent! They really interact well with the kids making sure that no one is left out, they are kind and caring. They also do evening kids parties which include dinner the cost is $65 for those who'd like to have a nice adult dinner in the evening. The kids can stay all day or just drop in for specific activities, it's all up to you. The Four Seasons also offers babysitting service through the Nanny Connection. The cost is $14 per hour for the first child and $2 and hour for each additional child. There is a 3 hour minimum. We used the Nanny service on 3 night from 5p-9pm so that we could celebrate the husband's birthday's. I was very impressed with the service, my kids loved Nanny Kathryn! It was nice to dine in the evening without tired children beside you, it was even nicer to come back to the room and find the children asleep in their beds in their Pjs! I highly recommend the Kids For All Seasons kids club and the Nanny Connection for babysitting services, these service helped each member of our family truly enjoy our vacation! The resort also offers strollers, highchairs, and other items for use during your stay, use of most of these items is complimentary, although we were told that if we would like to keep the stroller for our entire stay they would refer us to a company that rented out children's items, so check on availabilty and charges before you arrive. We borrowed a double stroller for a long walk one day and it was very nice! There are also children's DVDs that can be borrowed from the concierge, beach toys are available at the beach and at the kids pool, and there is a game room with video games, pool tables, and TV for the whole family to enjoy together. BOTTOM LINE: Once you stay here you're spolied for life! You'll be planning your next trip back before you're back home, I guarantee it! The staff is amazing, the resort grounds are absolutely beautiful, the pool, the beach, everything is perfect! We checked out the Kea Lani and the Grand Wailea while we were there too. The Kea Lani was so noisy and over crowded, lots of kids running everywhere, worse than the Grand Wailea. The Grand Wailea, had a beautiful lobby, and Humuhumu was great but it was overcrowded and the rooms that we saw were small. There is still construction going on right next to the Grand also, it doesn't look like it will be finished anytime soon! They were jack-hammering at 8am while we we're enjoying our pancakes!

Reviews.Title: “Not convienced”
Reviews.Author: BDE
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at this Four Seasons and I am still not convienced. Yes the hotel is beautiful and the people too, but our expereince was just not that great. First, we made a reservation for a garden room instead of the 'partial' ocean view. This is a much better option as the rooms are the same and actually better at times. However, it turned out our room was above the trash compactor and we got to listen to the ---- thing all night until 5am when I was able to talk to the Manager. They did not offer to change our room but did credit us the night and asked housekeeping not to use the trash campactor until 7am. Don't you think this should be standard? We also did not have hot water for the 1st night. Not sure what was going on but not what you would expect for their rates and the Four Seasons. Both resturants are excellent and I would come and eat at Fararos the next time I come to but don't stay at this very expensive hotel. If you have the bucks to have a upper level room then I am sure your expereince will be great but if you are a common 1st level guy then save your money and go to the Ritz in Kapalua.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: MJack
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from our Honeymoon (July 19-26) after a wonderful stay at the FS in Maui. This was our first time staying at a FS and were treated to the best service we have ever received. When we first arrived we were greeted with a lei and a cold towel as well as an upgrade of our room to a partial ocean view. The room was all that was advertised including a big bathroom, DVD player, and CD player which had traditional island music playing as we entered the room. The beach area is great with umbrellas or cabanas provided at no charge. We highly recommend the outrigger canoe ride which is free, but only offered on certain days of the week, so make sure to book early. The best time to go is at 7:00 a.m. We had the Bed and Breakfast package which was a wonderful buffet at Pacifico, which by the way, includes gratuity. We also ate at Spago's which was well worth the price. We did eat out a lot in Kihei which is just 5 minutes away and has much cheaper dining options. After seeing the other hotels in the area there is no doubt the FS was the nicest and had far less young kids than the others which was important to us while on our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “No doubt the best hotel in Maui and maybe Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Four Seasons in Wailea during our honeymoon from July 10th-July 17th. I have been to Maui a few times before and stayed at the Grand Wailea both times. I was anxious to see how different the Four Seasons would be compared to the other top 2 hotels on Maui. I was absolutely shocked by the difference. The Four Seasons is so far above the Grand Wailea and Kea Lani. Itâ€™s really in a class by itself. We booked an Ocean View Room with the breakfast package. When we arrived, we were escorted to our room and I was little disappointed. The view from the room was not that great so I called down and spoke to a manager who said they would change our rooms the following day. The next day we were moved to an outstanding Ocean View Room, #747 to be exact. If you are considering an ocean view room, I would highly recommend requesting a room in the interior of the hotel, the views are much better. We were so happy that we booked the breakfast package with our room. It added $35 more per night but it was well worth it. Our buffet breakfast would have come out to $65 per day with tip. So we saved a few hundred dollars by booking this package. The service, the grounds of the hotel, and setting is just amazing. The beach is one of the best on Maui, very big and the water is relatively calm. You can snorkel right in front of the property and there are huge turtles and many interesting fish to see. The Four Seasons also does not nickel and dime you for certain things that the other neighboring properties do. Free cabanas at the pool and beach, water and popsicles passed around, Evian mist sprayed on you by the pool, free snorkeling gear, free scuba lessons. The Four Seasons is much smaller than the neighboring hotels which make the hotel seem much more intimate. Itâ€™s not a 10 minute walk from the pool to your room like the Grand Wailea or Kea Lani. The food at the Four Seasons is incredible, very expensive, but incredible. Plan to spend a minimum of $300/day on food and drinks for 2 people....$17 turkey sandwiches at lunch, $30+ plates for dinner and very expensive drinks. The Four Seasons also provides a free sedan service within Waliea which we used many times. We walked over to the Grand Wailea to have dinner one night and we immediately wanted to come back to the Four Seasons the moment we arrived. In fact, we ordered our food and then decided a few minutes later to leave and then ate at Ferraro's at the Four Seasons. There were screaming kids everywhere, it smelled and the service was horrible. I really don't think there is a better hotel on Maui or maybe Hawaii. The only other hotel I would consider staying at now would be the Four Seasons on the Big Island. We heard from many Wailea Four Seasons employees that the their hotel on the Big Island is incredible. I have got the Four Seasons bug now, we are already planning a trip again for Thanksgiving of 2006. Email if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel We've Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are not FS regulars so we may not be as seasoned as some reviewers here, but we stayed at the FS Maui for our one year anniversary, and got back yesterday. While on our trip, we drove to Lahaina and Kaanapali, and toured the rest of the Wailea hotels also. After walking through them and seeing how the service was, the thing that always comes up was "I'm glad we stayed at the Four Seasons" This hotel is expensive, and we had to save for quite a while to stay here. Was it worth the money?! Absolutely. We have decided that when we return to Maui for another vacation, we are staying at the FS or not at all. As we put it, we are "scarred for life" / spoiled by our experience here. No one else comes close. The service was impeccable, and everyone is ready to give you a smile, and ask how your activities went that day. Everytime they brought our car around, we would tell them where we were going, and they would give us tips on how to get there, what to do, etc. It honestly seemed as if they really cared about us having a good time, not just because it's their job. Some other reviews mention house keeping coming late in the afternoon. We saw some of that, but the first day they asked us when we would like the room to be cleaned each day, and we said 9 AM would be great. One day we were running a bit late, and at 9:15 they called and asked if they needed to come back later, or when we would like them to come. Not a huge thing, but for them to be that attentive was great. That's how everything is there. The other guests are generally laid back and nice. We were afraid that staying at the FS might mean being amongst a bunch of snobs. There was a fair amount of plastic body parts in/around the pool, but we expected that considering. There were a few people that we felt were rude to the staff on occasion, but as a whole the other guests are nice. I didn't intend to write this much, but we are certainly going to recommend this resort to others. This is the place is the yardstick to measure all others.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Nomad3
Reviews.Content: Very elegant property, clean smooth-sanded beachfront, excellent service. Highly recommended for vacationers looking to relax in luxuary and seeking pampered service. My husband, our newborn, and I shared a standard room: It was very spacious and well appointed. The bathroom was so large and beautiful that I was able to use it for our baby's night feedings so as to not disturb my husband. POOL & BEACH Each day the poolside & beach-side staff were very attentive as they set up our cabanas/beach umbrella and beach chairs with thick clean towel covers and beach towels. Pool areas were beautiful. Large beach had soft yellow sand and gorgeous sunsets. We never had to seek the wait staff for poolside drinks and eats. They were always one step ahead of us and anticipated our needs without being overly intrusive. I had ordered everything from the adult lunch menu, but found the Kid's Menu most tasty. The best value was the Chicken Teryaki/Steam rice/Fruit slices entree for lunch($12). There is food & drink service poolside only. No alcoholic beverages are served beachside. FOOD We recommend the Breakfast buffet at the Pacific Grill ($27) is devine. Chefs cook to order omellettes, pancakes, waffles, brioche french toast. Otherwise there is a vast selection of fruits, juices, pastries, cereals, etc. We recommend going off-property for dinner. Some local great eats are Tastings (Fine American Cuisine), Sensai (Casual Japanese), Tommy Bahamas (Casual Caribbean).

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons in Maui has got to be the best hotel I've ever stayed in! Our family of four (2 adults and 2 girls aged 13 and 12) had been planning this vacation for six months. We were undecided about where to stay in Wailea (Four Seasons, Fairmont Kea Lani, or Grand Wailea) but after many rave reviews about the Four Seasons we decided to stay there. We stayed here for 6 nights at the end of June.We made an excellent choice. We stayed in an Executive Suite with a Garden View which was absolutely amazing. The room was extremely spacious and clean and the bathroom was unbelievable. It was quite expensive but well worth every penny we paid. We requested a small refrigerator (complimentary) to cut down on expenses for breakfast and lunch. We walked over to the Whalers General Store or went into Kihei (10 minute drive) for groceries. The pool service was awesome. Ice water refills constantly. They passed around fruit and cold washcloths along with Evian spritzes for those guests that wanted it. Our girls made many friends their own age and spent alot of their time in the complimentary game room. It included pool tables, shuffle board, ping pong, playstation and Nintendo! The hotel also offers a complimentary outrigger canoe ride right from the beach. I can't say enough about this wonderful hotel. If you have any doubts about where to stay in Wailea don't think twice....pick the Four Seasons!!

Reviews.Title: “incredible service”
Reviews.Author: krisgia
Reviews.Content: We have visited Wailea before and stayed at the Kea Lani where we felt very nickel and dimed. It was nice to have free valet parking, free cabanas and free snorkel gear. It seemed to be more of a honeymooners and couples hotel. If you bring kids above 5, I would suggest the Grand Wailea or Kea Lani. The poolside service was usually above and beyond; however, we did notice that certain attendants were much more attentive than others. We highly recommend Sandy; she was phenomenal and very personable. The poolside food was very good; the best we have ever had at a large resort. The rooms were spacious and clean. Yes, on some days, the service was in the late afternoon, but that didn't bother us because we were enjoying the outdoors. The spa services were pricey, but they were also worth the money. As for a previous review mentioning a lack of people of color; that wasn't the case during our stay.
