The only downside to our trip was my husband slipping on muddy grass that was located between the tiled steps on the path between the pool and beach. We saw several guests slipping in that area. My husband was wheelchair bound the rest of the trip and is now looking at knee surgery. Also, a honeymooner slipped right after my husband and tore ligaments in her ankle. So, watch your step in that area. The breakfast buffet was great, but if you want to save some money and don't want a ton of food, then get a to-go container to bring back to the pool area or your room. We ate at Spago's and Ferraro's. Spagos was fabulous. The fish at Ferraro's was overcooked, but the sunset was incredible. I recommend that you go to the Shops at Wailea and try Tommy Bahama's and Ruth Chris Steakhouse. Also, we ate at Kincha at the Grand Wailea. The sushi was great and so was the Kobe beef. I would definitely return to the Four Seasons even though our trip was heavily marred by my husband's fall. I would leave the kids at home for the trip because it really is a couples hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Hualalai, but really enjoyed it...”
Reviews.Author: LT789
Reviews.Content: Just finished a one-week stay at the Four Seasons Maui. It had been several years since I'd been there and it was, if anything, nicer than I'd remembered it. The restaurants (while pricey) have definitely been upgraded and the service was very good -- the bell staff was friendly and efficient, housekeeping was impeccable, the pool and beach attendants were attentive and helpful, and it's a great environment for the kids. Unfortunately, the resort suffers from the inevitable comparisons to its "sister" resort, the Four Seasons Hualalai, on the Big Island. The facilities on Maui are not quite as graceful or sprawling, the atmosphere is a bit less relaxed, the level of service probably not quite as high, and the amenities are not as impressive. Among other things, there is really just one main pool at the Maui resport (plus a smaller one for kids), compared to the assortment of pools at Hualalai (four by my count, not including the snorkel pond). As a result, the Maui resort feels more crowded. Moreover, the health club facilities are dwarfed by those at Hualalai. Nonetheless, the wonderful beach at Wailea partially makes up for those gaps, as does the price differential (while hardly cheap, the Maui resort is definitely less expensive than Hualalai). Bottom line: this is a top-tier luxury resort and my second favorite place to stay in the Islands. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the 4 Seasons Maui”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were here for 5 nights during our honeymoon. We were so tired after a very long and uncomfortable flight, when we got to the 4 Seasons we got a lei greeting and checked in very quickly. We were then given a tour of the hotel and taken to our room. The room was great, it was a partial ocean view on the 5th floor, the view was very nice and the bathroom was unreal. They even made a reservation for us at Ferraros that night. I didn't really care for the food there, its overpriced and lacks taste, but the service is good and the view is awesome. The next morning we went to the beach and rented snorkel equipment, the first hour is free. The beach in front of the hotel is great for snorkeling but go early in the morning, it gets very windy around noon. We spent a lot of time sitting around by the pool and ordering lunch and drinks. When you arrive to the pool area or the beach you need to go and have one of the employees set up a cabana or chairs for you. They don't charge for this and most other hotels do. They even hold the seats for you if you leave for a little while. The lunch by the pool is great, you can even order from the kids menu in adult portions for a decent price. The room service at the hotel is great. We tried both breakfast and dinner, the chocolate cake is really good as are the scrambled eggs. The rooms are cleaned in the morning and there is turndown service at night, sometimes they would dim the lights and leave some soft Hawaiian music playing for when we returned. They also leave orchids everywhere. The bathroom toiletries are great, they have L'occitaine soaps, shampoo, moisturizer, and even after burn lotion. The restaurants in the hotel are all great (Spago was a bit to eclectic for us). Although, our favorite was Humahumanukanukaapua'a at the Grand Wailea. Call ahead of time, as they are always full. The food is great and the restaurant sits atop a huge saltwater pond stocked with fish. You can also walk to the Shops at Wailea which has restaurants and many shops. We got some nice Hawaiian shirts at the ABC store there that we saw at another store for double the price. My only complaint was the amount of children, we couldn't believe how many children there were in Wailea. I would avoid going at the end of June, unless you like being around children. Overall, awesome hotel, I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Great rooms, great food, awesome views. Makes for a perfect honeymoon spot!

Reviews.Title: “I was a little disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: kperk13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days in June for a wedding. We have stayed at the 4S Hualalai and Punta Mita a few times each and after reading all these reviews, I was expecting to be impressed. First off, when we arrived at the valet, no one even acknowledged us pulling in. We had the luggage out of the car and I was halfway to check-in before someone came to take the keys from my husband. Check-in was fine - cold towel, lei, etc. Our room was fine - typical 4S. Huge bathroom. We were exhausted from our trip and basically fell into bed - the next morning we noticed a huge stain on the sheets - NOT from us. Gross. I left a note and the sheets were changed. I would have expected housekeeping making the bed the first time to notice such a stain. The restaurants were good. The spa was fine but nothing really compares to the spa at Hualalai for me. The pool was small and crowded. Service there was not good. On two separate occassions, we had to wait so long to get towels and chairs, we did it ourselves and then when the pool attendants finally came around to get our room number, they seemed insulted we did it ourselves. I was never offered a menu or asked if I had a drink order the entire time I was there. It's also a bummer they don't have an 'adults only' pool. I guess my expectations were just too high after Hualalai and Punta Mita - those two resorts really set the bar high for me.

Reviews.Title: “Quite pleasant”
Reviews.Author: gbn
Reviews.Content: The reviews here capture the hotel pretty nicely. To the gay folks who felt singled out: this might have been what happened, or it might have been age bias. My wife and I (37 & 40 yrs) found ourselves doing a fair amount of our own care, partially because we were less willing to find someone to do things. But your perceptions were probably right: this resort is definitely not one that sees a lot of openly gay visitors, nor does it see many children or people of color. One needs to suspect that they like it this way. The partial ocean view room was just fine, the beach is super, the workout room and spa area was really quite nice. Hopping on the stairmaster or treadmill, outdoors, with an ocean view is a special experience. My wife got a massage in the spa and enjoyed it, but found that the $40 extra she paid to "add on" a foot massage actually took away 10-15 minutes from her 80-minute massage. Huh? The service is quite attentive, and they're also happy enough to leave you alone if that seems to be your preference. As strict vegetarians, we found the breakfast buffet (which we got "included" as a bed-and-breakfast package -- a very good deal) was quite worthwhile. For other meals, we mostly ate elsewhere, though our one dinner was completely off-menu and accommodated our dietary needs. About $110, without alcohol or desert. Not being nickled and dimed really mattered to us. Valet parking is included; various aprez-sun and other toiletries are included; workout room included; lots of water to drink and cool towels; beach seating, etc. Though this place is pricey, at least the price includes all of the basics except food.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I can tell you....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was recently married on June 18 and my husband and I spent a week at the Four Seasons in Wailea for our honeymoon. Because this website really helped me choose this hotel, I thought I would give a little back and tell you all everything I can about this wonderful place. HOTEL- Upon arrival, we were greeted with leis and hospitality. I feel some reviews exaggerated a little on how the staff ----- up to you there. Don't get me wrong, service everywhere at the Four Seasons was amazing, but not everyone remembered your name and kissed your butt. The lobby is beautiful and open air. Plan on everything in Hawaii being open air (lobbies, restaurants, even exercise rooms). The lush gardens outside are so well kept. WEATHER- This was a surprise to me. I heard how dry Wailea is, but that's not necessarily true. The employees at the hotel put it like this: They can guarantee the morning will be beautiful, but they can't make any promises for the afternoon. It rained a lot for a few afternoons. Luckily we got up early every morning (6am) and were on the beach by 8am. No problem getting tan from 8am-noon (and it was hot). Normally the clouds rolled in around lunch time. ROOM- Spectacurily clean. Bathroom was HUGE! I was more comfortable in that bathroom than mine at home. Plus it was spotless (and I really checked it out). The bed was so comfortable that you can actually buy the pillows and the mattress to have at home. We had an Ocean View Prime. I misunderstood the website and I thought these rooms were at the very ends of the U-shaped hotel (closest to the ocean and beach). However, they are not on the ends, they are near the ends of the hotel. This was a little disappointing. We could see the ocean, but not like you would think for an Ocean view prime. I considered it a partial ocean view seeing as you had to turn your head on the balcony to see the ocean. You might want to save your money on the view and just get a partial ocean view room. HOUSEKEEPING- Great job, the only thing that made me a little upset was that for the first few days they weren't cleaning the rooms until 3 or 4 pm. Now for a couple who gets up at 6am, leaves by 7am for breakfast, spends the whole day outside and gets lunch, we expected our room to be clean so we could get ready or relax for a bit. When we returned at 4pm and housekeeping was bothering us to clean our room, I was irritated to say the least. Also, there were a few afternoons (around 3pm) that we took a nap, and we put the "do not disturb" sign on...so what do they do? They call us!!! Be aware of this. This happeed twice and it was ridiculous. We had 2 phone calls within an hour asking us when they could clean our room. It seems to me that if there is a "do not disturb" sign on the door, calling would be inappropriate. BEACH/POOL/OCEAN- Beach is beautiful, but not nearly as big as I thought (try the Jersey shore sometime). There are a lot of people there, but it never felt "crowded". Ocean was warm, but not really clear. There is great snorkeling by the rocks at the end of the beach (from the Four Seasons, walk out of the hotel onto the beach and look left). You have to go out a ways, but there are hundreds of fishies and coral there. Surf was bad the last few days which you couldn't snorkel. Low tide is in the morning so the best time for snorkeling is 7am-10am. The views of the other islands and the West Maui Mountains from the beach are breathtaking. Best part of the trip. Pool is beautiful. There always seemed to be room to get pool chairs no matter what time you arrived, although the earlier the better. We saw Tori Spelling there everyday by the pool. They serve awesome drinks and lunch poolside if you want. Yes they hand out fruit kebobs and cold towels. Your ice water will always stay filled. Pool is a little smaller than it should be for the amount of guests that are there. When it gets really hot, the pool gets really crowded! BREAKFAST BUFFET/PACIFIC GRILL- Awesome! Breakfast was so good. Another highlight of the trip. Such a variety, I can't comprehend how people can complain! You have to get waffles with macadamia nuts and coconut syrup! My favorite! SPAGO- We loved it. Make sure you get a table with a view that's to the RIGHT of the columns (you'll understand when you get there). Every two tables there is a huge column that blocks the view for the table next to it. Service is unbelievable here! NICK'S FISHMARKET- Surprisingly, we were a little disappointed at this place. Food wasn't bad, but it was the least favorite of our meals for the whole trip. I thought they were "oceanside", but they are "poolside". When you stay at the Four Seasons, you start to appreciate how wonderful all of their views are, and Nick's is at the Fairmont Kea Lani, which doesn't have nearly the views as FS. FERRARO'S- OUR FAVORITE! We had the BEST table. The view of the sunset was amazing. Food was unbelievable (I had Hawaiian lobster). *To dine while the sun is setting, make reservations for 6:30pm. The sun sets in Hawaii about 7:25pm this time of year. Humuhumunukunukuapua'a- In the Grand Wailea next door. Really charming atmosphere (you are over a huge fishpond). I had the Humu mixed plate, and it was sooooo good. Saw Gary Sinese dining with his family (from CSI and Forrest Gump). If you get the drink called Pele's Revenge, be prepared to drink out of a coconut the size of your head! MAUI ONION- Best onion rings in the world. Made with Maui Onions. Salads are delicious too. Located in the Renaissance in Wailea. You have to go here for lunch (we went 3 times!). They are open from 11:30am-6pm. OLD LAHAINA LUA'U- Great time! The pork was alright, but the steak and chicken was delicious. The dancing was really neat. If you get traditional style seating, you will have the best view of the stage, but you may get uncomfortable and cramped. Great atmosphere. Bring your camera! Lahaina itself is a bustling town with tons of shops. In fact, there are som many art dealers, ABC stores, and jewelry stores that you think you are walking in circles. Really cool town, spend an afternoon there and have dinner. HANA ROAD- Too long to explain here...read my review under the Hana Road topic for Maui Attractions, titled "Read this for an HONEST review" or something like that. It is a very curvy road. EXTREMELY curvy. And slow moving. And yes people drive like maniacs. But it was beautiful. However, if you get car sick, this is your hell. I hope everyone has a great time. This was the best place on earth! We know no other resort could even compare with the Four Seasons. Grand Wailea I've heard is not a good place for your honeymoon. The FS is much more romantic and private. So if you're going to spend the money, I receommend the FS and go the Grand Wailea for dinner one night just to see it.

Reviews.Title: “very positive, some glitches”
Reviews.Author: ccoreySanDiego
Reviews.Content: My son was married and honeymooned here. Many in my family stayed here for the week or a few days and we tried all the restaurants, breakfast, lunch and dinner. We also used the spa, aquatic activities, concierge services and obviously housekeeping and valet parking. We also had the luau reception for 75 people the night prior to the wedding so I feel we gave them a good run for the money. We thought the rooms were typical for the FS. My husband and I had the prime ocean view room which we actually liked less than my daughter's garden view room(in the U part of the hotel.) The honeymoon suite was apparantly fantastic (according to my son and DIL) A room up on the concierge level which my brothers had smelled of old cigars but otherwise acceptable. Housekeeping service was fine. Check in and registration was generally poor. Granted we were a lot of people with varying needs but I was surprised by level of service. Not typical for FS. Everything got straightened out but it was time consuming! We went several times to Ferraros and really loved that place! Breakfasts were also fantastic and the service was friendly and warm. Pool and cabanas and beach activities were wonderful! Spa was ok. Concierge was inundated with so many people. Tried hard. The wedding was marred by high winds which prevented anyone from hearing any part of the ceremony. That was disappointing but I don't know what could be done about that. The wedding reception was just fine. If you have an event there, I would unequivally recommend the luau. The setting is gorgeous, the food was superb and the entertainment top-notch. We had a terrific time! Yes, the FS is expensive. Nothing new there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service and the best bed ever”
Reviews.Author: skye25_2000
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Four Seasons Maui in May. I was in Maui to get married. Although I did not get married at the Four Seasons, the staff still treated us like royalty. We received a bottle of champagne upon arrival and was always greeted by name and with a smile. The pool attendants were our best photographers? We wanted to take pictures by the pool and they suggested the most amazing spots for the most beautiful photographs. The beach attendents were equally as helpful. This was truly a wonderful experience for my new husband and myself. We loved the Four Seasons Resorts so much we are off to the Four Seasons Punta Mita next!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Finally fount the nearly perfect resort”
Reviews.Author: pemarsh
Reviews.Content: We have been going to hawaii for nearly ten years, and used to live there for three years. We have been to many many resorts on nearly every island. We have rarely stayed at the same place twice. I think that might change now. We just came back after 12 days. Rather than tell you how great everything was from head to tow, Ill compare this to other places we know of, and atleast tell you why we decided to stay here. FS vs Kea Lani: Kea Lani you must reserve your cabana (and you have to reserve a specific cabana), and it costs $75 per day. That was an instant turn off. We have a two year old, and we like to have a cabana for everything. Keeps him out of the sun. The pools there are nicer than the FS--FS has a rather small pool, but very nice...but to be honest, the pools at Kea Lani are much bigger, and nicer. Kea Lani has suites...nice!! They also have a nice beach. They however do not have the service that FS has---twice a day treats brought to you at poolside---fruits and/or ice cream. FS will not go an hour without brining you water. Of all the resorts I have ever been to, I have never seen more attentive service than at the FS. If you want suites...this is it. You wont find a better price anywhere for a suite. The atmosphere is similar to the FS, but like I said, you wont get the service. If the service here was similar to the FS, and the cabanas were free, and you didnt have to reserve a specific cabana...this would where we would go. But $75 per day for 12-14 days for a cabana adds up. FS vs Grand Wilea: Simple reasons here....too hectic, too loud, and a cabana here will cost you $150/day!!!!!!!!!! If you have kids that love to play in the water, and you dont mind the noise...this is for you. Grand Wilea does have a large area assigned for adults only, next to a pool for adults.....but they allow NO children there...not even a two year old...so that was it for us. GW also makes you wear goofy wrist bands....way goofy. It shares the beach with the FS, and the beach is perfect. No rocks, crystal clear...can get a bit choppy, but nothing really that big at all. Bottom line...we didnt stay here due to the cabana expense, the noise and all the kids playing. We wanted a bit more quiet. But, dont get me wrong...this resort is very very very nice. You would not be dissapointed. FS vs FS at big island: The resort on the big isl just is in class of its own, however, we did not like it due to the beach...really not all that nice at all for swimming. FS vs kapalani resorts...simply put in our opinion, FS is a class above those resorts (we have stayed at most resorts there FS vs mariott wilea...no comparison...FS is just in another class. The mariott does not really compare to any of the three major wilea resorts. FS just does not nikel and dime you---and while you may be saying to yoursleves as you read this review that its not such a big thing to be nickeled and dimed...wait till you get there. $$$--We know very well how much $$$ everything is. And I am not complaining, but I want people to know---we ate at the restaurants at the FS usually...we dont drink, and we dont get appetizers.....but we each get a dessert usually.....not once was our dinner bill under $100. Hamburger is $20. Virgin drinks are $9. Just to give you an idea. We loved this place so much, we are going to repeat in 2006. We have stayed at over 15 resorts all over hawaii....this we find is the best balance of them all. If anyone has any questions, please feel free to contact. This site really helped us, and we just wanted to give a little back.

Reviews.Title: “Not gay friendly!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a lesbian couple that travels the world extensively, we have never experienced such bias at a hotel. If you are looking for top notch service, this is not the hotel. We booked our stay at the Four Seasons for the Memorial Day weekend. From the moment we arrived we felt we were singled out for being a openly gay couple. When we arrived we were told our room was not ready yet, and that they 'would call us' when it was cleaned. We never received a call, and 1 hour pass check in time we finally went to the front desk and were told, 'oh your room is just ready' Other couples behind us in line were immediately taken to their rooms. At the pool, we watched as others were spritzed with Evian while we laid without service. We were asked to move from a poolside bungalow while straight couples were left alone. Everyone poolside was brought pieces of pineapple, we had to go ask. At Spago, the same treatment was observed. Next door at the Kea Lani, we experienced a much more gay friendly attitude when we went for drinks/dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - I'll address the negatives mentioned in other posts”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were married on Maui May 12, 2005 (not at the Four Seasons) and spent our 9 night honeymoon at the Four Seasons. We could not have been happier. This is an excellent, top-notch hotel. My review will focus on some of the negative reviews I have read on this site. FIRST, most if not all, of the negative reviews could have been experienced at any hotel. PRICE: it is expensive, but so are all of the 5 star hotels here. Yes, food and drinks are expensive, so you should plan accordingly. POOL: We never had a problem getting a covered cabana. We arrived at the pool at different times each day - sometimes at the busiest part of the day - and always got a cabana. The pool serivce was incredible. You will always have a cover for your chair and a towel. Ice water non stop. Lunch service was very fast and the food was excellent. Iced towels, free fruit and popsicles. We never had any trouble with kids running around. If the fountain is off it is because the wind picks up and the spray from the fountain gets on the guests, so they turn it off. A few local kids got in the pool and were asked to leave as soon as the staff noticed them. THE BEACH: One of Maui's best. You can get snorkel gear for free for one hour each day - plenty. They have covered seating on the beach always available. THE ROOM: We had a mountain view room that had an excellent view of the ocean. The bathrooms are huge and the room was very nice. Maid service sometimes was later in the day, but who cares? Are you there to enjoy your vacation or to complain? If you need anything, it is there very quickly. If you absolutely need your room, they'll leave and come back. STAFF: Very, very friendly. They will make dinner reservations, book trips, give you driving directions, tips on where to go or eat - all quickly and friendly. The valet service was outstanding and give great directions. THE FOOD: excellent. Yes, it's expensive. If you are on a budget, go somewhere else. We ate twice at Ferarro's. The food is great and the view cant be beat. If you want a beautiful hotel, great pool, great food and service, on one of Maui's best beaches - you CANNOT go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade, if you can for the best time of your life...”
Reviews.Author: frankfooter
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent one of the best vacations of our lives at the Four Seasons in Maui. This was our (many years belated) honeymoon, and I guess the backdrop of Maui, along with perfect weather, would be major contributing factors. However, our stay at this particular Four Seasons only enhanced our stay on the island. Have stayed on Kauai and it is beautiful, but much more on Maui to do and see. So much more. After a grueling 25+-hour trip from the East coast (a nightmare of delays and missed connections), we were treated to a very special week at this hotel. By keeping in touch with the hotel to let them know we were going to be a day late, they bent over backwards (as opposed to our airline) to make sure this trip was truly special. The hotel upgraded us from a â€˜prime ocean-viewâ€™ suite to an exceptional â€˜ocean-frontâ€™ suite with a double lanai. We later came to find out this room was valued at 2-1/2 times our original suiteâ€™s rate. I assume that their payoff will be in our profound recommendation of this hotel not only on this web-site, but also by word of mouth to our friends and family. If you can afford the â€˜ocean frontâ€™ (not prime ocean view) rooms/suites, then your view will be better than staying near the â€˜backâ€™ of the hotel. From the â€˜ocean frontâ€™ area, you overlook the restaurants, the entire pool area and more of the beachfront. Although it is a little noisier in this area (mostly from the fountains, and of course the ocean), you get a real sense of staying â€˜on the beach.â€™ In this suite, we also received fresh fruit every day. In general, if you choose to stay and eat at this resort, it will be expensive. For this amount of money, one expects perfection. We were very fortunate that we experienced a week mostly full of perfection. However, I can understand some of the previous reviewersâ€™ negative comments to be mentioned later. Nevertheless, it is our opinion that most of the negative experiences could be avoided by treating the staff with (monetary) respect. By our simply tipping the pool area staff and housekeeping staff, our simple requests were honored, and for the remainder of the week we found a mutual respect of expectations and services. The pool: We are late risers, and were never disappointed in the available selection of pool and/or cabana seats. Our recommendation is to start at the beach early, and move up to the pool later in the day. People seem to depart the pool about an hour or so after lunch. The ocean is calm in the morning with very little wind, the sand is not yet burning on your feet, and the beach staff is just as attentive as the pool staff. You can get a nice umbrella seat, and the morning snorkel (one hour free is about all you need to see the sea turtles, eels, variety of fish, etcâ€¦) is easier than in the afternoon when the seas get rough. Keep in mind that a (monetary) tip for the attendants will remind them for the next days to follow, that you are a serious vacationer. Yes, I know your already paying dearly for this vacation, but these are the people that you need the most, and showing them respect will only get you the same in return. Since you are paying hundreds, if not thousands for a night in the hotel, along with hundreds for breakfast, lunch and dinner; what is twenty bucks to remind your attendant that you appreciate their efforts. Our only complaint is that there are a few inconsiderate people both at the pool and on the beach, who choose to ignore the notices to keep their cell phone use to a minimum. The last thing I want to hear in paradise is someone elseâ€™s problems on a cell call. Since we had a full view of the pool area, it was somewhat humorous to note that these were the same people who were battling at 7:00 am every morning to grab the â€˜primeâ€™ seats. Note again that â€˜primeâ€™ seats are available anytime throughout the day. The cool towels and continuous filling of ice water made the days exceptional. Although, we did not see as much of the frozen fruit or Evian spritz's as mentioned in previous reviews. Housekeeping: Again, these are the staff members from whom you need and want quality attention. After some minimal monetary influence after our first night, our staff seemed to understand exactly when to clean the room (mid-morning) and when to provide our turndown (dinnertime) service for the remainder of the week. A recommendation is to inform housekeeping early in your trip to provide extra towels every day. P.S.: you donâ€™t need to bring shampoo, conditioners, lotions, after sun lotions, etcâ€¦as the hotel provides generous Lâ€™Octaine products. Restaurants: Best meal of the day is definitely breakfast. The made to order pancake/egg/omelet dishes, the fresh fruit, fresh squeezed juices and fresh bakery goods are the exception at this resort. Pricey, but outstanding. Our dinner at Pacific Grill was easily beaten out by Spagoâ€™s upstairs, again both pricey. Never made it to Ferraroâ€™s, because, after a couple of days, we found out that 40 minutes away in Lahaina, you could get the same wonderful meals for one-quarter the price. Of course, itâ€™s not the resort, but we spent many evenings driving with the top down, back and forth with wondrous views of the islands. The shopping for various souvenirs and keepsakes was also much better in Lahaina. Rooms: We can imagine some of the negatives about the â€˜partial ocean viewâ€™ rooms. If you are staying near the rear of the hotel, you only get a limited view of the ocean, but the gardens appear to make up for the loss. Keep in mind that this is Hawaii, and that the hotels are normally set further back from the shore than those found on the East Coast, and in the Gulf of Mexico. Just make sure you speak with the hotel to get a mutual understanding before your arrival. It has been my experience to have a discussion with the hotel staff (not reservation staff) before any stay at any hotel of consequence. Bell Desk: If you have a rental car, do be sure to call down to get your car before your leaving the room. It may take up to 10 minutes to get your car otherwise. Always ask for water and/or towels if you are out for the day or evening. They are free and pleantiful. Try the picnic baskets provided by Room Service, but only get one meal for two people if you are taking a trip around the island. Too much food if you order two full meals. Summary: It is expensive, period. Make sure there is not a massive convention at the hotel during your stay. The day of our departure, we saw a huge convention arriving and could understand how the hotel could become overcrowded (although we were told they were 95% capacity during our stay). Nevertheless, that could be due to the congregation of too many people in one area at one time. Unfortunately, we never hit the spa, because we ended up driving around the island 4 of 7 days. The remaining time was spent just relaxing and enjoying the views and the beauty of the island. In addition, if you decide to stay at either of the neighboring resorts, we spoke with some people who said they would much rather have stayed at Four Seasons. Mostly because they said, it appeared as though the property was not so overwhelming in size or total number of people. They also said they were nickel and dimeâ€™d to death on â€˜resortâ€™ fees. Moreover, it is all practically the same beach, but quieter. By the way, never a problem with children running and screaming. Quite the contrary - and we don't have kids. Would not recommend if you are young and single, scoping out other singles. It's definately a 'couples' or family atmosphere, married or not. We don't have any real complaints about the place. We only have fabulous memories.

Reviews.Title: “Everything as stated..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Partially due to having read the reviews of this hotel on this site, my fiance and I booked a weeks stay at teh Four Seasons Maui for our Honeymoon and it is everything that most have stated it to be. From the cold towel offered to you at check-in you know you have arrived at a place that will treat you extraordinarily. Upon check-in we were also told that we had been upgraded from our originally booked garden view room to a partial ocean view executive suite. What a great surprise that was! Even though we never really used the extra room, it was exceptional. The bathroom is HUGE and the private lanai is fabulous for relaxing and watching the sunset. Only negative was housekeeping. They kept wanting to turn down our room at 5:30 even though we were always in our room at that time and asked them to come back after 7:00. This with the fact that they usually didn't end up cleaning our room in the first place until around 3:00 most days. The pool area is great. It's not huge, but you never feel crowded. We didn't find that securing a cabana was exceptionally difficult either. If you get to the pool by 9:00 am, you should have no problem getting a good one. Covered seating is almost always available regardless of time we found as well. One word of caution at the pool. Drink prices were high ($10 for a pin colada) as well as food ($18 for a burger). Best to go elsewhere for lunch. Restaurants are both good (didn't try the other one, Seaside or something like that). I would avoid Ferraro's though. Absolutely stellar setting, but woefully overpriced. THey didn't have a single wine that was available by the glass for under $13. Entrees were in the $38-$40 range. Plus, while good, the food was great in our opinion. Spago was better. Definitely ask for an outside table. Prices were more reasonable (at least for Maui standards) and food was better. We had two excellent meals there. Other place we had dinner where Nicks Fishmarket (EXCELLENT food, and great service plus a pretty good open air setting) at the neighboring Kea Lani Resort and Mama's which we weren't overly impressed with and probably isn't worth the drive. We also went to the Maui Price Luau, which I wouldn't recommend as it's pretty generic. The one negative I would have on the Four Seasons is their concierge service. I would highly recommend booking any excursions and dinner reservations on your own as the concierge doesn't add any value. They aren't particularly well connected and aren't able to get prime dinner times at popular restaurants better than you would be able to. Plus you will have to pay full retail for any excursions in comparison to buying them at any of the excursion shops located in the towns. Also I would highly recommend the Maui Revealed guidebook. All of their reviews where pretty much spot on and they give good ideas of where to grab lunch and/or breakfast economically.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Did a Honeymoon there for first week in May 2005. We stayed on the Club Level and highly recommend if you can sacrifice the extra cash. The food and drink in the Club Lounge is great and the personal conceriege (sp?) will gladly attend to your every need and provide great insight to Mau. Everything was typical Four Seasons' excellence. It is VERY pricey, but in my opinion, I could not imagine staying anywhere else on Maui. The following is a list of restaurants that we dined at with the first being our favorite and the last our least favorite: 1. Capeche (Small. Great view, food and service) Ferraros (Tie)(Table near ocean is must, food and service were excellent). 3. Spago (Food is good but you pay a premium for Wolfgang's name)(Must get outdoor table). 4. Nick's (Food was good; however, their service, while excellent, is somewhat gimicky) 5. Mama's (Not worth the drive from Waileia)(Food was ok to good; good evening ambiance)

Reviews.Title: “Only 4-stars for the 5-star hotel...”
Reviews.Author: mhbtr
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just returned from a week at the Four Seasons. It was, indeed, a lovely resort. However, we felt that it lacked that certain je ne sais quoi. To the resort's credit, we found the consierge & valet staffs to be wonderfully helpful & resourceful recommending restaurants (LOVED Mama's Fish House & Hali'imaille General Store) & providing us with ample bottled water for all of our excursions as well as blankets (Haleakala at sunrise - 40 degrees in late May! Pack pants/long sleeves if you plan to do this!). Additionally, we thoroughly we enjoyed the cabanas. (Unlike some reviewers, we were out by 9 am & never had any difficulty getting the seats we wanted & the resort was completely booked.) The chilled towels & fruit were highly refreshing (though they could have been more forth coming with both as it was QUITE hot) & they did keep our glasses filled with ice water. The room was nice (the large bathroom was the best part), but not extraordinary (expected much nicer linens). In our experience, the hotel's cleaning staff was its weakest element. Many days our room was not cleaned until 4 pm. (Although, ironically, they showed up at 10:30 on the day we were checking out - we were in the process of finishing our packing & did not understand why they did not wait until our check out.) When we pulled down an extra blanket stored in the closet to use, it was very obviously soiled. They immediately sent another one after we called, but then failed to remove the soiled one until the next day. Daily I would have to call to request extra towels/washcloths (primarily because we were trying to get ready & they still had not cleaned our room). Regardless, after a day or 2 of this, note should have been made to leave extra towels in our room. Also, twice they failed to put away the ironing board after it had been used. While these things may seem quite picky, these tiny details are what you are paying for to stay at this caliber of resort. Details are their specialty. The food was good (not outstanding) & quite high ($18 for a cheeseburger - although it did come with both fries & onion rings & $4 for a coke). On the night of our 10th anniversary, we chose to eat at Spago. Again, good but not extraordinary (although I DID thoroughly enjoy the appetizer with the sesame cones). We were highly disappointed that we were not given a table with a view (we notified them that it was our 10 year at the time of making our reservations). When I expressed this, they apologized, but said that those were already taken. In all, we did enjoy our stay, but did leave feeling that the resort lacked the attention to detail that is synonomous with that type of resort. We would possibly stay there again (the weather is always sunniest in Wailea), but only after careful consideration of other resorts.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Wailea”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 10-day vacation in Wailea, Maui. This was my second stay at the Four Seasons. I enjoyed my stay here even more the second time around. During our stay, the hotel supposedly had a 94% occupancy, but at no time did I feel that the hotel, beach, pool or restaurants were crowded. We never had to wait to get a private cabana. Service was tremendous, almost to a fault. Of course, I will echo previous reviews of this resort by stating it is indeed pricey, especially the food and alcoholic beverages. Even so, it was worth every dollar. On two occasions, I checked out the Fairmont (next to the Four Seasons) as well as the Grand Wailea, Marriott and Renaissance also in Wailea. The Four Seasons is somewhat smaller than its neighbors (Fairmont/Grand Wailea), but I think this lends to its appeal and exclusivity. My fiancee and I stayed on the Club Floor (8th Floor) which costs more because one has unlimited access to food and beverages (including alcohol). It opens at 6:00 a.m., and closes in the late evening. In the long-run, this turned out to be a smart and convenient way to to conserve one or possibly two nights of dining out. Some nights, we just didn't feel like getting dressed for dinner and opted to watch the sun set from private balconies on the club floor while drinking wine and eating crab claws, among other delicious yummies. I'd highly recommend the Four Seasons!

Reviews.Title: “I Must Have Stayed at the Hotel's Evil Twin”
Reviews.Author: billyar
Reviews.Content: Judging from the comments below I must have been at a different hotel. This hotel is just too big to work. Perhaps the fact that we were given the worst Ocean View room I have ever encountered and the location among other Mega-resorts on a dry and unappealing, except for the beach, area of Maui colored my opinions. Our Ocean View, Club Level room was at the back of the inner-side of the U-shaped building. All we could see was a sliver of beach between the wall of our lanai and the rooms on the other side of the resort. They really push the envelope calling it a Ocean View. When I walked in I thought a mistake had been made. The Club Level Room was large but rather corporate and plain. It lacked any kind of plants or floral arrangement. There was no bedisde phone, no shaving mirror, and no magazines in the room. The service was very uneven. Room service did not address us by name on the phone, and the cart was left in front of our door all night and into the next day, despite our call. There were no towels at the pool, and the fountain was not operational; kids ran wild. I requested a big robe in the spa as a cover-up as we had to walk through the public areas of the resort for beachside massage. It never arrived and I had to walk through the Resturant in my bathing suit and too-small robe. The spa attendant offered me a big apology when I returned. I would have preferred proper service. The staff was much more concerned with rushing us to our massage than customer comfort. The architecture of this Monster among Monsters is 80's corporate. It looks like the headquarters of a Silicon Valley chip maker. On the plus side the Club Room food was superb and the L'Occitane amenities were great. Nevertheless, this was by far the most expensive and least appealing lodging of our trip. The place is really just too big and crowded-- noisy, unmannered families and drunks on their Honeymoon--to provide the usual Four Seasons experinece. And at nearly one thousand dollars a night it was highway robbery. There are superior hotels to be found elsewhere that offer a more serene and desirable environment.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons v. Fairmont Kea Lani”
Reviews.Author: HotelSnob2006
Reviews.Content: I went through most of the reviews of the Four Seasons and the Fairmont located next door before we went on our trip. I could not decide which hotel to stay at so we split our time between the two. What sets all four seasons hotels apart is the polish and level of service that no other hotel chain can come provide. There were many more positive attributes of this hotel than negative ones. But, to me there were 3 negatives about this resort so that is why I deducted one star. First, the pool area is much smaller than the Fairmont and there aren't as many good seats available when the hotel is occupied to capacity. Plus, the pool itself gets crowded. Second, the resort shares its beach area with the Grand Wailea whereas the Fairmont has a more private secluded beach area so it gets noisy. Third, the walls are really thin so you can hear the guests next to you. During our stay we heard the family next door to us and then later a couple being intimate. It was uncomfortable to say the least. With that being said, there are so many other positives about this hotel that I would stay here again. Our check in was fast and the front desk staff was so professional and helpful. Our room was very nice with a lovely marble bathroom and the rate was $20 cheaper than the Fairmont. Every wednesday is managers reception day at 5 or 6 PM so the hotel offers complimentary mai tais, wine, and snacks with a chance to meet the senior staff members of the hotel (ie: marketing director, manager, etc.). What I really liked about this Four Seasons is that it does not nickel and dime you like the Fairmont. Things like, late checkout (until 2-3PM if room is available), cabanas, DVDs, parking, latest magazines, video games, and bottled water are all free. Pool side service is exceptional, do not refuse an evian spritz! Spago and Ferraros have great menus and if you are counting carbs then there are plenty of options for you. Plus, if there is something on the menu that you would like but it is not available, simply request it with no additional charges. For example, I asked for whole wheat pasta at the Fairmont and was told I would have to give the hotel 48 hour notice and would be charged extra. Four seasons had it readily available with no extra charge. That is is just one example of the level of service at this hotel. The spa is very nice and appropriately priced. I am an avid spa goer with high standards so this spa met my needs quite nicely. I recommend the stress reliever massage and ultimate foot treatment with Doug. Spago is great but I personally enjoyed Ferraro's more because of the amazing sunset view! There are many more complimentary activities at this hotel. We had free scuba and tennis lessons. There are also water aerobics, yoga, spinning, and pilates classes offered. Overall, this hotel offers so many small classy touches that make up for any structural challenges (pool and beach areas) in comparison with other comparable properties like the Fairmont next door. I will most likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stop looking for a place to stay -- THIS is the BOMB BABY!”
Reviews.Author: ADriggs
Reviews.Content: This was HANDS down THE most luxurious resort I have EVER experienced. The staff, the service, the accommodations, the food, the landscaping, the entire experience was a perfect 10! When making our reservations, they knew we had a young child with us (he was 4)... they went OVER THE TOP to make him comfortable. When we opened the door to our suite they had put a protective netting over the balcony so that nothing could go through the bars, padded protectors were around all of the tables' edges, they had a special platter of crushed graham crackers to look like sand with gummy worms and white/chocolate shells along with buried "treasure" candies, a sand bucket full of ice with a little carafe of cold milk, a shovel, a stuffed dolphin and some cookies for him! They also had the bathtub set up with alphabet sponges that spelled out his name and a soft hippo faucet cover on the bath tub. He felt like this vacation was all about him! The pool... the pool attendants are the most attentive, friendly servers. They help you choose locations based on where the sun is and where you wanted to be in relation... if you wanted shade, etc. The pool itself was pristine... the waterfall was fun. My son had a great time. The breakfast buffet was a FEAST! Everything was fresh and tasted as if it were made just the way I liked it. Absolutely divine. The reception staff remembered us... and called us by name on sight. THAT was very professional in my opinion and deserved major kudos. The room was comfortable and the bathroom was a DREAM! Next time we go to Maui, there is NO question where we will stay... they have earned our forever seal of approval.

Reviews.Title: “Hands down spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: sunveggie7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June '01 for our honeymoon and came back to find everything just as perfect in Oct "04. I have since discovered this web site and want to retroactively write a review. This hotel is as good as it gets...PERIOD! We have been lucky enough to have stayed in many of the finest hotels in the world and this one probably takes the cake. Both stays were perfect and I would go back everyday, any day in a heart beat. Where to start? Both times we stayed on THE CLUB FLOOR and if you can afford it you should too. The service was absolutely second to none, by the time we left we felt as if the club concierges were family. They learn your name from the get go and only address you by name afterwards. They have wonderful reccommendations and always follow up to see how your experience was. The club floor (and hotel for that matter) is peaceful, serene and lovely. The restaurants too were exceptional with our favorite being Ferraro's. You will not find a better dining view ANYWHERE if you go at sunset with the tiki torches lit. Absolutely breathtaking. Perhaps the portions were small but the food was delicious and I talked my husband into going there for lunch AND dinner on more than one occasion. Yes it is all expensive but what do you expect? Spago was also fabulous with it's sexy decor and interestingly shaped booths that seem to all face the beautiful view. Food was also excellent. The spa is absolutely peaceful and wonderful as were the couples massages given in grass thatched huts above the beach. There is no greater relaxtion than listening to the ocean crashing onto the beach as you are being massaged. HEAVEN ON EARTH! Yes the spa is on the small side but the treatments and facilities are very nice. The only reason to go to the much talked about Graind Wailea Spa is for the Hydrotherapy circuit which was very interesting and like nothing I have seen before. The spa treatments themselves however were better at the Four Seasons than the Grand Wailea. Overall this hotel is really where it is all at. The rooms are comfortable and very nice and do not make you feel like you are in a traditional hotel room. Rather you feel as if you are in a condo or in the guest room of someone's home. The bathrooms are big and gorgeous and the maid service is great. I obviously cannot say enough great things about this property. The only (and I mean only) negative I can think of is that the treadmills are open air which is nice in the early morning but VERY hot in the afternoon. I personally require air conditioning to keep me going on a hot treadmill! :-) MAHALO FOUR SEASONS!

Reviews.Title: “THE ULTIMATE Honeymoon Resort!”
Reviews.Author: ebalestro
Reviews.Content: If you're looking to experience a honeymoon that is intimate and romantic, with the luxurious service and amenities that can only be experienced at a first-class resort, do not look any further than the Four Seasons. I had done extensive research before booking our travel plans for our April honeymoon, and after 10 days of ultimate paradise, we are thrilled with our decision. The Four Seasons is luxurious- there is simply nothing that falls by the wayside, the resort cut no corners when designing this space. The service is impeccable- everyone knew your name and never ceased to ask if you needed anything. And the atmosphere is upscale and intimate- at times you felt like you were on your own private island. They definitely made you feel like special guests. We selected a Partial Oceanview room which offered beautiful views of both the gardens and the pacific ocean. The room was sparkling clean, with double doors leading to a huge bathroom that featured double sink, glass stall shower, large soaking tub, and a private room with a toilet. We had a private lanai with two chaise lounges, and a dining table and chairs. It was so peaceful and relaxing-we never heard a sound, other than chirping birds or the waves hitting the beach. Even though the resort was full during the 10 days of our stay, I think there were only 2 occasions that we even saw another guest in our hallway. The environment at the beach and pool was just as we wanted- serene and quiet. All guests seemed to keep their conversations to a hush, while respecting the romantic intimacy and peaceful beauty of the resort. (The Four Seasons even posted polite notices that cell phone use was discouraged in restaurants and/or dining areas.) Shaded cabanas were provided to you every day, at no charge, and you would be escorted daily by the Four Seasons staff who provided fresh towels and soft chair covers. While you relaxed, the staff would also bring you cold towels, fresh fruit, ice water, and refrehing Evian spritzes-also at no charge. (Other resorts charged as much as $55 per day for the cabanas.) We ate breakfast daily at the Pacific Grill, which was a lavish buffet with a made-to-order omelette/waffle/pancake station, as well as a delectable array of tropical fruits, breads, pastries and more. The chocolate croissants are to die for. We did try the breakfast buffet at the Grand Wailea (next door) and it didn't even compare. And, their restaurant was noisy filled with screaming kids, loud voices and clanking dishes. The Pacific Grill also offered a romantic, tropical atmosphere for dinner. We ate there on our last night and the food and service were both outstanding. The resort had two other restaurants, Wolfgang Puck's "Spago" and Ferraro's, but despite great reviews from other guests, we did not have a chance to visit either of them. The Four Seasons concierge was unbelievably helpful. They took care of all our dinner reservations, as well as some local activities, and even typed up itineraries for our convenience. Every restaurant recommendation was perfect, we had no complaints. They also offered easy to understand driving directions to ANYWHERE on the island, and the valet provided bottled water and/or towels (if you were headed out for an island excursion!) If you are looking for a high-class honeymoon where you need not worry about anything but romantic relaxation with your spouse, this is your destination. I travel a great deal in my profession, and I've stayed at many resorts that consider themselves "five-star". Very few compare to the Four Seasons, take my word for it. At the Four Seasons Wailea there is no loud music, no volleyball in the pool, and no beachside bingo. Instead you'll find only the calm peace of getting away from it all, in an environment where service and beauty go hand in hand. When you experience your first sunset, you'll see for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: sgp123
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Four Seasons in Maui. It was everything we had thoght it would be. The service was outstanding, the hotel was beautiful and we couldn't have picked a finer place to relax for our honeymoon. Everyone at the hotel was very helpful from the concierge, front desk, pool attendants, and the room service. You get what you pay for, and even though we paid a lot, we got a lot in return. The pool area was very clean and nice. The service at the pool was more than I could have expected, there was water service, food service, towel service and all with a friendly smile. The beach was also very clean and nice. The hotel restaurants were also great. We ate around the hotel during lunch and sometimes for breakfast when we wanted a good cabana. For dinner we tried to get out to some of the other great restaurants on the island. There are plenty of things to do at the hotel and you really don't need to ever leave if you don't want to. We were quite pleased with our experience and would stay at a Four Seasons resort anytime we want to spend extra money and get service in return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel on Maui”
Reviews.Author: Flunie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent 3 nights at this wonderful hotel in the Wailea section of Maui. So many great things to say. The hotel is beautiful, the pool area and beach are fantastic, if a bit crowded. The food and restaurants are amazing, and the Four Seasons always gives a great service experience. For instance, one day, after returning from the beach, I noticed that on the made-up bed, one of the pillowcases had a small stain. No big deal. I called Housekeeping, reported it, and within 15 minutes someone came by to change the pillowcase. We left the property for dinner and when we returned to our room, there was a voice mail from the asst. mgr. of housekeeping. I called back and she profusely apologized and asked if we were inconvenienced. I said "no harm, no foul". When I looked in the washroom, she had left a handwriiten note of apology along with a basket of bath salts and body lotions. This is the Four Seasons! It should be said that it's not cheap, that they did make a small mistake with my golf reservation, and that we found the pool area a little on the busy side. It's also a real "hotel", not a resort like their property on the Big Island. But my wife loved their spa, and it's hard to imagine a better hotel experience. Last point: Although I did not go with my kids, if you have money coming out your ears, the kids will have a great time. They have a terrific kids program, activity room, etc. And what kid wouldn't wat to be spritzed with Evian water!

Reviews.Title: “2 words~~~Hotel of Luxury & Opulence”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: **********Four Seasons equals LUXURY******************* I have never been disappointed with The Four Seasons Hotels and the one in Maui did not disappoint! Rooms: Any room you reserve even the lowest grade category room is luxuriously furnished. Beautiful double doors that lead into a large bathroom. And all bathrooms have speakers which you can listen to music All rooms all CD & DVD players Restaurants: Spago~ EXCELLENT Ferraro's Bar e Ristorante ~Very disappointed! (extremely SMALL portions and not as tasty as Spago's) But fantastic sweeping oceanview Pacific Grill~ Better then Ferraro's Pool: The pool area is Beautiful with the cabanas(free) arranged so the oceanview is not compromised There are two separate pool areas & both were disappointly small and a little dirty. Which wass shocking but the Wailea beach which is located a steps away blows you away! FORGET about swimming in the pool! Go to the Beach! Swimming is excellent in Spring/Summer but turbulent but swimable in the winter. BOTTOMLINE: Four Seasons is unbeatable in service and luxurious accommodations & extremely kids friendly

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons Maui in April, 2005. We found it absolutely terrific in almost every aspect. We would happily stay there again. There is a reason that it is almost always booked. 1. Accommodations. The Four Seasons is expensive. It is not significantly higher priced than its neighbors in Wailea, but it is not for those looking for a bargain. We booked a Garden View room, and well, it was a room with a view of a grassy area. It was not a view of the street, but of a somewhat plain grassy area. As a result, we did not spend much time on the lanai. The room itself was terrific. It was large, and the bathroom was enormous, with a separate deep tub and separate shower. The two double beds were somewhat small, but overall the room was great. We had two small kids with us, and we never felt cramped. 2. Service. The service is precisely what you read about: Outstanding. The staff was friendly and responsive. The concierges provided good advice. The valets were efficient. The beach staff friendly and helpful. They even played baseball with our son on the last day. The food and beverage staff attentive. Service is a hallmark of Four Seasons, and it is easy to see why. 3. The Extras. The Four Seasons does not nickel and dime you. The rooms are expensive. But cabanas are free, the pool is large enough (we never felt crowded), and the umbrella and beach tents are free. Sand toys are free. The Kids Camp is free and our kids (5 and 8) loved it. You can drop into the Kids Camp and need not make an appointment. Snorkeling equipment is free for an hour. Ice water is delivered to you at the beach. Bottled water is given to you when you leave for an expedition. We went on a picnic and were provided with an ice chest, waters, and a blanket. We asked for and received, within twenty minutes, a refrigerator for our room. All complementary. There is no resort free. You can use the spa locker room which is excellent. We even got a late check out. 4. The Food. The food was great, but very expensive. This was apparently endemic to Hawaii in general and Maui in particular. Entrees at restaurants are $35 to $40 each, and it can add up. Conclusion. This was a spectacular hotel. The beach, though small, is great and swimable. The service is great. The facilities are great. Everything was wonderful. If you are not interested in a wild "scene", and seek a more understated and yet elegant hotel, the Four Seasons is for you. We'd like to go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Vickie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Four Seasons in Wailea for 3 nights in March 2005 and we've already rebooked for 2006. We travel alot (this was our 3rd trip to Maui) and have stayed at some pretty nice places throughout the world and this resort is one of the nicest we have every stayed at. The staff are incredibly helpful and polite. The rooms are gorgeous with nice large balconies, and the bathrooms are amazing. We had prime ocean view which was very, very nice. The pool is not as large as some of the other resorts but very classy. Even though we were there in March break there were very few children which pleased my husband and I. The Fairmont and the Grand Wailea seemed to have tons of kids. We had dinner and lunch at Ferraros. We loved the food and atmosphere of this restaurant. We even used the gym which we do not usually do while on vacation. But the gym is open air with a nice view, so we though "why not". There's also a path which runs along the ocean in front of the hotels which is very scenic. We walked this a number of times. Many people jog it in the early mornings. The one thing that we were disappointed about had nothing to do with the Four Seasons but more with Wailea itself. We found that, in comparison to Kanaapali, there are very few restaurants within walking distance. However we did find the weather to be better in Wailea than Kanaapali. Next year when we go back, we will be staying a few nights in Wailea (just to stay at the Four Seasons) and a few nights in Kanaapali (for the variety of restaurants). We've also already booked the Four Seasons on the Big Island since everyone seems to give it outstanding reviews as well.

Reviews.Title: “Best thing about our vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night on our way back from Kauai (previously on our trip we had stayed at the Kaanapali Alii and the Kauai Marriott). Staying here was the best thing about our vacation. We had a one bedroom garden view suite. We loved the room. We were traveling with our two sons (12 & 17). There was a sleeper sofa and we used a rollaway bed (no charge). The two full baths in the suite made it great for a family of four to get ready. We loved the service and free cabanas at the beach and pool. We were constantly surprised with the included snacks and amenities with which we were provided. The weather was cool the two days we were at the Four Seasons, but our sons loved the game room and spent several hours there. The beach was nice, however, our sons liked Kaanapali better because the boogie boarding was better (i.e., bigger waves). We had a late flight out and although late checkout was not available for our room, we used the Spa facilities to shower and change at the end of the day. We loved the men's facilities (everything you needed was provided) although mom thought the female facilities were too dark to do her hair and makeup. Overall, I would highly recommend the Four Seasons. Everything about the hotel was top-notch and allowed us to just relax and enjoy ourselves. We loved it so much we will probably plan on taking our next vacation at a destination where there is a Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Unreal”
Reviews.Author: artgirl23
Reviews.Content: Outrageous is all I can say! CLEAN, PLUSH rooms and the BEST BEACH in HAWAII!!Amazing Service!!

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could still be there”
Reviews.Author: nancymb
Reviews.Content: We have been home for 3 weeks and still miss it. We were there the first week of March. We stayed at the Fairmont for 3 nights and the Four Seasons for 3 nights because based on other reviews we could not decide. THE ROOM. Big (we had a suite). Nice. They brought a toddler bed for our 3 year old and once described to her as a "princess bed" she loved it. They had movies and music in the room and you could get more if you asked. They had baby toiletries and her name spelled in bath sponges, plus a mini bathrobe. Great details. THE SERVICE. The service was great, as expected with the FS. THE POOL. Cabanas were nice and free but did not close, so we were still trying to escape the sun at times. Overall the pool was not too crowded and we could find a great spot every day. Food at the pool was great. Slide and kiddie pool good for the little ones. They have lots of buckets and toys at the kiddie pool in case you did not have room to pack any. SPAGO. We wanted to try since we'd never been to any of them. Great service. In fact, I'd seen an item on the menu the previous day while walking by and they made a variation of it for me even though it was not on that night's menu. Beautiful setting. Delish. BREAKFAST BUFFET. Some complain about prices on Maui. I try not to think about it but this is one break.... small children (I think under 6 but don't quote me) are FREE. Very good. Better than the Fairmont's in my opinion. SPA. Oh yea. Massage, body wrap, delish smelling items. Oh yea. Must partake. REC AREA. Great for older kids and also grown ups. Pool table, video games, tv, shuffleboard, ping pong, board games, etc. KIDS. They had a camp but the kiddo's have to be 5 to be dropped off. They have babysitting through a separate service but we did not use. OTHER. We miss it. We are planning to go next March and will stay at the Fairmont the whole time. If we were honeymooners or traveling alone, the FS would be our destination. It is a bit more relaxing. We did not ever feel that our 3 year old was unwelcome and she was enjoyiner herself, but the Kea Lani was a bit better overall for little ones.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, luxurious resort.”
Reviews.Author: margo8461
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Maui and would definitely recommend this resort for those traveling without children who are looking for a relaxing, quiet vacation. We have 3 children and stayed here first before moving over to the Grand Wailea. This is the ultimate in luxury and pampering. The room was huge, comfortable and had a great view. The pools are not as fabulous for kids as the Grand Wailea's, but are very nice. We really appreciated that so many "extras" are complimentary here and that you are not charged for every little thing. The beach is beautiful and the great sevice continues there too. Definitely a top-notch resort for those looking for service, pampering and relaxation. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “The Ultimate Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been fortunate enough to make it to this hotel 7 out of 8 years in a row, from the ages of 11-18. In Wailea, we have also stayed at the Kea Lani and visited the Grand Wailea. While the Grand Wailea is nice, and we had zero complaints with the Kea Lani, no hotel on the island can even try and compare with the Four Seasons. From the moment you walk onto the property and step out of your car, you realize what paradise truly is. This is the only hotel in the world where the bellhop is someone you would consider your friend. Everything at this place is designed with perfection in mind: from the amazing restaurants, to the beautiful beach, amazing spa, to the famous view from the top of the steps, booking any other hotel would just be mistake. To further elaborate on how amazing the hotel is, the one year that I did not make it to the Four Seasons, my parents took myself and my siblings to Atlantis in the Bahamas, and while it was nice and fun, it was pale in comparison. Most other people on this message board have mentioned all that is wonderful abut this place, the beautiful rooms, the great ocean views, the AMAZING bathrooms, the complimentary scuba lessons, the great kids program, the impeccable service, the spritzing and fresh fruit. I can mention that one of my favorite times of the day was when the pool staff would bring fruit popsicles around for everyone (~2ish i believe). The shopping and golf cannot even been compared to anything else on the island. While Makena and Wailea are both great courses, I feel the staff at Makena is more personable and I enjoy that course more (probably because it is not as trafficked). To the people that say the Grand Wailea is better for families with kids, they are wrong. They claim that there are kids in the pool, but they are bored - but if they paid any attention they would notice that the kids that are bored in the pool are the same kids that walk over from the Grand Wailea (you can tell it is them from their horrid looking wrist bands) because they are bored there. The kids for all seasons program is amazing, as well as the recently renovated game room - featuring video games, ping pong, pool, table shuffleboard, big screen tv, and plenty of board games and DVDs that work fine in the DVD player in your room. Also, the people that say the Four Seasons is not good for younger people, they must not realize that there are always plenty of honeymooners there, and I really don't see how anyone could choose any other hotel besides the four seasons. I know that I have always enjoyed the Four Seasons, and I hope that other people can experience the same joy as I have. Mark Bashuk bashukma@gmail.com

Reviews.Title: “On Business versus Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: LJ'smommy
Reviews.Content: Beach walk - beautiful but it's only 1 1/2 miles round trip not 3. Also, quite narrow - you can't walk hand in hand 2 abreast when someone is running the other way. Also, tight squeeze with a stroller. Warning - Take an umbrella!!! They're everywhere around the hotel including the closet of your room. I got soaked as did my 1 year old. Excellent for kids - babyproofing includes soft, plush bumper pads around both night stands and dinette table as well a crib with bumper, balcony netting, electic socket covers, etc. Also, covers for water spout and water flow control in tub (in addition to child's name spelled out in sponges - tho they were way off on our child's name we appreciated the effort). Also, chocolate milk, 2 chocolate cookies, gummy bears, and M&Ms delivered the 1st night (again - appreciated the effort but don't want sugar high first night with jet lag etc.). Best deal in the hotel - the kids menu. For example, yummy grilled cheese, perfect french fries and side of 3-4 different kinds of fruit all for $5. Can't beat it!!! We ordered it lunch and dinner for our 1 year old. Note: a small glass of milk to go with it is $4-5 plus tip, tax, etc. Had refrigertaor delivered - only took 5 phone calls and us remaining in the room for 1 1/2 hours to do it - even tho' told them repeatedly that we had fresh food that we had brought on ice packs all day from the states for the baby that would spoil. Nanny service - $14/hour. Used one night for corporate dinner and one day for a LONG round of golf on the Gold Course (beautiful!). Great game room for older kids (pool, ping pong, foozball, board games, DVDs, separate glass-enclosed computer game room with 6-8 terminals, etc.) Many free activities - in addition to snorkel, scuba demo and outrigger also daily activities like lei making class, etc. Separate rainy day activities they add at last minute - movies, in-door yoga, etc. Room was still not ready when we arrived after 5pm even though check in is 4pm. Difficult when traveling with 1 year old. Also, had business dinner and needed to be showered, dressed and ready by 6:15. No aplogy. Big mistake was that we had pre-paid a partial ocean view room and they stuck us in the worst room - 767 - 1 flloor above and overlooking maintenance area/employee parking. Significant traffic/truck noise. Told desk it was wrong room but were basically ignored. Fortunately, the mistake was rectified late the next day after mentioning it to our attentive in-house corporate travel hosts/organizers. But we still spent the whole afternoon packing everything up after empyting 6 suitcases, moving the small objects and calling 3 times for the rest of our luggage to be delivered. The front desk manager did send us a nice tray with pineapple juice and pineapple candies the day after in apoplogy but felt we wasted the few precious moments we had of free time in as much as we were there on business. Art exhbits seemingly everday in the lowere poolside lobby with artists performing their craft live alongside the display of their work for sale - jewelry, pottery, carving, sculptin, painting, etc. Beautiful and fascinating, e.g., prints of fish that have been and dried and the skins brush/rolled with mutli-colored paints and then pressed on fabric not paper or fish done with blak and white and the penciled in colored pencils because there were so delicate. Quite windy and rainy in March. Cold at night.

Reviews.Title: “Go... you must!!!”
Reviews.Author: lynger41
Reviews.Content: The pictures say it all.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Wailea”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed on Maui for 8 nights. We split our trip between the Four Seasons and the Grand Wailea. We have also stayed at the Kea Lani on a previous trip. The Four Seasons is the best of the 3, in my opinion, but it depends what you're looking for. We enjoyed the intimacy of the resort. Our ocean view suite was amazing with views of Molokini, Haleakala and in March, a lot of whale watching! The service was exceptional. Pool side cabanas, water, fruit...the complimentary amenities were wonderful. Pool-side spa services were also available for a fee- the foot massage was well worth it- you don't even need to move- they set up at your chair. The pool is smaller, but clean and not crowded even in peak season. Ferraro's was an exceptional meal where you can watch the sunset and dine seaside. Spago lives up to its name; it was wonderful. Take a walk along with the concrete side walk that follows the ocean for 3 miles, round trip. It's well worth it. Compared to the Grand Wailea, the FS goes above and beyond in all areas. When we return to Maui, we'll stay at FS and visit GW and Kea Lani for a meal or two. Wailea is the only way to go, in my opinion. Shopping and golf is the best on the island. The restaurants are top-notch. Expensive, yes...but what do you expect? Sea Watch at the Wailea Gold golf course has an unparalleled view at sunset and the food was incredible. Sarento's on the Beach, which is run by the same company that owns Nick's Fishmarket, is also a great seaside dining experience with excellent seafood dishes. Both of these restaurants take you off the properties and still have great service and cuisine. Longhi's at the Shops at Wailea was also good food, however the view left a bit to be desired. The Grand Wailea restaurants that we recommend are Humuhumu and Kincha. Before leaving, I booked dinner reservations at a few restaurants for 7:00pm. After arriving, I changed most of the reservations to 6:00 so that we could watch the sunset. Most of the restaurants in Wailea have sunset views and it's worth it to take advantage even though you're dining earlier. With the time change, particularly if you're on the East Coast or CST, you'll be happy you chose to dine early.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Chedder but Worth every Penny”
Reviews.Author: hogburn
Reviews.Content: The was the BEST Hotel I have ever stayed at. It's Pricey..... but it delivers. This was my first experience with a $19 Grilled Cheese Sandwich. It tasted the same as an $8 grilled cheese, but I figure the other $11 subsidizes the costs associated with having such meticulous and well trained staff. The grounds are awesome. The room was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute of it!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: NOTHING WILL COMPARE!!! My husband and I carefully selected the 4S Maui to celebrate our 5th Wedding Anniversary last April ('04). Let me start by telling you we were not disappointed - in fact, we were more than pleased with our choice. We had originally booked next door at the Grand Wailea, but cancelled our reservation after reading some scathing reviews and realizing how far more expensive it was to be a guest there (parking, cabanas,activites)...and on top of that the 4S is a far better resort anyway! The service and attention to detail and food (Ferraro's at sunset!!) and spa (strongly recommend getting their signature Treatmant for all Seasons) far exceeds anything you will find elsewhere. Go next door to the Kea Lani for dinner at Nick's. Went on Halaeakala sunrise tour and though we grew up in NY, froze in our sweats - bring a jacket and hat and gloves: that is your warning! Favorite memory is going on a sunset catamaran cruise...ahhhhhh. Booked a mountainside room and unfortuneatly weren't upgraded upon check-in. That simply was our only complaint, and a very minor one at that. Our room nonetheless was beautiful and the marble bathroom was huge - bed very comfortable, too. Maui is paradise and the Four Seasons only elevates it to another level. We will return! You must go!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great, but you're definitely paying for it.”
Reviews.Author: screennamesaresilly
Reviews.Content: We went here on our honeymoon. We were a bit non-plussed with the "garden view" (street/parking lot) from our suite, but the suite itself made up for it. Service is great here. I can't think of any time when I had even the slightest issue with service, and my expectations were very high to begin with. This hotel is fairly high up there in terms of cost. One thing I think you should know, though, is that this hotel doesn't nickel-and-dime you like some. There are a lot of things that are complimentary/included in what they offer that other hotels would charge for. You'll pay for drinks like you would at most places, but this hotel isn't going to add a bunch of extra charges for parking, access to the fitness facility, etc. I've read in other reviews that folks my age felt out of place. I can see why. I worried about what I wore to breakfast. Most of the guests were 20+ years older than us (reflected hilariously in Led Zeppelin played by classical violin and guitar in their Italian restaurant). I'm not saying this is a point that the Four Seasons needs to address: I'm just pointing this out for younger readers--This won't keep me from staying there again. We ate at all three restaurants while there. It definitely wasn't cheap. One thing you need to know about Maui: You're not going to find too many (if any) $20 dinners here.
