Our average was about $200. The best of the three restaurants was Ferraro's (Italian). If you book an early reservation there, you can see the sunset. Note: This is not a same-day reservation type of place. Book in advance. Spago was ok. They're very proud of their food (like most upscale Maui restaurants). I'd suggest getting dinner at their bar and peoplewatching--great bartenders! Pacific Grill was also fine. Their breakfast certainly is impressive...and expensive. If you are interested in diving, I'd recommend checking their dive shop out. The guys there are very nice, and are very competent at what they do. A quick lesson is complimentary, and I'd recommend taking the $99 dive afterwards. I think we'd both go back, though. Service is great, and this is a great facility. There aren't too many places where the bellman takes you on a tour of the hotel on the way to your room.

Reviews.Title: “A piece of heaven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the first week of our honeymoon at the Four Seasons in Maui and it was incredible. From the moment we arrived we experienced the incredible service that the Four Seaasons is known for. Our room was beutiful and spacious and incredibly relaxing. if you are looking for a dinner that will blow you away not only because of the food, but also the view, try Ferraro's. Being from New England, I found the wine to be wammer then I am used to. I decided that this was the place in which to try my hand at scuba, great choice. The staff at the dive center made it feel like a walk in the park. The hotel is located in the town of Wailea. there is great golf and shopping without leaving the town. The location is the a perfect place to launch a days adventures from. With all there was to do, we found ourselves eating on our Lanai twice in one week, that says a lot for the room. This hotel is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: lunchtime
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Four Seasons Wailea as part of our honeymoon in September 2004 and now, I don't think we can visit Maui and stay anywhere else! The moment you walk in the door, you just feel peaceful and serene. It's romantic, classy, elegant. When checking in, they were extremely polite, calling us Mr. and Mrs. and remembering our names! We were lucky and got upgraded to a beautiful suite with a partial ocean view. The bathroom was to die for! Marble bathroom, with two sinks, separate vanity area for putting on makeup, soaking tub and separate standup shower. The pool area was AMAZING.. Beautiful cabanas, top-notch service. (love the cold towels, strawberries, and ice-water with lemon they keep refilling, and being spritzed with evian water) The beach was gorgeous too. My husband went for a run in the morning and when he came back - they had a cold towel and bottled water for him. The spa was incredible.. service and facility. Everything about this hotel was perfect. Can't imagine staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Is there such a thing as a perfect hotel experience?”
Reviews.Author: tennis_ace_2005
Reviews.Content: Outstanding property! Can't think of a negative thing to say. My two boys get birthday cards from the Kids Club people. The small waterslide at the kids pools is great. Service at the Four Seasons is a tad business like for my taste, but most people would probably construe that as professionalism. We prefer Ritz and JW for a less formal atmosphere, but that's obviously personal preference. This hotel makes it almost impossible to have something not meet your already high expectations. High recomend spending the extra $$$ for an deluxe oceanview room. We used the highly reliable babysitting service and felt totally comfortable that our kids were in good hands. This hotels status as the best of the best is well deserved!

Reviews.Title: “four seasons runs a tight ship!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: just a perfect stay- really spoils a person for other hotels! beautiful facilities, pleasant staff, never had to wait for the concierge, valet, bellhop, etc. we'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: dicarlo27
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went on a great vacation in Maui. We had been to Oahu and Kauai a few years before and had a wonderful time. We spent 7 days in Kauai at the Hyatt and loved it. In Maui we had heard and read that the Four Seasons was the place to stay in Maui. The hotel was full during the beginning of our stay, but we were able to get a room for the 5 final nights. We checked into the Four Seasons at around 11am. The hotel, grounds are very beautiful. They were very accommodating from the minute they greeted us at the valet. We changed and sat by the pool. As you have read the pool/beach staff are extremely accommodating. Showing you to your chair, setting it up for you, getting you complimentary water etc. etcâ€¦ This is not a family resort. If you have kids take them next door to the Grand Wailea. There were kids playing in the pool and you could see they were very bored. These kids were kicking around a soda can and the FS staff would run after them to pick up the mess these kids were making. This hotel is very stuffy. I felt obligated to get dressed up to walk to the beach. There were quite a few very rude guests that would get upset at the smallest things. We had enough and decided to check out and go next door to the Grand Wailea. Upon check in (at the Grand Wailea) they upgraded us to a full ocean full (at the least expensive room rate, $309) This is a very beautiful resort. This resort is made for families and young adults while still being very upscale The pool is the best in Maui. It is unreal. They have a separate pool that is for adults only. Very similar to the Four Seasons. No kids allowed. This gives you the best of both worlds. You have a nice private pool with a wait staff. Now the staff isn't as attentive as they are at the Four Seasons, but we went to breakfast in beach attire and didn't feel uncomfortable. I guess it really depends what you are looking for. For younger couple (late 20â€™s and 30â€™s) I donâ€™t think you will be happy at the Four Seasons. They Four Seasons is great for your money. They include, valet parking, they donâ€™t surcharge you $15+ a day for a resort fee. We also stayed at the Hyatt at the beginning of our trip. This is located on one of the most popular beaches. But, to go into the ocean you had to walk Â½ mile or so. It is nice to be able to just run out and jump into the ocean like you can at the Four Seasons and the Grand Wailea. The spa at the Four Seasons is very nice. But, so is the Hyatt's. I have my best massage ever at the Hyatt. I didn't try the spa at the Grand Wailea. Email me with questions â€“ ddicarlo99@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: mominnashville
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Maui for our honeymoon. We stayed 6 nights at the Four Seasons and it was perfect. We went the first week of November, which was wonderful because it wasn't crowded. There was some rain on the island, but it stays away from the Wailea area so I have no complaints on the weather. We didn't care too much for the breakfast buffet at Pacific Grill. Instead, we preferred ordering room service where the staff set it up on our lanai. Our dinner at Spago was the the BEST I've ever had in my life. Other great dinners included Nick's at the Kea Lani and Mama's Fish House. It was a long drive to Mama's, especially in Maui's version of rush hour, but worth it. It was a very expensive trip, but we left feeling it was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: jojo1976
Reviews.Content: This was the best resort I have ever been too. If your looking to be treated like royalty, look no further. I have stayed in many 4-5 star hotels and the Four Seasons Wailea surpasses them all. My husband and I stayed at the Four Seasons Wailea for part of our honeymoon, which was 5 days at the Four Seasons, then a 7 day Hawaiian cruise, then 2 nights in Honolulu. After staying in the Four Seasons nothing compared to it. For the rest of our honeymoon we yearned to be back at the Four Seasons. It was heaven on earth. Everyone is treated like royalty, no matter what category room you booked. All of the staff is exeptionally nice and eager to please. You get frozen fruit, cold towels and Evian spritzes as you lounge by the pool and the pool waiters are constantly filling your glass with ice water, so you don't even have to spend money on drinks while hanging at the pool if your on a tight budget. The room rates are a little pricey but the Four Seasons offers great packages like the one we booked, the Mountain Side package which has a car and breakfast daily included (plus we got upgraded). the buffet breakfast is $25 per person, so if you tally up the car rate and free breakfast from the room rate, your paying the same amount for the room that you would pay at a lesser class hotel. Most other hotels in Maui have extra charges also like $15/day resort fee, parking fee, kids activities charge. At the Four Seasons this is all included, even valet parking is free. So when you take all this into consideration the Four Seasons is not as expenisve as it seams. It really is worth every penny. We're planning our next vacation already.

Reviews.Title: “Best Reason to go to Maui”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We love this Four Seasons. Just came back from our 2nd stay at this resort. It is by far the best resort in Maui. I have stayed at the Fairmount and the Ritz and there is no comparison. Great service! Awesome for kids! Upon arrival the room is childproof, the childs name is spelled out in bath sponges and the also provide a small stuff animal. My husband and I are extremely picky and this is by far one of our favorite hotels. Plus the restaurants and pool service is top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Accommodations Not So Great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Seasons Wailea for the second half of my honeymoon in November. We were upgraded to a suite upon check in, but once we entered the suite it was extremely damp and had an odor of must. We were very surprised to find numerous stains on the carpeting and a can of bug spray in the closet. As we turned in for bed that night, we found the sheets and blankets were damp so we called the Front Desk to complain. They offered to move us to another room and when we went to view this room before moving all of our belongings, it was equally as damp. We were told that we were on a tropical island and it was humid and all of the rooms would feel the same. We had just arrived from Oahu where we stayed at the Halekulani, which was amazing, and did not have this problem. I have never had this problem on any of my vacations, let alone my honeymoon. The second day, we bought candles to try to lessen the smell of must in the room. We also tried turning the air conditioning off and leaving the doors to the patios open because it was more comfortable in the hallways and outside then it was in our room. Before we went to sleep that night, my husband used the hair dryer to dry our pillowcases! After our second horrible night of sleep, we called the Front Desk again and asked for a manager to come to our room. He agreed that the smell of must was overwhelming and moved us to another suite that was damp, but did not have the smell of the original room. He also was able to get us a dehumidifier from Housekeeping. We closed the doors to the bedroom and left the dehumidifier on all day for the rest of our stay at the Four Seasons. It was only after we emptied gallons of water numerous times a day out of the dehumidifier that we were able to get a decent nights rest. I will say that the service by the pool was amazing, but it was hard to enjoy any of the other great things about this hotel since we had such a horrible experience with the accommodations. I would never stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place for Cabanas and Service”
Reviews.Author: HEW19
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 6 night stay in early December. If you are sun-sensitive and want a cabana in the shade free of charge, this is the only place to stay. You will also be set up at the pool area and receive personalized service. If a suite or higher category room is available and you are celebrating a special ocassion, you will most likely be automatically upgraded. Their concierge desk is open 24 hours along with the outdoor gym. Visited the Fairmont Kea Lani and the Grand Wailea next door. Feel that Four Seasons is the most reasonable in terms of price and service. You will not be nickled and dimed here. Parking is free as well. Of course, there are other factors to consider depending on your personality. Location of your room: closer to the front of the hotel the better; our room was on the Grand Wailea side and was noisy in mornings. Pool: preferred the second pool which is really a children's one, but was nicer and more exotic. Breakfast: Wish we were able to get this with our package, may be worth it or else is very expensive. Nightlife: If you want to see shows in Lahaina, you need to be type of person who does not mind driving far on highway in evening. Weather: South Maui was windy, but still had lots of sun; West Maui was windy and rainy. Maui has a lot of activities, but if you going there to relax, the Road to Hana and the Haleakala Sunrise Tour may exhaust you. If you get carsick easily from winding roads, remember to take dramamine. The Old Lahaina Luau (need to book in advance) was fantastic as well as the magic show at Warren and Annabelle's. Beware that you may be picked on during this show no matter where you sit. Also stayed at the Hyatt in Kauai and Kahala Mandarin in Oahu after our stay here. In terms of service, it is true that it is hard to stay anywhere else after staying at a Four Seasons Resort. You can write to me at hew19@aol.com.

Reviews.Title: “Great for toddlers!”
Reviews.Author: tc2009
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Four Seasons with our 16 month old son. We had debated between this hotel, the Fairmont, and the Grand Wailea but decided on the Four Seasons because they had a promotion on executive suites. Our son goes to sleep at 7pm and also takes 2 naps a day so we wanted him to be able to sleep in the bedroom while we watched TV or talked in the living area. The suites at the Grand Wailea were about $400 more per night. The Fairmont has all suites but after reading some reviews about older rooms, dirty dishes and bugs decided not to go there. I saw a lot of reviews pertaining to honeymooners or couples but I didn't see many regarding people traveling with babies or toddlers (maybe we are the only ones who are crazy enough to do it!) Anyway it was great for our family, I already told my husband I want to go back every year! When we arrived, they had everything ready for our son, from his own lei at check-in, to a microwave, refrigerator (I had them empty the mini-bar), high chair, disposable bibs, diapers, wipes, swim diapers, cookies and milk, toiletries, crib with baby quilt, stuffed iguana, "JAKE" spelled out with sponges on the bathtub, and DVD's (Spongebob and Little Mermaid, much to my husband's excitement). Upon reading the list of other things available I requested a baby bathtub and a portable changing table as well! EVERYTHING was complimentary- I guess if you want to save room you don't even need to bring diapers, they will give you as many as you want in whatever size you need! Also, they had baby-proofed the room with outlet covers, netting on the balcony railing, and padding on the tables and nightstands. All the restaurants, including room service, have good children's menus. In the mornings we always had the breakfast buffet which was great, and shared with him. After the first day when I asked for oatmeal (complimentary) they would bring him a bowl every morning without being asked. They have kids dishes, silverware, and cups so you don't even have to bring your own. We went to Spago for dinner and they made him a complimentary cheese pizza because he was fussing and squirming, brought it out within 5 minutes so he didn't have to wait. After he was done eating the wait staff would even bring out damp washclothes so we could clean him up. They have a toddler pool which is small but nice, connected to another pool with a small water slide and waterfall. We spent most of our time at the beach, which is beautiful, great service, umbrellas, ice water, etc. Our son loved to run around and play, they have sand toys you can use. Oh, also, next time we won't bring our stroller, they have beautiful, clean strollers you can borrow, everything from umbrellas to joggers- we took our umbrella which is not so comfy so ended up borrowing a bigger one to take walks every morning- there is a lovely paved beach walk that goes along the water by all the hotels. We also went to the Maui Ocean Center which has a nice Aquarium. Anyway, I had heard this hotel was more for couples but I would highly recommend it for families as well, the incredible service makes travelling with babies so much easier. Maybe when our son is older he might want to stay at the Grand Wailea and use the pool, but until then we will come back to the Four Seasons- everyone is so friendly and goes out of their way to ensure you have a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Honeymoon, Doylestown PA”
Reviews.Author: CyndyP
Reviews.Content: What can we say? Everything we heard was true....the perfect place for a romantic honeymoon. We were originally going to stay at the Fairmount Kea Lani but saw the many reviews at TripAdvisor and stayed at the Four Seasons instead. We made the right decision. The positives: We paid for an ocean front prime view room and were upgraded to a suite...much more room. We didn't need it but it was oh so nice!! Hint: The FS will upgrade honeymooners if rooms are available but they will probably only upgrade you a level or two. We stayed in early December, two weeks before busy season. The room & amenities were amazing. We were looking for superior service and were not disappointed! The staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome. Everything was top notch! Our favorites staffers were the valets....they busted their bums for us. They were always pleasant and helpful. We never went anywhere without a bottle of water, extra towels, directions and a wish for a pleasant day. They even washed our car...without asking...after our trip to Hana!! The pool is small but we spent most of the time on the beach. It was beautiful!! The beach attendants are awesome and deserving of tips so please extend them. Cabanas at the pool seemed to fill up and we did see people stake their claim early and head to breakfast. We also saw some folks reserve a cabana, in the shade, and additional chairs in the sun. Given the size of the pool, I thought this a bit rude, especially when people were looking for poolside chairs in the afternoon. (The winds pick up on the beach after lunch so the pool becomes more desirable.) The restaurants are the best! We ate at Spago's twice and had amazing meals and service both times. We like to eat early so we always had a wonderful table and never had to wait. We suggest early reservations...before 7 and then walk off dinner on the beach walk!! Ferraro's was also awesome. Our romantic dinner was just beautiful. In both restaurants, we found the staff and food excellent. We didn't eat at Capise...up the road...but the concierge recommended it for our next visit..yes...we will be back! Please try it and let us know how it is... The breakfast buffet at the Pacific Grill was always yummy. The negatives: We were actually delayed a day in our arrival due to airline mishaps. Gratefully, our travel agent secured an extra day but told us we would have to move rooms. We were fine with that since we didn't have to pay for the extra night. When we checked in, they upgraded us and advised us that we would not have to move for the extra night. We were very pleased they went out of their way to offset the frustration of traveling 36 hours from Philadelphia!! Unfortunately, someone forgot to tell the assistance manager and we received a message the evening before our departure telling us to be packed up in order to move rooms. Long story short, we stayed in our beautiful suite the last night but weren't too pleased that it took three discussions with the assistance manager. They made an error when we checked in and expected us to move nonetheless. This level of resort, they shouldn't make us feel bad for their mistake. I believe the comment was..."It was our mistake and I'm going to discuss this error with the employee who made it. We will just have to move the couple scheduled your room to another." We didn't need to hear that. Other island pointers: Maui Revealed IS the best guide book. We found it amazingly helpful. There are several great beaches in Wailea just down the road from the resort. We went exploring one day and found them all. The snorkeling is really awesome down by the Maui Prince. We thought the Lahina Luau was overrated and not worth the money. The road to Hana was awesome...the Mustang was fine for the one way trip around. Hope the review helps. We are happy to recommend this resort. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Seasons Resort for a week in early December, and even if I try, I cannot think of a negative thing about the hotel. The hotel, the beach, and the whole Wailea community are absolutely beautiful. I had no idea I was in for such a treat!! To sum it all up, I would say that wherever I would go on the island, I just couldn't wait to get back to the hotel. Next time I come to Maui, I want to spend more time at this hotel and less time going to see different sites around the island. Being at the Four Seasons was pure relaxation in a gorgeous setting. And I want to add that the hotel staff are so attentive to making sure you are having a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: SAS-7
Reviews.Content: We had never stayed at the Four Seasons before and this hotel surpassed my expectations. We stayed here for three nights in November 2004. We booked a mountain view room and were upgraded to a partial ocean view room at checkin. They also allowed us to check out late for our 6 pm flight when we left. The staff is very helpful and friendly. We went running in the mornings and they would greet us with cold water and a cold towel upon return. When we left on day trips they would give us bottled water to take with us. The self parking and valet parking were free. The room was nicely sized and the bathroom was huge. The staff was very helpful and the service was great. The pool area was very crowded, but the staff was very helpful with finding chaise lounges. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay for honeymooners.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Here's the breakdown of the hotel: Stayed - April 2004 for our Honeymoon Room - Club Level Suite (Top Floor) - Private Access Only - Partial Ocean View Ammenities - Access to the Club Lounge (free drinks [including alcohol], continental breakfast, and tasty brunch and after-dinner desert bar) Price - $800+ per night The Good: 1. Awesome check-in for Club dwellers - No front desk. You're escorted directly up to the Club Lounge for express check-in with free drinks, warm towels and fresh his/her leis. 2. Unlimited drinks and snacks throughout the day. Forget about room service... a quick stroll to the lounge and you can get whatever you need (in bulk, even). 3. A surprise for my wife was kept a surprise by the staff...no one messed it up! 4. Great consierge service -- for a price, they offer picnic baskets and with a simple call, your car is always ready. 5. The room was a pretty good size. Huge bathroom with bathtub and seperate shower. Ultra soft bed (we both slept great). Romantic lanai. Great turn-down service! Smelled clean and looked immaculate! 6. The dinner at Ferraro's, at sunset, with the live string band was really romantic. Great Service and ambiance (wave lightly crashing in the background and amazing hawaiian sunset). 7. The grounds are well kept; beautiful pool setup. 8. My wife loved the spa services (Scrub, Rub and Facial). We definately got our money's worth! The Bad: 1. The little bar fridge wasn't working -- but they redeemed themselves by giving us a whole new fridge! 2. The bathtub was too small. They say "deep-soaking tub", but it only fits one comfortably. With the amount of room in this area, they should have installed spa-style baths. 3. Thank god Spago's has great food, because the service just hurt! We had reservations, which we showed up 15 minutes early for and ended up waiting for at least 45 minutes. Then our waiter made us feel rushed and indecisive. 4. The "beach" property they have wasn't very serene. It was kind of cramped and the waves were a bit too big to play in. Plus the employees in this section didn't seem inclined to talk to you. You had to make an effort to get anything. This portion of the resort left a lot to be desired. Overall: Well worth the money. We have memories that will last a lifetime and a place to return for on anniversaries in the future. - Derek S. OC, CA

Reviews.Title: “Four Season Maui- Couldnt be better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the Four Seasons in Maui. I truly had NO idea, how amazing it would be. I knew that the Four Seasons were well known for their impeccable service and attention to detail, but they even surpassed my expectations. We had a Mountain View Room that had breakfast and a car included. What a deal. If you consider all the extras they include, the room is worth the cost. You get free snorkel gear, they will stock your car with water and towels before you venture out, they have free valet, L'Occertaine bath products, free beach yoga, free lounge chair setup by the sea, free cabana use by the pool, it is amazing. Best of all, EVERYONE there will look you in the eye and say Hello. How amazing is that. All of the staff that we met were so happy to be there, they had a sense of pride about the resort. What a wonderful place. I am going to pick the rest of my vacations by going to the Four Seasons website, and picking a country/city where they have a resort. If you can, STAY THERE. While it may be pricey, I would prefer 5 nights there, then 10 days somewhere cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on the Island”
Reviews.Author: Bill&Tracy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons for eight nights in October. The service was excellent. We were well greeted when we arrived and check in was fast and pleasant. We have traveled around most of the world and we both agreed that the staff at the resort was the most friendly and polite we have ever come across. Our room was an Oceanview prime that had a good view and a great bathroom. The hotel is laid back a little from the ocean so you could never get a direct beach front room if thats what your looking for. We visted the spa and received a beachfront couples messsage which was excellent. We rented a Harley and rode around the Island, went to Kaanapali did not like it. Older hotels, older homes and apartments even the beach was not the same as Wailea. Went up to the Ritz nice hotel for golf but to far from the beach. Went on a helicopter ride of the Island highly recommend it, you get to see the volcano, hana, and the rain forest with out that long hard drive we have done both don't do the drive. Wailea is by far the best part of the Island great beaches, down the street there is big beach and little beach there is a great inlet for snorkling just by little beach which is all just right of the hotel. The lava fields are just down a little further from little beach something which must be seen. The town of Lahania is also neet avoid the traffic between 4pm.& 6pm. you will think your back at home. For dinning out we went to Nicks was not great, the restaurant at the Grand Wailea average, Ritz had a great restaurant 45min.to get there. Even mamma fish house was not what we expected. Our choice was Spago great food and wine list, Ferraros which I found excellent even though other reviews by others were not as good and Seawatch Restaurant on top of golf course to right of resort. I did not write much on the resort it self because it was perfect from the pool to the beach, the staff, the restaurants, the spa, the decore, the rooms everything was just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “fight the flies at dinner and just forget the do not disturb sign on door becaus”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not what we expected from a four seasons in maui of all places. However the room was spacious and the bathroom was wonderful. We are planing to copy it for our on bathroom. We had a garden room next to our grown children's room so we were able to go from room to room from the lanai's which was very nice. we were also able to go to the pool area from our lanai. It was my daughters birthday and the chef created the most beautiful and realistic shells out of white and dark choclate. Now for the down side that upset us to the point that we will NEVER return. #1. The two restaurants that are owned by four seasons are outside, which you would think would be calm and peaceful looking at the ocean right? Not even close. It was overpriced (expected) average food. But the massive amount of flies and birds at our table made me feel extremly uncomfortable about the safety of my food. flies kept landing on my food and I kept waiting for bird poo to land in something. We were forced to eat in our room the rest of our trip. Oh but we did find an Outback steakhouse down the road. # 2. Don't even bother using the do not disturb signs on your door. they come in anyway. twice when we were out by the pool and went out the lanai door ( where we could see if anyone tried to go in from there) they came in and cleaned and locked us out! Once they came in while i was in the shower. Then after I complained for the 3rd time about it and was told it was their policy to come in anyway. they started banging on the door and calling. usually at very inopportune times. #4. My daughter rented boogie boards and when we were getting ready to check out, I went down to turn them in, Everyone directed me to a different area. one person (the pool consierge) was so busy chatting on the phone, she directed me to the beach in front of the grand wailee. Mind you these were heavy boards and I am a small woman. 30 minutes later I go back to the consierge and when she realized i was ready to call manager she said she would personally take me. I was exhausted and she didn't even offer to help carry one of the boards. Stay at the Sheraton in kaanapali. We have stayed there twice and both time were incredible. Great Hospitality. Plus if you want to do parasailing or whale watching, you have to go to kaanapali anyway. Sheraton A++++ Four Seasons B-

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there Oct 19th- Oct 28th for our honeymoon. We arrived to paradise. The staff there is incredible and remembered our names in about 2-3 days. We chose the moutain view, breakfast and car package for $325 and it was a great deal. Our room view faced the garage and not much mountain view but were upgraded to a partial ocean view after 2 nights. The Wailea area is almost always sunny so you pay for location but I noticed most other decent condos and hotels were around $200 anyway so it is best to pay more for this hotel. We ate in other areas such as Kihei and Lahaina. These were much cheaper and had ocean views as well. The hotel restaurants were very pricey. We also used the free snorkel gear each day but also rented sets for $20 for the week in Kihei so we would have them when exploring the island. The hotel offers free outrigger canoe lesson and trip and it was a blast. Rob and Gary were a lot of fun and we learned a great deal. We also did intro scuba clinic and ocean reef dive offered from the hotel. This was a great way to start and the instructor Clark was really amazing. He made me comfortable and was extremely knowledgeable. The valet was super as well with bottled water and fresh towels for any trips we took and always asked if we needed any directions etc. We mentioned on the way out of breakfast that we were heading to Hana for the day and the staff immediately brought us containers to take anything fromt he breakfast buffet, includ juice cups and tins for fruit. They said you will starve and there are not many places to stop for food. You can take out food complimentary from the buffet. This is a good tip for a snack later or bring an ice tea to the beach. I really have nothing bad to say! I was so glad I chose this hotel for my honeymoon. Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paradise -- Almost”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Season Maui for six nights during our honeymoon in August. After reading countless positive reviews of the hotel on Trip Advisor and in top travel magazines, we had extremely high expectations of this resort. Overall, the experience did not disappoint. The service at the Four Seasons is unparalleled by any other hotel chain â€“ we were greeted at the hotel entrance with leis (our first in Hawaii) and then escorted to our room by a friendly bellhop (coincidentally from our hometown of Boston), who gave us a quick tour of the hotel on the way to our room. We were upgraded from a Mountain View to Garden View room without even asking, leaving us to wonder what would have happened if we had pushed for an Ocean View. The hotel has a great open air feeling, as almost everything is outside â€“ from the bar to the restaurants and even the fitness center. Our room was vintage Four Seasons â€“ at least 400 square feet with a comfortable king size bed and a bathroom the size of most hotel rooms in New York City (complete with double sinks â€“ which we swear weâ€™re going to replicate in our next home). Curtis (the bartender) told us that one of the few worldwide standards for the Four Seasons Hotels is double bathroom sinks. The â€œGarden Viewâ€� was a bit disappointing, as we didnâ€™t have any privacy on our lanai, and it overlooked a fountain that was under construction (with people working on it at odd hours of the day). We were treated to a chilled bottle of champagne in our room, which we wasted no time enjoying. The pool at the hotel is exactly how it appears in the pictures. Itâ€™s fun to swim under the central fountain when itâ€™s turned on, and the views of the ocean are amazing. Our first night, we enjoyed a cocktail at the pool and watched the sun set over the ocean (with the Maui mountains in the distance) â€“ an experience we highly recommend. We spent at least three of our six days relaxing by the pool, and the lounge chairs in private nooks facing the ocean are definitely the place to be. The chairs come complete with pull-up covers in case the hot Hawaii sun becomes too strong (and it is strong in August). The only distraction was all the people talking loudly on their cell phones â€“ usually recapping their weddings in great detail. While the staff couldnâ€™t have been nicer, the guests were a lot less friendly â€“ not that it mattered much to us. People at the hotel tend to go to bed early â€“ the restaurants even close by 9 most nights â€“ but the pool and hot tubs are open for all-night enjoyment. The breakfast buffet was pricey and very mediocre compared to other Four Seasons weâ€™ve visited. There was no special brunch on Sunday, and the food reminded us of something youâ€™d find at a Disneyworld resort (except with amazing fresh fruit juices). Breakfast next door at the Grand Wailea was much healthier and cheaper! We didnâ€™t eat dinner at any of the restaurants, but we did splurge for the Ultimate Romantic Dinner. The price was astronomical, but our customized five-course dinner overlooking the ocean more than made up for it. We also ate at Nickâ€™s Fishmarket at the Fairmont Hotel next door. After hearing rave reviews of Nickâ€™s, we have to admit that we were extremely disappointed. The tuna was way over-salted and served with greasy french fries no less! We also had a terrible bottle of New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc. And top it all off, we were attacked by a dying bird on the (dark) walk back to the Four Seasons â€“ so much for a romantic moonlight stroll. If you want a truly amazing dining experience on Maui, make the 45-minute drive to the Banyan Tree at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua. The lemongrass soup is truly one-of-a-kind. Overall, the Four Seasons Maui was a true oasis. However, we canâ€™t say as much about the surrounding community of Wailea, which felt more like a master plan suburban development than a charming Hawaiian village. And the surrounding landscape appeared dry and brown compared to some of the more scenic and lush locations on Maui. www.allsetinmass.blogs.com to read more about our trip to Hawaii

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons for 5 nights 10/25-10/30 after 7 nights at the Princeville in Kauai. Both hotels were amazing but the service at the Four Seasons was top notch. Everything from the foot massages at the pool, to the cold towels and bottomless ice water! Breakfast Buffet was nothing special though. When you pay $60 for breakfast, you hope for a little bit more variety. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “i felt totally spoiled!”
Reviews.Author: stampy55
Reviews.Content: Any guests out of state or local get treated w/ the highest respect. I'm sooo glad I got a chance to experience what four seasons was about. well worth the time. I highly recommend this resort to anyone and everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: ladybug5
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the Four Seasons, Maui Oct.11-15th. I really enjoyed the Four Seasons. We had a great room with great view even though we had a partial ocean view, it was better then I expected. The restaurants were good, but pricey. We had a breakfast package which was very good, but would have cost $52 for two if not included in our room price. My only disappointment in this hotel was the pool. It is extremely small for a resort in Hawaii. We walked thru the Grand Wailea next door and seeing there pools next time I definately would give them a try.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Four Seasons!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 10 day stay at the Four Seasons in Wailea and it was perfect. I was debating between the Fairmont Kea Lani and the FS and I am so happy we stayed at the FS. Everything was perfect, from arriving with the lei greetings and cold towels to the champagne that was delivered to our room from the hotel because we were getting married in Maui. The pool was great, we never had problems with finding a spot and the service at the pool was always attentive and there when you needed them. Spago was great and the service was good. Ferraro's was really nice and a great view/location. We can't wait to go back for our 1 year anniversary. I recommend the Four Seasons very highly. Maui is beautiful. I also recommend Mamas Fish House. The food was the best and the view and location were unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: “a true dream vacation”
Reviews.Author: mimimax1
Reviews.Content: We had very high expectations, but I'll have to say that Four Seasons at Maui exceeded them. We celebrated our 10th anniversary there for 5 nights (9/17-9/22), followed by a 5 night stay at the Hyatt Regency at Kauai. Hyatt was nice and very "hawaiian" in feel, but it was not even close to the Four Seasons in terms of luxury, cleanliness and service. Any time we asked for anything, the staff gave us what we needed and then closed with the phrase, "Is there ANYTHING else I can do for you?"...no exaggeration...EVERY single time. The Four Sesason's earth-toned, open-air lobby is absolutely incredible and truly makes you feel like all your worries are being lifted away as you step into it. The vibrant 'picture frame' view of the pool/fountain area and the ocean from this 2nd floor lobby are too spectacular for words. Our guest room was impeccably clean with an extremely comfortable bed, a large lanai and one of the most well-designed bathrooms I've ever seen (not a detail was spared). We had a partial ocean-view 6th floor room that had a decent view of the ocean but was part of the outer wing (overlooking the main driveway into the reception/entrance), so did not have the view of the pool/fountains and experienced some noise from the passing cars. This noise was eliminated by keeping the lanai door closed, but if you're one to enjoy sleeping with the just the screen door, you might get annoyed. I think that a partial ocean view or a garden view in the middle section (overlooking pool/fountains area) would have been prettier and quieter. It's true that the pool and pool area are somewhat smaller than at the other resorts, but it didn't feel crowded at all and we always got shaded chairs. Though maybe mid-to-late September is relatively low season. I could see it getting a little crowded over the summer when kids are out of school. Overall, we were so sad to leave and are looking forward to returning someday. We had originally booked at Kea Lani next door, but changed our minds a couple of months beforehand. So glad we did!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Pool”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Make NO mistake, this is an INCREDIBLE Resort. My Wife & I stayed here in Sept. 2004 and LOVED every moment of it. Our only DISMAY was discovering how unbelievably SMALL the Pool was for a resort of this caliber.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on the beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We came for our honeymoon and stayed at the 4S, Maui for 4 nights(Sep 15-19) after a week on the big island. Can I say, this place treats you well!!... Once we arrived and told them we were checking in, we were greeted with leis and escorted to the reception desk. the room was fabulous, not only with marble bathroom, but also a speaker above the bathtub with about 6-7 channels playing continuous music. we were fully stocked with products from l'occitane. there is complimentary kona coffee in the room, with the grinder and all. champagne for the honeymooners, need i say more? the courtyard with fountain is very picturesque, with the gorgeous beach in the back. pacific grill breakfast buffet is a great bet, with an assortment of fresh fruit, freshly made pastries and made to order pancakes/omelettes. if you're a fan of hot food items, the selection is limited. 4-5 fresh juices... i could go on. we also ate at ferraro's, with a tremendous view. i would recommend after 8pm for a more romantic feel. the service good, the food so-so. if you want great food, nick's fishmarket at the kea lani, with amazing food and service. the opakapaka fish there is out of this world. we heard about mama's fish house north of kahului, but did not get there ourselves. the beach in front of the 4s is very nice, with calm water in the morning. the beach concierge will set you up with a set of lounge chairs with cover. probably because i was bringing my own snorkeling gear, but he did seem to think at first that i'm not a guest. snorkeling is great off the beach. there are many people at the beach and around the pool area, but we got a cabana around 2-3pm without a problem. if you want romantic lounging, try the beach around 7-9pm, you'll have the beach to yourselves. the road to hana was very nice; we went on 2-3 short hikes, saw 5-6 waterfalls, some lava tubes, and gorgeous scenery. all in all, this is exactly what we wanted for the last part of our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Salvation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was a refugee from another Wailea resort and the Four Seasons was salvation. The staff was especially helpful and sweet. Rooms and hotel best in that area. Very happy with food, pool area service and the spa is divine. There are so many hotel spas now many dissapoint, but not this one. I had two incredible treatments which surpassed expectations. I will say that it is large and so it did not quite live up to the magazine hype about it-but I was very happy and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons was just "ok" for us”
Reviews.Author: RobinB2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the FS from 9/1 to 9/8. It was our first vacation in 3 years and we wanted the "best". The hotel is very nice and service is great. However, there were many children here so not real quiet most of the time. We were a bit disappointed with our room. They don't really have any "oceanfront" room, just suites and we were not upgraded to a suite unless we wanted to pay $2450 per night - no way! We had a beautiful view from 787 but we could not hear the ocean. We could hear the pool/fountain and kids. That's a bummer as we love to sleep to the sound of the ocean. We ate at all 3 restaraunts several times and had 2 spa treatments. Pacific Grill had wonderful food & service. Rick is a great waiter there and took good care of us. Their chocolate souffle dessert is incredible. Spago's was good, but VERY expensive. We ate there twice and both times we were given tables with "blocked" ocean view when we specifically requested ocean front view. Also, both times we were there we were surrounded by tables with children. Some were very quiet and well behaved and a couple were not. Ferraro's had good food and good service. In our opinion, Pacific Grill & Spago's had better food. The construction around the pool was annoying at times but they really try to keep it as quiet as possible. We didn't have a problem getting a covered chair or cabana, but we are early birds and were usually down there by 8am. The Spa was pretty incredible. We had oceanside massages at 8am the first morning. Really nice, but a lot of noise from the beach and the walking path that runs in front of the hale's. So if you want a completely "quiet" massage, better to do it indoors. Our last day we booked the Couples Cocoon Experience. It was nice, but way too short/rushed of a treatment. It's only 50mins and it goes by really quick. Not sure if they let you book that one longer, but they should. You get 14mins total time in the steam shower & whirpool tub before you have to get out and into the Cocoon beds. It's a very WARM treatment and I felt a little claustraphobic during the treatment. If we go back to Wailea, we'll try another hotel as this just didn't quite meet our expectations for the $$$$.

Reviews.Title: “worst 4 seasons ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I forgot to mention that if you must go to maui and you must stay in wailea the FSR is your best option I reccomend moving around on MAui and not just sitting at the beach hana is cool by the way if you have ever been snorkling before dont bother with the $110 pp snorkling trip to molikini literaly 100's of boats 1000's of people and the "reef" very weak i guess its the only thing to do on maui in terms of snorkling outside a private trip

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: neewyorker
Reviews.Content: Our partial-ocean-view room was just gorgeous, as were the hotel grounds. The service is impeccable. The Four Seasons Maui is an incredible experience--your stay feels very special here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Some Dining Overrated”
Reviews.Author: hydrola
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Four Seasons August 20 - 26, 2004. Overall we had a wonderful time and would stay there again. One thing to keep in mind if you are looking for a "romantic getaway", etc. In genreal Maui is just as much a family vacation spot as it is a honeymoon/couples spot. Hotel Service: From check-in to check-out all staff was pleasant and helpful. Things to note: valet will provide bottled water (if asked), towels if headed to another beach, blankets if headed to Haleakala for sunrise. If you are wondering if you should rent a car or not ask questions about their car service, there was some complimentry service. At one point our room key was not working, security was at our room within 5 minutes. This occured because we had exteneded our stay by one night and needed to get new keys issued, which we were not informed of (the only speck on the service record) Rooms: We stayed in the "cheap room" and would again. To us the view isn't important for the amount of time we were in the room. If you are paying 345 your not going to have a view of the ocean, it will be over the garage, tennis courts, road, mountain, golf course. Try to request a room on the upper floor to minimize noise from garage. We were on the 7th floor and we did have some noise, but nothing unbearable. I did however notice that some sounds do travel a bit in the rooms...like the TVs. Bathrooms were marble/huge. No problems with maid service came twice a day. Always had fresh towels. There were wonderful cookies waiting for us in the room when we arrived. Spa: We visited the spa twice and had a great experience. Would recommand having at least a massage. We made our reservations a month in advance for our treatments. Not sure if this is a must but we wanted certain things on certain days so thought it was a good idea. There were people actually coming over from the Grand Wailea. Grounds: During our visit they started some renovations around the fountain in the courtyard which included scraping up the concrete, etc. They tried to make this as discrete as possible, but if you were sitting by the pool the noise from this construction was not pleasant. Renovations have to happen, you just hope it's not during your visit. We spent almost all of our time on the beach so it did not bother us. The grounds were clean and well landscaped. Pools: There are two pools the smaller (the one with the waterfall) is cut into 2 sections with the lower section considered "the kid pool". The main pool has 2 large jacuzzis, one is adults only. I never saw more than 10 people in the pool at one time so despite their size you can enjoy the pool. The hotel was at capacity while we were there and we never had a problem getting a seat. Yes people start getting "prime" areas at 7am, but there are some rules. You can not "save" a cabanna. If you leave yor cabanna for more than 20 minutes (unless between 11-2 to have lunch) you lose it. So gone are the stories of somone dropping a book at 7am and not actually showing up till 11 AM. We never had a problem getting covered chairs on the beach. If we got there after 10 we may be sitting behind someone which prevented a direct view of the ocean. The pools are in the center of the resort and if you are in the pool as dinner starts you may feel a bid like your on display. Wailea Beach and all beaches south of Lahania (never ventured north of Lahania)...due to severe winter storms the depth of these beaches is much less than you might expect. When we arrived on the first day we expected much more sand based on pictures in books and from friends who visited prior to this past winter. We found this to be true on many beaches along the west coast of Maui. Our first restaurant was Pacific Grill. This was the best food and service at a Four Seasons restaurant. Would eat here again. Waiter was outstandings as was the fish sampler! (1 drink, 1 app, 2 dinners, 2 desserts, tip, $150) The Pacific Grill is the only place open for breakfast. Buffet is $25 also has an ala carte menu. Best buffet I've ever had, worth to try it once. Steep to go every morning. We ventured into Kihei some mornings. Ferroros is the only place for lunch. Will run you about 50 bucks for two people. We also went to Ferroros for dinner. Has been named by some as the "most romantic" place for sunset/dinner. Okay there is a great view of the sunset (if your in the front), but since this is a family friendly resort and sunset is about 6:30, you guessed it ...the average family also eats at 6:30 so your romantic dinner will most likely include tired children. The food here was just average for what you expect for this hotel and the price. The service was also a bit off, but this may be because we had such a great waiter at the Pacific Grill. I would not return here or recommond it to a friend...SKIP THIS ONE.(2 drinks, 2 apps, 2 dinners, 1 dessert, tip, $135) FYI..Your best bet is to eat dinner around 8PM if you want a "romantic" evening. It seemed that most of the families were done with dinner by then. Spago...due to the name we expected nothing but the best here. We had a 6PM reservation and were brought to our table which was in the front of the restaurant but located at the corner (L shaped up front) so our table was sort of in the corner of the L we could see the sunset fine, but quickly realized our table was sort of floating out there and the tables at th top of the L were set up for a party of about 25 that showed up just as the sun was setting. We should have spoke up as soon as we sat, but we didn't realize that we were on top of the party till they arrived. We would have caused a scene had we asked to move at this point (we were eating apps). We should have never been seated in such an area, we just made the best of the situation. When your on vacation the last thing you want is stress and problems. Anyway the apps were tasty as was my meal, surf and turf. My husband had the same and we had our meat cooked the same, but his was over done...this is Spago we just expected more. And of course once the party arrived our service suffered too. Dessert was excellent!! (4 drinks, 2 apps, 2 dinners, 2 desserts, tip, $235). Overall we expected a bit more, probably not do it again, but would get dessert there!! Warm chocolate cake was out of this world!!! I did point out and stressed some of the negatives, but that is how you make the next vacation better. Price info may also help some that are trying to budget. Hope it helps someone. We would stay at this hotel again as the service was bar-none. We would just explore some of the other restaurants in at the other resorts. They were the reason I did not go with 5 stars. Other notes: Snorkal Equip free for first hour (water was too turbulant while we were there to comment on how good or bad it can be) 5 buks additional hour /12 day. They have an Outtrigger Canoe hour trip 3 times a day (mornings) on certain days but limited space. May want to ask about and book before you arrive if interested. They are building new condos in Front of the Shops at Wailea. Therefore there are no views from the restaurants on the bottom floor (Longhi's, Cheeseburger). If you are thinking about staying at the Grand Wailea or Marriot. You definetly do not want to stay on the north side of the Grand Wailea or the south side of the Marriot. We ate lunch at Tommy Bahamas one day and it was very noisy. And there is currently a huge yellow crane ruining your view. We could not hear any of this constuction at the 4 Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Made the right choice by staying at the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: ltgmead
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week (8/20 - 27) at the Four Seasons with our 3 children - ages 9, 12 & 15. We had planned this trip months ago and had debated staying at the Four Seasons, the Fairmont Kea Lani or the Grand Wailea. We were all so glad we chose the Four Seasons. The resort is truly lovely, the staff gracious and the included amenities are terrific. We made good use of the pools (never had trouble getting shaded chairs), the beach (on calmer days, we used the complimentary snorkel gear and took out boogie boards and rafts when the surf was up), played croquet on the course outside our room, used the workout equipment and the terrific locker rooms, and enjoyed the game room with the kids. We also loved the beach walk in the morning that runs along all of the Wailea resorts. I pampered myself at the spa and we had terrific meals at Spago and overlooking the beach at sunset at Ferraros. We had the bed & breakfast package and started each day off with a great buffet breakfast at the Pacific Grill. On the one morning the kids wanted to sleep in, the hostess graciously handed me a ton of covered containers to fill with breakfast and take up to the room. The resort is certainly expensive, but considering that many of the amenities are included, it didn't seem to be any worse than the two neighboring resorts. Plus it is so much prettier than the other two resorts - the pools overlook the ocean and the rooms are large, spotless and just plain luxurious. Our only dissappointment was in the tennis. The two courts on the premises are an odd surface and up on the 6th floor roof. It gets very hot up there and it didn't seem to get much use. My husband did get in some free time with the ball machine every day so he was satisfied. Don't even bother with the Tennis Center at Wailea. The staff is rude and the pricing is ridiculous. A couple of other tips - take Dramamine before driving the Road to Hana - it's brutal. Also, if you have a car and run through laundry as quickly as we do, drive up to Kihei and use the Lipoa Laundry Center - you can drop your laundry and pick it up the next day. They charge $1.25/pound to do it for you. Much better than paying $5.00/t-shirt at the resort! I don't know if we would make this trip again - the flight takes forever - but if we did, we would definitly return to the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “As close to perfect as it gets”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and spent 10 days at the Four Seasons Maui for our honeymoon in July. The resort's grounds, rooms, service, and restaurants exceeded our expectations, which were very high given the rave reviews. Our room was large and well appointed, with a marble bathroom that can only be described as opulent. The ocean view was worth the extra expense for us just to be able to wake up in the morning and relax on our lanai, by ourselves, and enjoy the ocean. The room was spectacular, and so were the resaurants at the FS. Spago was the best in our opinion. We ate there the first night, and every other meal that we had while in Maui paled in comparison....until we went again our last night (the prime beef, if on the menu, is phenomenal. It is the most expensive item, but is worth every penny...ask your server to describe it and you won't be able to say no). At Ferraro's the food is good, but in our experience could not compare with that at Spago. Nevertheless, the atmosphere at Ferraro's was better, with true ocean front dining and live violin music every night. Also, if you feel like a dip in the pool or ajoining hot tubs at night, you will usually find them completely empty and be able to enjoy star filled nights in a beautiful setting with the violin music nearby (very relaxing and romantic). The resort did at times feel more packed than at others, but we never felt that it was crowded. The staff was always attentive, and we rarely waited more than just a few minutes for any request or order to be filled. At the FS, they truly make a concerted effort to make you feel welcome, often remembering your name. My wife and I loved the FS and will surely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Four Seasons based on the sterling reviews posted at this site. Overall we were very pleased with our stay and I would rate it a 9 on a scale of 1 to 10. During our 7 day stay staff service and friendliness was outstanding, except for one instance with a pool attendent who was somewhat rude when my wife asked for an Evian spritz that she was offering to other pool guests. We chalked it up to the extremely hot August weather that week and long hours this employee must have been putting in. The food was very good in each restaurant, but especially so in Spago's. The property itself is certainly up to standards and well kept, but my wife and I couldnt help get the felling that the layout and design of some areas were dated and beginning to show their age. If you don't plan on leaving the property during your stay you'll be very happy at the hotel itself, if you plan to go into town (Kihea) you might be dissapointed. For years we had always vacationed on the other side of the island (Kaanaapali) where the is a lot more to do outside of the hotels compared to the Kihea area. The downside to Kaanaapali is that the resorts aren't the same caliber of the Four Seasons. The hotel baby-proofed our room beautifully and offered a nanny service as well. Cleanliness of our room and the property overall was never an issue, although I do have a disgust for tropical bugs, namely cockroaches and unfortunatly we were visited by 2 during our week long stay. Luckilly they were not the giant ones that usually roam tropical islands. The fitness center had various cardiovascular and weight training machines along with dumbells up to 50 lbs. The spa was exceptional and well worth all the money we spent there. My family and I very much enjoyed our stay and will most likely visit the propery again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall - wonderful experience. The room was very comfortable. The beach was fantastic. The service was great. And last but not least - their Starlight Martini (at the Lobby lounge) was simply perfect. The Concierge was not efficient as the rest of the hotel's team and the hotel's breakfast was not exciting. I would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We wept when we left.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here August 8-15 as part of our honeymoon. Everyone raves about this hotel, and we really did not think it could live up to all the positives we have heard. It not only lived up to the positives, but it exceeded them. The rooms and bathrooms are huge. The grounds are kept in extraordinary condition. The food is amazing, and even though expensive, was cheaper than the Hilton Waikoloa Village and Halekulani. THe thing we could not understand is other reviewers gripes about finding chairs and cabanas. We never ever had a problem, and the hotel ws at 100% occupancy. They always found chairs for us, where we wanted them and when we wanted them. Also, after spending 5 days prior to this at the Hilton Waikoloa village, where everything down to the safe in the room included a charge, there was no additional nickel and diming. Everything, other than food is included. Don't even consider any other hotels in Maui. This is the place. The only negative is that the housekeeping in the rooms is sub par for a hotel of this level.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, Sean, submitted a review on Aug. 2nd, but left out a few things. We were there on our honeymoon and had an incredible time. After walking back from the local shopping I noticed a flowering bush that looked an awful lot like one of the flowers from my wedding boquet. After inquiring about it at the front desk, not only did I receive a phone call with the name of the flower but also a two page printout describing it (that was delivered to our room within minutes!) Sunsets were incredible from this hotel, and my husband loved the fact that there was a special number to dial just to have someone come and pick up the room service table when we were finished with it (along with the fact that room service called to ask us if it was ok if they delivered our food a few minutes early!) We are already saving our money for a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited the Four Seasons in Maui for our honeymoon last August and were blown away. I had researched many of the hotel reviews on this site and was impressed with all the praise. We especially enjoyed the buffet breakfast each morning, even more impressive as we rarely eat breakfast at home! The hotel staff provided lots of great recommendations from beaches to restaurants. A valet called ahead to an upscale restaurant to let them know we were on our way so we had a very warm welcome. We returned to our room and housekeeping placed a Four Seasons bookmark into a magazine I had left open. I have never before seen that level of attention in all areas of a hotel. Another plus...great bath products and an ENORMOUS bathroom. I have stayed in several luxury hotels and this was the best experience I have EVER had.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seaons for our honeymoon. We had very high expectations from all of the fantastic reviews and awards this resort had received. Four Seasons went well beyond all of our expectations. We have stayed at the Greenbrier before and the Four Seaons surpassed even them in many areas. The food at all of the restaurants was fantastic. The serivice at the Four Season's is unsurpassed from the valet to the concierge. Everyone there was very friendly and went out of their way to help us out with anything we needed. We saw Mike Myers(Austin Powers) around the pool a couple of times which was cool. We stayed in a Mountain View Room which still had an incredible view. The breakfast buffet is out of this world. We never had a problem getting a seat around the pool at any time. Anyone who is not happy with this hotel will not be happy anywhere! This is one of the top resorts in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is pure paradise!! The service and attention to detail is second to none!! When we arrived, our room was not ready. Later that night, when we returned after dinner, there was a gift box and note from the manager apologizing for the inconvenience. The gift was a box of chocolate covered truffles! My husband and I were not staying in a suite or anything close where we would expect this kind of treatment. We stayed in their cheapest room ($345.00) and joked that it was the "low rent district". Our room overlooked the road and a mountain which was fine since we were hardly in it. The furnishings and everything about the room was far from "low rent". This hotel was a great value considering it's "The Four Seasons". Valet parking was included as well as snorkeling gear, scuba lessons, strawberries at the pool, and cabanas. I've been to other resorts which charge you for the cabanas. Throughout the entire hotel, there was an artistic touch... flowers everywhere, pottery, candles, beautiful artwork, fabulous seating areas. The whole place is a vision of beauty. The resort literally "glowed" when you looked at it from the beach at night. It was truly inviting!!! We had top notch service at the pool & in the restaurants. The attention to detail was so impressive we wondered how the employees kept to such high standards. I couldn't believe there were bad reviews on this place. We had no trouble with service, noisy kids etc... I don't know if I'll ever be able to stay at another hotel after this wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to Leave”
Reviews.Author: SuzieQ123a
Reviews.Content: The hardest thing to do was to leave the Four Seasons, Maui! Most vacations or get-a-ways my husband and I are ready to return home when our trip is over. We vacationed at The Four Seasons with our two young children (2 and 1) and just hated to leave. It was the best experience we have ever had, the one that we will compare every trip to from now on. We will return again and again and again. Well worth the effort and cost. If Heaven is anything like the Four Seasons, I'm glad I'm going!

Reviews.Title: “What a place!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jig789
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about this hotel. I was a little worried after reading some of the reviews but I am glad I went. My wife and I celebrated our 20th wedding anniversary. The staff is incredible. The hotel itself is beautiful. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest most sincere staff on earth - heavenly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BigAppleWriter
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights of our honeymoon here and share the same sentiments as all of the other positive reviews. The hotel DID have a handful of families, but it's expected and was still incredibly romantic. The staff truly made you feel like they had your best interests in mind. We became very friendly with the staff, spoke to many of them on a first name basis within 5 days, and they made everything pure bliss for us. Ferraro's was incredible food- request a table right along the hedges and see if Mitch is working (best waiter we have EVER had). Partial ocean view rooms have enough of a view that you don't need to pay for the full ocean views... Do room service on your terrace at least once - it's impeccable, food is piping hot and delicious and it's a treat to dine alone from your balcony. Take advantage of 1 hour free snorkeling along their beach - it's really a great view and you see tons of fish! If I could go here every vacation I would - the bad reviews are basically once in a blue moon incidents, I assume - though I have heard during December the hotel gets VERY full of families!

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Wailea: an incredible experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two week stay in Maui and Kauai. My husband and I got married on June 24th at the Four Seasons Wailea and I can't say enough about the experience or the hotel. Amazing. Since we were having our wedding there, we were automatically upgraded from a garden view room to a junior suite. We never even asked. I hear they do this (upgrade rooms) for people on their anniversary as well. The junior suite was a fabulous place for me to get ready on my wedding day. There was a spacious living room equipped with a well stocked bar, sink, dining table, Bose stereo and large television set. The bathroom had it's own satilite stereo system. Not a dinky radio, but a nice stereo system. L'Occitane bath products were stocked in the bathroom. The bathtub was equipped with a large nice loofa sponge, sea salts and a "bath tea bag" stuffed with lavendar and other herbs. Mine actually exploded in my tub which was interesting..but still nice. Due to the wedding, we received different presents every day during our stay such as exotic chocolates (the presentation was so beautiful we didn't want to eat it..but we did!), hand written notes by the staff congratulating us, champagne...fresh flowers...I felt like a princess..it was wonderful. On our wedding night, we received a gift of beautiful bubble bath, candles and a flower trail of orchids. The customer service is spectacular. Every staff member from the valet person to housekeeping is always trying to anticipate your needs and consistently provided service with a genuine smile. I wanted to hug everyone when it was time to go! We did not meet one rude staff member the whole time we were there. The pool is a wonderful environment..yes there were kids, but if you don't like kids I would not suggest traveling to Maui. They were everywhere. If you are coming on your honeymoon and do not want kids around, I would suggest finding a private home or condo..something perhaps on Kauai. I noticed it was a little more quiet there and not as many kiddos. Although the cabanas filled up quickly, I never had a problem finding a family that was leaving...I could snag one easily and enjoy! The pool furniture cushions were actually comfortable and plush. The waves were kicking while we were there, so I did not have a chance to snorkel. However, I can imagine on a calmer day, there is a great rocky area to the left of the beach which I bet is great for snorkeling. Every time we went to the beach, a staff member would set up our chair, put the towels down, add the sun shade thing if we wanted..before we would ever have to ask! The hotel is beautiful, but what makes the Four Seasons so special is 1) the customer service and staff and 2)the fact that they don't nickel and dime you once you are there. For example, at all the other resorts, we had to pay a daily rate of $15 for parking. No charge at the FS and valet is also complimentary. No charges for beach chairs, towels, etc. I did not find that the drinks were much more expensive than the other places, although I am sure that depends on where you stay and also WHERE you eat/drink on the Four Seasons property. I read that a few people have commented in the past about "cell phones" and the "snobby people" who visit the Four Seasons. I am a laid back, middle class girl from Austin, Texas and I did not feel uncomfortable at all. I assure you, I don't dress up around the beach. (I live in Austin so I rarely dress up at all)..Honestly, I looked quite hideous every time I went to the pool. Every family i met at the Four Seasons was nice and friendly. Yes, there are a lot of kids, but once again, they were everywhere in Hawaii! There were probably a million kids and babies on my flight from LA to Maui. I was prepared though and it did not bother me in the least. I was actually impressed by all the "young" travellers and how well behaved most of them were (a compliment to all you parents out there!) Also, I was one of the "cell phone people" but I am not a snobby cell phone person! I simply had to talk on my phone alot to plan my wedding details! We had guests who always had questions and wanted to know where we were, so unless I stayed trapped in my room i had to use my cell phone. Anyway, my point is that yes, i think it is rude to use your cell phone out in public all the time like that, but sometimes there are situations that are out of your control. I did not mean to offend anyone while I was using it. Of course I know, there are the people who go overboard. Anyway, I highly recommend the Four Seasons and will return in the future. Although it is much pricier than I would normally pay for a hotel, it is worth every penny to me. By the way, if you can go by Ferraros and have dinner/drinks or appetizers, I hope Don Lax (violin) and Vance (acoustic guitar) are playing. They played at my wedding and were incredible. Ask them to play "Ave Maria" or Con Te Partiro"..it will make you cry! My husband and I danced (first dance) to the Beatles' "Here There and Everywhere." Beautiful! If that, along with a tropical drink, good food and an amazing sunset doesn't make you feel romantic, I don't know what will (ha ha) One more thing: after the Four Seasons, we honeymooned at the Princeville in Kauai. It was a beautiful hotel but I think the Four Seasons has ruined us forever. We kept comparing everything to the Four Seasons and the Princeville just can't hold a candle. The Princeville is a nice hotel, but the Four Seasons is an experience that you really can't put a price tag on. Whether you are going on vacation or have a special event coming up, splurge and stay at the Four Seasons Wailea. The Four Seasons is a treat that we ALL deserve at least once in a lifetime!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, beach, food....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is my third time in Hawaii (2nd in Maui). I stayed on Kanapalli beach the last time I came, It was nice more centrally located near Front Street. It is a different story on the other side of the island. Wailea is PERFECT. The beach at the Four Seasons is perfect, It is alot more calmer than Kanapali beach. There is perfect snorkeling conditions and if you want more waves there's big beach which is beautiful with white sands and clear blue water, it is about a 10 min car ride away. It has a good view of Molokini also. The hotel was amazing the people who worked there were very friendly. The service everywhere was amazing, even the elevator was fast. Recommend it to everyone will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to celebrate our Honeymoon at the Four Seasons in Maui. We were apprehensive at first because we had read some very bad reviews of the hotel but I have to tell you that anyone who gives this hotel a bad review really is not capable of being pleased nor having a good time at a great Hotel. The service was extraordinary. The hotel was breathtaking. The amenities were fun and relaxing all in one. The staff was extremely courteous, very professional, and always going the extra mile to please all guests. We were immediately upgraded to PRIME oceanfront room from a partial ocean view we had booked. There was a bottle of champagne and strawberries waiting for us in the room when we returned that evening. We dined at Ferraro's and Pacific Grill and the food was inicredible. We ate at some other very well recommended restaurants in town but the food simply could not compare to the restaurants at the Four Seasons. If you want to find Heaven on Earth, the closest place is the Four Seasons Maui.

Reviews.Title: “The ultimate experience”
Reviews.Author: Mahilady
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons Maui sets the standard. We stayed in a one bedroom suite for 15 days. The suite (1400 sq ft) was exquisite. Lots of upgrades --two lanais, two large marble bahtrooms, Bose stereo system, CD's and DVD's, plus an unbelievable display of fun amenities for the children, all waiting in our room on our arrival. They even childproofed the room for our little one, left bath salts/teas and a book light for me. There is nothing they didn't think of. The beds and pillows are extremely comfortable. In over two weeks, we never missed home! The Ultimate Romantic Dinner they provide was not to be missed, but book early as they only do 1 per night. After 15 days on Maui, it was easily our favorite activity. The entire staff was extremely polite and helpful. The only negative we can think of is that our suite was slightly noisy from outside delivery trucks. On our next stay we will ask for a suite in a different area. Overall our stay was worth every penny and we will return as soon as we possibly can.

Reviews.Title: “the best of all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at this hotel last month to celebrate our 35th anniversary. We have been to many first class hotels over the years and the facility and service here surpassed all. Immediately we were upgraded to a suite with a magnificent view of the ocean and pool and every need we had was immediately fulfilled. We got last minute reservations at the restaurants there, we got frozen fruit and evian spritzes continuously while at the pool, our room was spotless and kept that way, it was perfect. The hotel grounds are magnificent and I plan to go back as soon as I can.

Reviews.Title: “exemplifies Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: spiderback
Reviews.Content: Spent a week there last month after a particularly difficult four months. Hands down, the place is terrific! We had a two bedroom ocean front suite...99.9% of the details were taken care of. Great staff, restaurants were good, service great.
