Yes, you get what you pay for sometimes......in this case, the money was well spent. I can't picture anyone being disappointed with the hotel, amenities, staff and location. The "complaints" I have seen on Trip Advisor are not appropriate to me or this five star (deserved) property. I can only suggest that if you have a major complaint about this place....stay home.......because you won't be happy anywhere! Again, a wonderful property!

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Maui; Horrible Dissapointment!”
Reviews.Author: chrystaldave
Reviews.Content: I can't believe all the great reviews for this hotel. My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights after being in Oahu for 3 nights and staying at Kahala Mandarin. I was so excited about this hotel because of all the hype and great reviews. What a dissapopintment! The rooms are small and not that clean for being a Four Seasons. We had a partial ocean view and couldn't hardly see any ocean at all and our room was almost the furthest room away from the entrance when other rooms were available. The first night we were there we wanted to eat at either Spagos or Ferrarros but there were no menus for them in the room. I called and asked them for menus so we could decide where we wanted to eat. We called 3 times and never got the menus. We ate room service. I thought this place was known for great service and we can't even get a menu? We went to the pool 3 different times and never saw any evian spritz, chilled fruit or even had anyone ask us for a drink. I couldn't even believe it. Noone there ever asked us if we needed anything. When I stay at a nice hotel I expect to be pampered and instead we had to get everything for ourselves! The bartender was very rude at Ferraros and even put our drinks down to make other peoples drinks when we were there first. When we were walking the grouds we even had an employee following us around. The staff was very arrogant and made us feel very unwanted. Conceirge was nice and helpful at times but at other times seemed uninterested. We tried to book a parasail and when we checked in to see if we had been booked they knew nothing about us. We called several times before I just went down there myself to make sure it was taken care of. We have stayed in quite a few nice hotels and have never been treated this way. I WOULD NEVER STAY AT THIS HOTEL AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing kids club”
Reviews.Author: o2beaway
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons in August 2002 and could not fault this hotel . If you have kids I highly recommend the incredible kids club that runs all day and is complimentary. Everyone in the club was fantastic and very friendly. My daughter aged 8 had the best time and can't wait to go back again this August. Also, both of our daughters recieved gifts as well as milk and cookies upon arrival. This is not just a celebrity hotel, The Four Seasons really cares about children as well as the adults. This hotel is amazing, yes the pools are a little on the small side but the service more than makes up for it as does the celebrity sightings. Seeing Mel Gibson really made it worth while for me!

Reviews.Title: “Can't get any better than this”
Reviews.Author: Dani4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I never had a honeymoon, so we vowed to make our 10th anniversary a special one. We have hyped this for years, so it had to be PERFECT - anything less would disappoint us. Thank goodness we chose the Four Seasons. We went May 15-23 - perfect timing, not crowded, we were always able to get everything we needed. Rooms are fabulous! We were also upgraded from garden to partial ocean view (what do they mean partial???? We saw the ocean perfectly!) Whatever you do, do not leave without enjoying the spa. The oceanside couples massage was heaven, and I had the Maui Sugar/Honey Wrap. AWESOME. Food was great, yes it was expensive, but hey, you are at the Four Seasons. Splurge! We are aiming to go back in two years, and it is now our personal goal to visit as many Four Seasons as we can. DO NOT MISS THIS HOTEL! YOU WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED. (Just don't go during the peak season if you don't want to share heaven with everyone!!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: bonjovirock
Reviews.Content: We recently spent three nights at the Four Seasons and I cannot recommend this hotel enough! All facilities are simply first class (although with prices to match). In response to recent criticisms we had no problems securing a seat by the pool whenever we wanted and water was in plentiful supply from the exercise areas, valet staff and reception desks. On the down-side we found the pool area very small, the cabanas are very close together and we were woken at 6am by the gardener cutting the grass! Also, Spago's appeared to have a selective seating policy whereby all the 'executive types' were offered the outdoor balcony tables whilst the 'non-executive types' were given less preferable seating inside. Overall, an experience not to be missed, especially if you are lucky enough to get an upgrade as we did from Ocean View to Ocean Front Suite (1400 sq ft of luxury)!

Reviews.Title: “perfect relaxation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 4 days at the Four Seasons, and it was a great get away. We barely left the resort, and instead just relaxed completeley. The staff at the resort really goes the distance to be friendly, efficient but not obtrusive. After our first day, everyone we encountered remembered our names and even remembered what we ate and drank the prior day. Spago was very good food, amazing view, and very good wine list (with some surprising reasonably priced wines - stick to the Santa Barbara pinot noirs). The beach was beautiful, and on a small bay shared with only the Grand Wielea and one other hotel, so never too crowded. The beach staff could not have been nicer and cold water and fresh pinapple passed out was a great touch. We almost never left the resort - we ate at Nicks - skip the flashy in your face service with average expensive food, and did walk to the shops nearby - your standard high end mall (gap to prada), but for the most part, went from breakfast to the beach to lunch to the beach to the bar to the lanai to dinner to bed... the room was great - big bathroom, lots of towels, in room CD player and DVD, great ocean view (the only complaint is typical of these resorts - you can see others on their lanai, and even into the rooms from the big mirrors - but that is why there are big full lengh plantation shutters, remember that at dusk). To address some comments of other postings: if you want a specific covered cabana you have to get to the pool before 7am, but if you sleep in you can still get a great pool chair or even better, beach chairs 50 feel away, steps to the water at any time. We did not encounter many children, nor a Vegas style setting. You get the pool crowd typical of any high end resort: the really tan, the really pale, the talkers, the cel phones, etc. but this is everywhere, and does make for fun people watching. You CAN eat between 3 and 6 pm at the pool side bar, the have a limited menu from the restaurant. The ocean view room is worth it, the service never in the way, but always efficient. We loved it, and so did our marriage. Need we say more?

Reviews.Title: “We'll definitely return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our 10th anniversary. This place is top-notch! The staff is conscientious, yet not over-bearing. Upon our arrival we were upgraded from a mountainview room to an ocean view suite (approx. 1400 sq feet!) Bell staff and concierge could not have been better. The property was beautiful. There were kids there, but they were not intrusive. This place was the most romantic place that we have ever stayed. I could not recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “First class”
Reviews.Author: Mariettatraveler12
Reviews.Content: First class hotel. My wife and I just returned from our honeymoon where we had the pleasure of staying at the Four Seasons in Maui. After a lousy performance (service level) at the Royal Hawaiian on Oahu, we were so excited to check in here, and they sure didn't disappoint. From the moment we were greeted with a smile by everyone at the front desk to the pool attendant who laid our towels on the chair an hour later, we were amazed that there are still businesses out there that remember what service should be. The rooms were exceptionally clean, the restaurants were outstanding (especially Ferraro's), and the people were friendly and attentive. The last night, the staff helped me arrange for a dinner on our lanai. They spread rose petals on the floor leading from the door to the table outside. The food quality was better than any room service should ever taste. The entire stay was incredible - we can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Response to recent comments”
Reviews.Author: Canadian-Beagle
Reviews.Content: Having now stayed at the Maui Four Seasons a number of times (most recently February of this year) I find some of the recent comments surprising. Our experiences at the Four Seasons have been wonderful and we have found the hotel to be simply superb. When my wife and I have been to Maui we have not gone during Christmas or Spring Break so we have not had to deal with a hotel at full capacity with young families. That being said, if you go at this time of the year you should expect to (i) have difficulities getting chairs at the pool and (ii) see a lot of young kids and families. Obviously all of the hotels in Hawaii are going to be busy during those periods of time and will have similar constraints. In fact, no warm weather destination will not struggle with those problems during those two seasons. If you have a problem with crowded hotels and the accompanying issues, you should not go during the busiest seasons during the year. People bring their young children to the Four Seasons because they can afford to and also because the hotel accommodates young families wonderfully. What other hotel has child care services all day, for free. As for the obnoxious baboons with their cell phones at the pool, you really can't blame the hotel for that (that just seems to be the way our society is going). Regarding the inability to purchase inexpensive water and other items, the Four Seasons is a high end expensive hotel. Guess what, they have a business plan of making money. People should not expect to stay at the Four Seasons in Maui and be able to purchase inexpensive sundry items at the hotel. That is simply not the nature of this type of property. The Wailea shops next door provide ample opportunity for those who don't wish to pay premium prices for such items. Personally, we stock up on those items early as I have a similar distate for paying a premium for bottled beverages. As for the bottled water, during our stays bottled water was plentiful (whether at the exercise room or at the valet) and we never encountered staff expressing any concern to provide any amemnity that we requested (water, toiletries or otherwise). While certain criticisms are legitimate (ie. failure to identify credits on bills) a number of these are reflective of unrealistic expectations. I sincerely doubt that you will find other properties on Maui (or any where else for that matter) that provide for a better experience than the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Blis”
Reviews.Author: TMM
Reviews.Content: All I can say about the Four Seasons is we have already started saving for our next visit. We are totally hooked. The Four Seasons is incredibly beautiful. Sunsets and evenings are spectacular from the bar and beach area. We are soooo glad we chose it as our honeymoon hotel, as we could not have imagined staying anywhere else. We stayed there for a week out of our two weeks in Maui. We did the Mountainside Package as we don't care about views. However, we got one of the better Mountainside rooms as our balcony was very quiet and the view that we saw every morning as we exited our room was the ocean (there was no room across from ours). Our room was beautiful and big and the bathrooms are opulent. There was also a complimentary bottle of champagne in our room when we arrived. We loved everything about the resort. We had the breakfast buffet everyday and ate at Spago (excellent food) and the Pacific Grill (not as good as Spago, but just as pricey). The room service is fantastic as well. I had my hair, make-up, manicure and pedicure in the salon (very small salon). The did a great job, but it was pretty expensive. We also had two couples massages in the Spa which were fantastic. Ken, my husband is really missing Valerie (the technician that worked on him). The pool is small and a bit overcrowded at times. There were many families there, but never in the main pool. Most of the children we saw were 5 and under and they were never a bother to us (maybe because we have a one year old which we can't wait to take there). We loved the popsicles and ice water service. We often went to the pool in the afternoon, so we ever had a problem getting a chair or cabana. While lounging by the pools you are given chilled towels, Evian spritzes, frozen grapes and popsicles, all complimentary all day long. The staff is incredible and they pay attention to details. They will remember your name from the moment you check in (honest). Every time our car was brought around for us the valets were sure to ask if you needed printed directions for our destination or beach towels, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Honeymooners”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons from April 6-10 for the last part of our honeymoon. It was a huge dissapointment. We had to be at the pool each morning by 6:30 to get a spot by the pool. The pool area was overrun by children, making it difficult to read or sleep. The chairs were so close together that I could not have a conversation with my wife without other guests joining in. The pool service was awful, as they did not have enough waitstaff to handle the huge crowds. The hotel crowded people on the beach like sardines as well. Being on our honeymoon, we were upgraded to a "prime" ocean front room. I am glad we did not pay for this upgrade, as you could still not see the ocean unless you were on an angle. While I realize that this was a busy time of the year, our prior hotel (the Kahala Mandarin Oriental) was also at full capacity and did not feel like a zoo. When I talked to other guests, they just seemed thrilled to be at a hotel with Arnold and other celebrities and to be staying at the Four Seasons. This hotel is clearly living off of its name, and cannot be considered a romantic destination.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but beware of kids and smokers”
Reviews.Author: PatWV
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons is incredibly beautiful. Sunsets and evenings are spectacular from the bar and beach area. Our room was very nice and service was outstanding. My husband and I visited in January, 2003 and were looking forward to peaceful snoozing and reading by the pool. NOT! Loads of screaming babies and toddlers at all areas near the pool. If no babies, then smokers. We even had kids in strollers perched in the bar with tired and arguing parents. Breakfasts were ruined by travelers doing business on cell phones. Food at Wolfgang Puck's was excellent. I won't stay here on my next trip because of the kid problem. I can't imagine why any parents would take screaming toddlers to such an expensive hotel. The resort has made a commitment to be a family resort. Beware unless that's what you want.

Reviews.Title: “Hawaii Las Vegas Style”
Reviews.Author: Prowlerkat
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here Apr 20 to the 25th. The morning of the day we arrived the hotel experienced a fire in their laundry facility evacuating the hotel. Estimated damage was $1,000,000. So well did they handle this catastrophe that we never even knew about it until they gave all guests a $150.00 credit on their bill. Overall, I found the resort to be classic Las Vegas style but at twice the price. The rooms are nice with large marble bathrooms and comfortable lanais. The service was pleasant enough but not pampering. I was irritated that you couldnâ€™t buy a simple bottled water anywhere on the property without high price room service or the refrigerated bar in your room. They had complementary water at the valet station but it was under lock and key and when we asked for it they asked us to hide it from the other guest. Can you imagine! Also, there are no restaurants or snack bars open from 3:30pm to 6:00pm which means the famished golfer returning mid-afternoon must resort to room service. Speaking of golf we tried both the Emerald and Gold courses. Both courses are gorgeous but my vote goes to the Emerald for the most breathtaking views. As a footnote, we paid $150.00 green fees each while the locals that joined us paid $62.00 each. They, indeed, love the tourists here. We had a hotel package with an automatic $500 credit towards spa or golf activities but they didnâ€™t apply it until I insisted they review my bill at check-out. There was also a $200.00 erroneous restaurant charge that I had to dispute before they took it off. That was bothersome as well. All in all itâ€™s a nice resort but I may look somewhere else next time

Reviews.Title: “Worth the big $$$, honeymooners!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I honeymooned at the Four Seasons Resort Maui from April 5-10, and we loved it! Having booked under the Romance Package, a nice convertible Ford Mustang was waiting for us on arrival. Upon arrival, we received beautiful fresh leis and were offered cool towelettes. We were escorted to our upgraded full ocean view room and found it spacious, comfortable, well-appointed, and well maintained with our monogramed robes in gift bags on the bed, fresh flowers on the desk. Moreover, it was quiet, and the bathroom alone was bigger than the room at the Best Western ($86-hotwire) we stayed at the night before! The staff was attentive and courteous, but not overbearing. The facilities were meticulously maintained with beautiful flowers, comfortable seating, and a decor very much in tune with the surroundings. ).The water activities were great--they got us into our rooms early and then had us scuba diving off their beach by noon. The ocean was clear and snorkeling was complimentary for an hour a day. The pools are well designed and the pool areas very nice. Yes, they do offer to spritz you with Evian. They also come around and offer cool towlettes or fresh fruit. We spent a couple days just lounging by the pools--with Arnold & family and Pat O'Brian. We ate at all three restaurants while we were there. Ferarro's (which was included in our Romance package) is incomparable for it's cuisine, staff, and atmosphere (right on the beachfront). The romance packages gives you a $250 credit for dinner and we spent $240 with tip! The Pacific Grill has a wonderful breakfast buffet and it's dinners looked great though we didn't eat dinner there. We absolutely loved our honeymoon and will definitely go back someday when we can actually afford it. If the Four Seasons is on your list, buck up and go for it. You will not be disappointed! No matter where you stay buy the guidebook "Maui Revealed"...it tells it how is!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is closest you can get to heaven without going thru the Pearley Gates. Service was outstanding. Must do the breakfast buffet, outstanding. Service and staff are first rate. Rooms are very clean. I would suggest if ypu never been to Maui take a land tour to the rain forest. If I go back to Maui I will stay at the Four Seasons. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing stay in paradise”
Reviews.Author: boomersofcmh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons in early February. After a stay at the Grand Wailea two years ago, I was dubious that The Four Seasons could measure up. It surpassed my expectations in every way. The service was amazing - personal, friendly without being slavish, helpful in every way. The design is restful and inspiring at the same time. I spent a morning just looking at artwork on the grounds. The rooms were perfectly comfortable and elegant without being overstated. Our room was one of the farthest from the lobby, which I wasn't sure I'd like, but it had compensatory features that made me love it. All the included extras, like the snorkel equipment and the scuba lessons make me feel like we were getting our money's worth. Spago meals were great. The room service was fast and delicious. We used their concierge for horseback and helicopter selections and both vendors were aboslutely charming. We had no problems getting a cabana by the pool. I also loved the spa and yoga on the beach in the morning. My only warning is don't plan on using the business center. It's horribly expensive. I can't wait to return to this beautiful hotel for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel -- But Pricey”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you can afford to stay at the Four Seasons do it (although stay at the one on the big island -- even better!). The hotel is beautiful and and the staff is friendly. We stayed for 8 days, and despite very bad weather, had a wonderful time--mostly because we had such a nice room. We splurged on the prime ocean view room and it was worth it. We could sit on our terrace (even when it was raining) and watch whales go by. We also stayed on the club for and had the bed a breakfast package -- both were worth it as food prices on the island are through the roof. There were great programs for kids as well. The cabanas at the pool do get taken early, but given that an attendant on the beach will set up a chair for you (with a cover) and bring you ice water all day long - who wants to sit by the pool anyhow. The other good thing about this property is its size. The Grand Wailea and the Fairmost (on either side) are huge and feel huge with lots of noise and people. Although the Four Seasons is still good sized, it is a much more intimate feeling place. Other than the Cape Grace in Cape Town South frica, this was the nicest hotel that we have stayed, but of course it is at a price!

Reviews.Title: “We are spoiled now!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a wonderful week in October while we celebrated our 15th anniversary. Everyone on the staff pays just the right amount of attention to you--not obnoxious, just very nice! I have been spoiled for all other hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Great last minute escape!”
Reviews.Author: mespirit
Reviews.Content: I flew to Oahu to attend a friend's wedding and decided to spend my remaining vacation days in Maui by pampering myself at the hotel and spa. Amid honeymooners and families, I was concerned about being self-concious being a single female traveler! The bellman who escorted me to my room gave me several restaurant suggestions at both the resort, the Kea Lani and the local areas, where I can enjoy a meal as a single traveler, rather than ordering room service. Having spent a few childhood years in Oahu, I also inquired about where I can find "butterfish" and "malasadas" and he told me he'd get back to me with recommendations. Next day, he spots me in the lobby and personally listed the 'local' hangouts along with directions. The places I tried hit the spot for me. The service throughout the hotel was beyond excellent and everyone greeted me by name by my second day. I do agree with the honeymooners from Toronto ("Kihei: Four Seasons Resort Maui: "Paradise? Depends on what you are looking for..." ), that it can be pretty crowded --getting up early to secure a poolside place isn't really 'lounging'. For this reason, its best to make the most of the Spa. The Thai massage was INCREDIBLE and the Cocoon and bath package, along with a cranial-sacral massage was very relaxing. My masseusse, who took care of me during the Cocoon and bath treatments, packed bath salts for me to bring back home, since she didn't use it all during my treatment. The spa rooms were very well appointed and elegant -- much nicer than the bling bling Grand Wailea (looks like Vegas in Hawaii!). Also, a 5 minute drive south of the resort are two beaches much more beautiful and wider than the hotel beachfront. One is called "Big Beach" and another is unmarked, just go through the two orange posts. The unmarked beach is black sand and my friends spent a day there snorkeling and saw many sea turtles (another local recommendation). Also, one point that the Toronto reviewer made about the leis is misguided. The leis made of leaves are not from 'orchid vines' but from ti leaves. These are also traditional leis for men and are considered a form of good luck. Please don't consider this as poor quality as the Four Seasons is actually being consistent with the Hawaiian culture.

Reviews.Title: “sets the standard for service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our FS experience began when we pulled into valet parking. We had already been on the island for a few days and our car was a disaster, I wanted to get organized before the valet come over. To our suprise he got right in there and did all of the dirty work crawling around in the car, collecting our things while we stood back in utter amazement. The smiles and warm feelings the staff provided made us feel like we were their best friends and they were proud to have staying at their home. Having fresh pineapple slices, popsicles and ice water regularly brought to us beach and poolside was a more than welcome treat. Whenever anything was needed from roomservice we were always amazed with the promptness. This is also a beautiful resort. Our only complaint was our mountainside room. The resort was completely booked and this room was our only option. The mountains were beautiful, it was the lanai over the parking lot we objected too. Also there is a very noisy, twisting road very close to the rooms. The truck traffic reminded us more of being in downtown Chicago during rush hour, than Maui at sunset. Too bad the resort was built this way, it seems this problem should have been addressed then. Our advice is avoid these rooms, and enjoy an unbelievably pampered experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Best hotel, EVER!! Nothing can compare to this hotel. The service is amazing, they make you feel like royalty.

Reviews.Title: “Great except for the Birds”
Reviews.Author: Dot
Reviews.Content: This place is great. I am only listing the negative things as everyone else detailed the positives.. The breakfast buffet is tasty but watch out for the birds...they are all over your food and it is rather annoying. The staff does what they can to keep the birds away but it is not fun. Also, dont waste your money on the so called "ocean view" rooms if you are trying to save money as you are far far away from the ocean. Spend the money you save at the fabulous spa!! And the hotel needs to update the carpets in the halls and the rooms. They are faded and musty. Not up to 4S standards.

Reviews.Title: “This gets an A+!”
Reviews.Author: spep4
Reviews.Content: Everyone else has already raved about this hotel, and we agree. The one thing we'll add--this hotel gave us the best service for our kids we've ever received anywhere. We had our 2 year old with us. Before we arrived, the hotel placed padding on the tables and sharp edges in our room, they installed a diaper disposal basket, they put bath toys in the bathroom for her, they spelled her name with bath sponges, they had her crib all ready to go, they left us extra diapers, etc., for her. It's hard to exaggerate the impact this pampering had on us, and on our other kids -- it was really great. The hotel is beautiful, the service is incredible, and the location is breathtaking.

Reviews.Title: “High priced pampering on the Club Level”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I consulted this site often before chosing the Four Seasons as our vacation destination and our expectations were high. We booked the Club Level for which we paid approx. $800 a night after taxes. We did have a ocean view room on the top floor, which also included the sound of cars coming and going over the valet area. We were greeted at our arrival and escorted to the club level for check-in. We found the concierge service attentive and experienced...booked all our activities and dinner reservations through them. At the club lounge, we had available continental breatfast, afternoon tea and cocktails, evening desserts. Went downstairs to the breakfast buffet one day for a change...two buffets and a latte cost $70 after tip. There was an honor bar in our club room...$3.50 for a Coke, and $8.50 for a bottled water! We could walk over to the lounge and ask for beverages without cost, so this seemed inappropriate. We had no problem with beach seating during our stay...a turkey sandwich on the beach is $15. On our second day we received a message to call the front desk...our credit card did not have available funds when they charged the entire stay...our intent was to pay cash using a debit card upon departure, so this was an embarressment to us...if we has known the policy, we would have provided this debit card to secure the room. The Four Seasons signature massage was truly special while my husband enjoyed golfing the gold course. Our best dinner was at the Kea Lani...Nick's Fish Market. The best excursion was the Sky Trek to Hana...a comfortable and informative ride up to Hana, with a helicopter return. We also enjoyed the Warren and Annabelle show up in Lahaina. A rental car is a definate must. We think the world is too big to visit the same place twice, but we will not hesitate to chose Four Seasons Hotels as we have done in the past. Our most spectacular hotel and service commendations still go to Pebble Beach...that and the high prices are why we chose above average for the rating. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: Balt0Traveler
Reviews.Content: This is probably the nicest hotel with the best service that IÃ‚ ve ever stayed at. My husband and I stayed there for 5 nights in early December for our honeymoon. As soon as we arrived they adorned us with leis and we were escorted to the reception desk. Check-in was a breeze and they upgraded our partial ocean view to a full ocean view. The bellman took us on a tour of the hotel, offered to snap pictures, and escorted us to our room. He gave us a tour of the room, which was beautiful, and explained everything to us. In the room there was a bottle of champagne and some Hawaiian cookies. Nice touch! From there we spent the next 5 days in paradise at an absolutely beautiful hotel with perfect service. The Four Seasons defines what a 5-star hotel should be. All guests are treated as equals (no reserving the cabanas at the pool- first come first serve) and as adults. There were no silly signs everywhere telling you what you could or could not do, there were no silly rules. Every time I thought that I wanted something, it was there. The staff is excellent and does a great job of making you feel special during your entire visit. As soon as you arrive at the pool, they will assemble a chair for you wherever you want (pool, beach, overlooking the ocean, etc). When you come back from a jog, the bellman will greet you at the doorÃ‚ not to harass you about if youÃ‚ re staying there or what room youÃ‚ re in, but to hand you a bottle of water and a cold towel. The restaurants are all wonderful, but expensive (but you should really expect that if youÃ‚ re staying at a 5-star resort.) They have an adults-only hot tub which is something EVERY hotel should have. The beach is beautiful and the two pools are just enough (not huge or amazing like the Grand Wailea, but elegant and just what you need). Overall, IÃ‚ d say that if you can afford it, donÃ‚ t think twice about staying at the Four Seasons. It was definitely worth the money and you will never think twice about your decision.

HotelInfo.Name: Four Seasons Resort Maui at Wailea
HotelInfo.Address: 3900 Wailea Alanui, Wailea, Maui, HI 96753
